title: Meh
review: Great place for college or high school students just trying to get experience and a flexible schedule for the most part. Management however could greatly be improved.

title: Issues
review: Management repeatedly tells you the same thing over and over and do nothing to fix the issues that they keep talking about.  They don't care about your mental or physical health.  Benefits are great...but not worth the toll this place takes on you

title: If I could give negative stars I would
review: I initially was excited to work at Walmart. After starting my job i quickly learned that the team leads didn’t care what was happening around them and if you complained to someone higher up they would treat you worse. The job is stressful and your coworkers can and will make it worse, they will talk behind your back and pretend to like you to your face.

title: Please do not use working at Walmart for a long term job.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Well if you enjoy working your you know what off and getting no raises and being legitimately sick and getting points for being sick because they do not accept doctors letters, oh and getting a injured on the job and having to argue to get an injury report filed. Not that it matters because they will fight toorth and nail not yo pay your claim. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?No respect, no raises, a lot of customers are disrespectfulWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is okay plenty of culture. Not much else to sayWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful and you typicaly go home stressed as well. Would write this same review at any point in the job

title: No
review: Too physically demanding, no body can make up their mind and they want you to be a an associate but take on manager responsibilities without the pay for it. Hard to climb up the management ladder no matter how hard you work

title: toxic management and judgement
review: while walmart was fun at first the management began to rely on me for a lot it’s stressful and then i get told i don’t do enough i’m sure it’s not all like this but always be careful who you trust in walmart

title: Horrible and disgusting
review: The managers and personnel are horrible do not work here! Dont say u werent warned. I will never work for walmart ever again store 1219 lem turner 🗑🗑🗑

title: Too much work for some worker and not enough pay
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Greeting and helping customers to make their shopping go smoothly.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Most of the time there is no team effort and the days that you have to work. Certain workers have good opportunity and the hours they want while the others have to keep taking whatever hours they are given.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is definitely not what I expected. I really thought we would all work as a team and be treated the sameWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Very stressful and tiring. Some workers work very hard while others do not much of nothing when they are even visible on the job.

title: Typical of Walmart
review: It is what it is. Horrible management, underpaid employees. The few benefits are greatly outweighed by the horribly toxic work environment. Do not recommend

title: very average place to work
review: the job isn't difficult but you are compensated accordingly. as long as you don't mind putting in some amount of effort you'll be ahead of the curve compared to the rest of the employees.

title: You have to be productive and active and move kinda fast when helping the customers and you have to know what you are doing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It have its ups and down like any other job I be there 23 yr next week What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Sometimes it’s the customers or the associates What is the work environment and culture like at the company?All types of culture that comes inWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It depends can’t really say sometimes maybe a Monday or a weekend that’s when it kinda be busy

title: Ho humm
review: It’s a walmart what do you expect? But it’s a job I suppose and it pays the bills, lots of favoritism and overworking people people are lazy here not a good time

title: Low pay
review: Low pay and regional management micro manages and pops in on you just to stop you from working and wastes your time. This is a position for a tech just starting out.

title: Okay
review: Was a good place to work with flexible hours. However, management can use some improvement and a lot of favoritism can be shown. Good benefits but pay could be better.

title: Abysmal management decent pay and depressed workers
review: In my time here the pressure that upper management puts on it's TL and associates is downright shameful.Mental breakdowns are common and we are perpetually understaffed.

title: Fun workplace and easy going !
review: I loved it , it’s pretty easy you can listen to ur headphones everyone pretty much leaves you alone !! Just go to work and get your work done the pay is pretty good the company is great experience to have

title: .. they have favoritism and doesn’t accompany your school schedule. Definitely not flexible
review: they have favoritism and doesn’t accompany your school schedule. Definitely not flexible as flexible as they claim to be. Didn’t have a valid orientation either.

title: Great work place
review: Can be tough when it’s late and crowds can get pretty packed but you get to to do all your work while the concerts are going on. Overall great place to work.

title: Decent place
review: Work is slow, management doesn’t really inform people much. But work is easy, of course a lot of twisting and turning. Heavy lifting most times. Feels like you in high school most times.

title: Overall it’s not a great company to work for.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers and some co-workersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The coaches and team leads are rude disrespectful and demanding while they do nothingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unfortunate and at times unbelievable regional puts to much pressure on the store managers What is a typical day like for you at the company?You never know how you’ll be treated or belittled until you work an hour. Your constantly lied to and H.R. makes grown men cry

title: Management sucks
review: Managers are never around unless we were having people come to check store. Very little opportunity to move up the ladder . No good direction and no one to help you if you need it

title: Walmart job position
review: I want to work the stock crew, I think it would be great, honest work. Stocking shelves and making them neat and tidy is a good skill and people should take pride in their work.

title: Bad Management
review: It seems that the mangers have almost no care or empathy for any of their employees and will constantly put their own failures on their team. Bad communication as well.

title: Not a fun place to work
review: Management was very annoying, I couldn’t stand the employees I worked with. Everyone was very lazy and the work they didn’t complete would be my responsibility.

title: Work hard as you can and get absolutely nothing out of it.
review: You give 110% and get your tiny Pay in return, no recognition, no loyalty, nothing! Your fellow associates appreciate you but they work as hard and get nothing either so they can relate. Management sits in an office laughing and joking and EATING with Eachother , while watching you struggle to open a door or when you need help. They don’t help with anything! When you get sick you get fired! Even with Dr notes… but thank goodness they don’t control the unemployment compensation!

title: Employees needs more money
review: Needs to increase everyone with the 15 dollars pay. Not just the new hires because people that had been there over 4 years and not making 13 dollars a hour.

title: It's a coin toss
review: I was lucky to have super understanding and nice coworkers to help me get through the day. If it weren't for them I would have been dead. Management can be a major pain, most being inconsiderate of the environment and situation of the store and the people. I didn't even get a full reason for being fired

title: Running stay away from this type of culture
review: What is the best part of working at the company?No work life balance.  Lack of help.  Poor structure.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of help.  Lack of support.Work life balance is poor.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Bad culture. Lack of respect..What is a typical day like for you at the company?You are expected to be in two place at the same time.

title: Great diversity no chance for advancement
review: This was the first job I had gotten after graduating from college. The management is not interested in helping you advance. Sometimes the job can be boring. Even though there is great diversity most of the workers do not speak English as they are Latinos Haitians or Caribbean’s so Spanish and creole are more spoken than English they are not well staffed so when a customer needs something open I have to call someone to open a case for them.

title: Night shift
review: Couldn't imagine working this job during the day with customers, it was hard enough dealing with the highschool culture of your fellow associates and managers.

title: Nice coworkers
review: The coworkers are nice and very helpful when you need assistance with a customer. It can be stressful, especially when there’s a rush of customers. But just breathe and don’t pay mind to the rude and impatient customers.

title: It was a job.
review: Walmart itself is a decent job, the managers are what the problem is.   They don't listen if you need off it is a headache.  A lot of the people there are single parents and they need to realize that.

title: Fun, great pay,room for advancement
review: I loved working for walmart, except I missed time-they will work with you but you have to work on it too. Everyone got along, like a family and excellent teamwork, management always let everyone know that they are doing a great job 👏

title: Fun place to work at / managers are iffy
review: It's a great job easy pay for somebody that's trying to earn a decent salary. However the managers can be iffy sometimes depending on who you talk to.

title: Not All Glitter and Gold
review: Yes the pay is decent, but the work culture leaves allot to be desired. Management is absolutely toxic and have very clear favorites. Advancement is nearly impossible if you aren't best friends with a higher up and I honestly felt overworked and unsupported until I finally gave up and quit. It was not the best place to work and looking back, I'm honestly happy I left.

title: Retail is retail
review: Most coworkers are friendly but sometimes reluctant to help with simple things, most team leads often seem half-dead (understandable considering the hours) and unhelpful. You will stock most departments in store and depending on your shift you will be loaded with duties from other departments.

title: Not fun
review: Stressful and politics everywhere. Its about who likes you and not about how hard or good your work is. Be prepared to work weekends, holidays while others dont

title: horrible
review: horrible place to work bad management everyone baffles me never work at walmart if u can help it pay sucks they don't care about your well being at all

title: Delivery and shop for customers
review: So I set my alarm and eat my Wheaties or donuts and wait for the "trips" orders to populate and select the best paying ones based on mileage/ higher paying trips.  This job is hit and miss depending on time of day, weather, drivers working in your area. Patience will save you headaches and solid surprises as well.You do not pay taxes doing this job and get 100% of your tips so saving gas receipts/ oil/phone payments and setting aside a percentage yourself for taxes without touching will benefit you.You make your own hours and is flexible enough to do as a side gig as well. You can make really good money if you apply yourself and stay close to busy stores in-between deliverys for best offers.Dependable vehicle and common sense is about only requirements.QWeekly pay every Tuesday, and they have incentives from time to time to make more cash.

title: Toxic and childish environment but we get some work done.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay is really good for what you do.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers tend to be really rude and mean to the employeesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It can be extremely tense and toxic. Everyone's immatureWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It was very Boring and loud but good pay

title: decent place to work
review: My supervisors and co-workers were all very cool people but some of the managers were not the best. Either way the place was very accommodating and understanding. The only thing I didn't like was the point system for calling in.

title: After 5 weeks of training it was still hard to meet expectations
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Technology that allows you to do your work easily What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not really knowing the the business of the whole store, but being expected to run it anyway What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, new people aren’t fully trained What is a typical day like for you at the company?Going from department to department unlocking cases of merchandise

title: Management sucks
review: They do not know how to treat their employees at all. I would STRONGLY recommend that you do not work there. They don’t even keep the store clean. Fitting room is a constant joke as well.

title: Idk
review: IThis was the worst job ever they do not care about you or your life. If you are looking for lots of hours this is the place for you. They will work you to death if they can and have only a 5 point limit

title: Overwhelming and not very flexible
review: Worked at this Walmart location for 8 months in 2022, very difficult to balance this job and school. They forgot to give me permission to go on break on two occasions so I worked 12-hour straight shifts

title: Stressful, Slow
review: Stressful sometimes Would get upset at associates if an order will go late when it would be the stores managements and inventory count that was wrong.

title: I would never work there again
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good hours Good pay A learning experience What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers , managers, a lot of tasks What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Busy employees can be irritating What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy lots of work to do slicing various cold cuts and cooking hot foods

title: Very stressful anymore
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They have changed to even worse... don't do it!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything about working for them is stressfulWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Just not good environment anymoreWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It was a nightmare never knowing what management or corporate were going to dream up next!

title: Messy. Management acts like teenagers and highly unprofessional
review: The job is literally easy but messy childish co workers who start fake beef and spread rumors like it’s highschool will make you want to stop working here. During the winter there is literally no work to do and managers can’t be bother to come up with any type of direction for employees except for cleaning like janitors for 3/4 months. There is no moving up only transferring out of state so don’t get your hopes up and you only get 5 points until you’re fired.

title: Absolutely terrible
review: What is the best part of working at the company?NOTHING walmart doesn't care about their associates at all.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They over work you and don't care about you.

title: Walmart worst work place
review: Management has no respect or understanding for people with disabilities they also have no respect or any Understanding for people with mental health..

title: they pay a lot more than they used to
review: What is the best part of working at the company?lots of really cool personalitiesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?dealing with the awesome customersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?hardworking and detail orientedWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?walk to work, work, then walk home

title: Great Coworkers, Annoying Coaches
review: The management could use improvement, often felt like it was so disorganized. Also, coaches don't care about associates. Great coworkers make it better, met a lot of amazing people here. Of course, working food and consumables are always going to suck. However, if you work the closing shift, expect a little more freedom, and for the second half of your shift, you'll generally be sent to go-backs, which aren't so bad. For the first half of your shift, you can be sent to do anything, like stocking meat, produce, or produce, as well as doing happy to help. Also, the food and consumables department is very short-staffed, expect to deal with customers angry that an item is out of stock. The happy-to-help department is also very short staffed so be prepared for angry customers that are tired of waiting for assistance with getting locked items. Not everyone has a key which just makes everything so much worse.

title: Fun but stressing
review: I worked at walmart for 1 year, and my experience was not good but not bad either. A lot of the associates are old people and they always nice to work with, altough the management on that store was horrible. There were no teams leads or coaches to work with, but over all is not that bad.

title: Not bad
review: It's okay, definitely has its days, management is the worse part, and the lack of communication, but if you know what you're supposed to do, just keep your head straight and don't listen to others

title: Don’t apply, no amount of money is worth the headache and stress of working for this company.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Absolutely nothing. Terrible management. Terrible company.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with management and rowdy customersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile and full of passive aggressive behavior What is a typical day like for you at the company?Management belittling employees

title: Fun
review: You can also have a good day at work and enjoy your day off and enjoy your weekend with the family enjoy the day and the kids and the rest will see how you

title: The experience has been good, but it could be better.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with nice people. Also the summer time incentive. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having enough employees on our team.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I get along with most everyone on the job. What is a typical day like for you at the company?In the summer time it's very busy as I work at a beach store.

title: Exactly what you expect
review: Basically decent pay for hard work. The actual schedule sucks (5am-2pm, 2pm-11pm. Overnight) but is good if you stick with it. Most people at Walmart are really cool, a few exceptions here and there. While working it’s never really bad, just sometimes more annoying than other times.

title: Great place to work
review: I enjoyed working here. The staff was nice and the managers worked with you in any accommodations! I would definitely work here again. if you’re thinking about applying do so!

title: Low morale
review: Employees had blank stares. Training videos stressed customer service, but you're a stock clerk for entire store. One person ran three departments, with no help from management. Avoid.

title: flexable work schedule, no such thing as managers
review: meet good cowrorkers who keep you going and working. they work with your felxability for the most part, and pretty decent pay depending on what depertment you choose. can be stressful at times with no help from managment.

title: Productive and enthusiastic
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The team work and benefits there our keys to making it a fun and pleasurable working experienceWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Merchandising the freight in StocktonWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Amazing very fun friendly excellent teamwork very diverse and openWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?8 hours of stocking merchandising and helping customers

title: Not great
review: They don't bother training new employees, which is why they are so understaffed. It is very dysfunctional. Management is also terrible. I would never work here again.

title: It’s what you make of it.
review: Constantly stocking beer and water can get old. But you work with some good people. Have fun with it and try not to be too serious. Clock in, do your job, clock out.

title: Horrible management
review: Team leads will lie to save themselves. It doesn't matter how hard you work to get the job done, it's never enough. There's no communication between the shift leaders, and if something is communicated it's never enforced. Half the time the management all will tell you different things to do without realizing it, because there's no communication,  and then when you can't do all four things at once, you get introuble.

title: For the most part, I enjoyed my job at Walmart; however, I made so little money I couldn't even afford to eat meat!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Comradery of other employees, getting to work in a department I understood (hardware) heavy responsibility load placed on my back each and every time I showed up for work (I was a department manager), getting help from other more experienced workers when I needed it!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Upper management that didn't understand that I couldn't remember a list of ten things to do, I needed then written down.  I had a TBI as a 14 year-old and short-term memory is an issue.  Getting frowned upon and eventually losing my job for this reason was unfair!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Different every time I came to work.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Scan the empty pegs, get the merchandise from the stock room, always listening for the paint call over the intercom because that was my job, placing the merchandise, and by the end of the day making sure the light bubs and spray paint looked perfect!

title: Just dont
review: You aren't guaranteed to have weekends off. They tell you 40 hours but cut you way down. I have a family and can't live off 25 a week. They forget about you sometimes for your breaks or lunches.

title: Underpaid and Management severely lacking
review: Walmart is underpaid and you are asked to go above and beyond the amount of compensation you recieve. Working as a cashier you are told to harass customers to take a 5 Star survey at the end or of each transaction. If the store scores low they blame the cashiers for not pushing the survey instead of actually addressing the issues as to why the numbers are low. E are also told to have our work phones in our hands at all times. Giving the apperance to customers we are on our own phones not paying attention. Management does little to nothing as they are always in the back in the office. Only coming out when higher ups are making a visit. They guilt trip you if you have any schedule changes. You won't get two consistent days off.

title: Good job bad management
review: If your looking for something reliable this is a great job but the management makes the job toxic. They have unrealistic expectations for example I worked in pets I would be expected to put up about 10-15 L-carts worth of freight while the truck is being unloaded and about 6-15 dog food bag pallets and break packs, now I get it doesn’t seem like that much work, honestly your right but this is where the toxic management comes into play, the department managers around the store never have their aisle in order or located in the system correctly so when you use your scanner you find out that they have “plugged the stop” and at the store I was at I wasn’t allowed to make new price tags I worked second shift so after my first hour the department manager was gone for the day. So your say well I need to tell somebody about this and be a good little employee, nope you tell your manager the problem and they go to the department manager saying your complaining about how the department is ran causing frustration with the department manager even though they are aware of the problem and have done nothing to fix it. Now your sitting there with the short end of the stick upper management doesn’t care they just backstabbed everybody to get to that position if you think I’m lying ask somebody who worked at Walmart I’m sure there’s a few exceptions but for the most part they are terrible people. Just do your job to the best of your ability and don’t say anything because if you do you will be treated differently.

title: Mediocre
review: Work life balance was terrible, and they call you off the clock all the time.The only thing that helped was being able to train and lead associates to be the best they can be

title: Ambiente pesado
review: Horrible trabajar en walmart dificil cambiara de area te bajan las horas etc . Cinclusion no trabajes hay

title: Treated poorly and as if you don’t matter to higher management
review: The pay is okay but, not for the stress/unfairness you deal with everyday through team leads and or customers.  It does not allow a good work/life balance and makes it near impossible to even be sick without there being consequences with your points. I will never work at another Walmart again.

title: It's okay
review: It's not bad they have flexible scheduling and great benefits and like to promote from within the company and most of the management is understanding.

title: Great Pay
review: The pay is good and the work life balance is ok it’s a great job for someone that only care about the money. I’ve worked at 3 different Walmarts and always have problems during winter seasoning when my son get sick and I have to call off and there’s nothing I can doing about getting points there should be more wiggle room during winter and they don’t accept doctors notes

title: A joke
review: Too much tools completely unusefull and ridiculous  ( phone apps). Completely conter productive. It leads to a segregation by the faster phone you own. Most of the guys who works there for more than one or two years spent more than 1000 $ on their phone. The walmart device (phone) is a shame slower than my 200 $ phone just because they put a "Spyware" in it (knot)  to make statistics  on you . all is about micro management and the way you look on the video while working. People got so much pressure than they prefer to look overexhausted and fast paced on the video doing something that has already be done or anything else completely unusefull than to have results and save energy by team working. Communication, the key, is simply inexistant precisely because of that huge pressure they put on their employees . The official walmart policy is team work, excellence, yadi Yada and now we sing like in a Disney moovie. But all their process is about dividing people with demagogy for more competition between employees. It doesn't work.

title: Store wise
review: Poor management When they want you to do something they want it done as quickly as possible and don’t like being asked questions either but they expect everything to be done

title: Fun
review: Good job super easy nice pay The people at my job made it fun Kinda bad in the winter but other than that funGreat summer job to Customer make it difficult sometimes

title: Striving workplace and very fun
review: At Walmart working 8 hours goes by fast. You always have something to do that isn't too hard because all employees work together to make sure everything is organized and accurate to always set out on its next mission. The main bosses and managers would always stop by to check on you and make sure everyone was doing a fair amount of work with great pay and benefits. They would also do little challenges to push their employees to do and get more out of the job I think was very rewarding.

title: Questionable Leadership
review: Some coaches'll snap at you over minor things, show favoritism, and whatnot. They're not shy to abuse their position.  My previous location had the same issue, but much worse.  The overnight coach straight up told us it was their goal to make their position obsolete, because they wanted us to be able to take care of everything on our own. They spent most of their time strolling around the store, hands tucked in their front pockets. Coworkers are great though. They make the job manageable at my new location.

title: Easy, however...
review: I felt as if the job itself was easy enough. Tidy department, fill shelves, work freight, put away put backs, and assist customers.However, work-life balance was lacking.Attendance is imperative. Do not bother working here if you plan on calling out or slacking. You will get CUT immediately. Come to work.

title: Fast paced up bringing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It's a great job I wanna go back to work there. Walmart takes care of there associatesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nothing is stressful it's all goodWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great everyone is very nice and helpfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Everyday is a good day I have nothing to cplsin about

title: It was fine.
review: Walmart sucks, but the workers are cool. Typical corporation, a manager told me once, if you have 2 working hands and 2 working feet, this job is for you lol.

title: Great work place with many opportunities to advance in the company
review: I've work for three different Walmart stores and they were all fairly amazing in their own ways. It was nice to be part of the Walmart family for many years. There are tons of opportunities to grow within the company and most of the employees are hard working and caring individuals. My management team was great at all 3 locations, I was an amazing asset to the company working as a cashier, grocery, unloading trucks,produce, bakery, and my favorite job was the wireless "connection" center... there I sold cell phones and helped people connect with their loved ones through technology. Best of all was when I would receive reviews from the customers that I had helped letting me know how great of a job I had done. I was always very productive, professional, and kind.
location: Union, MO. Sullivan, Mo. Saint Robert, Mo

title: it was good i guess
review: 15 was good pay, easy work, supervisors were super annoying and too serious but other than that it was fine. Being able to choose my exact hours was pretty cool

title: It's Alright
review: Working here was okay, but it wasn't for me in the long run. I was mainly put in the freezer to stock frozen. I never enjoyed going in the freezer that's for sure

title: It is a fast pace job in a hostile environment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?None. Company supervisors, group leaders ans managers have a hostile approach to their employees as well as deliberate abusive excessive work loads and inconsiderate work hours. They do not take care on employees needs and do not offer future growth.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Taking orders outside job description and obligating extra loads of work with or without experience in certain areas of the job.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile and abusive. There is no culture except to carry their own agendas. Overlooking the skills of the employee to do their jobs. Management can offer open doors to only mislead you, nothing gets done when reporting incidents with other coworkers.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in wait for instructions then get to work wherever they send you not expecting to finish any of your tasks in time because they need to get their projects pushed first. Leaving you looking like you did not work your regular tasks then rushing before clocking out to get the most done of what you didn't do when you first started.

title: Fun Times
review: Everyone gets along usually, and we all help each other out people are willing to train you if you don't know how to do something.  There are days where its bad but its retail costumers acted entitled if you  dont drop everything to help them find milk which hasnt moved in the 10 years this building has been up

title: flexibility with hours
review: If you are part-time at Walmart and they have too much overtime, they take part-time employees' hours away. The pay in some departments is low for all the work you are expected to do. Sometimes their leads make you feel like you didn't work fast enough and didn't do your work.  They say remarks like that's all you did after you worked on a couple of tasks for the day and only one person in that department.

title: Terrible leaders
review: They treat their associates very poor moral in that place is terrible teaching and training is very poor the pay is terrible for how much they try to work you

title: Not a place for someone who has a family
review: This company cares nothing about you or your family anymore! It use to be a place that did but now all they’re looking for are people who will dedicate their entire life to that place. It’s really sad because I use to love working for the company, but now the work load is more than one can handle they don’t give you enough employees to run your area efficiently and raises no longer exist for hourly management what so ever. I made the same pay for 3 years with no raise.

title: Fun
review: It was fun until they removed department managers. Then you were given the same responsibilities with less pay or in a different department all together

title: Sometimes stressful, otherwise a great opportunity for professional development and growth.
review: Overall, working as a customer service representative at Walmart can be a great job for people who enjoy helping others and are good at multitasking. While it can be challenging at times, it can also be rewarding, and there are opportunities for advancement within the company.

title: back braking work tight time line
review: AT THE TIME A job was a job defiantly not a job for a family provider but a very good starting place for the younger group just starting the working live.

title: Fast-paced workplace with decent pay
review: The work is simple but physically demanding. The pay is reasonable, with better pay on weekends and night shift. The freezer is the best pay, but the coldest part is -20 degrees F. The management is fine.

title: ok place to work
review: always got more than 45 hours a week, good pay. didnt like how the pay was bi weekley. no communication from managment, whole workplace was not organized or ran properly

title: Good starter place to work
review: Hours and pay were fair. Room for promotions and advancement if you’d like to make a career out of it. Fair benefits. Don’t get to interact much with upper management.

title: Too much work for not enough pay
review: The company works you too much for not enough pay. PTO had so many days blacked out that it was hard to take a decent vacation. Changes aren't communicated clearly from higher up leaving everyone questioning what to do, then they ask why processes aren't run correctly.

title: A fun place to work and get as much knowledge as you need to move up the ladder and get what you need out of the company the knowledge and all
review: The job is very productive it's a fast-paced job and as long as you stick to what you know and what you want to know and learn more you can move up the chain to where you can be a team need you can be a coach you can end up being a store lead or a manager you just got to work hard for your goals and do what you need to do and be very positive and also work with your Associates and everybody else even your higher up your management everything

title: You work,
review: Good place to work, just need to reign in managers ,coaches,so they don’t make people fell like they are unwelcome or not needed. Like telling them to quit.

title: Productive decent hours
review: Decent hour no benefits for part time workers there system is based off points don’t miss to many days managers was pretty laid back customer service managers not so much

title: Productive and fun work place
review: I love working there so far no problems. I love that it’s keep me busy making the time go by faster overnight managers are cool certain team leads can be better at there jobs

title: If you need a job it's ok
review: I had a bad experience working there.  I was put on the floor and not told anything about what I was to do.  No once cared.  I got an angry supervisor get mad at me for not doing something that I didn't even know I was to do.

title: Terrible but learned a lot
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people but only because it is a small town What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything. Walmart is the cheapest, meanest, most underhanded company I've ever worked for What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Expect way too much so low morale What is a typical day like for you at the company?Long and tiring. Terrible schedule for most employees

title: Yuck
review: Good if ur a customer lol but can’t change schedules less u are part-time and u can’t transfer less if u have someone replaces you  otherwise no ur choice if u want to do it

title: Productive and fun
review: Not much breathing room as there are a lot of orders all the time. Very busy and very productive. Customers are nice. Pay is really good and you can listen to music while working.

title: Poor management
review: The management at this location is horrible. I caught covid after working here and was fired because of it! If you get sick too easily then avoid working here!

title: Good place to work
review: Good place to work, fold clothes, make sure things are where they are supposed to be. Cashier if you need to. Easy dress code. Breaks could be longer.

title: Friendly environment but lacks training and support
review: All my co-workers were nice and really helpful, but I barely interacted or was trained by my Team Lead and Coach, and they both demanded unreasonable things from the new associates. Its hard work but not the worst, if you are good with physical labor you'll be okay.

title: Interesting place to work
review: Decent place to work, especially for hourly employees. Salary positions varies and so does leadership. Since leaving I have heard that they have a better work life balance now for salary employees

title: High Performance Culture
review: This site has a great want for high performing individuals offering minimal salary. Job demands are not worth base salary alone. Bonsuses and incentives make up a large portion of compensation but are not always guaranteed.

title: I enjoyed my work there and loved my work!!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Stocking, cutting material, helping others when needed, organizing shelves, picking up returns and putting where needed, breaking down boxes and taking to back of store and put in a machine . Enjoyed my work there.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When my car gave me trouble and that was frowned upon because I couldn’t be as reliable as should be. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was a nice atmosphere. Ones were nice and got along. You do your work and get it done.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping people with crafts and material with purchases. Opening boxes of supplies and scanning to see which isles they are to be put and keeping shelves full and neat.

title: Decent place to work
review: It's a decent place to work, I enjoy my coworkers and my managers are tolerable. The department I work in is mainly high schoolers and teenagers. It's physically demanding but pay is ok.

title: Wal-Mart-Meh
review: If you are looking for a part-time job, Wal-Mart is an ok place. The pay is ok, the work is tolerable and as long as you stay to yourself, mind your own business and just do your work, go home, your fine.

title: With the management they currently have don't apply unless you are willing to tolerate the bs.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The money as long as you're full time. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management don't care for their associates life outside of work. They have favorites and it shows.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The culture and environment are toxic. They will fire you for getting into a car accident. Like I said management could care less about their associates. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful, toxic, over worked and highly understaffed.

title: Good pay if you can tolerate management
review: I like doing my job, but management has been trying to take away autonomy, making our job harder than it should be. Management specializes on making sure our job is stressful, and cannot stand if you do your job so well that you end up standing for a couple minutes.

title: Laid back
review: Best trucking job I have ever been to. I wish I started 30 years ago!! I’ve been here a year and a half. Love it!!  No touch almost all drop and hook.

title: retail sucks
review: working as a cashier at Walmart made me permanently leave retail and never look back. the systems were outdated, you get more training in the back than you do on the floor

title: Sucks
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There wasn't a good part if the job. Well benefits. If you don't mind killing yourself. It's a great jobWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Production!  Absolutely ridiculous they way they want people to work. I will never work there again What is the work environment and culture like at the company?People are great. Rude  if you have to miss a day. So if you have kids. Don't attempt a job here.

title: Busy and get crazy at times but I like where I am at do your job and everything will be good
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Decent wages for working there  , and after 3 months you can work up to team lead and further your career. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They have a points system which is every six months at 6 points you can get fired best thing don’t call off unless you have enough P T O  time availability.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Busy at times but fair where I work my co workers are great if you need helpWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Everyone has a assigned place and job and we work together to get the project done

title: Boring but easy job. Terrible management great coworkers
review: Super easy job but very repetitive. Lots of manual labor but easy work. Co workers make the day fun but management is very bad. In my department our team leads and managers don’t help us but love to yell if we get behind as we are short staffed. 3/5

title: Productive and career oriented with a new learning experience everyday
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting and helping new people. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to help with situations with co- workers. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Diverse and great. Love working with the public and Walmart is endless with serving the public.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Work to make that day better than the last and go home stress free

title: Bad environment
review: Bad environment to work in. A lot of gossip and drama. The manager at the time participated. Very little teamwork. The pay was decent, which is why I gave 3 stars.

title: Decent
review: Lower management at Walmart is alright, you're basically just a regular hourly employee with very little extra responsibility. You don't have control over much, not until you get into salaried positions in middle management.

title: Good first job
review: Very fast paced at times, but also can be super slow at times. Always something to do, lots of hours and you get PPTO. Never told to clock in or out early/late.

title: Ok job
review: Bad pay for the work.                                                                         Retail.                                                    Enough said.Some employees are good, some bad. Management is over worked and disinterested. Some managers are real helpful others could care less about their jobs. Overall not bad but effort feels wasted most of the time. Could get paid to do nothing w no repercussions

title: Great for part time
review: Management cares for employees. Very flexible schedules, fun environment when I worked there. My cashier supervisors were totally fun to be around and helpful

title: Team relliant
review: The job is super easy and fun with a good team. If you are not given this foundation everything falls apart and everyone eventually quits with morale really low.

title: Everyone is very polite and courteous.
review: Overstocking is not an easy task, but not impossible either. I have been working there for about a month or so, all leads/coaches are very kind and respectful. Learning where all the merchandise goes is not an easy task, but if you are willing to learn. you will get the hang of it soon.

title: Low stress and independent environment
review: Pretty great gig to have. The other bakery staff and I had good chemistry, which made small talk enjoyable while we spent the hours decorating, restocking, and filling orders. It is repetitive. But easy and fun, overall. Solid lunch break, every shift. Less hours than I needed at the time.

title: Production
review: Decent place. Would go back someday if I needed a decent place to work. Management is ok some better than others.Shifts are the tough thing. It’s hard to have a life

title: terrible
review: this is a terrible place to work, low pay, long hours, no schedule flexibility, nobody cares about their job. its a dead end waste of time, do not apply here

title: Walmart is fun, productive, and great chance to grow.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Helping customers find the best option for them.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Coworkers that don't have the actitud to work on companies behalf What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is a friendly environment sometimes. Concentrate on my own work helped me.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Restock, help customers, folding clothes, alignment of products in the right price, sweeping the area.

title: Wouldn't work here again
review: Work was unrewarding and repetitive, hours were inconsistent, management was very petty and played favorites, pay could be better, expectations were too high for as few team members as we had

title: Great environment
review: Bad bosses most of the time but occasionally would get a nice one. Long hours could sometimes come into play. Plenty of overtime to be had as not everyone wanted it

title: Productive and fun
review: Working as a cashier at Walmart was productive and fun. Working as a cashier brought a lot of memories and the management was also very helpful when I need them

title: Easy and fast paced
review: Fun first job, good location. Keep to yourself and you’ll be fine. People will want to get close to you but they are all fake and only care for themselves.

title: Enjoyable, would've liked to learn more.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoy the interaction of helping customers with find merchandise. And it being relatively busy throughout the shiftWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having enough people per depart at times. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very friendly and customer service oriented. Upbeat and open door policy. Definitely a diverse culture. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Time management is your friend. You stay busy. Alot of standing bending and walking. Customer service and merchandise fronting and folding clothing in women's department

title: OK place
review: OK, place to work. There are too many new rules and regulations we must follow. Could be better pay and more sick and vacation time should be available.

title: Very unfair a lot of high school mentality
review: Mgmt sucks, favoritism, some people can do no wrong and other ppl can do no right! Only work there if you have to and until you can find something better!

title: Strict underpayed
review: They expect to much out of you for the amount of pay. Be ready to work random hours and do other people jobs. I worked there for a year and a half the management was terrible and none of them care about you

title: Work environment
review: As an associate that's been with the company for a while, I've come to the realization that the people that's been with the company the longest they appreciate less than a person that's been there for a shorter amount of time. It's sad that some of those that come in after us is getting paid as much as we are or even more. Overall the company has change tremendously.

title: Decent
review: Not the best not the worst, pay is good for starting off. I would recommend if you are looking for a good paying first job. must have a lot of patience.

title: Great Benefits
review: I enjoyed the co workers I had. I enjoyed most of Customer interactions  I had daily. I appreciated my team leaders and digital coach for being honest with certain  questions  I may have had. The medical,dental,vision, life insurance  benefits  were great! The only thing about all those benefits  is they are temporary. You do not Sunday's off unless you put you have certain religious  beliefs! Only time you get a holiday off is if you request  paid time off one month or more in advance! Christmas  is the only guaranteed day off because  all Walmarts are closed! The pay is 14 an hour starting out. I personally  had to start from 9.25 to get to that. I would tell anyone  to read their policy  about anything that  you have  a question  about. If you do that you will not  be deceived!

title: Easy Work but Bad Management
review: The work was easy but management was horrible. Great coworkers, bad leaders. Whenever you need something from management you have to constantly remind them, very annoying.

title: Qa
review: Very great place to work room for growth if work place fun they are fair that was one of my best jobs I ever had I love the mangers great pay wonderful raises h

title: Productive Place To Work
review: Walmart is a very productive place to work, and you can learn a lot from working there. Walmart has a lot of benefits that are available for their employees.

title: Overall not bad
review: Making sure quality of products are good is not the first priority. As long as you finish your pallet or job it’s fine. Pretty understaffed for the workload though.

title: Sometimes it's really good and customers are pleasant then you get days when everything turns upside down just retail life
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Wages are fair and insurance is good. You keep very busy while on your shift. Not everyone that works there takes pride in their jobWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Having to watch people steal and not being able to stop themWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It depends on shift and managers on dutyWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Starts out slow then get super busy

title: Over work
review: Cap 2 is good if the management is consistent. The work is physical and it requires a lot of moving. Besides the heavy lifiting, day to day is decent. The job is easy if you’re ready to work

title: Decent, but only decent
review: The pay is alright for what the job is, but expect to be standing doing nothing for the majority of your shift. I was always glad to be assigned real work, and it was all too rare. More draining than putting effort in.

title: Good pay
review: The only positive thing I can say about this job is the pay. The hours suck, the amount of work I have to get done is crazy, I do 3 shifts of work in 8 hours. Management don't care about the employees in less they are part of the in crowd.

title: Great workplace
review: The managers were great and the hours as well. Not bad for a first job , pretty easygoing . Definitely depends what department you work at though.definitely recommend

title: Its like working at WalMart!
review: The breakroom has a TV. A nice couch too. Lots of friends young and old to be made there. Sometimes I look at the people working in Electronics and wonder what it is like to have such a fun job.

title: If you want to be silently discriminated...please apply for the job!
review: Trash management, trash people, trash way of dealing with any situation.You will get stabbed in your back by multiple envious people in any position you work.More for less mentality!

title: Busy, hardwork but good prospects
review: Very busy store, on a daily basis. Never a quiet day.  Customers can be often demanding & rude & sometimes aggressive even!,  but on the whole we have many very nice regular customers, which makes it enjoyable. Lots of opportunities to move up or switch departments till you find your niche.  Management very hardworking & supportive to associates.

title: Great place to work
review: Walmart was a cool place to work. They worked around my schedule the best they could. Pay was equal to the amount of work you performed. Management was easy to talk to as well

title: Productive. Hourly pay is better now than back then!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I like helping people so I pretty much  did that working as customer service  fitting room attendant/switchboard operator for all in-store calls and overhead announcementsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?During a threat I maintained my position as the store announcer to communicate with management and encouraged staff and customers to exit the sore safely.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Like any other retail customer service position management is key to ensuring great customer service from all staff as much as possible. The culture was good!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Upon arrival, Turn on phone to receive calls. Clean work station and area. Put clear returns carts and straighten any sales items  as needed. Count customer items and proved ticket upon fittingroom use and exit. Announce customer needs, calls for items, employee call outs etc. Customers mostly pleasant.
position: Switchboard Operator/Fitting Room/ Sales Floor Associate

title: Stressful
review: Would not recommend. It's like working on a sinking ship. Mentally draining and stressful. Great associates, not so great management. Poor work ethic is allowed and good workers  get overworked and burnt out.

title: The employees make it a good place to work , working with friends makes it feel less like work.
review: Management will give employees certain certificates for certain advancements.  Those who have longevity in the company are overlooked when it comes to advancement . An associate from another facility is more likely to get an open position of advancement than one who has worked in that facility for years and actually has knowledge of the department. The employee who wishes to advance within their own department , management does not determine their worth of this position based on their actual knowledge , dedication and work ethic and or culture .

title: Productive
review: Walmart was so fun to work at. I will work there again. Stocking i had alot of exercise and it made me a more organized person personally lol The Only thing bothered me is negative co workers, and sometimes heavier loads than usual. When U get burned out u know when it s time to go. Overall good place to work for someone who like to make things look pretty and fast paced movement.

title: Run and go somewhere else
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Flexible schedule that you can fill out when you start working there.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Expected to do more than your job and paid just for your job. You can try your best and it is never good enough….. they always want moreWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful most days because of lack employees to cover the shift.

title: Decent work
review: pay is decent for a retail job, work environment is pretty solid with the right management. Definitely good work for a fresh out of high school or in school kid.

title: Good benefits
review: Just like every other retail position; long hours, thankless, stressful, underpaid. Higher ups push change and demand maximum profit with graveyard crew.

title: Management needs work but work is easy and pays well
review: The store I work at is unorganized, and most management seems very unsure of decisions often leading to the wrong ones. People are quitting left and right due to this issue. My job is so simple and pays well considering. Benefits are offered. Most jobs in my area do not pay as well or offer Benefits to the "grunts".

title: Micro manage
review: No sick days. Micro mange. 5 points then you’re fired. The management team like to keep up drama all the time. They do not allow you to do call outs. Bad experience good for part time

title: Good money, Hard to get hired VERY Hard
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The wages, two 15 min breaks one hr lunch   but the team leads were hard on certain people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The team leads, they think you should learn everything in one dayWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressfull, When I applied ask for full time when they let me go they changed my app to seasonal, part timeWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy, but I love the people, I would still be working there, but they let me go they changed my app from full time to part time

title: Fast moving
review: This job works well for people who like to move around and always have things to do. I find it would be best for a person who likes to have all their tasks on laid out infront of them

title: Fun place to work with limited micromanagement
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pretty laid back to work for. Mostly friendly associates and management What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I haven’t found anything really stressful What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is laid back What is a typical day like for you at the company?Coming to work everyday and doing my job

title: Good place
review: I really like working at Walmart because it wasn’t really asking for much in a job and it was really easy. As long as you did your job then you wouldn’t be bothered. I’d definitely work there again.

title: Decent first job
review: I hated the hour lunch but they were willing to move me around if I wanted. I enjoyed working with customers in electronics but hated working the front registers.

title: Fun work place
review: Such a fun environment. I really enjoyed my coworkers and managers. Not really fast paced only on certain days such as holidays. Will always love this job

title: Full of Drama/ Hostile Working Enviorment
review: No wal mart is not a good place to work especially the one in harden road in Burlington nc. They keep people who just stand around and talk and do the bare minimum and get rid of hard working people such as myself for small little things. They are full of drama and you can’t trust anyone working there. People play pretend to like you and to be your friends all at the same time they snitching on you to management but not telling on they selves why they do that I don’t know I would not recommend anyone working at this particular wal mart.

title: I enjoyed working as a cashier
review: I enjoy working around the public people.greeting customers and helping those out around me. Handling food and store items and money and credit cards.

title: Stress/ bad management
review: It's sucks at Walmart management doesn't care about their employees. And u only collect about 1 day of pto every month and half. Ur lucky if they let u use it to.

title: Pick somewhere else. Don’t waste your mental health.
review: Spent 3 and a half years stocking shelves, making online orders, and breaking down pallets. Never once heard my department coach tell us thank you or good job. All management does is brown nose the store lead and upper management, walk around the store, and pretend like they actually do something. They treat you like dirt on the rare occasion they take the time to speak to you and they never compliment or offer a reward to a job well done. The pay is not merit-based, bonuses are non-existent, and they treat you like a replaceable peon from the moment you walk through the door. The only way you can get a raise is by getting a promotion and the process for getting one is panel-based. If the other managers if the store don’t like you, you’ll never see that promotion or extra dollar. Worst place I’ve ever worked.

title: Awful management, high turnover, stay away
review: Honestly, the only good thing I can say about the location that I worked at is some of the people I worked with were cool, had one cool manager. If you haven’t worked there 20 years like all the low life’s still there, you are treated like expendable garbage, while they get to do whatever they want (hide in the bathroom, take long and extra breaks) you are expected to pick up their work and finish it all. Despite the store having decent staffing, almost nothing would get done and would constantly get pushed onto another shift because of the sheer lack of motivation and people working. STAY AWAY!

title: Treat you horribly
review: Management treats you horribly Don't want to let you have days off because they are short. Even when you go to work everyday still treat you horrible don't give you credit for showing up and at x-mas give you a children's toothbrush....

title: Poor management very stressful lack of organization skills was not a good experience
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits and stocking management perksWasn’t a good place to workWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack if organization skills poor upper management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful and unpredictable. Unprofessional What is a typical day like for you at the company?Impredecible and unhealthy environment

title: laid back!
review: easy going work from home, not micromanaged at all.the pay is okay for the workload.You can climb up the ladder very fast with a little effort . apply apply apply

title: Never work there again
review: Management sucked, hours we’re constantly getting cut because they had “too many” employees on paper but half the employees were never there. No matter how much work you got done management was never happy with it . They never would send help if they have you too many pallets and you were low on people.

title: Fun Place
review: Easy work, with great benefits. Great coworkers, I learned multiple positions. The problem would be the customers, thay always had a problem. Management could be better, but overall a good place to work.

title: I love Walmart, and baby I am the experience.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I love my job at Walmart. I love my bosses and my co-workers. I love my schedule. I love my pay. I want to be an exceptional employee. Thank you so much Walmart.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I love my job at Walmart. My customers are great and nice. Today is my birthday, I love my customers.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Walmart is very diverse. I love Walmart. I love my Walmart.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I love Walmart. I work part-time for the most part. When I am at work, I love and enjoy my job.

title: Worst place I've ever worked for
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing is the worst company to work for they don't care about there associates What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They send you to a different area your not comfortable in What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile cause they don't care What is a typical day like for you at the company?Not know what time your going to leave

title: Job gets worse everyday
review: Enjoy benefits while you can, the company constantly ruins what they built in terms of benefits. Its a great stepping stone to something more but make sure you don't stick around long.

title: Made a difference in my department, so that was satisfying.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good Teamwork. Generally good direct supervisor guidance and helpful team members.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Production pressure and volume of work is usually  high.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Decent  and mostly positive people. Very hardworking co-workers. Upper store management was less than interested in front line workers. Not a good storewide vibe from upper management. Well that is not  unusual in America these days.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Work and clean. Move decisively.

title: It wasn't bad
review: People can be rude but it's not too bad. You kind of get used to it. Simple job. Just do your job and you'll be fine. Easy money. Orientation is easy then you do computer work for a couple days then actual training. It was a decent job

title: They don’t want you to help
review: I was fired for being to helpful. They hated that I wanted to know every department even if I knew my own. A joke to work with. I knew way more than the managers and they were all older and oblivious to technology.

title: Lots of diversity in jobs.
review: Pretty good place to work. Have something for everybody basically. Some departments are slow some are super fast paced.Lots of room to advance with the company too.

title: long shifts
review: it was ok. i didn’t enjoy how rude the customers were but other than that the team managment was ok. it is tiring but get used to it. interview was easy

title: It was okay
review: It was fine, but felt a lot of workers got away with doing nothing but always felt the need to call out others for every small thing. Pay was okay, and management was okay

title: I have none
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Horrible place to wrk I quit after 11 months What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Poor management poor scheduling What is the work environment and culture like at the company?39% of management was disrespect to customers and staff and race's What is a typical day like for you at the company?The 11 months I was there I hated 70% of it after the 1st week because I saw situations that had nothing to do with me butt it still was not right to see management act this way to others

title: Favoritism
review: If you work hard, you are a threat to the Leads that do nothing, and you WILL be treated as a threat. There are much better starter jobs out there. Don't waste your time and energy

title: Absolute poor place
review: Worked here for 3 years before being terminated. Management sucked and treated you like an expendable number and didn’t care about anything Was bearable for the first beginning and then things changed during Covid, but all and all place is a poor place to work

title: Very stressful working environment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Being able to purchase items after work without having to leave the store. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When people in your department don’t show up for workWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Most employees are down to earth, most Team Leads or managers don’t let the employees know how good of a job they doing, they only talk about the problem at work, some others just don’t care about their position because of the way they are talked to and they feel there’s no team work.It’s like a every man for themselves. Really there’s no team work, most are bringing their problems from outside to work and at times it’s uncomfortable sating in the break room or just having a conversation What is a typical day like for you at the company?I’m not there anymore, but it did feel  like nobody cared about the job, just the money, like I was just among employees with attitudes for no reasons. I had to be careful about what I say, everybody in their own world communication was poor.

title: It used to be a good place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with my cashiers and the day I got fired.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to work with management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Ungrateful, dread going to workWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Fast paced, way too much to do. Not enough time or people to do it.

title: Okay to work here.
review: Worked part-time during the evenings and weekends.  No issues.  Easy position and okay money for part-time position. Workplace culture was fine and co-workers were nice.

title: Okay summer job
review: Not too many hours. Pay could be better, benefits are not so good. Work is easy to learn, customers can be exhausting. Nice part-time job during the summer.

title: Nice workplace
review: Walmart is a great place to work. They have a lot of different benefits including health, dental, free college, 401(k), and the chance to choose the hours you want to work. Management experience was nice they were knowledgeable and willing to help out when needed.

title: Fair place to work as a temporary job
review: No room for growth and lots of cliques, but good place to pass the time earning money. Management was kind and seemed happy/operating in service of others.

title: Productive and fun
review: The managers are helpful and everyone will soon become a second family to you. They are always looking for people who want to move up. As long as you do your best you will not fail.

title: It was alright
review: The work was somewhat tough, and the employees (daytime shift) seemed miserable and were quick to start drama or slack off. I loved the night shift because of the people. You get an hour lunch, 2 15 minute breaks every 2 hours. Management is ok.

title: Not fun over worked
review: The worst experience I hope to have in retail. By far the most out of touch, unorganized, degenerate organization I also hope to ever work for. The reason why I say hope is because I hope to never experience a position at a job worse than OGP. It seems consistently that the most toxic people get projected into higher positions. Unless attaining a job further than entry level drives you to toxicity but I wouldn’t know that much.

title: Picky Management
review: Worst management ever, nitpick everything that you do all the time. Called my team a group of failures. I do not recommend working here as a member of management.

title: don't waste your time
review: This is the worst job possible. Management doesn't care about associates and the conditions are horrible. Every day there is something new and its for sure not worth it.

title: Very stressful
review: I've worked here for a short period of time and have never been so stressed out at a work place. Management wants to snap at you and treat you like a child infront of everybody including customers for doing your job. They want to push you to make people do the surveys after checking out or they threaten to write you up or fire you. Management from all departments want to bark orders but not lead by example, instead stand around and watch us while talking to each other. Favoritism plays a big role in what you can and can not do. I have gotten snapped at for having a conversation work related while watching others have conversations for 30 minutes at a time about personal things while others work and nothing is said about it. They don't treat you with much respect at all especially when you are doing your job.

title: Meet good people
review: Worked there for over 2 years and they are very understanding to a point I loved my co workers and the way the point system works they work with you and the job is not hard at all you just gotta work

title: Underpaid
review: Not a bad job but not worth the amount of pay. Job duty isn't very clear either as you are expected to stock but also help any customer who may come your way.

title: Fun job. Low pay. Awful hours. Always weekends and closing.
review: It's a somewhat fun job if you don't mind confrontation and constant interaction with law enforcement. Customers will put you tiktok/social media and speak offensively and inappropriately towards you. Walmart has a completely "hands off" policy for "everyones protection" but also leads to you getting in situations where your job security is always in question because of the actions of others. (If you did get into a physical alteraction regardless of reason or who initiates it you are likely to lose your job) and this in a job where the main focus is apprehending shoplifters. The potential for a violent interaction is always there so not for the feint of heart.

title: boring
review: job is fairly easy but if you don’t have headphones it can get boring & on days when it’s slow or there isn’t much freight you’re kinda just wandering around or cleaning up after others and doing odd jobs

title: Fun depending on who you working with
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get to learn the whole storeWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?When you don’t have help and they want to work you but don’t send any help but put a lot of demands behind everything for little payWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Is a good environment, but you have different nationalities that you work with all typesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Nice & Smooth then later on in the evening or afternoon it’s bananas

title: Productive and easy
review: Walmart definitely keeps you busy with fairly easy work and they make sure you are well trained before putting you on your own however they play favorites.

title: Love it
review: Great place to work. Awesome benefits. Always hiring and have open positions. You can also get into their stocks with them. Insurance is good too. Covers everything

title: I hated it
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They are sorry and always have their picksWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The supervisors are evil and they don't careWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's was good and I like the customers

title: cool
review: This is a good work to work in. They offer a good pay and good benefits such as walmart plus membership. You are also given consistent hours. A good place for college students to start at.

title: The Overnight management leads are very helpful and understanding.
review: Because the shift is understaffed, like most places currently, the work load is heavy and stressful when you have an aisle assigned to you with no help and a whole lot of merch to be stocked.

title: Productive and fun place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The supervisors and managers.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Physical activity.  Lifting heavy items over the course of the day.  Added job duties, time expected to complete orders.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Diversity.  Pleasant co-workers for the most part.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Filling online orders for customers groceries and other items.  Inventory.  Lifting up to 25lbs.  Walking, stooping, standing, bending legs.  Packaging orders.  Frequently being interrupted by customers.

title: Good Job
review: Good job to work for just can’t get sucked into being stuck there like majority of the older people other than that you just do your work and go home nothing more nothing less.

title: It is what you make it, Everyone  one experience  is different.  Personally  mines had as far as Customer Service  I have a high level  of  standard
review: There are many people  being hired and fired , I've heard witness more than a few.My advice Work  hard , stay busy and love what you do.I did , Thanks for the opportunity  it was fun!!Met a lot of employees  I changed lives forever  and Customers  love me , Tyra

title: Avoid if you can
review: The company itself has good benefits, however, the majority of all the stores across the country have a terrible reputation and what you read about the company is all true.

title: absolutely love it, walmarts been the best place i’ve worked so far, especially cause i got all the good coworkers!
review: I got all the good coworkers and managers! Columbia KY Walmart is the best one out there. It’s a fun place to work and yes it gets stressful but at the end of the day we’re like a great big family who cares for eachother

title: Pathetic
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Was assaulted by a customer that was planning to shop lift and Walmart then fired me for work place violenceWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Peaceful dealing with disgruntled workers and not being paid enough to live as a grown adult What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fairly tame.  Stockers seem stressed more then anything as they are on timers for stockingWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It’s pretty boring for how ever long they let you work

title: First great job
