review: Flexible for students. Easy to manage with school. Lunch breaks are short. Discounts. Good first job however eventually should want more. Pretty easy job

title: Decent job
review: A decent job for the pay and repetitive work flow. Not much room for growth unless you're a long time employee and if management considers you a favorite.

title: Fast paced business environment that leaves absolutely no room for any employee appreciation.
review: Though this corporation offers great benefits to adult employees, as my time working as a minor there, I received absolutely none of this. Due to my age, I wasn't allowed to work overtime, nor setup a 401k, and despite this setup leaving me barely scraping for ends meat, I would come in every day and give this company my all. In the end though, it never mattered to Walmart. No matter how many sales you help make, how many times you fight to have a positive customer interaction despite the despicable environment, they will cut you the second they have new faces to bring into the company. That is how much respect a corporation such as this has for their associates. They pick and choose who gets to bend the rules. Associates smoke in aisles, management takes goods without paying, certain employees are far past retirement age, and are busting away every day to make ends meet at Walmart. This is no healthy place to work. If all else fails, and you are REALLY scrounging for money, I still wouldn't recommend anybody put themselves through the pain that is working with Walmart.

title: Overall its okay place for my first job experience
review: The job I am doing right now works for me as part time worker also in a college. Most of my coworkers and team leads are very friendly to me. Anyways, I personality really want to change my job within the store, lke I want to change to the optical center, but it's been taking a very long time on it and crrenty still waiting on it.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Horrible managers whenever they were around at all. Majority of customers that come in are the most entitled negative individuals you will ever meet and upper management will take their side over yours Everytime.

title: Workplace
review: Has it days where it is super fast pasted but sometimes you just chill and have nothing going on. It can be super taxing on feet because of constant movement

title: Okay
review: Okay, management sucks. Can’t leave on breaks, decent pay. Starting $16.00 +. Easy work, customer service isn’t bad and I enjoy working with the people I have now.

title: Was an okay first job
review: This job was fine while it lasted but I knew pretty early on it wasn’t for me. I didn’t like being micro managed and understand now ( I was 18 at the time)  that this is what comes with have a big corporation job.

title: Stressful
review: In general, Walmart is considered a large company and in the area I worked in, it was stressful at times especially when certain items had been opened and it continued to be kept on the shelf or even thrown away.  Job was easy and self-explanatory in itself and great for saving up money but it was a hassle at times.

title: Great Job!!!
review: I worked for Walmart Call Center as a Resolution Specialist II.  I enjoyed taking calls from customers and solving issues related to products purchased in store.

title: Dont
review: Just don't take a job there it is not a good idea. Horrible mangers that do not care about you or your life to let u take off work. Horrible pay even as a manger.

title: Managers pick favorites
review: This isn't a bad place to work and the job is pretty easy. If the managers don't like you, then be expected to be treated unfairly. It is also difficult to change availability and most of the time when it does get changed, it is not followed

title: Bad
review: Used to be a good place to work but the manager does not care about the employees just the money he's making. 1st does all the hard work. 10/10 don't recommend

title: Retail
review: Great place to work. Overly corporate style of management. Often times over bureaucratic. Feels like the whole company is ran by an outdated computer ai sometimes. Open opportunity and plenty of possibilities and positioning

title: If given the opportunity to work there again I would.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Consistent work load. Generous pay hourly. Working for the general welfare of the company to keep goods and services available to the public.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?To many managers in the department with different work agendas, causing one to be shuffled around to different work areas with the inability to master a position.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Teams work well together if you're part of the team. Nose rings, finger nails and hair are the culture. There are a lot of hard working people who work hard.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Assignment, work hard to meet the demands of production quotes without interference of equipment malfunctions, and the lack of equipment to productively meet the demands of production.

title: It’s ok
review: Well when I started working there it was great but then the schedule started getting messed up I have a 7 kid and no one to watch her while she off the bus or school so it’s a little hectic

title: Quit if you don’t move up in a year everything is pre selected
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing, management doesn’t care What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You get treated like a slave, you’re years pf dedication don’t matter, you will be terminated for having home crisis issues. They don’t protect or care about you. They just need bodys to make corporate money. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Management doesn’t help the Stressful environment they just add to it. They give unrealistic task that they expect you to achieve when your the only one working in that area for the whole shift & customer services. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Typical day is being treated like a child by managers. Bring treated like your nothing but a number, that’s what they had told me directly. I did enjoy speaking with customers i knew them by name & helping them find items.

title: Great pay and benefits
review: Can’t say nothing bad about the job…Great workout good paying job excellent benefits..I recommend anything that’s look for a challenging job that you will love the hours and schedule then Walmart is the place

title: Walmart is a company which provides the opportunities to continue to level up.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Walmart provides flexible schedules as well as a considerable amount of time off.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Due to the economy and it's lack of quality people who want to work it can be frustrating when not enough people are around to get a job done properly What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Coworkers are helpful and management tries very hard to fix any problem What is a typical day like for you at the company?As a digital Shopper the day is fast paced and you must be flexible and determined

title: Productive environment. Great learning experiences untill a certain point. No help in growth in advancement unless chosen.
review: A great starter job recommend going for OGP for a great starting pay. Coaches are really picky on who they choose to promote. Pto and ppto benefits are great to have for taking whatever days you want off.

title: Overworked
review: The hours sucked and they would switch up your schedule to get you to work on days you had off. Worked for 7 days straight waiting for my day off and when it finally came i got scheduled again.

title: Nice place
review: Good place to work Customers were great but occasionally you would get those that you want please no matter what Management varied by person to person Some were helpful some not so much Raises take to long to get and when you dad get one it would be 24 cents their so cheap they can't even get a while quarter

title: I loved being there and I will try to get back asap to keep the job at Walmart.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?At Walmart, the hours are great, the roles are, and the freedom feels great too.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?On a slow or sluggish feeling day, the hours could be long and a bit harsh to do with.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s very calm to be there working. Different roles or worked areas are obvious with the workers as well.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I go in, try to do my job to the best of my ability and knowledge, miss stress if I can and learn for the next day.

title: Ok
review: Okay it was alright though some customer interactions were less than good. Though the workers there were nice and as long as you did what you’re supposed it worked out

title: Production and fun place to work at
review: Good and have fun but not to much fun work hard and you will get what you want and watch what you do and say around people cause you never know who is watching you

title: Mixed Experience
review: Pay is good as long as you don’t stay stagnant in one position/store. Lack of respect for employees is stressful especially when a lot of management has less experience at the job than the employee. Depending on the store favoritism can make or break your experience as well.Early morning is the best grocery picker shift due to lack of customers and well stocked shelves, but is often (understandably, as long as they do their job well) reserved for senior employees. Also, if you hate mornings and want mid shifts another position may be better depending on how your store views procedures. If they expect you to look everywhere for an item, get with management, etc. it can be physically and mentally exhausting. I’ve been in tears before trying to find a manager while getting interrupted by customers looking for stuff as well.If you are hired on as a dispenser expect a lot of physical work and movement. Totes often weigh more than you expect due to multiple gallons of milk/water or something like cat litter. You will deal with more problem solving as well due to people misplacing totes, losing labels or customers/delivery drivers having order issues, get to know the system well as soon as you can.Work life balance also greatly depends on your management. For the most part you get enough PPTO (protected paid time off) to cover for anything, but expect them to hold it against you in various ways even if you go out of your way to pick up the slack or stay late to help thinking that will “make up for” the times you couldn’t be there.If you’re going into full-time just be sure - more...

title: Overworked
review: Great job but at times I felt overworked and a little unappreciated. Nice pay for those who don’t have much experience with any other job. They were very flexible for college students

title: It’s a job
review: I worked overnight stocking doing dairy products which I feel was a lot of work for the 8hrs you are there. You can get lucky and be put in other areas but you make moving constantly and with a purpose to meet deadline or get reprimanded, it’s a job for the meantime

title: Great
review: Walmart is the best place to work has great benefits, pto, & treats employees very well.! I worked here & can tell you from my experience that their employment was very awesome.!

title: Unnessary Drama with poor Market Leadership
review: As a Coach, I truly love my job. Unfortunately, all my leads get pushed out as soon as they try to hold people accountable with ethics cases. Years ago it was completely different. Associates today will run you ragged being disrespectful with poor performance as they know they can get you written up or terminated with a false ethics case. Also, tasks cannot be completed as associates have learned how to manipulate PPTO to come in late so many days a week or put in on key event days.  There needs to be more experience in the market teams, we have mostly younger men with little to no idea of the diverse communities and departments we have. Walking around the backroom- turns out most of us are in therapy or had to become medicated to come to work everyday.

title: Ok job to start off but not a career
review: Regular retail job, flexible scheduling, decent pay for young people. There is opportunity for growth but you’ll need to build relationships as that will matter more than just job performance

title: Do not trust management
review: The company will literally screw over dozens of employees to satisfy one customer. The customer can treat you like trash and you have stand there with a smile

title: Very unorganized
review: Do not recommend at all very unorganized. Managers are no where to be found and it seems as if they are only hiring kids. Tried this company as a part time job and decided to leave within 2 weeks

title: Do not work here
review: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! Managements and CSMs play games non stop. They favor the lazy, "good looking" workers over tehh ard workers. Don't get stuck in this dead end job!!

title: Worst company ever
review: Horrible place to work management is horrible. They treat a employees horrible. You are constantly being gaslighted, and they like to play with your hours.

title: overall a good work enviroment
review: I worked here for over a year and was expecting a unpleasant environment but was met with a acceptable standard. The best part was the co workers as they are a make or break in this job the only criticism I had was feeling overworked and understaffed during shifts as well as occasional system issues which caused mayhem and trouble on those days. The only downside and issue with the job i faced was rude and disrespectful customers.

title: Hellhole
review: Low-paying job with low morale. High turnover. Management keeps full-time employees capped at 39 to 39 1/2 hours to avoid paying benefits at 40 hours.

title: Easy to get hired!... Due to high turn-over.
review: Typical Day?Stocking, cashiering, stocking again.Workplace culture?I worked overnights. We were a tight-knit family. Management?Some were good eggs and knew what they were doing. Others had no clue and should've never been promoted. Often times capable people were passed over to promote incapable people. Hardest part of the job?Having to pick up others slack or do three jobs at once. Best part of the job?A portion of your coworkers feel the same way about how things are ran. Also, maternity leave/baby bonding leave totaled 4 months consecutively while I was employed. What I learned?I learned quite a few skills that ive carried with me throughout jobs. But, I also learned first that everyone is replaceable.

title: Good place to work for students
review: Walmart is a decent place to work if you are in college since you can work full time or part time. They work with scheduling for the most part. However, the communication there is lacking especially between management to associates. The quality of the job really depends on which department you’re in.

title: Working at the dc.
review: Benefits are ok, the fitness pass is great, free walmart plus membership. Raises every 6 months from hire date until 2.5 years then you've reached top pay for that departmant. YOU WILL BE WORKED.

title: Soul Sucking
review: Poor management and favoritism is the name of the game at Walmart. If your manager likes you, you could get away with anything. Even if you are the worst employee. You hard work and efforts to go above and beyond will go unnoticed. If you do happen to make it into management they will put you in the position with little to no training. This place leads to burnout and a crazy turn over rate. The only reason for two stars is because their benefits and PTO are okay, not great but okay.

title: Management sucks
review: There are cliques within management that have been through multiple locations and found each other back at the same store together. More so a competition between management and employees.

title: It can be a fun and productive place to work at except...
review: Why do I feel like Walmart or this location at least, doesn't really care about the individuals that they've hired? All associates who I have spoken to have either felt like they're never actually heard or recognized for most of the work they've contributed for the company. Management sucks so good luck looking for a manager or a higher-position lead anywhere when you need them the most. They allow in just about everyone to come through those company doors, which made me feel unsafe and explained a lot of my former co-workers desensitized-like behaviors. We're not allowed to refuse service to rude or even harassing customers because that would "escalate" or "instigate" a situation. We were told that yes we are allowed to defend ourselves by minimal physical efforts as much as possible and encouraged to run if anything. Yup.Other than that the job itself is super easy and manageable when you're not getting reamed at or thrown impossible lists of things to do before your shift ends. Maybe its just this store. Hopefully. Micro-managing places like this never cease to amaze me how much they can get away with treating their employees and still be booming in business.

title: Ups and Downs
review: Not a bad place to work for the most part.  the job has good benefits and the pay is honestly really nice.  Makes it really hard to get away from to be honest.  But satisfaction and happiness are a big issue.  Would love to do something more meaningful and fulfilling honestly.

title: Ok job . Pays the bills
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The co workers and discount cardWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management . Each one will tell you different things that need to be done. Then you get yelled out for not getting thing done What is a typical day like for you at the company?Punching in and going straight to work .unloading a trailer . Got to do it in under 2 hours. No matter how people you have

title: productive
review: good coworkers, annoying supervisors, easy workload in cap, just stock pallets from overnight that they couldnt finish, change features and zone and topstock

title: Decent Place
review: It has it's rush hours but it's a decent place to work at. I would recommend working here, as any job can be stressful but doable. If you want to get paid more take the exam for pharmacy technician.

title: Favoritism and lack of guidance
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people I worked with and helping customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The orrcurances and the upper management and the work phones not working right What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast pace and so many different cultures What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in get on a register or self check out and work for 2 hours go to break then come back doe 2 hrs then 1 hour lunch and come back for another 2 hrs and break then come back for 2 more then off

title: Definitely a learning experience, often very discouraging.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits, opportunities for advancementWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Very inconsistent leadership, high turnoverWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It differs from store to storeWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?What's typical is there IS NO typical day. Inconsistent

title: Terrible!!
review: Do not work at Walmart!! management does not care about their associates at all, all they care about is their money. you can be severely ill or have a family death and they still expect you to come in. 0/10 do not recommend working at Walmart.

title: Relaxed environment
review: A great job for high school and collage students to earn a fair wage with a flexible schedule. Management is understanding of employee scheduling needs and will make schedules work .

title: Fun workplace
review: Very fun job. I enjoyed working with the public. I enjoyed working with my coworkers. The management team was very good to work for. They were understanding.

title: It was a great 20 years.
review: I enjoyed working for Walmart for 20 years. Their benefits were good, the pay wasn't quite as good. Management did the best they could with the tools and resources they had.

title: Fun and talkative environment work place
review: Walmart job was my memorable work place, where got so many friends, good environment and fun place with work. I really missed those day when i was working.I feel i will get chance i can work again in walmart.

title: Horrible management
review: Management were rude, bullies, and did not care about their employees well being. Coworkers were great and the job wasn't bad but management ruined the experience and made it a stressful place to work at.

title: Solid spot
review: Solid job do your part and it’s easy money. Environment was okay everyone was working together. as long as you do your part the shift should be easy. Management is okay.

title: Micromanage too much, don’t appreciate work!
review: Your store manager has a lot to do with the store politics but ask any Walmart worker and they will tell you they don’t like it. Honestly just look at their faces as they work none look happy most are have it their soul sucked away.

title: Soul Sucking
review: They work you harder and harder. As time goes on, the freight increases and the number of employees helping decreases. It's not the absolute bottom as far as unskilled labor so it gets a 2/5.

title: Overall
review: Mostly pays bills, Room for growth Everybody can work there no previous working experience able to transfer to different States. If need to and good to retire from

title: Nice place
review: Lots of work to be done. Management was not helpful. Little training or support from coworkers. Overall would not recommend some one to work here for too long

title: Good pay for area
review: Good pay for the area especially when considering it doesn't involve a lot of physical labor. Hours can fluctuate and management can be a pain, but its a solid job with room for advancement if you're looking for that.

title: Great Managers, Great Pay, Great Job.
review: I have worked for Walmart DC in Corrine Utah for 7 years and have loved it. The Managers and higher ups strive for the best. The pay is great, especially when you are an order filler. The shifts are great 4 days on 3 days off or 3 days on 4 days off! I am moving states so I will be transferring to a store but this job has done so much for me as far as getting my life together and keeping my family fed and happy. I am Proud to have worked for a distribution center that dedicates itself to being the best!

title: It’s ok I guess
review: Walmart is ok there not to much good or bad to say it’s kinda well balanced between pros and cons manager sucks but the associates are awesome mangers don’t help much but they team work makes up for it

title: Great opportunities, disorganized, hostile, lack of respect from management
review: My store in Cambridge Maryland has gone through 6 managers ,my initial job was successful and tons of compliments from customers , my issue lack of moral lack of respect from other managers and co workers ,the job environment was hostile, disorganized, lack of  management support,

title: Good job with some stress
review: I took the job for granted it’s way better than working food but it could get really busy and workflow could become heavy on you depending on what needs to be done and how many people you have, especially during seasonal times

title: normal
review: decent job you can get your work done and get out honestly it's just a good started position if you need money. Don't sweat it too much. There is upward mobility if you really want

title: Easy
review: Was an easy yet boring job although my coworkers gave me a spark that wanted to keep showing up to the workplace. Job eventually gets super repetitive and demotivating.

title: Not what you expect
review: I, like most people who work here longer than a couple years, have worked several positions and more than 1 store. It's hard work and your experience depends heavily on your team. If people have integrity and know how to help themselves by helping the team it can be a great place to work. I have had construction retirees and national guardsmen quit for it being too hard on them.What most people don't realize is that each store is run on it's own finances. Theft, shrink, etc comes out of the same money paychecks are paid with. So please don't take corporate earnings as how well your local walmart does. Either as customer or associate (we don't have the same rights as employees) how you'll be treated can be incredibly different than another one just down the road. That said, corporate makes all decisions on what products are carried at what time of year such as sending swimsuits and nixing shovels in the middle of midwest blizzard season. Or Christmas starting shortly after school so people are tired of it before Thanksgiving.

title: Good place
review: I've worked at a neighborhood market as well as the big stores and I enjoyed both places. Management cared about the quality of the product being put out as well as their team.

title: Okay workplace
review: Not a bad job just bad management and employees. Point system is not the best and new hires will make more than you. Hardest part of this job is dealing with bad management.

title: Not the company you think it is.
review: A typical day in homeoffice included answering phones, working issues other associates are having, and collaborating with several teams to resolve problems. What I've learned in my time here is the culture within Walmart is very different than its customer face. Management has free range to treat any associate any way they feel is better for the company. It is well known by the associates that the core beliefs have become more like the core suggestions. Values that are dropped at the slightest provocation. Standards salaried members of management that are allowed, and encouraged, to treat any associate with as much discrimination or other ill-treatment that is required to increase the teams productivity. I absolutely love talking to customers and resolving their issues, or teaching them how to resolve their own issues. This however is seen as removing the possibility for more "tickets" in the team and is highly discouraged. There are good managers who have the best interests of their associates at heart, but in my opinion they are far and few removed from the overall culture at Walmart homeoffice.

title: Fantastic
review: Good place to work great people understanding yes .I appreciate every thing it was great. I worked very hard to succeed and appreciate all the love Walmart gave.

title: Pay succs
review: They hire you at fulltime but work you part-time hours so u lose your benefits and everything eise right out the gate very. Unprofessional and unethical

title: The paperwork right that I worked with and I got the job done.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The the people that you work with.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management and getting things done with no help.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?That was no problem. The store was not the cleanest especially in the back room.What is a typical day like for you at the company?It was Non-Stop from start to finish if you had a minute management wanted something else done.

title: Good job overall
review: Was very simple work, mostly just making the shelves look nice and stocking them. Had the freedom to listen to music and drink and eat as long as it didn't hinder my work. Good breaks as well. Easy job, but if you don't take is seriously, it'll show by the end of the night

title: Simple
review: The work done is simple but can get a little overwhelming. The people I work with are nice though the management could use some improving. You might get moved to a department you don’t want to work in.

title: Productive
review: Great place to work and grow, a lot of potential with the right mind set. Great manager and co worker.

title: Es profesional y hay oportunidades
review: Buena empresa muy profesional hay gente muy buena si hay comedor en un tiempo  fuimos los mejores gerentes han cambiado buen trato hay protección civil  mucha seguridad  simulacros

title: It’s okay
review: They pay well, I like all my coworkers except my boss. They give raises every year and the environment is not bad. The pharmacist Manager can be hard to work with though.

title: Good pay for the work you do.
review: It’s a good first job for the pay if you can handle a little manual labor. Not too stressful and the people are pretty awesome. Walmart is always a good career path choice for some people if that’s what you’d like to do.

title: Hectic
review: You walk about a million steps per day all over the store, and then a bit more dispensing orders. Physically demanding, even more mentally demanding because of lack of staff and unrealistic expectations with skeleton crews

title: Lower management (on the floor) was great, hiring team and upper management are unprofessional and passive aggressive
review: The management I have worked with (Online grocery dept.) are great. However, the manager that hires and is supposed to support employees in their careers/ growth is passive aggressive, unsupportive, and likes to make younger adults feel terrible for living like any other adult (being a younger caregiver, sick leave, having 2nd or 3rd jobs, child care, bereavement, etc.). It has gotten ridiculous. At least 3/4ths of my department has left since I started working there, which is just over half a year. Do not recommend, I have had customers tell me that they are rooting for me to get out while I can.

title: Easy Money if you play your cards right
review: - You a guaranteed 40 hours a week without a doubt if you're hired as a full time associate- Work schedule is very flexible and the PTO system is easily understandable and easy to use- PTO works on a hours worked rewards hours off basis and there is also a Protected PTO system separate from that that works on the same merit however it's a fixed rate whereas PTO becomes faster to obtain the longer you are there. PTO is used for days requested off in advance however you can request days off unpaid anyway if you don't have the PTO.- Call offs work on a points system and that's where Protected PTO comes into play. If you need to call off you can submit Protected PTO for that day and you will be paid for it as well as not have the call off count against you.There are two routes to succeeding here:A: You keep to yourself and just do your work as needed but stay an AssociateOr B: Make friends with everyone, especially anyone in management. Build connections. Go above and beyond from time to time. Just be generally good at your job, friendly, and reliable and you will move up fairly fast especially if you vocalize that you're interested.Very important thing at this company is to be a good judge of management because while most of mine have been great people, every company has its person that shouldn't have the position they do. People play favorites here. It's a "don't hate the player hate the game" kind of situation. You can't beat, or change it. However, the "game" is easy if you're just friendly and reliable. It's a retail job. Expect the quality of a retail job.TL:DR - more...

title: Decent
review: it's a simple job to do and I'm paid 14/hr but I think the pay could be raises a bit more. Managers need to do better with scheduling people because I end up staying late

title: really good place to work
review: It was a cool job just rough because it was from ten pm to 7 am HARD ON YOUR BODY NEVER ENOUGH SLEEP OR CATCHING UP BUT THE BEST PLACE I HAVE WORKED SO FAR

title: Very inclusive
review: I felt like I was part of a team that supported each other. I liked the hours. We worked hard to keep the shelves organized and presentable. I felt that management cared about people.

title: H e l l. on earth!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing its all a big lie! Don't waste your time.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Knowing no matter how hard you work  its never appreciated or enough for this company, They will use you, break you and throw you away. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?If you have a sole you will not go far, What is a typical day like for you at the company?You got this, you got that, and while your doing the next thing Im about to give you , you need to come over here and do all of these other people's work as well. Don't ever ask to use your vacation time that you earned because it will never be an appropriate time to take and Im sure if you do get it thry will tell you that you are still responsible for getting your work done while your not there

title: Stressful
review: It is stressful because all of the managers are under extreme pressure and do not know how to handle it and take it out on their employees. Working here feels like it's you against the world.

title: Blackhole
review: Soul sucking. Management is untrustworthy, unorganized and spiteful. If they let you stay on task it's a breeze. But they are terrible at planing. Management does the bare minimum of work. They mostly walk around and flirt with the youngsters.

title: You're only a number to them.
review: Worked in a few different departments, with many different managers and it was always the same. You're not a person to them, you're only seen as a number.

title: Fun place
review: I'm happy working here.  Everyone has been respectful and helpful.  The job isn't hard sometimes customers aren't to nice so it's hard to please them no matter how nice you are. Managers seem nice and not to managery as I. If you stay busy and do your job they leave you alone.It's an entry level basic job as cashier so the pay is fair for this title. You can clock in and out on your phone so you don't have to walk a mile to the back.

title: Depends on the people
review: Good for people who enjoy fast paced work, I did both picking and dispensing. They found out I was really good at preparing orders and thats all I ever do. Good luck getting a day off work it depends on if there’s coverage and tenure.

title: It's eh. Depends what you need out of job.
review: Good benefits for full time, good co-workers, fun work, about 50/50 on your management team, under paid af, under appreciated, they make weird choices who to promote. Very weird. Don't bother working hard if you want to promote, just kiss the right *** and you'll be good.

title: Absolutely terrible place to work
review: Worked for Walmart for almost 8 years. The people I worked with but the job itself was terrible. Working 60-70 work weeks. Being lied to about getting employees over and over. Upper management not caring about employees. Very very toxic

title: It’s ok
review: It’s ok when the team works together like they are suppose to. Works well with the schedules people want and need. Managers, well there’s good and bad ones everywhere lol

title: Good workplace
review: Amazing coworkers amazing boss! Everyone works well together and we don’t have a hard time getting things done. You don’t get looked down on and if you need help the workers there help

title: Fun an lovely place
review: Had good team players an fun managers.Good place to grow an start your life an family place to have.Good for schooling an degrees to have at the job..

title: Not a very good work environment
review: Some of the managers have favorites, and it shows, it’s not good for mental health. You’ll make really amazing friends but that’s it other than that don’t work at Walmart

title: Fun workplace
review: Very good place to work but people can be rude. Slow some days and the hardest part is when it gets busy can be stressful. I loved working here tho people are amazing and kind

title: Takes your soul away but it pays well and great benefits
review: I have worked for the DC 6019 for 8 years. They take real good care of their people. They would do cookouts and sometimes even pot lucks. The dress code is super relaxed even though freight would at times be falling from the modules high up. You get your work done and go home SAFE. I like the fact that you get REAL and CERTIFIED  training on power equipment. There is room for advancement. Really good pay and benefits. The co workers I miss the most. Management were cool. Hours though are the most deceiving. Sometimes a 36 hour work week would turn into a 20 hr work week when slow, however you can cross train in other departments. At times it's a lot of PHYSICAL work meant more for the youngish. My body is pretty ruined after 8 years but I really have nothing bad to say about Walmart!

title: Good place to work.
review: Many drivers gave made a great living here. Management is good to work for. Integrity is a must unless you are management especially home office. Many schedules to choose from once you build seniority.

title: Good job
review: I enjoyed it. Great people. Breaks is short probably is the only flaw. They would make you work 12 hours with one 15 minute break and one 20 minute break which makes 0 sense

title: Extremely Stressful
review: It is very good money but the most stressful job I ever had. If you don’t handle stress well, you definitely may wanna think twice about working here. They give you plenty of time to make production but definitely ride you until you do.

title: Bonus and pto
review: Bonus was usually a large sum but was extremely difficult to obtain. The amount of pto was great if the management team was allowed to take it. The upper market management was unfair and hardly promoted based on extra tasks completed throughout the market.

title: Very friendly
review: Good associates good managers great training you love working there I liked it I had almost 24 years there  I got fired because I broke a rule Walmart has a point system every absence is at least a point depending on type of you get more than 5  in six months your fired that's what happened  to me  it use to be nine points wish that would have stayed I wouldn't be fired than

title: Unloading trucks the best thing around.
review: Unloading trucks kept me away from customers huge + At least until I threw my shoulder out. Some nights we were denied lunch until the last hour of the day, either allowing us to just clock out and get in trouble or stay additional hours to not get docked in attendance for taking a lunch to close to clock out time.

title: Managers
review: Managers very disrespectful always talked down to like you were just born and when asking for help they were annoyed that you were taking time away from there social hour

title: Favoritism, they do not value school
review: Management does not treat everyone fairly and they do not like listen to concerns you have about any coworker you may have. They also do not accept doctors notes and leaves are never approved.

title: Busy, Customers, Fun sometimes
review: This Walmart can be extremely busy. 10-minute breaks are actually 5 or 4 minutes. They expect your 10-minute break to start from the moment you leave the register. It won't matter if a customer asks you questions, and they don't care about the time it takes for you to walk to the breakroom.

title: easy job
review: i really recommend working here. they gave you actual hours here and the pay isn’t bad. why it doesn’t have 5 stars is bc sometimes the work here is boringly slow and drags on.

title: productive
review: you either start the day taking out orders to customers or you’re shopping all day for orders it’s a good job there’s always something to do i would recommend working in this department

title: Okay place needs more people
review: Just needed more help a lot of time doing 4 people’s job, the managers were decent and most of the coworkers were nice but they would hire people that were not good with people a lot.

title: Great place to work
review: The job can be stressful, but rewarding. Some difficult customers. Corporate is a little out of touch with in store problems. Overall I would do it again. I learned a lot there.

title: A great team
review: I am blessed to work with a group of experienced and exceptional technicians. Work life balance has also increased over the past few years. I get exactly the schedule that I want with all of my days off together.

title: Flexible schedule. Management at my store was good. Not many opportunites for advancement or raises.
review: The job was good while I was attending school. I'm sure management varies greatly between stores, but mine was good. Corporate can be difficult though. There were few raises and I didn't advance much in my time there.

title: Great
review: I worked there since 16. The job is pretty easy and chill, no complaints. Manager didn’t distracted from work. The people are not always but mostly nice.

title: Love the team that I was with
review: The team that I worked with made the job fun! We were always laughing and having fun, especially when it was slow. The con is that there was favoritism, but that can be found anywhere.

title: Productive work place
review: Great benefits. The pay was on but the point system Isn’t the best with family life it’s like the job always come first. It’s really what you make from it.

title: Run
review: Such potential but the coach for the department is an absolute WRECKING BALL. People are dropping out of the department like flies because it's so bad.

title: Great employees
review: It was really good manager and employees are nice and we had a lot of downtime when there was not no orders but eventually they had a big lay off due to no work

title: Es muy competitivo
review: Es bueno competitivo  buen dinero muchos beneficios

title: Good place to work
review: I really enjoyed working her for the most part. Some days were not so great but overall a good job for anyone looking for steady work. Good management.

title: Slave driving labor
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Other people working there and the 10% discount What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The equipment never worked, never enough carts and jacks for everyone to use without fighting. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?They expect you to get 11 hours worth of work done in your 8 hour shift, absolutely no over time, but god forbid you don’t get all your stuff done either. It’s a joke. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful, sore feet, faulty equipment, managers expecting more than realistic

title: Run.
review: I’ve never had a worse job in my life.outdated equipment makes unloading the truck almost impossible. We’re supposed to have 20+ people and we have 6. But we’re expected to get everything done like we have a full team.

title: Fair workplace
review: Good pay fair workplace. Would recommend to anyone. Managment will work with you on your schedule super fair management and great co-workers. cant really complain about much

title: Definitely not worth attempting mean to staff
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Terrible place they don't care about staff What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything is terrible not worth it What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not friendly at all everyone bullies and is stuck up What is a typical day like for you at the company?Overwhelming mean people very strict

title: Easy work low pay for experienced drivers ,
review: Easy job, great pto, office people are nice , great equipment and a lot of focus on safety, good 401k and stock options, it’s very low pay for new people with many years of driving experiences ,forget being a new driver there and getting time off in the peak summer months , that’s saved for the senior drivers , over all great place to work , oh ya, there medical and dental are the worst benefits I’ve ever had in my many many years of driving,

title: When we got together and work as a team, is the best team you can have ever,.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They are so willing to cover your needs, either you are student or you have some part of disability, or circumstance change in your life,. They will work with your schedule,. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When you are regular worker, you are around other workers, you can see who is a hard worker and who is just playing around and get credit for the ones they do work hard,  but our managers don’t see it,!! I understand they are not full time with us, but at least ask around before they fired somebody,.  Y’all may be getting rid of a good worker,What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Overall is a very good place to work and good benefits What is a typical day like for you at the company?I am totally different then the rest of the workers, I work for my Lord, normally I do my best for Him in everything I do and say,. I am always happy, no darkness can shut my light,. I am ok, I always find a words to say when somebody is complaining, disappointed,  I enjoy my days and my work and my love for the people don’t let me see any bad intention that will upset my day,, different!

title: Easy Paycheck
review: Walmart is nothing special. Relatively easy work for a paycheck that's it. Managers are mostly just cashiers and stockers who never quit so they care as much as all the other stoner teenagers working there. Decent job if you just need some temporary work for some money but wouldn't recommend looking into it for anything long-term.

title: Awful
review: Awful company, treats their people like garbage. No ethical guidelines, and no **** or giggles given towards their employees. 10 out of 10 would NOT recommend this job

title: Hit and Miss
review: When working here, I learned that just like how teachers can make or break classes in school, managers can make or break any job, especially retail. When (Salaried) management treated us with respect or even left us alone, this was a nice place to work with plenty to do and comradery between hourly associates and managers. Things really got bad after the new store manager deliberately made our work harder and was hostile with staff.

title: Okay
review: I worked at Walmart a while back. You were always part time so you didn't really get benefits and they are very strict on missing time for any reason.

title: a typical day at work
review: From My Personal Experience It Wasn’t Bad At All, I’m Just More Of A Quiet Guy . Not Much Of. A Talker Unless Needed . There Were Great Team Leads Assisting Us To Our Job Duties .

title: ok to work
review: not a recommended place to do business it was ok not fun low pay hard work no guidance from upper management. No one seemed like they wanted to be there.

title: Coworkers are OK Management is terrible.
review: Let's start off with the good....I like most of my coworkers. However management is a joke. You have an app to request time off, even if you're using your "protected pto" they still deny your request. I had to change a major drt. appointment 3 times & still couldn't get a day off. Finally had to just call out of work, & receive a point for it. If you go to work early because they've called you in, you get 1/2 a point. If you clock out past your work schedule because they've made you stay late, you get a 1/2 a point. You can only receive 5 pts. in 6 months or you'll be terminated. I've had to go above my stores bosses, and fight to keep my job. It's ridiculous, it all sounds nice until you actually work there. In my 9 months of working there it's been a revolving door with Managers. I've watched 11 ppl that have been there for 12, 18, 20, 26 yrs quit.

title: Terrible work experience
review: The long term employee's treat the part time temp help terrible and actively try to get them fired. Only good thing is the flexible schedule they provide.

title: Productive workplace
review: Fair place to work, co workers were good and management cares. Can get lots of hours if you want, pretty laid back work environment as long as you are doing your job.

title: Fun
review: Good place to work. Can be stressful at times, but for the most part, I enjoy the atmosphere. The store manager is great, and so are most of the customer service managers.

title: Stepping stone
review: good place to start if you don't have a degree or any skills. Get hired, do more than you sign up for to get promoted, use those skills to go somewhere else.

title: Co workers
review: Cannot move forward hard to get promoted at my store too much theft so unable to advance or even go to another store some managers are friendly others you wonder how they even got there

title: The overnight crew is a blast. :)
review: The environment that the overnight team create is so welcoming. I enjoyed working with them. Once you know where things are, the work is pretty simple. It's mainly about getting things nice, neat, and organized. It's a good fit for people that enjoy organizing.

title: productive, invigorating, frustrating hard working place to be
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You meet alot of team players and you have to meet a wide variety or people both customers and employees and you are never boardWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The time frame they think you should be able to get certain tasks completely.  They do not take into consideration that you are not only working on the task but waiting on customers in betweenWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Somedays are good and somedays are not as good but you need to start each day with a positive attitude and focus on the good thingsWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Go in  get your keys or equipment for the day focus on the department overall look  of your area and dress it up a little...meet with your department supervisor to get your duties for the day and go to work

title: Treating new employees with respect anld guidance to achieve the work hard for.greeting people with a smile.leaving an impact on the customer .
review: I enjoyed working as a cashier.appling myself to the job expected.professionately.and confiently.greeting people with a smile and kindness along with having patients.

title: Not worth dealing with the employees or upper management.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay was decent and the four day week. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of leadership from senior management. Associates act like children. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile from the associates if you make them follow the rules. Which most managers don’t. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Early mornings getting the staffing ready. Then dealing with all of the associates that leave through out the day. Usually working alone.

title: De vez encajando
review: Trabajo estresantes y hostil.no tengo  nada bueno qué decir  disponible qué las cosa aya mejorado en esté tiempo.pero cuándo yo trabaje para Walmart las cosas no fueron favorable

title: Not worth the pay.
review: Honestly. Don't work for a major corporation. They will not care about your needs and whether you can live off the pay. Just go to a local grocery store or other business.

title: High turnover rate
review: It's a revolving door. The people that were there when I started have dwindled to where it's only a few left in the department. They've changed management back there 3 times in less than 6 months. The rules change everyday and you'll be told one thing by someone and then be told something completely different by someone else.  Even if you put in your availability you'll have to constantly keep having them fix it over and over again cause they'll keep scheduling you shifts you can't work. Overall it's easy work once you learn the flow of everything, but management and customers make it stressful.

title: Bad place to work
review: Management is horrible. The pay is not good. It is dirty all the time and unorganized. They don’t work with you when you try to request time off. I would not recommend.

title: as a cashier it is fast paced
review: Walmart will hire anybody. Just look around, Hygiene isn't important to them! The cashiers they have now don't care if they help you or not, they don't even speak to you. Bathrooms are always filthy.

title: Terrible working environment
review: Terrible work culture. Not a very family friendly place to work.  The only time I would recommend working here if youre just out of high school and looking to make money for the summer

title: College Job
review: It was good job to earn money while going to college. If you work and aren't extremely lazy, you can get as many hours as you want and the flexibility can be better.

title: Laid Back
review: It gave me the opportunity to learn peoples needs through customer service, I learned quite a bit but it was too laid back, people wouldn't put in the work

title: Toxic management
review: If you have any kind of physical ailment beyond your control, don't even bother going to management to try and get a transfer worked out from one department to another. They will drag their feet until you either give up and stay where you are or until you flat out quit. They hear you talking but don't listen to what you're saying.

title: Fun well paying work
review: Management is amazing and the pay is great. Genuinely love my co workers and don't dread going to work every day. Good benefits as well. One of my favorite places I've worked

title: Pharmacy Employee
review: I used to love the work but it’s steered away from helping patients to meeting metrics. Required to do more with far less staff as the years progress. It’s very soulless now.

title: okay
review: Okay workplace, better than working fast food. As long as you look productive they don't care how fast you work so if you work fast you just get more work

title: Co-workers were great
review: The most I can say about this place was that the people I worked with were great, with exception of some. I wasn’t planning to stay at the company for too long so it was a good place to work briefly.

title: Poor place to work
review: Upper management does not care about there associate needs. Work and family balance does not exist. Company focuses on favoritism instead of skills, instead of working with you they belittle you

title: Not a hard job
review: Pay was decent. Managers was cool. You just have to make sure that you are being productive. You get to choose your own schedule. Overall not a bad job if you have good work ethics.

title: Challenging and very hard on your body if you're there for several years.
review: Very high turnover, pay starting at $17.50hr but loyal hardworking employees that have been there more than 15-20yrs are making maybe a dollar more an hour working the same dept doing the same job. Start of Covid they were making at least $4-5 more an hour than those who just started. Hard when 16yr olds can make about the same as a worn out hardworking loyal employee who has been there for many years 15-20+ in same dept. People who have been there over 15yrs should get at least $23hour while newbies get $17.50.

title: it is a job
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The company does not hire quality people, the pay for cashiers is not compatible with other stores, and they give blanket annual pay increases of 2.5% they do not give you a raise based off your personal performance.  CheapWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?none of it because I do not let them stress meWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not good at all they want some employees to do more than their job w/no compensation What is a typical day like for you at the company?for myself it is ok because I do only what I applied for and leave the rest to management

title: Ok
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great coworkers and nice environment to work inWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of hours what's the weatherWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly people and and good help

title: A great learning experience and opportunity to work well with my community.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The flexible schedule and ability to work as a team. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to keep up with demanding work instead of working at your own pace.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Enjoyable getting to see the various types of people and assisting the customers.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Up and down but always a nice steady pace.

title: Ok pay but team leads are terrible
review: The attendance policy is a joke. I was fired for being late constantly after multiple attempts to remedy the situation but team leads wouldn't even try to remedy it on their end. I was late for overnight because of childcare and they knew that. Still didn't care. The me@walmart app doesn't reflect the correct amount of protected PTO time needed to cover the time to prevent an occurrence and after multiple times informing management nothing was done about it. If team leads don't like you they will make it their mission to fire you, but others can no call no show and still have a job. You have team leads doing human resources job and arent educated to even do the job. No real management that knows how to operate on a fair professional level but instead operate based off emotions and if they like you on a personal level

title: Its even worse than its reputation
review: Cliques, bullying, favoritism, poor attendance policies, incompetent managers. Rules only apply to certain people. Benefits were ok. Would definitely not recommend.

title: Customer are great management staff ungrateful
review: Management terrible pay not good either treat employees like they are in a swept shop and the only thing good about Walmart are the customers and some of the team members

title: Decent
review: Working at Walmart wasn't  too bad, but depending on who you work with and who your managers are, then that could change your entire work experience.I kept to myself and had fairly good CO workers, but some of management was terrible. They would constantly demand that you stay and help with other departments while expecting you to finish your work load in your department.

title: Pretty easy job
review: A pretty easy job once you get the hang of it. After awhile it gets pretty boring and if you are stuck dispensing all day it can get pretty annoying.

title: Cool workplace
review: Okay place to work management is okay Would work again the customers come in and ruin your day with wild request and complaints so be ready for that

title: Fun workplace with poor management
review: Managers see their employees as replaceable and there are little to no incentives no matter how hard you work. Some managers are great while others treat you with no respect. HR is not honest about their policies and try to keep their employees from looking further into them. The employees will help you and are honest, but heavily lack professionalism. The best part about working here is the accessibility of moving up into management.

title: I would not advise anyone to work for Walmart. Employees are treated terribly.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There are no best parts when you are terminated for not passing a test after the computers have gone down but expected to pass without the same information as everyone else. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The lack of training and the lack of care from employees to customers. Terrible customer service What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible. The district manager was an idiot who did nothing. The environment was dirty and shelves not stockedWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Very confusing. No training and many expectations.

title: wonderful
review: great environment, benefits and people, the culture is positive and the opportunities to move up in the company are limitless. I enjoy working at walmart

title: The company lies about the AP-09 and all the videos you watch on the U-learn videos are not how they actually do things
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing because the management is not doing their job at Walmart south in Muncie and they do not treat the customers right What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The company doesn’t listen to the associates when they have a problem with management they say there is a open door policy but that is a lie the corporate office will not listen to anyone and I was Asset Protection and I had to quit because the managers would not listen when the other AP would over step her authority What is the work environment and culture like at the company?If you don’t fit into the right group then you will not lastWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Hectic and stressful because the management does not have your back if there is a issue

title: Productive workplace
review: Huge work load, not many opportunities for overtime. Dislike the point system especially when anything can happen that’s out of your control. Some of management is cool.

title: Depends on who you know, not What you know.
review: Your personal experience and work environment will depend on who you know and if the right people like you. A lot of favoritism and double standards within the workplace.

title: Busy work life, micromanaging managers and mediocre scheduling.
review: Plenty of customers who are varying ranges of pleasant to disgruntled. Bad managers micromanage you where finishing all the tasks is hard within the time frame allowed. Middle managers usually will not accommodate to your needs.

title: Ambiente sano
review: #NAME?

title: Amazing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It the best company to work for What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nothing I love it it's just a lot of standing but the job is good What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very busy but keep you doing something it's not boring and you get to meet a lot of people and that's a good thing it's all about love thy naber I love itWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Getting to know people and loving it making them love to shop their showing them love and welcome them with love

title: Fun
review: Good for the pay but I would work somewhere where a worker can get tips to maximize their earnings. But management was nice and it wasn’t too hard as work went

title: THE best place to work
review: I started with Walmart as a job. Assumed it would be a few years then move on. What I found was a career. There are literally hundreds of different jobs to always keep your mind going and the limit of your rise is up to you based on the effort and drive you put forward. The best thing about working for Walmart is the people. Walmart associates are some of the smartest, kindest, and hardest-working people you will ever know. You will make friends without even trying. If you are looking for a job that will take care of you financially and emotionally, Walmart is that place!

title: Not good
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The store manager is great. Always friendly and makes time for employees. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some of the managers blow you off and act rude towards you. They change your schedule and don't tell you or ask you in person. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment feels stressfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Working a dept by yourself for hours

title: Eh
review: Its an okay place to work at if your willing to deal with the exact same things everyday. Managers and supervisors are all different so your experience will vary.

title: Horrible Schedules
review: Don't work with your schedule and change it to their wants making hard to focus on school at the same time. Managers say they'll help change it and accommodate for school but don't.

title: It’s a good job if you are in a tight jam but try and seek better employment
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Have decent benefits, you get an employee discount of 10% on general merchandise What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They split your days off not two consecutive days off in a week, they force you to cut your hours on your lunch break, What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful most days especially holidays What is a typical day like for you at the company?Get to work usually a swing shift so you get there at the busiest time of day and try and hold the store together till closing

title: Bad managment
review: When you try to uphold policy you are always told to go against it. Cutting full time hours drastically. Managment is out of touch. Constant changes to Jon description.

title: Hard work but good pay
review: Walmart is a okay place to work but at the same time it’s really stressful every day. it’s something different and it’s always a new headache. It’s retail what do you expect.

title: Good Pay
review: Good Pay for no experience and easy fast hiring you. Management are friendly and approachable. Interview process was smooth and interview itself was sooo easy.

title: Enjoyed it
review: he work was hard and physical, but so rewarding and worth it. Management gave many opportunities for interns to get hands-on work with the safer/intern-permitted species and I learned so much about the standards of the industry in all aspects including care, conditioning, and speaking to the public. The next season I was offered another position, so they're certainly looking to help their staff grow and develop career-wise.

title: Depends on you
review: Seems like it comes down to who you know. It can be very political. Evidently if you do your job right, mind your business and not others, and show up and be a team player, in the long run its rewarding. Although it may not seem like it. Walmart is a revolving door. No matter how high an employee/ employer sits or how many corners they cut everything comes back around or to a balance.  Know what you want out of the job and take advantage of it benefits. Not even managers would let u know what those are.

title: Pay was ok
review: The work was always there. Hardly ever got breaks other than lunch. Management was always trying to hurry us a long because there was always more to do.

title: Not that great
review: Super boring job, super simple, but is brutally micromanaged by corporate managers that pop in from time to time. Local managers were fine, but corporate made it unbearable. Also lots of redundant and pointless training “modules” and they give you just enough hours to not pay full benefits.

title: People there are cool
review: Working at Walmart is a good starter job and i enjoyed it alot but the management there is kinda bad they dont care very much for there employees and tend to force you to stay longer shifts if needed

title: Productive and offers flexibility
review: It is up to you how far you go in the Company.  A good positive attitude and good attendance is rewarded.  If you don't take things personally and do your job consistently, you will succeed here.  Walmart gives you all the tools you need to do your job well.  Pay could be better for role.

title: Managers are inhuman
review: Managers claim to care about you but constantly go behind your back. You are given constant tasks which are impossible to complete due to part-time employee's hours being cut. Most days you are the only one scheduled by yourself for the entire week. I've been told by managers to bury dead cats in the parking lot, that I'm replaceable and not needed here, and I was told to have fewer sick grandparents to stop missing work and when I was told this my great grandma passed away the very next week. I've been driven into deep depression many times through management bullying and the work environment. The negative experiences keep me up at night.

title: Overseeing amazing associates
review: Walmart Dc is only designed for people whom don't mind a physical challenge during work and can withstand working on your feet for numerous amount of hours

title: Walmart doesn’t care about their employees
review: Walmart doesn’t care about their employees.  They cut peoples hours. They look down on their employees and treat them disrespectfully. There is no room for advancement. The emotional toll and damage is shocking. Your on a daily basis disrespected from your coworkers because everyone is so unhappy. Liters the worst work experience. The managers are cold, cruel, unnecessarily demeaning, and are always over worked. So when your overworked you tend to take it out on your other colleagues. Hardly any asked days off are approved. They can change your schedule whenever and however they seem fitting to accommodate themselves.

title: Overall it's worth it but wish they would give raises more often.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Overnight Stocker doesn't have to deal with the public. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Very fast paced with little pay.

title: Ridiculous expectations
review: Don’t get me wrong working at Walmart was not always terrible. As someone who suffers with a lot of medical issues, being sick is nothing new. Granted since I’ve been through this my whole life I work through rarely ever call out and always do my hardest and try my best when I’m working.  But for those few times I have to go to the doctor and call out I’m always met with rude comments implying that my medical condition isn’t real and they don’t want to see my doctors notes. They don’t care that I have the notes or anything.

title: Poor management
review: In Walmart the staff was rude and unprofessional when it came to their employees. Managers didn’t help. When it came to scheduling they added days without consulting you about it.

title: I enjoyed it. I would go back if they would allow it and if the business was still there
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The job was great. I enjoyed working with people I could associate with.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful part was struggling to keep the machines runningWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Where I was, work environment was joyful. We helped each other out when times got toughWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?I work days. I come in get the machines ready for scrubbing and buffing.

title: Horrible..run
review: Culture is just bad, they yell at you all the time..very unprofessional management and disrespectful to empolyees..there are ways to communicate and panicked yelling isn't one of them

title: Great place
review: Fun environment, steady and easy work, decent pay for what you're doing, excellent benefits, lots of room to grow, pto is awesome.. no complaints from me

title: productive,clean work enviroment
review: super clean work enbiroment absolutely love management. ive been apart of the company for four years now, cons: no respect for regular employees by specific managers

title: Don’t bother
review: Great if u want them to pay for ur college, do that- but management is toxic from home office thru store management/ they’re completely political and personal when it comes to advancement- they don’t do outside thinkers- u have to b a company drone- 0 out of 10stars, wouldnt work here again

title: Needs better management
review: Do you have a doctors note? Here it doesn’t matter. Here you’re lucky to get what you need from management. They don’t want you helping each other but they don’t respond when you need help either.

title: Fast paced and friendly
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting new people and learning new things. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not being able to meet all of the customers needs or wants.

title: Boring and Stressful
review: Pay was good for retail but the work was unbelievably boring and repetitive. Also very understaffed which made rush hours awful. Management wasn’t the greatest but at least they helped out. Overall wouldn’t recommend unless you’re a masochist.

title: Fun begginers job, better if you have good coworkers.
review: The team-lead vs regular associate pay gap isn't huge, they cut off our hours at 39 a week. I only liked it because my coworkers were fun and I had a chill team-lead. I only make $11 an hour, buts thats ok for a first job.

title: Fun place to work, great people
review: I really love the job that I do at Walmart. As an overnight stocker it takes a while to get use to the hours of course. Your basically just going in and stocking shelves. It's not a hard job but it is hard work. The hardest part is trying to get all of the truck worked in one night with so only a few workers most of the time. That's the only downfall about the job you're working nonstop from the moment you get there trying to get all of it worked and sometimes you just don't have enough people and hours to get it done.

title: just ehh
review: its ok not something id go back to. managers were never really on the same page with each other which caused problems for everybody. when you're wrong you're right

title: Great job with flexible schedule
review: An easygoing work environment with the occasional rush. Multiple opportunities for overtime and paid time off. Expect to help out in other departments or clean at times if your department slows down.

title: Great benefits
review: Pay is decent and I Loved the job . Physical work and you will stay busy but it makes your shift pass really fast . There are so many benefits , most start on day one . Aside from health benefits and discounts , they offer free Walmart +, gym memebership discounts , free college , vacation time . You will also have a set schedule which makes it easy to have a life outside of work

title: Not great
review: Not great, toxic worm environment. Would not recommend. Unorganized company. Schedule is draining, even for retail. Coworkers are not supportive. Company is not understanding.

title: its alright
review: the work is easy but can be stressful during holidays. of course. stay to yourself dont get involved in drama and stay on the managers good side. a lot of favoritism plays out here

title: Great!
review: The pay and hours were great. It's a cold place to live but great summers. 10/10 I would recommend this job and if I still lived in the area might still work there.

title: Fast paced but easy
review: Working here was a good time with a great leadership team in the department I worked in. The only cons are it's very easy to get behind on orders and the customers aren't always pleasant when you're walking around the store trying to shop. Overall was a very pleasant job though.

title: Nothing bad
review: The job is what you make it. If you aren’t ready to work long hours, stock shelves, and deal with hateful customers the jobs not for you. If you embrace the challenge though it’s not bad.

title: It is pretty simple, deal with bad customers
review: The job is so simple it takes only a few hours to pick up. Depending on what city you work in the customers can be rude. The bosses sometimes don't know what they're doing but that can be contributed to bad training.

title: They rather turn over lower entry associates jobs.
review: They rather turn over lower entry associates jobs, then actually being a team player. They only care about their bonuses. Management look after the higher up, never the little guy!
position: SCO, Cashier and Customer Service Desk

title: It has its moments
review: Some days it’s good other days it’s a headache. I used to be hourly supervisor visor but stepped down because I could never be backed by my salaried manager.

title: Long work and boring
review: you couldn't use any headphones so it got super boring during the shifts but on the hot days they supplied you with water which was nice and when it rained you got to work inside

title: Great Job, Hard Work.
review: Depending where you work throughout the building, the workload can be different. Some areas get VTO, some get MET. I worked in freezer. It was REALLY good money. $33 an hour, actually. But, the work isn't for the weak. You have to work hard and consistently move, or else you won't make your rate. Management is good. Coworkers are decent. Bonuses were amazing, especially during covid. I think its a good job, and if you're willing to put in some work, I'd go for it.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Walmart treats their employees like trash. I had 2 managers that I loved and they both moved on and after that it just went downhill. The pay sucks, the managers only care about themselves, work life balance is almost impossible. It's just a terrible company to work for.

title: fun
review: good mangers, good team building, good clean work space. they  want  to  train  everyone everywhere.  if you work hard you can move up in this company

title: It’s a job
review: Management has its favorites, pay is not that great for what you have to put up with, always being sent to other departments to do their work for them

title: Fun place to work
review: I overall really enjoyed working at Walmart. In my time their I worked three different departments. I worked self check out, customer host and overnight stocking. They are all very different but enjoyable.

title: Started out ok but after covid and wfh jobs we are short staffed.  When people realize how much they want you to do for so little money they leave
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The end of the work day and you are leavingWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers and unrealistic deadlinesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Extremely stressfull due to high turnover.  Mixed cultureWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Painful and full of stress.  Low pay and high demands.

title: Miserable
review: The work culture is horrible and the store manager at apple valley Minnesota, location doesn’t care about employees we are all just pieces in his game board

title: okay job to get you on your feet
review: pretty simple shifts where you can keep to yourself except when helping customers and help people find items. i like to zone or stock and it’s pretty laid back with fair pay at $14/h minimum

title: good
review: the days were short and worked most weekends. asked for time off and wasnt given the days off  i moved on to a differnt job after that. good managemen

title: Is a job
