review: It was fun, coworkers were great, would honestly come back. Rules seemed to change in the matter of seconds but it was manageable. Got to do just about everything in the store when asked and I loved that.

title: if you like being watched like a hawk and berated by managers, apply now
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Very flexible, great coworkers, great pay, always busyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The coaches(managers) were too strict and overused their power, and they weren't even my manager, otherwise it'd be the customersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?sometimes it would be on edge, otherwise it was niceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?avoiding managers, trying to work somewhere else in the store

title: Must be motivated and customer oriented
review: Customer service is a must or we don’t have jobs. Must get along with others and ignore rudeness from staff and associates. Just do your job and do it well.

title: Productive work environment due to workers
review: The Management is HORRIBLE they don’t communicate within each other regarding associates schedules and occurrences. I was falsely terminated due to attendance that a team lead was supposed to fix a month prior, that we talk about.

title: There is very little incentive to stay.
review: If you want a promotion, you need to be adequate. Any more than that, and you'll be stuck because they can't replace you. Any less, and you'll be stuck because they don't value you.Most of the leads and managers are good people, but the company needs to learn that an asset is more than merchandise. Every position is understaffed, and it's a combination of people calling out because they need a break from being overworked and underpaid, and the company firing people because they called out. As a whole, the company is completely ridiculous. However, the work itself is fine.Some things you'll hear from the leadership, and their translation: "I'll see what I can do." = [I don't know how to tell you it will never happen.]"I've got it covered!" = [I should've listened when you told me 3 months ago.]"It shouldn't take you more than 15 minutes..." = [I have absolutely no clue how long that task really takes.]"It took me one hour to finish what I tasked you with yesterday!" = [I literally threw 80% in the trash and intentionally misidentified the rest, but I still need someone to blame.]

title: Fun work place
review: Great management.great people. pay is also good. Customer can be rude have to have patience. Overall I love working for Walmart. You can get promoted very fast

title: The job sucks
review: Customers suck. management is even worse. Inconsistent schedule. Managers expect to much for little pay. Be ready to be treated like a total sub human.

title: Fun place to work.
review: There are times when things are tough,  but working with good people makes tough times fun.  The one downside is having to stand on hard floors all day.

title: Management is not good
review: Workers who complete work are punished by management by having to do other people’s jobs. Lazy people are rewarded. Would not recommend working at Walmart

title: Productive and fun place
review: Working for Walmart can be a challenging experience for some people, but for others, it can be a rewarding and fulfilling career. The company provides plenty of opportunities for growth and career advancement within the company. Walmart is known for providing competitive pay and benefits for its employees, including health insurance, 401k plans, and a variety of discounts. Many employees appreciate the flexible scheduling options that allow them to balance work and personal obligations.

title: I think the educational program could be a great benefit.
review: Unsatisfactory experience prefer not to comment but advise against being employed at this location .I felt inadequate even though was assigned 2,3,and 4 jobs a night. I worked 80 + hours never received proper pay.

title: great people to work with!
review: the highlight of Walmart is mostly the associates surrounding you. You will meet the nicest people you have ever met while working here. They also have flexible schedules.

title: Okay job for people that like being on their feet
review: The work is simple. Just scan items and check the customer out. Nothing too complicated. The hours were short at first, but they began to increase as I worked more days. My coworkers were chill and the higher ups were okay.

title: Straightforward
review: You come in, clock in, do your job and leave. Co-workers were cool but no real incentive to work hard som people would often slack off and make jobs harder for others. Management was always changing and never really helped when you brought up issues. Overall standard first job type of feel.

title: Fun and good pay
review: It was a great place to work and I loved all the managers. The pay was great and the hours were flexible. They are very lenient with time off as well

title: Productive workplace
review: One of the best warehouses I have had the pleasure of working in. The people are easy to work with. Manager operations run smoother than other places I have experienced. Although not perfect I enjoy working here very much.

title: work work work
review: lots to do everyday nonstop work apart from small break. labor intensive ofcoz especially during holiday seasons. not 24 hours anymore on store front so lot easier to get job done

title: Ok place to work
review: I would say all together it's not a bad place to work. The pay is pretty good. Staff is normally good. standing for long periods of time can be a pain

title: stressful
review: honestly don’t waste your time working here, there are some 40+yr olds who love to start unnecessary drama, and the HR really doesn’t care about your schedule.

title: It’s a start
review: Work at Walmart as a CEA, had to deal with rude customers for low pay and barley got any shifts. It’s is a good beginner job for high school students, but nothing more.  Lots of walking/cleaning.

title: Horrible
review: Horrible place the word do not care about employees were their time no matter how many years you put in the job we will never be happy because you have to be in a loophole in order to secede

title: A lot of work does not match the little pay
review: Upper management didn't communicate well with us regular managers and team leads. A huge disconnect. Poor work life balance. And time off requests were never approved.

title: Interesting workplace
review: When I first started, I loved the job! The management was amazing and I loved my team lead. The work was expected and I had no issue with it. Then management changed and it was awful. We were given too many tasks in too little time. Unrealistic expectations and management was not helpful.

title: Productive and fun workplace
review: They was fun and easy to get along. Job was decent and the coworker was your life line. Management could've been better and they hard to deal with when it a simple problem but other than that they was ok

title: Not for people with families
review: If you don't care about spending time with your family on holidays then this is the place for you. You work all holidays. You also never know when your days off are.

title: Very repetitive
review: Job is what you make of it honestly. Very repetitive so it can get boring fast. I would suggest branching out to different departments to keep things interesting

title: Not bad
review: I think it all depends on your location and management. Being a stocker you don’t have to interact with customers as much unless they come up to you and ask. Was hard to get my schedule changed

title: It was grind
review: Long hours and force to work holidays. No life outside of work. Pay was alright but many times management did not care too much about night shift. Night shift always had to pick up the slack from day shift

title: Don't work here unless it's your last resort.
review: No one that works here is appreciated. Management is clicky and always blaming the people that work the hardest for their own ego fueled failures. The start of each shift involves a meeting where they fake smile and act nice while telling everyone how worthless they are to the company. You will work yourself to the bone and have less and less energy each day you come in. Safety means nothing. Most equipment is old and worn out and doesn't even work half the time. Don't bother bringing questions or concerns to management. They never have answers and don't care if you drop dead on the job. I can't stress enough that unless you have no other options don't ever work here.

title: No job security
review: Start off saying the company doesn’t care about anyone but there self it’s all about perfect image and that’s it management is pretty good worked there for almost 5 years they screwed me over in the end I mean that hourly rate is good but it doesn’t matter cause the hours ain’t if you make 24$ an hour but only get 20-24 hours a week that’s only about 500 a week and that’s not even including taxes and other deductions they raise production way up every year then punish you for not being able to make it I recommend staying away

title: Poor management
review: The “Team Leads” were very rude. They didn’t really work with me well being in school. I had dr appointments and requested the day off and they tried to fire me for not coming in. It was an okay place to work at. They need to look at management better!

title: Not worth it
review: Even if you make the most apprehensions, you still get treated like you don’t matter. This particular location was high risk low reward and I wouldn’t recommend working there.

title: no thank you
review: management is terrible, no communication unless its negative. staffing is always bad, you're usually expected to do the work of fifteen with five. store manager changes every five minutes

title: It’s work
review: Not much to say about the place. It’s work, but it really feels like they just get you in to get you out. The team members and leaders are great people, but it does not change how Walmart works as a cooperation. There is no compassion for you as a person and you will be worked to the bone.

title: Great place to work if you’re lucky enough to get good management
review: They are not a bad company to work for provided you get lucky enough to have good management. in many instances they would rather hire someone out of store or out of department with no previous experience of the role than promoting people who have been working towards the promotion and know the position inside and out.

title: We Are Struggling
review: My experience was full of both good and bad times. I really enjoyed my coworkers as well as getting to know my customers, and the work is a good workout! Yet the majority was very unpleasant, which was mostly due to high work loads with low pay (and this company is the highest paying in my area)! Managers and higher ups did not help my experience besides a very slight few. They are actually the reason I'm ultimately leaving the company, and had to leave two years ago when I previously worked here! There were part time workers receiving full time hours without getting benefits or classified as a full time worker, meanwhile full time workers were getting hours cut and told it would continue into summertime! Nightshifts pay is $15.50 with no bonuses, so until the additional $2 beach store raise hits, many employees are living paycheck to paycheck and are lucky to be able to pay their rent, and these are full time employees!! There are workers who have been there for decades and making less than workers just coming in. The pay is unfair, the work conditions are unfair and management receives any and all praise their associates work hard for! My store is 574, and I truly hope things change so Walmart can continue to have workers.

title: Ambiente de trabajo con favoritismo y acoso laboral.
review: Un día típico en el trabajo es hacer cualquier otra cosa que no sea el puesto de trabajo para el que firmaste en el contrario.

title: It was ok
review: Pay was good, but management wasn’t very nice. Your work was never enough for them and some were on a power trip after getting promoted. Would have been better if the life and work balance was better.

title: overworked and underpaid
review: Walmart treats some employees as their golden children. management blames the employees for things that they caused, belittlement, not enough pay to make the environment worth working in.

title: If you liked high school, you'll LOVE being a Walmart employee
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers, contrary to popular belief. I've never had any issue with customers, even when they're already disgruntled. They're just regular people who want to be treated respectfully and as long as you're doing that, everything's fine. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Demands from certain coworkers that aren't even management who feel like they get to dictate what you do and how you do it simply because they have "more time on the job"What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Clique-y. If you're cool with the right people, you can get away with almost anything. If not, tread lightly. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Overall, the customers made it a better experience than it would've normally been

title: Productive workplace
review: Productive workplace and wonderful place to work for. Great help and staff. Always a pleasure to help customers and patients get what medications they need.

title: Walmart life
review: Walmart will pay you well but it comes at the risk of being away from your family all the time. It’s ran off politics…who you know not what you know. It’s crooked, don’t invest your life there.

title: Great place to work where you are treated as family
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Flexible schedule for you and your family What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When short staffed and you have to wait longer for breaks or lunches.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great everyone gets along with each other What is a typical day like for you at the company?Crazy at times, but love to do multiple things for my manager

title: Highly productive environment but not a friendly place at all.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Employee discounts. Uniforms provided.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Processes are constantly flip flopping back and forth. Too many managers per employee base. As many as six managers per 15 employees.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not good at all, highly toxic and stressfull. Even the simplest of task become excessively over processed.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stock until you are completely exhausted, miss most of your breaks and have your equipment constantly loose sync and reset.

title: No flexibility and very strict management.
review: They follow a very "micro-management" style, and often set you up for failure. They expect above and beyond performance for average, barely acceptable pay. The co workers are cool if you watch what you say as a lot of them will just report what you say to management to make themselves look good. However, if you just show up on time, find a good pace, and stay quiet, your job is basically secure.

title: Overall not that bad, decent pay
review: Good place to work, slow hours Jan-Mar overall management is easy to get along with and the benefits are pretty good.

title: Productive and Fun Place
review: Productive and fun place to work. In this place to work there is alot of fun stuff. While working it is a very productive place with other workers making it a fun place to work.

title: Their point system is farse also true emergencies or incline t driving you were still given points
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Different types of people's and backgrounds What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I works in opd total personal shopper but was in back as prep staging and dispenser and there is never enough dispensers orb Preppers so your constantly running in circles What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Culture great environment somewhat ok calm for most part but alot of lazy people who don't take pride in their work and or just lazy What is a typical day like for you at the company?I did 10 miles a day SR64 Walmart but constant go go go doesn't slow down til close to 8pm

title: work
review: working de la primera mitad del torneo apertura de fútbol a la boca del fútbol argentino en la frente y a los dos jugadores de la boca y a los dos partidos

title: Great way to build character
review: Working at Walmart is a wonderful way to make a difference in the community. The best feeling is being able to help someone make their life more convenient.

title: Crazy Busy!!
review: Not enough supply (technicians) to meet the demand (customers, phones, prescriptions to fill, etc.) Other than that, it's a very good system to work with.

title: I work with great people
review: Pro: Overall a good place to work.  The diversity is a great balance. Con: The workload is overwhelming at times. Hours are different but it is Retail.

title: Not a bad place to work
review: 4 10 hour days, easy work. Only negative some managers are clueless.  Would recommend working there.

title: ehh.
review: working here was fine. it’s hard to get hours because they’ll take you off of the schedule for days at a time with no explanation. they’ll also tell you that you can come in to get more hours, but then them point you. management treats you like you have to live and breathe the company , because they don’t care if you have a family emergency or personal emergency.

title: Too much stress for too little pay.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There was no best part working at Walmart it was an awful place to work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customer complaints all the time.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment was miserable coworkers who called out all the time.What is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day was stocking freight for 10 hours a day, getting interrupted on my meal periods and chasing people down.

title: I liked working at Walmart.Made alot of good friends and overall had fun.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?If you are eager to learn and a hard worker then you have a good chance to advance in the company.Most jobs are fast paced so you keep busy and time goes by fast.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management pushes you to the limit.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great if you like working with the public and other associates. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Fast paced.Alot of interaction with people.

title: Great environment to expand your customer service experience.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The ability to work different departments and the ability to transfer to other stores if you need to relocate. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working with the community you live in, people are unpredictable so you learn to hone your skills in customer service.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Diverse and unique, no discrimination or religion preferences, no tolerance of retaliation. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Work with customers, process insurance billings, answer phone calls, process orders, clean and do light housekeeping.

title: Bad
review: Walmart is the worst job around. The management is complete garbage . They treat employees badly and they will cut your hours soo bad then shortly . They will blame you for things that you didn’t even do.

title: Not Good but Not bad
review: The job is fairly straight forward. This store has pretty good management which helped a lot. It really all depends on the type of management you have. I know of several other stores where they have bad managers and it makes the job a lot worse. Would recommend if you want an easy job that pays the bills

title: Very strong happy and loving what I do to where my ethics come from I'm a strong person
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Just helping people and meeting people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The customers because at the end of day they don't understand that you're there for them and they fight against youWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's a strong company and it could benefit you as long as you can truly do your job

title: Find another job because walmart is terrible.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Theirs is really nothing good. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being constantly understaffed.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Absolutely terrible. Every worker does bare minimum. Bonuses are a joke-literally a great value stale biscuit.What is a typical day like for you at the company?On feet all day. Working through lunch to catch up on other peoples work because understaffing. Barely have any time to drink water or go to bathroom. Health decreased dramatically.

title: Easy to move up
review: Great opportunity, good benefits, they pay for you to get a select degree from select schools in business, healthcare, technology etc. also for people who don’t have ged’s or high school diplomas!

title: Unreasonable expectations
review: Expectations in regards to pace of work is unreasonable. You could be stocking large items like cases of water and soda hour after hour and your stille xpected to move at lighting speed.

title: Good checks to pay the bills really not that hard of a job
review: Good checks can be possible to move up in the company pretty easy once you hit the 6 month mark  also you could transfer to another store as well in the 6 month mark. Just keep away from the drama and your be good at Walmart

title: fun environment
review: good pay, good coworkers, fun environment, managers ehh depends who it is but overall love it here. been here 3 years and looking elsewhere for personal reasons but wish i wasnt

title: Only work here if you don't want a life and like being put down and ridiculed.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay is good, that's all that's good.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Every single thing. Management is horrible and you're treated like garbage. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?High-school. The store is broke down to clicks and if you don't fit in they make your life miserable. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Expected to do more work then your time allows and leave feeling rundown and worthless.

title: Helped me come out of my shell
review: I was at walmart for four years. And I have to say, I came out of my shell completely while working there. Unfortunately though, favoritism is a thing there. For all the responsibilities I had, I never had pay that mirrored the work they had me doing.

title: I wouldn't recommend this place even to my worst Enemy
review: Been here for 10+ years and have seen many changes... not in a good way. The workers are lazy and don't want to help and Rude as heck. Management is just as bad.

title: Nice co-workers, not enough training
review: I worked with really nice people, but never felt like I received enough training when it came to issues with insurance companies. I eventually left the position because I felt it was too much stress for relatively low pay.

title: Good first time job
review: It’s really simple. It’s basically shopping for groceries but for other people. The job does get lonely if you always have to pick. You don’t really interact with coworkers, mostly customers. Management always changed. Even in the short amount of time I worked there which was like less than a year.

title: the availability to work in other departments, and hours flexibility.
review: A typical day at work would usually start out great, everyone was doing their responsibilities and I knew what was expected of me walking into my job.What I've learned is, in my field of work, in the Deli, there are days that are easier than others, but most of my Co-Workers were very helpful when we all worked as a team. But it was not always like that. There was always one that made our work more difficult.Management started out very supportive, they even made accommodations behind my back to make my job easier. But then, they were frustrated with me because I'm not a robot and the responsibilities were stressing me out because I was told to take care of my jobs, the other Co-Workers jobs that were left for me to do after they went home and left for me to do, and that it was my responsibility if the Deli was closed down because I needed help, with more responsibilities and not enough time to accomplish everything, and it got to a point where I wasn't able to physically close at 100%. Even though I spoke openly of the situations, nothing changed and I was on over-load.Workplace culture was unstable.The hardest part of the job was getting the help where we all were working as a team, as a whole, to make the Deli 100% on a daily basis.The most enjoyable part of the job was seeing the Customers leave happy and when the job was done at 100%.

title: Not enough people
review: Was technically a cashier but they tried to get me to work customer service without the pay because none of the CSR’s came to work or knew what they were doing

title: The worst job to date that I have ever had.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Maybe the 10% discount, until you find out it does NOT work on food.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management is a complete joke. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, unorganized and lacking respectWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Long, rarely get a break and go home crying because you have been yelled several times and management will NOT step in and help you.

title: Productive and fun
review: Great company. Great benefits. It’s a good job while I go to school. They are super flexible and understanding of any emergencies. They work great with schedules

title: Fun workplace
review: Great company lack of management easy work but not a lot of overtime good job if you have a family management could be better other than that great company

title: Turbulent workplace, very depressing. Cried many tears.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It was terrible. 10 years of pure stress. Different job titles including department manager. Very ghetto, do not recommend.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers are very unprofessional and WILL create a toxic work environment for everybody.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Turbulent and a toxic work environment because of the company management. I’ve worked at four different stores. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Upper management will throw you under the bus in a heartbeat. Even if they tell you to do a task, then act like they told you to do something else and you wasted time.

title: Good job
review: Good job to get your employment started. Most managers and supervisors are supportive. Decent benefits. Pay could be better. Easy to be promoted if you do your job well

title: Definitely a experience
review: The best part of my experience there is the coworkers in the garage they make the job less painful. But with that being the best thing its also the only good part the verbal harassment from customers is only comparable to the complete lack of support from management in situations.

title: Terrible
review: Not good for long term work, but as a minor or some one who needs some what of a flexible schedule it will do. Would not recommend trying to move up in the company. Truly not worth the time and money.

title: Paid the bills but annoying if you are competent skilled or educated. Good if you like being a mindless drone for an America hating company.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing. Don't work for these woke neo communists.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?All of it. Forced masking if there happens to be a china flu, working for idiots.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Like a cult. Corporate micromanagement. managed by incompetents. What is a typical day like for you at the company?A long drawn out nightmare. 9 years I'll never get back.
position: Garden Center associate Marble Falls TX

title: Great employees
review: Great place to meet people and everyone is amazing however, the environment itself was not the best. More employees are needed and self-checkout machines could work better.

title: Flexible Schedule
review: Neighborhood Markets are a calmer and slower version of the super centers. Great place for part time workers and those who need flexible schedules. Room to promote.

title: Learned my lesson to never go back ever !!!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing never ever work for this company the turn over rate is the highest in the entire country What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything is 100% miserable all the time never get holidays off your always burnt out your treated like cattle one of the worse jobs I've ever had What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is one of the worst culture there is none they say there is but there isn't pure misery What is a typical day like for you at the company?Like working in a mine you get a fan and a light bulb. miserable wanted to quit your treated like cattle

title: Decent
review: It's a decent Walmart and upper management is nice but you have all of the same problems as working with a Walmart associate. The pay is not good and you are on your feet all day and it can be frustrating to work with the customer.

title: Fun and Productive
review: Fast paced, organized, and productive. They offer many break times and most managers are flexible with schedules. Only downside to it is managing time.

title: Love the people
review: fun place and great team mates. Job is easy to do. Some times short staff. Will work on your feet all shift. Manager is great to work with. You get some benefits.

title: I would never work for them again. I’ll rather eat nails and rats to get by before going back to work for them
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Management is the worst and the company doesn’t value their employees it’s all about the customer. They can lie , cheat and steal and when you do your job Walmart will fire you or if management has a personal problem with you or your friends that you have made while working at Walmart they will fire . Over all it’s a good place to start getting your own money but it’s just a stepping stone don’t make it permanent they don’t care about you What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The customers and managers . The Customers and location and management. No matter how long u have worked for the company they don’t care.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast and Annoying and overwhelming. It’s a horrible feeling to come to work stressed and Walmart will have you stressed.What is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day at Walmart is stress and Angry Customers and mean managers. It’s a day of chaos and frustration that really isn’t needed but that’s Walmart

title: Not great
review: No help, no overtime, barely any time to take off because you gotta be able to work somebody's call off if you get called in. Only 2-3 people a day and they don't even help they just sit in the back and talk

title: Terrible Managment and Communication
review: Worked here for two months. Had absolutely no training and none of the Management team was willing to talk to me. Had to learn from other associates as to how to do things, by looking over their shoulders.  Was constantly ignored and dismissed before I could ask any of the managers questions when I needed help with my job. I was left alone for hours without keys or tools to do my job, then scolded for not doing my job.  To top things off, all of the backroom products were coated in mold and rot. The walls were unsealed and they made no efforts to rid the health risk.

title: Overworked
review: Amazing company. Management needs some work. I feel as though if you want to advance there is potential. You get to meet lots of people. If you follow the leader and have no opinion that is the place for you.

title: It’s a paycheck.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Having a set schedule and getting a 79hr paycheck every 2 weeks.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lazy coworkers and rude customers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Go to work, complete your shift and go home.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Normal work day as long as you don’t get involved in drama.

title: good
review: The job is pretty straight forward you can meet some great people and crate great bonds. the training is self explanatory. and the job its self pays the bills.

title: great workplace
review: the best place to work awesome enjoyed it very grateful love it love the work love the job love people great the best awesome highly recommend definitely

title: It’s an excellent place to work if you have great leadership
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part are the different cultures. And the promotion. If you’re at a really good store the teaching and training.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management!  The expectation with different task.  without all the tools and resources to get the tasked completed. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?We’re like one big happy family.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Teaching and training working side by side with my associates.

title: Fun
review: Fun place to start off but it's not that organized . Meet great people pay needs to increase and get better management other then that it's a job ....

title: Easy Work
review: Real easy work. Just hard getting up at 4am everyday. It really gets tiring after a couple months because some manager don’t understand that you’re human.

title: Nightmare
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Coworkers good work ethics That's it What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Store manager running the store as if he was a sergeant in the militaryWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment was horribleThat's it all I have to sayWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy with the manager coming by every 10-15 minutes yelling at us and customers that were so rude and we didn't have any manager that would come and back us up!

title: Worst experience I’ve ever had
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Consistent pay and a regular schedule What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The amount of work they give to you in an inadequate amount of time. Very unreasonable expectations. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Always stressed. Shifts are tense co workers are always miserable because they are mistreated What is a typical day like for you at the company?Overwhelming and stressful. Racing around to try to complete work assignments, sometimes not even taking allotted breaks

title: Poor management loose good employees
review: What is the best part of working at the company?In the beginning it was excellent team work What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Exchanging Team leader then management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Culture ok work environment terrible so I quitWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?I don't work there anymore I was working in Olympia fields

title: Fun
review: It was okay , the staff are nice but sometimes it can be ruff . I wish we got more hours and better training . I was a cashier and stocker and floated a lot

title: fun
review: The best thing so far is time flexibility with work but it is ok gradually and the income is great down and the expenses are less. overall is great place to work.

title: Ok stable
review: Ok place stable And secure.  Pay could be better but it’s a decent, no training necessary. Good for those not needing a full time position or someone in svhoool. There are some benefits.       It’s something to do       .

title: retail establishment
review: what you would expect from a retail store in a relatively small town in the midwest region of the united states as compared to other retail establishments

title: not bad
review: cant ask for much you know. they pay you and you work, thats about all. sometimes they get angry and you have to stay longer, but its not too hard overall.

title: Disrespectful but Safe
review: Management ignored multiple requests for my hours to be reduced. In my interview I agreed with my hiring manager that i would work 20-28 hours a week, but was consistently scheduled for 35-40 hours.

title: Horrible management toxic environment
review: The job isn't horrible if you don't mind being yelled at your entire shift by managers with a superiority complex that do nothing but sit in the office and play on their phones. There is drama around every corner and if you tell on person anything it's around the entire store of 300ish people in a day. Overall it's a toxic work environment and I'm glad I'm leaving.

title: Ok to work for
review: Decent pay, decent hours, decent benefits…not much room for advancement for a hourly worker without knowing certain people in higher positions, just a ok job

title: Productive and fun workplace
review: Overall great time i spent here at walmart, management was very nice and easy to work with, and the crew was great. Couldn't have asked for a better time.

title: Good benefits
review: I was constantly told I wasn't doing a good enough job when I was doing all my work and the managers work too. When I confronted management about this they then turned it around and made me feel guilty for even suggesting I was over worked. I was severely depressed the last 2 months I worked there. No one showed any concern in management.

title: Favoritism and clicks
review: There was a lot of favoritism going on and the manager was hella lazy. Manager would lie on you if you wasn’t a favorite. They will talk to you any type of way and no consequences is done.

title: productive and fun workplace
review: Diversity and Inclusion: Walmart prides itself on being an inclusive workplace that values diversity. Working with colleagues from diverse backgrounds can make work more interesting and enjoyable.Opportunities for Growth: Walmart is a large company with many different departments and career paths. Employees have opportunities to move up the ladder and take on new challenges.Team Environment: Walmart values teamwork and collaboration. Working with supportive colleagues can make work more enjoyable.Employee Benefits: Walmart offers a range of employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans, and discounts on purchases. These benefits can make work more enjoyable and help employees feel valued.Fast-Paced Environment: Walmart is known for its fast-paced work environment. For some people, this can be exciting and fun, as it keeps them engaged and challenged.

title: Eh.
review: Working here was pretty mid, I would say. There is really nothing extraordinary about that place. It is not worth working at, though. I would not suggest it to Mt friends or family.

title: Highly productive, and exciting place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Flexible hours. PTO, PPTO, 401k, Benefits, Culture.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Keeping up with freight flow and following ever changing processesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and accepting. Walmart is a very diverse and inclusive workplace.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Working freight, and customer service

title: Run away as fast as you can lol
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Lunch, breaks, coworkers, working outsideWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Incompetent upper management, double standard, working holidays especially on ThanksgivingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, no minority managersWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?No such thing, chaos everyday, cleaning up behind folks

title: I wasted 10 years for nothing.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?That I worked and made money, yearly pay raises.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?No guarantee of working 40 hours a week, barely even gave the minimum to maintain workers at full time status. Was always understaffed.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was very toxic, little chance of a meaningful promotion and overloaded you with work of you did. No accountability

title: Nice coworkers, short staffed constantly
review: Breaks get pushed off or half forgotten a lot because we’re almost constantly short staffed towards the end at least and it can get annoying but the team leads do genuinely try their best to get everyone on break and help out, lovely people to be around

title: Dread going to work
review: Always understaffed. Customer service lacking. Indecisiveness from management. I would go in and plan my night just to be given a list of things that were not accomplished during the previous shift. There was not enough associates to get all of the work completed.

title: Ok place
review: Okay place to work management and customers are terrible. Overworked and management would get mad when asked about breaks meanwhile they’re not doing anything

title: Stressful, Toxic, and never again.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There really isn’t any honestly, when I worked there my higher ups were very rude to not only me but my other coworkers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Sometimes they would make you stay over time and then the next time you worked you had to take a extra lunch so they would t have to pay you for the over time What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic, don’t get me wrong there were some good ones but mostly they were all bad What is a typical day like for you at the company?Extremely stressful I was doing the job of not only me but the 5 other cashiers that were there

title: I liked working for walmart  great managers and co-workers .
review: What is the best part of working at the company?CO WORKER  AND THE MANAGER  NAMED IZZY What is the most stressful part about working at the company?NONE , TO MANY PALETS FOR ONE PERSON TO DEW What is the work environment and culture like at the company?FOR ME WALMART WAS A GREAT PLACE TO WORK .  THE ONE IN MT LAURAL NJWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?WELL I WORKED OVERNIGHT IT WAS GREAT TO WORK THERE

title: Hard labor physically
review: Standing for long hours on end lifting pulling pushing over worked underpaid and management uses unfair favoritism amongst other management for deciding weather you'll be fired or not.

title: Terrible management
review: First all, I loved my job and was great at it. Though the store management at my store is terrible. All the management isn't on the same page, your direct Coach/team lead will tell you one thing and the store manager will say another. Walmart is all about metrics or numbers, they really don't care about their actual workers.

title: time consuming unproductive environment.
review: this was my first job ever and at first, it was worth it, a high school student working during the summer is perfect right? however, they do not care about your outside, for example, a family death, unexpected car troubles, or being in school. once school rolled around I made it very clear I would no longer be able to work before 3-3:30 pm. They made no change to my schedule and counted every day as a point against me. I was eventually let go, and when asked what could have been done for the job to work out I was agitated because I already told management the situation and was told changes were going to be made to work with my schedule.

title: Buena atención al cliente y amable
review: Muy completo en todas las secciones buenos precios para el cliente buen salario, prestan atención al cliente ayuda rápida en Información completa amarillo para las personas que solicitan empleo y ubicación muy buena para mí para solicitar trabajo

title: Overwhelming, Fun, Good First Job
review: Great place to work for your first job. Some of the managers don't do anything if you have complaints & if you're a cashier, be prepared to hear complaints from your bosses back to back.

title: They don't care
review: For the most part, the vast majority of the ones in charge just don't care.  They work you like crazy and treat you pretty badly. There were some decent team leads, but my coach was horrible.

title: Learned a lot and met some good people
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They almost always give overtime and pay is decentWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management is bad and customers are tooWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?They demand too much from you and almost never reward you for it

title: I would enjoyed this position a lot more if I'd been trained more.. I trained myself.
review: Team leads and management were not good at communicating.. for example I was not mace aware of, nor did any lead come talk to me about my attendance.. the complete lack of care for associates and taking advantage of associates was very disheartening. I was told to reapply 30 days after termination.

title: Receiving trucks with pallets, break down pallets and then stocking the products around the store
review: It is a good place to start if you dont have experience, but they cut your hours sometimes, they are disorganized and when i quit to apply for another possition the company never considered to hire me again

title: Great
review: I've worked for the company for 8 years and I've always enjoyed it. There have been times when management wasn't the best, but so far it's all worked out.

title: Decent
review: I would recommend this job as a part time or side gig. You’ll get a decent amount of hours and be able to go to college or have another job. Management is a little lackluster though

title: Drama
review: Decent money for the hours worked. Old timers get pretty set schedules. Newer people get sporadic schedules. Part time can still be up to 38 or more hours a week without the benefits. Some weeks they'll schedule you for 4 hours others they'll schedule you for 38 and they often change it last minute and only have to notify you 24 hours in advance. No one in management communicates and its a constant battle to get any questions answered or any issues fixed. Everyone talks about everyone and nobody actually cares about their jobs. It's okay money, but a drama filled and stressful shift everytime.

title: Run!!! Team leads are a joke and lazy!!!! Where the is the manager, anyways?????
review: I  tolerated this "toxic work environment ONLY BECAUSE I needed the money at Christmas time!! TEAM LEADS ARE THE BIGGEST JOKE EVER!! It is a contest among them where MANY DID ABSOLUTELY NOTHING "ALL DAY LONG"! Many of them were gone from the sales floor for hours (It sure showed as the place was a mess)!Unbelievable!! They sure collect a paycheck though~!!

title: Ok. For new starters or student, will get good experience
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Assist to the customer with their complaint or working with few team lead and associates What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Needs lot of improvement inside the store and team lead. Rather than doing favors

title: For a teenager, it was heaven
review: I initially started when I was 16 as a cashier. I learned the environment pretty quickly and had a good amount of friends near my age range. The management was 3/10, due to the lack of communication and even disrespect.

title: Better for retail
review: It’s retail so pay is good expectations can be unrealistic…better than CVS or Walgreens but quickly changing to another mini version of their competitors

title: Great place to work!
review: Loved working here! Everyone is so friendly and the pay is great for the job! such a wonderful learning opportunity and a great way to get your foot in the door! Great place for a first job as well!

title: Good pay, bad management practices
review: They pay well if you're in the right department. However, managers never had time for their departments. My manager in particular was over several departments. Whenever we needed help in our department, he couldn't seem bothered to fix it because he was too busy in his other departments.

title: Nothing is ever done correctly
review: Every shift has an issue with each other and it’s always a blame game. It’s Walmart and it’s retail so it’s kind of what is to be expected at this kind of job.

title: It’s a job
review: The best part about working at Walmart was the people. Other than that, you are a stocker most of your shift. The way the management teams talks to their employees is absolutely disgusting.

title: Okay but not very good
review: This company is trying to run on bare minimum employees on top of dealing with a large number of unreliable people in critical roles throughout the store. Never enough getting accomplished, but there’s always something to keep busy with.

title: Bad working environment
review: We don’t get paid well enough even though Walmart itself is a company that makes a lot of money. They don’t care enough about its employees at all. They are cutting back on the hrs we work meaning no paid overtime.

title: you could find something better...
review: My experience at this Walmart was by far the worst job experience I've had. I wasn't even properly in the system or trained for weeks after my first day. The management is cliquey and treats their employees poorly. I was essentially harassed and threatened my job for their own failure of communicating with their employees. Overall, my experience was very unfair, and I don't recommend this location.

title: Poor
review: Poor leadership qualities lazy management understaffed expectation way too high for pay promotion is not based on what you know it's based on who you know

title: Run
review: Well where should I begin.....If you are part time don't plan vacations they get denied most of the time. You HAVE to use 8hrs to have the day off, part timers good luck getting that. Have an issue with a coworker nothing will happen, management don't care. You can get pulled to other areas that pay more, expect you to do the same for less pay. They got rid of quarterly bonuses, now it's only for leads and salaried...The same leads that will tell you he or she can't stand you at times. Same lead who will tell another associate who wants to keep there pay if they transfer they will see what they can do. After you mention that you never got to, same lead says well that's because no body likes you. You can report it but Walmart don't care about you. To walmart you are just a number.

title: Easy enough
review: Super easy work, pushed reshops, zoned apparel departments, answered calls/ fitting rooms. Overall, repetitive work. Lots of walking, bending and lifting.

title: Trabaje de noche y es algo exigente
review: En la tienda en la que estaba había menos personal del que se necesita para realizar el trabajo de manera eficiente, por lo que los empleados teníamos que trabajar el doble incluso el triple para que la mercancía saliera a piso lo que causaba que nos casaron aun más.

title: fun
review: Working at Walmart can be a mixed bag, depending on your personal preferences and experiences. On the positive side, the company offers competitive wages and benefits, including health insurance and a 401(k) plan, even for entry-level positions. Walmart also provides opportunities for career advancement, with many employees starting in hourly roles and moving up to management positions.However, the work environment at Walmart can be fast-paced and demanding, with long shifts and a high volume of customers to serve. Additionally, some employees have reported feeling overworked and underappreciated, with a lack of support from management. The company has also faced criticism for its labor practices, including allegations of wage theft and discrimination.Ultimately, whether working at Walmart is a positive or negative experience will depend on your individual circumstances and priorities. If you value stability, competitive pay, and opportunities for advancement, Walmart may be a good fit for you. However, if you are looking for a more relaxed or supportive work environment, you may want to consider other options.

title: Laid back
review: Walmart is only good for the short term, I need a job now type situation. Don't be a Walmart lifer. Managers don't seem to know who is working or even starting new. Training you receive is laughable, you watch a bunch of videos that don't prepare you at all for your job. Then you're put out on the floor and expected to know how to do everything.

title: Managment
review: Terrible management. They are lazy and dont wanna do their jobs. and the work we do isnt at all worth how much we are paid. Never accept time off even when its been there

title: Awesome place to work!
review: Pays well, plenty of pto, good management. Ability to move up is insane if you are willing to work. Pay at 14 an hour team leads start at 18.00 to 22 an hour.

title: They are not the happy family company portrayed in their commericals.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing, you are treated as a number  and worked beyond what a human body can take . With production requirements are unrealistic. Expected to work with no heat or air conditioning and expected to produce 98% every day 14 hour day or you fail for your day . What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Expectations , exhausting, and physical toll on your body What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Your are just a number in the eyes of Walmart What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress , sweat, pain ,frustration sweat  no mercy and they are always looking to write you up for anything

title: Ok place
review: Its alright can be better team leads tend to pick on the ones who do there job over the ones who don't can be a lot better they can choose there favorite

title: Great job supported my family for years.
review: Great pay and job supported my little family for years. They have management that cares and listens to concerns always felt like I had a great team of workers that became long lasting friends.

title: Alright
review: Good place for a start, love and hate some management. Some are power hungry while others are like family. The job is a little boring, and you definitely meet some unique people…

title: Walmart
review: Management is bad and their is lots of lazy people , overnight complains too much and truck unlockeders get miss treated alot,cap 2 department needs to be treated better

title: BEST Trucking Job By Far!
review: Great Work. Office and Management 5 stars really care for drivers and treat us as family! No wait time. You are the captain of your ship. Dispatch and other drivers work as a team! Love my Walmart fleet!

title: Consistent stressful physical demanding too much responsibility for a little paycheck
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They don't care about your health when your a cart pusher.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The whole parking lot is YOUR responsibility that's stressingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Rude people bad wether and ridiculous for calling offWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It was stressing and my life was at risk while working there.

title: management
review: the  management team is the reason most people lose there desire to work most time cause they act a way with some people differently with others which only will create division

title: It was okay
review: Managers aren't the greatest, but it was a decent job. Hours weren't very flexible and policies made no sense at times, but it was an okay job for what I needed.

title: Keeps You Busy...
review: Great place to work, especially if you have any kind of disability.  You can work and learn at your own pace.  If the position isn't right for you, they'll find you another one in another department.

title: Distant pay
review: Good job for people who hate to work. If you are a worker tho. They will work you to death and if you're a lazy person you get promoted. Again great job for anyone who hates work and loves brown nosing

title: Fun place to work
review: The work was easy and constant with no down time.  Co workers were great.  Pay wasn’t great but it was enough to get by if you had few bills.  The benefits were horrible.

title: Meh
review: It could be boring. Time could also fly by. Most customers were friendly. Some were rude. It became annoying really quickly. It was redundant and repetitive.

title: Ok
review: It's pretty solid job, many people to help you out. Relatively quick onboarding time starting right away on register. Overall solid job with efficiency.

title: Fun workplace, great management.
review: I’ve worked at this location for about two months now and the best thing about the workplace is the friendliness of your fellow co-workers and the management. The ability to talk to management about an issue is also very easy to do. Hardest part of the job I would say is to be able to know how to multiple areas, but given enough training and practice, that won’t be an issue for very long. Typical day at work would be you doing upkeep of your department while also assisting customer when need be, and maybe the occasional stocking of shelves

title: Interesting and repititive workplace
review: A very high theft location. Coworkers and management is nice, but not so much the customers. However a lot of the regulars are pretty nice. We try our best with the customer services despite the circumstances given. Also having problems with the lock ups and a lot of homeless frequenting the area. Whenever I go to work sometimes I feel down but by the end of the day I feel somewhat better by my coworkers. Shift for the most part goes by fast but some days feel slow.

title: Fun workplace
review: Fun workplace environment. Just not the place to advance so you have to find another job for that. Its an easy job with stressors but If you play dumb its the best. Its pay so that works out to have some extra money.

title: Disrespectful and power hungry management
review: The worst company to work for iv worked at 3 different Walmart in two different states and management is the same everywhere the management run the show like a game with full disrespect to employees under them and with punishment for the employ when things don’t go their way.

title: The worst place ever. Overworked. Underpaid. Understaffed.
review: The management is the number one issue, it is comprised of people who do not care about anybody except themselves. You will be constantly asked to do more than what is possible in a given time frame. You will be understaffed to handle the work load so prepare to do the work of 2-3 people. No overtime is allowed and if you do accidentally go into overtime you will be made to take extended lunches in order to burn off the time. The management only cares about metrics & numbers (because the metrics reflect their quarterly bonuses). They expected us to have $200+ grocery orders put together and out the door in less than 3-4 minutes when we had a 350ft+ walk to get from our staging area to the parking lot where the customers pick up the orders. We didn’t have enough equipment to do our jobs properly. When asked what they can do to help us get the wait times down they completely ignored everything that myself and many other associates offered up as ideas & they simply expected us to work harder.Instead they asked us to cheat the system and sign off on the orders before we even get outside to confirm the customers identity. We were constantly expected to go and help other departments whenever we were asked & had no choice in the matter even if it left our department struggling to get our own job done. This was a daily occurrence I worked Online Grocery the entire time I was there and yet I know how to stock, zone, run equipment, unload truck & do many other jobs around the store. I understand when our department is ahead we can afford to help out in other places but they forced us - more...

title: Would not work here if I had the choice
review: I’ve worked here for about a year and it’s a very depressing work environment. I don’t think I’ve met one person that is there because they like it. They are only there for the paycheck.  The lack of training doesn’t make it any better. It is also understaffed, and I have found that the staff there is unreliable. The 1 hour lunch break is nice though.

title: Unfair Pay
review: New employees are being offered higher pay rates than the long term employees with more experience. They are attempting to do this to increase the retention rate, but failing miserably because most of the people they hire barely make it through their 90 days. Instead of focusing on people who haven't yet establish themselves within your company, how about pay a fair incentive to the employees who have been loyal to your company for years.

title: Great first job and team
review: Had a great team to work with and had a pay that was good for the work that was required recommend this job for teens and has great benefits but the job can become boring after a year as it’s the same things over and over.

title: Great place for a first job
review: Decent and easy work with fitting pay, most managers allow you to be flexible with your hours. As long as you stay respectful and do your job you should have 0 issues with any management.

title: A very family friendly work place
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Friendly employees great staff and the job was fun What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Just having to be outside in all types of weather conditions What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is great and also the culture What is a typical day like for you at the company?Just going back and forth pushing carts and helping customers load stuff into their cars

title: Decent place to get a start
review: It’s a decent place to get a start and build your career but expect to have a lot of unmanageable tasks dumped on your plate the higher you move up and promote.

title: Productive
review: Awesome place to work. Treated with respect. Managers are really personable. Great pay and advancement opportunities. Hours are flexible. Was overall a great place to work.

title: Great coworkers at a great store
review: I enjoyed my time working for OGP (now called "Digital") at this store. My coworkers were great and the managers I worked for were nice, caring people. Our direct manager wasn't able to handle the stress of the job, but besides her, everyone was chill. The store manager was amazing and kind as well. The job, for me, was taking orders out to customers and loading them into their vehicle. It was chill, everyone had a good time, and we got things done. Perhaps it wasn't 100% by the book, but we worked hard and earned good money ($17 / hr when I was there). I miss the people I worked with and this store in general, but alas, I had to move for school.

title: A decent place to work
review: Walmart is just like any other retail job out there. Nothing too impressive but not horrible. It is a place to simply be when you need to make money and since everyone there is just like you then there's no problem fitting in

title: overworked, terrible scheduling
review: I work at a neighborhood walmart in the online department and I hate it. The scheduling manager is horrible. On the busiest days of the week they schedule the least amount of people over working the people there. And on the slow days they schedule so much people to the point where we all just stand around. I don’t understand. Not only that management does nothing to help when we’re backed up. And we’re under paid. Currently looking for somewhere else to work.

title: It’s a solid first job
review: Loved some of the managers there. The employees made the days go by, felt like family Typical workday:Do what your told as fast as you can, get out and go home.

title: Bad environment
review: Walmart don’t care for employees and works them to death. Don’t even think about dealing with workers comp with them because they try to sweep it under the rug.

title: Could be better
review: Instead of giving employees a chance to rest and prepare when not busy the managers pull associates from other departments to help. Whenever associates have to leave to go to their own department, the team leads get upset at them. Granted the insurance and discounts are pretty good compared to other companies, but the work culture here is just toxic.

title: Paycheck & perks
review: This is a great place to work.  Stay on your feet and are always busy. The holiday seasons get very busy and time passes by quickly.  A good place for students.

title: Good
review: I think it was really good. What Happens If You Fry Frozen Meat?Before discussing why and how you can cook frozen chicken, let’s first see why so many people advise against it.When meat thaws or defrosts, the process does take a couple of hours.During this time, the ice crystals (water molecules inside the meat) slowly melt and water seeps out of the flesh – this is the water you see in the plate or bowl after something has defrosted.

title: Ok place to work
review: Not bad to work  for. Had lazy co-workrs or ones that thought  they  were  the  bosses. Had to keep register tidy. Hardestv part of the job was the customers.

title: Draining, mentally taxing and lack of empathy for employees
review: I don't think it's a secret that working at Walmart is a nightmare. This corporation will stop at nothing to drain every last bit of you before letting you go for something you could not help or avoid.

title: Fun and energetic
review: Good place to work!I recommend it Very good management, they figure all problems usually in a timely manner, they provide excellent training, and the breaks are long

title: I really liked going to work everyday.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people. Customers and co-workers.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Handling customer complaints. Dealing with angry customers.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very kind and caring. Like a familyWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Scheduling lunch and breaks. Helping associates as well as customers

title: Poor Management
review: Management at most stores, having worked across many, are extremely lack luster. Work is passed off to you always and mistakes made by them are your fault. Very rarely is there good management, and most of those will not last long regularly quickly moving on to greener pastures.

title: They fired me wouldn’t recommend.
review: They fired me wouldn’t recommend. It was a typical day at work as well but they fired me for no reason at all shaking my head. Don’t send your kids there to work

title: Fun place to work until you become salary
review: I have really enjoyed working for Walmart. The team I work alongside is super fun and make me enjoy coming to work each day. I will say however, once I became salary my work-life balance was almost completely disregarded. I work crazy hours and I feel like I never have time to do anything but work and sleep.

title: Could be a great place to work
review: No compensation for working holidays. A lengthy process to call out because of illness or an emergency. Full time must work weekends. Do not necessarily get two days off in a row. Your days off and shift changes every 3 months. Do not adequately staff all departments. Mandatory one hour lunch. Can not take 30 min

title: Horrible
review: Lots a lot drama, constant employees fighting and starting fights. Management is awful they don’t care about anything. Horrible pay and horrible manners

title: Easy work
review: Very easy work but could be compensated better. Management can be hard to work with sometimes when it comes to scheduling but once you find the right one they will get it fixed. Hard to take time off

title: Horrible
review: Bad management don’t care about employees.they leave you in one department by yourself for hours and get mad when things isn’t done within a timely manner

title: Walmart management is worthless, and the corporate polices only benefit executives
review: The work isn't terrible, but the management makes it unbearable to stay long term. Work there if you need to and leave as soon as a better opportunity arrives.

title: Walmart
review: Great place to work at only left due to health issues.

title: good overall company, not so good local managers
review: walmart as a whole is a good company, but store managers are intolerant of any illness or rescheduling. the pay was not bad, but the work was mundane and it was difficult to connect with other employees.

title: Not a bad place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoyed customers and co workers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Bosses always changing positions What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Sometimes stressful but co workers are great What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good I enjoyed my work there Day goes fast when busy My favorite day is Black Friday

title: Best
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Atmosphere is great and best department to work is for customers service What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working overnights and late hours make more tired What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and supportive  helpful

title: Fun
review: It's definitely a fun job, your co workers definitely make the day a lot better, has decent benefits paid time off and a ok schedule, it's definitely a good starter job

title: Horrible team leads
review: My team leads are all fully grown adults. The adults, however, choose to act like children and talk down to and about associates to other associates. Over all the work environment is extremely depressing and as a front end associate, we are extremely micro- managed. This job is stressful between not being guaranteed hours, store hours getting cut, and other problems, this job has become so extremely unreliable.

title: Your life
review: If u get sick an do t have sick time they fire you… They do not care about your health or well being only you come work sick or get fired an they way they people to you it’s like you not human they only care about them self

title: Pretty good pay for retail
review: The job is extremely easy for the pay you get, and they give you a 1-hour lunch and 2 15-minute breaks. However the work environment is very stressful.

title: The customer are HORRIFIC
review: Retail is retail we know that, but the customers at Walmart are a diff breed. It's like they wait to get all their aggression and anger out til they get to a Walmart. Customers verbally and sometimes even physically abuse associates, the clientele is the worst and the only real reason I hate my job. The job itself is fine, the associates and management are fine but the customers? Hope you have thick skin because they are the worst kinds of customers.

title: I love walmart
review: Literally pointed out because of the pink eye which spread to my coach that coach was too good to fix point n ended up quitting later hard workers get treated unfair n being sick with a spreadable infection crazy to not see the truth.

title: Great place to work if you like a lack of leadership, babysitting and enjoy being rewarded with more work.
review: Too much babysitting those who wander around. No immediate supervisor available to report issues or resolve higher level customer issues. Changes to work processes tend to “fix” things that already work and ignore the issues that need fixing. Apparently a great place to work if you like to play Clash of Clans.

title: Amazing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I love working there. It was know bad energy,  all positive vibe What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When the lead, and coaches did know what they wanted What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great, everyone gas great understanding What is a typical day like for you at the company?I came in from 11pm until 7am, I started as a secret shopper, and ended up on the mod team

title: Easy to get hired
review: Lack of overall management,communication. No H.R. presence. Transfers are impossible. Attendance policy is a nightmare.No commute. Pay is decent, correct.

title: Stressful place to work
review: You must work every weekend, even if you’re part time. Hourly pay is mediocre, McDonald’s pays a higher hourly wage. Walmart does their best to accommodate your schedule when you need time off for vacation, family events, or appointments.

title: Fun workplace and great people
review: Good job, great pay it’s calm and you always have help. Management is good and I would recommend this job to someone else. If your looking for a job with fun people and great vibes this is the place to be.

title: Good job, horrible management
review: I enjoyed my job. However, the management was horrible. They talked down to us and picked their favorites. I was overworked while other were allowed to lean and chat all day. I grew extremely upset and decided to leave.

title: Fast Paced
review: The job involves unloading the truck(s), organizing its contents, then moving it onto the floor. It can be hard work for those inside the truck, especially during busy seasons or the summer.

title: I respect Wal-Mart as a company, but management team was a nightmare to dal with.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working at Wal-Mart was the pay.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management does not care about employees. I have heard team leaders curse out workers and demonstrate inappropriate behavior. Also we had to work in unsafe conditions during night shift.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not a safe environment to work. New workers are expected to pull around tons of merchandise pilled 12 feet high with out proper training . If you were in a managers bad side expect to be called out infront of everyone.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in, gather for a meeting and hope to get through another night.

title: Productive, fun, learn alot of retail information and work flow that gives experience to take to any job especially retail
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Stocking department has set hours part-time usually worked 32 hours+ team work in all departments What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Rude customers  just have to know how to assist them professionally and move onWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Inclusive, professional most of the time, team-work orientated What is a typical day like for you at the company?Easy going but physically demanding

title: You don't get the hours you need
review: Not a great place to work. They will not work with you if you have small children as a single parent. The point system is ridiculous. The people who don't work get the most benefit for some odd reason

title: Great work environment
review: Great company to work for great benefits, I work overnight and everyone is doing what they are supposed to be doing no issues with anyone great leadership from the supervisors

title: Long drives rough team
review: Started out decent. Good pay and such. But breaking down drama filled coworkers ruin the experience. Favoritism run rampant and incompetent leadership.

title: The only good thing about working here is knowing walmart will be around for years to come
review: This is not a good place to work. They do not care about their employees at all. They will fire you one day and the next day or two hire you back in another department

title: Relatively easy job, but work isn't easily spread out
review: All in all I found the job pretty easy. Between order fulfillment and working the door you could have enough variety to keep the day from getting boring. The regular break times helps the day to go by fast too. The primary down fall was management allowing some people to loaf and allowed others to carry the additional work load. Management was friendly, but allowed favorites to exist. This drove some employees to leave despite enjoying other aspects of the job.

title: Complicated
review: The job was very easy, but the managers make the job hard and complicated! Some of the customers can be rude, and some can be very nice at times. Walmart management is poor!

title: Not a bad job, but difficult and demanding
review: The job itself is simple and pretty straightforward, but simple does NOT mean it's easy, as it's a very physically demanding job. You're walking for hours on end, and it requires a bit of arm strength, especially if you're pushing lots of carts at once. Breaks also tend to be incredibly inconsistent, and I usually take my breaks based off of how busy it currently is, sometimes not having any at all (except lunch breaks). Management can also have some outrageous demands, when I physically am incapable of doing what they want me to, especially since at the time of writing this review, I'm only a month in and already completely left alone on some days. Even when they drag associates out to help me, it can be a real challenge. But aside from demands from management being a bit much, and breaks being inconsistent (and sometimes totally absent), it's not a bad job at all. It's just the conditions that I genuinely have complaints about. If we weren't so heavily understaffed, my complaints would be very few and minor.

title: They will over work you
