review: So for starters the management is trash they don't give you any pay holidays but still say it's mandatory to be at work otherwise you'll get 2 points. Walmart policy's is all about protecting them not the employees. You gotta wait 6 months to get benefits witch is unheard of. They expect you to go above and beyond with no preference pay or bonus, the only bonus you'll get it about 30 cents after one year if working for them. You're not allowed to talk to anyone because apparently you only gotta focus on your job and they will yell at you for that.

title: Not enough employees.
review: Not enough employees, managers are always on different pages. No one works picks during the day, not enough equipment, favoritism, bad team leads. Terrible truck schedule.

title: If you need a job that offers a lot of hours this is the place to be.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?store discount for all employeesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?coworkers not taking the job seriously and rude custumers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?toxic work environment unless you make best friends What is a typical day like for you at the company?fills prescriptions, check out, type prescriptions

title: Okay
review: Not the best. Not the worst. Could’ve been better if breaks were actually scheduled. Management was kinda messy but that’s expected. Long hours with only one lunch break.

title: Good place
review: Fast pace environment. Good for starting job. Working as a cashier was good but could get very busy at time. There are a lot of workers so it was good for my schedule.

title: fun place to work as a teen
review: easy way for teenagers to get jobs in highschool or college. hours might be mediocre but the pay is 15. truly suggest starting in a retail environment

title: An Okay Experience That Could've Been Better
review: Overall, my experience with the store was okay. However, due to staffing problems, subpar training, and occasionally confusing expectations it wasn't good. I believe that the issues were just with my store. I've heard better things from individuals at other stores.

title: Fun place to work
review: Management and employees were all friendly. It is always busy at the store. Everyone worked hard and pay has increased. Fast-paced environment can be fun.

title: Overall a positive experience
review: Being a cashier is a great first job for a teenager. I learned a ton of real life experiences and appreciated that the company accommodates school schedules fairly well.

title: Great experience
review: Was recruited when I was finishing up college and working in a department. Excellent training program. Remember it’s who you work for and not the company. I had a great management team. We treated our employees well and paid them well to retain them.

title: I'd rather be homeless or mopping floors for taco bell than work for Walmart again
review: Hired for full-time but frequently scheduled much less, sometimes 16 hours for the week. Management had no clue what was going on. Team leadership changed frequently so no one to handle personnel issues. Way too much chaos and drama. I don't even shop at Walmart anymore after my experience. I'd rather be homeless or mopping floors for taco bell than work for Walmart again

title: Fine
review: It’s fine, nothing special. Very typical for retail. The work balance is fine, management is hit or miss. You get what you make of it. Stay away if you don’t like big box retail

title: I loved everyone here
review: I absolutely loved my job working at Walmart. I was an overnight stocker. Management were understanding and helpful people.  They understood hardships in life. I had gone through 2 family deaths and through pto, and loa, I was able to take time off and give my last respects.I loved everything about the job. It was fast paced and fun. I loved stocking,I had been there 6 years when I went for a random checkup to my doctor who told me I had high blood pressure, and wrote a letter to my employer that I shouldn’t carry more than 20 pounds. There went my job as a stocker. Walmart management worked out a daytime apparel position for me, but it was less money. I gladly took the position but I found it wasn’t paying all my bills. I decided to look for another job for more pay.I hated leaving Walmart. If I was able to transfer my previous pay and raises I had earned in 6 years to my daytime job, I would never have left. I feel overlooked. 6 years of my employment meant nothing to them. I’m hurt. Perhaps in the future, Walmart should exempt loyal associates from their “daytime pay” rule. I’m saddened and miss my Walmart family, but when my pay was lowered, I’m afraid paying my bills took precedence.

title: Ok
review: It was ok for the work, i mainly spent time folding and putting clothes away, alot of it was mostly boring and alot of the place was a mess but hey what do you expect from walmart

title: Good and the Bad
review: great job for those with a strong work ethic who don’t mind not getting paid enough , support for injury, and co workers rude to their customers.

title: A pretty nice place to work.
review: Lax management that makes sure you're working and getting your job done. Some jobs cannot be reasonably done in the time required due to staff shortages but management is generally understanding of this.

title: Stressful
review: Walmart manager were more worried about what could be done in 8 hours instead of how their workers felt or their health. Would not recommend to anyone

title: Its good place to work
review: Been working in Walmart understand on what i have to do to help customer and grow with the company.work great otheralways willing to help and succeed together with the company.

title: Productive and fun workplace
review: You can learn on your own rhythm. All people is willing to help and teach you news skills. The environment is nice and clean 24/7. Nobody is pushing you. Opportunity to study any career do you want.

title: Toxic environment where they don't respect the few staff who chose to stay
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Payday and schedule flexibility What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of staffing. No support from management. Deceitful coworkers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very toxic. Unappreciated. High turnover What is a typical day like for you at the company?Hectic. Dealing with rude racist coworkers and customers

title: Beats working in food
review: Your experience working for Walmart will vary widely depending on the manager on duty during your shift. There is a fair bit of training for the core parts of working at Walmart, but as a floor associate, you learn about 95% of your job on the fly. I feel that could use improvement (though, in fairness, I did leave Walmart in 2019). On occasion, you will be asked unreasonable things. At that point, you have to make a judgement call as to whether you can say “per policy, I cannot accommodate this” or just involve management.Also, no, medical breaks are not a thing.

title: Alright job
review: Its not too bad, but boring sometimes. It depends on what managers you get. I really like my coworkers so you can request to work at the same time is them so its more fun.

title: What you expect
review: It's walmart. It's what you expect it to be minus the optimism. If you don't mind grinding the corporate ladder to maybe get paid decent someday then it's for you.

title: Work life
review: Good work life balance, provide good customer service , 2 breaks , focuses a lot on metrics, good team , build , have good patient relationship , good quality of life.

title: Disorganized, dirty and very rude and unprofessional employees
review: I've worked here a very short time and let me tell you this,  it's a very dirty store with staff that shows favoritism and is very rude to co workers as well as customers!  Nobody wants to do their jobs and just does whatever they want.

title: i enjoyed my time at walmart
review: as a truck driver your gone 5 days a week, home for a reset, thats trucking. it is a good job and pays very well! i had to quit due to medical reasons. i enjoyed making delieveries to walmart stores/ sam's clubs/ and market places  .i drove night shift so traffic wasnt terrible.  if i could go back i deffinatly would!

title: Not fair
review: Forced to work short shifts, about 10-15 minutes each week.  No pay or benefits unless you skip scan an item or two.  No uniform requirement is nice.

title: It’s ok
review: Very poorly ran, managers barely were around to help but would get if they can’t find you. The only good thing is the breaks and flexibility but other than that, they’re alright

title: Easy but a lot of walking
review: The job did started great customers are nice most of the times just the lack of help and management everytime I work or do my best even in a busy and hard condition the manager came in and just stood there looking at me while I’m by myself trying to serve customers all because I was behind and she rushes people and doesn’t come back in like a week or 2 the managers are nice and “sometimes” helpful but it just doesn’t seem right sense I mostly see people barely working and just sitting around, like they always say hard workers gets paid less while lazy ones gets paid more, I just want to see a change in the environment and people, I also heard you will get fired if something important is happening to you personally.

title: non productive
review: not great establishment. makes you train yourself and puts you on a spot that doesn't need to be called for. Plus will fire you on the spot and has creepy workers there as well

title: strict and rude
review: managers don’t care about your health and just want to use you as chess pieces and could not care less about your feelings. or your physical being.

title: Overworked and underpaid
review: Every Walmart is different but at mine, I felt overworked and underpaid. I felt like I wasn't appreciated and was overlooked for the work I did. The pay was $13/ hour at the time and I stayed overtime, cut from my lunch break, and did stocking too. The job itself was okay except for the heavy lifting.

title: Terrible place to work
review: Typical day: running around like crazy to finish orders because department is never fully staffed, not enough equipment for everyoneManagement: play favorites, don't enforce rules for everyone, give no compliments, think yelling at the team will make us work faster, never help the team when we're running behindWorkplace culture: very clique-ish, lots of gossip

title: They don’t care about workers and pay is not good
review: I feel as an employee for Walmart they don’t appreciate associates and if you or not liked they will treat you like a child and possible fire you for something that everyone does or did

title: Good coworkers, bad managers
review: Working at Walmart can be a mixed experience. While coworkers can be great, management often prioritizes profits over employee well-being, leading to a stressful work environment.Walmart often expects employees to handle multiple departments rather than hiring additional help, resulting in overworked and overwhelmed associates. This can be especially problematic for departments that require multiple associates to run effectively.

title: Great for a paycheck
review: Upper management was very clique focused. If you could get in with someone higher up, you could have a decent future. Otherwise, keep your head down and you’ll have a steady income.

title: Work is easily manageable
review: Any position is fairly tolerable. Working isn't difficult and it's pretty simple to learn. Overtime is almost guaranteed and we'll worth the pay. As long as you consistently communicate with your team, you will do the job well.

title: Unorganized and poor management
review: Poor management and unorganized, messy, staff are rude, product gets tossed everywhere and damaged by stocking employees, unreasonable shifts, Don't work here

title: Management is terrible
review: Management could care less about your opinions on how to improve processes or be efficient. Work is easy however and pay is decent for a base job. Become brain dead to survive.

title: Okay
review: Okay job, don't love or hate it, have to work to pay the bills. Store management us fine but it's a huge corporation. Certain things come from working there

title: Glad I go out
review: Difficult to move up,  the rather higher "managers" from outside who know nothing then have the associates who have been there a while train them.  They often don't last and getting promoted is pretty difficult.  You are not appreciated and remember you are replaceable.

title: Overworked under paid very short staffed
review: Me personally feels like Walmart can take better care of their workers better than they do there’s no longer holiday pay health insurance is trash and management needs more training on how to treat the employees like human beings and not like robots to do the job of 3 people being a former overnight worker of 2 and half years there I’ve seen the level of disrespect dished out from management was ridiculous

title: Productive
review: The pay is decent and the work is super easy to learn. There is room for improvement and opportunity to grow within the company. They pay you mileage which is a plus.

title: MUCHAS TAREAS
review: LAS PRIORIDADES,RESPETO,INTEGRIDAD Y DISPONIBL
position: Cajera, Servicio al Cliente, produce stockers

title: Over Night Stocker
review: At night the air conditioning is turned off to save money but it is very uncomfortable for people working, bending, lifting, and stocking shelves. Also, the equipment needed to do our jobs is often in need of repair or there are not enough carts, pallet jacks or supplies needed to perform our jobs effectively. If zoning were done by cap 1 we could complete stocking shelves overnight.

title: Starter job
review: Starter job with benefits that was easy to learn and quick to move forward. Stock options were a plus that is hard to say no to. Raises were not very good.

title: Decent pay, but not worth the headache
review: The harder you work, the more work you'll be expected to do, while lazy employees just walk around all night. You'll be given nine hours of work in an eight hour shift and get in trouble for not finishing.

title: Not fun
review: Underpaid managers do not care It’s like a high school. Do what you want tattle on everybody else. The ones that work hard are the ones I get this  end of the stick. Management loves to walk around and criticize instead of giving anybody a pat on the back.

title: Over all i like my job and my customers it is just hard on your body
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits and ok pay also location What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The hours can be rough not getting home until midnightWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Much like any other company there are some good workers and some badWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Greet and provide excellent customer service to all

title: An absolutely terrible job for a human being.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Money and bonus potential. Benefits 1st day.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They dont care about you and dont follow human resource law or federal wage and hour lawsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible, understaffed and underpaid = bad environment.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Nothing but work hearing employee complaints trying to raise their morale while hiding yours

title: Horrible non friendly non friendly bad place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing it sucks they do not treat you like a person What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Mbira being home every night with your family What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s horrible and fake and not worth itWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?No direction no person talks to you they suck

title: Nice
review: Walmart is not too bad. You have to get there early. The early bird gets the worm. But they have a good selection of food and jewelry. The best thing is if you buy ok one soda you get another one for free

title: Good
review: It was a good and fun place to work for someone in college or high school. Don’t recommend staying here…. Hours are pretty steady and the pay is good compared to other places

title: Productive
review: Everything here is determined by who you know and who they know. If someone (a coworker or supervisor) knows someone on the council or in administration and they decide to act out or create a hostile work environment, worst case scenario is they will be moved departments and not receive any punishment or coaching. A lot of the time, if it’s a supervisor, you will be moved. It can be hard to get fired but it’s not hard to be the victim of a hostile work environment. The way HR is set up, if the person you have a complaint against has friends higher-up, the complaint will be brushed under the rug.

title: Horrible terrible wish I could quit
review: Management gives Little to no training, time constraints, multiple departments, skeleton crews, coaching for times, fixing aisles for an hour, putting go backs away for an hour so I'm left with barely any hours to get freight done. Part time working full time hrs with no benifits.

title: Standard job
review: Ok but gets old after a while   Decent pay lots of options for locations Can’t think of much else to say. Can’t compare to another similar job.  Won’t work there again

title: Productive Workplace
review: Good place and a great place for you first job, pretty flexible on hours. Customers can be upset by new set up though and sometimes made the job a little upsetting.

title: Understaffed and overworked
review: Depending on which Walmart you are at!! Walmart hiring manager do not like to hire people, so a lot of task are put on the little amount of associate they have.

title: Decent place to work to pay bills
review: Not bad overall for retail. Customers can be violent towards workers for no reason. And management just watches the police have to make store do something to protect workers. A sick joke!

title: Very fun
review: It was fun and peaceful every one was great tha k you for listening to my story it helps me alot to wonder if anyone us really reading what I'm saying

title: Positive and supportive work place with grate management
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Grate coworkers and management. Work depends on the exact job you need to do at the time, even then the work is always manageable and not stressful. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Accidentally dropping glass or electronics, still it's very manageable and positive work placeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Everyone is great. You can work without much conversation (other then when it's a necessity) or you can choose to be social and chat with coworkers (so long as you keep up work productivity) What is a typical day like for you at the company?There are alot of diffrent jobs at Walmart but I was on the remodeling team (only a temporary job at which you can get a new position. But I stocked and filled shells as well as took trash to a compactor. Other then that your manager may pull you aside to do something else

title: It's meh
review: Pretty easy just very cold. Was a one man army most of the time but didn't mind much since I'm a workaholic. Schedules are typically 9 hours total minus the 1 hour lunch they give you so technically you only get paid the 8hrs.

title: what is the job like
review: It can take a toll on your body but for the most part it's not a really hard job. Just pushing the cart around and picking groceries. Assisting customers with finding products.

title: Conflicting
review: I spent over 3 years passionate about the job, promoted early on as well as surviving a restructure, but the toxic culture remains dominant sadly. I worked all shifts in effort to become a coach. But unfortunately was mistreated badly and manipulated time and time again. However, I learned leadership skills and had experiences I’ll take with me for the rest of my life. I feel better equipped in my current job because of what I learned working here.

title: Walmart is not a family oriented business anymore!
review: * Never enough employees to help the customer and help the one person behind the desks!* I learned a lot of skills that I got to use because they did not "see fit to lose the one person that knew how to do everything that a salary manger was suppose to know, so they said to me when I asked to be transferred to a different department.*Management was bad for the fact that when a customer had a problem with say a return, they told us to make the decision that would help the customer and the store they would then come over and override us in front of the customer. *The management time for breaks and lunches were bad for some us whom did what were told for lunches and breaks were punished because they allowed others to take their breaks when they wanted (approaching 5th hour) and never punished for it.* workplace culture I will not comment on for my store was the worst.* I was injured on the job and never got the proper help for moving thing lifting things and understanding that i was under a limit that was not followed by the managers there.* Paycheck!

title: What I have noticed about working at Walmart is the favoritism
review: They have a lot of drama and favoritism with this company there is a lot cons to working at Walmart more than there is pros which I can say Is not fair at all to workers and I can say that when you work there it is miserable they say they will work with you and your availability and issues that you have but they do not actually help at all they just say well we got jobs to do and we’ll that sucks and that is not a great response to an associate not very helpful at all

title: too much for the pay
review: encharged of 4 departments and 6 employees, not time to do your stuff, always working and helping other departments. Miscommunication, every time they tell you to do something after is done management wants to change it .

title: Okay starting job
review: Didn’t work here for too long but was treated pretty well for the time I worked there. I would recommend it to anybody. Training is helpful and some coworkers were too.

title: It’s a good reliable job
review: It’s a physical job, that requires you to be busy at all times . It can be stressful but it has its perks , Two 15 minute breaks and an hour lunch which is very much needed . You can instapay twice per pay period to take money out your check if needed.

title: Consistent hours
review: Management can be a pain, can be fun or frustrating entirely depending on department and which quarter it is.  Our team had. Consistent hours 40 every week full time, easy work. Show up and you won't be fired, ignore everyone else and take your 15s and lunches.

title: Easy to get a job here.No requirements
review: Have a enough  working equipment to go around.For everyone.Transfer or get rid of the non working people.Don't rehire the slackersJust because your desperate for help

title: Easy but Hard Goals
review: I actually really liked working at the warehouse because I could come in, do my job, and go home. I didn't have to talk to anyone, scheduling was stable, and I worked 3 days a week but 12 hour shifts. I worked 13 on Saturdays. Management was good, but the metrics became hard to beat. Easy job, but hard to beat labeling 360  items per hour when super heavy things come to your lane and/or you get pallets with no so many items on them. It's a gamble. I worked there for a year or so. I'd even go back if I could. Well, if they had better achievable metrics.

title: Everything is bad at Walmart
review: They squeeze you till last deop . Don’t pay enough. And cut. Lot of  hours . The management make me laugh.  And if you wanna be promoted  you should  lick 👅 the shoes from the coaches or supervisors

title: Don’t work here
review: They do not treat you fair. Don’t work hereYou can’t advance, no raises, works you to the bone.No paid holidaysBarely any PTONo respect.Again don’t work here

title: Good highschool job
review: The job is easy and the front end management is friendly. The direct supervisor is a good manager and he treats employees fairly. It gets tough in the winter but they aren’t very strict in those times.

title: Great place to work and build a corporate career out of if you can deal with people.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?As long as you were willing to learn you could do just about any job.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with shoplifters and them nor wanting to release  unpaid merchandise.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great as long as you did not make  management mad then sometimes it felt like they were all out to get you.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Was clocking do my routines walk the sales floor speak with associates about theft and how they could help mitigate it. Drive safety for both the customer and associates stopshoplifters go home

title: Worst job ever
review: WORST job. Must be a “popular” person. EXTREMELY TOXIC. Full time hours but “part time” employee. No benefits. If they don’t want you there (no matter how hard you work) you won’t be there. They’ll “fire” you by not saying anything to you. Just taking you off the schedule then not answering your calls or talking to you anymore. They DO NOT CARE ABOUT YOU

title: Typical retail
review: Always understaffed, though higher ups will say you’re not. Be prepared to do everything from truck unloading, running residual freight, working very long hours to complete notes and receive little to no appreciation for your dedication.

title: Frozen section
review: Working in the frozen section of Walmart can be a challenging. It is a physically demanding job, as you will be lifting and moving heavy boxes of frozen food. However, it is also a job that requires a lot of attention to detail, as you need to make sure that the frozen food is properly stocked.

title: 10 out of 10 would not recommend
review: Management had favorites and refused to listen to availability and thought I didn't need training because of me being assigned female at birth and also insisted that I did more then the job description without being compensated fairly

title: Productive
review: Productive and enjoyable workplace. Management is a bit overwhelming sometimes. Pay can be better. Diversity is a plus. Lots of different people from all over the world.

title: Boring
review: Working at Walmart can be a mixed experience. On the one hand, it can offer a steady paycheck and benefits, as well as opportunities for advancement within tWorking at Walmart can be a mixed

title: I'm very happy there
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The team leads I have!! Very helpful and understanding!!!!! Non judging What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Having better ways to contact team leads when needing asstWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?No problems at all everyone is kind What is a typical day like for you at the company?Bizzy ..but I love my job and my customers

title: It was awful
review: It was my first real job and it started off great, however as time went on I felt like no matter how hard I worked no one cared. The customer service wasn't the best and management was horrible  I had one manager tell me he had better things to do than to give me my paycheck forcing me to wait for when I worked a shift when HR was there to get it. It was the worst experience of my working career.

title: A learning experience in how bad retail can be
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people you work with are crazyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Rude customers, unrealistic expectations from inexperienced management, and lazy coworkersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Overworked and understaffed while ODP is the complete opposite. One person is expected to load 40 pallets of mulch by hand while another is expected to walk around and do nothing all day for more money.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Depends on the position. Usually you deal with multiple angry and rude customers a day. You will also have to do the work that others don't finish because there is no accountability for the lazy associates, only the good ones.

title: Decent ok place
review: Good for temporary work when you are between jobs.  Not good for long term; no benefits for part-time and very hard to get full time.  Hours vary depending on business needs

title: I really do love this Job.
review: Wal-Mart is one of the most underrated jobs you can have, There's one in 32506 area code. They'll give you everything you need to succeed.  They're understanding of what it takes to be a growing worker in society. They'll teach how to manage in various categories as most employers don't. They're good at helping you build a home life too. I appreciate my time spent there.  It really was like a family I never had. I could call them today and they'd be happy to see me and wonder what I've got myself into entirely unbiased.

title: Fun workplace
review: A+++ good place to start if you are looking for a place to work. Good pay and benefits also it’s very easy to move up in management very friendly managers.

title: Nice environment for customers and the public for threw out our city
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working around good employees better as myself,working as a good team member What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Just dealing with shop liftersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Everybody’s on the same page giveing the customer good service What is a typical day like for you at the company?To not work under pressure an get the job done on time

title: productive and fun
review: ok job I have worked at worse places, and I have worked at better places. its a job if you need money, just try not to have your job taken over by a kiosk

title: Favoritism and lack of training
review: Working here is the height of my anxiety. Team leads don't listen, they don't train people when they have "one good person who can do it fine" they yell at you for the simplest things. Do not work there.

title: Bad upper management
review: Lower management are great and try their best to mitigate the lackluster leadership of upper management. Unreasonable time expectations to fulfill orders.

title: Good High-school Job
review: I worked here during school. They worked with me so I could still work and attend school while playing sports. Management asked a lil to much out of a high school student.

title: Great
review: Fun for teens, great pay, nice hours. Great work culture. Very busy sometimes but that doesn’t stop the money. Doesn’t allow very much time off but perfectly fine with me

title: Productive cool workplace for the most part
review: You’re usually busy for most the shift depending what department, made good friends as well from working there. Majority of managers are not the best but you’ll usually find at least one or two good ones. Job security was never a problem with me, just do what you’re supposed to do and learn it and you’ll be fine, advancement in ranks can be difficult if you’re looking to make a career out of it as sometimes management does not always pick the correct employees to move up, hence why there’s always bad managers. You do get decent PTO the more you work and the longer your tenure is. No holidays off except Christmas, and if you want to get a holiday off it’s takes double of your PTO hours which is a letdown, that includes any blackout days.

title: My experience was much better than I had expected.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great focus on family. Solid leadershipWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?layers of bureaucracy and corporate leadership and leadership in general is run thin.  They want to support but they don't always have time to support What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Good, family focus and safety is treated very seriously. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and working hard. If you have time to lean you have time to clean.

title: A disaster that they're walking into, often greeted by coworkers walking in with the phrase  "just turn around go home".
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Discount on certain items throughout the year in store and online.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of work and family balance. They frequently do not give employees entire time requested off knowing full well the week of vacation is out of state. Lack of managerial support.Constantly say "fully staffed" when there are not enough staff to cover breaks, lunches, and time off when they are actually very under staffed. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, due to lack of employees and properly trained managers, so thise who can are pushed to the breaking point day in and day out to do the work of 2 people.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?That varies depending upon shift worked and job title or role.  Everyone is to be helping the customers. Not enough equipment to properly communicate with staff even though they believe the phones are an improvement over walkies that are much more reliable.   Try to cover and get done your assigned tasks in your area and even other peoples areas.  Delegation is key when trained staff are available.   Busy.  On your feet on poor quality flooring.  Customers trump employees and a customer usually can get their way even when it means violating a policy.  They are either pro overtime or expect one to cram as much extra stuff as possible into an 9 hours day.  You get a 1 hour lunch.  They DEMAND weekend availability and if they can finangle it they will work you the entire weekend.  They onky close Thanksgiving - more...

title: They don’t care about employees at all
review: The company doesn’t really care about you. The hours will be terrible work all holidays and weekends with low pay but most of the people you work with are pretty cool

title: its a ok place
review: job was great the environment was lack luster to say the least felt like a jail some days with the way the walls were painted but id still go back if it came down to it

title: Nice
review: Nice schedule, you get your tasks and have to do them on time but other than that the place is very chill and fun to work with. Customer service is not the main part of this position.

title: Good first job or even move up
review: It's a great first job in my opinion. Lot of opportunities to move around positions or move up. Always was treated fairly. Should have stayed with the company

title: it is a productive workplace
review: Managers are nice I really like working there sometimes it is hard lack of training but lots of fun people do get fired some people get hired I enjoy workinh there

title: In home fun. Managemet not
review: Management most of the time are disorganized and don’t know what the heck they are doing. They give good positions to people who do not know anything just like them

title: Help customers in lawn and garden. Was not fun at all.
review: Help customers in lawn and garden. Ring them out as well. I DID NOT LIKE IT!!! If you get hot easy DONT work here. 10/10 would not recommend working here.

title: Stressful, but can be fun at times
review: What is the best part of working at the company?People you work with, they're like family. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Have to worry about too many points against you if you have to call in.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Can be stressful when it's real busyWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Sometimes customers are in a bad mood. If you try to talk to them they can cuss you out.

title: Productive
review: Job started off great my primary job was a packer. Was later trained in multiple areas in the warehouse. Production was good until my line would be shut down and would be sent home for the day.

title: Job
review: It's an ok job.  Work is pretty easy. If you have great managers you will like the job. Bad management ruins every job. The hours are consistent so you will get your 40 hours

title: Good place for a part time
review: Working at Walmart was a mixed experience. On the one hand, the job offered stability and the chance to work with a diverse group of people. The pay was decent, and the benefits were good. However, the workload could be overwhelming, especially during busy periods like holidays. There were times when the management seemed disorganized and unresponsive to employee concerns. On the whole, I would recommend Walmart as a good place to work if you're looking for a steady job with decent pay and benefits, but be prepared to work hard and deal with some organizational challenges along the way.

title: Why did I stay here so long not worth it
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The less you do the more like you are to be rewarded. If you're a good worker you will get no where good luck 👍What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Clocking in here and the zero communicationExtremely under staffed Hiring freezes for what reason It's all about the managers here and their bonuses What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic and very political here you can be blacklisted very quickly if u ask for help it seems What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress no help made to feel like a joke and you don't matter it's honestly pathetic the way this store is run

title: Meh
review: I mean it was alright the managers where shady same for some of the coworkers some good some bad but good pay and excellent benefits wouldn’t mind going back

title: Its a job
review: Pays good for what it is, a walmart job. But hours can be pathetic, and expectations are ridiculous. This depends on the location, from what I understand

title: Terrible
review: Ungodly Business managers tht have been there for x amount of years are allowed to do and speak to other employees bcz of their time as an employee. Very disrespectful and not really a customer friendly business

title: Quick pace environment,
review: Working for Walmart was a great training experience and the promotional opportunities are great. They provide training program to get you started. They have a great benefit plan.

title: Stay away!! Pay is good but not worth it. Turnaround rate is about 90% leaves in first week.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?4 days on 3 days off. It was a 10 hrs shift. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They treat you as a slave. They don't care about you. If you get hurt they will find a way to blame you. I was part of the emergency team. They always were mad at me for helping others.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is hurry up and keep working. They only care about production. Your problems are nothing for them. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Rushed to make production or get written up for it. But if you are a stick up to the managers you will be fine until they need to blame someone for their mess.

title: You shop
review: Too easy for me and my family and friends are going to have to be there in a few minutes to get the kids to the house and get it done and I don't have a lot

title: Terrible management
review: Working at Walmart is terrible. Management will walk around all day and have all the associates doing all the work. They don"t pay nearly enough to their associates.

title: It okay sometimes
review: Having been employed for awhile, it's an alright job depending on what department you're in and what day it is. It can be busy at times, other days it can be chill. Really just depends on how your team is

title: Good place to work.
review: Great pay, great benefits. Good, consistent hours. Room for growth. As an EHS associate, it's a fairly easy job. I prefer working in warehousing instead of the stores. Management is fair and good.

title: Good workplace
review: It is a good place to work so far good management and pay not bad for what you do I would recommend to work here they have all kinds of benefits and perks for employees

title: Fine when properly enabled
review: More than Often not prepared with what i needed to do my daily tasks, if you do more work than the minimum its now expected of you everyday, hard to find my bosses when i need to talk to them

title: Fun place to work
review: Overall a good place to work.  Fun and laid back environment with good co-workers. The pay is not great though and it can be difficult to get full time benefits.

title: Great place to learn if pursuing automotive career
review: Good place to work and learn when beginning your automotive career. Hours vary but overall decent balance between work and at home life. Managers can be difficult at times but usually no problems if your doing your work.

title: Productive
review: Your always doing something... They keep you busy... They always need help around the store, inwhich I usually always there to help all departments... They are good company to work for... They will help with ur education too...

title: Terrible employee treatment
review: They do not care about their employees they will fire you for things out of your control. They expect you to do jobs you’ve never trained for. They will pit you against other employees to get one to do more then the other.

title: Run
review: If you are looking for a soul sucking environment where management doesn't care about you and you get cussed out by customers on the daily then boy is walmart the place for you.

title: Negative place to work, zero training and no communication from either coworkers or management.
review: There was absolutely no communication between management and associates, you are expected to know everything from the very beginning as there is no training. You may be hired for a specific category but they will make you work in every other department and will not compensate your pay for the higher paid jobs that you assist with. They will fire anyone who discusses unionizing. They may also hire you for a set amount of hours but will change at random for store benefit.

title: able to learn diff departments
review: worked for a few years worked in alot of diff departments. wad start of when you could start have colored hair. and pto was starting to be based on hour many hours you worked.

title: Decent place to work/opportunities to grow
review: Its not a bad place to work. Pay is decent and there are opportunities to move up or try other departments. But they are frequently short staffed and workers gossip like high schoolers.

title: Easy, but stressful
review: It's the easiest job at Walmart, but very stressful. 500 picks at 5 am is a decent day...anything over 1500 forget about it. Morning shift is the best shift. If you're coming in after 11am I'm sorry for you.

title: Great pay, terrible environment.
review: Management is iffy, pay is great! I had more problems with management than I did with anything else. I loved my job and position, but it was a very stressful workplace.

title: Great experience if you’re considering a career in retail
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Decent pay but management changes happen oftenWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of support. Walmart suffers from too many people having management positions without management skills. They will rarely agree on processesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Just another job. Do your job and go home to avoid the drama

title: Sad place to work
review: products are broken while unloading the trailer. employees don't know much. had to spray bed bugs in a trailer one time. you will never see the owners. they don't care about you as a person

title: Very poor and wish I never started working at Walmart.  I don't even liking shopping at that store anymore
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The discounts for the employees.  There is nothing else nice about working at Walmart What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management is awful and uncaring about the employees safety What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unfair and expect to be sexally harassed while you workWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busting your butt and always having your boss saying that your going to slow for every employee

title: My experience at Walmart was wonderful.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working at Walmart to me would have to be how understanding the managers were. They are usually flexible in situations and are willing to help whenever they can.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful part about working at Walmart to me would have to be the upset customers and having to be able to stand for hours at a time. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment and the culture at Walmart is sort of similar to being at a family reunion.What is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day to me was usually simple and enjoyable.

title: Different things to do .
review: Awesome experience, they have lots of different positions and opportunities to learn a mass variety of things and that makes it that much better u have Lots of room for growth which is great .

title: Productive and fun work place, little bit of favoritism but I guess that’s everywhere these days.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Co workers were nice and friendly, helped me learn real fast. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Easily the disorganization of the holidays. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment and the culture seems to be improving.

title: It was a stepping stone for future careers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I had a lot of good experiences with staffWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough pay, they made work part time for a whole year. When I switched to full-time then you waited another six months before you were eligible for benefits.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Diverse environment, you had a mixture of young and old. Multi culture environment. What is a typical day like for you at the company?It was very demanding but sometimes fun

title: Decent pay
review: Nothing good or bad it’s a good first job but management sucks,they play favorites and refuse to fire the lazy ones who call off everyday but fire the ones who shows up

title: I had to quit for my own sanity. I would never work there again, ever.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Getting a paycheck. Not much else.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Telling you to get the computer learning skills done, but too many glitches and nobody to help you out, and that is if they give you the time to do it.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not good. Not recognized for going beyond job. Just a thanks would have been nice. No support from the CSM. Did not address customer tantrums.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful. Customers were ok, it was management. Some of them would constantly rebuke you, in front of customers!!

title: Great associates always helping each other, always something new to learn
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Competitive wages, opportunities to advance within the company, ongoing training.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Changing of direction due to customer needsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Inclusive culture, cross training throughout the facilities, teamworkWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Working freight  daily, customer service, training of new associates, being trained in different areas of a store

title: Good Bad but worth it
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Opportunities, family friendly What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Fast pace environment large freight load What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fellow associates worked well together got along and respected one another’s valuesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy enjoyed meeting new people

title: Productive but bad
review: What is the best part of working at the company?N/A there was not anything good about working there besides the employee discount.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The rude staff and rude customers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The management is so rude and don’t know how to talk to their employees.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and hectic. Long hours getting rude comments everyday

title: Good laid back
review: Working at Walmart can be a challenging yet rewarding experience. As one of the largest retail companies in the world, Walmart offers a wide range of employment opportunities, from entry-level positions to management roles.For entry-level employees, Walmart provides a comprehensive training program to ensure that they are equipped with the necessary skills to succeed in their roles. They also offer competitive pay, benefits, and a flexible work schedule that allows employees to balance their work and personal life.However, working at Walmart can be demanding, especially during peak seasons, such as holidays or special events. The workload can be heavy, and the pace can be fast, which may require employees to work quickly and efficiently.Overall, working at Walmart can be a great opportunity for individuals who are looking to build a career in the retail industry. With a focus on customer satisfaction and employee development, Walmart provides a supportive environment for employees to grow and thrive.

title: Fun workplace and friendly coworkers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Assignments and also the discount What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When too much to do. Also when coworkers are being slow What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and multi cultural also clean and very neat

title: Loved it
review: Family oriented was able to be a single parent and work took lots of vacation and great pay.. Like any retail job it had its ups and downs but I really loved working with my Walmart family

title: Terrible
review: The job is utter garbage unless you have a unicorn that cares about what you applied for. Otherwise, you will be thrown in to tasks you did not sign up for, and will be expected to cover for those tasks you did not sign up for

title: Cool job for college
review: Great job with decent pay for students. Works with schedule and allowed to save money for school to be the best you can be while getting an education.

title: Chill but the people are kinda weird
review: Walmart will hire anyone and it showed in the people i worked with. A lot of drug users or just all around weirdos. Half of the night time dudes were creeps and the Management all had their little cliques and would overlook most issues. If any were brought up to them, it was met with an excuse or would just get shrugged off. Working in the pharmacy was okay because I couldn’t be pulled to other departments, and my pharmacists and techs were pretty cool, other than that, that job was pretty…meh

title: Ehhhh it aight
review: It was ok up until other managers made you do a miscellaneous tasks and had your manager get upset with you for not finishing your duties because you were stuck covering for somebody for up to two hours

title: Horrible. Management are rude and unethical
review: This place is awful to work for. Don’t inconvenience management by asking a question or worse asking for help. They think everything just takes 5 mins. You get pulled away from your area to help other departments almost every day, sometimes for the entire day… then get chewed out for your work not being done.

title: Good pay but tiring work
review: They pay quite well, on top of the COVID pay it was amazing. However whether or not your manager was terrible was luck of the draw. Also, work can get repetitive and boring really fast.

title: Si far it is the worst work environment I have ever experienced.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I met some nice co-workers who were very cool to work with. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The unprofessionalism of the company and there's no integrity nor standards.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Management has very nasty attitudes, rude and does not respect employees. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Work hard, don't talk, don't laugh, don't converse with co-workers, everyone is uptight.

title: Used to be great job, I detest MORONS
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoyed Helping others,working in new areas, and making friendsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working with Un qualified FAKE managers who harass you and make you quitWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The Stoughton store no longer feels Welcome, everyone absolutely HATES the 2nd manager..and now no one trusts anyone anymore..SAD..it used to be such a fun store filled with happy associates...What is a typical day like for you at the company?It was always busy..Working freight,working in 3different areas, and working with some good team leads and coaches

title: Cashier
review: Great part time job. Easy hours. Great discount . Fun work environment . Shifts worked with my school schedule and the managers were nice . The schedule was weekly

title: Good place to work
review: Pretty good place to work.Nothing really bad to say about it.Did multiple jobs there and enjoyed working there for a while. I won't say anything bad about them.

title: Productive and repetitive
review: It's ok to work there if you're younger and going to school. The pay is minimum wage but that's expected. And the benefits are ok. Just do your job and mind your business and you'll be ok.

title: Good hours and pay, management kills it
review: It'd be an alright place to work if the management we're direct and worked with their associates to reach their goals instead of complaining and "supervising". I've never worked somewhere where in management cared less about their associates or morale.

title: Certain managers would either like you u or not.
review: I did enjoy WALMART in the beginning it just became very difficult to work for them during the start of the pandemic, I had people trying to argue with me about wearing proper hygiene necessities like masks etc. It got really old

title: Fun workplace
review: Everything is good. Sometime customer so angry a little bit. You can go to work everyday, my supervisor very good, she have a kind heart, always take care you if you sick, take your vacation or something about your job.

title: Not a bad environment
review: The work place was very balanced and the people created a very diverse community to engage with and enjoy working, mangers and leads are useless but that’s how it is every where.

title: Productive
review: i loved working at Walmart i felt as if i was offered many opportunities. I made many friends there and as well gained a lot of knowledge from the managers and also discovered what i would like to receive my degree in.

title: Very poor management
review: As a spark driver I can tell that the pay is descent but very poor management.you can schedule to pick an order and stuck there forever waiting for it.I get deny to pick up an order by an employee for just asking her why the order was taking so long after waited more than 30mn.I come across very rude people who really need to be trained about how to deal with customers.

title: Bad
review: Bad not good work environment. They don't care about you. Feel like you are a robot there. You are underpaid and worm too muxh. Never working at Walmart again.

title: Fast Paced and Family Like Atmosphere, Management Lacks Experience
review: Over ran with managers and trainers that lack experience in promoting a team environment.  Great place to work if you're barely out of high school, a suck up, and fit in with the cool kids.

title: Nice place
review: Good place to work decent place also very nice ppl and nice pay . Also nice well that all .. but sometimes place can be hard and bad management all together .

title: Eh it’s ok wouldn’t work there again
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Not really is one I mean I liked when covid happened because I got to sit down and take peoples temps all day other than that it just kinda sucked my boss was pretty rude but had some cool coworkers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The customers even if you take off your vest people still ask you dumb questions and the breaks are pretty short because you have to walk to the break room and stuff What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s just a grocery store nothing much What is a typical day like for you at the company?A lot of dumb questions and weird side task constantly

title: Fun, Teamwork
review: Pretty easy hard work. Management was so terrible I had to leave. A manager from another department was making me not want to work there. I did have lots of fun with my coworkers and it's great to meet so many individuals.

title: Great benefits, boring job
review: The benefits of working for this company is amazing but working as a cashier is not fun and very boring. I would suggest starting anywhere else as cashiers are treated the worst and get paid the least.

title: Busy and supportive
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I am treated with respect, my co workers are kind and always willing to helpWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?It does get very busy and some customers can be cranky and difficultWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Positive and supportive, respectful and understanding What is a typical day like for you at the company?Always very busy. I am a cashier and many people would rather have a cashier than use self check out

title: A good learning experience to put towards another career
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Discount on purchases for general merchandise What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Knowing you will never succeed What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Positive Results for the companies bottom line above all else

title: Okay place to work
review: The associates are the key, since their the backbone. Get in good with the leads and coaches and youll be fine, since its a lot of clique attitude. Not the worst job Ive had, but certainly not the best.

title: Great place to work!
review: Good management and great coworkers! During the holiday season it can get a bit hectic but it is also really fun if you enjoy a fast-paced, sometimes stressful work environment.

title: Rough want you to give life
review: Walmart wants you time and nothing else the benefits are awesome. The bonus structure for management is wacky yearly based on a bunch of metrics you truly have no effect on. Customers are the absolute worst treat you so poorly and there is no support to stop that from happening. This is truly a place where you only as good as the amount of time you give.

title: Productive and fun
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay honest work good people work together as teamWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to get all work done on time not enough help What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Another of team work good hard working peoplen

title: Productive workplace
review: You stay busy from the point you get there till you leave. Management doesn’t bother you much. They have flexibility in scheduling and you can get benefits even if you’re just part-time. Most of the managers I’ve met are pretty friendly and professional

title: great place to work
review: i loved it here, great stepping stone for youth and decent hours for students. it is a good atmosphere but i wish pay was better, no complaints otherwise

title: Easy money
review: Pretty good pay and nice environment, coworkers are the best part. Management seems to care about their workers and are flexible with hours. Would recommend especially if you’re a student looking to make some pocket change.

title: Extresante
review: Los empleados regulares quieren mandarte como si fueran jefes

title: First job
review: The job wasn’t hard it was a lot of standing, enjoyed my coworkers a lot they became family.the company itself was fair and I never had any problems..

title: Unorganized, pushed beyond your limits,  unappreciated
review: Will break your back and then want more.   Does not care nor appreciate their associates.  Very unorganized.  Very nasty.  And there is always favorites that get away with everything while some get written up for anything and everything.

title: Unprofessional someone call ethics
review: Do what they want . To who they want . Play favoritism Like to place blame on othersThrows u in a position BIGGEST problem MANAGEMENT .No accountability Very unorganized Verrry unprofessional Pay little to nun

title: Steady
review: Not bad,sometimes there is a lot of work to do on a given time basis and other times its steady and consistent. Usually depends on yourself for the most part IMO.

title: No training completely clueless
review: They tell you nothing you go in for classes they don’t tell you you have to take breaks and lunch once you do start out on the floor they don’t exactly train you they throw you on the floor and it’s sink or swim all the while they are watching you every chance they get while pretending that’s not what they are doing the job put me in a constant state of anxiety due to feeling under trained despite my at the time coworkers being extremely nice and trying to help me learn what to do after awhile of not having any hours barely 22 a week 16 hours I had one week after being told the minimum would be 22-32 hours a week I couldn’t pay my bills with my paycheck after two weeks  because I didn’t have enough hours to give me the money I needed

title: Easy job, terrible management
review: It really depends on the walmart you work at. It has the potential to be a good job where you learn a lot but it’s highly dependent on management as they can be very petty and immature. Favoritism and grudge holding is a big issue.

title: productive and fun workplace
review: As a customer service representative at McDonald's, the job entails serving customers with a positive attitude, attentiveness, and efficiency. It involves managing orders, handling cash, managing the inventory, and being responsible for the cleanliness and hygiene of the restaurant. The job also involves working with a team and communicating effectively with colleagues and managers.As the face of McDonald's, excellent customer service is critical to the success of the restaurant. Providing quality service can lead to increased customer satisfaction, loyalty, and revenue. Thus, working at McDonald's in customer service helps in developing important soft skills such as communication, problem-solving, and conflict resolution.In conclusion, working at McDonald's in customer service offers a fantastic opportunity to earn money, develop skills, and build work experience. It is also a chance to work for a respected corporation that values teamwork, diversity, and inclusivity.

title: Productive
review: Great! Would recommend to research any job first. The customer service job require to be responsible with your work knowledge and respectful at all times.

title: Productive I guess
review: They make you do alot of stocking while team leads and managers do basically nothing. They don’t train you on the floor and get mad bc you don’t know what to do.

title: Management sucks
review: The management sucks they don't know if they are going or coming and nothing is ever organized. They burn their good employees out. My coworkers made the job decent

title: Good place
review: Good job, easy going. Room for advancement, great benefits, and vacation. Can you get really busy at times you really have to be able to multitask?As long as you show up and do your job to the best of your ability, you should be just fine the keyword to show up. I had a lot of Coll outs when I was in a manager.

title: Great place to work if you find the right store.
review: Some stores are hard, others are easy. But if you find the right store, stick with it because it can make or break your career. The key is to stay positive no matter what.

title: It was a nice place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people that I got to know while working there.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Disgruntled customers and some of the Supervisors.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was a nice work environment.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Usually pretty busy. When it wasn't we completed other tasks that were assigned to me.

title: Market Leadership
review: The company offers lots of opportunities and great benefits. Unfortunately, leadership can be biased depending on what market you are in. Puts a bad rap for the company because of the leadership that " runs"  it.

title: new direction change sucks
review: newer management stepping into roles has no clue what there doing just following orders from people in suits who do no tailoring to location as opposed to by the book hemorrhaging people as fast as amazon some months

title: Just started
review: So far so good. Good hourly wage. Everyone has been really helpful so far. Hopefully it is a long term steady job for me. Love they pay for advancing your education. You get Walmart + and Paramount TV free and after 90 days even more benefits.

title: Pay is good
review: Decent pay but long hours. Management can be better. Fast paced. If you haven’t been there for a long time, you’ll get treated like a black sheep.

title: Great place to work
review: I Love it here the pay and benefits when I need time off I am able to get an approval. I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

title: People, great. management? not.
review: management has no issue with speaking publicly about disciplinary actions of fellow associates in front of whoever, despite a core value of "respect for the individual" and policies in place to keep that information private. management also has no problem in turning down ideas for improvements and saying they are inefficient, then adopting those ideas as common practice with zero acknowledgement of the origins. Management also refuses to talk to people as human beings, and when called out, will gaslight you. This is all particularly true for Store 3837, a small town store, with sales goals larger than others within the market, for 2$/hr less pay for some reason. opg is expected to do x4 the work as any of the rockford store.

title: Busy environment
review: It was ok work for the pay. Hard on the body as far as your knees. Kind of easy too. Would recommend to high school students or maybe even college. Overall good experience.

title: Okay place to work with decent pay
review: Okay place to work with decent pay. management can be a pain at times, and when the store is short staffed you will get pulled to work in other areas. Great first job, or a secure one as long as you show up on time, and you are productive.

title: Major form of excrement
review: What is the best part of working at the company?One of the worst companies to ever work for us manager was hired to do a job was never give tools to do job properly was repeatedly berated for not doing job, because I don’t have the equipment to do. The job correctly was eventually fired because of their negligenceWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of proper training and communication for managers managers are not trained properly, nor they given the proper training to be able to work with other people in a large formatWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Upper management could care less, whether or not the lower management Even actually has the proper tools or equipment or manpower to be able to do their job. It’s all about how much money the store makes nor less has nothing to do about quality of Employment.

title: I left because “big brother “ ruled and not  management.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great coworkers, usually willing to helpWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with the public and cleaning after them.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very much big corporate, few real local decisions.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking, helping customers, cashier duties, other duties specific to my department

title: Fast paced environment
review: Very fun job overall but its stressful trying to keep on top of the picks when they just seem to pile on. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes. Thank me later

title: Corrupt Management, Hard to get time off
review: Management is very corrupt.  The work itself can be a lot if you aren’t the hardest worker but the management makes that problem worst. Wouldn’t recommend.

title: Overall good job.
review: Pay isn't the best, but the job isn't hard. I loved the people I worked with. Consumers don't always make your job the easiest, but welcome to retail.

title: Toxic Hate Filled Market
review: Loved walmart until I transferred to a location closer to home in a new market. Market team was ridiculously unprofessional, immature and inappropriate.

title: The work experience was great
review: The experience I had were the employees would help the customer when the need the help and I liked how we was bringing in new merchandise and we would have to unbox the stuff and put them on the shelves

title: ok platform
review: Spark used to be good . Not good anymore. Lots of lots of Tip baiting and Walmart happily allows that to happen with no consequence to fraud customers who tip bait.Less tips and cheap customers , low pay for the kind of heavy grocery we carry every day. metric system sucks .

title: Loving
review: Very nice working place. Mangers are understandable and nice. I’ve been working here for about a year and a couple of months it had changed me in many ways. i will say they are very selfish when in comes to OT

title: It was alright
review: Nothing much to write about, but pretty OKAY starting job. Gave me experience in retail, which I can’t complain about. Other than that I’d prob finding something to do that allows you shut your mind off for a bit is the best.

title: good
review: want to work here. it seems like a good job i see many people here workig and enjoying the place so i would like to work here and get to know people and balane

title: Productive and Fun Workplace
review: I love how they have great benefits and payThe managers really care about you and have excellent training  to teach you about the job I learned which is great

title: Hard work/life balance
review: Managed very poorly. Understaffed. Ridiculous expectations for overnight crew. Toxic work environment. Employee and management turn over is extremely high. The only decent thing about working here is that the pay is fair.

title: Lazy management , poor staff
review: Not enough pay for the work, teens mostly work here for their first jobs and slack off heavy for others to pick up , would not recommend working here

title: Na
review: Nope just nope. It's not the best for many reasons some reasons being that I can't drink on the job. It's so terrible and it's just not a good place to sleep

title: Good
review: The place is good. nice work environment. Pay is reasonable Feel excited to come to work and there is lots of opportunities for growth. I would highly recommend.

title: Fun work place, easy starting job
review: Fun work environment and very easy, some days a lot of work others not so much but nothing you cant handle, and usually pressure is never really brought upon you

title: Low pay
review: Pay and benefits do not make up for the grunt work and dealing with rude customers. Management is full of corruption and you can expect your work to go unappreciated.

title: Short staffed
review: They always seemed to be short staffed and always want you to go above and beyond and it makes the day stressful, your not able to get your own work done having to do others task for them.

title: Wal mart lost focus of their employees.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?As a salaried manager it pays wellWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Employees are overworked and not appreciated enough for what is asked of them. Also a high turnover.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is stressful and very demanding.What is a typical day like for you at the company?12 hours plus more work than time to complete.

title: Easy come easy go
review: The pay isn't too bad, and they hire you pretty easily. The problem lies in how badly management handles day to day operations and any problems that come up.

title: Will cut hours when they are extremely understaffed
review: Got hired and told the shift I had needed people bad just for them to only schedule me 1-2 days. Can be good if you have the right manager tho so not all bad

title: Great place!
review: Best job I ever had especially on 3rd shift. Very lenient occurrence system compared to most companies. Job is not hard at all. Climate controlled building.

title: Bias Managers
review: Managers would pick favorites and only have the same two people ever dispense. When we asked why, we were told that the other two were better at it than the rest of us. We got a two week trial at dispensing when we started at Walmart and then we never dispensed again. Pay was Ok for a college kid but I'd never work there again.

title: Location dependent.
review: I currently work for a Fulfilment center that’s newly opened and it’s alright, stable hours, ok management. A lot of walmart is location dependent on how much you get that suck factor

title: Walmart
review: It's just about what you expect. 10% of workers doing 90% of the work. Management picking favorites, staring at their computer/phone screens half the day, only helping the associates to save their own necks/get a bonus.

title: Lots of potential for promotion
review: I was with Walmart for 6 years. I started as a truck unloader and ended as a coach. I was promoted approximately every 6-8 months. Working as a manager for Walmart will open up lots of doors for other retail management  jobs. Other companies will pay more just because you worked for Walmart.

title: Pharmacy staff
review: Pharmacy staff is amazing, team work. Everyone is willing to help. They treated you as a family. Walmart management is horrible but, pharmacy area is different.

title: Terrible management
review: Horrible management do not care about employees terrible pay and lots of favoritism going on. Stay far far away from this place. Never do things correctly

title: Stressful with unrealistic expectations
review: They company itself expects you to create miracles. The stress is handed down the chain. There is a lot of favoritism. If you're too good at your job they will coach you to prevent you from promoting to another store or transferring.

title: Alright
review: Worked there about 15 yrs ago. Was pretty good for a high school student. But then again this was over 15 years ago from February of this year. That is all

title: Productive and friendly costumers
review: A typical day at work for me was watching the self check out and making sure people didn't steal from the company. The most enjoyable things about my job was talking with and getting to know the customers a little.

title: People are friendly
review: Hard to move up in the company.  Pay is ok. Will not go back to work here. They say they are family until you need help then you are on your own. Moving on to better things

title: Okay if you just need a job to get you by
review: Management was not friendly. They were definitely overworked which resulted in them not caring about their employees. Did not care about theft at all.

title: Easy Work
review: With a job like this you know what you are getting into. The work isn’t bad just mundane. Pay is good for an entry level job. There is a lot outside of your job that you will have to deal with.

title: Productive and easy
review: Good company to work for but you have little error to mess up based off the point system which made it hard. Work was ok and was able to have several people under me

title: plenty of hours
review: good hours here,decent pay, their is good and bad days like any other jobs. i enjoyed my manager's because they also chipped into help and give tips if need

title: Not bad but not great
review: This store has a high turnover of store managers due to it being a training store. The Market team is suspect. MM is fine but the others are not that good.

title: Needed a more productive environment!
review: Poor management. Great place to work when there’s adequate employees. Department Heads and employees that have seniority are very lazy. Spending way to much time lollygagging with customers and other employees to avoid being productive.

title: Management is poor.
review: Several departments have management that refuse to work and instead yell and demand of their subordinate personnel increases in productivity. The chain of command provides cover for the lack of leadership by conducting no action to correct issues in management.

title: It's a job
review: people are good to work with management wasn't bad. all in all its an ok job but can be physical. basic entry level job and entry level skills if you have a strong back you can be succesful.

title: Pay was okay but over worked
review: Worked a lot of over time and no work life balance. Pay was good but worth selling your soul to a corporation that can replace you soon as you quit. 5/10

title: worse job ever
