review: when you have an issue and report it management does nothing and even corporate doesn't do a thing. when issues happen your on your own no one stops to help you as they know they can replace you.

title: Stressful
review: Extremely stressful, no work life balance. The amount of freight coming in compare to the workload is very 3 to 1. Wages get cut often and want more all the time.

title: It's ok
review: It's ok. Could be worse. Extremely busy after school pick up hrs but pretty chill first thing in the morning. Definitely a way to get your steps in. .

title: It is a good company
review: A lot a work that need to be done but as a good worker I proceed the work no problem we thrive to go beyond. I know how to do a lot since I worked there

title: stocker
review: unload the truck, put different product into different pallets, almost of the end of the shift take pallets with products to the outside, it can be fun.

title: Fun experience
review: Fun experience, great employees to work with. Not a hard job and they work with my schedule as a student. Customers can sometimes be hard to deal with, but enjoy my work.

title: Terrible place tonwork
review: Management is what makes this place a terrible place to work! There is no communication, no organization, no plan of action. Management will give you unrealistic expectations for the day. All coaches think everything can be done is 5 minutes! Understaffed and underpaid! You would be better off going to work for a place like Publix or Target! Stay away from Walmart! Everyone I know that works at the Walmart I work at is looking for another job!

title: Draining place
review: Work here if you're ok with being taken advantage of and running multiple departments for little pay. I always had to cover other departments and when I asked for a raise, it was a joke. I would look elsewhere.

title: A warm family and a place to advance your career
review: lot of autonomy at work lot of training opportunity career advancement opportunity upright corporate cultureput customer as number one priority strive for excellencemanager lead by example  happy peer relationship
position: VP Merchandising, Pricing, Planning; VP marketing & eCommerce

title: Productive and understanding place to work with others
review: The fast speed job on a get it done right the first time basis from learning how to use the scanner to the forklift driving but also doing things the correct way

title: Horrible
review: Horrible management. No compassion, no true teamwork, no consideration, rude, poor training. “Everyone is replaceable” attitude. I was overqualified for everything in that store and I was moved 3 times.

title: Greensboro -high point road
review: Always understaffed and told “do the best you can” but criticized for the time it took. So much drama and employees fights. No room for growth was literally told not to bother applying for a different position. Management relaxed and doesn’t enforce active work day for employees. Always pulled from position to stock shelves.

title: flexible but needs better pay
review: it was alright to work here but it needed better pay. The customers were generally all rude and some of the smelled bad asf. Don’t recommend it for full time job

title: Worst job ever, it's a good starting job
review: I don't recommend working at Walmart yes the benefits are somewhat good but they care only.for there bonuses that we don't get anymore Walmart doesn't care about.the person anymore it's just money. The more they make they are happier once they receive a one star, they want you to get five stars for them. If you're sick, doctors notes don't excuse you if you dieing you will still get a point. They don't care about you. Your expendable as they see it.

title: Good company to work for.
review: Set schedule and flexible hours. There are also opportunities to grow with the company. Good first job. Customers can be difficult at times but its retail and that can be expected.

title: Management is very unprofessional and expect to get yelled at by customers daily
review: management has always been unprofessional at Walmart. Most of the job duties for the team lead fell on top of the regular associates in the bakery and upper management has failed multiple times to fix this issue. most of the time other associates get away with not completing most of their job duties and requirements before leaving, but if you are the night person working in the bakery expect for their job to become yours on top of all of the other responsibilities you have every night. Work is unevenly distributed and favoritism is played very strategically at this location. Don’t forget the customers who try to teach you how to do your job on a daily basis. Most of the time they’ll try to get something for free and argue with you. Meanwhile the customer is always right, because that’s how management will always treat any situation and be quick to write someone up.

title: Okay
review: It's an okay place to work with little to no interaction with management as long as you meet your goals. The job is physically draining but the pay is good

title: Meh
review: The company itself seems to have good intentions, but that isn’t reflected in the employees. After just a few weeks you can tell when someone has worked at Walmart (in management, specifically) at any other job you go to. Many things need to get done but they would rather stick people in places where help isn’t as needed. If you’re desperate, go for it. Otherwise you might be better off searching for something else.

title: Fun workplace, pto, great coworkers
review: Great benefits, work life balance, stressful at times, shorthanded but that's any job.  Had a lot of fun!  Managers and leads were awesome, actually cared about their employees.

title: Favoritism
review: Management always favoring people they like. You will not get a chance to grow if you are not in their list. You will get low hours and loaded with jobs like pushing carts.

title: It’s okay and decent pay.
review: Over all the pay is decent, opportunity to move up is there. Favoritism among managers is a definite at my current location. Once you get good at the job they expect more from you and less from slackers. All stores are different but it’s a job none the less

title: Not a horrible first job to have, decent pay.
review: The work was very simple, and co-workers were extremely nice and helpful. The only issue I had with the job was the rude managers and customers constantly messing with the merchandise making my job more stressful than it already was.

title: Semi productive and semi professional experience
review: The women I worked around were usually helpful and sweet and all in all fun to work with that I think everyone's professionalism could've used Improvement the whole time myself included at that point in my life

title: Strict and no faith
review: No faith I. Their stickers and push you to the point of breaking 24/7. Constantly nag back and forth at you and expect this massive amount of work to be done in 2-3 hours lol

title: This is the place!!!!! To work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It is a place in which I can be myself I can give ideas I get a lot of feedback it pays good and is close to me What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers knows that Walmart is a great company putting  customer first and there is a few of them that gets advantage (returning unreturnable items, returning less than half of merchandise etc) and they send letter or bad reviews to the companyWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Really good, I have a nice people working with me and they understand my personal needs and I know what company expects from me and I give all my effort to accomplish What is a typical day like for you at the company?I always try to make customers their best experience at Walmart it doesn’t matter if is the same customers I treat them with respect and try to do their shopping fast and easy

title: Productive, easy work
review: Very easy to understand quick process, shifts are always available, sometimes things can get behind with timing but overall it’s easy work. Sometimes management could be better with organization.

title: Decent pay
review: The pay was decent and the job was a lot of walking and lifting. Got to listen to headphones. Management was lack luster leaving job openings open and not always quick to respond

title: Its alright
review: Not a bad place to work, especially if it's your first job coworkers are nice and helpful. The only problem I had  sometimes was that they asked you for too much but not a bad place

title: Walmart
review: Walmart Is a completely worthless company to work for unless you can just be dead inside and do your job or deal with the mass amount of lazy people. Or not having enough people to even finish the tasks at hand mainly in frozen and the diary department. Lack of pay ,lack of employee's, Walmart is full of people who can't read or use what little tools they give you to do your job. And once they fire someone in your department they don't hire anymore people so you'll more than likely have to do more than what you were previously given.

title: Awful
review: If hired here I would not recommend staying more than you need to. Management is a joke. They don’t properly train in anyway and will not hesitate to leave you high and dry at a moment’s notice. Would not recommend for anyone. You can find better.

title: Low pay and Rough Work
review: Typical work as a cashier but dealing with rude customers and extremely tough management and borderline unrealistic expectations made the job painful and unbearable to manage

title: Good place to work
review: I think everything is good . Good place, good food but bathroom is not perfect.Sometime, I checked receipts of customers, I got they did not want I did it .

title: Ok for a college student
review: While the work is alright, working second shift tends to mean there are high schoolers that don't take it seriously at all often times meaning you're picking up the slack for them.

title: productive and decent place to work
review: it's a cashier job. you do the same tasks everyday and it's fine for a part time job. you can build people skills. there's not much more to the job than that.

title: Just bad....so bad
review: If you want a paycheck this place is fine for that. The second you start wanting more you have to kiss management's feet in order to get anywhere there.  Alot of team leads there let the wee power they have get to their heads. Depending on the location. I.e saint clair/ they care more about their own bonus. Cut people's hours alot.  Management has no real connection to anyone. Pick and choose who they allow to break rules or not. I.e call offs some people had like 9 points before they were fired because they liked them.

title: Not good
review: Not good pay rude customer, no days off ,  no paid holidays , managers not helpful , and rude schedules are bad not consistent, benefits are not good as well

title: Always short staffed
review: The people are good to work with but always short staffed .  Too much is put on Team Leads without teams to lead.   Nothing you do is ever good enough.

title: Challenging area to work in
review: Region 75 and Market 288 are very high volume stores that require constant inventory management corrections. Do-able if you have time. This job would not be challenging if not for the customer base in the area and the hiring pool you have to fill your teams with. You will find very quickly that the job itself is manageable but the people are not

title: Hardworking and friendly people
review: I worked here for about 8 years and things were not always the best but there always seem to be a good culture with most of the employees, and it seemed as if the company cared for you as well.

title: A job for teenagers or somebody that needs a job really bad
review: It has good people there the staff work hard as possible. The managers need to be more charismatic in the customer service is no help really I worked at Money center at the beginning of month is very busy towards the end of month is very busy

title: NO work life balance
review: not a good idea for a first job, or a job while your in school. They dint care for their employees, just the business. Best thing was the hour lunch where i would try to squeeze in some errands for the day. of course there were favorites.

title: Extremely busy
review: Working at Walmart felt like thought I came in everyday and do my job when others slack I always was fussed at because of their lack of drive, management is constantly holding meetings berating you bc the team was unable to work 13 trucks in one night and management refused to help the associates on those busy nights but want to be hold meetings complaining about what’s not getting done

title: Untrained and unqualified management
review: I believe the company is a good place to work but it's always understaffed and because of that training is inadequate or non-existent resulting in a management team that is unable to lead effectively or resolve problems favorable. Burn out is not optional it's inevitable.

title: Great work place to grow and learn
review: No complaints about the store I worked at. I would go back and work at this place for sure. Managers and associates are unbelievable ppl to work with there

title: A joke
review: There is absolutely no job security. If you like being constantly lied too. Stressed out and generally not wanting to go to work. Walmart Montrose is for you.It's not the associates that are the issue.  It's the management team and the store manager in particular.  It was a really good store at one point but the current management team has made it toxic.

title: Disrespectful unachievable non honest management with God complex company that is uncaring about lower employees!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The only good part would be the customer interactions that go right and the money.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything because if you do all that is asked your still overlooked or not chosen for promotional advances due to gender or lack of popularity.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Confusing instructions given due to management not working together you will have to prefore duties in different way according to what manager is working or you will get scholded.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Start shift with more work then hours available and if you do finish work will only be rewarded by having to help others whom are purposely not achieving there standard because they know that nothing will be done about it.

title: productive
review: it’s okay i previously just started working there, sometimes they set standards for stuff that just isn’t doable and make you feel like you did something wrong.

title: No work life balance
review: As a overnight stocker they put one person in an area with multiple pallets full of stuff and they expect you to finish it all alone by a certain time or you get a write up . nobody trained me they just expected me to know everything on my first day and i got a write up for not finishing on time even though it was my first night and i wasn’t properly trained

title: Okay workplace
review: Management only cared about profits. Multiple complaints were filed against my previous manager yet nothing was done about them. Other than that not a bad job.

title: Blessing
review: Deli work at walmart is whT u make of it , if you are a go getter you will thrive, if you are lazy you will not enjoy this job at all, time management is key, have to work as a team to be successful, but walmart dosent believ in hiring help they mKe u swim n deep end and wait for the winners to surface and ones who can swim are bound the driz ound!!!  8 out of 10 rating

title: Good pay bad management
review: Hired too many people, not enough hours right now. Won’t let anyone work 40 hours. Can make more the harder you work. Schedule is nice 3/4 days off, that’s about it

title: Hard work
review: Physically hard work. Good job if your young and fit until you can find something else. Coworkers made the work place fun and time go by. Worse part of the job was not knowing when you’d get off.

title: I would not wish it on my best friend to work there!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working at Walmart is that you get to see a lot of people and that’s what makes the world go aroundWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working at Walmart all your managers do completely the opposite of what you ever imagine they would do. They will do anything to get you irritated and then you can just quit. They will do anything in their own good not thinking about others and especially the store managers, the store managers Are narcissistic to the max What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment at the Pagosa Springs is so uptight when you walk through the door, you can feel it.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Negative customers few happy ones. Majority of people are very unhappy there the big corporation is not like it used to be 20 years ago. Things in the Walmart world have changed. This could be good and bad.

title: Productive fast paced
review: Very tiring job but can be rewarding if you work constantly..Long hours short breaks..The facility is very huge and you barely have enough time to eat lunch

title: just over all a lot sometimes
review: What is the best part of working at the company?benefits are the best thing about working there What is the most stressful part about working at the company?managers and HR are the most stressful part What is the work environment and culture like at the company?environment really depends on the day but most days there is a lot of favoritism and drama. What is a typical day like for you at the company?slow 10 hours that is for sure

title: Good pay terrible management
review: If you’re looking for a good pay job with terrible managment and terrible workers this is the place for you! Corydon Walmart is terrible do not apply!

title: poor management
review: Management is horrible and very disorganized. They expect so much out of you when they dont do the same. Poor training , you have to learn on your own.

title: Productive and Busy
review: The training was minimal and possibly had a high turnover rate. I shadowed someone for a bit and then was on my own, only to be told later that I was doing things wrong, guess they should train longer on their inventory scanning in the back room.

title: Love working for Walmart
review: Pay is awesome and the work is kinda laid back.  The hardest part is getting your foot in the door.  They are very selective and you can be denied for the least little thing.  Once you are hired and working you are the master of your own paycheck.  You can make over 2K a week most weeks if you use your time wisely.  If you wanna take it easy you can still make 1500.

title: Humdrum
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Soon to retire. The company has changed so much since I first started there. The managers have no people skills.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Too many bosses not enough workersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is low moral. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful for no reason. It's not the shoppers it's the managers

title: Physical job
review: Hard physical job but decent pay and benefits. Most of management was easy to get along with, but like any other large company there were a few bad apples that you learned to avoid. Overall good experience but definitely a job for a younger person.

title: I worked as a Cart Pusher from 2006 until 2010
review: I worked at Walmart for over three years as a Cart Pusher and as I progressed I have hoped to move up in the company.  It never happened, I have heard stories about how Cart Attendants are treated and it seems they are treated like lemmings and that they are pitted against those who work inside the store.  I will admit to my mistakes but in the long run, it seems they did not care about the Cart Attendants and are willing to let them burn out and replace them with fresh meat...as they would do to me.  If you are looking to build a carrer and find yourself a cart pusher at Walmart, look elsewhere to build your skills.  Walmart will leave high and dry if your pushing carts.

title: Great place to work if you like keeping busy.
review: As a personal shopper(picker) at Walmart, there are thousands of items to be picked every day for online shoppers, so it's impossible to not be kept busy most shifts. It can be exausting and repetitive, but it's not as boring as standing around for hours with nothing to do.

title: Not terrible if you don't have children
review: Lower level positions provide work-life balance if you get first shift but not much opportunity to move up unless you just don't care to see your family.

title: Decent place management shows favoritism and lack of understanding
review: It's not a bad place to work by any means but the management needs to be more cooperative and understanding. They expect the most and get on to you for anything.

title: Easy but tedious
review: I would honestly say if you're gonna work at Walmart, it should be OGP. With the exception of deli and bakery roles, you get paid the most and are also less likely to be pestered by customers compared to stocking associates. It's easy work, but your productivity is tracked so you can't slack. If you're in the delivering the staged orders, you're in the best spot

title: Decent pay and horrid management teams
review: Depending on which walmart you work at the management team might change. When I was last employed at Wal-Mart the management team would ream you for not being done before home office shows up and give you 10 minutes notice. Aside from management the pay is nice and keeps you steady hours

title: There are better jobs out there
review: Walmart = robots.I got hired by a robot, my assessment is done by robots, the self checkout is managed by robots. You clock in with a robot, you clock out with a robot. PTO is directed with a robot. Good luck talking to management about a PTO mishap or a family emergency because the robot takes precedence.

title: Stressful.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The only good was the pay, work load for associates, especially leads are next to impossible to get done.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The many tasks to get done in short time frame and never positive criticism from coachesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Customer service is none existent and stressful with trying to get done for the day

title: Advancement issues.
review: I personally have been looking to advance but nothing is happening. Pay is decent and benefits are pretty good. A lot of coworkers have attacked my faith which is a heavy negative

title: Suck
review: It’s alright just not for long term and it’s hard to get fired if you get fired than something wrong because they don’t care about points but the management can be messy

title: Poorly managed
review: Management falls short. Back room is always over stocked, but they will continue to cut hours and expect employees to work the job of two people. would not reccomend.

title: Inside or out. This one or that. All the same.
review: I worked CAP2, unloading trucks, the job is a bit more fast paced. But each "team/department" Lead has its favorites and they aren't super welcoming. Third shift makes any other shift job harder, they never finish their tasks/assignments, 1st and 2nd shift will always get blamed for 3rd shifts mistakes. 3rd never got reprimanded. Managers frequent unprofessional, personal relationships with employees under their authority. If you need management or help you can never find them throughout the store. But the pay is ok.

title: good place
review: it’s a pretty nice job that pays well and time goes by relatively quick if you actually work instead of messing around overall 7.5/10 you just gotta bear management/coworkers

title: Unorganized
review: Schedule Always Changing, Barely enough time to take a break during busy season, throw you on registers without proper training, Management never available when you need them

title: okay
review: okay for the time being but on to bigger and better things..pretty much what you would think of when it comes to being a cashier no more no less . peace and love

title: fun
review: Good place to get you goin. Fun and entertaining atmosphere to work in day in and day out. not the very best insurance, and plenty of time to be taken

title: Not for me!!!
review: Overworked if you are a good employee, they will work the few great workers to death if they can. The terrible workers get praised on doing a bad job.

title: Pretty good place
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Money,benefits ,pple,the hard I workedWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Making sure yr job was done rightWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Good,air conditioning, pple y worked wWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Enjoyed worked w pple,the hrs and days you worked

title: Fun workplace
review: I loved the people I worked with and its a good job with decent pay. All the managerd are very nice and there's always something entertaining that happens at Walmart

title: Fun workplace, great management
review: Amazing management, a lot of the managers are super nice and caring! Also a very fun work place environment! The people who work here are often very nice but most can be stuck up.

title: I worked for a year & I was cashier.
review: I worked for Walmart for a lil over a year & it wasn’t a bad place to start off at it’s not a bad place to work I liked it im a people person I love the energy the people bring like to meet different people.

title: Terrible place to work
review: I left after three months. The pay was low, we were short staffed. High turnover. Walmart already has a bad reputation for how they treat their employees . Don’t waste your time.

title: Dealing with too much stuff for lousy pay
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Decent insurance flexible hours and a discount What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Bad management bad customers and bad equipment What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Anything to make management look good for more management people What is a typical day like for you at the company?Mostly busy helping customers find items and helping manager look good

title: used to be great
review: Every year became do more with less. It used to pay out overtime to ensure the shelves are full, now it doesn't care if they are empty. Facing took priority over stocking.

title: Pay is good, people are not
review: The pay and hours are good, but the people in management are horrible. They don’t care about the coworkers working under them. Their point system is ridiculous they don’t care if something comes up in your personal life or if your sick if you don’t come in (even with a doctors note) you get a point if you get 5 points you get fired.  They speak to you however the they want or feel like if they are inconvenienced even a little they get rude and nasty. They treat you disrespectfully and don’t care about whoever works under them. The coworkers you work with are great people but management really needs to be replaced.

title: it's was a challenge.
review: I worked here for six months, nothing but trouble this place is a mess everything was unprofessional and unorganized. I don't recommend this job to anyone but if you do work at the one in Walmart good luck. wish the best to you.

title: Fun workplace
review: Great place to start and work it was ver clean and respectful. Management very understanding and supportive. Best place to work for as long as you want.

title: Managers sucked
review: The managers and team leads and coaches are very weird towards people, talk funny to you, and make you feel some type of way when they feel something and then they try to control you

title: Easy pay is good
review: Job pays well for how easy the job is. Managers friendly. Gets stressful during holiday. Managers where easy to get along with and product is ready for you to start stocking

title: It’s good job if you don’t mind being micromanaged
review: The job itself is not hard and actually has some decent benefits. what makes people quit most of the time is management. They micromanage, play favorites and treat you like a kid in kindergarten. If you go in and don’t make too many friends then you might be able to avoid the drama that goes on. Most of the team leads are super nice but also very stressed out because the coaches are rude and don’t know how to professionally talk to people or how to give people a break when they obviously need it. You also used to be able to have a set schedule with the same days off each week which could be  one weekend day and one weekday but now they’ve changed it to a 4week rotation where you get one weekend off a month and you work all the others and you may even end up working 10 days in a row if your coach doesn’t care about you.

title: Great Workplace
review: I've worked for 8 years, and while there are highs and lows, I truly enjoy working here. Manager is great, willing to help you advance your career. Great pay, too. Work hard, show interest, and you'll go far!

title: Poor management
review: They don’t notice the workers that go above and beyond. They allow too many employees to slack off and wear whatever they want. They are always understaffed and never seem to treat the customers with any respect. Yet they expect the hourly employees to be polite. They never keep enough registers open and so customers get angry at associates thinking we are all trained to be cashiers! Not every associate can unlock merchandise and again the customers don’t know this so they give us a poor rating. No room for advancement yet pay differential for graveyard shift only. Managers walk around with their chests out and treat hourly employees like slaves. It’s a job. It pays but this is my honest opinion. If you apply here. Get ready to work hard and not be noticed.

title: Good if pay matters more then your mental health
review: Decent pay but you're constantly being over worked and under appreciated. Upper management only cares about metric and continue to raise the the expectations and work load regardless of staffing and abilities.

title: Fun Work, Very Kind Mangers/Teamleads
review: Been working at walmart for 4 yrs I would recommend working at walmart if you have confidence in yourself, the most enjoyable part of job would have to jewlerly department and helping customers

title: Good place but has it moments
review: Easy place to work just dealing with customers and thrives also day. Hours can change from time to time but make sure you put what hours you are avaible for

title: Work
review: Good for early work experience . Helps fill resume . Would recommend trying as a first job . Stayed there for 6months . Until I had to go back to school.

title: Blind leaders but solid team
review: Would be better if leadership was cut down by half at least and they promoted the good employees. It's a job but don't expect to like much of it, and you can expect to be ignored by management.

title: Good environment
review: Good customers not good management. Write u up over anything. Its all about favoritism and favorites. Hard part about the job is working if your not the favorite

title: Company is nice, this store isn’t
review: Walmart is a good company to work for in my opinion, free education (certain subjects/schools), and they have pretty good benefits. This store in particular isn’t great though, the up front section of the store is in chaos with poor management and even less stable team leads. Be prepared to do the team leads job with out the $19/hr pay if you’re gonna be at the service desk, the people are nice but the stress isn’t worth it.

title: alright
review: okay job overworked decent pay management is chill toxic manager hard time dealing with customers good workers flexible strict point system fun hdjridorrkord

title: No good workplace
review: Poor management.. very toxic . No overtime . It’s just to much sometimes . The pay isn’t great . In general it is just a lot of gossip & no room for growth .

title: It’s Walmart.
review: No need to go into depth about how unprofessional this location is. It is absolutely terrible how management is with their scheduling, training and sense of direction with their operations. Not only do other co-associates agree, but a few managers as well. 0 stars. Look elsewhere for employment.
location: 5734 S Orange Blossom Trl, Orlando, FL 32839

title: Fun work environment
review: Great work environment with great people! They would schedule me full time but not provide me full time bonuses and other incentives but overall very relaxed job if you’re not behind!

title: not fun to work at for more than 3 months
review: This job is an okay starting job but I wouldn't recommend getting stuck doing it. It gets really boring really fast. Half the managers won't know how to do the jobs of their employees. Customers can have massive egos that makes them blind to their own idiocy

title: Not fun
review: If you voice your opinions but still work hard , don't come in for extremely last minute shifts because it's your legit day off or you get the wrong manager with a chip on their shoulder angry at you , well…. BEST ADVICE ANYONE CAN GIVE YOU IS , DO NOT APPLY OR WASTE YOUR TIME WALMART IS A HORRIBLE COMPANY

title: It’s a job
review: Not an inclusive company unless you are part of one of the many cliques you are an outsider. There is a lack of integrity and a lax ethical standard from management down leading to new hires losing enthusiasm and high turn over.

title: Boring and Stressful
review: Bad managers. 8 hours feel like eternity  Working as a personal shopper. The team lead Rey is the worst. Managers don't care about you. They say flexible schedule but when you can't do a shift they ask why.

title: Its ok
review: The pay and job is good. Coworker situation can get a little weird just stay out of all the little kid hs drama and focus on your work, you’ll be good

title: Is okay.
review: Working at Walmart can be a mixed experience. On one hand, the company offers competitive pay, benefits, and opportunities for career advancement. Additionally, the company provides training and development programs to help employees gain new skills and knowledge. On the other hand I have a  feeling of being overworked and underappreciated, with limited employee benefits and poor working conditions. I also criticize them for their labor practices, including low wages and inconsistent scheduling. Overall, Walmart is an okay place to work, with benefits and opportunities available to those who are willing to put in the effort. However, it may not be the ideal place to work for everyone.

title: Bad
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Never thought I’d say that but it was good and has gone down hill ever since. Sad Sam Walton’s company is going down the tubesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Senior management can’t make decisions What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very stressful and family doesn’t come first like they say it money first

title: Great options for advancement but no set schedule
review: I was able to easily promote, but all hourly and salary managers have a 4 week rotation of days off and hours. It’s hard to find time to see friends and family consistently.

title: Job
review: It’s a job. Slow and boring a lot of days. Never see management. Not enough workers so you end up doing multiple jobs. Pay wasn’t that great not a lot of hours

title: Great
review: Freakn love this place thought of getting my life together ,but this is it for me The shights smells people culture, it just inriches a common pleab like i

title: Efficient, friendly, and clean
review: Best Walmart store to work for. Associates are friendly, store is clean. SM runs a tight ship which makes it a good store. People are always willing to help other associates. Coaches are knowledgeable and easy to talk to.

title: Productive workplace
review: super fun great management i reallly enjoy my time that i have spent there the store is super clean and my coworkers are very friendly and also professional

title: Overall, it is a good workplace.
review: The Good--The people you meet and work with; I have formed close bonds and friendships with many.  Helping Customers find what they are looking for and being able to make other suggestions if we are out of a certain product they wanted.The bad--having to take an entire hour for lunch break.  I would much rather leave 1/2 hour earlier than stay longer for an enhanced lunch hour.
location: Newark, NY; Wimauma, FL; Gibsonton, FL

title: Bad environment
review: It’s Walmart, what else can I say. truly it wasn’t fun working here and I wouldn’t recommend it to others.management was cruel and in general there were few opportunities for growth.

title: Glad I’m not there.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?When you’re sick they take care of you. But they ride you while you’re there.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The badgering and riding you to move faster. There pushing of there political agenda.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very political. You hear the word gender every day. You hear about inclusion and diversity every single day. But you not included if you’re a white conservative male.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful fast paced. Favoritism everywhere.

title: Fast shift. Overworked.
review: Management was a problem. No benefit in going above and beyond but god forbid you have an off night. Good workers were written up for having an off night. Caused a lot of our better employees to quit.

title: All about your coworkers
review: It’s really the coworkers that make the place better. Has its good and bad days. A good starting job for any teens who want their first job and it’s a pretty easy job

title: Great place to work with supportive supervisors.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Flexibility Of schedule. You have the opportunity to propose your own schedule plans with regards to your availability to work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working hard for less amount of money. It would have been a great place to work if the minimum wage was a little more.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I love the variety of race. There are so many different races with varying levels of culture that it makes you feel a sense of belonging there.What is a typical day like for you at the company?When you clock in, you go to your department and start working, normally as a team, then take a 15 minutes break after 2 hours. Then take your 1 hour lunch after the next 2 hours, go back to work, then take another 15 minutes break the next 2 hours again, then go and work till you close and clock out. You have the liberty to clock in and out on your cell phone.

title: Ok
review: It was ok at the time but it needed some changes. Changes in relation to the upper management and their communication skills since it was incredibly lacking.

title: One of the worst managed companies I have ever worked for it’s a company that leaves  to much revenue on the table
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I really can’t find anything good except it’s a pay source for the time being What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Horrible management that favors non productive associates What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic at best there is zero culture from the old man Mr Sam What is a typical day like for you at the company?You never know what you are walking into and the tension is so thick it can be cut with a knife

title: This job I will give it a 4 out of 10
review: What is the best part of working at the company?My best is working with co workersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?It is so stressful because we are having a lot of problems What is the work environment and culture like at the company?My environment work is serving the customer What is a typical day like for you at the company?My typical day is going home and enjoying the rest of the day

title: Too much work, little pay
review: I was a regular team associate, and I had to unload trucks with pallets that were usually damaged and about to fall, is a good job to start with, but if you can get out of there as soon as possible.

title: It is generally a completely frustrating experience.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The associates who worked for me on my team. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Corporate walmart is completely disconnected from store level.  There are completely unrealistic expectations. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Poor.  The work life balance is absolutely horrible for management at store level.  Corporate is completely hypocritical in the way it treats store level management.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Not enough staff to work all the processes correctly.  Working in other areas to help them out.  Putting out fires all day.

title: Great Environment and Staff, but It's Hard Labor for Basic Wages & No Health Insurance
review: I loved the company, loved the people I worked with and my managers, we were like a family and I would never take those days back, but the way upper management and corporate pushes you to kill yourself just to earn your pay, it's ridiculous. I still have some lingering health problems when I used to work there. Not to mention, no health insurance to help with the health problems. So no, I don't think it was worth it in the end. If you do, just be careful. Also, get good orthotics.

title: To much employee drama
review: Nice place to work if you enjoy power tripping supervisors, teen girl drama, and working with immature highschoolers or so they seem like it. Would not recommend.

title: The best way I could figure out how to keep it fresh was by making it a game like who was the fastest like a race
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The worker's were really nice  overnight stocker most shoppers really nice What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Learning where merchandise belongs   and expectations of the company What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Verry versittal of different types of people who you can learn from best training What is a typical day like for you at the company?Staying busy so the day goes fast

title: time
review: it’s a lot lol. it’s really toxic but it can be great. i don’t recommend it though. management is especially terrible. the customers are even worse. they don’t care, run.

title: Good benefits, decent pay. Management is Lacking in Qualified People.
review: Too many chiefs, not enough indians. Seems that every manager has a different way for your job to be done. Communication between managers seems to be non-existent. Aside from that, it is not a bad place to work.

title: Definitely a huge family, you have a second home
review: What is the best part of working at the company?My coworkers were my favorite part of my employment I miss it, my job was pretty simple and you could have a pretty enjoyable time with customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful aspect was probably the amount of points you had before termination. It didn’t really give you a lot to work with but you could gain time the longer you worked there What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very hands on and you met people from all walks of life, even being in such a small town I met people from New York, Canada, Florida, and New Jersey What is a typical day like for you at the company?It would really just depend on your job but most days you would have a lot of customer interactions and that was some of the best parts

title: Low pay high expectations
review: Working at Walmart you’ll get hounded by lazy upper management and pay is just not enough for what you have to deal with working there. Definitely don’t recommend

title: It's a great starter for learning retail...
review: Managers like to pick and choose favorites and who gets to promote.No appreciation for what anyone does, unless you're a favorite. Fast paced work, somewhat fair scheduling.

title: its a good job.
review: good pay. managers play favorites whoch can be annoying, but the job is typically fine. can be very stressful sometimes and coaches that think they know everything refuse to listen to associates who have been here for years, which makes the job more difficult

title: eh
review: it's okay just good starting job would recommend to younger people tho standing all day sucks but this job probably be obsolete soon with new technology

title: Great coworkers, not great customers
review: The job is very straightforward and there's nothing too complicated about it. So long as you keep your numbers up and are nice to the customers your job should be relatively easy for the pay.

title: It's a place
review: Things and stuff. Stuff and things. People suck. Too many people want something for nothing and will gripe and moan for special treatment that the higher ups will give just to save face.

title: Stocking shelves
review: The pay was fantastic for my first job. The managers were unreal friendly and the best managers ive had since working for other managers. The location was good. And the benefits were decent! 10/10 would work there.

title: Check people out
review: Bad place to work and they treat you bad way under pay , full time is hard to get there and u will work every holiday and they don't care about you like they should

title: seasonal
review: worked seasonal and was offered fulltime job, job was decent cashier job had company holiday parties. Worked overtime due to no coverage. Would recommend as second job.

title: Tedious Work
review: Easy to work with little customer interaction but gets tedious very quickly. Expect to stock the whole time with some things being pretty heavy such as canned food or drinks. It is hard on knees and back.

title: It was ok
review: I enjoyed working with my team. However, management could have been better. I often wonder how those who lack proper interpersonal or managerial skills become managers.

title: not a good career
review: I felt as though a lot of people I worked with were bitter and clickish. Made working there uncomfortable. Standing all day is also hard on the back and feet.

title: Family atmosphere
review: Grateful to work here. Plenty of exercise. No need to join a fitness gym. Fast pace environment with occasional heavy lifting. Walmart has good safety reputation.

title: Productive
review: I learned alot from this company made me want to learn more from other departments inside Walmart I thought I could be a better associate with Walmart from other departments

title: Not the best place to work
review: Walmart is a horrible company!. Management is horrible and it’s worse with store managers! WM does not care about their employees or customers at all.

title: Inconvenience
review: Promises to be moved up a higher position were never fulfilled. HR would never acknowledge issues. Managers would often give write ups if you had a family emergency or personal issues.

title: Simple workplace
review: Serves as a decent introductory job for customer service. Whilst the work itself is incredibly easy, the management can be dodgy at times. Job mainly consists of hosting self checkout, working registers, and doing returns.

title: Productive and fun
review: Good place to start your career at. Offer help with school and flexible with schedule. It is also easy to move up in the company if that is what you want.

title: You can do better than Walmart
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Helping customers, getting first look at new products What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Bosses inability to understand family emergency,  and inability to communicate wants or desires What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Coworkers where great, bosses were too good for us working classWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Depends on department,  season, time of day, many variables with this question

title: Customer  service
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good.i was almost there for 18 years dedicated  associate to my job and was terminated for sick days unfair.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Long lines and no help,1 register open and the rest self checkout unfair.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Good.your pretty much on your own..What is a typical day like for you at the company?Taking care of the customer and providing  good customer  service.

title: Not a good work environment
review: To be completely honest, it’s like high school all over again. Everybody gossips about everybody and makes up rumors about you. Management expects you to be a robot & get everything done within an hour. My overall experience at Walmart for the couple years I was there was just not good. The fellow employees are terribly rude and bitter. Managers are just as bad. Highly don’t recommend.

title: Productive and Encouraging
review: Communication is great, the feeling of completing the objectives feel rewarding. Definitely would recommend for anyone starting their path into retail.

title: Unfair pay for tenured associates
review: Pay is not enough for what is expected. Tenured employees make the same as a new hire.  Some of the coworkers were great and made some great friends.

title: Productive and fun workplace
review: Good work environment and coworkers were friendly. Management was professional, helpful, and understanding. Great benefits. My overall experience was great.

title: I love the job but the associates made me so uncomfortable
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The job I had was o.k it's just the workers there messyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with adults who act like high school kids overall the job is easy and the customers I love them they made my day What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It would rain in are store we have more blacks then any race and they are so rude had lil clicks I didn't not feel safe while working thereWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Very stressful associates was mean to me I was being bullied I would tell a lead or coach nothing would be done about it

title: Favoritism
review: The nice place to work but in the long run you doing other people's work you're not recognized for who you are and there's a lot of favoritism workloads doubles when there's no one to help

title: It’s Walmart.
review: I’m sure you can imagine. The Managers are horrible.if you are wanting to  get a schedule change that is is non-existent. Point system is trash etc. no

title: Terrible
review: People are rude no matter what you do and management sucks.  They will cut your hours to where you will have to quit.  No way to live with the pay they give you

title: fire you once u get paid a lot
review: poor management makes you do the same thing every day and expect the same people to do the bad jobs. lie about not firing you then kick you to the cutb

title: Management can be better
review: There have been times when I asked for time off but was called back in because of lack of others in scheduling. I felt that was the failure of management to schedule others in.

title: Productive Fun Work Place
review: Very fun places to work at that is fast paced and full of surprises from the different kinds of customers you meet every day. Would definitely consider working here again.

title: Great work place
review: Great work place, fun, good pay, good benefits, good hours, good management, fast pace, always in the go, always things to do, over time, pay rises yearly.

title: Store #2294
review: Wasn’t that bad as people make it out to be. As long as you do your work and keep your head down. There were some good managers and some bad. The place can be pretty busy in general.

title: Easy work poor management
review: Easy work, management will put everything on you. Let other people slack off while you do most if not all of the work load. No team work. Management will not hold people accountable or tell them to do their job. Some employees come in drunk

title: Not recommended for the faint of heart
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benifits and some of the people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything you need to do and know What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not really good work environment and low morale What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressed out and have a long commute

title: Fun exciting place reaps benefits
review: It was a good work environment, would recommend new associates to consider this position and assisting every day shoppers. Learned how to interact with customers. Hardest part was dealing with customers that were angry but helping them resolve their problems is rewarding everyday. Supportive managers.

title: Okay
review: It was okay working here if your just trynna get a okay job and money with a okay schedule defeiniety depends on your managers and location I are at i

title: Fine
review: Okay to start off with. Keep applying elsewhere. Management needs improvement and stressful because of the clientele. Workplace culture is toxic and overwhelming.

title: Draining
review: They want more work done with less people and not enough pay. They don't really have good benefits. They have a lot of favoritism. Management is the worst part.

title: Trash
review: Don’t even bother applying here. They’ll screw you over in every way possible and make it seem like it was your fault. The environment is toxic and they play favorites.

title: In one sentence? It sucked, the work wasn't overly difficult just very complicated at times and management was a nightmare.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Coworkers and the decent pay..What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management write ups from day 1 for 6 months. The gaslighting the constant wondering what I'm doing wrong when I'm going to get wrote up or fired What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible. Night shift was spread paper thin even on an 11 hour shift we still struggled to get things done. Too much freight not enough hands or time. Company refusal for OT pay. Toxic management from the store manager down to the team leads.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Typical day we come in at 7pm or 10 depending on who was on truck duty. We unpack the truck and try to organize it into departments. Since we were so short staffed we as night shift never touch produce or deli. Around 10:15 we would have a team meeting and get assigned areas. Most times I was put either I the freezer section, infants, cereal or general merchandise (ie pharmacy, shampoo, beauty etc.) Cereal was the easiest and hardest because we weren't allowed to take an excess back to the back. It had to be put on the top shelves for top stock even if we had months of back stock up there. We did what we could stocking shelves until 4:30 a.m am then we would typically zone the store. Clean isles, front and face things etc. 5:15 we would deal with back stock which would have to be scanned, tagged and shelved in under 30 minutes. So we can deal with put backs, broken merchandise etc and re face our isles after the store opens. Then we clock - more...

title: Decent for pay but don’t expect help from higher ups for anything.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good pay and friendly coworkersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Hr, management, and corporate don’t listen or do anything about problematic coworkers or excessively stressful job duties. Uses a third party to process any disability accommodations so expect it to take months for approval. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Occasionally decent but rushed What is a typical day like for you at the company?Tolerable enough for the amount of pay

title: Over worked
review: Over worked short staff always expected to stay above time hours. Barley get your hour lunch and sometimes never your two 15 minute breaks and always asked to come in earlier then time expected because of so many call outs

title: Okay
review: Some customers were brutal but that's what's expected. Cashering made time go fairly quickly so that was a positive aspect. Obviously, working at Walmart isn't viable as  along term job but it's fine if you're in high school or just need money.

title: Fun Workplace
review: I absolutely loved this job! It was so fun & not too difficult! Being a shopper was so easy & fun. The people are amazing to work with as well! Highly recommend

title: Good job fast paced good training
review: Management is pretty helpful coworkers are also great. I learned money handling and stocking and merchandising.. work place culture is fast paced but management is awesome  Christmas holidays are a bit tough so I disliked all the crowds .. it’s a good job if you don’t mind being on your feet a lot   …. Training is very thorough coworkers are conducive

title: Times have changed
review: From the time I started to the time I left the company changed its values. They became more money driven and less about the customer. I would go back if I needed a job. The pay is pretty good.

title: Good Job
review: They honor associates availability. The more flexible you are the more hours you’ll have, if desired. Transfer process is easy. It’s possible to go from temporary to part-time status post 6 months. Easy tasks pertaining to money center operations and returns.

title: Fun good people. Management not fare.
review: Work easy.good Co workers. Management is the problem. Don't care about people. Only there favorites. Only look out for them.point system not fare.if sick have to go through Sedgwick. No help.pay was ok.

title: Vile upper store management, Most coaches and Some Leads
review: If you think for yourself, speak for yourself and believe that all people deserve some shred of decency or respect. Lehighton Walmart is not somewhere you want to work.  If you like being talked down too, told that you are worthless, REPLACEABLE, to SHUT UP and DO YOUR JOB (even though you are doing someone else job, again) then please apply here.  If you want to be watched/followed constantly by Leads or Coaches at the GM's request because they want to know what you are doing every minute, every second of your entire shift, because you were with a customer just a little too long explaining something to them. They Need you. However, if you have a work ethic, self-respect, dignity and value yourself this is not the place for you. Your worth more somewhere even if you make less money.

title: a garbage fire rolling into a highway
review: What is the best part of working at the company?the leads there aren't that good and they are very money hungry and power hungry and they don't treat people with respect they will find good workers and they will try to work you to death. also just don't try to work here it's terrible.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?the power hungry higher management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?terrible they want you to be work to deathWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?being assigned double the work as my co-workers

title: Great company
review: I enjoyed my time at Walmart the company was great and could be stressful at times. The higher up could sometimes make the job difficult. The company is always rolling out new initiatives.

title: Busy and stressful
review: Working in the deli was stressful very busy. Always understaffed pay was terrible. Only thing decent was the co workers were very helpful and team work was good

title: Fair pay
review: Walmart pays you fairly for the stress level of most tasks. There is some lack of accountability for less reliable employees and acknowledgement for those who do their best all the time.

title: Terrible
review: If you like to be micromanaged then you're in the right place. Horrible benefits and low pay. Not very flexible with hours.

title: It's a job.
review: Pretty good entry-level job for anyone needing a regular paycheck. The hours and schedule are very taxing, but the pay isn't bad for the work. Management is friendly enough and doesn't tend to bother you if you're actually doing your job. Not a whole lot of room for advancement, but as the title says, it's a job... That's about it. Get paid and go home.

title: It is what you make it
review: Job itself is pretty easy and the shifts are variable so it is flexible. Management can make or break the job. I like the break and lunch policy. Employee recognition and incentive would be something they can improve on. And better pay

title: Poor work culture
review: Not work life balance, poor pay in Puerto Rico. No opportunity to grow. Poor management. Human Resources was lost in the processes. Only a few manager knowing their roles.

title: Not a bad job
review: The work can be hard physically especially in the summer but management was good and we had adequate breaks so overall it was a good experience for good money

title: Good job for college students
review: This was a great job while enrolled in college.  The managers were laid back and were more than willing to work around college classes.   The interview process was very easy.

title: Decent for job security
review: Decent place to work if you are not looking for great pay. Not hard labor but pay could be more competitive. Favoritism runs high in this place also.

title: Always Something Going On
review: Wasn't the worst job. Working latenights and overnight shift was awful though. Customers would come in and tear the store up and we were expected to clean it and keep it tidy.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Don’t waste your energy.  Unqualified management, no positive feedback or encouragement.   All about the numbers, and you are definitely only a number.

title: Not Great
review: Management is not great at all, you work a lot and it's hard work, takes a toll after a while if you're working full-time. Wouldn't recommend cap-2 to anyone, if you're considering it, don't do it, at least not at this location.

title: Sometimes need
review: I've been working here for almost a year now and I have to say, they really know what they're doing when it comes to recycling. The whole system is incredibly efficient. The staff is well-trained and knowledgeable

title: Great benefits
review: You accrue sick time starting day one, they have schedules that fit your life and give you work life balance and really good health insurance. Easy work since everything is pretty much fully automated

title: Great pay but very demanding
review: Great pay as a store manager but unrealistic goals, company continues to trim wages and expect higher sales. High stress level not very good work life balance

title: Good pay, requires open availability
review: I enjoyed the nature of the work at this company. My store was always clean and had friendly employees. Management goals could be unrealistic considering the lack of proper equipment. Good pay and benefits, but not flexible with scheduling.

title: Do more work, get less pay.
review: Do you like being required to do the work of three people without getting paid a decent wage to begin with? This is the spot! The pay is low, the expectations are high, and you are probably going to be one of the few people that does any of the expected work and that’s also monitored constantly while working, so no bathroom breaks! Coworkers are decent people just struggling to get by, just like you, but you’ll have at least a dozen people (your “superiors”) telling you what to do and they’ll all be there to complain at you and about you to each other. It’s like that scene in office space, you know the one. For some reason they have a very high turnover rate, but will never do anything to retain employees.

title: terrible management and coworkers
review: even working full time it’s not good enough pay to be able to live on your own. coworkers act like high schoolers even the 60 year olds. management doesn’t approve time off.

title: Ok to work
review: Ok place to work, I like it usually. I wish pay and benefits were better but it is what it is. Wish there were chances for promotion but we're doing our best

title: terrible
review: work home balance is horrible, store manager isnt good to work with at all and there is alot of favortism . worst job ive ever held. managers are sleeping with cashiers and just a bad enviroment!

title: I would not suggest to work there bad company to work for you're just a number just the body that's all they care about
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Walmart is a bad place to work management doesn't care about you if you get hurt all I want to do is get rid of you it's not worth it!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You do all you can work as hard as you can and it's never enough it's not good enough not worth itWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very stressful bad job managers are awfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Before like I said it's stressful customers curse you out and managers do not stick up for you and customers are getting really bad about doing this especially if you work at the front door and you ask them for a receipt they'll either curse at you some of them are nice or just walk out and say no I don't have to show you nothing it's rude customers sorry

title: Decent good benefits
review: Great place to work just the hours get to you mgmt is fairly nice stays out of your way and lets you do your job. Hours were what did me and most others in esp if you have small kids

title: Secure work
review: It's ok full time, but they don't want you to work part time. If you do, then you might work till 11pm one night and come in and 6am the next day. If you work full time and don't miss many days, then it is a very secure job. Although Walmart changes its everyday working environment a lot so, it is a little unsettling at times, but usually you can keep the same schedule.

title: Productive and stressful
review: You work everywhere and anytime and rushed and trained how to work from stocking to maintenance to customer service to Unloading trucks and loading trucks. Changing prices everyday while performing your normal duties.

title: Its ok
review: Job is physically draining. There is not much of customer service there. All you have to do it keep the shelves clean and put back the stock. Some items are heavy. And usually noone helps. There is little scope of growth and promotion

title: Scheduling too stiff for me but good pay!
review: Keep in mind that I did overnight and its likely its a different experience compared to day workers, but the scheduling system is the same. There is a 5 point system, which is where I kind of screwed up. I had to take mental health days as overnight was a bit much for me but I wanted to see it through. Unfortunately when I got violently sick with a stomach virus and I was on my last point so I had to quit. The points fall off but only after months and its one by one. The management was very chill and extremely kind and supportive to me which I appreciated so much. I really don't like the two week in advance notice if I need to call out for whatever reason. Also I was considered part-time despite working a full-time schedule which meant I didn't get full-time benefits which I found a bit unfair, but I think that was due to being a temporary remodel position. The dress-code is very chill too and you get two 15 minute breaks and one hour lunch which is a great system. Overall I can say my experience is positive! Overnight is just not for people struggling with mental health in my experience LOL

title: Fun if your bosses are cool
review: I have nothing but good things to say about this place I worked here for 2 years and I think the place was very rewarding fair the work load wasn’t overwhelming and overall you meet great people

title: Relatively easy work for decent pay
review: The mangers are the worst part of the job. The job isn't very stressful, nor is it very hard. The pay is pretty good too. Its also nice to be able to buy lunch there as opposed to having to go out of the store.

title: Would not recommend
review: The coaches and team lead treat their associates like garbage! I would not recommend this place to work at. I was belittled, treated like I was dumb,  unrealistic dead lines, the list can go on.

title: Walmart is a good place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The co-workers I had worked with worked as a team and it made everything in our department run smoother and our team leads listened to our concerns and ideas.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?In the ogp department I worked in it's about speed and accuracy which on some of the days when it was very busy it would be stressful trying to keep up.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fun and welcoming. You start to feel like your coworkers are family.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Come in start a pick walk until I dispense repeat

title: Highschool-like atmosphere
review: This job was very physically demanding. I witnessed several people only last a day or two. The expectations are constantly raising, and even when we had a "successful" day, we were basically asked why we didn't do better. There's a lot of pressure on management, and they end up directing that stress towards their employees. This department used to pay a higher amount than others, but now that they pay the base rate and you don't get paid any more than people that get to stand around for a majority of their shift, it's just not worth it.

title: The jobs is demanding and rewarding for the time you work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The Benefits they offer the associate What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working for 12 hours a day on the weekends What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Pretty good it's warehouse environment What is a typical day like for you at the company?Working on the computer, labeling pallets, and resolving problems within the warehouse

title: Easy retail.
review: The hardest part is dealing with people. It's a people job and you have to deal with A LOT of them. There's a lot of repetitive work and never enough employees so just keep calm and collected and you'll be fine.

title: Miserable every day except payday.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay is phenomenal. You get paid for everything you do including layovers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Northeast travel lanes and being micromanaged What is the work environment and culture like at the company?A  facade of  a family oriented and caring. What is a typical day like for you at the company?13 hours about 3 to four drop/hook and as many miles you can squeeze out of your 11 without violating.

title: Easy job to get into
review: Would not recommend as a career choice, more of temporary job for someone desperate. Management not on the same page between shifts, frequently pulled in many directions and blamed for not fulfilling expected case counts, picking & binning goals set on a daily bases.

title: A job
review: Its a job that helps you understand if you want to work retail or not. Personally, management could have been better and overall a lot of the people working there seemed miserable.

title: Horrible
review: slave house .dont appreciate u for nothing .bad place to work and u get no weekends management is poor.gotta work the whole store they rush u to get finished

title: It was okay
review: The people there were okay and the management was quite alright, the Human Resources manager showed favoritism to her own kind but the pay was fair enough for the job.

title: productive
review: Working at Walmart has its pros and cons, but it all depends at what store you work at and what job role you have. I've had the privilege to work at two different stores as a cap 2 associate and the roles were flipped at both stores. At store one, we are responsible for unloading trucks and stocking gm and grocery while vizpicking and working picks on top of working freight. Its not bad but it gets frustrating when your asked to work other departments while those employees get to slack off and my manager pushes us to get our work and other departments work done. At the second store we were also responsible for unloading trucks but did not work fright as overnight worked freight from the trucks. We would vizpick all areas and work picks, then stage all fright for overnight and clean the backroom. Management was also different at both stores but are goals as a store were still the same. The workplace culture is good as long as you get along with everyone and its even better when there is a-lot of associates around your age.

title: Productive and fun work environment and the people are great
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good benefits pto and ppto good place to work all around What is the most stressful part about working at the company?It's twelve hours for the shift What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's great work environment really good people What is a typical day like for you at the company?Long and hard work it's worth it though

title: Fun place
review: I work from 10 to 5 . I learned how to have patience. Management is cool everyone was laidback. It was really fun and cool people to work with . The people are the best

title: Much better to work for than CVS and Walgreens other than that not that great.
review: Highly variable most Walmarts are awful but some in the suburbs are ok. You get more help than CVS and Walgreens. It is still retail pharmacy and the push the numbers can be extremely stressful. You could do your job perfectly and not sell enough vaccines and you are considered underperforming. The culture is set up to get your coworkers in trouble and upper management will try to get you to say negative things about your coworkers.  Walmart  pharmacy is still much much better than CVS or Walgreens. independent pharmacies will always be much better than the other options.

title: Eh
review: Not bad place to work FOR FIRST JOB. Good place to start but there are way better jobs out there for you, but good pay for first job and don’t get sucked into the Walmart life.

title: Hard
review: Deal with a lot and it’s not enough pay have to deal with awful mangers and customers and feel disrespected constantly. I would not work for the company if I didn’t need to at the time

title: Pretty straight forward on what your had to do!
review: Delivered different Walmart stores and Sam's clubs everyday you never know what the next schedule holds. loads are divvied out as needed. Most stressful part for me was standing out in the pouring rain/freezing cold trying to get a response to be let into the back of the store to be offloaded. I waited 5.5 hours one night and had to have the rest of my load rescued so it could finish being delivered on time. Very frustrating to say the least‼️ but over all it was a grate company to work for and I would go back if life permitted it. After 15 months I had to leave for family medical reasons. I was mostly happy at Walmart Lord knows I earned that job ‼️ and it was very worth it in the end. The bad to me was being gone all week. But that is truck driving! Even tho you come home for the reset it goes by instantly. So there's no home life to speak of. I found I really didn't make that much more money then anyone else on other jobs. As you have to pay for lawn care and everything else they goes wrong when normally I'd fix it myself‼️. While on the Rd wife called and said the pipe behind the washer was leaking. So I had to call a plumber out. Was charged $468 for a 5¢ piece and took him three minutes to fix and leave. I guess you truck and stay away from home for the passion not because you'll get rich doing it.

title: Great place to work !
review: Great pay for the job. Would highly recommend if you’re looking for good pay and benefits with easy work . May not be the same at every location but I love mine !

title: management is terrible
review: terrible place to work.  management is terrible. point system is a bit ridiculous if you ask me. not enough workers in my department so you were expected to get all these tasks done in little time.

title: Good job to start.
review: Its a good job to start at. If you want to move up in the company going to different locations is your best option. The schedule can be a little crazy depending on what department you work in.

title: Love it
review: Love it. I love coming to work here. The town is very beautiful. I have good work hours. Who Am I kidding. Im just writing this so I can see all the other reviews for another company

title: Low income no respect for employees
review: For associates this is not a good place to work. There's no respect and no income. Today's date April 4th 2023 New York, they pay 16$ per hour. Also don't give 40 hour a week. Even if you work 80 hour in two week you pay check will be round about 1000$-1040$. Apart from this, there's no respect for employees from the managers side and some customers side as well

title: Learning new tasks
review: I have worked in several stores and I'm happy to learn new ways to do things....work smarter not harder...be open with your mentor and don't be afraid to ask questions because that's the only way to learn the process from consumables headline to garden center ...no matter what the question it has a rhyme n reason to it

title: Fast paste
review: Fair pay fun at times cool co workers some management the only problem is management that don't do nothing walk around and delicate others to do there jobs

title: Lots of overtime opportunity, higher pay for overnight
review: Better than many other retailers. Lots of room to move up. But be ready for long hours. High turnover rate. But managers and team leads are very helpful.

title: Needs better team work & better supervisors
