review: Honestly I loved working at Walmart, it was the other associates I’d have to pull extra weight for & mind you they’ve been there longer than me. And the department i worked in needed more than one person working to ensure that every item was stocked

title: Not great
review: Too many expectations for the pay. Managers don’t care and higher ups don’t either. Hours get cut randomly and have to go in a circle to get a day off.

title: Good
review: Good place to work. People are real nice. You learn a lot from the training that is provided. Hours can be flexible or set. Pay is based on experience.

title: It was ok
review: It was a bad but good job for a 17-year-old. Don't be fooled, the managers can make or break your whole experience. it's a 50/50 chance though, not everyone is bad.

title: Easy going and fun
review: Working as a Walmart cashier can be fast-paced and challenging, but also rewarding. Expect to be on your feet for long periods and interact with many customers.

title: expect to be assigned tasks that other people dont want to deal with
review: Job "responsibilities" basically leave you open to being the person made to do whatever small annoying jobs or disliked tasks other workers don't want to do or cant be bothered to.

title: fast work day
review: the work days are good the days you have bad days are when the customers give you attitude when you cant help them with another department responsibility or when the managers wants to bring negative energy from home to work

title: Decent
review: The pay is good but the management makes it hard to want to continue working there. You work many hours but barely accumulate any PTO. You’re penalized for having to take off, even if you have to be out due to a doctor’s note. The turn over rate is high

title: Overworked
review: If you are a hard worker do not work here. They will see you can get much more done than the average person a work you to the bone. Just stay away form Wal-mart entirely.

title: Miserable Experience
review: I applied for them in March 2022 and didn't hear back until May of 2022 and hired me without an interview for a part time position.Once hired, there was no time to give a tour of the store and had to figure out everything on my own while also dealing with job shadowing. Team leads and other associates were very helpful, but the management was not the best at times. They mainly cared about money instead of associate wellbeing. There was also conflicting information of procedures based on who you talked to. I also had a few times where I was only scheduled 7 hours per week. Overall, I was very unsatisfied with working here.

title: Didn't expect to like it but do
review: If you wanna work there always something to do as a overnight stocker, which makes the shift fly bye and before you know it you're done. It's not that hard of work either though your training comes from asking questions and your co-workers mainly so you learn on the fly. Way better than my last job of 10+ years. Makes me wish I didn't waste that time there.

title: Good workplace
review: Compared to other retail pharmacy, Walmart is one of the best. It pays more than most retail pharmacies and has a lot of benefits such as pto, loa, bonuses etc.

title: Fun work place
review: Fun work place the coworkers some of them rude in general it’s a good experience to get and it’s paid not well so yes you look for something else while you are working

title: Good pay, relatively easy tasks, unorganized management, lack of training
review: The pay is decent and livable. Daily tasks are seemingly easy but unreasonable expectations of what you should get done in a day. Lack of training and help. Management is unorganized... coaches are left with too many roles and communication with team leads and associates needs improvement.

title: GREAT employees; Terrible Managers
review: The job was great, the hardest part was dealing with managers. They act like they know what they are doing when in reality, when a problem comes up they are the most unreasonable.

title: Order filler
review: it's not the greatest job it's not the greatest job in the it's not the greatest job in the world but it does take a while to get used to overall it was a fun job hard work set schedules so you have work-life balance at the same time frame as I did have some management that was full of stuff but that was years ago so who knows if they're still there but the job is pretty decent if you're trying to start out and get into something

title: Good entry-level job
review: Work is easy enough and pay is decent. Management and customers can be a pain. Keep your head down and do your best and you can make decent money with not a ton of effort.

title: Is no longer "family orientated"
review: I have found working for Walmart is no longer a place to try and build a career.Trying to get promoted seems to not be what you know but who you know. Walmart does have benefits that are helpful to new parents. Most of the benefits are for associates who are considered fulltime.

title: Keep your head down and do your job
review: As long as you are doing your job and not creating problems, great place to work. They have high productivity rates that can be achieved if you put effort into it. Food and drinks in the break room are overpriced.

title: Zero Employee Appreciation
review: Worked here for over 4 years and it did not matter how much work I did, the team leads would treat me horribly. I was doing double the work while getting screamed at for not helping other lazy employees. If wanting to work here, I suggest not doing much because it seems that they appreciate the lazy people over the hard workers.

title: The job is great but management needs some help
review: The company is great and the coworkers are very nice. They go over way too much at the interview and expect you to know everything within an hour. There is no real training considering you're trained by other associates.

title: You are not a person you are a machine
review: Where to start.. Management can add points to your attendance even when you are at work. If you get hurt on the job they will do everything in their power to let you suffer. Pay sucks, corporation sucks

title: Pros and Cons
review: I've worked here for over 2 years and most people work hard and actually care about getting ahead. Some of management overworks employees and constantly use the phrase "We are overstaffed" when asked about why we can't hire new people to share the work load. Most people here are really nice to work with aside with some of management and a couple of employees.

title: Not a good place to work
review: Out of tune managers who believe any lie without consulting with you or other people.Favoritism to those who do nothing and make fake complaints about you.If you don’t talk the talk or charm them to make them happy, you’re fired or threatened to get coached/written up.They have no response when you give solutions to fix things. It’s like they don’t even want to actually manage people.None of the managers can even look you in the eye because they’re afraid of your honesty and mindset.Very toxic workplace.No overtime but you’ll still be struggling and they’ll say you are fully staffed. However, once they fire you they’ll get a whole bunch of people to help get things done that you couldn’t finish because no help was given.People who started a week ago get paid the same as someone who has been working there for a long time.I do not recommend working in any fresh department as there is over the top drama and unrealistic expectations.

title: Management
review: The site I worked at had terrible management. They would often talk down to me as if I was actually lesser than them for the littlest things. Would not recommend.

title: Trabajé overnight y fue muy importante hacer stocker en una tienda trabajando para los clientes
review: Creo la forma en q se organiza overnight stocker ayuda a q seamos eficientes, yo q no soy tan rápida podía hacerlo muy bien y terminar lo q me asignaban.

title: Horrible place to work!!! They don’t care about you.
review: The management is always Bull $h!ting. don’t care about you or your life out side work. If you take a manger position and then step down they will expect you to still do the management work as a basic employee

title: Work life
review: It's great if you want to be around others, but the job itself isn't very fulfilling. It can be tiring standing for so many hours, but the time is pretty flexible.

title: Dont care about employees
review: Breaks are good, pay is decent, management sucks and doesn't care about you at all. I definitely don't suggest the Florence neighborhood market. They put up a front and once you start you're treated horrible

title: Ok Job
review: I only left because they would not work with my college schedule. I liked working in the shipping department. One issue they have is that you give an inch and they take a mile. They need to understand that workers are human not robots.

title: To much drama and everyone one is two faced, mangers pick favorites
review: I hated working at Walmart everyone was two faced, lied and way to much drama. Mangers pick favorites and are not willing to work with childcare schedules.

title: Nope
review: Any creative or independent ideas can be shot down quick. In case you know more then your managers you will be seen as an enemy. Be dumb and ignore any good advice just work untill you had enough.

title: Poor management
review: They care more about numbers of bodies.  Still doing phone interviews covid been over for awhile.  Don't let associates even apply for open management positions.  Rather hire someone off the street with no experience.  They wonder why employees are quitting of have bad attitudes

title: Depends on the store
review: The main downside with any walmart is that they are very corporate. Some store managers will let you take an loa ID needed others will MAKE you go through the 3rd party "because they legally have to" and just can't tell you no. Are some store good with good people? Yes are some managers the worst people you will ever meet? Also yes

title: Working for Walmart
review: The scheduling for what days u have off ARENT the best. I worked every weekend. You only get 40 hours no more. The workers weren’t the best. I definitely didn’t like how lazy they are.

title: I wouldn’t work here unless it’s your only option. Otherwise I’d go to school or learn one of the trades to not have to be treated like a number
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The only good about working here was the discount for working and the extra discount for working Black Friday but the regular employee discount doesn’t work with foodWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?You can’t move up without a good performance review which was a biased opinion of whichever manager did it. I couldnt move up because one of the managers didn’t like me for reasons unknownWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Everyone was miserable. Nobody knew where they worked from one day to the next unless they were assigned to unloading trailers. If you weren’t assigned to it from day one you eventually ended up unloading a trailer or straightening up shelvesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day at Walmart is showing up clocking in and getting jerked from your department to work somewhere else and / or get treated like mud by a customer

title: Awful.
review: The management is absolutely awful. The human resources department is incredibly rude and dismissive. The online pickup and delivery department is a MESS. Everyone is overworked, underpaid, and there is no space to store orders. They won’t let you take time off, and play favorites constantly.

title: Not very good for mental health
review: Theyll overwork you and just complain you shouldve done more. Half of the workers there do way less work than you just for you to get yelled at more than them. (They hastle the better workers bc they know theyll do more)

title: terrible, dont work here.
review: worst place to work, its walmart. high turnover, managers dont care, angry customers. forced overtime during holidays then hours cut back drastically afterwards to recoup the extra money paid out in OT.

title: No fun...they want robots
review: They are a terrible company to work for. I wasted 16 years of my life. I put in blood sweat and tears into that place and ended up getting nothing out of it

title: This place is miserable
review: Everyone hates eachother and treats eachother like dog water and I wouldn’t recommend working here cause it would give them depression and send them into a mental state of crisis…

title: it was okay manangement was awful
review: good pay but overwhelming with customers. The mangers were mostly okay but some of them made me quit. It was a good job to have while in school because the pay was good.

title: Decent pay and benefits if you can avoid the politics
review: Walmart's a great introduction to retail for those looking to get in the door with a company that has minimal hiring standards. Depending on the state or country there's no drug test unless you cause an accident or come to work annihilated. If you play the politics and the cliques, you can advance very far. Otherwise keep your head down until you find something else.

title: Quality of work and respect
review: I really like working here plenty of work and nevera dull moment this job is for anyone who like work in the clothes department flexible hours good and clean environment

title: Fun but unorganized work place
review: Job was fun , only due to coworkers… the schedule is always changing. I learned alot with costumers ! I really recommend working there, it helped with my anxiety

title: Productive
review: Overall okay job to work. Its like any other job but they have changed their rules over the years. Management can be okay if you have a good manager.

title: Terrible company
review: You're barely trained before being thrown out on your own. They don't care about your needs if you don't have pto to cover an absence or need to leave early its held against you unless the management likes you.

title: Good People; Bad Management
review: I was there for a month and the disdain for the general store manager was palpable. Everyone in my department was great, but we were constantly stuck in understaffed-limbo. The moment any new employees would be trained and integrated into the environment, the same amount of people ended up quitting. Considering the workload that was placed upon the people left over I don't feel like we were fairly compensated. Walmart Inc. hates paying you for overtime. They would make us take longer lunches just so they didn't have to pay you for your longer hours. Good enough if you just want some easy money? Yes. Is there much room for growth without experience? Not really.

title: Productive but Stressful
review: Basically the walmart expeirned is someting that i owuld definitely overlook and the things that could get me places were very overlooked, overall the managment did not care.

title: Easy
review: It wasnt a bad job. Show up and do what you're asked. No stealing. You get breaks. Coworkers are nice for the most part. Customers not very nice like anywhere

title: If you become a favorite, then you are good.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The benefits, if you are full time. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Unprofessional salary management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?They preach integrity but that only applies to the associates and hourly management. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Shopping customer orders, trying to meet metrics.

title: Stressful
review: Yaks! It's something you need to do if you have no choice. The pay is not worth the amount of work you are expected to do. The people are nice, but I don't recommended it

title: Pay was better than most retailers and fast food
review: The management was solid, never had a problem with them. Never had an issue with the pay; you receive a .30 raise every 6 months and occasionally bumped up the pay. They had flexible hours. part time received on average 29 hours during the holidays and 20 hours normally. Full time would have 35 hours plus during holidays and 35 hours normally. Responsibilities - Checkout customers: busy days are the weekend 12pm-4pm- Making sure customers did not steal.- Help customer find products- Help Customer load products onto their cars- Cover other departments such as Cart pushers and Electronics. Just do you're work, stay off your phone when its busy, keep earbuds out, show up on time(they are lenient tardiness but don't push their limits) and you can get far just doing that. Very easy job and pay is great for doing really nothing. oh and almost forgot don't argue with customers its not worth the time and effort.

title: I love the overnight shift
review: When I started at Walmart I was on the day shift. I didn’t enjoy it at all. You really didn’t know what you were going to be doing on any given day. The overnight shift is the opposite. I’m able to work the same department every night and because of that the job gets easier after you have learned your department

title: Okay, but be prepared for the BS
review: As an associate, you really have as much time as you need to really get down for whatever your job title is, but once you move up the ladder your voice and actions mean don't mean much to management unless you bow down and follow them.

title: Productive
review: The pharmacist is knowledgeable. All of the techs are made aware of changes. The only drawback is the understaffing sometimes and the rude customers. I enjoy everything else

title: Easiest job for the pay
review: Literally the easiest job, pay is better than most jobs like this. Almost impossible to not get hired and almost impossible to get fired. Just stay on everyone’s good side and you’ll have no problem.

title: Ok workplace
review: This is a good place to work if its not your first job and you have experience but if you are new to the workforce this is not the place for you nice coworkers

title: Productive, fun, and interactive until some team leads set a glim tone. Bad employees drive down the good until we get fed up.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There are the work friends you make a no d some customers that are glad to see you every week.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?At least in my Walmart, it’s the management, team leads. Except for two, the team leads are horrible, foul le standards for things, have their group of any wrong doing, but if it is someone else, you’re going to get in trouble. Not enough staff to take care of lines, checkout people are constantly put on freight, 1 person solely handling 8 self checkouts with a backed up line then condescended for things out of our control. Store 941 ladies and gentlemen. , Certain team leads are not there when we or a customer needs them, puts their own work on a lower employee that’s busting their but so she can go visit her boyfriend that was sent to a different department for this very reason. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Certain employees will help one another, some work others goof off and don’t work. Honestly the behavior of the bad employees drags down the good employees and drives them away  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good/okay, or bad depending on which team leads are in.
position: Front End Team Associate, Former Customer Host, & Personal Shopper

title: Starting pay is very competitive but comes with high expectations
review: Walmart tries to be based on team fundamentals. Problem is, with them chasing corporate gains, you will have your workforce cut each year if your store is not performing at an extremely high rate. This company wants 120% at all times. The amount of extra computer work, & “class” work really gets in the way of performing duties.

title: Stressful and under paid
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Clocking in and doing nothing. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Putting up with management. Getting the money you deserve. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful when management is around even though they won't speak to you. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in and avoid management, catch up on who is leaving the company this week.

title: Productive
review: It was a good easy job paid fine didn't have any problems with staff. I was always kept busy always had something to do there which was good. overall a good job.

title: Unrealistic Expectations
review: Worked overnight as a stocker. Some managers were laid back but others were micro-managers and stressed everyone out constantly. They would expect an unrealistic amount of work to be done quickly and would give you the equivalent of a write-up if you didn't get it finished in time

title: Stayed busy
review: I worked night shift/seasonal/temp which can be tiresome, I stayed very busy, I worked the clothing department and there was always something to do!!!

title: Consistent available hours
review: Management is good people trying to get all the work done, but also not rushing. whatever gets done gets done and if not just put away for the next crew or the next night.

title: Fun in the sense of co workers but stressful
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great co workers. Helping customers to satisfy their needs.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Never having help and stocking the shelves to maintain and fulfill customer needs.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Lots of pressure and very stressful.

title: Ok, not the best
review: It was not that bad, poor service and very long hours. The management was okay but the workload was intense. It depends on the person and the limits you have.

title: Ehh
review: It’s very easy but not good long term. Turnover is very high and management doesn’t seem to communicate enough. Pay is alright for the job. Can be physically demanding.

title: Fun sometimes
review: Only fun if you make friends but management always on you for every little thing you do. They used to watch us in the security camaras and scolded us if we talked to each other even if both coworkers and I were on self checkout without any customers

title: My Walmart experience
review: The Walmart I worked for had terrible management, barely had little to no days off.  Walmart does not care if you have kids, or need a mental day off, they would rather you work every day, no days off and they barely took care of any matters that effected your work.

title: Making customers happy.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?After hired, you're ok for a few months and you're picking everyone slack. Store 1771 don't appreciate anything you do.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Picking everyone slack, and the point system, and the pay the favoritism,What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Customers, who appreciate you,What is a typical day like for you at the company?Run register, do freight, also clean my area. Making customers happy.

title: No Livable Wage
review: They never let us hire for the positions we truly need, they don't accept any kind of doctor's notes, so if you don't have enough time saved up you'll get occurrences. 5 and you're fired. It's a very high stress work environment. Don't expect to get paid enough to take care of bills and a family unless you're management or higher.

title: very good
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers were the only good partWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The bosses had no compassion. I had a miscarriage and had to be out and have surgery yet they still fired meWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mix of culture and some employees were niceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Long and sometimes stressful. Other days ok

title: Dont do It
review: I didn’t want to go to work everyday, managers are incompetent and hours are variable. Very cliquey, only do this job if your in school and going to do someone else

title: Understaffed and Overworked
review: The pay is the only thing that will keep you at this job. It’s extremely physical and it’s mentally taxing. It’s just such a degrading job and none of the managers care at all. I am currently employed here and I can’t quit because the pay is so high and I can’t afford to leave. If you can find another job with comparable pay, do yourself a favor and run. If not, hire into a different department than batching, shipping, or non-con.

title: Favoritism and No Advancement
review: This place is a disaster. I would never work there again or recommend anyone else to. They had me (making basic pay) training people, when the supervisors or managers should have been doing that. Isn't that what they get paid for. Terrible experience. Wouldn't recommend anyone to work there.

title: Management treats bad
review: I worked here for a while and the first week I was there for night shift everyone was being yelled at. They always stick u in same spot even when you ask to try somewhere different. The night managers would get high on lunch. I ended up quitting because of poor management.

title: Workplace advancement
review: Walmart had many opportunities for advancements which is one of the reasons I love it. You have opportunities here that some places don’t provide. You can advance from sales to department manager and to salary. This gives for a great career path

title: No balance
review: Not enough pay, horrible management, favoritism. No people skills, hr is never there and if you ever need to speak to them they just push it off. I would never recommend working for Walmart. To much stress for the pay.

title: Great People
review: The Walmart i worked had a great environment and everyone was kind to each other. I would highly recommend applying. One tip is that if you do apply make sure to call in cause the hiring managers dont always check.

title: Very Stressful for Pay
review: Some great people work here, but it is a very stressful job and there is a heavy work load dropped on you for the amount of compensation you get. Staffing issue as well!

title: Horrible place to work
review: Company does not care about its employees or their families all they care about are still change your schedules and you're availability without letting you know. No work-life balance

title: Not a fair place to work.
review: There are double standards in all departments. Managers are poorly trained and not good with dealing with people, employees or their customers there. Is with most businesses the bottom line is the most important but they pretend to care about employees.

title: Toxic
review: Don’t recommend it for a life choice definitely just a temporary place. Not the best management team or policies, but if you need money while furthering your career elsewhere I recommend. But unless you like high school drama don’t recommend for the long run

title: Bad place
review: Management sucks got there favorites and always let the lazy workers away with everything and you work your butt off and never appreciated for all the work you do

title: Unhappy with Higher Management
review: I started as a cashier, and was moved to learn multiple departments in the store to be able to work in other areas, not stuck in one. However, in the same aspect I was still paid for only one position. Hours in all departments, and issues at times for needing off for family.

title: Easy job
review: Easy job. Pay was decent. Management could have been better. Lack of employees made the job harder. You do the same thing every single day and the Walmart music is awful

title: Management is somewhat unorganized.
review: Overworked, and underpaid for the amount of tasks you have to do. I guess the best part about this job is the coworkers you meet. Would I recommend this job? If you don't mind being overworked, then this job is for you.

title: You have to love people.
review: Walmart has gone to a rotating schedule. If you don’t do this schedule they will know you down to part time. They don’t care if you are a parent or a caregiver you will have to quit because of this. They don’t give you a set day off either.

title: overall alright some management issues
review: job itself is pretty straight forward and laid back but the management can make the job harder than it needs to be. Pretty good coworkers turnover can be hgh.

title: I'm getting to make money and that's awesome
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You will always be busy lots of customers and decent payWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The stressful part would be keeping up with the stores demands and the customers needsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?I think they're just fine they are customer focused and employee focused as well

title: Eh
review: Company is just focused on money. Pay employees a lot to keep retention but no training or management care for workers. Only Pro was the huge pay they gave out.

title: Working from home
review: You get more benefits and incentives working for Walmart at home and I love it! You’re able to get assistance pretty quick. You’re able to move up pretty quickly as well.

title: They don’t value outstanding employees
review: They only care about management bonuses.  They talk down to you and will make it an uncomfortable work environment, forcing you to quit.  I pointed out numerous safety and ethics violations and was ran out of the store.  Walmart corporate even swept it all under the rug.  They also overwork reliable, fantastic adult employees while giving the teenagers a break, holding them with zero accountability.  This is a beyond broken corporation.  I was treated better in basic training for the military.  At least I was recognized as a human being.

title: Walmart doesn't care about employees.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing positive unless you enjoy being  overworked and underpaid. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?No communication from team leads. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Favoritism, lack of communication, management cliques. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Extremely stressful. Exhausting. A lot of days you end up by yourself in self check and are expected to oversee 7 or more self check stations.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Horrible place to work they don’t care about there workers at all and they hire you to work one position and you get put at another doing 1000 jobs they have favorites

title: I enjoyed working at Walmart
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Always a fair company to me, and willing to work with schedule change. Team work a necessity.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to get all of the work done before end of the shift.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was easy going for me. Part of a team.

title: Decent first job
review: I worked here as a picker/packer co workers were nice and hours were flexible. The only complaints I had were the pay as well as some toxic management

title: Not my favorite
review: The attendance system is terrible and completely unintuitive. You cannot be late or miss for any reason, no matter how valid, without getting in trouble.

title: rewarding
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Technical prowess of staff. Leading edge projects.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Walmart's antiquated process for evaluating talent and yearly review process.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hard work is rewarded. Creativity not so much.

title: It's an okay place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Vacation can build quick if you let itWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Freight, puting it up and being expected to do it every day by yourself What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Okay if you did what you were toldWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Freight every day and having to put up three pallets on the floor by myself

title: It was pretty good overall.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoyed working with the public.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?We had very uncertain work schedules, 35 hours a week then 20 the nextWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?I'd say about average. But mostly positiveWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It really depended, but the variation was nice.

title: Busy store with friendly people
review: Everyone helps to run the store efficiently, even the managers pitch in when needed. Very busy all the time. I'm never bored! If you don't like what you're doing they will move you to other positions you might like

title: Very nice people
review: My co workers were very nice and it's a good place to get your self figured out.the interview process was extremely easy and the management is pretty easy going

title: Toxic masculinity negative will never shop or work there again
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The money but it’s not worth it more than it’s is good your treated like nothing like you can be replaced in the a second What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The way they talk to you  and they do not care who is around who can hear  you don’t do it there way to a (T) it’s wrong and your getting coached What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic toxic toxic toxic toxic negative I did not want to go to work It was so bad there treated like trash What is a typical day like for you at the company?Getting yelled at getting yelled at for others mistakes made to do a job with know help yelled at for not getting done fast.

title: No time to sleep
review: I worked for Walmart for only 4 months, I left after a manager accused me of leaving a mess I didn't know was there in my aisle. They also starting scheduling me so close together, and with no consistency, that there were times I had less than 8 hours in between shifts... 8 hours is not enough to eat, sleep, shower, do any kind of house chore, etc. Horrible company

title: Not a family oriented place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers were the only good partWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The bosses had no compassion. I had a miscarriage and had to be out and have surgery yet they still fired meWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mix of culture and some employees were niceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Long and sometimes stressful. Other days ok

title: Harassed, and bother ever happen to the managers.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with friends, other than that nothing was good about working hereWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?When someone tells you, you can’t wear the hoodie we made you buy in order to be warm. Then get fired for wearing a Walmart hoodie.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Sucks, because I had a manager who was trying to get me fired. So never a good environment What is a typical day like for you at the company?Getting harassed by managers for what I’m wearing. I always got my work done and helped other people when I was done. As long as I wasn’t bothered by the ones who was trying to get me fired it would be good. But they made it horrible.

title: It is a job if you need money
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Money is the only thing good about it. A very stressful job.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Taking their dumb test you know nothing about.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hard working people and lots of gossipWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Runned around like a crazy person trying to get things done. Lol

title: Corporate, but fair.
review: The work is fairly easy, but the procedure is terrible. Extremely corporate feel. No personal experience at all. Just clock in and clock out without making a difference. Pay is fantastic. Benefits are good. Tons and tons of drama.

title: Okay workplace
review: Its a easy job. I have nothing against job itself but some of the team leads can be rude along with some of the coworkers. It might be hard especially when it gets really busy. There is a bit of lenience. overall its not a bad place to work.

title: Good place to work
review: It was a good place to work. My team leads were great and helpful. I really enjoyed the relationships I developed with my coworkers. Most coworkers pulled their own weight with the exception of just a few.

title: Overworked underpaid
review: Over worked, underpaid. Strict attendance policies. Constant turnover due to poor training and lazy ppl. No paid holidays even tho you’re expected to work them.

title: Walmart
review: It was a great job but I worked with my ex boyfriend I didn't like it. It was a great place the people I worked with was so awesome I would be there now but I got really sick I wish I worked there now

title: fun workplace ones you get to know people
review: pay alr mangers just strict n be on you bout the little things. be prepared to get points that will get you fired. be sure to call in hours b4 work so you won’t get points bc they will for the littlest things

title: Ok
review: Its ok but at times it gets rough sometimes if u like really faced past work then go for it the only bad thing about it was the managers but Other than that the pay is really good for your first job

title: Alright
review: It was alright, the pay was good and the hours weren’t too bad. Their point system was not good but you got to keep people from calling in all the time somehow.

title: Fun place to meet new people
review: Walmart was a fun environment to work and they understand if you have a family emergency they work with you on hours . And the pay is good for having a easy job . But your on your feet all day .

title: Management Is awful
review: This company is pretty good at making you think they care when in reality they don't. No holiday pay, yet you get penalized for calling out. No incentive to be there whatsoever. Customers are rude as ever and then have the audacity to complain that every associate looks miserable. It's because we are! Management has major attitude problems..  don't get me started on the favoritism, and heaven forbid you're a cashier that needs to use the rest room! They will tell you to use the action codes on your register so someone can relieve you but they never come! And if you turn off your light and just go you'll get yelled at! This place needs a serious reality check. No wonder the turnover rate is so high.

title: easy work
review: The job is really easy. It does get tiring some times with pretty much just putting things on shelves though. Couldn't recommend it for a long term position.

title: Great place to work.
review: I loved watering the flowers and building grills for display. It’s been over a decade since working there, but I still think about the good ole days.

title: Under paid and overworked
review: In my opinion ridiculously underpaid with way too much expected. Not only that but they're severely understaffed for as big of a company as they are which makes customer service hard

title: Worst company to work for
review: Worst job I have ever had. You can work yourself to the bone but if you are not friends with management you WILL NOT EVER be promoted. When and IF, you get promoted your workload becomes so much that you will need 3 of you to get it done. Management is not at all helpful, they will just tell you to figure it out. The pay is high but if you get overtime they will make you cut your hours so they don’t have to pay it. You literally will feel like you sold your soul to the company.

title: fun
review: great place to be at fun always different jobs to do. it did get hot in the distribution. they have a cafateria and overall a good place to work for i would work again

title: Fast pace and a bit stressful
review: I loved working at Walmart but the attendance policy is insane. I didn't have a ride and the manager kept putting in hours outside of my availability which made it super hard for me to show up to work.

title: Production fun Joyfully peacefully
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meet New People's and to grow with the teamWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nothing is stressful I love the company What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Focus on becoming my dream of the future What is a typical day like for you at the company?Working during the week. Focus on one job they assigned me to.

title: Good Place to Work
review: Good place to work. Lots of good people at Walmart that can make the pain of retail easier. If you can deal with the politics and be able to get along with your managers you’ll do fine.

title: Transitioned then bolted
review: Not bad if you are Trans and need a safe place to transition but pay sucked and my bosses would always take my associates and put them in other departments.

title: Great pay , Bad Management
review: Working for Walmart pharmacy was wonderful with great pay but the management teams were horrible there was a lot of favoritism shown in the scheduling and training in that department.

title: Understaffed
review: Will get on you about anything especially if you do meet the standards they have. Makes it harder when customers ask questions during a run. I don’t recommend this area unless you like stress and the fast environment

title: Awful.
review: 0/5. Do not recommend. Managers don't care about you. Management is awful overall. Terrible customers. You'll never have the resources or tools needed to do your job. TCs and printers always broken and management won't care. Constantly understaffed as well.

title: Fast-paced environment
review: Fun, fast, and welcoming work environment. Management was very helpful and organized with training and getting you started quickly. Would apply again.

title: Terrible place to work.
review: Not gonna get into detail I could legitimately write a book on how terrible Walmart is. I was let go due to being told to go on covid leave, I provided a positive test as they wanted. I was made to go home for a week and after filling out the leave paper work they denied me saying I had no proof of a test. I sent the picture again with no reply so safe to say Walmart is a strange place. The management I could type a book on alone. Stay away from the drama save yourself the stress.

title: Ogp 2021
review: It was difficult because you were timed while doing your pick walks. Every day was very stressful. Higher-ups did not really care about you. We would be understaffed which was also stressful. Overall not the best experience.

title: Where to begin
review: Heavy work load with little to zero recognition for hourly associates who are underpaid in comparison to management. Love the work I do and the relationships built with customers. Wish everyone had the same worth ethic and that raises were based on performance instead of corporate handing out the same no matter what. Dig deep to work here....your level of success will be determined on who "likes" you not your actual work performance!! This company has gone downhill in the last 5+ years.

title: Es importante incorporar personal calificado para lo cargos de coordinador en las diferentes áreas de trabajo.
review: El trabajo es excelente, solo las personas intermediarias no tienen manejo de personal y no tienen conocimiento de cómo tratar a su equipo de trabajo.

title: Fun and fast
review: Fun place to work at that offers competitive pay, offers a lot of different roles and positions for any one interested in applying I would definitely recommend working

title: No quality management
review: Sometimes felt like I was back in high school. Favoritism ran deep with some managers. Not as easy to advance as they like to pretend it is. Coworkers were pretty good as long as you didn’t step on the wrong toes.

title: Great at first but it goes down hill
review: it was great working there before management switched. None of the managers respect you has a human being. They will remind you that you’re replaceable all the time.

title: Started out great, but….
review: Started out great, but learned quickly I was just a number. New management came in and changed everything for the worse. I was there over ten years.

title: Was a great high school job!
review: I worked this job for the majority of my high school career and found a lot of friendships, learning experiences, and reasons to stay with the company. As a whole, the store typically depends on the management, and if you want to succeed in Walmart, you must act like it. I wanted to learn and thrived learning.

title: I love it here pretty much
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The associates,business benefits manager the whole team at Walmart What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not being able to make it work out What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s lovely great clean cut smooth organization What is a typical day like for you at the company?Best work environment you could have

title: i loved the work, but i felt like a minority and got treated like a felon
review: What is the best part of working at the company?the money and always busy, time goes fastWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?ive worked at 2 walmarts...mostly all spanish or immigrants work there and they refuse to help the white workers.  experienced it at both walmarts. they treat you like garbageWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?its bad if you are white, they make up stuff to get you in trouble and they stick together. its awfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?work hard, get dirty, dont talk or ask questions

title: Very wonderful and rewarding
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people I would work there again if they would hire me back What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working midnight makes it hard What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was really good I love the customer What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking and making sure the product was out

title: Fun
review: Amazinly nice to work.Nice and helpful.Helpful and fun to be there.Fun place that is awesome. Amazingly nice place to work.Nice and professional helpful. Fun to be around. awesome everyday.

title: Avoid
review: Walmart will treat you poorly and have you work in dangerous conditions without a bonus or raise. If you try to improve conditions you will be yelled at and belittled. They take ages to fix even minor problems that are necessary to get any work done.

title: Good coworkers (mostly), not so good managers
review: Sometimes felt like I was back in high school. Favoritism ran deep with some managers. Not as easy to advance as they like to pretend it is. Coworkers were pretty good as long as you didn’t step on the wrong toes.

title: Okay
review: Had lots of fun working here, decided to quit because they made me push buggies while pregnant. Did get me hooked up on a nice vacuum for my new apartment and new baby crib for free. Threw me a baby shower. Felt so nice and had all kinds of pizza parties. The Girl Scout cookies out front were always real good.

title: Awesome job
review: It was pretty good honestly I loved the job and the environment. Perfect first job. The pay was also really good ugh I wish I could go back to the job it was awesome

title: It's just 'meh'
review: I've worked in the OPD (online pickup & delivery) department since being hired almost three years ago. I have been denied promotion twice (the first being to another department. The second, my own department). In both cases they chose someone from another department, or another store all together. We aren't given the proper equipment to do our job (ie, handhelds and printers). We aren't given proper training, but are expected to do our jobs correctly. I usually find out how to do something after I've been repremanded for doing it wrong. But it's hard to get fired from Wal-Mart. You can come to work high, and that's fine. But you'll get written up for wearing ear buds or a hoodie while working on the floor. Managers play favorites, and will promote their friends instead of a more qualified applicant.  On a positive note: The associates are all so unhappy that we've formed a sad kind of family bond with one another. They don't drug test, but then again, this allows for some questionable hires.

title: Wal-mart review
review: Its an okay place to work. Could be a potential career, but only if you want to stick to retail. The pay is decent for what they have you do. A decent job for someone with no work experience.

title: I liked working at Walmart but
review: I don’t feel like they paid me enough for the amount of work I did. I worked there for 3 years and my pay was only $.65 more than the base pay, which was also low for how much stress they put you under. The only thing I miss about Walmart is the consistency in the work schedule and the perks like PTO and PPTO.

title: Great place to work, pays reasonably plus you get to work with friendly & helpful people
review: The sales floor is always busy in my location, and in my department, so there are always things to do. On-the-job duties are easy as pie. Customer service is the main focus and you can fine-tune your customer service experience. If you love helping people, then you will love working here.Sometimes management will ask you to be a greeter at the entrance or bring shopping carts back into the store. If your not physically fit, these tasks will be quite difficult to complete.

title: Excessive work & not enough recognition
review: Underpaid compared to same level position in US (at all levels of the organization) and with with excessive load of work.

title: Productive and fun place
review: it was a fun place. had great hours and great staff. management was good aswell. had a great time there a couple years back. You should be ready bro woke

title: A good place to work, especially for new employees between 16 and 18 years of age, but bad customer service and leadership
review: Basically, I was a team member of Cap One.   I enjoyed working in apparel (include shoes), but I more so enjoyed uploading the truck in our backroom.I felt more comfortable unboxing shoes (especially in the backroom) to prevent any disturbance from the public.

title: Nice and steady
review: Good place to start a career, helpful people, ability to buy stock, not a bad apple there. Was happy with just about every single thing that was done, they gave me loads of raises because I worked.

title: Decent place to work
review: good pay, coaches and team leads are easy to work with. company expectations a bit extreme on times but leads aren't too hard on you. hour lunches aren't my thing though.

title: Okay place to work
review: I really enjoyed working when the supercenter was being constructed but ended up in the bakery.  I had no weekends off even though it was promised, but this was years ago and hopefully things have improved

title: If you want to do the work of 3 people, this is the right job.
review: Slackers are never held accountable while the hard workers get more pushed into them. No matter how good of a job you do, you'll always be expected to do more.

title: Slow and well structured workplace
review: It's a simple job and can be repetitive but everyone was super chill and welcoming. I enjoyed my time working at this Walmart as its slow and there's normally not a lot going on.

title: A company with large system
review: Walmart Labs is a good place to work. The system is large and complex. You will get expose to many aspects of a complex system. Group at Reston is easy/nice to work with.

title: Fun workplace
review: I loved working here! Never a dull moment with your fellow co workers. Managers actually know what they’re doing! And pay is good for just watching people checkout!

title: Opportunity for growth hours not great
review: Opportunity for growth to become a coach. The shifts can be difficult to get used to at first because they are drastically different. Not always able to focus on your department. Have to help in other areas like OPD and not always having the tools to do your job.

title: Fun flexible work environment
review: Good range of slow and fast paced work environment. Great people. To this day one of my favorite places I have ever worked. Was excited some days to go into work. Don’t ever expect anything from management. You’re dead to them

title: Productive and enjoyable work place overall
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Schedule flexibility, room to grow within the companyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?No set schedules, your schedule will always change from week to weekWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Social, teamwork, they literally live by the phrase "teamwork makes the dream work"What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking shelves, Helping customers, Cleaning work areas

title: Fun workplace
review: The workplace was great. They were reallly good with scheduling me. I met great people. The pay was nice. Every thing about walmart was honest very great

title: Productive and a fun place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Helping customers. Giving a smile and making a difference in someone's day.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with difficult customers.   Sometimes people are just focused on their task, and are not respectful to others.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?We work as a team. Always willing to help others. Being compassionate and respectful to team members. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very fast paced. Getting your projects completed along with helping customers.

title: Productive room to grown fun workplace
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They care about you and appreciate your hard workWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?This job is not stressful at all. How ever you come to work that will be your stressWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment is very free spirited and it’s diverse What is a typical day like for you at the company?Driving around all day doing replenishment for the pickers

title: Interesting Job
review: If you work with someone you know it can be fun, but management kinda sucked and it was hard to make schedule changes or get time off. Some people that work there just didn’t know how to do their jobs, but overall it really wasn’t bad

title: No upward mobility at all
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Employee discounts during the Christmas holiday What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Using broken equipment that needed to be fixed or exchanged What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work by yourself in some departments What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful, never same clock in time , when it easy to be done

title: Great place to work
review: I would have thought when I first started working at Walmart that it would be pretty much like any other retail job position.  However I must say I was pleasantly surprised!  Working as a PDS has become a fun job and the staff at Walmart are great to work for.  They offer flexible schedules.

title: Consistency and morale at an all time low
review: Associates are paid the same regardless of your experience, intelligence or seniority. Priorities are often questionable. Cleanliness and safety of associates is nonexistent. No paid holidays.

title: Decent
review: Working here is pretty decent. You unload the truck then once released to the floor whatever aisle you’re assigned to. Once finishing whatever stock you’ve gotta put on shelves you generally go to another aisle and help them finish up.

title: Alternating between insanely busy and insanely bored depending upon the time of day, the weather, sporting events on television etc
review: What is the best part of working at the company?consistent hours, days. The people you work withWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The customers can get rude, be disrespectful, deliberately ignore policies and expected public behavior normsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?good, a bit too 'rah rah' sometimes. Annoying if you get a manager/store manager who thinks motivation means setting literally impossible deadlines with an expectation that they be met or elseWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?clock in, work the floor a few hours. cover multiple areas of the store helping people as needed, to include checking out people at registers, mixing paint, selling hunting licenses etc etc. Full hour long lunch. Then back to it. Two fifteen minute breaks.

title: High paying Job, okay benefits, but if you're not a manager your out of luck.
review: The pros of this job were that it was high paying job, and the benefits package was okay. The cons of this job were that there is an impossible working standard, and if you don't hit a 100% production rate you get wrote up, even if there isn't enough work for the day. Management will make everything your fault. There is a ton of favoritism as well. There is no accountability when it comes to managers and their professionalism. I tried to report a manager for harassment and was brushed off, and magically let go for "production issues." There are a ton of other shady things they have done but it would take a novel to explain it all.  This company only cares about numbers. People do not matter to them.  Don't work here if you can.

title: Busy so days go by fast
review: Okay place to work goes off of a tally system once you reach a certain number you will be fired they base it off of attendance and don’t care if you have a doctors note it will still cost you a point so keep those kind of things in mind

title: Typical cake decorator job
review: Fun if you like cake decorating, all buttercream no fondant decorations or airbrushing work. just beware of the point system! You are allowed to clock in 9 mins early/late without penalty which is nice

title: walmart
review: Great company to work for, a lot of benefits, and a great place to move up into management once you are there for awhile. Hours are ample to work any time you want.

title: Fun workplace
review: What can I say it was just kinda mid. The management was mid, co workers mid but I was able to drink the chug chug from fornkte so it was OK I guess but it was just so mid

title: Experience of a lifetime
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Photography is my passion. ThanksWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Mgmt treats employees very badlyWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible. The managers were mean spirited, and abusiveWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress, angst, photos, stress, getmeoutofhere!

title: Love my job.
review: I love my job very much, just dislike most of the management. They don't care about people or show empathy. Everyone else I work with is a joy. The call out "point" system is not fair. Especially if you're a parent of a special needs child like I am.

title: Bad
review: They expect you to pick to fast but also check and call for them if you are out of stock of an item. Also point system is wack and if you're sick you will have to deal with it.

title: Cool
review: It’s an easy job just poor management. You don’t even be full time but work full time hours they barely want to work around school schedules or any medical appointments

title: Easy going place to work
review: work was easy going, minimal leadership available. Workers helped each other to learn different positions. Leadership was nice but was not around a lot to give much assistance

title: Nice
review: It was 5 days before Xmas at 4p and the place was very well stocked. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to find items I looked for. Surprisingly, I was able to zip thru checkout using the self checkout. I always like the kitchen wares there because you can find unusual, beautifully decorated plates, bowls...dinnerware, among the rest. Forget about ambiance there during holiday shopping. It can remind you of Costco in some aisles. It's all about providing as many affordable options as possible. It's best if you know exactly what you want before getting there.

title: stressful and not very interesting.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?the pay was okay I guess. It was not greatWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?everything had a timeline and if things wasn't done, it was our faultWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It felt like a cult if I am completely honest about it.What is a typical day like for you at the company?go to work. watch the sun set and it get dark, go home.

title: Pretty laid back
review: There are occasional rushes, but overall the job is pretty laid back. Now that Covid is letting up it isn’t nearly as busy at was during the peak of things.

title: It was iffy
review: It was an  okay job, half of the people didn’t do anything, just depended on how management felt that day, sometimes it was really fun because of the people, super easy.

title: Good workplace
review: Competitive Pay: Walmart has consistently raised its minimum wage in recent years and currently pays its employees an average of $15.25 per hour. This rate is higher than the federal minimum wage and is competitive with other retailers in the industry.Employee Benefits: Walmart offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, as well as a 401(k) plan with a company match. It also offers discounts on goods and services, such as cell phone plans and travel.Opportunities for Advancement: Walmart offers a wide range of job opportunities, from entry-level positions to management roles. The company provides training and development programs to help employees advance in their careers.

title: Good place but bad apples
review: Always drama a few bad apples can make it hard to stay ahead. Other then that the actual job was great, if you love to shop this is the job for you. Thank you.

title: Freindly and professional workplace
review: What is the best part of working at the company?SHIFT FLEXIBILITY AND ADHERENCE TO SCHEDULE APPLIED FORWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?COULD NOT ALWAYS MAINTAIN SCANNING QUOTA DUE TO SHIFT TIMES OF LOW TRAFFICWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?USUALY VERY FRIENDLY AND PERSONABLEWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?WAITING ON CUSTOMERS TO CHECKOUT, ZONING AREA, EMPTING TRASHES AND SWEEPING MY OWN AREA AS WELL AS THE OTHER REGISTERS. COUNTING DOWN DRAWER AND LEAVING.

title: It’s good
review: Working at Walmart was great meet a lot of nice people which made the place better but the management needs a little bit of work but overall ok. And a typical day for Walmart would just be getting up and so simple things as a cashier

title: Workplace culture
review: Pay decent but management is not always the best.  The public are hard to deal with.  Employees are not bad to work with but no one smiles much.  It’s a job.

title: Walmart
review: Walmart was decent. I loved having access to my paycheck when I needed it in between paychecks. Management was very understanding. Only worth it at that location.

title: Horrible Mangement
review: This place is horrible because of  management. Management's behavior towards associates is unacceptable and there no repercussion for their actions. I can't wait until I leave in August. I don't think I will be returning anytime soon!

title: Too frantic and clique-y
review: You’re paid the minimum they can manage, treated poorly unless you are friends of management, and the management is so lazy that if they can get some chump to do all the work for them, they’ll load everything they have on his back in a heartbeat.

title: Great staff
review: I enjoyed my time at walmart and appreciated the employees and the hire ups. I learned so much from them and I am glad I had this opportunity to work for walmart.

title: A beautiful and very productive environment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Being able to work overtime when you’d like and being able to train outside of your department if you’d like to move or get more hours. Last but not least, the opportunity to advance in your career.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The work load at times. If you are the only sales representative in your department, it’s a bit hectic getting everything finished.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?This is very dependent on where you work. People are different in every place but within my own experience, the people were always nice and very understanding. The culture was very inclusive. Everyone was supported and everyone mattered.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Working, life stories with customers, meeting new friends and seeing old ones

title: Awful
review: management doesnt care about you, expect way too much so they dont have to do their job, horrible job, never will i work there again, thanks for the $.25 raise i got after 2 whole years working there not missing a single day

title: Okay place to work
review: Besides management micromanaging, it can be fun at times. Mind your business and make your money. Abide by the point system when applicable. Beware of swamped days.

title: If I could give zeros I would
review: Worse place I have ever worked for. Terrible work environment. If you are a good worker you are expected to do the job of 6 people. Management is a joke and treats you horribly and doesn't support you in anyway. I wouldn't have my worst enemy work there. No recognition at all when you do your job well. I could go on and say so much more out of all the years I worked for but I think you'll get the hint.

title: F that place.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working garden during spring every other season was very unpleasant What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management having unrealistic expectations of individuals and to quote one of the upper management "I don't care about any of them I don't care how long they have worked here or the amount of extra work they do I'll fire them on the spot for any number of stuff they can't prove they are a dime a dozen f-them"What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Management is a social club and anyone not in it gets the work load dumped on themWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in run multiple departments with multiple call outs but that just means it all becomes your work even if it's not your departments held accountable if you can't get all the work done yourself ask for help I dare you

title: Fun place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get to work in different departments and learn how to stock and assemble furniture to display. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Having to do a task in a timely manner What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast paced and stay focused. Happy to help What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stock the shelves and update the on hand. Price changes and helping customers.

title: Enjoyed the work
review: Pay was ok & enjoyed working on vehicles. Other employees were ok to work with, only downside was having to help inside doing put away & having customers ask me questions.

title: Not bad just gets old
review: Management could definitley have been worse and co-workers were delightful, job just gets old. Pay was decent for the time an the schedule was a bit much but not ridiculous.

title: Solid workplace
review: Good work, good employees, good managers. Busy but fun work. Some customers are a bit difficult but a fun place to work at overall. Would recommend it as a first job.

title: Was good, until it wasn't...
review: Working at Walmart was stressful. Very few people in the higher management really seemed to know what they were doing. Job was good, until new rules prevented us from actually doing our job.

title: It's a job if you need one
review: It's kind of a cultists culture where the only way of doing anything, even if there's a better way, is their way. But the money isn't bad, so if a gig needed, it's a great place to start resume building.

title: Great Place
review: I worked at a the Neighborhood Walmart on Ponchartrain in Slidell, Louisiana. Management was always very friendly and it was a great environment to work in.

title: Busy place with lots of departments and lots of pallets
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay is good for a starting wage,  hard to move up anywhere because of the structure of management.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Pressure on completion of tasks before shift is over.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?A lot of the people are nice but also rude.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?I worked the overnight shift and it typically was repetitive but the pay well.

title: Horrible
review: Managers horrible.  Managers treat you horribly, they have favorites and will show you. They fire you for nothing. Run and don’t look back. I was miserable for 6 years. I stayed bc I had early morning shift and was home when kids got home.

title: Good work place
review: I enjoy working there would like to go back to Walmart the people where nice and the manager where good people good work place it's a good place to make something

title: Would not recommend
review: Sucked a lot. Would not recommend you to work here if you actual need a stable job with good livable wage. Good for high schoolers. Make promises to move or promote you and they never will. Lots of favoritism.

title: It's what you make of it
review: Fine place, however the people you work with and management make the deal, coming from a couple of stores, it can be the best place or the worst. I see it getting better, but if they keep moving in the direction of trying to only recognize teams instead of individual acheivement it wont do well

title: Needs to have some more work ethic.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting new people. Doing different projectsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?When tyou can not get off when you request a day off.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?ok not the best there is no communcation.What is a typical day like for you at the company?stressful, sad sometimes, and hard

title: Why Walmart Sucks
review: If you are not full time you cannot have PTO. You can only have PPTO. You are not given any dental, medical, etc. You are expected to work 40 hours whilst you are only part time.

title: Productive and fun environment with good compensation and responsibility.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Advancement opportunity was there if you worked hard and performed your job well. There was excellent job coaching and often you worked in a different area of the store. The opportunity to meet new people and make friends was always a plus.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?There were often deadlines to meet if you unloaded trucks or stocked shelves on night shift.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment can be fun and enjoyable and the people I worked with were helpful and hardworking.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I helped unload two semi trailers with merchandise and food. During the holiday season this could increase to three. All items were placed on pallets or carts and once the trucks were unloaded the items would be taken to the floor or grocery area and shelved. Employees were responsible to assist with cleanup of spills and breakage and warehouse cleanup at the end of shift. Employees often worked an area alone but depending on the job and location might work in pairs. Each night an employee was usually assigned a different area of responsibility in restocking the store. Employees also faced product on the shelves to make the store look presentable.

title: Fun workplace
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay and the lunch break timeWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working outside in the cold I guess What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's ok environment is nice and very multicultural What is a typical day like for you at the company?Smooth and full of some unexpected experiences

title: Long Hours, Low Pay, No Respect
review: A 50+ hour work week for a salaried manager was the rule, not the exception. Pay was low, bonuses promised but rarely paid. No respect or support from local management or home office

title: Laid back and great managers!
review: I know whenever I go into work that it is going to be a nice laid back day, and the managers are super nice and friendly people! Over all just a great place to be.

title: Paid the bills
review: Was a job to get me through high school. Paid the bills and gave me valuable experience. I didn’t love it, but I didn’t hate it. I am thankful for the opertunity

title: Not bad
review: It was an alright job. Long days. On your feet 24/7. Seeing customers come to you with carts overflowing gets annoying and honestly overwhelming at times

title: Great job experience I wish they would raise pay but overall if I was not in school this would be a great job!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The ability to pick your schedule/ staff. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They were not able to work with my school schedule so I was working more than I could and it resulted in a lot of call offsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very relax work environment most of the staff are African American and can come off as hostelWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?I was usually on the register or self checkout. Not much work just gets kind of boring standing around

title: Productive work place
review: Not a bad place to work but the night shift had 0 management. Night shift lasted until 10:00 which wasn’t necessary and management was never there past 5:00

title: Okay
review: It's okay. Don't expect to have a life. Ten hours a day six days a week are standard. It took me two months as a new hire to get the basic tools I needed to do my job.

title: Walmart
review: Walmart Is a job to have they pay enough to live.. I was a stocker and I got over time almost   every week I'll work af Walmart anyway... then they pay 15 dollars a hour now

title: it was okay
review: it was an easy job they pay $15 an hr for stocking. stocking produce was early mornings very easy. if you work during the day you work a lot in the back

title: Easy job
review: The job was easy plus you got to get off early. Only con would be the shift started at 4am. The benefits were decent. The hiring process was pretty easy as well

title: Physically and emotionally exhausting
review: I have so far not love the experience working here. It has been taxing on my mental and physical health. My team leader is so uncooperative it's insane. Its rough!

title: Stressful and extremely frustrating to work there but in some ways it's not terrible
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people I got to work with, not including management. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management was always coaching others and myself on not doing our job correctly (even though it was done correctly), or coaching us when we wouldn't do it. Either way we were never doing anything right (according to management).What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I am not a people person by any means but I loved helping and associating with customers and all the different cultures that were in our small town. It was interesting to learn new ways of cooking, languages, and even how they talked to one another. However, it was highly stressful. Always short-handed and seemed like all the co-workers were always trying to get each other in trouble and this was management included. What is a typical day like for you at the company?My day consisted of talking myself into going to work as I sat in the parking lot for 20 minutes. Then I would head in and help people at self checkout and try to stay busy and avoid management.

title: Great job for no experience
review: One of the few jobs I think you could make a lifelong career off of without college or trade school or apprenticeship. Great benefits and supports and helps pay for said educations.

title: labor intensive and no AC
review: Had tough work conditions when unloading trucks in the back of the store in the summer and no air conditioning. Many folks slacked off so I had to do more or the work wouldn't get done.

title: Easy work with a very small chance of advancement unless you're a brown noser
review: It really depends on whos in management, the work itself is extremely easy but being a hard worker with a great work ethic is more punishing than rewarding which in itself says a lot about the job but as an entry level retail job its not terrible for a 1st job. Just don't stick around too long, you'll know when too long is too long when your mental health starts to deteriorate

title: Hit or miss
review: Teaming was the worst thing to come out of Walmart. Mismanaged teams and not enough guidance on how things should be divided. Over zealous coaches ruining the experience with their lack of knowledge or basic know how.

title: Great Pay for Grocery Store Work
review: I have heard many grocery stores still paying low wages but I believe Walmart pays pretty well for being a normal associate/stocker at a grocery store.

title: Absolutely horrible
