review: What is the best part of working at the company?Don’t it sucks, they say there family oriented but there not they don’t care about you they only care about the money they makeWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers every thing about them What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Horrible they don’t care about you or your family What is a typical day like for you at the company?Well if you enjoy getting screamed at by customers and your managers then this is the job for you

title: Good place to work
review: Very friendly supervisors , can be busy at times but everyone helps out to keep things smooth. Hours can vary but they work with your schedule. Overall a good place.

title: I put in10 years experiences working as Reclamation receiver at Walmart I learn to enjoy working with customers to make a better place
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I really enjoy interacting with the different customers & knowing I’m having a positive impact on their buying experience, & working in a team environment & learned a lot by collaborating with others members. ♥️What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Hazards encountered.. & do not utilize workers skillsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Team work makes dreams work… employees share ideas freely and work closely together in order to get the job done right I set my mind and focus to make positive things What is a typical day like for you at the company?On my typical day I start by checking my Area, so I can get everything organized and start off my day and then look over my to do list and get started on my project that I have my top priority

title: Good Job For College
review: Was a nice place to work while going to college. The deli was always busy so time went by quickly.If you're looking for something part time to pay the bills it is great.

title: Stressful workplace with not enough help, putting MUCH more stress on people that are there,
review: What is the best part of working at the company?fellow employees, helping customers with finding things.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Never getting supervisory help RIGHT AWAY, or within a reasonable amount of time. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I have no answer. The culture was ok, the environment was VERY stressful.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Cashiering in the garden center, helping customers with questions and finding things. I no longer work there.

title: Good pay, Poorly run
review: In the past y years the pay has increased amazingly but with that comes the constant restructuring of all stores and leaves you unsure how long before you get you hours cut.  No flexibility for family needs or any needs.

title: Walmart
review: Most definitely a laid back environment beside a couple of manger and the low pay one of the easiest jobs I ever had I understand why people work there for 5/10/20/30 years

title: Very stressful
review: Very stressful job. Some of the coworkers are great, others act like they are bosses when they aren't. Manager has a type A personality who micromanages everything. Always hear her saying that we can't have customers waiting but she leaves them waiting longer than anybody. When you ask her about something the response is usually "check the wire".  Typically fast paced job with not a lot of room for errors.

title: Exploitive
review: They take advantage of employees and expect them to push through being sick. The attendance points are also ridiculous. I don't recommend as employees are also severely under paid

title: Good In store management
review: Flexible scheduling, good team. Work with me whenever they can. Company directives can be a bit off the wall from time to time but as a part time technician I have no complaints.

title: Plantation
review: The pay is great but that’s it. Management sucks. They are rude and not helpful. The people lead isn’t helpful either. Work all holidays and don’t get many paid days off.

title: Eh
review: It was an easy job when I was a teen. Not much more I can say past that. I only worked there for a few months. The training was ok although they didn't teian me for the shift I'd be working, and the pay was pretty good at the time but that was quite a few years ago.

title: Great way to move up in company. Fun and family like
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Paid time, off set schedules.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Inventory They let customers talk to you any type of wayWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?My store manager is awesome along with our coaches. It's like family. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy, fun at times and stressful at times
position: Ecommerce Department Manager/Currently Team Lead of online grocery.

title: Okay
review: The work wasn’t too bad. My coworkers were excellent people who helped make time fly by. The managers were also decent people who cared about their employees.

title: Flexible hours & decent pay
review: This was a great place to work during college. Hours were flexible and management was for the most part very approachable and friendly. I would recommend this job to anyone who needs part time/full time job.

title: Great people with poor management
review: Worked for a short time later in the evening. The employees I worked with were great, but I didn't receive too much instruction from management for my first shifts. I had to learn directly from my peers, which wasn't bad since they were good sports. Back-breaking work, but if you're a strong and capable person, it should be a walk in the park.

title: Life balance great
review: It was a great job to have. I really enjoyed working with Walmart and I would not have had it any other way. Walmart was an amazing company to work for.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Managers suck they are always watching you on the cameras . Feels like a prison. You can’t ever sit down or barley take a break. Mangers always focus on the bad never reward for the good

title: Meh
review: The company really doesn't care much for its employees honestly. The point system sucks and really doesn't work for people with families, but they don't care.

title: Horrible Company to Work for
review: Management is awful, hours are horrible, not treated like an employer should treat an employee. Harmful working conditions. No respect from any managers.

title: Weird cult like vibe and mistreated by customers.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Maybe the discount. But other than that, nothing.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You're going to be overworked. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Cult like. The weird worship of Sam Walton is creepy. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Hit the ground running. Keep going until it's time to leave.

title: Horrible management
review: The workload is insane because they cannot keep people employed there. That means all of the extra work is put on the current employees. You are told that you’re slow, that they’re embarrassed of your performance (as a group) and you only get praised when they get to go home on time. They’re gossipy and some are intimidating. In my time there 3 managers quit. I was there for less than a year. I witnessed managers gossiping about employees in the aisles- which makes you wonder “do they talk about me like that too?” By far this is the most unprofessional place I’ve ever worked at or heard about. We were told by a manager “if I gotta come to work sick, then so do you” please if you’re thinking of working at this Walmart- RUN. Get a job literally anywhere else.

title: Productive
review: A great place to work with great benefits.  It's best to just focus on your job, and stay away from the gossip. Hours are great. They will work with you on your schedule

title: It's a job
review: It was ok. Management was ok and it is a good starter job for anyone looking for work. Both my wife and I have worked here in our younger years. It was a paycheck.

title: Experience
review: Management is the main reason for my distain. I hope that they will make some much needed improvements in how they treat staff and customers. Hope this helps

title: Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people that work there not including management What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Understaffed underpaid overworked and bullcrap system I got fired for having the flu and told they dont take doctors notes like wtf 😒What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful work environment management helps you zero percent of the time 🙂 you could have a line of people yelling at you and they don't come and help at allWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Great coworkers but management telling you your replaceable and screaming at you just for doing your job

title: Poor Management
review: Unprofessional upper management. Quick to cut hours for any reason at all. Especially to part time workers. Definitely a good stepping stone for getting into customer service though.

title: Es un ambiente activo
review: En esta empresa el ambiente laboral es activo e interesante puesto a que siempre aprendes algo nuevo. Te preparan para crecer y formar tu carrera a largo plazo .

title: In my store a ace to get a paycheck with doing the least pissible
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Insurance benefits other then that there are noneWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The fact that corporate has lost all awareness of not caring about hourly associates What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Can be great depending on the store if indeed that management can manage and keep people

title: productive and fun workplace
review: not too bad. it's a decent first job to get some skills working with people in a retail space. the schedule was less than ideal and sometimes you would have to deal with terrible people.

title: A lot to learn
review: Management was not too helpful,only a handful of them were. It was fast paced so the time went by but you were also asked to do a lot of jobs that weren't yours and some of those jobs made more than you which I don't think is right. The breaks and long lunch was nice. Point system is terrible

title: Not appreciated
review: There’s a reason Walmart is always understaffed especially at the front, the management doesn’t care for their employees I worked here 2 years straight out of high school and I regret it. The assistant store manager at the time was okay, but almost everybody else was rude and didn’t care about their own employees. Wouldn’t recommend

title: We can’t really have fun I won’t cap n lie like other people
review: It’s a good place to meet new people yeah but some rules are js horrible I understand it’s a company n all but lol lord if y’all can see what I see, also rushing my working or watching me as I work

title: Productive
review: Looking for a job where you can move up for a better opportunity for this job. A lot of differ opportunities are around, you may come in under one title but you have some many things to make you feel good and comfortable to come to work.

title: Bit of a mess
review: I worked for about six months in apparel overnight. This job was so taxing and difficult to manage. Apparel was everywhere in the back and I kind of couldn’t leave until it had improved.

title: They don’t care about the person they self
review: They just cared about if u was doing the job good and they would take advantage of the hard workers and overwork them They did not really care about you just the work u did for them they would put more on you then pay worth and act like they couldn’t see it while the mangers walked around doing the bare minimum

title: Horrible point system
review: Managers don’t care. They get sick, get you sick, then fire you. They have a point system. 5 points and your fired. They do not care if you have family or children.

title: Hated it
review: Management was horrible don’t work here always drama they give you so much work and if it’s not done to their standards they make an issue glad I left

title: Fun
review: It was a decent job . Just temporary the pay was pretty good. Management however was a joke. Always had an attitude but I didn’t pay them any mind I came in did my 8 and clocked out.

title: Is okay
review: It's good, depends on the day,some customers where nice, other not so much, flexible,well only sometimes,or when it wasn't busy, other than that it ok

title: Ok workplace
review: Ok, minimum pay for the work your doing work schedule and unorganized, fast hiring process.Ok if your looking for something quick or part time  temporary

title: Not good
review: Worked there 7 years. Raises are a complete joke! 10 cents every 6 months! Was working full time and was told due to attendance I could not be full time on paper therefore no full-time benefits. I would definitely say go back to school. This is literally a dead end job.

title: Great Hours and pay
review: They pay well here and have great pay. Also, your off on saturday and sunday! There's a wide range of employees that come through that you get to interact with and serve.

title: Understaffed and Poor Management
review: Most of the rank and fill workers are solid, but poor staffing and management butting heads kills things. Overall, its a decent place to work at for the pay. Of course, its Wal-Mart too, so take that as you will.

title: They are very strict with their employees and it used to be fun
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They pay good and they have a great loa and can be understanding.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They don't like to work around your availability and don't accept doctors' notes.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?There is tons of drama and what made the job fun they would change it to where it wasn't fun.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Basically you would start with the job your assigned to but then end up in other departments helping out.

title: You get to work with & meet alot of interesting people from all walks of life.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The employee benefits. Also, you get to see what's on the clearance aisle before all the good stuff is gone. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When checkout lines are long. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?About average for a company of that size.  Idk ... I kept to myself. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Time flies, because you're so busy.

title: Tough
review: They will over work and if you ask for help you receive none. Sometimes it’s only one cashier and no other lanes are open. Overall don’t recommend this location

title: Work elsewhere
review: Work elsewhere, you have been warned.they will overwork and underpayment you. I didn't enjoy this job at all and I'm glad that I left. Don't apply for this

title: Not a great place to work but can be something if you are desperate
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Hours can be good but are often left to the whims of the managerWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Managers are typically very antsy toward lower staffWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The "family" culture which if you know what that mean then you know why its badWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Normal day to day is just stocking, moving objects, checking inventory

title: Okay place
review: When I worked here we had wonderful management but quickly all the good ones started to leave. I realized that I needed to get out of there fast. Hope it’s gotten better for others.

title: Safe and comfortable work enviroment
review: Walmart does everything in it's power to make the job as easy and convenient as possible. I would highly recommend this job to anyone who is willing to do fair and easy work.

title: Awful management
review: I am a current employee there, when I say the management is god awful, I really mean it. They hardly give you enough time to take care of your family and loved ones. My husband has cancer and I am his care giver. We have to go to and from the hospital and I barely get the time off to do that. I don’t know why people work there.

title: Not a fun job
review: Not a good place to work. Management was awful, always getting on to people for dumb stuff. Customers were so rude and managers never had your back. They just care about their money.

title: Sales floor associate
review: I mean it is walmart so you kind of know what to expect. But to be honest, for a retail job, it wasnt really even that bad. Wages were above minimum wage and the work was pretty easy

title: Not bad work but they arent honest about what you will have to do
review: I was told id be slicing sandwiches and working in the deli but Ive had to move all around the store and move heavy cargo. If you are ok with having to lift heavy boxes and ok with not knowing what each day will hold then it isnt bad work.

title: its fine
review: it's okay for a first job. i did this for a couple of months and then i left. the workers were nice and i enjoyed working with the general public all in all

title: Never enough help
review: Always asked for help. Never received any. Bosses were rude and don't care about their employees. They would write someone up over the smallest things. I wouldn't recommend then at all

title: Fast pace and heavy lifting required.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Efforts were made to provide me with a schedule fitted to my availability. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Meeting expected time of completion. Many employees even long term workers have all expressed this issue. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It can seem friendly and easy going, but leadership’s approach of time being met closer to EOD tends to leaders to scramble. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Arrive early, observe freight to best estimate my approach of effectively and efficiently meeting times. Would search for equipment to best assist me.

title: Fun workplace, supervisors and managers are great
review: I loved working for Walmart. The supervisors and management cared about you and making sure the job is going good for you. I liked all my co-workers, everybody was always there to help when needed.

title: Walmart bad workplace
review: Walmart has reduced associate hrs by 12.5% across the storeWithout asking the same of management. Overall not a place I would recommend to work at. Coaches areYoung and immature and have noIdea how to manage

title: Look for a better job
review: worst job i ever had , actually being yelled at by managers for not finishing tasks on time when the time you are given is never enough to complete them, pay is low and not worth it, the whole working environment is toxic where management pins your coworkers against each other, making it a very hostile work place where everyone is yelling at each other for not working fast enough, also you are very replaceable which you will be reminded of regularly.

title: stay to yourself, not productive
review: the team lead will try to get you fired by telling lies to the managers above them other than that it is laid back and a good place to work just don’t let them get to you

title: It was work.
review: Because it's retail, management expectations often change for your tasks during the day. You might start a task and be pushed to something else, multiple times. Expect nothing, do as you're told, and go home for the best peace of mind.

title: Fun, Easy, Never a boring day
review: Fun workplace, you will always see something fun. Management isn't horrible it's very equal no favoritism just stick to yourself and you will be good

title: Bad hours
review: Bad hours, long nights, mean people, management wouldn’t have your side, nothing worked well, machines didn’t work, short breaks, over worked and not enough oay

title: The employees
review: They understand the meaning of work and work together although it can be tough. I like the time request off that is provided for us. The lunches are an hour long which helps me settle and relax

title: Running up hill
review: Never feel like you can complete a task fully because you are being pulled everywhere because of lack of staffing. At times it was fun but generally not.

title: Tolerable
review: Typical day was spent racing around trying to do the work of 20 with a staff of 7. Super busy and management often will not help you or doesn't care too/claims no one is available to help you (eye roll) I had some great coworkers who tried very hard and stayed late often to help me who stayed late almost every night for 2 years.

title: Stocker
review: It's not hard work but it's honest work. If you're looking for something to make some side money while in schooling, etc it's not a bad place. Flexible scheduling and ample training.

title: Ok
review: Just a normal job.....-- You show up do what your supposed to....-- for the day and that's it.....-- Ok pay.....-- Ok environment.....not alot of complaints

title: boring
review: boring to work at and we don’t get paid enough managers don’t care about associates only 15 an hour to deal with rude customers um no love the breaks though

title: Simple work
review: I enjoyed my time. I found the job to be quite repetitive and simple. Doing the same thing everyday for 8 hours really drained me mentally. There are chances to move up if you work there long enough. The pay was decent, however walmart raise their national minimum wages and mine stayed the same.

title: This job sucks
review: The management sucked, they choose who they like and if they didn’t like you they would give you an absurd amount of work to do and if you didn’t finished, it was your fault. They cause problems and you can’t miss a day for anything or you lose your job. I do not recommend this job.

title: Low pay fast paced
review: Not worth the money. Too much stress and not enough pay. Of the amount of work associates do they are not compensated well. Probably best for students who are trying to become pharmacists

title: Great opportunities
review: Lots of room for growth but leadership sometimes holds top performers back for the sake of the business. Benefits not the best insurance especially with very high deductibles and max out of pocket.

title: Horrible
review: Very stressful.  No support.  Managers lie. Don't do nothing just want the money. Could careless about store. If u don't have support system from managers u have nothing.  Managers just walk around.  They don't work. How do you expect the people to work. Employees are never reprimanded for careless work that's why it's continued.  Overall not properly managed. Don't go there to work because you will be miserable no team players. Stores will never run smoothly if Managers don't work. They expect associates to do all the work . And if u don't get it done you are making Managers look bad. Oh well maybe one day eyes will be wide open. That day I don't c coming.  Like i mentioned before once a associates become Managers they change into a whole different person. Better wake up and realize who is buttering your bread. You will get alot more done n properly done if the Managers work with you. Instead of walking around with a stick in your ....Walmart is walmart.

title: Workplace
review: Pressure and stress are two factors that will motivate you or leave you down. If you don't handle either well on a good day, you won't make it too far. Other than that, the friends you will meet while working will be very good company for those days you may not feel so good.

title: Ok pay
review: Worked nights for multiple years and never had any issues arise. Covid transformed the environment and many overall changes happened in rapid succession. Demand became intense but overall the experience was fine

title: All bad
review: Walmart is one of the worst places I have ever worked for. They treat their associates like trash and their management even worse. I work for Walmart for 3 years and went through three store managers.

title: Not fun
review: Breaks not so good. Less hoursIf you have to use the restroom you are to hold till someone can come can be up to an hour of waitA lot of preference Not worth it

title: Management quite strange. Work Fulfilling.
review: I worked at this store in 2018, and while I enjoyed working with customers, especially regulars, Management would make strange decisions. I once got in trouble for telling a child not to stand on top of a self-checkout register even though it was a safety issue and could potentially damage equipment.

title: Currently in orientation
review: i will let you all know how it goes, but remember that experiences can be good or bad on how you perceive, how you flow with or around it, take no negativity from anyone, but don’t be negative, remember if you can’t attract try the positive approach :)

title: Phenomenal
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I have freedom, I don't have to be in the house, I meet more new people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?the most stressful part about working at the company is picking up somebody else slackWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Quiet,laid back,fun,and very relaxing What is a typical day like for you at the company?Normal,easygoing, calm and collective

title: It was decent
review: The work wasn’t really hard to be honest, it’s just the managers that were annoying to deal with . They had you standing in the same spot for hours waiting to go on break.

title: Decent / unfair
review: I honestly can't complain, about the hours. I was hire, as a pt employee, I worked hard, every weekends, and holidays, rarely called off. I noticed how this company uses you, wouldn't schedule, people, I had to work many times 3 department's by myself. one year force us to work the holidays times, or we would get 2 occurrence if we called off

title: Easy
review: This was my first job, was a super easy laid back environment. Only reason I left was to move on to a better paying job. Would definitely recommend as a good place to start.

title: Managers pick favorites and a lack of organization.
review: I got fired because I was sick and Walmart gives no sick days unless you hit certain qualifications. They also aren’t very flexibleWith school. They don’t care if you have tests or your classes run late. It’s only good to get job experience but once you’ve been there 2-3 months you should leave.

title: Great opportunity for self employed people
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Freedom of being my own boss and their incentives What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Long waiting times for the associates to get the items and bringing them outWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is peaceful and the culture is chillWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Pickups and deliveries to various areas in the surrounding areas

title: Team Leads & Coach are BAD MANAGERS
review: All they do is tell you what to do and basically take advantage of you and your life outside of work. “Your work should be beneficial to us” says the coach on team lead’s side with no care in the world about their regular associates. I would not recommend you work there EVER.

title: Profit is king
review: When I worked here for 5 years and then another 6 months a couple years later, I found out that this company does not care about presentation, or the customer. This job will work you to the bone and it's only goal is to make sales and bring in profit for itself. Management will try to force you into an unflexible schedule, try to guilt you into overtime, throw away your bonuses and write you up for being sick, or in my case, going to my grandmother's funeral. The management will practically forget that you exist until something is not done. They rarely go hands on either, electing to order you around instead of doing a simple task right in front of them before disappearing to hang out with half a dozen other managers in the back office, regardless of the manpower or time your team has. They will also ignore the fact that almost every piece of equipment is broken, including carts, jacks, dock plates, dock lights, handheld computers, even faulty exposed wiring hanging from the cieling. When I was an unloader, management seemed to forget that we existed, until the end of the shift when things weren't done within a strict time frame. You would be expected to force freight onto the shelves when there wasn't room and the write you up for assisting customers instead of working product.The training was minimal too, definitely a figure it out yourself type of attitude. They will not teach you the proper way to handle customers, they will not teach you how to use handheld, they will not teach you how to use cash registers or powered equipment, even at your request.The bonuses - more...

title: Okay and Chill Place to Work
review: It's am okay place to work at. Just focus on your task and you should be okay. Don't get involved in gossip. You can have down time if you just focus on your tasks.

title: Soulsucking job
review: Worked here for almost 5 years. Don't do that. Walmart is good for being a temporary job. If you are good at your job at Walmart, you will NEVER get a promotion because they can't afford to replace your station.

title: Alright at best, stress-inducing at worst
review: Decent starting job but the management here is either inept, or rude. They will only ever tell you if there's a problem or if you did something wrong. Almost never motivate or compliment you for your hard work.There's a very select few higher-ups who are actually very cool and are honestly my favorite managers.Turnover rate is very high. I've seen so many people come and go during my time here. Most of the time their reasons are because of the management being extremely rude to them, or they are overworked and are expected to get everything done when it isn't possible by themselves, whether it's due to some ridiculous method a manager wants you to complete a task with, or simply because there's too much to do with so few people.

title: Worst
review: Management sucked and always over worked employees.. turnover rate is crazy..No room for advancement..hard to get days off regardless of if it’s an emergency

title: Fast-paced
review: If you like a fast-paced job, then this job is for you. This job required you to be multitasking and you learn a lot how to deal with people. The most challenging part about the job is dealing with people and meeting the company's goals.

title: Awful!
review: Stay away from Walmart altogether!Cheap, irresponsible and poor management. “Walmart SUCKS". It's not even worth giving one star. The system is also messed up. In addition, my account is arbitrarily closed, making the rehiring process even more difficult. NEVER WORK HERE!

title: No training at all
review: I’m a cake decorator with lots of experience and I guess they assumed I didn’t need any training on the way Walmart does things. Their attendance system is a joke and it’s not explained in the handbook.

title: Mediocre
review: It's a decent job to get a paycheck, but the ability to move up is very limited. If you want career advancement, you need to find another place to work. Management often has unrealistic expectations, but there is rarely any accountability for the people who need it the most.

title: Eh
review: It was alright. I don’t think the management did all they could to make the environment safe for others. There was a lot of gossip that use to get passed around and I HATE gossip.

title: It’s okay
review: Pays good if you been there for years and stepped up and down from management. You are just a number. Good health benefits with full time. Picking up a lot of other peoples slack.

title: Fun workplace
review: The managers seemed like tyrants, but it was fun to work their being a highschooler and having a first job. The pay was good for a 16 year old about (700) every two weeks, The strike system they have is stupid though and they don't have flexible schedules

title: Productive & busy
review: Very busy department with lots to do. Maybe stressful for some but fun for others. Not too hard to move up, just be wary of favoritism. hate the point system but overall isn’t a terrible place to work

title: Not fun place
review: They are choosing their friends for higher positions and expect you to do everything in the Walmart and all the managers lying about everything and when you ask them to raise your minimum wage, they saying they can’t, they cannot do that, but they will do for the friends of them

title: ok
review: Was an ok place to work for. Customers were the biggest issue. Coworkers were fun. Good hours to stand at the register and scan items. Selling credit cards was a little rough but made it work. Was "promoted" to returns and HATED my life. This lady returned a dead fish with no receipt or proof of purchase, then scolded me for not wanting to assist her. Overall I would work there again if if absolutely had to.

title: Don't recommend
review: Its walmart,  what you see in the store is what you can expect as an employee, no fulltime position unless manager. No overtime but need to complete task is frustrating

title: Easy if you’re patient
review: Great pay for beginners and the amount work and effort needed to be put in. The only problem is staff of all levels being unnecessarily rude to you for absolutely no reason at all.

title: fun
review: it was nice and hood and i lieks it but vete hard and eveyone wa anxiety there were many guests and it was stressful but ways and idk it was fun yes or n

title: Rewarding benefits and great flexibility!
review: The head of management in my department was the best manager I’ve ever had, such a kind and hard working person. There was a bit of laziness amongst some employees which in turn does make the job more difficult because it’s a team oriented position, however; like I said before the manager was pretty good about trying to distribute work equally so that no one was doing it all by themselves etc. The benefits were the best I’ve ever seen for regular part time jobs compared to others such as the paid time off that you get even as just a part time employee and the tuition reimbursement. Overall a great job for fellow future college students like myself.

title: Management is horrible
review: They tend to leave you high and dry. Also expects a 3 man job to be done by 1 in a time limit. They order you around to do many things all at once with no help and still gets you in trouble if something was not done. They also expect you you not talk talk to anyone. With that they also will not hire so they can have bigger bonuses. Upside most coworkers around are amazing.

title: Muy buen ambiente laborar
review: En lo personal yo lleve mi solicitud directamente a la empresa...y ese mismo dia me quede a laborar.Hay buen trabajo en equipo...

title: Physical job
review: Being a warehouse worker requires physical stamina. Specially if you work in the night shift. It was nice to work in the facility until they made some update and got rid of a lot of people with no clear basis. People got overworked, resulting to several injuries. People you work with in the facility are very nice.

title: I liked who I worked with
review: I liked who I worked with, managers were not good, though. Wanted me to stay late a lot, with no overtime. Managers gave good jobs to their friends. Never had enough sackers. Wanted to send all customers to self-serve. Heavy boxes. Not enough help to lift.

title: Pros and cons
review: There has been a lot of positives that have come from working here, coworkers for the most part, certain management. But there have also been a lot of downs, some managers can be difficult to work with, you are stretched thin as far as help, and you feel like you're overworked and burnt out.

title: Management
review: They expect different departments to do other people’s jobs while they still have stuff to do in there department and for example the auto care center had a lot of cars and only two technicians and the management demanded to not work on the cars that are waiting to get serviced to go work inside to help which left no one in the garage to do the cars and customers complained and management just brushed it off

title: Hard Work for not enough pay
review: I worked for a Walmart DC in Kansas. Overall, I liked the people I worked with and learned new stuff pretty often.The work itself was very manual labor required and there was minimal safety nets for if you were struggling.

title: Bad company
review: The management doesn't care about employees and you are not paid enough for amount of work doing in company.  Management doesn't appreciate employees.

title: Cashier but actually Every Job
review: Was employed as a cashier, ended up working as a cart pusher for weeks before I left due to short staffing. They don't like to see their worker being not busy.

title: fun workplace and easy pace
review: Easy play to work and get experiencemanagement is okay, not a lot of people work in Boerne so its hard to find people because we always short on cashiers

title: Good pay
review: Good pay but managers are kinda rude. They cut your hours and sometimes your work a full shift other days you can only work half a shift. Not a physically demanding job

title: Alright
review: Job was easy, management is not that great, you work on your own the most of the night, and sometimes they let you use earbuds and sometimes they don’t let you use them. 2 breaks and a lunch, not as flexible with schedule as they say they are, or at least with my experience.

title: Decent pay
review: Decent pay, can move up to different positions but only if you fit in with the right people. You get treated badly but certain team leads. They make you do they're work when they're making all the money. If you take up for yourself you will get wrote up or threatened being fired.

title: It's okay
review: It's okay place to work.its a job it pays some bills good job for college student or part time job.you really don't advance though like I was saying it's a neat part time job

title: work
review: trucks very well taken care ofhometimegreat pay. I loved travels on a set schedule. I was always on time to delivery.I wish they paid more. overall good

title: Flexible scheduling
review: They can work with your schedule, and what you put into it is what you get out of it. Just make sure to plan ahead in order to not get a point for something that could have been avoided.

title: You only stay for the co workers
review: Overall it’s a horrible working environment. You are constantly overworked, under appreciated and told to do better but with zero resources. The only reason anyone stays is for the co workers.

title: Terrible work environment
review: Managers are for the customers they don't care about the employees. Also they talk to you how they want to talk to you. It needs better management and new supervisors.

title: I want to work here
review: I am a good  work and I will be on time also do my best with the work and I love having conversations with the  employees and I love  working in a warehouse

title: Great for just existing
review: Basically a job where you would exist in day to day and never know what position you would be in and never really be prepared for it since it changed daily. I was a cashier one day then the next day I would stock and then usually I would be put in the electronics department to do nothing because no one came to electronics on night shift.

title: stressful
review: very stressful job when nights are slow its ok but whenever their is a bigger truck you get thrown by yourself in some departments and expected you finish everything

title: Sosiable
review: Son buenos y sosiable trata cada día más. Dek tu trabajo sea más fasil para ti donde no te latime y pueda tener mayor rendimiento

title: Everything you can expect from Walmart.
review: I cant complain. It is what it is. Basic Walmart Job. If you know you know. If you don't, you'll find out. I don't really know what else to say. Pays decent. I'd do it again.

title: Favoritism, don’t accept doctors notes
review: The only good thing about this job is that there are guaranteed hours. They do not care about their employees unless you are their favorite. Customers are rude and smelly. Point system sucks and so many people are constantly quitting or being fired. Walk 3-5 miles daily

title: It’s a good first job but the environment it creates is toxic.
review: So many people are not working with a team mentality. Most are working separately and towards their own goals. People will lie and deceive others just to try clawing their way into a higher position. Management is usually a joke and no matter how hard you work, and how much you have to do, they will expect more. I was a back door receiver for nearly three years and I was also made the Officially Unofficial Alcohol Department Manager. This meant that I had to check in the orders, stock the department, rotate freight and top stock, and clear out the bins in the back room, on top of my duties as receiver. Although no one was supposed to have overtime, I was essentially forced into working 12 hour days without repercussions, just so that I could get both jobs accomplished. I had no help in Alcohol. The whole department and its freight was worked solely by me for years. I received no extra compensation for it. I was made to feel that if I didn’t get it done, that I would be written up and/or fired.

title: What you expect
review: I worked at this location a few years ago as a stocker on the night shift.  The job was ok, not horrible and not great.  Night shift was preferable because there were fewer customers.

title: Great job depending on the store
review: Great job i spent almost three years at walmart from the time i was 16 to 19. First year, i was a cashier and I’d overall say i loved it. However there we obviously flaws i didnt like tho

title: It was an ok place to work but could have been a bit friendlier
review: The breaks are good....the environment is good.....have to put up with hateful customers....so can get very stressful at times.....alot of customers have their own clicks....don't like that

title: Productive, Okay place to be mentally
review: Terrible structure very unorganized, terrible scheduling and miscommunication. A typical day was good if you were to be scheduled for it. Flexible hours I suggest it is a good starter job for teenagers.

title: Very horrible experience working for Walmart, the company does not care for its employees.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Not a good company to work for, 60hr work week minimum on salary pay.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not a work life balance, you are expected to be there at any time.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?No work life balance, the company does not care about its employees What is a typical day like for you at the company?You start early morning and are expected to work a minimum of 10 hour shift daily, many days you are expected to stay past 10 hours

title: Good position
review: Flexible schedule and good pay. Learning the different screens to use was easy and simple. Working from home with kids is definitely beneficial. Weekend schedule easy as well.

title: Ok but too demanding
review: Doing a whole lot of carts by yourself isn't very fun. But most of the time it's required. I've been there almost 6 months and have had 2 coaches and multiple team leads.

title: Productive and easy
review: Smaller store. Lots of great personalities..Not enough hours to complete tasks expected daily Store manager was difficult to please and always seemed angry

title: Good opportunity
review: They gave me a chance to work  bc and learn.  I was part of a good team.  The hours were ok.  I was doing this while looking for a full time job.  The managers were good.

title: Pay is unfair!
review: Working at Walmart, there is no room for promotions. Sure, you can move to a completely new department for a pay increase but living in todays world, they do not pay a livable wage unless you’re apart of management.

title: Stressful and not good for your mental.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working at the Walmart is Going to lunch.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The MOST stressful thing about working at the Walmart is the customers.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Teamwork is what they strive for but some of the workers aren’t a team player.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Working until my back n feet fall off and I’m stressed out.

title: Horrible and Demoralizing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Leaving was the best part of Walmart. Management was toxic. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being expected to know something before you have been trained. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic culture with a lot of turnover.

title: Stagnant, Lack of Growth
review: Came here out of college, was oversold about the position. Figured I would take the role to get my foot in the door while picking up great experience on the way. Boy was I wrong. If you want to work in Excel all day while calling service providers while calling yourself a "Business Analyst" this is the place place for you. Otherwise I would aim for a role in Walmart Global Tech or avoid the company all together.

title: Hated it
review: Terrible management. Will constantly make you feel invalid and takes no action or accountability if you ever face any sort of issues within the company

title: Fun place
review: I think the job was a fun place to work and would work there again hours were good and the breaks are ok I think that there would be the better places

title: Lazy worker
review: No training so the workers do very little work. Just enough so they don’t get in trouble. Also don’t like theirs vacation time policies. They take you vacation time to pay for your holiday days

title: It helps with the bills.
review: As an unhappy Walmart employee, working at this retail giant has been a frustrating experience. The pay is barely enough to cover living expenses, and the workload is overwhelming with understaffed departments. Management is disorganized and unsupportive, often leaving employees to fend for themselves when it comes to dealing with difficult customers. The company culture promotes efficiency over employee wellbeing, resulting in a lack of job satisfaction and high turnover rates. Additionally, the lack of opportunity for growth and advancement makes it difficult to see a future at Walmart. Overall, working at Walmart has been a disappointing and demotivating experience

title: Everyone is there to help
review: The job is not a bad job. It’s actually one of the few good ones I had. They always helped without being rude and never minded extra guidance. The only problem is the customers being rude which very rarely happened when I was employed.

title: Management is horrible and unhelpful
review: If there’s a problem you can’t solve, management are never around to get help. They’re always hiding in offices while they make all the other employees do their work.

title: Look Elsewhere For Work
review: I was told I couldn't keep my job unless I performed inappropriate favors for certain staff.  When I reported this, the company didn't really seem to care.

title: Exhausted
review: Tired of being on my own working freight and some co worker are rude and just so mean. The higher ups like team leads talk badly about others. Very not family friendly environment

title: Awesome co-worker in the morning
review: Great, and tremendous place to work, could use more raises for know experience,awesome management, ppl like giving 5 stars if you don't harass them so much, enjoy conversations with customers 😀

title: It depends on the store
review: I like my coworkers and the pay. It can be tough in stores that don't have overlap for pharmacists. I'm lucky to work with another pharmacist for most of the day on most days except the weekends

title: Nice
review: Absolutely wonderful place to work. Everyone is treated fairly. The company does a good job taking care of the drivers. Almost everyone has a New Truck in New uniforms and the benefits are really really good.

title: Productive workplace
review: Good job that pays well. 40 hour work week. It doesn’t matter if you are part time or not. It’s  fairly easy working there, but the management makes the job harder than what it needs to be. Great co workers but in need of better management.

title: Micromanaging to the highest extent
review: I wouldn’t wish this job on my worst enemy. Don’t do it. I suppose it would be good for a young kid with no previous experience, but I can only imagine there’s better options elswehere

title: Work as a team and respect
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The Best part is the team work,customer service and then help them out What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Black Friday night and also the Christmas What is the work environment and culture like at the company?To be honest and respect to everyone What is a typical day like for you at the company?To be happy and smile to your customers

title: The customers were awesome
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The nest part of working there is the customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers are 2 faced  they are nice to your face then talk about you behind your back  What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Some of it was ok then you have people that work in your department that spy on you and run to management What is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers find what they want

title: They are a team at Walmart
review: I worked all over Walmart jobs easy the people sweet very big get everything you need there the manager can be more helpful but loved doing anything around there

title: Great staff
review: Staff (pharmacists and technicians) are friendly, personable and knowledgeable. A great learning environment. Company-wide focus is on inclusion and employee well-being.

title: Low pay and more work then it’s worth
review: Management has a lot of favoritism here with its employees. You will hardly ever get the days off you need and the pay is small compared to the amount of work that you do.

title: It's not the best work environment but it pays the bills
review: It's not what you know, it's who you know if you're trying to move up or move around. Some days are ok but most days are spent counting the time to leave and go home. If you have a good manager then you'll have a better experience, otherwise having a bad manager will make the experience dreadful, regardless of the job position. It's not the worse place to have a job but they will pretty much hire anyone who's willing to work. Customers are pretty cool for the most part but you will get a karen or ken from time to time, especially if you work in returns or money services. What makes it worthwhile is some of people you'll come across from different walks of life. I've made a few good friends working there. It's kind of like high school in a way. Just don't go around telling anyone your personal business, unless you want the whole store to know. Some people who work there only thrive on gossip. Trust me, your business spreads around the store like a wildfire, so don't fool around with anyone there for example and stay lowkey. Be mindful of who you trust in that place because not everyone there has the best of intentions. Just do the work and get out.

title: Semi productive fast paced
review: Poor communication. High turn over. Didn't learn much. Management never on th same page and constantly changing their minds as to how to do things. Most coworkers were nice and easy to get along with.

title: It’s absolutely the best trucking job I’ve ever had
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Being treated like a vital part of the team . What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They expect a lot because the pay a lot What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Safety and inclusion are 2 major parts of the culture .  Everyone is welcome . Everyone is equal . What is a typical day like for you at the company?Pick up Route paperwork , pretrip truck , hook trailer , pretrip trailer , haul to and make deliveries to Walmart Stores within our service area .  Return to the distribution center , either loaded with a back haul from a vendor or empty .

title: Good.
review: walmart is a big brand. it comes with job stability given that it's a company with large size. Not a bad place to work, especially if looking for place to start out.

title: Very flexible with your schedule
review: Walmart is a great place to work. Be nice If the pay was better. But the they are flexible w the schedule and you can ear time off here. The even app they offer is wonderful as well.
position: Customer Service, Cashier, and Personal Shopper

title: It is rewarding , sometimes really busy, challenging.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The benefits were good at Walmart.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Long lines are all the most stressful.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's a mixed culture working for Walmart. But still everyone did great together.What is a typical day like for you at the company?You learn something every day and you have a good feeling about helping others.

title: Great company awesome benefits and compensation
review: I'd love to get back into Walmart and get my 401k and retirement options going again. Awesome work environment if you want to work. I'd gladly accept the offer if another position was offered.

title: Bad
review: This place was bad not fun and the store looks awful just awful No good things to say about it all terrible to be honest don’t work there it is the worst

title: Not too bad
review: Not too bad went in at 5am and got off at 2pm, one hour lunch. The pay isnt great but they had daily pay so that made it a little bit better to get some of your check early

title: Toxic
review: Managers do not manage. They ate pharmacists that have no idea how to deal with employee issues, so they ignore them. Hours always changing, people quit all the time even though walmarts pay is the best in the area. Ask yourself why

title: Good place
review: Good place and fun environment. There is Possible chance to move up if you are smart and hardworking. Wouldn't make a career out of the one position though.

title: Quick hiring, lacking in support
review: Best cowokers around but a severe lack of on job support. Often left on the gate for hours beyond scheduled break times and at times even past mandatory meal breaks

title: Busy
review: It’s Walmart. What do you expect. Always busy. Rude customers. Management was always hit or miss. Got written up for things I didn’t do. They were good at giving me the time off I needed

title: easy job if everything works
review: it’s an easy job to do if everything works and weather isn’t even that much of a problem since they provide ponchos and let you go inside in the heat. if you get your work done there’s nothing stopping you from just sitting down and taking way more than the 2 15 minute breaks they give you. if the machine is broken and you have to push carts by hand thats the only way the job is frustrating or difficult. the environment is very inclusive with everyone getting their work done and following the break thing with just standing around which shouldn’t be a problem to an employee because everyone has their work done and are always actively available to help customers or do their job when needed.

title: Not great place
review: Your hours are always different no definite schedule. Poor management team and lack of caring for the employees there. Not easy to advance in the company either unless you in good with the management

title: Sucks
review: I’m completely biased when i say this but I worked at mayfield Walmart for a while “their management is god awful” you are constantly being pulled from place to place their is no help if you get hurt doing your work and it’s an overall bad experience personally.

title: Absolutely awful
review: They don't care about you. You're required to do the job and if you can't, oh well. Nevermind the fact that management doesnt back you up. You're thrown under the bus, the abscence policy is a joke, 5 points for 6 months and You're fired. No covid leave policy anymore, bad managers who are trained to push people beyond their limits and still expect you to overwork yourself.

title: Walmart has been the worst job I have ever had.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Lots of full-time shift options.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management.  Favoritism.  New manager every other month.  No consistency.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?TOXIC!  Very uncomfortable work environment.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Either being ignored or being sent home.

title: Low pay and can ever finish your job
review: U will always be working somebody else's job. Management is kinda lazy and doesn't care about you. Most people are chill. U can't finish ur job bc ur working other people's positions.

title: One of the easiest job I ever had
review: This job was the easiest job I had the only hard part  about this job is being away from home. The pay was good I Averaged $400  a day 21 pto day your first year

title: Worst Job I’ve ever had
review: Managers were constantly breathing down your neck, there is no understanding for basic human situations and life emergencies. The company doesn’t care about you.

title: Horrible Place that I've ever worked
review: If you like to kiss people's behind just to move up then this is the place. If you are a grown person, but wish to still act as if you are a child, then this is the place for you. Hard workers do not get any advancements. They only promote the weak and lazy.

title: In reality it's a great place to work for as a whole.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay has gotten better over the years.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Associates not following policy and creating a difficult work environment. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Overall it's a great company to work for when everyone is working together. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Usually busy answering questions and assisting the managers to resolve any clerical and personnel issues.

title: Only care about production / cut hours
review: Wouldn’t recommend even if your just there for the money. Production rate is impossible to reach and expect you to kill your self no matter how hard you work .

title: I only ever work at Walmart for short periods.
review: Pay is okay depending on your role. Management tends to be sub-par. You’ll end up doing other peoples work. They don’t take doctors notes so if you’re sick and you call off, it’s a point. Call off on a key event day, it’s 2. Unless you use ppto but it takes forever to accrue any actual time. In your first year, you’ll accrue about 2 hours every 2 weeks if you work full time so it takes 2 months to get a full 8 hours to cover a shift. Points don’t come off for 6 months. After you get access to your pto, you can use that if you get sick but you’ll still get a point. It’s a relatively easy job but at the end of the day, the turnover rate is so high because the attendance policy is so strict. You’re usually expected to finish your work in an unrealistic amount of time and if your manager is as bad as mine was, you’ll leave feeling like you failed no matter how hard you tried. Certain people will get special treatment as with any other workplace. Overall, it’s never been a crazy horrible experience but I’ve never left and not felt burnt out. Raises are hard to come by so don’t expect your starting wage to go up for a long time. I know people who have worked there for a 10+ years and they only make $1 more than my starting wage. They do however fully pay for ged/college courses for both full time and part time employees. Apply at your own risk.

title: It’s honestly not worth it
review: They hound you until all your work is done, you don’t get thank you for your hard work, you don’t get sent help when you need it, they definitely pick and choose favorites and not so favorites, they give you time limits which are completely unfair because in that time limit they give you they don’t include your breaks, your lunch, they expect you to have it all done right then and there and if it’s not fast enough you’re getting written up. Being short handed is a huge problem, management could be a lot more friendlier and understanding but they're not, they make it impossible to want to go back to work.

title: Nice people around me
review: Management treated me well, pay was ok for the job. I got an employee discount which was nice I suppose. I got paid time off one time but I quit before the second time.

title: Great pay, stressful work environment
review: Pay rate is great but like any job there are a lot of stressors. Every store is different but from my experience and what I’ve seen team leads have a lot of responsibility, sometimes not with proper training. Work hours are not good for a work/home life balance as schedule changes weekly.

title: Fun place to work and move up in time
review: What is the best part of working at the company?U get to talk to funny people some times and some of the other and people at work it's a fun in environment and u get good benefits working there What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Making sure u get everything out in the store as fast as u can can u need to be able to do multiple things at one time like talk to people trying to do ur job in the processWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Kinda fun they do fun thing gets closer holidays they play musicWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Tired ING I had to take a hole 2 hrs to help someone people to one feel like it was going to take longer but then we got it and I had to get back to work

title: Ok
review: It’s okay some days are easy others can get hired sometimes their aren’t any hours sometimes it’s way too many the more certifications on equipment you have the more useful you’ll be

title: Not bad
review: Low accountability standards. Could be better if that was fixed. Management gives unrealistic tasks and completion time. Loved my coworkers. Not bad starting pay for the work.

title: Liked the work environment
review: Work was quite enjoyable. expected to move lots of pallet and freight in short amount of time. Management kind of let you go to your pallets let you get work done.

title: nice
review: fun place to work.  learned a lot.  managed a couple of different departments.  Met many different people.  it's also hard work but would recommend anyone

title: Great
review: Walmart is an okay place to work. I enjoyed speaking with the customers as they came through my line. Most prefer self checkout. My bosses were very nice and always helpful.

title: It was a stable job with decent work hours
review: I worked here from my senior year of high school until my sophomore year in college. Some of the management was AMAZING, other parts of the management were awful. I never called in and finished all tasked asked of me, and was able to build respect quickly for myself. Towards the end of my time there, I was expected to finish 3 days worth of work in one 8 hours shift while my team lead sat around and did nothing.

title: Very Stressful
review: They want high patient scores, but severely understaff and it's hard to keep patients happy.  The turnover rate is horrible.  Management does not care about personal life.  Would not recommend.

title: Great u learn a lot about companies how everything works
review: What is the best part of working at the company?People environment culture the family partWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Big order wit no people to work What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Like a family reunion good vibes What is a typical day like for you at the company?Like playing in a championship game

title: Cut throat environment
review: The most toxic work environment I ever worked in for it to not pay no more than what it did.  It was laughable what people would say and do for a measly quarter raise.

title: Fast Paced- Made day go by faster
review: I enjoyed working there and the pay was great as well as the hours. But,they have a huge and consistent turnover with upper management and team leads. Things change to often.

title: Pretty bad
review: Pay wasn’t the best, no opportunities to grow. Managers disrespected my time. The job felt pretty soulless after a year and some change. Dreaded coming in everyday

title: busy days but good pay
review: it’s hard to work on a team in a department like this with a lot of calls off leading to more work and working around everyone’s lunch and break schedules. but the pay is good and you get kept busy which makes the days go by faster. the pay was good since this was my first job.

title: Overall decent
review: Physically demanding. Inconsistent management. Decent pay. Lax attendance policy. Not a great environment. Very difficult to move up unless you buddy up with the right people.

title: Fun place
review: The pay was decent and they allowed alot overtime. It was hard to move up to other departments. Management sometimes micromanaged but overall it was an ok.

title: Warehouse
review: It was awful. If you are new they give you awful trailers to unload with no way of making production. You are just a number to them, and all they care about is if you can make production

title: Hard Work but can be rewarding if you put in the work.
review: Retail is hard work, from unruly and disrespectful customers to management who either have too much on their plate to be able to manage effectively or are worthless and push everything onto their employees, there is a big element of luck in finding effective teams. However, with the right amount of flexibility to different styles of work and enough dedication to not just up and quit when things get hard, you can find yourself moving up in the company and that is where you can start to effectively change it. My best advice is to be the change that you want to see and not give up when nothing is going your way.

title: Cozy job
review: If I could stay working at Wal-Mart without the hope of thinking that there's something better out there for me, then I would work there forever. Unfortunately, hard work does not pay off at Wal-mart and the only way to move up is to stay there for many-many years. And unless you are good at socializing with the managers chances are you will never be noticed or promoted.

title: Good first job
review: Average entry level job, decent scheduling, management was fair, pay could have been better.  But thankful for the opportunity to earn some money and gain some experience.

title: Easy enough job, it's everything else that needs massive improvement that won't come bc no one really cares, high turn over for a reason
review: It's Walmart, don't expect much. Easy enough job... When the equipment works. Team leads & coach's are too busy to check in with team members, until you do something wrong & have to be spoken to because you weren't aware you doing something wrong for months. They have you train with someone that has maybe a week more experience than you do, hired at the same time, but started before you. When you alert managers of problems on the job (co-workers not doing their job, which adds to you not being able to do yours quickly & efficiently because you have to do theirs) nothing actually changes. Their attendance policy changed, they do not tell you what your "points" are, so if you go over the mere 6 your given in a 6 month span, even for part timers with no sick time, you will be fired, so check them OFTEN W a lead & make sure they are correct or get fixed immediately. Don't think staying late or coming in early will help you when cuts come, and they will, because it won't help. Being a team player doesn't matter either, although they'll say it does.

title: Solid work place
review: Pretty fun to work here very social, if you enjoy to work with others and in close proximity to other people, you will enjoy, can be very mindless work

title: Not enough pay
review: Good place to work but the pay is not enough the benefits are good teammates are helpful but some departments managers are rude and the don’t care about you

title: Worst Job
review: Management was the worst they don’t care about the employees at all. To them you are just another body it’s no wonder why their turnover rate is so high.

title: Not very productive or fair in my opinion
review: I worked for Walmart for 16½ years. It was definitely better in the beginning and it progressively got worse.  Went from having good customer service and plenty of people working the floor to bad customer service and barely anyone working the floor any given shift. Instead of hiring people, they would give extra work to the workers who were already stretched thin. They took away positions including the one I had as a Modular Team Member and turned around and brought it right back only to give it to someone else. They do some pretty shady things in my opinion but I'm sure it's not at every store. Not the best place to work imp.

title: Temp
review: Not bad but at the end of the day we are all disposable when they please. So do try to take advantage of a good pay while you can and they no longer need you.

title: sales  asscoiate
review: Well Walmart is a great career  is a place to work but I only feel that they shouldn't have a 5 point system. Because I was an former employee that love my job but I had physical therapy three days a week and I got fired for too many points so ridiculous I personally think because I had excuse for every time I was not able to work, but made up any time that was messed.

title: Horrible
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing at all. They don't care for their employees what so ever.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything!!!!!!! They made everything horrible

title: Corporate office is a good place to start a career
review: Walmart teaches everyone something. Their corporate office is a great place to learn and grow. Though there is a bit of a "better than you" mentality and culture, especially from executives. The company does support growth, flexibility, and mentorship and has great benefits for employees. They don't pay enough to keep the people they grow, which is a big downfall. If they would pay about 10% more to employees and allow more in-role promotions, I think they could retain more employees.

title: fun
review: fun I love i hate walmart. not fun so much fin walmart and I love so much I have so much fun walmart cashier so much happy in my job I love. walmart fun.

title: A little money for a lot of tasks
review: Managers always gossip or stand around there is never enough training. Once they see you work they throw everything on your shoulder and expect you to fix whole Walmart

title: Fun fast paced
review: Great pay, fun work environment, very busy on christmas season but great place to work, great with family flexibility, chances to grow within the company

title: Each store is different and it all depends on the management

title: hate it
review: very easy jobs most Walmart's I have worked at have difficult mangers like this one and I hate that there is favorite's and people who don't care about the polices in place

title: great
review: great place love the place love the work the people the managers the day to day eyeing i could return the best ever love this place enjoy this place love it

title: Treat employees terrible
review: Walmart is the worst company I’ve ever worked for took and walked us out of the pharmacy saying business was too slow either stock shelves or cashier and they would cut our pay which was very low for pharmacy tech

title: Productive
review: Great team and managers. Will take time to get used to. In charge of everything in the front team and so forth. Lots of responsibility and lots of work

title: Horrible place to work. I high recommended people to look elsewhere for employment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Going home at the end of the day. They don't care about you, your family, or what you have going on in life. You're replaceable to them.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The leadership/management. On your deathbed? They'd still require you to come in and die on the floor.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic. If you know people, you can get away with anything. If a certain manager doesn't like you, good luck advancing.

title: My overall experience is draining
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Going home at the end of the shift!!! Pay day What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The store manager he makes things stressful because he never think things are right when you do them What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Okay until you see the store manager What is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day at the company is long and stressful working with some of the people and if you do a good job they put more work on you and not the ones that suck

title: Stressful and toxic workplace environment
review: I do not recommend joining the project team. Store project coaches are rude and do not know how to speak to people. Instead they talk at you. You have to come into work with your guard up. They treat you like you are a child and talk to you like you are slow. I will not recommend this job to anyone, instead I will tell people stories on what I’ve been through for the past 6 months that I’ve been employed with them. If you are a person that asks questions, keep looking for employment. Questions to management is a form of challenging their knowledge. When really you need direction on how to complete something… keep looking

title: Job is decent with fair pay
review: The job is decent, the pay is fair. The customers can be a little hostile but that is to be expected. I have heard managers can be hit or miss, every manager I have had has been understandable. Coworkers are some awesome people.

title: Ringing up
review: The hours are flexible. The other employees are fun and helpful. But the tedium of scanning items and long hours on your feet are obviously not great.

title: Productive
review: I rather keep my opinion to myself.I was hired  7th day I requested to leave  to many hours I could not handle the schedule. I need flexable hours.???

title: Productive & Social
review: I enjoy having things to do while at the same time being needed by customers to get to things since everything is locked up in glass cases. Having the freedom to mess up let me learn a lot of things.

title: easy workplace and fun
review: I didn’t really enjoy working there because a previous manager hated me for no reason and would always complain i didn’t do my work but i was always working and did whatever she’d ask

title: It’s a job
review: It was ok. I could have been trained better and management lacked communication skills, but it was also 13 years ago. Hopefully they’ve lost a few employees that didn’t understand personal boundaries.

title: It's work
review: It's like a normal work place. Managers have their favorites. But overall great benefits and free perks such as Walmart plus and paramount plus. Also you have Thanksgiving and Christmas off.

title: It is fun and great place to work

title: Great fellow employees. Lousy management

title: It’s okay

title: bad.

title: Not fair
review: They don’t care about your availability, you have to remind them 24/7 to the point where you annoy them to fix your schedule. Attendance policy is bad.

title: Okay
review: Good part time job while I was there. The pay could be better and better insurance. Get quite busy during holidays season. Coworkers are easy to get along with.

title: Fun workplace
review: Meet new people. Working environment was great. Management was great. Training is excellent. Helped a lot with the videos. Benefits are great and everything is great.

title: Fun workplace. Good coworkers
review: Job is fairly easy, but can be stressful when super busy and not enough people at work. Coworkers are amazing and great management. Sometimes cut hours

title: Corporate machine
review: Easy job if you know how to look busy. They do not care about their workers, they will replace you as soon as they can unless you want to spend your life there.

title: Amazing management, horrible corporate enforced environment.
review: Bonuses slashed, pay raise was only $0.50-$1.00 (first one in 3 years) depending on how long you've been there while also cutting staff in half essentially doubling your work. Don't work here if you value your sanity.

title: Great colleagues
review: Fun to work with the staff all friendly. Unfortunately, Short staffed. Work way more than what they pay. Would’ve stayed longer if they actually let the hard workers move up instead of playing favorites.

title: Would definitely not recommend working for this company
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I would give this company a minus if I could. They simply do not care about their employees.
