Hazing and bullying is ignored. There is no reward for hard work and poor work ethic is ignoredWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Be prepared for your coworkers to stab you in the back and for managementnto ignore you

title: Read previous comments.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The provided excellent opportunity for growth and development.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Very hectic pace and high performance demands. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very positive inclusive transparent ethical.  Lots of opportunities.   You have to apply yourself they are not going to spoon feed you but if you work hard and smart you are not limited in your opportunities.  Great place to work if you are ready to work.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Monday - Friday  9 to 6 morning meeting and the worked my system job.
position: Process Manager Inventory Control and Training

title: It's ok
review: It's an ok job if you need money but they work you like crazy and don't give much reward for it. The holidays are insanely busy and you're struggling to keep up. Summer is hit or miss if you're really busy.

title: Great place
review: I enjoyed working at Walmart and Benton is a very friendly environment, accommodating to all types of people and schedules. I would work there again if I needed to.

title: Decent Workplace
review: Often busy and understaffed, although the coworkers make it an enjoyable experience. As a part time worker I struggled to receive hours sometimes not being scheduled at all.

title: Confusing
review: Getting a job at Walmart is very random. It almost feels like you're joining a cult or something. They never give you the answers, and you have to rely on a machine rather or not you will get a job. If you don't have a phone then you're out of luck.

title: Exhilarating, but the quality of the experience depends on the people on one’s team.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Opportunities for various positions based on merit, and ability to impact the performance of the store of location.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Time management in the face of heavy customer demand.What is the work environment and culture like at the company? A positive focus on teamwork and taking care of the customer that is at times at odds with new procedures and policies from company headquarters.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Enthusiasm, project goals, and positive customer interaction leading to exhaustion and frustration.
location: Wasilla, AK and Cedar City, UT

title: Management is a joke
review: Waste of time for anybody that can think for themselves. They only every paid attention to Yes men and the like. Would fire the most experienced workers that get stuff done over the pettiest reasons. I wasted 6 years of my life there for nothing. It's seriously not worth the stress or time just to be lectured by no experienced mediocre management.

title: Nice fun social place to work
review: I like it because you can do your work and socialize with customers and meet people from past to present . Also challenging to try new position. It's overall been a good experience for me

title: Fast paced, but enjoyable
review: Store manager is amazing so is the manager over the area I worked in. They care about their employees and the benefits and pto systems are very good. Your coworkers become like friendly. Good place to work

title: Walmart got worse over the years
review: Ever since they changed the management systems to introduce team leads and got rid of myshare, it’s pretty much trash. People sabotage and managers will sabotage you too.

title: buen lugar
review: nada fuera del otro mundo, tareas del dia a dia en cuanto a ventas y una que otra tarea administrativa sobre las ventas realizadas. el ambiente de trabajo es tranquilo

title: Terrible
review: Hate management the hours are terrible. They say they’re flexible hours but they’re not. They’ll even switch your availability without your approval and then you have to wait to change it back.

title: Interesting
review: Walmart is always an interesting place to work. I enjoyed the work but management could be really rough at times. I felt like I was having to do jobs that were not in my pay grade often.

title: horrible
review: walmart is horrible. customers are rude, staff members are even worse. management has favoritism so if you’re not their favorite worker than good luck to you!

title: Good
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Interect with people I am extrovert want to talk to peopleWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Attending phonecalls some customers are so meanWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and respect every culture What is a typical day like for you at the company?None I would love to working in Walmart everyday

title: ok workplace
review: Overall the job isn't bad. Some customers were difficult but coworkers were great. Most of the management was good but like all places some were better than others.

title: Productive and Flexible Hours
review: A productive place to work where you will earn your money well. You will be working with heavy machinery so safety is a high priority. This is a production-based role so you must make production if not you could fall under discipline. All in all, I can say that the opportunities to move up/promotion are there. The one thing they look at for a fact is a good attitude.Working weekends gives you 4 days off which you can use to your advantage for leisure or your side hustle. I can say for myself that I have enjoyed my time here thus far.The best thing about Job is the pay and the days you work.Some obstacles might be standing all day and sometimes making production.From my experience, this is a good gig.

title: Eh
review: "I've worked for 2 Walmart stores. The first store I worked for 3 years, then our store was closed, no longer there. Second one on Almaden Expressway. I was a cashier. People were great. Very serious hard working people.

title: Decent pay but find a better place elsewhere if you can.
review: Overview:When I first started working with this company two years ago, I thought that it wasn't as terrible as people said it was; however, those people became more correct as time went on as the store environment got worse overtime. I'll be sharing my perspectives in the following categories below:Management:Management tends to be very strict and doesn't seem to care about their associates. For example, Walmart has something called team scheduling which gives full-time associates a set schedule with the same work days and shifts and the same two days off every week and if an associate refuses or can't work the shifts assigned to them, then they're dropped down to part-time with the leftover shifts in their department. It has happened to me when I refused to work the 10a-7p shift they wanted me to work and when I asked my former people lead about not having hours for the entire week and all he pretty much said was "open your availability", making it feel like he was trying to force me to work that shift, which I couldn't do due to school. Not to mention that management tends to have favoritism towards certain associates and their rules only apply whenever they feel like it and towards certain associates.Plus some managers like to make up lies and their own rules in an attempt to scare associates such as telling them that they're not allowed to use Unpaid Time Off even though they can.Associates:Many associates and former associates were pretty nice for the most part. There were some who were rude, but I hardly paid attention to those ones. Similar to how high school - more...

title: Overall Walmart is a secure job and consistent, o have nothing to criticize.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?So far so good five star ,Walmart is great place to work now What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I have no answer for that yet What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Drive , prosses and merchandise shipping What is a typical day like for you at the company?About the same as always , my day never be that bad

title: Alright
review: It has its good days and it has its bad. Don't expect two trucks days to be good and you won't be disappointed. Good people to work with but management can be out of touch sometimes.

title: Good management simple job
review: Very simple job, some workers were lazy but management weeds them out well. High expectations but reasonable if you don’t waste time. Schedule was nice too.

title: Can be ok
review: Can be an ok place to work if you just go in and do your job. Alot of young people so very much a highscool ish atmosphere with lots of petty drama. A

title: Decent pay, bad work environment
review: management played favorites, a dirty environment to work in, and nothing to do on the day-to-day. it was basically a lot of standing around and trying to look busy.

title: Ambiente de trabajo tranquilo
review: En este trabajo tuve oportunidad de crecimiento, todos los beneficios y el respecto que todo empleado merece.

title: Overworked and unsatisfied.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Professional development opportunitiesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Inconsistent direction from the top down. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?High importance on work-life balance, trust, equality, but it’s a lie. Typical corporate environment that values squeezing every drop of life out of you and still being told it’s not enough.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Meeting after meeting after meeting with no solutions.

title: Productive and fun workplace
review: So long as you are doing your assigned task within your assigned time window, you will be fine. If you go in with the intention of doing the bare minimum, that's what you will get in return in terms of any leniency

title: It was okay but they over work there employees for low pay  and they don’t communicate well with there employees
review: Over worked for low pay and management sucks and they have  favorites they  don’t Communicate with there employees  .. they don’t  keep there word and there Schedule is all over the place they don’t have set schedules

title: Don't really get trained it's sink or swim
review: They're not really willing to help especially with the lack of training it's sink or swim then gets stressful with the work overload they're not willing to do more than what they have to do but expect more from you then get fired for being overwhelmed

title: Poor management and a lack of decency between peers
review: The managers treated everyone horribly and only gave promotions to those who’d die and bleed for the place. I wouldn’t come within 50 feet of another one of those soul sucking corp jobs.

title: No
review: Buenos Depues qué hagas tú trabajo y ello no lo valoran

title: Fun times working with your co-workers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Getting to know the customer's as well getting to know your position. Sales What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I don't get stressed out doing my job and help out with the customer service What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's a little bit knowing you do your job and help as much you can with the customer.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Getting things done as well making it look good with the department

title: Unfair pay and treatment.
review: The tile you have means nothing they will have you do anything and everything and not get the pay you deserve. Management pick favorites and with be rude to everyone else.

title: Productive
review: It is a very fast paced job very fun very friendly communication as well and obstructive customer service is on point also I believe that everything they do at this job is very important because it is really important that's all I have to say

title: Management and Leadership
review: At Walmart not all of the managers are up to par with their knowledge of the business needs nor do they assist associates when needed the most. They rely solely on false metrics and want to throw these "perfect" numbers at associates.

title: This job is not it
review: Store is highly understaffed and your always working up hill. Management really does nothing to help until it's desperation time. They just wanna use you up. If you get hired start lookin for your next job. Not a place you want to be too long.

title: decent pay
review: Online shopping is in high demand now, and associates are being overworked. The work environment could be a little bit better but is manageable. They like to save hours a lot, so expect your hours to get cut. They also like to over-hire so chances for you to be full-time may be slim.

title: Fun workplace
review: Good job. Can’t complain pay was great people was great hours was okay but I still liked it . I would go back if I could but once you quite it take litte while to be hired back on

title: Great time here it was fun
review: It was great place to work great pay while I was there great staff also basically I had freedom to do whatever I wanted in between time decent learned a lot here

title: It was a horrible experience.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It was horrible. Do not want there. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management treats you like a number. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was horrible. Do not work there What is a typical day like for you at the company?Hectic, unappreciated, stressful

title: Bakery
review: Opportunity’s to cross train both interdepartmentally and otherwise. Okay break lounge. Fed by the company a few times a year. Most definitely minimal involvement with management directly in both good and bad ways. ridiculous inconsistency in scheduling makes it difficult to have much work life balance.

title: Everything sucked
review: I hated working here. There was almost no benefits for working for them. They have bad management and I would get yelled at for simply mistakes. They require a lot out of you despite only being there for a couple days.

title: Regret working there
review: Store was dirty, management was rude and oftentimes clueless, poor training for new employees which led to high turn over, co-workers were okay, work was too labor intensive on the body.

title: Good pay
review: Being a team lead is a pretty big responsibility, you are in charge of the whole entire front end, including the maintenance team. The store I worked at was absolutely disgusting and the bathrooms were almost unusable at all times

title: Not enough pay
review: I worked there for about 9 months and they expected too much without paying well. It was an ok job but it was overnight and not worth the trouble to work there.

title: Productive and stable
review: Overall great company to work for, pay is good and hours are flexible. Stable environment And good for growth. Would recommend others to work here over other companies

title: It's an alright job, but management sucks.
review: I love what I do in my department and love my coworkers. I love helping our customers over the phone with their orders and how busy it is. However, the management and pay sucks. Other management from other departments are constantly ragging on us for anything. We get paid an entire dollar less than what another store(who is half the size and doing half the business as us) is. Our store manager seems to not be fighting for us to get that raise at all.

title: Walmart
review: Depending on the job the pay isn’t bad. I worked in apparel folding clothes, cleaning, setting up displays, putting out new stock, putting back old stock. I wouldn’t try to make friends with anyone if you’re not wanting to move up. If you’re wanting to move up in the company I would stay super low key with other employees, and work well but don’t over do it. If you over do it they will need you in that area and not to move up. Be nice to higher ups

title: Fun environment
review: Amazing environment fun to work in I honestly loved the people it was a super cool staff and I enjoyed coming to work with them everyday it was good experience

title: Ok workplace
review: The pay is too low to live off of so you should expect to also have a second job. The benefits are ok if you work full time but I have definitely had better. Unfair management.

title: Productive and individual growth
review: I started as an associate but with continue efforts and learning reached to management positions in multiple department. Various skill learning program and guidance available. Amazing perks such as employee discount and health benefits including yearly profit share.

title: Over worked and no fun
review: They overwork you and complain when you stay late. They honestly suck and are horrible to work for. If I had an appointment and made it on my off day they could change my days 24hrz out

title: I Love Walmart Environment
review: I was heartbroken when I left Walmart in February. I love the fun and friendly coworkers. I rather continue my journey with Walmart.  I enjoyed the different cultures.

title: Overworked and underpaid
review: Walmart isn’t the place to go if you’re looking for a conducive work environment. Managers are always nowhere to be found and co-workers disappear when the workload increases, making it difficult to get anything done

title: Easy job, okay pay
review: I got along with my co-workers which made the job enjoyable. The work itself could be repetitive but most interactions with customers were good. The pay was decent in comparison to the work load.

title: Decent Workplace
review: Working here is fine. Most of the leads and coaches there is great so connecting with them isn't bad. Only downside to working here is no one wants to be a cashier and sometimes you'll have to ring for hours.

title: It really needs some improvement
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting new genuine people. It would be a good first job but not a long term thing. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Too much of people thinking and worrying about what the next person is doing instead of the job they came to do .What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Culture is diverse environment needs a little improvement.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Sometimes good sometimes not so good .

title: Eh.. it paid the bills.
review: It was a good job. The pay was ok but not for all you had to. I was in OPD but they would always turn our picks off and put us in different departments but when we were overloaded with picks we could barely get help. Management was ok, there was only a handful who were helpful. I would go back but definitely to a different store.

title: not a good place to work
review: they would cut hours and would not offer any overtime. they expected a full time job to be done on part time hours. a stocking job shouldn’t be stressful

title: Never truly appreciate me and saw my true worth as an employee
review: I have excellent customer service skills and they never allowed me to use my full potential, if they had I would still be there. I truly did care about the customers and the employees and assisting them anyway I could. Management didn't see that and focused on negativity.

title: horrible job...do not apply here
review: terrible job management terrible a lot of work bad pay,,favoritism,,,,,bad management...if you do not want to feel bad in your job do not apply here,,,

title: Disappointing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers are positive and honest always What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management because they are not honest, they don't care about the associates just themselves and getting to where they want to without being qualified What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible the moral is down because you never have enough help or support What is a typical day like for you at the company?The condition are hard no air in the summer no heat in the winter until company is coming then all of a sudden you have help, heat, and air

title: understaffed

title: Long hours but a good place to work
review: I would say that working at walmart was a very good experience. I was able to get benefits and time off.  It was a pretty basic job of complete your tasks and go home.  The only bad thing would be that it could be hectic at times due to the team members not having the same work ethics.  Overall it was a good experience.

title: It was not bad but it wasnt great
review: Upper Management sucked. The Team Lead one was cool the other was bad. better then my previous job McDonalds after 90 days you get a 10% discount card and i met some really cool people hours were good. in the year and a half i was there i started at 11 an hour a couple of months after got raised up to 14 an hour then a couple of months later 16 an hour

title: Alright workplace
review: Was an easy job but management can cause you to be stressed a lot. Will add several tasks to you and expect you to run department by yourself at times

title: Hatefulness Abounds
review: No matter what manners you have been taught in life, toss them to the wind because if you're a middle-aged or older, you'll get NO respect here! This company is unbelievable unless you're a "yes-man (or woman)" and you're also young and attractive. I felt like I was in a really bad play for 6 months!I should have left on Day 2.

title: No support
review: No HR support, terrible hours, low pay, no holidays or weekends off. Very physically hard on your feet, and very loud in the back area. The entire store is cold.

title: Productive and fun environment for the most part
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Interacting and helping the customersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The team leads not being productive.What is a typical day like for you at the company?At typical day included checking out customers and bagging groceries

title: Years of emotional abuse from co workers, leadership team, and yes ethics board
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Some some some of the people I met through working for this company What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Equality is based on who they want to consider equal.     What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unethical, scandalous, and unequal bias upon race color and relationship  preference     The company sees what they want and not really investigating the unethical behaviors.   They victimize victims instead of finding solutions to help those really being targeted and harassed What is a typical day like for you at the company?I love my job finally, but the company is lost!

title: it was good when it first opened.
review: once management change everything started to change, and sales deteriorate. Not enough paid for the amount of work that had to be done. co-workers were all drama.

title: They pay well and that's about it.
review: Wal-Mart talks about caring for their associates and their families, however this is not reflective in their work practices. Constant requests for you to work overtime, heavy favoritism from management towards specific associates, and (in my experience) higher management will spread false rumors about you behind your back to make you look bad if they don't like you. Another mention towards the double standards towards associates. Overall, Wal-mart does offer good benefits with the GUILD education program and others, but the cons outweigh the pros by far of working here. My suggestion is to stay away from Wal-Mart if you can, they do not take good care of their associates at all.

title: Depressing, traumatic workplace
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Never keep promises, won't fix pay when it's messed up, schedule is unpredictable and never the same, ignore time off requestsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything that happens after you clock inWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's is not a great environment

title: Growth and Career
review: Opportunities to operate at many levels and if you focus on growth and learning you can pick up many skills that you can use at Walmart or elsewhere.

title: Good
review: Nice place to work at nice mic e place to work nice couturiers nice workers and managers got work with nice parking lot to park at nice building and pain

review: Pay is good ,3 or 4 day work week which is good because any longer would make you want to snap into a slimjim! The atmosphere in the Building is grim ,people hating life,I'm surprised no one hung themselves in the bathroom yet.

title: Stressful but decent pay
review: Working at walmart is an extremely stressful job. The pay and bonus is very good. But you have to be use to getting beat up daily by store manager and market manager and never get rewarded for the good you do in the store

title: Department managers were great, upper management was not
review: Department managers seemed like they had a great fit. Always tried to make sure you were doing ok. Always made sure you knew your job. Upper management played favorites.

title: fun

title: Good job

title: Stressful. Overworked.
review: If you make it past your probationary period then it's not hard to keep your job. But the work is stressful between the managers and the customers someday are difficult.

title: It's fast paced work
review: It'd probably be better if they understood parents and having a child get sick you shouldn't get pointed or have to have ppto to cover if your kid is sent home sick from school

title: Don’t Invest To Much Into This Company
review: I wouldn’t invest to much of yourself into this company. I wouldn’t invest to much of your finances into this company. Save as much as you can each paycheck. Spend time on yourself and family as much as you can.

title: Okay place to work just not long term

We had a mixture of cultures and races, and everyone pretty much got along.What is a typical day like for you at the company?In apparel we constantly had shipments arriving, so we worked almost continuously to stock or back stock items. We also did a lot of housekeeping, as well as customer service and the fitting room.

title: Just do your Job
review: Literally all you have to do is do the job you are told. Do this and management will like you and treat you well. If you don't do your job, well then have fun!

title: Something interesting at first
review: Management filled with favoritism. Production accrued when it's dead slow.  No advancement for donut shift, unless you become one of the 'favorites'.

title: Okay

title: At least it’s cheap

If am answering this correct What is a typical day like for you at the company?Staying busy  and mine my own self business.

title: Managers are bad
review: Managers are really bad, you’ll get maybe one good manager and sometimes you’ll get picked on for no reason. Just do your job and go home and don’t come late because of the point system

title: Productive and great coworkers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I liked all my coworkers and supervisors were real helpful when neededWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lazy coworkers and individuals who thought they were the boss.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was great when you needed help there was always soneone to help get the job done. Great benefits.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working at the DC gets pretty conjested but for the most part it's easy. It would be better if everyone followed them.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in. Try to beat my percentage for order filling from the night before. Clean, clock out.

title: Good
review: Okay company. Regular schedule and regular breaks. Management is understanding of time off needs. Co workers are energetic and fun to be around. Great place to work

title: Productive and fun
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The money. They have opportunities What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some of the managers take their job to the head. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Diversity, smooth for the most partWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Constantly moving and working.

title: Productive
review: It was great pay , you wont regret the overtime pay as well. They work with your schedule & position is easy . Co workers were friendly and managers were understanding.

title: Good
review: Working at Walmart as a cashier is an incredibly fulfilling and rewarding experience. As a cashier, you have the opportunity to interact with customers on a daily basis, providing them with exceptional customer service, and ensuring that their shopping experience is a positive one.

title: Supportive co-workers but hard workers are worked to death
review: The company has good benefit, scholarship program (common careers, nothing in horticulture/Botany), promotions are annual but can also be earned. Overall good benefits and direct supervisors but they kept us understaffed that many of us left.

title: Cancel any daytime plans
review: Honestly, I haven't worked here, but I did have an interview and the typical full time hours are 2-11 so if you have any daytime plans....no you don't. If you're not doing full time buy part time, it's 6-11 but still, you're left feeling exhausted from presumably constant lifting. Yeah it's supposedly the easiest job walmart has to offer but it doesn't seem like the best considering the lack of time you have for yourself and can over time get really boring

title: Fun
review: Just shopping for online orders but only downfall is 5 occurrences (missed days) is automatic termination doesn’t matter if you have a doctors excuse or not.

title: Productive and fun
review: Always set foot before the stores open with a fresh start of coffee and enough sleep during the nights okay. Great style are a plus due to younger generation needing guidance and great growth for the old folks

title: Fun place
review: I enjoy the atmosphere and the holidays. I love the rude and the nice customers. All around it’s ok with me. Sometimes it’s relentlessly busy but that’s my favorite part of the job.

title: fun
review: loved it. I just couldn't keep up with the schedule they wanted me to work, it was very short staffed when i came along so i got the worst hours. Gained experience though

title: Easy and laid back
review: It was a pretty easy job you didn’t in trouble as long as you were doing something. Favorite part was covering fitting rooms it was super easy. Almost everyone is nice.

title: Customer focused
review: Great start for a first time job. Lots of things to do. I am always busy with something.Lots of people to talk to. The job is easy ,check people out and  keep your till accurate.

title: Hated it
review: most of the managers played favorites and its was quite frustrating working with incompetent people who didnt work because they knew they wouldnt get in trouble horrible management

title: Fun place to work
review: It’s a great job but it does require you to have a good team to be successful. The pay is not bad! Manager does expect a lot out of the team leads. It’s not a hard job but it can be stressful at times

title: management and customers
review: Management micromanage, hours are terrible, customers are mean. Dealing with drug companies is probably the best part of it all and that is sad. Only thing worse is CVS pharmacy.

title: Excelente
review: Muy bien y lo que más te gustó del trabajo, todo es muy bien para

title: Excellent
review: What is the best part of working at the company?To ensure the customer find what they need, basic instock, great prices …What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Time issues trying to finish the task specially when it was busy What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Environment was nice great coworkers What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clean, instock working freight helping customers, doing price changes
location: Farmers Branch, TX and dallas tx

title: Good place
review: Coworker ar not the best. But management can understand you and willing to help you. Pay is not the best and is part time most of the jobs. I had a good time

title: Pretty bad
review: Not sure if it's the whole company or the store I was at, but managers set you up to fail giving you lazy people just to fire you. Especially if they don't like you (which is what happened to me)Get rid of the people that work, just cause they don't brown nose, and keep the bad ones who barely work and steal time etc etc

title: Good place.  Great exposure
review: Good people overall.  Must be good at collaboration.  Lots of other benefits. Good strategy and decent management.  Promotions at senior levels more political ,but smart people.

title: It's Aight
review: It's a good first job. Great place to get experience and learn but low pay. The Managers definitely had favorites and management was aight. A retail job is gonna be what you expect from a retail job.

title: Work
review: The work is intense and the crew was small. Forced to do other peoples work. The pay isn’t all that. Overnights just made it worse. More work left over by the evening shift just for the night crew to do more

title: Chaotic
review: Management and associates very unprofessional. Treatment of customers  is very unprofessional. People in positions they aren’t qualified to have and are allowed to treat others pathetically

title: Terrible
review: Terrible work conditio s no help expected to do everything yourself with no help are guidance no breaks hired for one position expected to do everything in every department

title: Long hours short staff
review: Overall, it was not a horrible experience. They pay well they definitely have long hours and when you are shortstaffed, you have to pick up the slack.

title: Always occupied but low-stress job
review: Mostly stay in one area, maintaining it and helping customers. Occasionally required to help in other areas. Was given tasks for the day and then was free to complete them as needed.

title: Not a good place
review: There are better places to work that won’t treat you like a piece of trash. Upper management will tell you they can do it all in just a few hours but never show you how it help you

title: Toxic
review: Horrible managers not a steady schedule. Very rude customers not enough time to complete task before being Tod to accomplish another. I would not recommend

title: Fun workplace
review: It’s a cool workplace as long as you get along with your coworkers, supervisors and managers. What really makes it worthwhile will be your coworkers, otherwise they’re repetitive days and boring.

title: Attendance, and Management
review: I gave it a poor rating for reasons.Those reasons mostly being attendance, and management. I think its well known that most Walmarts don't give people enough hours (at least where I'm from) , but will work you to death within the time frame you're there.Management is usually really bad glossing over problems with momentary problem solvers, playing favorites, or simply not knowing what to do while trying to meet unrealistic standards, or goals.

title: Great place to work
review: Good pay and benefits. Easily to promote within and always looking for new employees. If you have your goal set out you will grown in the company. Walmart

title: A job to *barely* pay the bills
review: Management was okay but pay sucks.  Most of the day you spend stocking things on your own. People are all about drama though they are like high schoolers

title: Fun
review: It was cool to work there I guess. Nice meeting new people and it’s very very fast past, I fell  like   It was a wonderful experience and I would definitely go back it’s a very easy job

title: Decent pay but very stressful
review: Decent pay over nights are very stressful short staffed and employees call out all of the time. Upper management is never on the same page.

title: An exhilaratred learning experience dealing with ways of people
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Co-workers and management are supportive.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Register/tool failure could be a stressful situation. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is lots of smiles and salutations What is a typical day like for you at the company?Customer service leads the way in all activities and tasks.

title: Good pay and benefits, bad work environment
review: The pay that is given is good for a single person or student so I was appreciative of that as a college student. Benefits were also good and provide good service. However, the sense of belonging here and the management has been unbearable here. There is a loss of communication through management and at the same time, they really do not have any form of peer recognition. You could do 9/10 tasks perfect but they’ll pinpoint the one incomplete  tasks and not acknowledge the perfect ones. There’s no accountability in management and they are not found of younger associates giving tips and ideas. A tad discriminating towards age.

title: Poor Management
review: Management didn’t care for the team as much as they cared for themselves. No good role models. Not enough praise to associates that deserve it. Very money hungry company. At least at my location

title: Productive and fun workplace
review: You get to meet a lot of different and interesting people while you are working. The pay was not that bad either, it could’ve been worse. I would recommend working at Walmart to a friend.

title: Micro managing, chronically understaffed
review: Horrible management. Write ups for using the restroom, looking at phone to check time, etc. Terrible communication, always understaffed, equipment is either nonexistent or doesnt work, probably the worst work experience of my life

title: Productive and easy place to work
review: Love everyone there but the managers can be a bit strict but the work overall is easy and fun. Break is 1 hour which is absolutely perfect and you get two 15 minute paid break

title: Happy spirited  bubbly place to work
review: I enjoyed learning the whole front end of Walmart I had earned a lot of trust and got to know corporate so I was always called in for over time they are a very good company to work for and have great benefits if you access them after your 90 days! If u wanna go up and make more they have many opportunities!!

title: Decent place
review: It's alright just boring, Monday thru Friday. Decent pay, I just need more than 40 hours. They treat you well, but it's easy to point out amd get fired.

title: Okay place okay people
review: Made friends, leadership plays favorites so make sure you are one. As long as you put in the work you won't have any problems. Hard to get time off and not as flexible as they seem

title: Fun and enjoyable
review: Really fun job. Management good. They treat their employees good. Good pay good hours. Good opportunities. You can level ip your career. Bonus and vacations paid

title: remote
review: walmart is a great place to work i would recommend walmart , the pay is fair the only downside is you do not get paid for holidays. management are easy to work with

title: It's okay busy body work.
review: The work is generally easy if you learn fast and adapt well. It's a physically demanding job and requires you to move at a decent pace in order to get everything done. The managers*can* be understanding as long as you're open, and honest with them. Other associates can be difficult to work with but there's always going to be people you don't like wherever you go. It's just a matter of if you're willing to overlook other people's attitudes and work ethic. if you like busy body work and keeping busy to keep your mind of stuff, then this is an alright job. Daytime management likes to blame all the stores shortcomings on overnight shift, even though daytime associates have very little sense of urgency to try and actually get anything finished. I'm not willing to work days at Walmart. And if Walmart ever opens up to 24hrs again, I will not apply. I only sort of enjoy it cause we don't have to deal with customers

title: Horrible place to work
review: Walmart is hands down the worst of the worst when it comes to how they treat their employees. They do not recognize hard work nor do they reward it. And don't get hurt they will treat you as if you are scum of the earth... I didn't get fired so im not disgruntled because of that. It was literally just the worst 2 years of my life!

title: Ehh
review: It was a minimum wage job for minimum wage work. Didn't really care a whole lot got a paycheck and went home. Don't recommend for sure. Unless your just starting off in the workforce.

title: Good employees, confused management
review: Management is typically clueless, will believe managers over employees leading to no evolution in work environment. Most employees do care about their jobs and their customers. But management makes it hard to stay at the company.

title: Loved my job
review: I really loved my overnight stocking position at Walmart but as you may or may not know Walmart has a pretty strict attendance policy. So use your PTO or PPTO (you earn as you work) wisely. I’ve been terminated twice for barely going over my points (4.5) because of being sick or my kids being sick.

title: It was an ok place to work
review: I enjoyed working there, but the place has changed since I have worked there.Management was good, but the supervisors would leave the work they left was below them for the sales associates to do that came in after them.

title: ok
review: It was a fun job working with friend and alright pay for a high schooler but I did not get along with the management. I also did not like the heat and cold rain especially for the amount I got paid

title: Okay job not a career
review: It’s okay not to bad the pay is average very little room for growth but the coworkers you have make the job worth it in a way I would like the job if management worked with the employees

title: Fast pace
review: It is a fast pace job, they will demand more from the hardworkers and make you make up for the ones that are slow, i used to get good hours but never got the full time position after more than a year, rises are very low every year around 25c, still better pay than many other places, good thing you'll work your schedule even if you don't get a truck

title: Fun Place
review: Very lovely to work here. People are nice. Great relationships. Teamwork  Flexible hours.  Meet a lot of happy and exciting people. Get to shop right after work.

title: Fast paced stressful
review: I swear working hear has cut years away from my life as a team lead you'll be expected to do more then what you're signed up for felt like I was getting split into 3 people. Also management at my spot was atrocious no communication no support no help whatsoever

title: draining and repetitive
review: Working here is very repetitive, you will go in and do the same thing repeatedly, day after day. If you have a go-get-'em attitude I would recommend staying away from Walmart.

title: Timed and micromanaged
review: The bad managers are always breathing down your neck. Started great and now they want to time us on everything. Unloading stocking zoning. Don’t waste your time. There’s a reason the turnover rate is soooo high

title: hahaha
review: I was with the company for over three years, and my plan was to ride it out until I finished my degree. The pay doesn't cut it, but nowhere does. Of course high turn over rates

title: Great introduction into retail pharmacy
review: Walmart is the LEAST stressful of the retail pharmacy options. Still an absolutely stressful, disorganized, sinkhole of despair. The pharmacy tech position can be incredibly rewarding experience, but the environment is full of toxicity with spineless management. You will be overworked. Social pressure and bend-over-backward expectations are frequent. You will be tired. Either stand up for yourself and fight a broken system, or be prepared for a hectic environment spent coddling the unappreciative.

title: I liked my job, Was disappointed when hours were cut to save corporate money.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Familiarity of the work environment and being able to learn of different products while working. You don’t have to travel far to shopWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?As an older guy, wrapping my head around the computer(handheld) way of dealing with stock and it’s proper placement in the store. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?At our specific store, it was very diverse and team oriented What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and quick paced(my pace) taking moments for levity and friendliness to team and customer interaction

title: Great place.
review: I worked here for 5 years, enjoyed every second of it. The only reason I left was to have more time with the kids. Management was always helpful, employees I worked with was kind. Steady hours, decent pay.

title: Another good starter job
review: If you get hired to the right department then yes, it's a good starter job. I've seen many get their happiness sucked out work there but others enjoyed it fitted their skills

title: Micromanaging in the workplace. Favoritism from multiple managers.
review: Constant micromanaging and favoritism throughout the workplace. Managers will negatively talk about workers behind their backs if they are unlikeable to them. Demanding and unrealistic expectations or tasks.

title: Decent
review: Customers are rude and very rushed environment. Usually work register and register is very easy but hard part was just standing in self checkout lines and going back and forth with helping every customer.

title: Nice people
review: Nice people work at the store and is a simple enough job that anyone would be able to work in OGP. Management knows their job and I have had no problems working at this Walmart

title: Productive and fun
review: Learned alot, great work environment, management is there when you need it, friendly, only reason left offerd a federal job, hindsight now really wish I hadn't quit.

title: Love working on cars didn't like company
review: It was great for a while new management came in and made us work like dogs we got down to 3 techs to do 45+ vehicles and we also had to take a lunch break. A lot of the staff left when new management took over so we had to rush around work odd hours like start at 4 am to set up inventory that wasn't even autos job then open at 7 am close at 1 pm and turn a lot of customers away who were angry rightfully so. I wouldn't recommend it

title: Meh
review: Business needs restrictions Work life balance is not the best. Hours are horrible. Pay is low. Jobs are easy to apply for. Moving up in the co.amy is not hard.

title: the customer and hourly associates
review: Good ole boys work place!  its who you know get the jobs the rest get kicked out or hassed.  do not follow company practices and pay raises not fair.  it's a joke at my last store>

title: Not bad for the money
review: Management was really the only thing that bothered me but they got two new coaches who are great.  The previous two were very challenging to work with.  Other than that it is a fast paced job

title: Good
review: It was good nice first job lasted there for 7 months it was good good PTO from start end good amount of breaks and good 1 hour lunch 30 min if you wanted to

title: Toxic Workplace
review: Feels like I was still in high school. Very disorganized, managers running around like headless chickens and in general, a complete mess. Obviously nothing is gonna change in the future.

title: Management
review: If management would practice what they preach it would be a great place to work. They're flexible on hours but lots of training that they don't back up when you do what you're supposed to

title: Fun workplace
review: This was my favorite job I've had. Every employee became like family to me. It does get hectic at times, but that's anywhere. I just had to move on to other things to better myself. Please always consider working for Walmart, especially Salem 2910!

title: Fun place with flexible managers
review: I was a cashier and would help check people out and occasionally help people find things around the store. They were very flexible with my school schedule and working with me.

title: Liked it
review: It was nice working at Walmart.I was in toy sales. I just tidied up my department, and put out freight when needed. Absence policy is extremely strict.

title: It's awful and managment doesn't care
review: Walmart doesn't care about it's employees. Limited sick time, vacation time, and low pay makes it difficult to have motivation to work. Most locations are understaffed, overworked, with not enough proper equipment to get our jobs done. People have gotten fired for missing too many days even when they couldn't help it and had good reason, managers play favorites with who gets in trouble and who doesn't.The only good thing they do, is tell off overly rude customers.

title: It pays the bills
review: When I started working at Walmart a little over 4 years ago managers had reasonable expectations of the associates, but over the last few year they have removed incentivized bonuses and continue to pressure associates into doing twice the work while being disrespectful and demeaning towards them leading to mass walkouts of up to 30 associates over just a few weeks. on top of the aforementioned problems they rarely approve days off even when you apply to be off 5 to 6 months in advance claiming that they don't have coverage on those days which is why in almost 4 and a half years I've only had 3 approved days off and no vacations. In conclusion I wouldn't recommend working for Walmart unless you just need a job quickly to pay the bills.

title: Fast paced
review: Good environment, the managers are nice and respectful. It can get busy and stressful but overall a good environment between co workers. Workers are friendly.

title: Good place
review: Good place to work and great benefits. Workplace environment is like family and employees get an abundance of paid time off. Also enjoyed the on the job training and opportunity to become a lead technician.

title: Over all good place
review: Work as a TLE technician and got promoted to manager, I liked it and the responsibilities. Pay could have been better but overall TLE manager is one of the best positions in the store

title: poor management
review: not enough pay. overworked just to be told its not enough, time off denied. they mess with your schedule during the holidays even though you never agreed to it.

title: Bad
review: The lack of management made the job so much harder than it had to be. The people that were supposed to stage stock to be put on the shelves didn't do their job the way it was supposed to be done therefore it made the stockers job that much harder. Most times you would spend what seemed like half of your shift sorting out what was supposed to have been sorted for you. And you've got your team leader breathing down your neck what's taking so long?

title: Okay place to work
review: Pay could be a bit better for the amount of work that is assigned. Working the front in was a bit nerve-racking especially dealing with customers at scan and go for some reason customers think that are covering them but honestly we’re just doing our job and making sure people don’t steal

title: alright environment , decent pay
review: worked here for six months and got decent paychecks, was not let on break as often as i would e liked, but cashiering was super easy and fast paced. diverse employees were fun as well.

title: Productive and a fun place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I’m my experience with Walmart, I’d have to say my coworkers.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Work in a busy store seems like there’s never enough workersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work in a controlled environment being indoors, I ask for anything moreWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy… from the time you clock in til you clock out

title: I don't recommend
review: Run far far away from this place. They will work you to death and then work you some more they don't care about there employees. Don't get sick because they will not take a doctor note or anything so it's very easy to point yourself out and get fired.

title: Not terrible but not great.
review: The leads are  a weird mean girls club. Walmart should focus more on getting qualified candidates with people skills.Rude and just plain unfriendly.  Truly awful

title: Fast paced cool people nice environment on Cap2
review: On Cap2 has the best management by far in the store. Working on Cap 2 is fun and have fun people on the team. You work with others alot so its easy to talk to other co-workers. Also if you are a hard worker they will promote you. I was never promoted but was offered but I decided to find some where else to work to make more money.

title: Ok place to work
review: Good place to work. Nice people to work with.  Management was kind. Benefits were lacking. Willing to work with your schedule. Pay was average not breaking the bank.

title: Good job
review: I enjoy my job just have problems getting all my hours.  Can be fast paced at times and slow others.  We try to give the best service to our drivers that we can.

title: Easy, relaxing job
review: Nice working environment. Only con is management and mostly having to deal with coworkers and Walmart politics. Otherwise good work-life balance. Good light exercise.

title: Would work here at my last resort
review: What is the best part of working at the company?discount- nothing else was positive What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having proper training or allowing to be a decent human What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile work environment everyday What is a typical day like for you at the company?clock in, listen to employees complain, listen to managers complain, no direction

title: It was okay
review: Meh. I liked it and the people. Worked register and garden center. Wherever they needed me. Transfers to a different location and it was terrible. But I liked the management here

title: Good benefits
review: Great company to work for and a lot of room to grow if you wanted to do so. Dealing with people every day can be difficult at times but when you have a good team to work with it makes it much easier

title: fun
review: this was a fun place to work. it had everything one could want. caring employees and fun customers. i would definitely recommend working at this establishment

title: Overall experience is good
review: Management is understanding. Good work life balance and team and manager is always ready to help. The pay is decent, yearly bonus is pretty decent too. Safe place to work for if you are a full time hire.

title: Great people but poor management after our guy who knew what he was doing left
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Helping people. Finding great deals What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management lacking knowledge of position and experience What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Poor. If you don't fit well with the cliq

title: company does not value employees, blames them for everything
review: Constant firing and reduction of hours for hourly employees. If you have bills to pay and a family to feed, this is not a good place to work. You will not be valued or cared about by company management at all levels.

title: Wa
review: Es un buen lugar para empezar, pagan bien y te tratan de una manera decnte, los salarios son un poco bajos para las horas que trabajas pero se puede con ello

title: Not a bad place to work as long as you can get your job done
review: My typical day ussually consist of either sorting or stocking freight, unless told to do otherwise. Management directly over me are caring but is also strict, which is a good thing. The rest of the management at the store typically is fruastrating to work with. I do not like the work culture surrounding my team, because the majority of the team that I work with consists of high school teenagers who would rather stand around and talk rather than actually work. Probably the hardest part about this job is working with the teenagers, because they do not care if the work gets done so trying to pickup the pace to cover for them is fraustrating. One part of the job that I personally do requires me to be alone, this is my most enjoyable part of the job because it allows me to get my work done without any distractions, especially from the teenagers. I wouldn't have such a big problem about the teenagers if they would actually do their work.

title: Fun could be stressful
review: Typical retail place super busy during holidays and weekends. Always extra hours to pick up, a lot of employees so the opportunity to make friends is nice.

title: If you find a good Walmart Automotive manager, you have a chance at a career; otherwise, it is a circus with clown for management.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Better pay than some corporation in the automotive department.  Plenty of OSHA regulations for breaks, lunch, and time off.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Unqualified, manipulative management.  Automotive tools that slow production and injure personnel (you are forced to use their tools because of corporate obligation).  What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Co-workers are good folk trying to make some money without be cheated by the company.  Management is unskilled, uneducated automotive representatives.  They play a lot of politics to make its personal work longer and harder for less.  They have no understanding about the automotive industry or its personnel.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?No set routine, but a lot of policy changes that deal with the Automotive Technician work and conduct rules.  One day you are changing oil, the next you can be stacking barbecue grills in the Garden Department, or called up front to help with registry.

title: I have a clear section to cashier.
review: I had to cashier. But my favorite part about it was telling the customers where an items. Management is really non existent. The only thing about walmart is if you and associate you don't have a personalized scanner.

title: Very close to home and pays nice
review: I liked this job a lot! It pays nicest and it's very close to home!! It's just the fact that the managers are sometimes mean. The other employees there were amazing to work with!

title: Fun environment
review: Nice place! I liked to work over there. Great people and team. The job was pretty easy to do!! Great benefits!My coworkers helped me a lot! My team leads were very helpful too! I left because I needed more free time to study! If I need definitely I will be back! Thanks Walmart!!

title: Toxic
review: Toxic poor management not a good work life balance I do not recommend you will burn out. Don’t waste time. They don’t appreciate you as a human being

title: Not fun place to work
review: Very horrible place to work  they accuse you of stuff you don’t do overnights  gets blamed for everything that goes wrong mainly when cap 2 don’t unload our freight or works it and puts stuff in wrong spot not worth the money at all

title: it was ok
review: good people / bad hours. job was very easy but at my location, we was very understaffed. they scheduled me hours that didn’t fit around my schedule and the managers were non-productive half of the time.

title: Encouragement peace and unity
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Painting clearing, construction What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I will be very happy if I get this opportunity to work in the company I will work hard to help the company as well as the your country What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Forklift training and painting What is a typical day like for you at the company?More so I will to work very hard in the company no jokes to help improve the company and the country as well

title: Good Pay long hours
review: You get paid good but you will work a lot the environment overall is not bad depending on your management team but if you value personal time and family time it’s not for you

title: Great company biased leadership
review: The company does great my store in Particular was always trying to take good care of us and boost moral but moving up is hard if you aren’t best friends with someone in management you will not get noticed for doing a good job or trying the hardest it’s about connections and friendships or work there forever until they have to promote you. Great benefits though.

title: Boring
review: It's okay place to work because it's just folding clothes and getting boxes from the box and just help people out. Management is alright but not the best.

title: No Appreciation
review: There is never any appreciation you receive from your Market Team. There is so much bullying and complete disrespect constantly. I enjoyed working with the associates in the store. They are what make the job special.

title: Expect to be short staffed, but expected to produce the same output as a full crew
review: Walmart has consistently cut staff members, as well as hours. However, they still expect the same output. In addition, they know that the revolving door of poor workers, is a lost cause. So, they heavily lean on their good workers. They do not acknowledge productive workers in any way positive. Instead, they rely on us to do more work, because they cannot rely on the other workers, that will soon leave the company, due to the strict attendance policy. The attendance policy is to fire a person, if they miss 5 days, within 6 months. You can apply for a leave of absence. But, all three of my employees that filed for LOA, due to sickness or injury, were denied. They all presented medical documentation of their illness, but each of them were told to submit more medical documentation. They will staff you with poor workers, and then blame you, as a team lead, when these employees cannot perform up to par. For example, my staff consists of one man over 60, one man who is autistic and slow moving, one man in his late 40's who is also a student and constantly exhausted at work. This is for a job that is physically laborious.

title: Management at my particular facility is awful.
review: Honestly, management in every area of the store is great apart from the Online Pickup and Delivery, as far as salaried management. The team leads are great and work with you, however. I had no complaints until the coach (salaried manager) who is over it now was promoted into the job.

title: Easy Job bad management
review: Easy and straightforward training fun coworkers but when it comes to any problems management sucks! The communication with raises or position switching was trash!

title: The people are Great but....
review: I loved it there. The pay was okay, but they wanted you to be little managers. It's a Great job if you only pick. The backroom was a mess. Getting cussed out was normal. Thick skin is needed!

title: Eh
review: Walmart sucks to shop at AND work for. Weak pay, their “promotions” are title changes and often result in less money. (Weird right?) either way don’t work here unless you’ve been to jail bc they hire some of the shiftiest individuals

title: I just loved working for wal-mart
review: I worked for Wal-Mart in Kailua-Kona Hawaii store 2321 for 13 years and 9 months worth of loyalty hard work. I worked as a cashier front end self check out host, would like to work for walmart again here in McCain Blvd north little rock arkansas walmart if you would give me a chance to work here in little rock arkansas

title: It can be a lifelong career and you can go as far as your willing to reach in the company
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good benefits Real Full time hours competitive pay solid schedule What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Sometimes you get pulled in a lot of directions What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mostly friendly helpful  Everyone trying to work together to have agood outcomeWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Come in start Assignment take breaks and lunch get feedback from management if necessary

title: Fun workplace
review: Use to work here when I was younger but some people are really nice like your fellow associates and some of the managers. Other members may try to use you.

title: Associates are fine. Management needs to work on it.
review: I have only worked here for around 3 weeks and although my team lead and coach were very nice :The store lead took the first interaction i ever had with them and tried to gaslight me. Then spread a rumor to other associates. Jobs shouldnt do that.I confronted it and reported it to the person i was expected to, only to get an apology where i was still told it was my fault.No thanks.They also overwork the people in my department by dragging them to other departments every day. And work them to an expectation thats stressful because we are both expected to do our work, but given explicit instructions and expectations that do not allow us to complete the work.The only good times are when we are allowed to work our positions and left alone by store lead.

title: Productive and enjoyable
review: I love working as a cashier everyone is very nice and great management great customers come through everyday never a dull moment best Walmart I have worked for.

title: Not for the hard-working
review: Management has unrealistic goals and gives no support to accomplish said goals, then chastizes you for not meeting those goals, if you're a hard worker. They don't want to hear your area is understaffed.

title: Great coworkers
review: Great place to work and good co-worker's.  Store manager wasn't the best but other than that great place to work. Opportunity to move up also.  Decent pay and good insurance.

title: Productive
review: Walmart was a decent job especially when pay raised 14$ an hour. 40 hour work week nice.  The only problem I had was changing departments. They made it very difficult to leave the cap 2 team for me at least. So watch out for that if you tend to overproduce quality work.

title: Falta de entrenamiento a los manayers.sobre cómo tratar a los empleados,y falta de personal
review: La verdad me sentí cómodo y muy agradecido,que me dieron trabajo Es una empresa.que genera mucho empleo Lamentablemente tuve un accidente.me operaron !!y creo que desde hay a cambiado mucho mi vida Por último perdí mi empleo ,por decisión de la administración Y yo estaba en periodo de retiro por orden médica ,,pero solo les agradezco todo

title: Unorganized
review: Hours were decent but i often had to reach out to H.R.,  which was hard to do, to change my schedule because I was scheduled outside of the hours i was able to work. The job was easy but you are expected to do way more than possible through your shift. There's no organization. Management and team members are always stressed and complaining. Most team members stock items in the wrong places and then when you need to stock the correct item there, you have to fix the error first, which is often and makes it hard for you to complete your tasks for the day. Pay wasnt great. This job is good if you need something to get on your feet while finding something better.

title: Not a bad job
review: Easy work but not enough hours. It doesn't matter if you want full time. You won't be able to get it until you've worked there for 6 months.

title: Loved my job
review: I love helping people so I loved my job and I worked so hard but with it being a corporate company they are not family oriented so therefore you miss a day because your kid is sick and they don't care.

title: Okay job, but not managed well
review: In my time working there, I’ve learned that hard work is not rewarded as it should be, slackening is encouraged and those who outperform others are then pushed even harder to make up for slackers

title: Really awful management
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Very disorganized poor management and under trained coworkers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Coworkers who didn't know how to perform their jobWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?In 2 Walmarts I worked at it was great. The last Walmart was awful.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clean prepare deli food or bake and bag bread depending on where I was working

title: Unproductive and miserable
review: Worst companies to work for, terrible pay and work/life balance. Management is worse than the pay. They only promote if you play teachers pet and treat you like you're just a number.

title: Overworked good pay
review: Pay is good, management treats you badly. Job is easy, management is what makes it difficult. The store itself is poorly managed and is a mess everywhere making the job difficult to do sometimes.

title: Torturous and Corrupt with only good Co-workers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The rare good co-workers and payWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything being put on you in half a supercenter sized store with at least 30 people a day needing help.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Managers were corrupt, didn't care about anything other than the tasks, except for direct team leads, they were caring, wouldn't teach you so you'd have to learn yourself or from Co-workers.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Get there, be told 30 different things at 7am after the previous day getting off at 11pm, having an anxiety attack and managers telling you something different before getting coached for doing something at the only pace you can with previous injuries and not being the MOST fit.

title: Lousy place to work!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best parts of working at Walmart are getting a discount card after working there for 90 days and getting basic Paramount Plus for free!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful parts of working at Walmart  are dealing with the guests that come there, working with your cohorts, not having enough workers, not getting your breaks nor lunches on time, if at all,  bad benefits and incentives, if any, disorganized, low pay, poor manage, inoperable equipment, lazy workers, stupid and unattainable rules, and lousy freaking pay!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment is very toxic! There is always an argument or fight amongst the workers and the guests! There are some middle aged and elderly workers there, but most are either teenagers or young adults! The teenagers hardly ever do any work!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Sometime I am constantly moving and sometimes it is at a slower pace!I am often berated by the guests!

title: Fine
review: The job was fine. It was very easy and not difficult at all. The concepts of the job are very easy to grasp I would recommend working there. 123456789

title: Sucks
review: I wouldn’t suggest working here, management was very strict yet sat around in their office all day and coworkers were the only thing keeping me there

title: Good Job in Highschool
review: Good pay for being 16 in highschool.Love the 10% Associate Discount and the ability to freely collect extra shifts through their scheduling app if I felt like working more days.

title: This company likes to see you fail because they know they can replace you easily.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The only good thing about working here was the payWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with management and tryin to get ahold of anybody during your shift. You have to teach yourself how to do your job and get fired if you can't figure out how to teach yourself.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Destructive, unwelcoming, indifferentWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Boring. Depending on your position

title: Pros and Cons
review: Overall the pay was minimum wage and expectations from management are pretty high- they can be bothersome and meticulous. Met some nice coworkers though!

title: Bad management
review: Bad management.  Biggest complaint is that management are the people who start the problems on the shift. Talking about employees and their personal business and things that aren't supposed to be discussed between other employees. Examples points, what they call in for, why they are on leave .. nothing is private there

title: Not Bad
review: I think if you're going to be on CAP2 you should expect to finish other people's work for them. Overnights include some of the laziest people I know and, from what I've heard, are told to purposefully mess up so either the morning or afternoon shift can pick up their slack. Overall, not too bad considering I had been on the team for a while. It was fun to work there some days and the employees are mostly nice.

title: Laid Off
review: Everything was great until they laid an entire shift off. They will continue to pay the employees for 90 days but it was completely out of the blue. Really sucks!

title: Never bored
review: There's always something to do so time flies.They hire new people at a higher pay and cut your hours once the work destroys your joints.Very little opportunity for growth.

title: Fun work environment
review: Work is fun and fast pace environment. Management is easy to work with. Lots of cleaning and cooking but the time goes by quickly. I enjoyed helping customers

title: Overall Decent
review: The work itself is not bad at all, especially for what they pay. Hour lunches, PTO, PPTO, and being off for Thanksgiving and Christmas are pluses.  A word of warning is that they always cut hours at the beginning of the year. This year has been worse as they (corporate) have cut entire days with some people getting only 16 hours a week.

title: Great people to work with.
review: Company has great benefits. They try really hard to work with you on your schedule. The pay has improved. The workload is hard in every department but just do your best.

title: Most be hard working individual, friendly  and love working with customers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay rate and flexible schedule. The management team is greatWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being short staffed and having to work a department alone sometimes What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Coworkers are friendly it's like a community What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy there its a lot of work but I enjoy it

title: easy to meet metrics and goals
review: job objectives are known and described early on the process allowing for you to understand day to day taks. Order picker is the same process day to day

title: Fast paced, high expectations, toxic coworkers
review: If you can find a good area to work in the store, you can have a good time. They usually work with you for days off and are understanding. Unfortunately, team work isn't this team's strong suit.

title: In one of their markets which the values and unfair treatment of employees which the customers were aware of their unethical treatment
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working at Walmart was working for the customers. Always receiving positive responses from the customers was rewarding.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?In my particular position, there were alot of misconduct and undesirable behaviors from the management team. Their actions were unprecedented and the customers noted this negatively toward all of the staff. Totally distasteful What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment is what you make it. When the management clearly sees you're with a customer and still proceeds to radio in your ear whatever they want, that was frustrating and not acceptable. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Volumes of work in any given day. Depending on the customer volume. Loved helping the customers

title: Stressfull, Low pay for what is expected of you vs management.
review: I started here years ago and thought it was not a bad job. Over the years the company has shifted priorities and does not care about associate moral or retainment anymore. Store management in general is ok, they do what they have to to keep the corporate people happy. Not many complaints there. The structure that Walmart has created is just terrible and it will only get worse.

title: Okay in the beginning
review: This company can be a great place to work if you have good management. Unfortunately this company lacks of that. There’s a lot of favoritism that goes on. They also lie about your schedule. I loved the customers and some of my co workers. That’s about it.

title: Expect a large workload with limited time to work it.
review: Poor management, and there’s a crazy high expectation to get large workloads done within an hour. Quite impossible considering they have poor scheduling. Hours for associates got cut so low, some associates were scheduled a 4hr day. Most call out for that reason. Majority of associates who get hired last about a month before they decide to not show up anymore. If there’s one place at Walmart to work at, consider only working as a order picker. They usually are the only department who gets and is allowed overtime.

title: Management is beyond trash
review: I'm prior military, and I can honestly say this is by far the worst company I've worked for all bc the management. The actual work as a stocker (physical yet not difficult), pay ( pay for positions soso), and customers( I love 99% of mine are fine). When it gets to the point you hate your job bc of management there's a problem. Yet, nothing ever gets done. So the management gets to talk to you and treat you in any way they please, and don't think anything will happen to them. I could go on for hours. But there's no point. Walmart is seriously going down the toilet.

title: This is not that place
review: 10 years in various fields.  Hours are consistent but pay does not equate to effort required. Benefits are mediocre. PTO is based on tenure but due to work load, rarely have time to use.
