Holidays for home office are not paid..so PTO gets spent on those days or work on the Saturday before to "make up time".

title: Employee at OGP
review: The job was stressful and you are micromanaged daily. The management of the store alone is terrible. They change things around all the time and mark things up and you are expected to always know

title: productive and fun workplace
review: you can see all different species of people. wonderful experience. a once in a lifetime opportunity. live laugh love walmart. a wonderful establishment. truly a delight

title: Fast paced
review: I worked here for a year and enjoyed it.  Management was understanding and co workers were great.  I moved from night shift to evening shift during my stay there. You will definitely work during night shift

title: Big mistake.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get paid right for the first 6 monthsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The four team leaders that worked on my shift. Very unnecessary.walmart wants new workers.but the team leaders treat you so bad, what a waste of my time.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's like living in San Francisco, very uncomfortable , definitely not for me.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Bad treatment, dirty looks. Rather than let you do your job, people feel the need to bother and annoy .

title: Not AP Work...
review: My Co-Workers were nice and were knowledgable. However, I wasn't really doing any AP work. I was stocking, unloading trucks, and getting carts. The only AP things I did were adding theft deterrent devices to merchandise. Camera system was horrible and had zero apprehensions. Also, no internal investigations at all. Overall, if you want to get in the door for Walmart AP, maybe, but as a real AP job...nope.

title: good could be great
review: great job good benefits needs more hours for the people who really wanna work though it's why I left I loved the job but I wanted full time never called out did what I was asked but I feel that their was already a culture in place where I was mainly nepotism cousins and managers kids getting priority which is fine but at least consider others but overall I still had a good time enough to go back

title: Terrible management
review: Everything is your fault and none of your supervisors are willing to help you. You do make good friends there though. All of the coworkers typically stuck together.

title: Too much work
review: The company don't do a good pay rate and it's always more work than you suppose to do. They have very good benefits pack but either way the pay rate isnt fair.

title: The whole establishment
review: This company cares more about the money and bonuses for the management team rather than the people keeping the store afloat… EMPLOYEES ! Everyone gets paid the same rate almost and told we would be getting a raise… we only got 28 cent. The management team is rude and inconsiderate especially if you’re a parent or full time college student or even in highschool. They expect your life and career to be walmart. there are no paid holidays. they expect yoh to use your protected time for everything but it doesn’t accumulate like it should if you’re PART TIME ! The work isn’t equivalent to the pay. This establishment has chnaged its policies to reflect its desire for excessive and passive income for them and they can’t even keep employees in the store that actually enjoy working there. There are no preventative measures for anything and the employees are expected to put their lives on hold to take care of Walmart. Change the policies back and maybe employees would enjoy working here with better pay as well.

title: All you can ask of a job
review: I can afford my bills and still enjoy my free time. Elderly and handicapped need this service. Funny stuff happens throughout the day sometimes. Why is there a minimum word count on this?

title: Interesting
review: It can be bad some days and good others. Trust in in fellow workers is very high. Pay for what you do is not bad for the job. Deal with alot of stress due to issues that come up with customers.

title: Poca colaboración y manejo de horario
review: Me encanta mi área laboral lo único que no me gusta es los horarios que se ponen a madres con hijos lo cual debería ser más flexible y poder ayudar a colaborar más en ese aspecto no solo a personas de su criterio si no a todas madres o personas mayores con algún tipo de dificultad en relación a su horario.

title: No free time
review: Overall pay is ok it handles bills and everything but customers can lie on you and call the police and get you arrested for just because you declined their service. Supervisors don’t have your back like they suppose to no matter how hard you work. It’s at will meaning they can fire you for nothing.

title: A very important quick and straightforward job
review: It a very annoying straightforward job that get on my last nerve. But it also pays well for a minor still in school like me and it has workable hours.

title: A stressful not fun underpaid and understaffed work place.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Learning about all the interesting stories about people's lives What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Confrontation multiple times a day. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful but can be ok if you like your coworkers but if not awfullWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress and confrontation and running around because you are understaffed

title: Fun place
review: Nice job to work at because all the workers are hard working and always on the move. Customers are always nice and everything in store is organized. Yes

title: Love my job at this store.
review: Walmart literally saved my life. I was stuck in a horrible situation at home . I was able to buy a house and a decent car all paid for in full in under 4 years. They have been flexible with my schedule and everyone feels like family and the pay isn't bad. I plan to stay till I fully retire

title: Wages not good
review: Wages suck after 15 years they make what the new ones start at So dumbManagement needs to improve Be nice no matter what I was in tears all the time because it wasn’t perfect

title: Good benefits bad training
review: I don’t think it’s a good place to work if you use the open door plan to be retaliated against or they find a way to get rid of you managers do not follow policies Asset protection does absolutely nothing lots of harassment goes on . I have found that even if you say something in confidence the rest of the management knows about it

title: Better than most
review: Good pay, lots of time off, no touch freight, work every weekend and holiday except Christmas. Slip seating is terrible and it takes along time to get an assigned truck, even then they use it when you’re at home on your 34.

title: Relatively normal, just do what is told and get pay
review: I worked their for about 3-4 months, the pay was so-so, But, if you like to make some cash and doesn't want to have a complicated job. Walmart is your place

title: Truly a good place to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoyed working for Walmart and would love to go back What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some of the rude and disrespectful people you have to deal with is hard but for the most part if you're good to people they act right What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Polite people and fast pace, sometimes you are so busy you can't handle but then there is times that are just slowWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?I would run registers until 8 pm then run the self check out

title: Every bad management
review: The management here is terrible. I would constantly get yelled at because we didn't have something like it would be my fault or management didn't understand that we were very short drafted and I couldn't move lines faster.

title: Poor management
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Company policies are not called out unless you have violated a policy. There is no communication between the stores and the Corporate office. There is no internal email for associates. The turnover rate is phenomenal people are terminated for the least infraction. Poor Company to work for. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Managers and co-managers have no control as to what goes on from a day to day standpointWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Poor lack of professionalism in the manager staff. Turnover is horribleWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking merchandise on the shelves

title: Great place
review: This walmart was extremely fun to work at. Would recommend. The pay was decent but we had a lot of fun working. Breaks wear a good amount of time and job wasn’t tasking.

title: Was good place to work at
review: Used to be well staffed with 1 hour lunch breaks. Used also to have Pharmacist overlap.The Pay was good and so were the Benefits. Gave annual bonus too.

title: Good place to work lots of overtime
review: Good place to work lots of overtime very easy work as long as u just show up they would rather u show up everyday and b a lazy worker than a hard worker who misses days here and there.

title: Great job
review: Fun and laid back job besides the fact that they technically fired me but called it a separation and said I was seasonal when I wasn’t hired as a seasonal worker.

title: Awful
review: They don’t give a fudge about your health or where you want to workin this company. Plus they write you up for not throwing “a box a minute”. The management is terrible too.

title: Walmart
review: Great benefits, occasion-free foods in the breakroom, flexible schedule, and all team members are treated with respect. Only negative is that Walmart treats its customers first before its employees.

title: Alright
review: It's alright depending on the work load and if you have help. Takes awhile to get used to  the pros are your days go quick cons are the pay could be better.

title: Productive and good place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits and pay is the main reason for employment. It’s a very laidback atmosphere and easy-hard  work load, depending on the truck loads. I enjoyed working for Walmart. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Young people drama, very confused about gender and drug users. Stay free from them and there’s really no stress. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Somewhat laidback. Great schedule and timely breaks make for a great night. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good and I think it’s a great company

title: Would never recommend working at this establishment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Very little was good.  Management was so worried about keeping their jobs, there was so few employees to cover all departments.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Attempting to cover 3 departments as one person and help the customers, keep stock looking neat and tidy while also doing housekeeping due to one housekeeper per shift for the entire storeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful due to low staffing all the timeWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Rushed and never enjoyable, constantly cleaning up after customers

title: Eh
review: Bad management from immediate supervisors. They don't like to train but expect new hires to sit around waiting for training whilst complaining they are doing nothing in the shop. Work goes by fast and if you have a good shop manager, work is easy and pay is better than most positions.

title: Great Pay
review: Awesome pay for the work, great environment. Managers are all very knowledgeable and have 6-12 years experience. One con would be the shortage of equipment.

title: Just ok
review: Micromanaged, undervalued, doing other peoples work when you shouldnt. Scheduleing was weird, no room for growth. I would only go back if i had too...

title: Poorly Organized, Decent Pay
review: The pay was decent for this type of work, and the bonus that bumped the rate to $16.50/hr during the summer was a nice touch, however all aspects of the store and job were poorly organized and a bit chaotic.

title: Hectic but personable
review: The job is usually very hectic and there’s a lot of pressure almost every night. The people are personable and are fairly easy to get along with. The job is much harder than people tend to think it will be so usually understaffed.

title: I am glad to be out of there
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great pay but not always 40 hours they hire too many people They treat you like a number What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Making production the numbers are hard to achieve What is the work environment and culture like at the company?If you don’t bleed blue and yellow they weed you outWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Watching the clock to go home

title: Very demanding job pay is decent
review: Job is very demanding and also a lot of customers in the way. The pay is decent bi weekly. My managers are cool too. Definitely recommend as your first job.

title: Good environment
review: Chill place to make some side money discounts through out the store good food an convenient parking in the parking lot nice employes get along good first job

title: Working at walmart
review: Working at Walmart can be both rewarding and challenging. The company offers a range of positions, from cashier and stocker to management roles, and there are opportunities for advancement for those who are dedicated and hardworking.

title: It's Walmart
review: The job is what it is. Work hard for not much compensation. Short breaks and physical hard work. Corporate does not care about you at all.  It's all about corporate making money.

title: Too many pointless policies not being able to speak your mind
review: At Walmart your voice does not matter there are pointless policies you are worked into the ground pays way too low if they want you gone they'll make up some excuse around bonus time you can't get the items you need in your department or it will cut into the store manager's bonus moving UP is not based on the work that you put in but who your friends with you're allowed to break the rules if it's to make money even if it's dangerous but not at any other time instead of paying more they want to give you Paramount Plus supervisors do nothing they're lazy and micromanage you anytime you stop to get a drink of water or use the bathroom and the turnover rate is extremely high not a good place to work!!!

title: Communication needs work
review: Communication is an effective route when used. Hard to come by half the time. Other issues are few hard workers and lots of call out and attendance issues. Can't find people who actually want to work.

title: Great night Managers
review: Night Managers great at teaching you! The manager make the work environment great and great team work! Can't wait to work there again or at another Walmart

title: It was just a job. The only thing that kept me at Walmart were the friends I've made.
review: Working at Walmart was just a place to get a paycheck and make new friends. The friends I made there are lifetime friends. Despite we would  all get disappointed with the politics and policies. We helped each other to work through it. Management needs to start asking their employees what would make them happy.  If there not being positively responsive it is because their not trusting there managers. That was always the case .

title: easy work, face paced.
review: simple job but you walk a lot. point based attendance policies. they give you something called protected paid time off for every day you work to use towards latenesses or absences to protect from points.

title: What time is it for the tree? They're employees and expect too much
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They throw into a job and don't tell you that you will be doing a dozen different jobs then try to hold you  accountable fore ther Decisions and they will  cut your hours to sute them sometimes blow what they Guarantee you.i wonton recommend working there  unless you have no other options available What is the most stressful part about working at the company?To many managers trying to tell you what to do What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful and you never know wear you stand  you will be the best today and the worst tomorrow What is a typical day like for you at the company?You will be on the go from start to finish and nothing will be enough

title: Good work and home life balance
review: Great place to work if you like having time at home and knowing your schedule at all times. Great benefits too. If you’re interested in online college, Walmart will pay 100% from day one of hire.

title: productive but stressful
review: all you do is grocery shop for other people and place the order on costumers cars, management is terrible and most of the time they don’t believe anything you say, some other associates can be rude as well

title: Job is not that bad still sucks though
review: It’s ight what do you expect from a minimum 9-5 wage job it’s not perfect but it pays the bills you know management is the worst so are the other employees but you get used to it just do your job and go home period.

title: Unappreciated
review: They don’t appreciate there employees. They always ask for more and don’t appreciate. Always over work there employees.  It’s never enough what someone does

title: Wonderful Team
review: Walmart has a great environment for any age group, you'll find a team you like working with and if not then there is a multitude of teams your can work with. If you stand out in your department due to your performance, you'll learn quite a bit about the job and running a team along with retail experience.

title: Fun place
review: Love the people there sometimes it’s hard but management is amazing good pay wonderful benefits good hours if you can work it they work with you when it comes to your schedule

title: Had a good time
review: It was a nice experience,  but the hours could be difficult due to the rotating schedule,  often days off we're not together. You'd get maybe a Monday and Thurs. Et

title: Terrible resource management
review: No room to work, constant increase of orders and less room to work in. Management teased a raise but then we found out we were never going to get it in the first place.

title: Stepping stone job
review: Walmart is only good for the short term,  I need a job now type situation.  Don't be a Walmart lifer. Managers don't seem to know who is working or even starting new. Training you receive is laughable,  you watch a bunch of videos that don't prepare you at all for your job. Then you're put out on the floor and expected to know how to do everything.

title: Good Place to work.
review: Working there was fun as a CAP2 associate  we had a good team whe I worked there. Always help each other to get things done faster. Benefits are are decent just expensive management is always micromanaging bad around black Friday and inventory time.

title: Decent workplace
review: Management is horrible sometimes.Supervisors are somewhat decentCo-workers can be either good or bad.Customers can give you a lot of stress. Don't take it personally when they try to irritate you.

title: It's okay
review: Not enough hours and if you work good they work you like a dog. They aren't flexible with scheduling and don't follow their own rules. They play favoritism

title: Productive & Challenging
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Overtime and pto and ppto and health benefitsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not leaving when it's time to goWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Culture great.Work environment not team work in some deptsWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Putting stock on shelves in the right spot.Meeting & assisting customers with their shopping needs

title: Walmart
review: Save Money And Time With Membership. Enjoy Low Prices, Free Delivery And More! e. Free Shipping on Orders $35+ or Pickup In-Store and get a Pickup Discount. Track Orders. Sign Up For Newsletter. Gift Cards Available.

title: Cool workplace
review: As long as you stay to yourself working here is amazing! You get to work with cool people and tend to help each other out a lot. I have nothing but good memories while working here!

title: Stay away
review: Total chaos, ok with failure, lack of communication from upper management to employees. Make a game plan everyday and no one follows up and it never gets done.

title: Not for the faint of heart
review: Terrible management that sees you as disposable. You are only barely appreciated for your hard work when they need someone to do their dirty work or to do overtime to save face. Older coworkers creating petty drama.

title: Walmart isn't for everyone
review: I worked at Walmart for seven years. When I first started there, it wasn't bad. But once our store got this manager that's when my store specifically started to fall apart. First of all the attendance policy was pretty ridiculous. That was like a ring around your neck to make sure you worked for days and days like a mule. The policy was basically a scare tactic that Walmart tried to use on associates. I could go on and on. Management chooses who they want to be nice or rude to. Loyal employees also get treated poorly. Walmart needs to improve and respect their associates way better than they have been.

title: Better jobs available. Find another company
review: Worst place ever. Upper management is the absolute worst. Rewards slackers, punish hard workers by making them pick up the slack of the slackers.Very rude and unethical. You try the “open door” policy to report the unethical behaviors and they retaliate.

title: Ran by corporate greed
review: Prioritizes personal bonus and running the store at bare minimum while disregarding worker's mental health and properly working equipment. Can't even find the budget to replace a dairy door handle for the customers but can collect their yearly bonuses since they stayed in budget...

title: Good work if u have good management
review: Good work if you have good management. Easy work and repetitive making it something easy to do even with no experience. All one needs to do is to follow procedures.

title: Hard work
review: It was a hard job for one person. I unloaded an entire tractor trailer by myself and another guy used a forklift. Very hard work. You have to be really fit.

title: Very fun place to work a lot of nice people
review: Very grateful for the hiring manager and co works really happened a lot I really didn’t like moving because I just met a lot of nice people and now bam

title: Worst job ever
review: I was let go for my attendance even after I told management that I was going through a lot and wasn't in the best mental state. Very toxic work environment

title: I have no words
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I can't speak for all Walmarts but the one I work for is awful there's nothing great about working there other than you get a paycheck every 2 weeksWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Corporate doesn't pay Holiday pay they took away bonuses ,customers don't understand why we have self checkout!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The culture is diverse the environment is toxic there's no direction ever, no raises, no holiday pay even if your full-time,no consideration for your loyalty or dedication, point system is a joke for call outs,  You're pretty much just thrown into the job there is no training, It could very well be just my store does this not really sure but it's the worst!!!What is a typical day like for you at the company?registers, fill bags, wipe registers, sweep floors,Customer service and attend to all customers and their needs even in the self checkout, zoning, putting Candy out and seasonal out everyday.

title: Never will I ever work there again unless major changes happen and that's with the bosses
review: What is the best part of working at the company?None , the company doesn't care anymore What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Bosses that sleep with your partner What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful ,time consuming ,not appreciate it even when you come in on your days off to help themWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?You will be tired and you will be underpaid and you will get credit for nothing that you have done to help the bosses and team leads will say they did it

title: Fun working there
review: The staff in other departments help out in other areas. Managers will work with you if you need to leave for emergency, a doctors appointment if you don't have the PTO time to call off work.

title: Draining
review: Absolutely no work life balance . You are expected to do the job of many other coworkers ontop of your own. Pay is not great at all. Especially for how much you put into working there

title: Cool environment
review: Interesting place to work. Meet all kinds of people. Pay pretty decent , must be willing to work weekends and holidays. It’s not the job for you if you want a set schedule

title: Overworked & under paid, major lack of benefits
review: No room for advancement, the company doesn't promote within usually will  hire a new employee for an open position. Work long hours, very few breaks.

title: An okay place to work.
review: This place wasn’t terrible to be at. I actually enjoyed it considering being a high schooler, i worked with other high schoolers i just felt that management could have been improved.

title: Decent starting rate; Management doesn't always acknowledge growth readiness.
review: Didn't have a bad experience onboarding or becoming trained/acclimated to the work requirements. Wound up becoming licensed for many pieces of equipment in the store and helping out in other departments. Unfortunately, I was continually passed over for advancement for less qualified applicants, so that was quite the motivating factor to begin looking elsewhere for employment. In the right store and with the right management, I'm sure someone's experience may be vastly different, but alas, mine was not.

title: It was alright
review: Stocking isn't just my thing, you have to load and unload lots of pallets, and doing the item and clothing sorting was just very tedious. Being in the back can get really hot and tiring too.

title: Not bad
review: Typical retail environment, not a bad first time or part-timw job. I reccomend this job if you dont mind management down your back , or if you have  strong patience for toddlers.

title: Okay
review: Fine for first job, pay was good, most of my coworkers were highschoolers, took 3 months to get the job and start because insisted online application, didn't look at application for a month after submitted, another month to review background check

title: Overloaded with work all of the time and very unorganized .
review: Before I got the job at Walmart in Hartsville S.C. I was excited because I always wanted to work there.... Little did I know what was the actual status of the store and job was on.... I was not properly trained.... I worked by myself on my first night... Management on my shift is not supportive of your wellbeing.... I know that stocking is a hard job but I'm always rushed and often have to go to 2 areas in one shift... The store needs a lot of repairs and cleaning...There is favoritism also.... I just thought my experience with Walmart was going to be like having a work family..... That's definitely not the case. I don't even feel as if I belong... No support from upper management... Even when I had personal problems that interrupted some of my work days.... Seems no one genuinely cares ... I work hard but was never encouraged or at least told I did a good job.... Not much encouragement but much criticism....  My work experience at this Walmart here in Hartsville SC has been like a nightmare to be honest..... I've never even held the hand held machine that they have there ... I e always used my phone.... And by using my phone.....I e dropped and damaged 2 of my phone's there....

title: It was work
review: It was alright. Learned alot and grew. Retail is the best way to start this career without digging a hole financially for yourself Walmart is probably the best of retail pharmacy

title: Decent if you’re independent
review: This business wasn’t a bad place to work. Management was just all over the place and it was hard to get help. Be prepared to do a lot on your own. They make a great effort though.

title: Pretty good
review: I like the people i work with ... mostly why I've stayed so long. Management is iffy and the people who control the system/orders, oh dear. Most is based off of seniority.

title: It's ok, it pays the bills
review: It's a job that will keep the lights on.  You might even get to move up. Just go to work, do the job and go home. Don't get caught up in other people's drama....like any other job. It will be what you make of it.

title: Great company to work when they need you. If you need the company,Don’t expect much in return.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great company to work, also will give you a lot insight when is time to move on. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Medical benefits are not the greatest. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great coworkers and great environment. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Smooth. Easy days at the vision center.

title: I had a bad experience as an employee.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Managers have preference with employees specially when they are the same race. A lot of discrimination managers don't care about how good of employee you are.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being discriminated and management gained on you.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Good until one employee has to make your job difficult and that employee is supported by management.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good and bad, it depends what kind of co-workers you have.

title: It's a decent place to work for good pay
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay and people are cool, make $20.50 stocking shelves What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to get everything done in the back roomWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The people are nice and the managers are pretty cool for the most part. Always rushing to get stuff done though so that's kinda a downsideWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Go do Dairy or Frozen (usually 6-10 pallets) be done around 12am (so 2 hours) than usually jump into grocery and try to get that knocked out by lunch (230am) and than GM the rest of the night or apparel

title: Good first job
review: Decent place to work. Management was ok. Pay was low. Opportunity to advance and move up. Coworkers were ok. It was my first job and I gained pretty good experience.

title: Good company to work for..Not that good upper  management
review: Good company to work for..Not that good upper  management...have noticed too much favoratism...company does compensate well...good pto as well..........

title: Overworked and under appreciated
review: Completely overworked and unappreciated. Management are very two-faced. Employees are often talked down to. The job itself is fun, but with the wrong management and co-workers, it can be draining.

title: Not the greatest at the DC
review: Walmart DC in new Albany is full of favoritism.  They don't have prober training. If anything ever happens it is somehow pointed to you. If you ever call home office about a problem and they find out you then have a target on your back. It isn't what it use to be anymore. Can't even make your hours anymore. Most ppl that I worked with. Great workers that have been there for years have already left.  Everyone in there is tired of working there. It's sad but true

title: Too difficult and stressful for the average person when there are so many other options for employment
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay rate is about it. The rest is tortureWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being there when people call in or quitWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Everyone is busy and tired. It's hard to be in a good moodWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy, stressful. You will hurry all over when you get off

title: Nice co workers
review: Bad management when it came to Covid and scheduling. Never again will I work somewhere so unorganized. Your thrown into working with little training bc half of the people who work there end up leaving. At least in my location that was common they said.

title: Fun workplace
review: Is Ok for what what they pay especially if you do college or need like a part time.The only bad thing over there is that many people over there are lazy

title: Good place
review: I love everything about this place. Fantastic management. Good people. The ride to work makes me crazy bc I wanna be at work so terribly. Love love love.

title: Easy work
review: Wasn’t a bad job . Lots of slow days. Busiest was on Sunday’s and the 1st and 15th of the month. You get the hang of everything within 2 weeks. Always opportunities to pick up shifts

title: Depending on what department you're working with the pay they give is worth it.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They work well with your schedule. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They have a point system when you reach 5 points in a 6 month period you automatically get fired. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is good.The management is a bit rude. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers and getting all your stuff done that they expect you to do is almost impossible.

title: Its fine I guess
review: Working here is great some days and challenging other days. We are a small store so you wear many hats as a manager. The management team works with you and tries to help you succeed in your area

title: Hardwork but good people and great managementt
review: I worked there in summer 2021, things may have changed now but I loved the people and management, just always on your feet and wrapping pallets, unloading trucks. Just the job description!

title: Good co-workers and immediate supervisors, upper management aloof.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people on my team, immediate supervisors.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Unloading trucks, palletizing various products.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Decent enviornment, some employees major butt kissing upper level managers and said managers tolerating it and treating said employees more favorably.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stock groceries, then moving on to other departments as needed.

title: Draining
review: I worked for 2 Walmarts and both of them treat their workers like hogs. They work you like a dog and make it hard to get any time off. They punish you for being sick even with a doctors note. They take sides and if you have an issue with a team lead they take the team leads side every time. Soul draining job.

title: Make money but location can be an issue
review: My time there wasn't bad you have a week of boot camp after u pass you go to the DC you was assigned for more training. After that your assigned a mentor and then get a final VOE check to ensure you have driven the minimum they require (I wish they would do this BEFORE you get there) the work is good and once you get the hang of things you can earn good money. Routes or lanes are not difficult. Benefits are good but I don't rely on them so double check to make sure. Now the Cons for me I had to drive 2hours to report to work and 2 hours to get home. I wish I could've got the closer DC to my home and I couldn't keep doing that drive. The 2nd was the slip seating I feel they could give all the drivers their own but they have a reason to why. And lastly and this might have changed but I would've liked a local position. Some DC's are in the process and some already have availability. Again double check to see if that has changed. Overall they are one of if not the best mega  / large scale companies out. They really appreciate the drivers, the pay is good, the equipment is top notch, if I could. I'd go back

title: If you care about your mental wellbeing, DO NOT work here.
review: Working at the Walmart in Crossville was okay for the first couple weeks, until I transferred up to front-end work. I have ended up doing more, if not all of the work. They keep employees that sit around and slack, and when I go and tell them about it, they only brush it off and say "Just do your part." That is NOT a solution for a problem that has been going on for two months. Leaving Walmart was one of the best decisions of my life.

title: Felt like an indentured servant
review: Good hours. Horrible management. Evil corporation. Almost impossible to move up in company. Hard workers get overlooked and taken advantage of while slackers receive praises.

title: Walmart is okay
review: We had 1hr lunches which is wonderful and had some of the best coworkers I’ve ever had and management was pretty rude due to the fact that we barley have enough time to do it our pallets and the pressure was on big time when they came around they would talk and let us know how much time til the next 3 pallets would be coming out vacation is unpaid unless you are full time and had been there a while

title: Forklift Driver
review: Good colleagues and good training opportunities. I had wonderful coworkers and I always felt appreciated and respected by all. I left because I changed careers, but I'd go back if I could.

title: It's good.
review: It is a good beginning job for highschool students (which what I did), just be wary of what section of the store you're going to work in and what it might entail.

title: Don't work there
review: Toxic work environment, managers suck, attendance policy sucks. Nothing about this company is good. You probably better off working at the post office or something. Only work here if you don't cate about yourself

title: Good pay
review: Everything good just short breaks if you work on the weekend you only have to work Saturday Sunday and Monday if you work on the weekdays shift then you work Tuesday through Friday.

title: Not bad
review: Pretty busy a lot of walking had to walk far to go on break and all the walking counts towards break.  Could play favoritism with who had to wear masks correctly. A bit soul numbing and draining.

title: Pay okay,manager suck
review: Management poor and well of course you’re just a number at Walmart not valued at all. Not a job to advance my career unless you’re liked. Just know going in. That either you’ll move up or you’ll be stuck in that position until you leave

title: Will hire anyone. no drug test required.
review: Basically, the title I posted tells the entire story of what to expect from Walmart. If you are capable of filling out an application, then you get hired. the lower management is just as bad as the rest. management can have colored hair and facial tattoos. they will recruit lower team leads as young as 18. Does Walmart really need 18-year-old mangers. Is there no one else qualified for a lead position except an 18 old just out of high school.

title: Fun
review: Loved working at Walmart. The team leads were always great and helpful (underpaid) in my opinion, but the coaches (higher managers) were awful. Additionally the hiring manager or hr lady that just recently got hired is terrible. She did everything, but her job and flirted with other managers. When you needed help with something coaches were not there to help. Other than that it was a fun experience.

title: Toxic soulless unpleasant work environment
review: I supervise there currently, and I can see without a doubt that this is the worst place I’ve ever worked. The management expects so much out of you whether you have a full staff or not. They don’t appreciate the effort that’s giving and hold you accountable for meeting goals that are pretty much impossible for a team of maybe 4-6 people for a day. It’s toxic.

title: Good support
review: Started as a cashier, then moved up to technician. Walmart paid for everything, license and certification. Always understaffed, but loved my coworkers.

title: Walmart is not the same as it was.  Find somewhere else that you don’t get hooked on the money and then can’t leave.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay is above company standard What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Hours are terrible.  Don’t ever go salary.  They own you at that point. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It used to be a great company.  It has gone downhill for last 10 years.  But they pay you too much leave.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Work Work Work Work Work and never look up!  It has gotten so bad.

title: Poor management ect.
review: Poor management. They put people in management roles that should not be there at all. When your over seeing others you are supposed to lead by example. Not put everything on your workers especially the ones that show up and work every day.

title: Average Job
review: I personally enjoyed my job as a customer service associate. I did my job, no one bothered me, and I went home. Sometimes the customer were made at things out of your control, but they had no choice but to follower the protocols in place for returning items.

title: Fast and friendly environment
review: I have been employed with the company for 2 years it is a fast working environment my job consists of having customer service skills as well as keeping work area clean

title: okay great benefits
review: loved being able to clock in on your phone and check your schedule 1 hour lunch was great the pay was pretty decent, and everyone was friends and knew each other.

title: Interesting
review: Every day is a new adventure as usual Al Walmart it keeps things from being boring and makes shift go by quickly which is always a plus. It can be traumatizing as well if you don’t keep your wits about you.

title: Coworkers were great, but Management was not
review: Management needs to be cleaned out BAD at that store. They made a simple job excessively difficult and overloaded employees with too many tasks. Coworkers are wonderful though, and very nice people.

title: na
review: not really much to say about walmart other than some managers aren’t the best n should treat there employees better!

title: It was great. I would go back if I ever get healthy enough to do so.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Overall it was awesome. I worked with a great crew. In the retail environment having a set schedule is almost unheard of. That was awesome. Great benefits. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Getting pulled to other departments that are short staffed. I severely disliked getting pulled to do freight. That is just my preference. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast paced. I literally walked 7 miles a day according to my pedometer. What is a typical day like for you at the company?I shopped for the customers online orders.

title: Work lif
review: The job was the worst I could have ever had. I tried my hardest there to be nice and everything but they are trying to push you to snap with some of the things they have you do

title: Interesting
review: The people there are great! Coworker wise that is... the leads need help, incredibly unorganized and never on time or helpful with anything. If you get more than three days ( hands on ) training, then you're a lucky one. The pay is the only thing keep many people there.

title: Not bad not great
review: It's not complicated work the stress come in from management and if you show your fast and a good worker then you have to pick up everyone elses slack

title: Good Company
review: Need a better pay structure. Company dosen't treat employees as good as they should. entry level should be $15 per hour. Benefits would be nice as well.

title: Has it’s good days and bad days
review: I started off in the online grocery department where work was simple. You would pick items from categories from oversized, ambient, frozen, chilled, etc. It’s very simple but once you get behind, it isn’t the most enjoyable experience. I was then moved to cashier where it was very simple and laid back even during the busy times. Management was mainly laid back

title: I look FORWARD to going to work everyday
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The unity of the staff members in our bakery and deli. THEY HELP EACH OTHER OUT NO MATTER WHAT. The supervisors work JUST AS HARD as we do. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When customers expect you to drop what you are doing for someone else and assist THEM insteadWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?FAMILY. THE SUPERVISORS HAVE YOUR BACK AT ALL TIMES AND COSTWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Walk in… greet… check my work load… get my orders out… take new orders… clean up… leave

title: Hit or miss
review: It’s easy work, but I would only apply to this specific Walmart if I wanted to feel like I was in high school with a bunch of middle aged women. Upper management is unprofessional and does not try to disguise their favoritism. Coaches are generally unhelpful and will backstab their own employees in order to satisfy other members of management. Team leads are hit or miss, some work and are involved in their departments, sometimes they’re the only people keeping it together; others only check in on their department when they’re about to leave after following coaches around all day. The place is also overran with rats (check out the pickle aisle) and management refuses to do anything other than put a few traps in the backroom. OGP was my first job ever, and it was honestly something I really loved to do. The previous location I worked at was completely different and actually a pretty positive experience, so not every Walmart has these issues, but this location is not great and I do not see that changing unless there’s a change in management.

title: Don’t Work Here!
review: Understaffed constantly, doing tasks of multiple people from call offs, lack of communication between associates and managers (unless management is complaining). No sense of direction, you have to figure out most things on your own, training is bare minimal. Don’t waste your time with this company.

title: Great Stepping Stone
review: This job entirely depends on the culture of your Front End, and whether or not you can deal with high stress customer situations. For the most part the accounting and daily routine of the job are great, if you have a good front end team, its a great place to get management experience.

title: Not a bad place to work.
review: Overall my experience has been positive.. decent pay, good benefits. Management is a little lacking in conversation,  but as with any company they are busy. Worst part is just not enough help.

title: Its fine
review: The position is alright. Scheduling was fine but there is a lot of walking  throughout the store & very physical because of lifting to high shelves  .

title: It was fun
review: Mean coworkers can make it miserable. It's retail. It is what you make it. Change is needed and welcomed as the company improves. Profit focused not people focused.

title: Great pay easy benefits
review: Nice local job for starter workers overall love it hate it beat it break it as a whole money better then time honestly take that message with a grain of salt

title: Unorganized and unhappy work environment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?My days off and getting paid. 1 hour lunches. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Never got breaks on time. Not much training. Time off requests were always denied no matter how much advance notice I put in. Hard to get a csm when you need help, due to the lack of training. Get stuck on self checkout for hours without breaks. Never get off when you're supposed to. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not too many coworkers were helpful. You're pretty much on your own. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in and get to work. Constantly rewuest your own breaks and lunches. Let them know when you're supposed to be off and then do it again so you can eventually leave work.

title: Always wanting more
review: Management wants more work without increasing pay starting pay is excellent most team leads are easy to work for don't process disability accommodations very fast

title: I would never waste my time or energy to work for that company ever again
review: What is the best part of working at the company?A paycheck and some of your coworkersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Straight favoritism of lazy associates, points politics for attendance and the unrealistic expectations of time if u are in management ans overall set up to fail everyday .What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unrealistic expectations and overworking grear associates so the lazy ones can continue to be lazy and not held at the same standards. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Go in have your day ready to do the proper processes for walmart standards then a higher member comes and tells u to do half the stuff  incorrect and wonder why the store can not stay above water.

title: Don't bother
review: if you actually work you would get in trouble for the stupidest reasons or even fired. If you kissed up to the manager you would get away with everything.

title: Fun
review: When I worked there it was a fun place to work. Pay was good for work that had to he done. Worked well with my school schedule, no concerns while employeed there

title: Horrible rude and toxic
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing good about this job, makes me sad thinking anyone invest their precious time hereWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything, management sucks, they don’t care about their workers and don’t care about your availability What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mean and rude. Environment is very toxic and harmful to anyone’s mental health What is a typical day like for you at the company?Come in, learn what wasn’t done the night before or overnight, ask management about it, get mad when you have to do everything, move on cause nothing gets fixed.

title: It’s walmart
review: It’s retail.  I used to enjoy the job but after Covid customers were meaner, and staff was always short.  It pays a relatively decent amount as far as blue collar jobs go.

title: Questionable
review: If you work here, you are basically on your own- which can be a good or a bad thing depending on what you want. Communication was very poor between management and staff, and often you get put into positions that you didn’t apply for. Part time employees may find more fulfillment in this job, but it’s not very sustainable unless you are higher up in the company. Strict attendance polices as well. Overall ok place depending on your needs

title: Managers pick favorites
review: And if you’re not their chosen one they watch you like a hawk to criticize you, all the whole dumping their job responsibilities onto their team. Double standards everywhere.

title: Most team leads and team coaches as well as hire up authority are disrespectful.
review: Everything you ever heard about Walmart wether it be on any type of social media or through news reports or word of mouth or another way is definitely true. I’ve avoided coming to work for Walmart most of my working life and personally knew a lot of employees at different walmarts and in different states and I believed it but I witnessed it and became a victim in the 11 months I’ve been here. STAY AWAY FROM WALMART. There’s so much to type but not enough room so fair warning especially if you like to stand up for yourself when you’re being mistreated they hate that. You definitely would be on the fired list. BEWARE!!!!!!

title: Fun place
review: Loved to be a overnight stocker because it was a peaceful place

title: Definitely an 8 I would recommend this job
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The associates and personal shopper What is the most stressful part about working at the company?It's really not that bad I would stay when we don't have the items on the shelfWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fun and down to earth , very good people What is a typical day like for you at the company?Some days are busy but it keeps me on my toes

title: Fun and Fast Paced
review: Walmart is a good company to work for. Gives out great annual bonuses based on your work performance and how the company is performing in general. Great people to work with as well.

title: Horrible and a waste of time
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing it was horrible the management are clowns this company doesn't care about anyone but moneyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers the work the customersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile no help at all no support no trainingWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Im stressed got headache nervous ready to go body hurting no equipment

title: Fun
review: Not a bad job. It's pretty easy get there on time break down pallets stock the shelves go home do it all over again good starting job don't get stuck here though

title: Fun workplace
review: Working as a cart attendant it was a great workout very humbling experience but it was honest work I would definitely recommend it to someone in college or in high school it definitely builds character and respect for hard work

title: Fun Work place
review: Fast paced environment, good benefits, lots of hours available, sometimes the customers are hard to deal with, good management team, pay is alright, would recommend

title: great benefits
review: great company and benefits, some locations could use better administration. opporutnities to move up in the compamy and relocate if that is something you are looking into

title: Horrible place to work
review: Hostile work environmentTerrible managementExcessive labor and overworking Mentally, emotionally, and physically drainingNo compensation when their minimum starting wage raises (i.e. you were already getting paid $17/hr after working there 8 years and they raise minimum start to $17, you get no compensated raise)They will force you to do other people's jobs including pushing carts, managerial work, stocking, etc. for no extra pay

title: Good thing is you have an hour lunch bad things are to much favoritism
review: Need to listen more to there associate's about problems and situations sometimes there is to much favoritism in the work environment should go by work ethics.

title: productive workplace
review: great job with consistent hours. they will work around your schedule and help you get promotions, when they see that you have been working hard. overall great job

title: A good job but far from a career.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I liked the work.  I was left alone most of the time.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Satisfying all the boss’s.  One would tell me to do one thing and the next would tell me to do something else.  My direct boss never backed me up.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Difficult to satisfy the bosses but overall,  nice people.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Was left alone to do my job.  When I was finished with my work then I was to try to please my bosses.

title: he work is not hard but, basically, they need better management training, knowing how to talk to people and how to work together
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Being around people, meeting different cultures What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They expect to much of one person, and not enough of all of their workers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile and aggressive tactics were employed needed to be aggressive to avoid being used against them by others and supervisors.What is a typical day like for you at the company?To come into the store and don’t have to do what the other shift left undone plus do what I need to get done as well

title: Ight
review: it was a cool little first job with ight pay. i quit working here once everyone started leaving and we got a new manager. the new manager was rude and

title: It was ok
review: It was okay. I didn't have an interview, just hired right into orientation. It pays well but they are very clique-y. I did not appreciate having to train for a week on days when the shift was 3rds but they do not train on night shift.

title: Productive work environment
review: I think the main reason I gave this rating is because of the position I was offered. I did not have a bad time with the company, just bad timing. The management was pretty cool  and they let you work anywhere in the store, as long as you’re actually working. There was always new people that were hired every week, so I think if you REALLY need to find something quick, then Walmart would always be there.

title: Good job, depends what role you get
review: As an online personal shopper the job was pretty easy. Pick the orders, place them in your carts totes, stage totes, take out orders on arrival. Cleaning of course, sweep the ogp room, wipe all the totes/carts, replace cart bags, etc. Then organizing the room as you clean. Filling in all spots with a dolly,  stringing totes on carts, basically just put things where they go. Hardest part is probably running around the store. Picks drop 3 hours before scheduled pickup. Meaning hundreds will drop, if you’re in a bigger city probably closer to 1,000 every hour. Also the room tends to get cramped with all the people who have carts putting stuff away and other people getting orders ready to take out. Management was pretty good. The most enjoyable part is your breaks. 1. 4hr shift =15 min break. 2. 6hr shift = 30 min unpaid lunch 2-15min breaks. 3. 8hr shift = 1hr unpaid lunch, 2-15min breaks.

title: didnt care about employees
review: work during pandemic and they just let everyone go once wverything went back to normal no reason/ pay was good / hours wasnt bad / just no job security

title: Cobstant work
review: I enjoyed my time there, it was medium-fast pace. Provided good income and the days went by quickly.I liked most of the co workers I was around. Top Management is a little harsh but there were, lower managers who evened it out.

title: More of a job than a career
review: There are lots of policies put into place to avoid favoritism, but unfortunately they have ways of going around them to pick "buddies" for interview positions. You don't have any authority to make a decision in management. They just want someone to say "yes".

title: Like working in a Warehouse
review: EXTREMLEY hard lifting all day (there is more than just shopping the groceries), can only be late 4 TIMES A YEAR, no benefits part time, they can schedule you 6 days in a row. Felt like i was dying after every shift could barely walk.

title: Solid but unfun
review: Pays the bills, but you are on your feet for awhile. Not a place that someone would probably want to stay at long term, but can help people get through the short term.

title: I love Walmart, am greatly appreciative for the experience.
review: I have great praise, love, and thankfulness for the multiple years of learning, engagement, and many opportunities to grow and develop my work skills.
position: Wal-Mart Cartpusher, Retail Sales Associate, Maintenance

title: It's ok
review: Store.manager does nothing but deflect responsibility. Most other employees do as little as possible. Generous time off. Pay is not equal to time and effort.

title: I felt with better management it would be a good place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I had my own department that I could work myself for the most part.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Filling in as a cashier without the appropriate training.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Most all employees were white/Caucasian and the environment was stressful due to being short staffed in other departments. What is a typical day like for you at the company?I kept busy so my shifts went by relatively quick.

title: Good highschool job!
review: Definitely was lacking a little on the scheduling side (took forever for them to change my schedule) but other than that I had a good time with my coworkers and team leads.

title: Frustrating
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Speaking only from my experience at the store I have yet to find anything good about it.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Total lack of communication and lack of training.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?For new hires it is like being a leper.  Employees that have a few years in do not want to help the new people. What is a typical day like for you at the company?I’m not with the company anymore

title: You come to work? Then work has to be done.
review: A time being treated unfairly but overall, it's about coming to work and completing task on time. Pay rate sucked when I worked there. A typical day at work is making sure the truck is done really fast. Management is readily available to talk to.

title: Walmart
review: Not bad not terrible. Stocking is fairly easy, management was pretty good to me. They were pretty understanding if I needed to take off of work for school or personal matters.

title: Some good some bad
review: The small towns are run by nepotism on steroids and if you accidentally step 9n toes of a liked person your done.  They allow outrageous behavior unprofessional behavior from those connected by family members

title: Fun work
review: Loved having a team to work with we had alot of fun remodeling the store! Met alot of nice people. Had the opportunity to advance in my career but I ended up having to leave due to at home problems.

title: N/a
review: They don’t care about they employees someone in your family could have died and they want you back the next day or kids sick nobody to watch them they want you there nobody that don’t care for people personally life

title: Perfect
review: Great place feelsLike family I would do it again just to be a part of it again. Yeah so like this is a great place. Ireally don’t have much else to say

title: Ehhh
review: Walmart is a okay company to work for if u need a job fast and now it is definitely a place for you there is room for growth but wouldn’t recommend it

title: No room to grow
review: Good place to work and fair pay but there's really no room to grow and the management and associates outside of the pharmacy could care less about the pharmacy employees.

title: It's not a career it's torture.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?People you meet. The abundance of never the same thing everyday.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You get pulled in every direction . 16 different managers telling you different ways. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Poor. The negativity is bad. Your treated with disrespect.What is a typical day like for you at the company?You look for something better every minute of the day.

title: Terrible
review: They put all the work on one person while everyone else gets by doing the bare min.it’s all about who you know. Favoritism galore.

title: Great coworkers but difficult expectations
review: I loved the people I worked with. They were all fantastic and I built great relationships with most of my coworkers. All the managers I interacted with were always great and helpful. They cared for the associates. The biggest downfall is working for an academy store. They had way too many expectations that could not be met especially with it being understaffed. I was only 18 and was put in charge of multiple departments, alone, for most of my shift way too often. Walmart's big selling point is that it is great for students but it is the worst job I have had while being in school. It caused horrible burnout and made it too difficult to come home to focus on school.

title: Wouldn’t take it back for the world, but look forward to experiencing better things in life
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It depends on the location, but the best part of mine is my coworkersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Doing my job, online grocery pickup is no where near easy What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast paced, stressful, but also welcoming What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very, very busy, usually not enough people scheduled

title: Fun people but unorganized management
review: My personal location, management did NOT communicate in any way. Which really made it hard for me to respect them. As a former business owner and retail manager for 25 years.

title: What a joke.
review: They don’t allow you do drink water in the pharmacy. They are constantly changing processes so nobody ever knows what’s going on. You’re never fully trained.

title: Okay
review: Management was absolutely horrible but the job is easy and pay was okay . Was there for a year and may have stayed if I didn’t go to college . Like a 6.5/10

title: Poor management and they don’t care about you
review: Got the job quick however if the management expects you to go above and beyond for them. Expect to do more than the job description or they’ll make you want to quit.

title: Okay for my first job
review: Was a decent place to work. Manager was decent and i worked with great people. their policy is the thing that sucks the most because they have a point system and you can even go home if you’re sick without getting a point

title: It’s fine
review: Great place to learn how to work, definitely not the best for a career unless you’re best friends with upper management. Great hours, really good pay, not my worst job.

title: Terrible management
review: Wouldn’t work for Walmart again if they paid me triple what I was making. Unrealistic expectations and management who would rather sit on their butts in the office all day then help their associates that are stressed to the max.

title: Management are born liars
review: Worked at Walmart for nearly six years, got nothing but lie after lie after lie from management - promised you things that never happened. You get told one thing then that changes for no reason/

title: Great
review: Loved it it was always great to come into work and be able to go off and work on my own thing without having to worry about someone breathing down my neck

title: Productive unless you are one of the pets
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Time off paid and breaks every 2 hours.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Rudeness of customers and you have to smile and take it.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Wonderful if you are working with decent people not bulliesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Feast or famine 24/7 tons of customers or few

title: High Expectations in first week
review: Always increasing quotas and throwing you to the wolves in your first week with barely any training. Managers give you impossible goals then go sit in their office on their phone. Do not recommend.

title: You must work hard everyday in a team like environment and finish tasks timely.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You are part of a team. They do make accomodations for disabilities.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Pace is non stop. The only real breaks are breaks otherwise constantly moving.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Face paced, hard working people only will make it there.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Constant walking and maneuvering, cleaning, resupplying, responding to supervisor requests

title: Managers do not care at all
review: Pay sucks, work sucks, no leadership, no direction and absolutely no one is ever held responsible for their actions. Do yourself a favor and bypass this place.

title: Cashier
review: Had a good time working here. Typical cashier job. This review will probably be outdated with the new store updates. But management was nice and helped out whenever needed.

title: Unproductive and unfun workplace
review: Walmart sucks, retail sucks. You get anywhere between 30 and 39 hours a week, you get zero benefits, you get paid garbage wages. They don't care about you. You know how it goes.

title: Alright
review: The work is laid back, sometimes management puts you in a different area to help out if its busy. Management is hard to talk to at times but overall its an alright job

title: Fun workplace
review: Fun workplace. The health insurance is great and so are the other benefits you receive. You build up quite a bit of pro in very little time as well.

title: Horrible place to work.
review: Managers treaty you like trash. you're never good enough for anyone and you do everyone else job. Get yelled at constantly and told you're not good enogh

title: Horrible
review: Once you have become salary Walmart seems to think that they own you and you need to jump when they say to. Have to work 18hr plus be on call 24hrs with no care for work life balance at all. No longer care for people who have worked with them for a long time.

title: Keep scrolling
review: Not worth it. The minute you get good at your job and comfortable they’re good for transferring you to a different department. Makes it harder to advance

title: Great pay and hours
review: Amazing pay and hours but management was ridiculous they abuse their power and force their work on to others Pm crew was blamed for anything and everything complained about paying overtime ALWAYS UNDERSTAFFED

title: Great Place to work
review: Great Place to work. Advancement opportuneness are always available as long as you seek them out. As with all other workplaces, there are positive and negativism however, there are far more positives working at Walmart as long as you seek to understand the whole process

title: Fun
review: Management sucks to a level of favoritism, they’ll go beyond to fire you without any warning and expect you to not show up at that store. Pay is okay if you’re a teen and not really wanting to do much, most end up leaving due to poor management and hours

title: Toxic Environment
review: It is only a place to go to if you are desperate and should look for other options immediately afterwards. Management doesn't know what it's doing most of the time.

title: Place isn’t the place to work
review: As a ex team lead people don’t get treated like people they get treated as work dogs that could care less about them you could have something big happen to you and Walmart doesn’t care

title: Not a good place to work at
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There is none you are over worked always short staffed an management is never on your side What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Over worked short staffed never appreciated an management is never on your side What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful and bad and not good What is a typical day like for you at the company?Always short staffed and not good management

title: I liked the job at first but they dropped my hours from 32 to 4 for no reason and are pushing me out for no reaskn
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They drop your hours from 32 to 4What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Getting hours dropped from 32 to 4 fir no reasonWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile and they play favoritesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Putting returns and drops away or opening a new pallet to put away

title: amazing
review: its the best place i worked at in my life. i like the work environment. my friends all work there. The management is great and the customers are all amazing

title: Fun and productive
review: Great working environment. Upper management support is ok. Obviously pay rate was low, but job advancement is doable. Opportunity is there, but you have to work for it.

title: Ok
review: The whole job was stressful and I felt overworked the entire time but the managers and coworkers were really cool and the pay was good but not worth how much u worked

title: Over worked underpaid self taught cause no one trained.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people I worked with were the best thing about walmart.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Thierry computers going down without any backup planWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Tools were hard to find and leaders did no work at allWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Change tires and oil without a break until you were late for lunch, take a lunch then repeat

title: Terrible
review: Terrible Bad management promotions were given based on internal motives . and everyone knew your business personal and you were made to do other jobs with no thanks and you weren't allowed free water especially during the summer

title: just dont work here
review: they will make you work for every penny, you get treated good by management if you slack off and hardly work, the people that actually put in effort get sh***ed on.

title: Great place to work
review: Good pay. Salary managers are only required to work 45 hours per week.  Opportunities for advancement. Great benefits. Walmart truly cares about there employees.

title: Fast paced, stressful
review: The job was easy in terms of not needing to have any type of skills. But stressful and high paced. Plus dealing with customers. It’s for some people just not me.

title: Its ok
review: Too much favoritism, moving up is hard even if you bend yourself over backwards. Health benefits are not worth it. Breaks are great. You get (2) 15 minutes breaks and a (1) hour lunches.

title: Fun coworkers, mgmt sucks.
review: Easy job, co workers are fun. Management sucks. If you finish early, you’ll be rewarded with even more work. For the most part you are left on your own and responsible to complete your hours.

title: Fun Enviorment
review: I enjoyed being outside grabbing carts. It got busy and crazy but was fun to be outside. Left to your own devices, no managers or anyone being over yiu.

title: Fun place to work
review: Met great people. Standing all day. Get a couple pair of comfortable shoes. Shifts change every 4 months. Management has their favorites. Pay was fair.

title: its ok
review: Always being moved around if you like that kinda of work, managers were clueless and never kept track of workers and people always left out pallets of overstock.

title: Hard working,loyal and honest.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Without uniform just Walmart vest 😁❤What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You don't have stressful part when you like your jobWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Environment great I'm multicultural so working with coworkers from different country is very interesting for me I learned a lot.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Do returns, price change, organize cosmetics, stock shelves,cashier.

title: Straight forward job
review: job was pretty good the work itself wasnt hard at all it the management that was the worst part of it all. went above and beyond with micro management

title: Good starting point
review: Kind of boring work as you can imagine, but it gives you something to do and pays more than minimum wage. Some of the managers are really nice and helpful, others not so much, so work experience can vary

title: Great job
review: Great place to work nice people. Many different departments to choose from. I worked in 3 different departments during my time there. Got a pay raise when I switched to deli from apparel and another pay raise when I became a cake decorator.

title: Pay
review: If you work there for a couple of years and pay increases, anyone that starts after you will make either the same or a little more based off experience.

title: Terrible management
review: No communication, Higher ups doesn’t listen or fix problems, Often do other shifts jobs and unfinished tasks, Lack of electronic supply, always understaffed and the pay isn’t good enough.

title: productive and fun workplace
review: Being on the front lines to try and get the best talent in the door for this organization can be tough in an employment market that is so competitive. However, I will say that partnering with hiring leaders has been phenomenal. The talent acquisition team works really hard to try and move candidates through the process quickly and give them a great experience and leaders are always willing to train new folks coming into the industry and to continue to grow their own.

title: Didn’t like it
review: Very poor management and awful rude customers and co workers it was fine at first but got old very fast easy job but walmart is not a company that will make you leave regardless as to how easy

title: Okay
review: Honestly , only work here if you’re in real need of a paycheck. If you have another option I’d take that. So much info with not enough training and way too much work for low pay.

title: No
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Focus on the job and hard working.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Most of them are not doing great job and disadvantage of me .

title: Was pretty good
review: Pretty easy.  Decent management too. Got pretty repetitious but was okay if you put in headphones and do your own thing. Also, theres a discount on food.

title: straight forward
review: great place to work and great benefits and hours. would love to work here again overnight shift was the best and the managers were really caring and kind

title: Management can be better
