review: Management can be better when it comes to listening to employees. Even if you sick with a doctor's note they'll still find ways to discipline you. Benefits are decent and by sucks

title: Hard working
review: Great time working there. Busy in most days and loved to get know my co-workers. Left because it was a temporary job for me due to me being in college. Just wanted to get some extra money

title: Fine.
review: Fine if you’re okay with stagnating and wasting away doing the bidding of people higher above you that can’t even handle their own job and look down on you for existing.

title: Love
review: Love my job. Great pay great environment. Wouldn’t trade the experience for anything in the world. Managers are very kind also. Coworkers make or break

title: Not terrible, not great
review: very unprofessional management, there’s lots of benefits working for walmart though, such as the 10% discounts & stock plans & the match pack the 401k plan through the company as well.

title: Work place culture is not great
review: Told them the hours I could not work and scheduled me hours I could not work. Waste of time.  The store is filthy and lower level management yells at associates.

title: Culture
review: Under staffed and leadership is not setup to succeed. Few undertrained managers with nobody to manage . Long term associates barely make more than the new associates.

title: Productive place to work
review: Can require a lot of attention to detail.  Overall a great place to work and people are helpful and easy to get along with.  Can be unpleasant with some but overall a good place to work. Management can be very unhelpful, good at telling you what to do and not so good with lending a hand when necessary.

title: Unfulfilling and Bad Management
review: The work is basic and unfulfilling. Management will pick favorites. Everyone is trying to do the least amount of work as possible, so things are not ran effectively.

title: Fun
review: Good place to work at. The managers were really nice. Everyone is always in a friendly mood. Customers are the best I love working here so much. I recommend.

title: Ehhhh it's average
review: Nothing special really, sometimes the goals that the company expects you to reach are either unrealistic or are really biased towards the managers/higher ups

title: Eeh
review: It’s ok. A lot of micromanagement and mismanagement all rolled into one big roll. Supposed to be some freedom on the road but with these guys. Not worth it.

title: Awesome place to work
review: Loved writing here. I had a clear understanding of my role.  Very willing to help. Decent pay. Products I could believe in. Once Wal-Mart took over, things changed, and definitely NOT for the better.

title: Great Pay, Hard Work
review: Overall a great place to work for, they have treated me great. I like how safety is always emphasized, including frostbite safety.  The pay is upwards of $30/hr for an Order Filler with percentage-based incentives adding up pretty quickly.  The downside is you'll be lifting heavy cases for 8 or 10 hours a day.

title: great
review: great place, great work, fun people Poor management. shift where ok and poor management. great place great work fun people, shitfts where ok and much overtime

title: Customer service
review: Sucks. Management sucks. Customer service, coworkers are awesome. Work as a team, and respect each other. You're job is very important, whether it sounds like it or not.

title: Not hard
review: Overall not hard work. You are there to help to customers. The management can get on you for not doing something while there is only a few minutes of down time in between helping people. Always have to be doing something.

title: Chill and enjoyable!
review: I had fun most days! Pay was good, people were cool. I appreciated my coworkers. Employee discount wasn’t much, but it was there. Overall pretty good!

title: I would not recommend walmart
review: From my own personal experience and including some co workers i used to work with they were never helped with points, their schedule for availability would not be respected at all and if you needed help with the coach from your department they would say they will help you but never will also supervisors too they are not helpful and i including the store managers they will not even look at you in the eyes to give you answers and help of how they should.

title: Bull
review: Do whatever makes you happy in this lifetime. Don’t waste it overworking yourself for no one, it’s not worth your time, energy, or the stress on your body.

title: Good job bad management
review: The job wasn’t the problem, the location and how it was ran was. I was mainly the only one really taking orders outside in the hot son and cold winter as a type 2 diabetic and it wasn’t until customers that come often got tired of only seeing me out there. The parking lot would get full and that’s when they send me help

title: Fast paced
review: Good place to work. I would recommend anyone just starting out to work there. If employee full-time they pay 100% of your tuition cost. Management is fair.

title: Management
review: Training is through, but your management team makes or breaks you. Mine broke me! I believed in taking care of our associates, they believed in money over care.

title: Fairly simple job but with a lot of tedious task and sometimes annoying management
review: Good bit of micromanaging but I would say it's a average difficulty job nothing overly difficult. Sometimes they ask you to do things not related to your position or job area.

title: Easy but annoying
review: This a job where favoritism is shown. Managers do what they want and all the work is left to the team members. They don’t care about work and life balance. Even i

title: excellent
review: good pay good benefits could schedules you have two set days off a week if you're full-time there's always work to do to keep you busy the leads are awesome the managers are awesome but there's a ton of teenagers working there and that makes for a lot of drama and stress but if you can just ignore it and keep your work and do your work you'll be fine

title: The Good, the bad and the ugly
review: Hired for craft/cloth department. But I was sent to every department in the store to work, including unloading the trucks.I was punished  by management for stating that company policy was to promote employees from within before hiring outside applicants for a position I had applied for in the current store. I was then punished and scheduled to work every weekend for 6 months straight..I worked there 5 years and was fired for no good reason as stated by the state. People promoted into management get power hungry and use their authority to mistreat employees at Walmert.

title: The good: Steady covid-proof work, insurance offered after one year. The bad: While you bust your hump, your slacking co-workers get paid the same.
review: Management in this company is totally lacking.They don't pay attention to what you yourself are doing, everybody gets the same credit/pay even if they are total underachievers.

title: Don’t Drink the Coolaid
review: Walmart is a very appealing place to work until you actually work there. Team Leads and Coaches are all stuck up, they all believe that the lesser employees are second class citizens compared to their pretty Team Lead badges. It’s like being in high-school again. Also they are proud that they turn out employees quickly? “We can get a new you here, trained, and working in three days time.” While being a big donator to the Make A Wish foundation, this employer does not care if a mother has to call off to take her child with Cancer to the hospital. Not if you got into a car accident. Nothing. Do what you gotta do but if you have a better opportunity elsewhere take it.

title: Retail nightmare
review: Terrible company. Terrible management from the bottom up. the only time something improves is purely so salary management can increase there bonuses meanwhile issues that effect employee quality of life and even safety get pushed to the side.

title: Has good benefits that come with the job
review: With your job you get Walmart + and basically save yourself a lot of money with the associate card that comes with it. The job itself is very straining and I had to stay standing for hours picking up heavy boxes and fixing things boxes people opened.

title: Pay
review: Good pay for very hard workEasy to move up and make managementSummer months are brutal, especially working inside of trucksDrink plenty of waterFeed you lunch

title: Straight up stressful work environment..after 7 1/2 years I am glad that I no longer work for them.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?nothing, you can work your butt off for then and get treated like you are replaceable What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management, they tell you what I'd expected but they don't ever do it themselves so don't know the stress of the job What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, and always worried that you will be called out for maybe doing something wrong What is a typical day like for you at the company?Trying to not do anything to get fired

title: Decent job but management ruins it
review: I was only an employee for a few weeks and then decided to work elsewhere. My coworkers were all great but management is where the problem lies. They treat employees like children and they will definitely  micromanage  you!

title: horrible management
review: During my time as an asset protection associate a lot of the management would place the blame on me for not being able to catch every theft that came through the doors. I’d say with the supervisor I had made me feel more confident and comfortable, but all the other managers just cared about themselves and when you attempted to advocate about something or someone you were turned away or given a cold shoulder.

title: Okay
review: Decent place to work. Low pay. If you've ever worked retail, then you know what to expect. As long as you do your job, then you should be fine. My managers were decent.

title: People were great
review: Coworkers were super cool, couldve been a worse place to work at but not terrible. Management sucked and could never get their stuff together enough to actually run the place

title: Almost good
review: Workplace feels like an unfinished product. You will do the dirty work while getting paid less than everyone, the managers are guaranteed to hold you accountable for their mistakes but do you get the bonus when all goes well? No. That may be okay when starting a job with decent behavior from coworkers but are you being harassed on and/or off the clock by your coworkers? No one cares, dummy. If you get past the 3 months probation, simply don’t do your job, nod along and you’ll have a job for life! Don’t text anyone not on a work phone, many have not learned what boundaries are. Aside from human behavior, the ability to earn a(n almost) free transferable AA is great.

title: fun
review: I truly enjoy my job. A majority of the customers are easy going. The crew I work with works as a team to get the job done. I'm not going anywhere any time soon

title: Productive, fast paced work environment
review: The point system that Walmart has, is hard for people to keep there jobs no matter if employee or family members are sick, have a family emergencies, or wanting  to attend a funeral from family if you don’t have PTO TIME OR PPTO TIME TO COVER THE DAY YOU MISS it will be accounted against you. Other than that amazing company and enjoyable work place. My favorite job I’ve had

title: Inclusive Work Environment
review: Where people of all cultures meet and work as a team. If there's one thing I can say about Walmart, its the diversity is second to none. Sure there are cliques, but as opposed to high school, most here get along. Management has great relationships with hourly employees, but once you are salary, you are all but owned by the company, as no regard to maximum hours per day/week are given. Supposedly 50hr week quickly gives way to 60 or 70, with little to no comp pay or days in return.

title: A place to start
review: No managers, just checklist reviewers. Expect a 2% raise, no matter what the "feel good" letter says that will be published about a month before they take effect. Not all the bad things on the Internet will apply to your store, but some will.

title: It's Walmart
review: I really enjoyed the people I worked with and my supervisors were great. I only quit because I felt like I needed to be available for my family. Of course the busy days were really difficult, but that's normal.

title: Underappreciated
review: Management is good on the low levels but worse as it goes up. Customers are pretty abusive. Pass on this unless you like to feel overworked and way under appreciated.

title: Fun workplace
review: Great career.  If you like customer service . The pay is very good and there's always an opportunity to move up . I highly suggest working for Walmart

title: Productive and interesting workplace
review: Hectic but good pay. Not a place for introverts or those who like to work by themselves. Management is okay but could be better. The best part of the job were the breaks.

title: Fun workplace with some downtime to decompress.
review: Hit or miss. Sometimes the work is overbearing with management not helping but yelling to finish and other times little work with management yelling at you to find work to do.

title: Overwork Employees
review: They expect you to do everything for them but dont care about your well being at all. Will hire you as a part time worker and schedule you full time hours without benefits.

title: Okay place to work.

Apply for a salaried position or look for a better place to work than Walmart.

title: Horrible Leadership
review: They like to create new policies and procedures without thinking them all the way through. They don’t ask the end user their opinion or suggestions about changes before rolling things out which causes lots of double work and confusion in a lot of cases.

title: Disorganized

title: Toxic people lazy management

title: Exploitive
review: Walmart as a company to work for is. very hit or miss. It seems like the company itself does not care about its employees, but I have nothing but good things to say about all of my managers and store supervisors. And I do understand that it is hard to manage a massive store, let alone thousands of them.

title: Not for the Weak
review: I worked overnight shifts and I had trouble staying awake, which was my only issue. If you have no problem staying up, it’s a great job. Easy money. I would’ve stayed if I worked the day shift.

title: Product speed

title: Working at walmart
review: This company only cares about making money during COVID they did not care if we were down people we still had to get the job done. They say they care but they don’t they continue to change to make sure the get their money it is the worst company to work for. I know people are still there because they need their jobs my heart goes out to them.

title: It was ok.
review: A typical day was to help customers check out their products while at the same time giving out good customer service. Most of the management were cool and the atmosphere was alright.

title: Fair workplace
review: Overall my experience was pretty good but be prepare to stand almost all your shifts. I had to stop because my back was hurting really bad. There was a lot of drama as well but it was ok.

title: It is one of your options of somewhere to work when you're just starting out. That's it.
review: This may not be true for all Walmart locations, but the one I worked at was terrible. Decisions from corporate always punished those at the front of the store and made our jobs worse, and when they weren't doing that, their decisions were just outright confusing. I had also heard from several other employees about how they've been mistreated by their team leads, though I never had it happen to me personally. As a cart associate in particular, I always felt on edge because of the possibility that I could damage someone's car or be hit by some jerk trying to leave the store too quickly.To highlight their incompetence, the reason why I left is because I had gotten injured at work. It took them 2 HOURS to file an incident report and have me talk to  a nurse over the phone. The nurse ended up telling me that I was on my own anyway and that I had to self-treat. I could have been at my doctor's office within 5 minutes instead of going through all of this.Honestly, there are many other options for you out there, but if you really need a job and some money, Walmart is an option, I guess. Just don't expect much.

title: Ambiente de trabajo bueno
review: Me gusta mi trabajo y eh avanzado mucho en el ambiente laboral

title: Good for a paycheck and not much else
review: I've worked for Walmart for three years at three different stores and in two different job positions. While each store has their own management and business practices, their core flaws are always the same. Individuals who work hard and are reliable employees are always given the work of others. Lazy, unreliable and generally bad employees are kept around much longer than nessasary. Meanwhile, decent employees are given extra work, little to no thanks, and often punished when they can no longer do the work of more than one person. Walmart typically relies on punishment for mistakes made and doesn't reward or recognize those who truly hold the place together. They no longer give double time or even 1.5x pay for working blackout days (aka holidays and holiday weekends) but will absolutely still give out double occurances if you call out. It's not all bad though. You are allowed and typically encouraged to take hour long lunches and you get an employee discount card. Since they don't ever seem to get around to firing employees with a bad work performance, the employees who are hardworking and basically untouchable. Plus, they need everyone they can get since the turnover rate is extremely high. If you want to get experience in a bit of everything, Walmart is pretty good for cross training different departments as well as training for management positions. Overall, it's not a great environment, but it could definitely be worse.

title: Good pay, good benefits and no one expect you to work too hard.
review: One thing stands out about Walmart after all of my years working there. The culture of acceptance, everyone is welcome everyone is accepted. If you need a job and you're willing to show up on time most of the time Walmart has a  place for you.

Still, there's always management, though the hours you would have to put in are going to be quite a lot for a field management position.

title: Low pay for work required
review: Was an online/digital personal shopper:  The pay was way too low for the great physical demands. One would think an online shopper running around with the carts would be an "easy" job.  It's not.  Sometimes those carts (with 8 crates in each) you are pushing around 300 to 400 pounds.  You are slinging around cases of soda/pop all day, gallon after gallon of milk and water, cases of flavored water, 40#'s of cat litter (all in one single bin out of 8 in a cart), and those are just the "small things" that fit into the crates.Then you have what Walmart considers the "larger items" go onto a larger flat cart but you are still having to lift and sling them around, dog food, etc.   Even worse if they are short staffed (which is the norm) they expect you - after slinging around heavy things filling and pushing a heavy cart around - If they are short staffed then they expect you to "stage" the crates - Taking crates that are 30, 40, 50# or more each into coolers, freezers, etc.  Over and over and over again.It's back breaking work that does not pay near enough.

review: When I working at Walmart I am sorting clothes and stocking also zoning they leave alone never help me and manager no respect associate person also never listen to associate they want working.

title: My work was mindless and meditative.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There's a Walmart everywhere and you can work your way up.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The work environment and my manager.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I was at a small neighborhood grocery so it's probably different, but they had decent training, assigned people to work with me in the beginning, and made it very clear what kind of behavior of coworkers and managers should be reported and how to do it.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I straightened the shelves and fixed the top shelves in the store, scanned merchandise on the shelves in the back and put what the handheld told me to put on my cart, took it to its place on the store and put it up.

title: The first time you have
review: The first time you have a chance at the top is the second one you get a free pass and you can go on your way back and then go to your car to go back to your house

title: Good starter job
review: Had this job in high school, not a bad place to start. Better than fast food. Managers kind of sit in office and don’t help is the only problem. As a 19 year old with experience with gun sales I was thrown to the wolves so to speak.

title: Not bad ig
review: Pretty much worked by myself. Some stuff was pretty heavy to lift but it wasn't too bad. Not a fan of their point system/no doctors notes policy. Would recommend to someone who doesn't want to work around customers

title: Points and management poor
review: Good luck if your sick and P P T O is not guaranteed to to keep you from getting points for missing work , team leads never spoke to me about my points or they don't care about you, nobody but a few coworkers who go through the same thing you do on the daily. Besides the convenience of working in a supermarket Im glad I don't work there anymore.

title: It was okay
review: Working here was okay, it is Walmart so don’t expect a lot. Nice coworkers, management was decent but could improve their communication to employees.

title: great place
review: Work with great staff and great workflow. Can be very stressful at times but over its a great work environment the diverse amount of people is a bonus

title: Good management. Excellent supervisors.
review: Good management. Excellent supervisors.Great benifits.Competitive pay.Room for advancement. Nice work hours.Good atmosphere. There's always help when you need it.

title: Fun and productive
review: I loved it I had regular customers that would come in everyday almost and the managers were great always made sure you got breaks and they was always understanding when I was pregnant.

title: Terrible place to work
review: During my employment, Walmart managers were uncaring and unprofessional. Attendence and points were handled differently based on managements friendship with employees. Some associates had points "accidentally" erased, while others have been terminated for taking bereavement, or while a medical leave was still pending. While employed, my store manager hid in her office when I needed to speak with her and has done this to others. When asking about policy, you may receive information from one member of management, that is incorrect of varies to what other managers will say.

title: Horrible place to work
review: It is definitely not the best place to work, far from it actually. It was ok at first, but lately they've been kind of unreasonable. They expect maintenance to clean the restrooms every hour!! A lot of times it takes me that long to just clean the restroom and sometimes even a little longer to clean the ones on one floor (two floor Walmart). Plus it doesn't help that they make you work nights and weekends a lot, leaving you with basically no work-life balance. Plus on top of that, you've gotta deal with customers yelling at you for taking too long to clean the restrooms when it would be a lot easier for them to just go use another restroom than to wait on me!! They also yell at you for stuff that's out of your control like when there's no registers open or we don't have what they want in stock or don't know whether they do have it or if you don't have the keys or can't find someone who has the keys for something they want!! It's like, excuse me, since when is the janitor in charge of that stuff!! My job is to clean, not get you stuff!! If you're thinking about working at Walmart, I advise you don't!! Definitely one of the worst places you could ever work!!

title: Great
review: Big money. Good job. Can make good money. Lots of hours. Good management. The break room smells nice. Lots of stuff to do. No overtime offered bad thing.

title: Great benefits, not much room for growth
review: The 401K is great, as is the insurance and paid time off. You have to work full time to receive all their benefits and that is really hard to achieve, regardless of your punctuality, reliability, and work ethic. Every time they give a pay raise it’s followed by job cuts.

title: Great Managers and Pay
review: I really enjoyed working with the management here. Each day they express their goals for zoning departments and encouraged us to get it done. Only downside is when code Spark was called and we had to go on the cash register. That would distract from our main task.

title: The company and managers are toxic
review: If you care about your mental health do not work at this place. You can do so much better for yourself and family. The business comes first they do not care about you or your needs or your family issues. If you or your kids are sick or in the hospital then tough luck. They will terminate you and say they have a business to run. They don't care about their employees only how much money they can make. And they also don't want you taking time off either.

title: great prices
review: seperating bags for customers so it was easier for them to grab them. management rarely worked with you, they would often wonder off for hours at a time and ignore your request for help

title: Good pay just micromanaging
review: The place is fine to work at if you need a job just the managers to some work. Constantly over shoulder watching what you do but if you want 16.50 go for it.

title: Interesting Position
review: Pay is decent. A little bit of heavy lifting. Kind of fun running around the store shopping for others and challenging yourself to be fast and accurate.

title: Great place
review: Wasn’t a bad place to work at all. Pay isn’t bad because the work isn’t hardManager could be better but everything was great overall. Would work for again

title: Awful
review: Worked at two separate Walmarts one was good the other was horrid. Avoid working at the Clinton township Walmart at all cost. The people there are great but the very top of store leadership is awful.

title: Okay for a temporary job
review: They ask a lot of you and will cut your hours for ANY given reason from full time to part time hours or less!They don’t care about breaks but they’ll tell you to take them on time, and expect to do jobs that are not within your description.Also it’s extremely easy to get points but extremely hard to get someone to care enough to remove them(with valid evidence and reason)

title: They dont care about you
review: This place does not care about you. Period. They just count you as a body that works to make the company money.dont waste your time here at all.beware of it

title: Numbers driven
review: Many unkind coworkers. Few were alright or decent. Management expects unrealistic goals for new hires with minimal training. There are classes Management can take to develop skills on how to treat others and speak to their employees. Either they need to start this program here or they need to get rid of bad Management who don't utilize the trainings and comprehend the classes.Genuinely enjoyed my job. But management and coworkers make it unberable.

title: Great place to work offers full benefits and great pay 👍
review: Although my employment was seasonal I actually enjoyed working for Walmart Distribution. Management was thorough and organized especially dealing with large amounts of hires. Pay was excellent and they offered incentives. Easy job laid back people are welcoming and helpful. Hours were awesome still had time for family & friends.

title: Great place
review: Great team! Great manager and staff great place to grown and to become something bigger thank yourself really enjoy the people there and I think it’s great place for anyone looking for a career

title: Little advancement
review: There was little advancement opportunities provided. Management at the time was driven to only having one gender as leaders without developing people.

title: Amazing
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay the hours and the team What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being laid off due to lack of work

title: OK place to work
review: Its Ok. people were nice. Hours were good. Management could be better. Overall it was a job that I needed. I learned alot about working which was good.

title: An utter waste of your time and no future in it.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The co-workers. You find friends easily.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nobody cares to stand up to harassment, the hypocrisy of management as a whole and their policies they break all of the time with no consequences. Don't ever let them make you salary or you'll never see your home again and even that isn't enough to get things done. Evaluations are a joke as are the raises anymore. And after you've finally had enough and leave them, they'll have the unmitigated gaul to want you to come back like they didn't already have years to hear what you tried to tell them before. The place is filled with change just for the sake of saying so, not kfor the actual good results those changes were suppose to make. Machines replacing humans all the time. Now you have what use to be cashiers just standing around and staring at you ad you check your own items out and you're not getting paid a salary. I could go on but I won't. Suffice it to say it's not worth it.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Understaffed always as you waste your time in a job with no future.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Suppose to be 12 hours. Ends up being 16 and you don't get any extra pay and it's never enough.

title: Good job
review: It’s been many years, but it was a good job.  Stocked overnight.  Bosses and coworkers were respectful.  Not the most enjoyable job, but Walmart was a good employer.

title: Productive and fun
review: Loved the job and hours great environment felt like home and opportunity for advancement the job was fun and not too strict great environment love the

title: So far it's good
review: It is my first week and so far I like it . I had to wait for an interview for like two months (I never call for an interview) the interview was easy and they hired me the same day. Something really good about walmart is that they pay for your college even if you are part timer.

title: In the beginning fun and growing at the end stressful and not trusting the managers there
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people you meet working thereWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management!!! And your job changing everyday What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful ! Management ruins it for ya What is a typical day like for you at the company?Never knowing what you were walking into on a daily basis

title: Nah
review: If you’re looking for an easy, boring, hostile work environment; Walmart is just for you!! Work your butt off and never get anything in return. Not to mention, management are lazy and entitled to the very little work they do. For the past 3 years I’ve been here, in total 49 New hires have quit within 2 weeks of being here. Managers drive people to quit for petty reasons. Very little managers here, have the maturity to be in the positions they hold.

title: good pay and good hours
review: walmart had good hours and good pay, along with great benefits for full timers. enjoyed working with my coworkers. management could’ve been better along with better flexible scheduling.

title: Do not work here
review: I wouldn't recommend to work at Walmart to my worst enemy. It may have just been the one I worked at, but you would be punished and retaliated against for missing even one day. The managers were not nice, and pretty much bullied you into quitting. Again, could just be the one I worked at, but I definitely don't reccomend it.

title: No work life balance
review: Great fellow associates, benefits and pay is decent ,  upper management needs to improve on empowering and sharing knowledge , overload of favoritism and unrealistic expectations.

title: horrible
review: horrible just horrible, no workers, a lot of work on your body, favoritism, bad management, people can be rude sometimes, and overall it can get stressful

title: The job at Walmart could lead to a career
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Teaching and Training. Easy to advance What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Walmart cares about their AssociatesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Walmart is an easy place to work as long as you're dedicated to your jobWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Teaching and training new team leads and Associates. Making sure customer satisfaction is obtained.

title: Management is a nightmare
review: Favoritism and clique mentality run rampant within this store. If you are not in good favors with the right people, your work will be micromanaged and they will find any reason to terminate you in a heartbeat. Most of the associates are enjoyable to work with and honestly the only reason to remain with the company but management makes working there awful, stressful and make you feel like you're back in high school again being bullied by the popular kids.

title: Good Pay, Bad Management
review: This company isn't so bad to work for, more so the management is a hassle to work for. They treat you as a number and a means to their bonuses rather than an employee or a person.

title: Online Delivery and Pickup is stressful
review: People in this area are frequently stressed and underappreciated. Management and corporate ask more and more of associates and are slow to get us the equipment, training, and resources we need to get the job done. The company values making money more than they value their employees. Shouldn't be a surprise considering it's Walmart. It's about our pick rates and not how hard we work to keep the store running.

title: Eh
review: Alright management got me out of there Good hours but no help sometimes Constantly bugged about my performance when people were literally just standing around

title: Counter productive place to work for.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Helping customers have a positive shopping experience.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Too many chiefs and not enough Indians to achieve some semblance of coordination.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful environment with a touch of apprehension. The culture was all about “me”.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Most customers were friendly,but, standing in one spot for eight hours was hard on the body.

title: Productive and Team work was amazing.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working in Walmart is that they work with you acccording to your availability, also they have Education assistance programme for free.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful part is working on Holiday without compensation, just normal day pay .

title: A bittersweet company to work for; good pay, high stress.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay was decent. The people that worked there were really awesome. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?It's very fast paced and customers and some CO workers are not very patient with you. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very sales driven. Doesn't matter how hard you work. You are there to make the company money. If you can't do enough for them you are replaceable.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very stressful and fast paced and anxiety inducing

title: the coworkers vary from all ages but the management is bad and the pay is good.
review: as a 16 year old working as a walmart stocker for 15 an hour was pretty good but the management sucked and they messed with my hours a lot. good walmart plus benefits though.

title: Over worked
review: The cashier are very over worked and. Alway doing stuff not in there job description, the whole place is really a joke the adults are just as childish as the minors they hire there 10/10 do not recommend

title: Terrible company would never suggest working there.
review: Company doesn't care about their employees, management is awful and will try to take advantage of you. They do not care about their long-term employees, do not expect raises you can be there 5+ years and they will hire someone on making more money than you because they know the new hires won't last.

title: productive and fun workplace
review: A typical day for a personal shopper at Walmart would involve a combination of online orders to pick and packing orders, as well as helping customers find products in the store. The job requires a high level of attention to detail to ensure that customers receive the correct items, and the ability to work efficiently to meet tight deadlines.

title: Hard work that doesn’t stop
review: Very hard work, everyone will slack off and management will expect you to pick up everyone else’s slack. Coworkers will ask for help so you can work all night while they sit there and slack while you do all the work.

title: Decent job- just sucks because it's entry-level and I was a teen at the time.
review: My peers were very nice, my managers where pretty darn approachable too, but the overall culture was just kind of soul sucking (as with all Walmart's). While obviously it's a matter of personal preferences, experiences and other factors- this was my FIRST job as a Teen and as such it wasn't a bad or negative experience to have. overall- A pretty decent first job and alright working experience.

title: Ok
review: Ok is a great place to work for a Skype call by chance today to discuss the best way to hold a meeting with you and I are in the same way as you can come over at 6 and 7 to the insole your feet on a road and a foot fetishist to a couple different places in

title: Good pay, next to impossible to move up
review: The pay is pretty good but it's nearly impossible to move up, if you're fine doing the same thing for 10 years then go with this company. Depending on where you are the management is pretty terrible

title: fun place
review: love working here with hardworking and honest people. sometimes they overschedule you when you tell them you can only work certain hours but it's whatever lol

title: It's what you make it
review: I had a lot of fun on the job, because I made an effort to make it fun. Others did not like the job that much. But you have to balance your job expectations with the reality of working. Customers are usually the only dynamic on the job, with the ability to set the tone for the rest of the day.

title: Bad management
review: Management doesn't know how to handle poor costumers behavior. No matter how bad they act they'll side with them and you can't really do anything about if.

title: Chill management
review: I loved working here, I was pregnant at the time and I would just sit on a stool and scan items my whole shift. They were very understanding of my pregnancy and random appointments.

title: Management doesn’t Care
review: Management changes schedule without notice terrible leadership. The best thing you could do it to never work here. This place takes the life out of you

title: Typical retail job
review: Job is alright, just gets busy and stressful because of lack of staffing (people come and go). The people are cool if you find the right group of individuals and click with.

title: Loved working with the customers, management chaotic and uncaring
review: If your life doesn't allow you to work their set FT shifts in full, you aren't eligible for health insurance even if you pick up enough hours to be eligible according to the handbook -- I was told by a team lead that was only true if they scheduled it and not just if you use the pick up shifts they offer. Management does not care about your end of shift. If someone calls out, they don't allow you to leave and threaten discipline if you have to -- even if it's to get a young child off the school bus.

title: Fun work place
review: Its good very fast working environment..time will go quickly..lots of benifts.teammates are good and supporting..dealing with online customer order.you wil enjoy it..

title: I loved my job
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great management at TAWAS store.  Fun coworkers.  Loved the customers.  They worked with me on scheduling.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Major physical work with deadlines and the pressure to work faster.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great.  Loved all of the openness and acceptance of different people and personalities.

title: Unbearable
review: Constantly getting yelled at and nitpicked to the point of annoyance, never good enough, slackers get to go home while real workers get burned out, being unemployed would be better

title: It's a fun workplace if you allow it to be if you let it stress you out it can just like any other time
review: To me it's a great company to work for I like it I enjoy it sometime the management team can be a little rough but overall I enjoy working at Walmart and I plan to go back real soon

title: I enjoyed it
review: Everyone hates on walmart for having horrible workers but when I worked there I loved it and all the workers were constantly working hard and doing their job. Everyone was great with customers and would help whenever asked unlike the stereotype of "walmart employees dont actually help customers" it was a positive environment and I loved my coworkers. All the workers is like a family

title: A business that will destroy you
review: Walmart is an insane place to work. You will apply to one department get hired for that department then show up to your first day of work to be stuck somewhere completely different. The lower "management" is a huge issue they will spend more time outside smoking and standing around talking then they will be working but will complain in a second if you aren't doing their job and yours.

title: moderate
review: while Walmart does care for your work and life balance, they throw a lot of unnecessary requirements and expectations at you all in the name of  money

title: Productive and a very fun place to work and build career
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Walmart has great benefit packages and the pay scale working overnight is amazing. When i worked during the evening shift, helping consumers was a passion for me especially when they were abled to walk away pleased with a smile. It melts my heart.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working with some that doesn't want to be at work.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is just any other job, some work and take their job seriously while others play around and dont take work seriously. I would say its fair.

title: Not bad
review: Job wasn't too bad for the pay. Depending on what you were doing that day it could be very busy or almost nothing to do at all. The pay was very good for the work.

title: productive
review: Very fun to work and funny coworkers. Great lunch breaks and there very easygoing when you make a mistake. Sometimes they provide food for the employees.

title: My experience caused me and my family a lot of damage
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The Pay and some of the co workers who actually have good intentions What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management, the harassment, the lies and the cover ups to save one's own job securityWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Competitive, racial and stressfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Under the right management with the right guidance a typical day could be great and stressfree

title: Generally a pleasant place and people, not hard work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great people to work with! I worked stock/Dock 2nd shift. Misrepresented job openings online to get you in the door for the interview. Enjoyed the job and the customers too! Pay and benefits are good.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Stress was caused be no-show and sick call-ins, and you we told to still get it done in same amount of time.... not my problem.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Culture is not the word, brown-nose is a better choise. What is a typical day like for you at the company?8hr shift with all the O/T I wanted.

title: Its a typical Walmart job
review: Its always super busy, registers and money order machine is almost always down. Managers are more understanding than my previous ones. The whole front end is young people mostly.

title: Walmart
review: It's good pay for easy work it just gets very boring after a while. Would recommend for anyone looking for a layed back job. Plus they have good benefits. The main down side is if your a fast worker you end up picking up everyone else's slack.

title: It is okay
review: Opportunity for advancement is fair and the pay is adequate. The work is never-ending which is expected from a big box retailer. Can become chaotic at times and plan on working long hours.

title: Great place to work
review: Wal mart is a wonderful place to start a career. I would encourage anyone to start a career here. Wonderful culture, benefits, and pay. There is definitely room for progress.

title: Deceptive deceptive deceptive
review: What is the best part of working at the company?friendly people just don’t work there What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They over work their employees .What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was a good environment but I don’t think anyone should work there.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good but they play games with the employee micro managing .

title: Customers
review: They help out the community. They value the customer. When it comes to the hours and scheduling. They care their products, and associates as well. Thank you.

title: High Volume of Calls
review: Worked for Walmart call center and all I can tell you is to expect call after call and you must be able to meet their metrics system. A lot of the time when you need help or a supervisor they might take a while to respond since they communicate via zoom

title: Decent paycheck. Moving to management depends on who your friends are.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The new points system has caused a huge turnover making the job much more difficult than it should be if associates worked long enough to get trained. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Pressured to work off days and overtime. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The company sees everyone as immediately replaceable. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Always felt like more was expected of me.

title: Depends on the day and how u handle things
review: There is a lot to be said for this place. For the most part i really enjoyed it there. I met so many really great people. The job itself can be very demanding depending on what department u work in and the time of year or even day of the week. I like a good challenge. So for me i didnt consider the job its self hard but there are people there that make it hard to do your job. Unfortunately there  are people who are in lead rolls that dont care about the people they are over and when u do your job well instead of being happy and supportive of your job well done they see it as competition and sadly will do things to sabotage ones who are doing well and will do anything to try to either make u look bad to the bigger bosses or drive u to a point of wanting to quit. Its not like that with the whole place just certain departments with certain ones that feel no one is good enough and will gladly take credit for someone elses hard work yet blame that someone when they them selfs fall short. There are people there that manage to just kinda float through the day somewhat doing their job but mostly bare minimum and then other workers have to really pick up the slack. I suppose most jobs have issues like that but its sad when its the team leads lacking and slacking and the ones under them are constantly doing so much more than the position its self requires,or is actually allowed. Some team leads push their duties off on the lower employees,yet refuse to acknowledge the job well done.

title: Productive place, Meeting New People, Poor Management
review: I've only worked there for 6 months, management and leads are not professional nor are they sympathetic to those who are a liability to Walmart and also lazy/inexperienced workers who don't want to learn anything in their department also more staff would be nice! And maybe change the music from time to time... Hear the same music every single day. But at least they show some appreciations to the employees and sometimes make food for them. Would be nice to do like spirit week for a whole week every once in a while.

title: Dropped case of water on foot and fractured it.companies workman’s comp denied my claim. So I was stuck with the hospital invoices
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Night work pay increase nice people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They fire people fairly quick.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mid rate not to fast not to slow . Pulling heavy crates around at night sometimes requires a lot of strength

title: Big gain, not so much of a loss
review: It was ok, whole department gossiped a lot which made it the last place to confide with a coworker/friend. New hour hires every couple of months. Supervisors helped their favorites keep a job no matter how many rules it broke.

title: Toxic work environment
review: Walmart's culture is awful.  The management talks down rudely to associates.   They lead by instilling fear.  These people are not leaders.   Just bosses.  They constatntly treat associates like they're garbage.  Sure, there's an occasional exception.   But mostly it's just a miserable to be there.

title: Not a bad job.
review: I enjoyed my time spent working for Walmart however I felt like I needed to move on. I met all kinds of people and built up my communication skills however working for a while can stress out the body. I wouldn't mind working for them again.

title: Great place to work needs new leaders
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Company is good ,it's the buddy system going on that is horrible. I was number 1 % on picking atleast 2 or 3 days out of the week and there couch was just looking for a reason to get rid of me.Bad leadership, no leaders just ppl that think there a boss.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers, team leads,couches horrible ppl.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The way walmart has it set up its supposed to be about the employees, but like I said bad leadership What is a typical day like for you at the company?So so,can be good can be bad,but always busy every day

title: It's quite a fun place to work if your leadership is good
review: The work itself isn't too bad as a E-commerce personal shopper. There can be a few loose cannons (supervisors) who think that tolerance equals strength and wisdom.

title: Terrible management
review: management was not very good but coworkers made it worth while. There was times when you wouldn’t find a manager for hours or when you tried to speak up for yourself, your words go unnoticed.

title: Employees are overworked, exhausted, and unhappy; it’s clear that no one wants to be there.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I honestly hated working for this company. They make it clear that they don’t care about their employees or their well-being. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management. HR is unrealible and will be sure to inform whoever you’re complaining about what you said and who you are. They refuse to listen to their employees and are disrespectful and uncaring. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unhealthy. Toxic. Managers gossip about employees to other managers and act exceptionally unprofessional as a whole. If you try to report any issues with managment to HR, HR will turn and report back to said manager and tell them who you are and everything you said. Then that manager retaliates against  you.

title: Management needs to be nicer and motrvhelpfulokpp
review: Not a great place to work.  Management doesn’t communicate but expects to hold you responsible for new rules and or procedures.  I got a whopping .30 raise and if they didnt fel like changing it they wouldn’t .  They took away our bonuses but still left the recording in the call out recording and when they took away bonuses they didn’t tell us.  After the huge Christmas profits they made they cut our hours.  What did they need the money that badly?  People needed their hours to live.  Lastly favoritism needs to stopped!

title: Cashier
review: I am a cashier at Walmart. Mostly work self check out. Pretty easy job. Benefits are nice, decent pay as well. The Biggest con is poor management and the occasional horrible customers. 401k match is nice and discount as well.

title: I don’t feel valued as an employee. I feel as if management doesn’t care for our wellbeing.
review: To be honest, the best part about working here is the pay. I’d say the worst part is the point system. While I understand the points, if you get to 5, you’re fired. If you have to leave during the workday (even if it’s a very serious matter) you will get a point or half a point and if you’re at 5, they’ll fire you and it doesn’t matter the reason you had to leave. This is just my experience with the management at my store so I’m not saying this is everywhere.

title: It’s alright
review: It’s a good place to work at but overnight shift always got the short end of the stick by dealing with problems everyone’s being blamed towards us from the store manager.

title: Terrible
review: Worst place I’ve ever worked. The managers for the department suck. They take no responsibility for anything going on. The coworkers are horrible. Half of them are sitting on their phones or constantly on break. If you go to your manager to complain, they do absolutely nothing even if you go to the higher ups. It’s like talking to a bunch of walls. The respect for employees is non existent. Such a frustrating and exhausting environment. I will never, ever recommend working at the Beaver Dam, WI Walmart, especially not in OGP.

title: Good coworkers and direct management bad corporate
review: The pay these days is pretty adequate for the work on paper that you're required to do but if they see you exceeding past your coworkers that's the pace they will hold you to even if your coworkers might even be doing half of what you do if you drop below your usual they will single you out and ignore your complaints.

title: work schedule
review: you should count on working every major holiday and weekend, not great for family life, customers can be very difficult to deal with and to satisfy, possibly good for part time workers

title: Great Company
review: People in general may think that only the barrel scrap works for Walmart… just another generalized misconception as a fact Walmart is a GREAT company to work for. If you are responsable about be on time and follow your work schedule which you know 3 weeks before but in general hours are fixed. Great benefits, great people working here. The culture is very positive and management is very open and accessible.  Inclusion is not a word for them is a verb well used.  I really enjoy my role as a Personal Shopper shopping for people who order online for pick up or to be delivered directed by us or carriers as an Uber. Makes me happy pick and choose the best products for our customers and think on them preparing and having their family involved or just enjoying the food they order and I pick. Sure we want to be better payed I think we all do but this is a totally stress free job and fixed 40 hours, when you leave for the day doesn’t need to worry about a call or email to answer. Is a great job!  Will love to stay there for years and explore the Team Lead position. Store 2475

title: Some nice people horrible management
review: I worked in maintenance. I recommend anyone looking to apply here not to go for it. Their policy is you have a lead to answer and get directions from however associates and other managers will want you to do things without going through proper channels. As maintenance there were several days we’re you was the only maintenance personnel for the day. You would be required to do the work of two even three people. Some of the associates and managers were nice but overall the managers are the worst to deal with. I will never go back to this place as they can be very disrespectful and discriminatory

title: Fun workplace but terrible policies, & favoritism
review: clock in, then Head to your department to be told where to work, you get a break, work, then lunch, then work, then break, then work, & leave. You have to have a thick skin or have no emotions as you will be cursed out by customers. Management brushes aside problems that you report saying “I will look into that.” You make friends with associates & some customers. You can’t advance in the company if management dislikes you. Protected Paided Time Off is hard to get. The attendance policy is stupid you get fired after 5 points.
position: Front End Check Out Team Associate

title: It’s a job and you are going to work hard.
review: It was a job. I worked here for about 3 months after an unexpected job loss. I worked set up crew on 3rd shift to allow time during the day for interviews. It was physically challenging, but had days that involved lighter duties.

title: Being a hard worker only gets you more work.
review: Job was easy, stocking merchandise on shelves, zoning and cleaning up work area (carts, boxes, plastic,etc.) Management loved my work ethic so much they thought I needed more work. So I went from just stocking to stocking, verifying others backstock, binning backstock, picking the bins, working topstock, etc. all for the same payrate as when I only had one department or isle to stock. It grew old real fast!

title: It was OK
review: Did pointless, mindless tasks.  Pay was low but I could buy gas and groceries.  Some people take their walmart job very seriously and needlessly made the workplace stressful for themselves.  Also, walmart threw away an exuberant amount of goods daily.  Things that could be donated. Extremely wasteful corporation, but aren't they all.

title: Great Workplace
review: Continually gave me more responsibilities when I asked for more to do and allowed me to be useful in many positions. Great front-end team that was easy to work with.

title: Avoid
review: My manager was relocated my first week and they constantly bounced me around from different department managers that could not answer my questions. Not to mention they wait till last minute to give you you’re breaks even for minors. If you complain they’ll treat you biased and rude. Most enjoyable part is the actual nice customers. Which is very rare.

title: Amazing benefits and opportunities to grow and succeed
review: Walmart is an amazing company to work for. If you are full-time you get two hours of combined paid time off and sickleave a week. They have a nine minute grace period. Before you were late and if you have any emergencies were you will need more than three days off you were covered. If you were in the right store it’s like a little family and everyone just wants everybody else to have the best, it’s like a little family. None of the work is exhausting or hard most of it. It’s just either repetitive or boring but it’s easy work and as long as you are nice, everyone else will be nice to you. It’s a great work environment and I can’t wait to go back. The only problem is if managements numbers are right that start breathing down your neck, even if you’ve been doing the exact same job for three years, the same exact way.

title: Fun
review: Walmart at moon was a decent place to work. Pay was fine. Had to operate in small when delivering the groceries out to waiting cars outside. The fridge and freezer are close.

title: Good work
review: It was nice working there met a lot of nice people really friendly environment the only thing that really sucked while working there was the management and coaches

title: You don't want to work here!
review: Walmart is a horrible atmosphere company to work for....they will tell you that you can advance and then never give you the tools to do so!!  A serious lack of serious management!

title: Toxic
review: Horrible, unqualified management. No integrity among them.  Turnover is extremely high, even for retail.  Disrespectful team leads, coaches and store manager.
location: 510 Kitty Hawk Rd Universal City TX

title: Horrible
review: Walmart is a disorganized disgusting 🤢 place to work. With some of the most gossipy messy individuals. Not to mention the management. The company is a great place actually the people they choose to employ is the whole problem. They worry about what people do and how they do it instead of focusing on getting their work done and helping the consumers

title: Do not work here
review: Walmart is a terrible place to work they will work you to the bone. They’ll go make you do a more difficult job than the one you applied for and not give you a raise. It’s agains the rules to sit while you’re on shift or discuss your wage.

title: Every store is different but I did not have a good experience
review: The higher up management is always the worst. They curse at you, degrade you, belittle you instead of teach and help you. I won’t say it’s every store but it definitely happened at mine.

title: It is bad for your mental health to work at Walmart
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Worse company to work for associates get treated with no respect and management aren’t experienced enough to deal with associates and customers respectfully Stores are always under staffed this goes for every state What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I’m experienced managers and not enough staff on the weekends What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful and maddening Some managers slow pressure to dictate how they manage and it destroys the team spirit What is a typical day like for you at the company?Chaotic and tiring Not enough help

title: Bonuses
review: They do not give the regular employees any bonuses anymore. It goes to team leads and coaches now. But over all the place is a. Very nice environment to working.

title: Walmart is a good and bad company to work for!
review: Walmart will  cross train  you in all areas of the store for the same pay. Walmart is great for first jobs and college kids. Walmart retirement plan is  terrible. this company keeps you employed for 15 to 20 years and any time before you retire if you are fired then you can't use your benefits saved for retirement.

title: Hang tuff, buttercup!
review: Hard work physically & mentally, but somewhat fun once you know what you’re doing. Very poor communication from managers & especially team leads & their associates. This leads to much confusion, chaos, & an especially stressful first 90 days for new employees. Most don’t make it past the 90 day mark before quitting. It’s hard to keep coming in day after day in such an oppressive environment. Supervisors are mostly to blame, as most speak to you like you’re a dog. Makes it hard to stay positive & breaks even the most positive person down after awhile. BUT, pay is decent for a small town & there are a few really great people who work here. My advice is, find those people if you want to survive. Also, take notes & document any issues you’re having bc throwing people under the bus is common practice here.

title: Easy job
review: Very easy and a lot of walking. They gave me as many hours as I wanted and you can even ask for whatever days off provided you do it with PPTO, which is like guaranteed off days.

title: Do a lot of problem solving and training
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great way to stay in shape and more ways to develop my teamWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?With customers who are hostile and staff who don’t show up What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Depends on the location you are at What is a typical day like for you at the company?Varies from day to day. I’m usually all over the place

title: Not very good place to work
review: Management was very rude and inconsiderate. They don’t even say hello any time they see you. Most of the immigrant coworkers were kind and easy to work with.

title: Cool
review: he department was always understaffed so there was never enough employees working that department and sometimes none at all.No holidays ir holiday pay available.

title: Friends you make at work
review: Depends on the Walmart location you are at it may be good but the location I’m at sucks the management don’t care about us and they don’t have any communication all they do is sit in a office all day and eat

title: Steady work
review: Steady work, great hours but management is iffy at best. Tow the company line, keep your head down and your mouth shut. Leave the stress when you punch out and its a fine job.

title: Great
review: Super easy love the staff very laid back individuals. Easy duties such as stocking trash and cleaning dropping tills super simple place to work for love it

title: Well compensated but comes at a cost.
review: High stress job, paid well, expect to work long hours, extra days, etc.  expect to work every holiday. Training programs are mediocre. Upper management point out problems but rarely have solutions except work more.

title: Okay
review: I wouldn’t recommend for long term, but it is okay to do until something better arrives. I worked here for 3 years and management barely cares, and employees are extremely lazy.

title: Fun environment
review: It's overnight and there is a lot to do to remodel a store.  You definitely keep busy and they are looking for people to promote so it's good place to grow with company.

title: It’s was alr tbh
review: Pretty chill place over all, they expected alot but you could get away with a lot as well. Management sucked, but got to do ur own thing as long as the work was done. Morning shifts better idk less management but closing way easier. Ohh and if you have mid-shift goodluck 🤞

title: Decent place to work
review: Great coworkers but can be understaffed at times which puts more of the workload on others                                                           .

title: Productive and can be fun at times.
review: It’s worth it if you want to put in the work and stay out of the childish games of others. Sometimes management isn’t the best, but accomplishing your goals is what makes you sleep better at night.

title: It’s okay
review: It’s okay they don’t pay poorly greasy for a first job the only thing that bothers me is that they don’t care abt their staff as much as you’d think they do and they’re breaks are not that great.

title: productive and fun workplace
review: Everyone is super kind. A lot of room to grow and have a good time. Everyone one is kind and understanding. They make sure you are heard and listen to any concerns. Great management.

title: Hard Work
review: Work was tiring. A lot of heavy lifting/stocking in heavy departments . Hard for a woman while management constantly pushed. I would have enjoyed the work of it wasn't so heavy. I enjoyed the discounts though.

title: Good learning experience
review: As is the case with most retail the location has a lot to do with your experience.  Some locations are managed better than others, and if there is a constant change in management, that tends to weigh very heavily on the team.  Walmart has improved the employee experience greatly and the pay rate.  Great place to start!

title: Bunch of lazy teenager
review: It was okay. But bunch of lazy teenagers. Management didn't care. Unfair for others who work seriously. Some teenagers would hide in the restroom or breakroom.

title: Highschool chidren as managers and teamleads.
review: I truly enjoy how incompetent and spineless these managers and team leads really are putting the blame and more work to good hardworkers. You will not grow here.

title: Great otr driving job
review: Great company good pay good management good job need to try it. It will be the best driving career you ever had. Holiday food and gifts are really nice.

title: This company needs to show more care on the employees and needs to open more check out line for customers and needs to be more nicer
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There is not to much to say about Walmart because it a lot of dislike with this company What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with that company where they doesn't care about people family when they are sick or went to hospital What is the work environment and culture like at the company?None NoneNone,no,no,no,no,no they are nothing I can say to much I like about Walmart But they not niceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday

title: Take pride in things I do but when thats be sacrificed or sabotaged, what’s the point?
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Getting a hour lunch. Benefits aren’t to bad but takes for ever to build up! Same thing for wages.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of professionalism! Treated as a pea on, even with prior experience. That’s the attitude, as if your always replaceable. Their are no bonuses anymore, got taken away from associates to be split up between couches,team leads and managers! Literally no instinctive at all! Way under paid to do your bosses job and they take the credit. When ask about all this they turn you into a outsider.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Babysitting with no culture everyone for them selves!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Customers was my top priority

title: Small store and lack of communication
review: It’s a job. Way too many task and not enough associates in a department to complete task. Difficult to assist customers me there’s only one lead/ manager in the building.good benefits.

title: Worst job ever
review: Do not recommend snakes in the grass will use you up and send you out the door and not care don’t work here if you have other options it’s just not good.

title: Just a Number
review: I became employed in the payments department because my previous job got bought out by Walmart. I was given no choice as to what position I would work and barely any information. I’m convinced they wanted us to quit, putting us in one of the most difficult departments where customers are always trying to scam you or screaming at you. Super unhelpful management, awful training, and basically no work culture or team bonding.

title: excellent employees
review: good work environment the management was excellent with the works and breaks given us extra time and go home early the food area was clean and stocl for us

title: Terrible and nothing useful on a resume
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Getting paid weekly and gas reimbursement was the best part What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The asinine rules Walmart makes you follow. The managers didn't know to properly train anyone and they were lacking job knowledge too. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unsafe most of the work you do is done with safety on the back burner. The work environment is stressful and leaves you feeling unsatisfied

title: Fast clean, and good service
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Being able to interact with people every day and having the ability to make other people smile.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When other workers doesn’t feel the same as you do and when you don’t see the same energy and the other workers.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The word environment is like a beautiful sunshiny day.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Quiet, moderate, but moving with people going in and out with a smile on their face

title: Decent Workplace
review: The job was simple and repetitive. Zoning and running go backs in whichever department I was put in. It was one person per department most of the time on top floor excluding electronics. Customers were the only thing that broke any monotony. Worked for about a year and didn't have much problems. Management was good and I didn't need help most of the time. Laidback workplace with everyone focused on their own department.

title: Fun workplace
review: A typical day is stocking a aisle al all day the and zoning it at the end of the shift. The work there is pretty straight forward and the same everyday.

title: Typical Experience
review: Plenty of opportunity to go to other positions and departments if you work hard enough.Just like any other customer service job, times can be trying with customers and management.

title: great people to work with
review: I enjoyed the company of others. Everyone pulled their own weight. You are given a rewarding amount of time for your lunch. They train with online learning tutorials which can be a pro but I prefer a more hands-on method.

title: Loved it
review: I really did love my job st Walmart the pay sucked work was easy I didn’t do anything all day just looked busy it was great if I would’ve got overnights 18$ a hour to just stock shelf’s it didn’t get better then that and you don’t have to work really at all all the ot you want you can work 100 hour weeks and the ppto is great used it daily he just lets you do whatever if you request it and it’s all paid great place

title: No work life balance
review: Crazy hours, crazy expectations. Pretty much no work life balance. Always called in on days off. Required to work a crazy amount of hours. A lot of room for growth though.

title: Pretty Chill
review: Good place to work if youre good with people, can handle indecisive managers, and are okay with honest work. You will sweat being a stocker, but the pay is fair and the co-workers can definitely make it worth it.

title: Messy
review: It was a cool job. It had its up and down moments. I was fresh out of high school so it was enjoyable for my 1st real job. Terrible management at one point

title: Easy Work, Bad Upper Management
review: The work is easy, pays pretty decently, but upper management dosent care how good a worker you are, and only care about the people they like, while also treating you like a kid.

title: hate it
review: i like it here they are very nice at the door, we no longer have to check out patients they do our job for us now which is great. i love walmart its fantastic

title: Friendly work place
review: Coworkers are friendly and work environment is pretty good. Not a good pay. Manager is polite but coaches are not. Only one hr . And you can hardly find her

title: meh
review: Working at Walmart can be a mixed bag, depending on what you're looking for in a job. On one hand, Walmart is a massive employer with a wide range of things to work as.

title: Good site for Pharmacy Technicians
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They pay well for my position and they help you go to school. The neighborhood pharmacies are a good place to work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When it gets really busy and they cut hours. We still have the same workload so I hate that companies do that. They are trying to cut cost at the wrong level. They should keep our hours the same and cut cost somewhere else.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I like the people I work with in the weekend. Most of the Pharmacists I work with help out a lot. I like that.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I woke the weekend in Pharmacy. It’s repetitive and semi busy.

title: 25 years wasted
review: Rules changing constantly. Upper leadership clueless. Zero work life balance. Company no longer cares about customers just their profits. Constantly told, “you’re paid to figure it out” when there are no solutions available. Expected to run areas with zero control of scheduling, wages, or resources.

title: Fun place to work. Not paid enough however.
review: As long as you are a good worker, management pretty well leaves you alone. Working here taught me how to work efficiently. Management at the Camdenton store was pretty great. The whole time that I worked there, I can only think of one manager that I didn't like. The store manager is great to work for!
position: Cap 2 Associate and Online Grocery Pickup

title: Stressful and hectic workplace
review: There is never enough staff at Walmart do complete the tasks at hand. Once you have shown that you can preform the work of two people, that is now your job. The work of two people. I recommend if you are going to work for the Walton’s don’t work hard, it will just make it worse. They promote whosever up the managers butt. So if you are good at brownnoseing this maybe the place for you. The only thing I liked about Walmart was the steady hours and the people I worked with.

title: Reliable Pay and Benifits.
review: Do the job EXACTLY how you were told and you will have reliable pay and excellent benefits. Some of the corporate rules and priorities are downright bizarre. Just nod in agreement and follow the rules (even when this accomplishes nothing productive) and you will be a star employee in no time!Oh, and sing the Walmart Cheer like you LOVE it. They might think you need more training otherwise. Every. Single. Day.

title: Fun and nice
