review: Very nice management, and team is just like family, I love working there, not everyone will have the same experience but it is definitely worth giving it a try.

title: Traumatized to the core
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It was close to home everything else was extremely toxicWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?It’s an overall hostile working environment . On the warehouse floor literally is like fight club. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic, hostile, favoritism,ses harassment. Everything you would avoid you would find here What is a typical day like for you at the company?Depended on the dept I worked in

title: You will lose your free time but you will earn a pretty decent paycheck. That’s if you don’t have bills to pay!
review: Management tends to have favorites so if you don’t end up being one of them you will have to put in the work. The work isn’t outrageous or hard, the drama is very annoying though. The coaches will not train you, your coworkers will, even if they don’t fully know what they’re doing themselves.

title: Okay
review: This job was okay, could get boring at times. Didn’t really do much. Just worked with garden stuff and holiday stuff. Rate 3/5 but it was a good job!!

title: I like working as a cashier there.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Appreciation and support from the supervisors, team work and working with the public. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Asking customers for surveys but that is pretty much expected in most places now a days. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?A very busy and diverse retail and grocery business. What is a typical day like for you at the company?It’s a very busy and fast moving days. There’s always something to do that makes the shift go by fast.

title: Its a bad environment
review: Its okay place, stresfull management. Always on your but expect to be very stressed and annoyed. Dont take the work home with you. Management suck and do nothing

title: It’s a job not to stay at
review: For my experience here this is not a place I want to stay it’s more of a high school kid type job and you don’t get paid enough to deal ail  with anything here with the customer yelling at and getting mad when you can help them because you are not form that department ex not really a fun place can’t make a good career out walmart

title: culture shift
review: In the beginning it seemed like a very blue collar store. It became completely different when leadership changed. I believe it helped initially but overall the lack of standards changed.

title: Un ambiente super bueno
review: Me gusta mucho la firma en que ellos te brindan ayuda y te dan las herramientas para desempeñar un buen trabajo.

title: Promote if you want, or stay if you want
review: The positions are very simple to understand, and can quickly be mastered. If you aspire to make more money, and promote, it’s relatively easy, and the team lead pay raise is decent. If you want to just work, this is a place that can work. Just go in and do your thing. It’s really what you want to make of it

title: Opportunity for advancement, ability to pick up hours and train for different positions
review: If I could come and work this company again I would. Your experience depends on your work ethic. I become full time easily and in the three years I worked there I was trained for multiple positions so I become an asset. When I left I made 7$ moee than when I began.

title: Not the same
review: Was a long time associate. Management especially at this location is extremely disrespectful to their associates. It definitely has a “good boys club” vibe- very sketchy store manager on a power trip and many accusations about him being too friendly with some of the girls that work there. Not the same Walmart it used to be.  Not family friendly.

title: Fun place to wor
review: Learned a lot working in lawn and garden.  Loved being around the plants.  Great management team as well that supported individual personal needs.  Will reapply,

title: Awful toxic work environment..
review: Aside from the relatively decent benefits, the company as a whole is a bad environment with rude customers, coworkers, supervisors, and of course management. The pay while better than some fast food restaurants isn’t good enough for the workload and what is expected of associates to accomplish daily. Management only cares about pleasing corporate and corporate only cares about money, Walmart puts on a face of “family/friends” but to them you’re nothing more than your ID number and they will treat you like it.. you are constantly reminded of how replaceable you are and how easy the work is by people that don’t lift a finger, let alone a box. -10/10 awful place to work.. consider this your warning.

title: Decent job
review: Good place to work when fully staffed. Otherwise it can be a headache working an area by yourself for months on end. A Good night almost entirely depends on your how your management approaches who goes where for how long.

title: Fun
review: I enjoyed it in the beginning but it went downhill after a while. It had great management but As they left walmart put inexperienced managers in. Which leads to a lot of problems

title: Very boring and bad management
review: The manager would have you work shifts alone without any formal training. The time went by very slow because there is so much you can do to meat shelf.

title: The only place I've ever felt like they hated me for working
review: Working lot for Walmart was physically draining, and you're looked down on for doing your job. Management would schedule too few people around holidays and then get mad that you couldn't cover the whole lot by yourself.

title: Culture Shift
review: In the beginning it seemed like a very blue collar store. It became completely different when leadership changed. I believe it helped initially but overall the lack of standards changed.

title: Messy/long hours
review: They put you where they want to even if told you can’t work those hours, the people in there doesn’t act like adults, lots of favoritism in there. Also management SUCKS

title: My experience as far as the actual job is pleasant . I enjoy my customers. But management in the store is unprofessional.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Interacting with the customersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Managers are unapproachable and have no sympathy or empathy or respect for their associates What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mixed culture. The environment is stressful

title: Not a bad place but decent people
review: Over all a nice job, stick to yourself and or trusted few. management could be better and understanding and and little less self-centered. Other departments including your's love to know about you just to talk about you too whomever

title: It was a very poor experience overall, and sometimes embarrassing. I hope to never fall back on it as a reemployment option
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I think the best part about working for Walmart was certain individual coworkers and the benefits.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The lack of care for the employees and a certain level of dishonest practices within the company and from some of the managers.I think the biggest part of Walmart that's caused stressfulness is the lack of communication. there was basically little to none.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?I worked at two stores, so I saw different types of culture. At the first store, there is a total absence of teamwork and camaraderie. I sensed a "every man for himself" approach throughout the whole company. At the second store the atmosphere was slightly better but it's still was somewhat similar to my experience  as the first one.Employees felt very tossed aside, overworked and severely underpaid. Overall, the work culture was not a good experience.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Same thing day in and day out. Come in, do my job, clock out and repeat. I had to become Street Smart when it came to approaching certain managers for certain things. I grew to be able to know who to trust for advice or concerns and who to stay away from.It got to the point where it felt demeaning to work for walmart. I felt like I outgrew the company and needed to move on to something better. I felt embarrassed working for walmart.
location: I was in four different departments in a span of 4 years.

title: A Decent Place to Work. Wouldn’t stay though
review: I worked as a 2nd shift stocker part time 2-11 shifts. Walmart is not rainbows and sunshine. It can be stressful like any other job. They are fair with hours and pay for the job. It’s a decent place to work part time but for full time I would look elsewhere.

title: Decent place to work but very boring
review: I’ve worked at walmart for around 4 months and it has proved to be incredibly boring and has pretty much gotten worse over time, it can be laid back and mediocrely fun at times but most of the time it’s incredibly boring and you get in trouble for things you weren’t even told about

title: The people you work with are amazing people. Many will go out of their way to help if you need it
review: There isn't really anything hard about the job I had (stock). Many of the issues came from management. Managers should strive to be leaders, but most showed little concern for those struggling, and falling behind in their assignment. The other associates I worked with were friendly and helpful.

title: Easy
review: Super easy not much is expected out of you. Just go to work and do your job it’s pretty easy. Nice length breaks and many people willing to help you.

title: Early morning easy day
review: Very easy and chill but you go in at 4am every day it gets old pretty fast and your days off are set you can’t change them but you can ask for days off

title: Great benefits decent pay
review: They pay for you to go to school. It is one of the main reasons I chose to work for this company. They also have decent benefits and give people PTO and Protected PTO. Great maternity benefits and the company constantly tries to build and create a better future.

title: Fulfilling but they cut hours & pay
review: I absolutely loved working in the pharmacy. I was over half way there to be certified as a tech, (they told me they would cut my pay if I didn’t finish by a certain date & then after the halfway mark, never gave me time to actually do the computer work so they would inevitably be cutting my pay) I also told them my childcare hours and availability which was fine for the first month and then they switched up and told me if I couldn’t work 2 hours later & on weekends then they would cut me to part time as well, so I quit. I don’t recommend working here, unless you’re single with no children, as the more experienced techs lives/families will matter more than yours, hands down.

title: Not a good place
review: Don’t do it management doesn’t care you are overworked and underpaid placed in departments you have never been trained in and expected to work like you do

title: Walmart culture
review: Walmart is the economic arm of China and should be removed from the United States of AmericaWorking at Walmart is soul crushing They do not treat their elderly employees well at all

title: The pharmacy has been a good place to work and is more fulfilling than working the rest of the store.
review: Walmart has been a steady, reliable job for me for many years. Unfortunately, there is only so far to advance. Getting into the pharmacy has been great. They were willing to teach and train as well as put you through a program to become a certified technician, but once certified, there really aren't any other positions to advance.

title: Slightrr and kind of a racist undertone
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Learning the skill, and being able What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The disrespect I got from my coworkers, management stripping me of my certificationWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Separated, and very obvious ran by ywoncultres at this location What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful and just wanting to get to my off day

title: Pretty easy, but be prepared to lift heavy
review: It's not a hard job, there's just a lot you have to remember and do– even if it wasn't in the job description. Pretty much, ripping & running throughout the store – stocking, pulling freight, helping customers, changing prices, not hard . You'll just work hard. Then some days, you won't.

title: Factory
review: Not enough paid hours. When they're aren't enough hours, employees have no access to medical and a few other benefits. There are some great ppl to work with and you make life long friendships.

title: Fun filling productive motivation and effort
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I like working and helping out customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nothing work is work if you don’t feel like working go home What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Cool the American dream home of the brave What is a typical day like for you at the company?Awesome work hard or go home respectfully

title: Fine
review: Training was efficient, atmosphere was fine. Fast paced and they did a good job being helpful if you needed assistance. Friendly. Clock in, do my job, clock out, no complaints.

title: Boring and Repetitive
review: Managers always forget about your break, get mad when you leave even though it is your break. If you love dealing with people, this is your job but if not people can be very rude.

title: Fun workplace
review: Simple job, long hours okay pay. It’s Walmart what do you expect. It’s teenagers working and people that need to pay their bills. Not much to it. Great job for someone in school

title: Never enough
review: Be ready to be blamed for every ill in the store. Trucks can never, ever be unloaded fast enough to please upper management. Expect cutthroat and heartless environment.

title: Wouldn't recommend if you aren't big on reading as training or a quick learner
review: To be frank, to work for a company like Walmart, it would be best if you already have a decent amount of experience with retail. Its a very fast paced environment, and things are constantly moving and changing. I've learned a lot working there, but not without being reprimanded first. Training is rarely physically taught, it's all done digitally, and if you don't understand certain aspects, don't really expect anyone, especially management to give you a clear and concise answer. On good days I would at most get a vague description/opinion from my team lead or coach. And if you're going for a cashier/frontend position, don't expect much warning about pricing changes or help with learning certain aspects of the register unless someone else is nice enough to tell you. Most people who work for Walmart tend to be arrogant and at times, extremely selfish. If you're lucky you might find a handful of people who are decent enough to be helpful and kind to you. Also, if you ever feel like advancing your position, good luck. They require a lot of specific things before you can even be considered to change departments at the associate level, so you can imagine how that goes with higher positions. Other than that, the only good things to mention are the benefits. They offer 401k, access to stocks and medical/dental insurance.

title: Decent pay
review: Okay job to start your career If you don’t have any experience but not for long work is some time stressful but not too much to handle in my experience

title: Fun workplace with friendly coworkers
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Everyone there is so friendly and willing to helpWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful part I would say is the customer sometime like the rude onesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment is great and it's very diverseWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It's very easy going and smooth

title: Great hometown store
review: I got a job here my junior yr in school because it was better hours with my schedule. This is one of the smallest Walmarts in the world and very unique.

title: Walmart
review: Well I don't like this company. But the actual job itself as a cashier and my regular customers I thoroughly enjoyed. If Walmart had paid me what I deserved would have made a huge difference. Plus management does not care about you you are not a person to them

title: not very stressful job but everyday is the same
review: Overall the people working at Walmart are good people but the job gets repetitive. Everyday it’s the same routine of unloading the truck filled with merchandise and putting them into pallets. After the truck is finished it’s usually lunch time and after lunch we start to stock the food. After everything is done we start to “zone” where we make the store look nice by pushing items forward on the shelves.

title: Stressful and understaffed
review: It is not the worst place to work, but definitely not the best. It is stressful due to the unrealistic expectations they give you. Market Managers and above are very  snobby and bully everyone. Good thing is the discount and the work friends you make.

title: Enjoy the coworkers
review: Coworkers all got along with me for the most part, management was hit or miss, but more often than not they were good to me. Transferring to a different Walmart is a difficult process so I left them for bigger and better things.

title: Ambiente cómodo y compañerismo
review: Pues es muy bueno 😍 ya q el horario es flexible 👍🏽y los compañeros son colaboradores ❤️gracias a Dios 🙏 nunca tuve inconveniente ❤️siempre m senti cómoda👍🏽y mi departamento muy fácil y encantada ❤️ si volviera a trabajar ahí estaría fascinada ❤️ . Si el salario muy bueno 👍🏽.y ayudar a los clientes ❤️ m llenaba de gran satisfacción, se los recomiendo ❤️

title: Unorganized and bad management
review: I worked at Walmart for about 3.5 years . The management wasn’t the best, and everything was very unorganized. Wouldn’t recommend this location at all.

title: Production ,fun,yet stressful
review: The position is easy. However, upper management pushes team leads to micro management the team associates causing extreme stress resulting from unrealistic expectations

title: Easy Job, Terrible Management
review: Don’t work here in the OGP department unless you enjoy drama. Easy job, but not worth the hassle that comes along with it. It’s simple shopping for customers who order online. Management sucks.

title: Worthless
review: Walmart is a horrible place to work for. Treat employees like numbers and require to much work for one person. Great benefits if you stay long enough.

title: Fair
review: What I like about this place is that they are willing to work with you on scheduling. It’s flexible! Also, easy to pickup shifts if you find yourself with extra time on your hands. However, I don’t like the stressful work environment and it can be hostile at times.

title: Stressful Work Environment, High Expectations, Intense
review: I previously worked at Walmart.com in San Bruno, CA. It was an intense work environment. People were generally nice and friendly, but it was very competitive. The leadership team worked us like crazy. People worked all day and night. Expectations were extremely high (seemed unreasonable). People were laid off, fired, etc. for what seemed like no reason. It was not a work environment that was healthy. It really damaged my mental health and permanently altered my overall outlook in terms of where I want to go in my career and the type of company that I want to work for (ie. trying to avoid a company like this one).

title: Like High School, but your livelihood is on the line.
review: From my 6 years of experience working at Wal-Mart, the only takeaway is that Wal-Mart is the largest worst place you can work at. Everyone gossips. If you're a bad worker but befriend management, you'll definitely get promoted into a position you have no ability at working. A SA perpetrator got promoted to salary positions while upper management knew there was pending litigation. Another manager actively stalked an associate during work that she had to step down from her position for a lower position. I was asked to clock back in from lunch 10 minutes into my break on a weekly basis. When I decided to pursue my education, I was given two different answers from the same manager about whether they would accommodate my schedule for my school schedule. I was literally scheduled for the first 2 years on days I had put "Unavailable" in the system. I left because they were unable to follow through with an agreed upon work schedule.

title: Good environment
review: Nice place to start and gain experience for better opportunities. One can also grow here if you know what you are doing and if you put your mind to achieve it

title: The more you give the more they want and they do not appreciate you.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Co workers, and learning something new. Walmart is always changing thing up.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough help. And the pressure from Management to perform miracles.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is stressful. The culture is diverse.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Hit the floor running and you don't stop until the end of your shift. Stressful and at times unreachable tasks are given. You train people only to have them taken away to assist in other departments, While your left floundering to accomplish the impossible alone.

title: Ok to work
review: As a first job it was ok.  Room to grow if you are willing to put in the work.  Most training is computer based which is surprisingly good, a lot better than most co.puter based trainings

title: It’s walmart
review: Customers could be ruthless and but it’s decent money for someone just trying to get by or in high school(they work good with extracurricular schedules). It’s easy to make work friends since there are so many employees and management does make an effort to know each one, maybe a little too much. I’m sure a lot has changed, but overall it’s a decent place to work for however long you can handle it, just not somewhere I’d want to be long term.

title: Solid Job
review: A good place to start.  Clean environment.  Large company no nonsense.  Was a great place to work as a teenager.  Felt safe, plenty of management to turn to if there ever were issues.  Lucky for me it was a great experience!

title: Ambiente muy bueno
review: Lo más que me gusta es que es un ambiente de familia

title: never quite know what you’re gonna get but it’s probably gonna be unpleasant
review: What is the best part of working at the company?i enjoy keeping busy at work and there was rarely a shortage of things for me to do. the fast pace of my departments was also a plus for me. i also made great friends with coworkers. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?poor communication between management and associates, policies constantly changing, unrealistic expectations, blatant favoritism by managementWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?it genuinely depends on the location and the management running the store. i’ve had some great experiences and some absolutely awful ones depending on who is running things. What is a typical day like for you at the company?hardly such thing as a typical day, but the main points were checking in with my supervisor about what the priorities were for the day, assisting customers and ensuring a clean and safe environment
position: Department Manager, Team Lead, Cashier, Sales Associate

title: If you need a check…a small one
review: It’ll pay the bills until you find better and that’s all it’s good for. There is no interview anymore. Ugly apply online and you get a call saying that you are hired.

title: Friendly
review: Nice job if you’re trying to make some pretty good money. The supervisors had the worst kind of expectations and demanded impossible tasks at times. But that’s any job.

title: Was good experience
review: I loved the electronic section and the online grocery and pickup section and I worked in both sections, my team members and colleagues in both sections were different but both the team were great. I had a good shift timings. In general I love talking to customers and both sections which I worked in gave me the opportunity to do so, and met different people.
position: Electronic sales associate & E-commerce Personal Shopper

title: This has been the best work experience I’ve had in all my years.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Besides the pay, I’ve been given the opportunity to be crossed trained. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Making rate weekly is probably most stressful What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly work environment and working with wonderful people What is a typical day like for you at the company?Picking orders and working hard

title: Terrible management
review: Not enough employees to complete jobs and all managers use other departments for their work.  Customers are the worst to deal with.  You do not know what to expect from day to day.

title: Okay with the right staff
review: Work wasn't hard, and was enjoyable since I worked with people I enjoyed.  Problems popped up when some staff would slack off, or we were short handed.  Also worked in a smaller store, so not exactly the same as a massive store in a Major metropolitan area

title: Wonderful
review: Great place to work, great managers, very organized, decent pay, great team. They also provide wonderful benefits and work with your scheduling issues.

title: Productive
review: long hours, decent pay, hire anybody really, over all good company to work for and with. flexible schedules, nice people to work with, good job to keep.

title: Very fun place
review: good pay. training is very hands on, staff is amazing. It will seem as if you’re always there but it’s a very good place to work at. Wouldn’t recommend as a first job.

title: Fun workplace
review: Love my coworkers and job. Plenty of hours and always busy at work, great benefits. I love it at walmart and hope to stay for a long time.I've done other retail but Walmart is the best.

title: Great work place
review: Great place to work, with great coworkers, and pay.  The schedule could be hectic but the pay is pretty good for this area.  Friendly supervisors and higher-ups.

title: Mindless repetitive
review: Not much to say about this other than it’s not worth it. Yeah the money is alright but the work like I said is constant mindless repetitive actions all day. Along with the constant struggle to keep up with the requirements they want.

title: It’s ok
review: It’s alright, low pay for what you do if you stick your head out. Managers will put more workload on you while others can sit and talk. Easy job if you only are doing your job

title: Customer service
review: I love working at Walmart it’s an amazing place I highly recommend it the pay is good And they work with you. The environment is amazing and I love my coworkers

title: Helpful, rewarding and most of the time was a highlight of my day
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoyed the work and talking with customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working with grumpy customers, having to ration quantities to peopleWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Getting to know people I worked with coworkers and good over all atmosphere What is a typical day like for you at the company?Pretty easy going and I loved associating with people and helping them by bringing smiles to their faces

title: The pay is good and the benefits but that’s it.
review: Managers look out for themselves the only words from them are put downs. The benefits employees got when Sam Walton was alive are all gone and if the company could get away from giving medical benefits or stock options or 401k I’m sure they would. Some managers who have moved up might be there based on their hard work the others for being jerks or kiss assess.

title: All the over time you want
review: Easy money. Go in do your Job go home. If you want overtime it's yours. If not that's cool too. Only downside is lots of cluless chiefs running around doing a whole lot of nothing.

title: Good
review: Walmart cares about their employees. They have good systems in place where if you need time off you can get it. You can miss work 10 days in a calendar year not including your PTO.

title: Pretty good
review: Good workplace. Management does need improvement with the way they manage their departments. In need some cases, they like to pick and choose who gets promoted.

title: decent
review: its hard to find a lot of hours, but it a decent job to do. there is a lot to do depending on the day. the pay is decent for what it is work for. I wish I can get more hours

title: Management
review: The management is generally just a warm body in a room. My experience with management was incredibly poor. They work the hard working staff right I to the ground implying that they never do enough and allow other people to hardly do anything all shift. There is literally always drama here no matter what shift you are on.
position: Department Manager and Modular Maintenance Team

title: Fun place to work
review: You’ll love it here. Apply!!!!! I love going to work everyday, working and scanning and putting up chicken and pork chops. It made me hungry looking at the door. One day I made a sandwich on the aisle and drunk a soda. It was amazing.

title: Great work environment
review: Excellent experience, my manager and fellow coworkers were great to work with. I was a full-time student, and my manager always worked to accommodate my school schedule.

title: The worst
review: This is the worst company i have ever worked for do not work for walmart they do not value in there associates in any way shape or form. Overworked and under paid

title: It was ok!
review: My coworkers were amazing but not my team leads. The customers also weren’t any help at all. The place was always a mess and it was very dysfunctional

title: Decent place to work overall.
review: The work was alright and fairly predicable. The customers could be rude, and management often broke policy to make them happy, instead of following the policy I had to follow.

title: Awful place to work
review: Awful experiece. one of busiest stores in Colorado only directed to fill shelves all other issues don't matter. The management will only talk to you if there is an issue or a walk that may happen but never does

title: Overworked
review: wouldn’t recommend. Very messy environment. Management will fire you for anything. I got fired and rehired in the same night without even knowing. Not something I’d recommend for anyone. Not a fair company either

title: Decent Job!
review: The floor stocker position is an easy way to make money. Just make sure you're fine with talking to people everyday, almost every few minutes. It's a good job overall though.

title: No
review: The job itself isnt great, you get an hour lunch, two 15 minute breaks, and most people took advatange lf these breaks. Dont be a hard worker at walmart, they will make sure to give you all the work while your other employees sit in the back room and get paid the same as you

title: Learning and motivational and i would do it again it was well worth it
review: What is the best part of working at the company?How they train you to be better and move forward in life. Help with education and learning new thingsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?I loved every minute of my job had no stressful moments in a people's personWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Positive energy, hard workers and great managersWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Making sure every one is completing their task. Making sure all cuts are sent out on time

title: I do not recommend this company to any person that cannot handle pressure to do a job that is meant for more than one person.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get to meet people that you work with that becoming like family.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The manager are the worst in that environment .What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's very toxic and it feels like you are walking on egg shellsWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?I would get there and just do my job and try not to have any interacción with no one.

title: Good pay
review: Good pay & easy workload the stress and management is the problem & hours are terrible. If you’re just looking for a job they start out really good pay depending on your position. You also have to work weekends and holidays.

title: Poor management
review: Only positive is the pay is good and I've met some great friends. The managers are rude and straight disrespectful. Run good people into the ground and treat the lazy associates like royalty. I was a former Lead at a different store and we never treated associates like this store does. It's sad really

title: Inconsistent planning. If you like being worked like a mule, then this is the place for you.  No recognition, ignorance at several levels
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Lunch breaks and my days off. The much needed time away to decompress from all the negative (facts) environment.  95% of customer are rude towards the employees and any complaints or issues made to your management, it's ignored because,  they don't care. The company should give employee's hazard pay for all that mental anguish and stress, since that's something we have to deal with on every shift you work. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of moral. Lazy management (across the board). Discrimination and favoritismWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Negative, lonely, sad and depressing What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy, busy,busy. All day non stop walking, bending, lifting, climbing.  Assisting customers

title: Good summer job
review: Pays well if you want a good summer job. Not a lot of thinking needed. Can be physically demanding if your coworkers aren't helping with the work load.

title: Favoritism over hard work
review: It doesn't matter how good you are at your job, they will always promote outside the company first. They gave a management position to a fresh college graduate who had never worked before rather than any of the associates that applied. Raises don't happen, bonusus don't happen, and if they see you're a great worker then you will get more work to do with no pay increase.

title: Buen trabajo
review: Buen trabajo, y buen sueldo perfecto para cabezas de familia turnos y horarios muy asequibles

title: I have got opportunities to grow in my job and can't wait to see how hard I can go
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Ability to  grow 8 hour shifts Discounts Walmart + membership What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Structure, no ones on same pageWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Family  understanding  and benefits What is a typical day like for you at the company?Fun alot of breaks and different  types  of learning

title: Okay
review: Low pay and they just don't really care about your family and work life balance. Good stock purchase plan. They don't give enough work hours at times.

title: Busy and fun workplace.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The flexibility and the opportunities that they have that will enable you to further your career within the company , and they also offer you  fully paid tuition for classes in any career. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Well, there really isn't that much training you kind of figure it out as you goWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?At my store it's fun and fast pacedWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Fast paced, fun, and lots of work to keep you busy

title: fair pay, bad management
review: the pay was decent. It was alright but since I started the management them changed several times and they mostly had a communication problem. It made the things confusing.

title: They were very overwhelming with the hours no respect for kids being sick.
review: The job was very overwhelming with the hours they had you work. Didn’t have any consideration for women with kids. No steady schedule. Was being over work.

title: Poorly Managed
review: If you like Micromanagement, then look no more, here you will get misguided so the manager can  lay down the law on you because your new. Even if you follow all their directions, they will sabotage your work to make look like your not following directions.

title: Work ethic
review: Great work environment. If you work at the right store. Big demand for help at times could ge long hours. Great teamwork otherwise. Great benefits and during the holidays you get a total store discount …………..

title: Good
review: Very good.Easy work.Easy money.Benefits could be better. Over all I can’t complain because it is helping me get through college and isn’t a difficult job.

title: Toxic workplace
review: Everyone is lazy and doesn't want to work. You're not appreciated for the work you do. The only way to advance in the company is to kiss up to management. No value in experience. Should be your last choice for places to work for.

title: i mean its alright
review: Pros: Tons of work avaliableOvertime if store allows itBraindead easy workCons: More bad Customers than goodPay could be betterSometimes have to work multiple departments even if they make more than youManagement is usually laughable

title: stressful, draining, overwhelming, unaccommodating
review: I definitely do not recommend coming from an associate that worked for Walmart over 5 years. It slowly got worse each week. Save yourself the stress and health problems... RUN.

title: good pay, lousy managers
review: It's Walmart. It's what you'd expect. Good pay, but no training, no help, no resources. You're on your own to figure things out and get things done. And when you make mistakes or have questions, you'll get yelled at.

title: Horrible environment
review: This is the worst job experience I’ve ever had. Management pushed off a lot of tasks to me. I was expected to complete tasks and give directions for evening crewmembers. This caused a lot of tension since I was not a manager. Since leaving, I have suffered from PTSD and cannot go back into the store. I have since moved to a different town entirely.

title: Productive
review: Doing what I love inspires me to be eager to get to work each day.    The smiles on the faces of our customers is my main priority and goal. I look forward to our happy returning customers.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Stay away . Unstable place and alot of favoritism. They will pick and choose who's going to get ahead. They nitt pick and only scold those who really work and keep to themselves. It's like a high school.

title: It’s okay
review: Just busy work with nothing else to it, the attendance policy is asinine as most other mega corporations but that’s to be expected from a big company like this

title: Unless you are exceptionally lucky you will work for someone that is incompetent.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The benefits are good. Insurance, education, 401k.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Ineffectual management, poor leadership all around, not caring to develop employees.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The company could seem cultish at times. They make you do a cheer. The computer based learning isn’t helpful in the least.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in and then pray that you don’t have to deal with rude customers and have the time and tools necessary to complete tour tasks.

title: Unorganized
review: Do not work here if you don't want to be treated poorly, management will not give any direction and will lie to you about proper ways of disposing things. I had a very bad experience with Walmart

title: It’s okay
review: Management sucks, but it’s well paying. Coldwater is the worst Walmart to work at in Fort Wayne I’d stick to a different location if you’re interested in working there.

title: Upper management doesn't care
review: Treated as just another pawn in their games. Difficult to move up to managers positions. Difficult to move to other shifts in the building if you are a lead.

title: Cool depends on the Walmart
review: Easy job doesn't require lots of skill some nights are easier than others and you don't have to deal with customers getting in the way. Pays above minimum wage

title: decent pay
review: long hours, decent pay, hire anybody really, over all good company to work for and with. flexible schedules, nice people to work with, good job to keep.

title: They Have good pay and good benefits but management doesn’t handle situations correctly and doesn’t treat employees with respect
review: They lacked training when I first started the job I had to learn for myself and I liked the job but my manager would find anything to try to say I done anything wrong and she would talk down to me instead of trying to give me positive feedback. They have a good company but they lack taking care of employees, I had an employee threaten to fight me over doing my job and reported it and nothing happened and somehow the other employees knew I told ethics

title: way to easy job
review: its an easy job like super easy most of the time i stood by the door on my phone and took orders out every now and then barley ever got put on a pick walk

title: Caution Avoid at all Cost!!
review: Working at Walmart isn’t the best it’s always dirty and smells. Don’t get me started on the people. WALMART PEOPLE ARE ACTUALLY A THING!! Lastly, the receipt check shouldn’t even be a police there is always a line out the door. Honestly it is a hazard.

title: No room to advance
review: During the interview they make it sound like it's a great place to work but don't plan to advance unless you can convince someone to take your spot but then they will need to find someone to take their spot.

title: Tiring place
review: Management is always down your throat and most people don’t like to work here. Customers are also rude but the people you work with are actually not bad people

title: Good pay
review: I enjoyed working there learning new skills the management is pretty disrespectful it is awesome pay and not hard work if you can stand on your feet all night you got it made

title: Review
review: Not the worst but could be better. play could be a bit more and the points system is bad. I found myself being left behind when I had more work then other.

title: Soul sucking.
review: Typical day at work is chaos. The company expects you to do the work of multiple people and for you to constantly work over or come in early, but will NOT tolerate any over-time. Management breathing down your neck about some SOP, and add more to your job description without additional pay. No work/home life balance. Lots of drama. Any concerns or complaints are swept under the rug, and if you've worked there for years, you can guarantee the newest addition to your team is making the same amount or more than you after putting your time in. If you've been there for a while, your best bet is to quit, wait 90 days, then apply again so that your experience is worth something. After working for the company for over 10 years and giving a months notice for my resignation, I wasn't even given an exit interview. Management is completely incompetent and if your new, you can count on getting thrown into the job. The turnover rate is absolutely unreal as well as their attendance policy, which is frequently abused. Quarterly bonuses are no longer a thing for the average employee, but higher management gets fat bonuses, which is why they are always on your butt about doing more, more, MORE. The reason I stayed for so long is because of the relationships formed with other associates and customers.

title: Good and Friendly
review: I’ve always enjoyed working for the company Good Benefits and supervisors .Some coworkers wouldn’t stay with dress code and didn’t stay with job very long. Did not like the point system for tardiness’s or absence.

title: Easy money
review: Working here is easy you just have to get use to having no help and doing everything on the plus side there’s attractive people to talk to all over the store through out the day

title: A lot of staff days and lunches that we manager do for all 3shift workers

title: If ya need a bit of cash this is the job ( for a teen )
review: Well if you need a job for just a bit of cash and that's it well you found it just be prepared for workers slacking and lying like it's a part of there lifestyle

title: Job is straight forward
review: I have two managers one is all about moving faster and will ask you to do something just to stop you mid way to do something els then questions why you didn’t finish the first thing they said. He really won’t  question about firing someone that’s the vibe. The other is a lot more chill and honestly I don’t mind working the days I’m scheduled with them. Overall really depends on which manager you have. Work in general is very straight forward with 2 15min breaks and 1 hour break which sounds good but then you think about why be there for 10 hours when your basically just getting paid for 8? Pay is 18.50/hr for all overnight employees. You are allowed to used your headphones to listen to music. One of the biggest drawback to this job is that it requires you to used your own personal cell phone the whole shift and it’ll kill your battery and phone!! Shifts are from 10pm-7am for all overnight employees. No store discounts and pay is bi-weekly. They are understaffed some days and depending on the manager will make you run circles around the store from what I’ve heard do to me only working 3 days a week. Oh one thing to note is the whole call out policy! Basically it’s very easy to get fired if your not ontop of it you need to call two different numbers and if you miss one or forget it’s basically two strikes and your fired! They basically don’t mind firing people because there will always be someone els to replace them. Some people get way more work than others almost like a whole favoritism thing!

title: bad
review: cart machine didn’t work half the time and they i was the only person getting carts no help pay was pretty good

title: Just me and the carts, essentially
review: I was a cart pusher. Not much to learn, easy work. I didn't work there long because it was a temp job prior to getting surgery.However, as someone who worked in the summer heat of Arizona in a physically demanding position, I strongly believe that the cart pushers should have hazard pay during the summer. Yes, they provide a tank of water for the cart pushers and always encouraged us to step inside to cool off for a few minutes when needed, but it was still absolutely dreadful. I had never drank so much water in my life and yet still felt like I could collapse at any minute. The job seems so easy but the more you are pushing these hot steel carts across long stretches of asphalt in 110°+ heat, the more you regret what you signed up for.Cart pushers also have the benefit in.. as long as there are carts to grab and everything looks clean out there, you can kind of slack a bit and chat with the others. It was a friendly and supportive crew of people out there. On the downside... management also seems to forget that you guys exist and is incredibly slow to provide help out there when there's only one or two people on shift and it's a busy day. During monsoons, they say they'll provide a poncho to protect from the rain but it takes near an hour after it starts pouring for them to get them out there and by then, you're already soaked.If you're looking for a summer job in a state like Arizona, I'd strongly recommend looking for a position INSIDE the store. It is not worth the suffering for the low pay.

title: Very good starter job
review: This was a step up from my old position at the customer service counter, and it was definitely a step in the right direction. It took my amazing ability for customer service and showed me how to enhance and focus it to apply it to sales and reputation upkeep. This is ONE of the many things I learned from my Walmart family. Definitely helps to fill out a resume, but my only concern was the lack of bonuses or raises higher than 2%.

title: Stressfull over worked and under paid

title: Walmart is a wonderful place to work and has lots of benefits.

I als enjoyed the stocking experience and stacking pallets.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The points taking off when you arrive late, and not being able to get in contact with your supervisor.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is a positive experience with everyone.What is a typical day like for you at the company?The typical day is a busy work load.

title: Terrible Company to Work for
review: This was overall the worst job I have ever worked for and I worked for Walmart for a year. You are treated like an inferior from the moment you walk into the door. You get no benefits. No holiday pay and if you call out on a holiday you get double pointed. Also you have no choice but to work on a holiday. Even if you request off they will always deny. Part time employees do not accrue PTO. You can only have 5 absences till you are fired. They do not take doctors notes so if you are sick you are SOL. Walmart was a disease spreader. If someone got covid everyone got covid because they were forced to come in. Do not work here if you have the chance. Save your sanity. Also I was going to college for a better future and the management belittled me when I asked for part time instead of full time. They do not want you to succeed they would rather you work at Walmart forever. A lot of my coworkers that have worked there for 20+ years are making the same as a new employee. You are not valued here. You are simply a tool to them.

title: Awesome invornment
review: Great employees and awesome pay if you stay awhile and move up in ranks! Willing to learn new things and stay focused in job training is important and needed for this position.

title: Worst management 2023
review: Potential job applicants, beware. Management will lie to your face. Management will have their "Favorites." they  will always give you the runaround, never taking complete accountability for their own decisions. Store manager doesn't speak. The store is a complete disaster. Needs better management that is firm, fair,  and constant.

title: Not enough pay
review: I worked money center, customer service, and cashier. For doing all those tasks I was definitely not paid enough. Tried getting promoted only to see a newer employee get promoted. There was no room for me to grow. I did like the PTO that was offered and it was simple request days off. Also I liked that the call off was automated, saves the hassle of being asked so many personal questions of what kind of sickness you have, and being pleaded by managers to come in.

title: The more work you do, more task that you learn, and the more time you put in, isn't actually noticed or acknowledged by management
review: The slackers, the sickly people who call in constantly, or the ones who absolutely will not and cannot stay over not even 15 mins to finish up a project, are more likely praised upon for  doing simple everyday tasks that should be done without being told to do them.Management promotes who they want to, regardless of experience or knowledge of dept. or the time or energy that you've put in to it looking decent and shoppable with very limited help and small amount of time frames to do it.It is however one of the very few places that I can honestly say that 75-85% of the people I worked with were the hardest working people I have ever had the privilege of being around. It's a shame that dedicated people like that, that have families and bills to pay and responsibilities to account for, are stuck at an employer such as Walmart. Who has the least respect for the people who work for them and / or their families. They are the hardest working, loyal, employees yet are seen as replaceable anytime Walmart feels the need to replace. And that's sad. If Corporate Walmart only knew which ones are struggling to work their rear ends off so that they have a job to support their family, but others are the ones stealing, goofing off, destroying products, and half way doing any job they are given because they simply don't care about any of it, are the future Store managers, or Corporate workers with all the bonuses, pay raises and benefit packages.When I left Walmart and it was my last day working there, after I was clocked out, I actually had a hard time leaving because I felt as though I was - more...

title: Soul Sapping
review: Walmart is full of double-edge-sword policies that management can choose whether they want to follow or not. With everyone following the rules differently, there's a lot of favoritism and unfair treatment between management, employees, and customers. Also, there's no training. The system is not set up for improving the employees they have. It's set up to cycle through people until they get someone who's already trained. Everyone is expendable and it really reflects on the culture of the employees.

title: No
review: Walmart hires unethical associate degree managers with zero skills which creates a hostile environment within our communities. Associates have nothing nice to say, ever. There is numbers to use for wrongful profiling. Walmart has zero tolerance for keeping any associates over scheduled. This is not lawful and reportable.

title: Constant flip flopping

title: Unprofessional

title: It's okay
review: It's okay. It's a job but it doesn't pay much for all the hard work you do. You also don't get any benefits in this position, I would've at least liked to get some pto. It's hard for me to take unpaid time off of a job that doesn't pay half my bills.

title: Laid Back, but lots of constant micromanagement
review: Working here was okay. Keep yourself busy and everything will be fine. There is some way of advancement, but as usual it takes a while. Management is not always on the same page. Be ready to get bothered for leaving “early.” There will be plenty of time for overtime work.

title: Easy fixable
review: Great place to work! You can move up fast! Make sure you show up for your schedule shift time. You will loose your job calling out 3 times. Full time

title: It's Walmart
review: Working here is exactly what you'd expect honestly. The management is alright, no one has a life outside of their 40+ hours a week, and you're always stuck working with either a 15-year-old or a 70 year old there is no in-between. The only reason I left was because my store manager ignored my leave of absence request, so it got auto-denied. Overall, I liked the people I worked with but its an exhausting job especially on the occasion that customers would scream at me for following policy.

title: Flexible schedule
review: This collar does not care about the employees that they hire this is not the company from years ago they only care about the mighty dollar and the incentives they get for the employees working there

title: Easy place to work
review: Not a bad place to start out at they lower hours due to not being busy only if you are a part-time worker. Overall not a terrible place to work but definitely not one to stay at forever

title: Nice people, but horrible policies
review: Everyone that works there is really kind and it has a very big family atmosphere. However, the attendance policy is trash. It runs off of a point system, does not accept doctors note, and unless you have enough ppto to cover your days off, you can and will get fired if you miss more than 4 days in a 6-month period. I've known people who got the flu, had to stay out because of obvious reasons, and were let go. So while I love the staff the business as a whole lacks empathy for real life situations that can occur for everyone.

title: Ok
review: Somewhat OK if you go in there and do your work then you have nothing to worry about. Management is just like management anywhere else follow expectations and you will be fine. And don't call out alot

title: Bad work

title: It's a alright job

title: Fine
review: It was fine working here. It's a customer service job, so it is what is is. Pay wasn't bad. Hours were fine. Not incredibly flexible, but that's about it.

title: Fun Workplace and Simple Job
review: Simple and easy job day in and day out. Pace typically picks up a bit on weekends. Decent pay but pretty hard to get overtime. You can also pull up to 50 percent of your check out early which was a good bonus.

title: Bad
review: It is not fun to work here. A typical day is working in a department that is not your own and you will run freight for hours with managers getting mad at you

title: Just a number, job is easy
review: Working as a cart pusher, I would usually get harassed by management for various things while we were busy (example, wearing headphones while working outside, even if I only had a single earbud in, or not having reserves of carts when the store is full of customers). It is difficult to take frequent breaks on busy days as a cart pusher, and doubly so if you are working on your own. The cart pushing equipment was okay, but typically had issues and would take weeks to be resolved. Issues would reoccur, would take weeks to get solved, and continued that way the entire time I was there. There is extremely high turnover, meaning co-workers who are very inconsiderate and inconsistent. No call no shows were frequent. Sometimes, you would be scheduled as the only one for the entire day at a store with several hundred carts. Two to 11:00, 10:00 to 7:00, etc.

title: Fun Place to Work I Enjoyed It
review: I enjoyed working at Walmart it was a lovely experience for me the customers were great my supervisors were great it was an amazing experience I'm thinking about going back

title: Not a bad place
review: Your regular retail store chain nothing too serious management was always changing you come in unload frieght put on carts and stock the shelfs thats about it.

title: Great Starting Point
review: I worked night shift, and if you are fresh out of high school or in college, this is a great place to work. Just prepare to be on you're feet a lot, and drink lots of coffee. There is some down time, but you won't be spending it in a break room, but communicating with peers. Great atmosphere and very individually oriented.

title: Great workplace
review: It'll get you where you need to be when you are a teenager but I wouldn't recommend continuing it afterwards. Use this job as a stepping stone for yourself!

title: Don’t recommend
review: bad management don’t recommend working here they are unprofessional and bad pay as well management sucks and they make you work a lot I would say get a job somrwhrrr  else

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Too many mouths telling you what to do. It becomes a problem of contradictory. It just ruins your day. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is busy I just did my best to get the job done. Some care more than others. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy. Always kept myself busy.

title: Inclusive
review: Miserable supervisor but coworkers were genuine and nice. Was told to clean drains by the one of the assistant branch managers, which was not what I been hired to do, I was actually hired to work in bakery but had to get down on the floor and clean the drains being that I was the rookie I was later told.

title: Good paying job.
review: It’s Walmart, they hire everyone from incompetent to exceptional employees. In the last few years Walmarts have started paying closer to $17/18 an hour, which is great. However, there are no rewards for going above and beyond. Its not even an offer. Incentives are reserved for managers based on the output of that department, meaning managers profit off the back of their employees. They often hire narcissistic, melodramatic and smallminded leads. If you can keep your mouth shut and come in every single day without issue, this is a decent job. But if you have any dignity or self respect, this place will ware on you quickly and take that away from you.

title: Fast Paced
review: Fast paced. Have to remind of break times. Hard to get a day off.  Employees are held to a high standard with overall attitude while management can be rude.

title: Easy work
review: On feet most of the day, depending on the store you might get a lot more breaks while dispensing, but if you are shopping for the groceries not not really. Be prepared for lots of walking.

title: Good coworkers, bad upper management
review: The company constantly cuts hours without warning. It’s hard enough in today economy. I started at 40, then they gave me 32, then 30, then 25… I couldn’t survive

title: they will take advantage of you at every turn
review: they will hire you for a low paying position but will pull you to do other peoples job every day. I was hired for electronics but had to work grocery pick up every day. they said I was not entitled to grocery pick up pay since that was not my position. you will be required to do higher paying task without the pay.

title: Good pay
review: I worked at the Walmart Distribution in Coldwater, Mi. They continued to buy new equipment for employees to make their job easier. As far as DCs go, this is the best one near Battle Creek, Mi.

title: A place where your overworked and under appreciated
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Insurance benefits are great. Otherwise not great place to work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Hours and no help in departments that are very busy. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?No one gives a care about you, your there for them not for you. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clocking in and running like a chicken with its head cut off.

title: Productive
review: Great job a typical workday is smooth and starting off unloading the truck with my team. I learned everything there and every department including how to work an electric jack also.

title: Stressful and unfair treatment
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay and employees. At times it's fast pace and other times it's slow.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Constantly getting threatened to be fired. Lack of proper leadership.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful but other employees make it fun.What is a typical day like for you at the company?12 hour shift. Everyone gets to VTO early but QA employees.

title: good place, tough job
review: They have many jobs at Walmart distribution center. unfortunately, most of them are order fillers. a very hard, fast paced and physically intense job.

title: If you want to move up just kiss some cheeks and show up, even if you don't show up they won't fire you.
review: It's a joke working there unless you get along with some of the crazier veterans and can handle training new people that get cycled through every week. Honestly was one of the easiest jobs I worked but I was depressed working there on the front end especially during the height of Covid.

title: favoritism & unfair, horrible management
review: The work itself isn’t hard it more just the management . I had a hard time at walmart because my hours were cut repeatedly, heavy favoritism with work task. putting other associates in charge of the floor that they don’t know how to manage.  Taking extremely long  breaks. overall just be prepared for the frustration

title: Stressful
review: "More money equals more responsibility." They like to shove that quote down your throat a lot. Beware that you will be doing more work than what your job description entails under the basis of a pay raise. Mind you the pay raise could be less than a dollar for twice the work. And management is very condescending. From store manager on down to HR. Would not recommend unless absolutely necessary.

title: There's nothing good about this company.
review: One of the worst companies I have ever seen. No appreciation No respect  too much pressure and most stressful. Years working with this company, is been useless.

title: Productive
review: Heavy lifting and always on the move. Lots of climbing, bending, kneeling, crouching, while moving and stocking freight to the shelves. Most associates knew what needed to be done.

title: Great
review: Great job for extra money! Highly recommend this as a side hustle if you have the time. Everyone in this day and age should have a side hustle and multiple avenues of income.

title: Okay for college students
review: Rotating shifts. Management does not work with your schedule. This job is okay for someone who is in college and wants a part time job. I would not recommend to stay for more than a year.

title: Sales Team
review: Walmart works for 15 years worth nothing. hard work and over time all holidays they don't care if we have family and children need me to be home. force works holidays and weekends. force works varies schedule morning and night must be flexible and hard for me pick up kids for school. not friendly for began parenthood. Job for single people who turning 18 years old.
position: Supervisor , Instock , Maintenance, and Meat Sales

title: Hours
review: If your part time they work you a lot of hours holidays then cut you after.  Management seems to show favoritism. If you looking for something to make extra money then not a bad job.

title: Boring
review: Repetitive, fast-paced, stressful, and boring. Management needs training with respect to their workers. Not enough tools to perform the job when management expects that you have to do the job doesn’t matter how.

title: Working at the Augusta Maine Walmart was a great experience and would like to return maybe sometime soon.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Assisting customers with their questions and concerns What is the most stressful part about working at the company?There were times customers would get belligerent What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment was great and I enjoyed working with the Diversity of everyone who I was associated with. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Start your 8 hour shift with a  positive attitude and finish up with a positive impact at the end of day.

title: Literally the most mentally & physically draining job I've ever had & I'm 47yrs old so what's that tell you!!!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There isn't one thing good about working for Walmart bc the harder you work and or try, the worst management treated you!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The amount of work that expected out of one person in an 7 1/2 hr shiftWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Frustrating bc your managers tell you we have 70hrs worth of freight to put away but only 45hrs of employees to meet said goal but your still absolutely to get it completed and cleaned up by 5am so actually we only have 5 actual work hours!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Fix mistakes daily, clean up the disaster the day shift would make & put all freight away & zone my entire department in 7hrs

title: Stressful and toxic work enviornment
review: Management is bias and treat new associates unequally to seniority. Fellow coworkers are not friendly to new people and are very disrespectful to coworkers that are not in their pre started friend groups. A typical day at work for me was stressful with very little direction and guidance, treatment from coworkers was very unforgiving and high standards of me and my job efficiency. The hardest part of the job was the customers, they treat associates like garbage and expect way to much from associates. What I learned from the job is retail is unenjoyable work environment, would never work there again. The most tolerable part of the job was the benefits that you receive and schedule flexibility.

title: Walmart is a place of favoritism
review: Walmart runs off of favoritism.If you know and in good with the right people you can go far . Working in the deli was not worth the pay according to what you had to do.

title: It depends on the people you work with
review: The people I worked for was fun we did our work proudly and took our work seriously  there has been times we had fun doing our work  management  was good team leads was good also

title: Hard Work
review: If you’re gonna work here for the money be prepared to work for it. The hours are long but the money is some what worth it. Especially getting minimum 3 days off most of the time.

title: Good job for students
review: Good job for studentspaid workoutCome to work & handle business type of jobHigher stress for management position (as expected with any retail management position)

title: Terrible
review: The team itself is okay and the customers aren’t terrible, but management. Some are okay but there’s always the one team lead/coach power tripping and expecting unrealistic deadlines bc that’s what some paper says. Don’t do it to yourself, it’s not worth it

title: None
review: Es buen habiente de trabajo , buen salario, te brinda seguridad, respeto y habiente de horarios a su medida . En el futuro también ofrecen buenas posiciones para tu desarrollo laboral. Lastimosamente me cambié de estado .

title: Good, if you don't mind being in the elements
review: It's a decent job. It can get rough, especially during bad weather or when it gets really busy, but a lot of the time its really chill and you have a lot of freedom in how you do things as long as the job is getting done.

title: Okay
review: I feel as if management can be overbearing at times. The company also cares too much about the metrics which ways the associates down. Short staffed on days where we are busy.

title: Cashier
review: It was fun working here but there were some crazy people for sure. I enjoyed the slow mornings, but when the evening came it was hectic and at times scary.

title: Management is disorganized
review: No one is willing to help or answer questions. Managers constantly changing their minds and opinions about how to best help customers. Miscommunication

title: Ok workplace
review: ok place to work. good people. average pay. if you are looking for a consistency then you will like it here. management is good and they respect their employees.

title: Rude management
review: Not a fun place to work, management is very rude and if you don't fit their click or need a day off it's over for you. You have to give up weekends if you want to work there

title: productive, fun place to work
review: working their is a good environment. easy to manage and easy to work around your schedule. The hardest part about this job is  stocking and labor. Carrying heavy stuff all day could be very killer for someone.

title: All around great place to work
review: I have been driving for Walmart at Brookhaven location for 7 months now. Best decision I've ever made. Everyone is very respectful and although there are over 190 drivers you don't feel like a number. The pay, benefits, paid-time off, safety bonuses, opportunities to grow are all better than all of my previous jobs.

title: I wouldn't work here again
review: The pay and benefits are good but management makes the hard working associates work harder to compensate for the unproductive ones, there is no accountability and the culture in the building is pretty toxic

title: Stressful but simple work.
review: The work was simple but it would get stressful on busy days. Management did not schedule me for a month even after I contacted them. Hours were good but the company has a lot they could work on.

title: Great advances
review: I worked at Walmart in Orlando for over two years and moved up from a sales associate to a department manager in a short amount of period. Of course with the hard work.

title: One of the best local stores
review: Kind people work at this local store and they are very helpful and very dedicated to their job that they chose to do and they are the very best local store in my opinion.

title: Productive and fun, relaxing environment
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people are very friendly. I was a picker and packer I scanned the device What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful thing is so many hours I have to work What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly, nice relaxing and helpfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Nice people are very relaxing and people are helpful

title: So far, everyone takes good care of their area.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Clearly defined jobs. Phone app for work is really good.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The sheer volume of business.  Always busy.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Pretty good work environment.  Clearly defined roles make the system work.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Nine hours shifts. 2 breaks and a lunch.

title: No home life balance, no chance to move up
review: I worked here for the company for 8 years and the main reason I left was because there was no where to go once you were good at your job. Also was blocked numerous time when I tried to take PTO.

title: Routine and fast paced.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Job security, advance schedulingWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?It's difficult to finish an assignment at times before being drawn to another task.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendliness is limited among staff because there's so much else to do.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Spent most of my time in my cubicle, typing on my computer.

title: Cool
review: Fun and cool employees were always nice managers are cool work is super easy and pay is nice also a lot of people to talk to and you get through your day pretty fast

title: Can be overwhelming at times
review: I have worked at Walmart in the past, its a pretty straightforward job but can get hectic at times. It definitely keeps you busy as you are on your feet for most of the time. If you have good co-workers it should be a fairly easy job.

title: Awful place to work
review: This was by far the worst job all around the board. The pay was lousy, other employees disrespect and degrade you, the hostility of the customers is just beyond words.

title: Fast Paced Good Work Environment
review: This is my first job and I enjoy it but not anything career worthy unless you are friends with people up in higher management, just a good temporary job to build skills. Working in the OGP position is simple if you can keep up with the fast paced work environment. Management is helpful as well as understanding; your team feels more like family than coworkers as everyone I work with are great people. Of course this can change as people come and go but from my experience this job was never dull. A lot of physical work is involved on both ends whether you are a dispenser or picker but as long as you can keep up with the pace anyone can do it.

title: Just go to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Everyday knowing that I'm helping someone find what they're looking for and putting a smile on their face What is the most stressful part about working at the company?No stress on the behalf you already know your job.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Trying to put you in a position to win daily What is a typical day like for you at the company?Wonderful everyday I know I've put a smile on someone's face

title: The first 10 to 13 years were good. Bonuses and PTO was nice. Changing work positions was easy.
review: Only 5 PTO days a year. No Bonuses. No extra pay for doing other jobs. Point system  bad. Can’t get sick unexpectedly and than have any other sick time. No time for any emergency’s and expect to get a paid vacation. I got diverticulitis and had to use up my 5 plus days. Medications make me high, sick and weak. So when my attic ceiling collapsed and I got sick from smell, etc… and couldn’t see, alone drive to work. I accumulated extra days off. I got 3 extra points which got me terminated. Time doesn’t count. I was 3 weeks away from being a 17 year worker for the same company. Yet others walk around with less years and more points (20 plus) and nothing happens to them?Management is really poor these days. No manger or managers on a daily basics. Yet they vacation every 3 months or less. It’s worse if you office help. That has over 35 years with company and gets to work from home and off holidays and weekends? Rarely ever in office and gets paid? Amazing how Walmart has changed in the past several years.

title: Their scheduling sucks and they need union for workers rights.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Always busy. That's good. But the scheduling is STUPID!! you have to jump thru hoops to get ANY answers. They really need a union so people cannot be fired on the stupid "point" system , which is a joke cuz the managers can go in an wipe out your points if they feel so inclined to do!! What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Tryin to take off certain days bcuz of appts.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It has gotten ALOT better since covid.MoRE relaxed. They didn't even let cashiers talk to each other when we got slow! They wouldn't allow you to have a drink at ur register UNLESS it was a clear container!! I take insulated stainless steel jug so it will keep ice ALL day. The culture is is a mix, no complaints there.. NoT much predjudice. It would be the black people that are predjudice when you can see it and hear it.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers ALL day with their groceries and answering questions.

title: Okay
review: Was not a horrible job if parties but didn’t pay well at all for fulltime employees They did provide a lot of opportunity for growth within the company if you are interested in management

title: Productive/ okay
