review: The job is pretty self explanatory and pretty easy. The problem I had was management mostly they just can not listen to you sometimes. I honestly also was not getting paid enough for the work I was doing so I had to step away.

title: good
review: Walmart is a great company to work for because they provide one hundred percent funding for education for those that do not already have a bachelors degree.

title: Nowhere To Go Except Insane
review: Wasn't able to hold anyone responsible for bad or unsafe work with the store manager overriding every HR decision we made so nobody respected middle management. Ended up having to do most work myself and work long into the night with terrible work-life balance. Worked for the company for 8 years prior, but management was a whole other beast. Very clique, very cutthroat amongst other managers trying to stand out for a promotion. No teammwork to speak of at that level unless your definition of team player is being the one getting taken advantage of just so you dont make waves while almost everyone else screwed around, lied, and threw eachother under the bus to look good to the store manager. Good news was a lot of them got fired after I quit. The whole experience led me to almost unalive myself due to stress. I'm not some whiny, lazy kid, but even MY psyche broke under the terrible conditions they had for management. Took an out at a job making almost 40% less, and it still was the best decision I have ever made. Leaving that terrible position ended up making me an even BETTER employee at a other company when I finally realized how unproductive I had become just because of burnout and stress trying to keep up with the impossible demands of managing a sinking ship of horrible work culture and their joke of a grasp of safety and ethics.

title: Fun, energetic, fast paced, and plenty of room for growth.
review: Walmart is a great company to work for.  My husband and I met at work, he was promoted and relocated, which meant I had to leave as well. Since he is now a Coach, we are no longer able to work together.   Walmart offers a ton of great benefits such as a 401K, paid time off, protected time off, and many others.

title: Highly productive
review: You never stop moving! If you stop moving you’re performance and production rate is already plummeting. Wouldn’t use fun as an example for this job but I will say it’s intense.

title: Ever changing
review: Sound job with good pay and decent benefits. As an assistant manager you are compensated well although the job can get overwhelming it is definitely a great experience

title: Lot of room to grow. Poor work/life balance
review: Plenty of opportunities in the company to advance.  Enjoyable work and people. Work life balance is difficult at manager level. Culture and company values are good but not always upheld by some management.

title: I hated it there, managment dosent communicate to each other and they don't care about you or your life at all.
review: I worked there for 6 months, at the start it was fine but after a while you realize how bad it is. For my first bit everything was fine I had good hours good pay and what I though was good management, but that changed after about 3 months. I got into a pretty bad car accident and couldn't go to work, instead of understand my situation they decided to point me 3 times (5 will get you fired) and threatened to fire me. After that I have heard from multiple people that management has been talking vrap about me behind my back aswell as multiple employees. Recently one of the managers walked up to me and just said we suggest you quit before we fire you. I will never recommend this job to anyone.

title: Great benefits, nightmare to work at.
review: I've worked at Wal-Mart on and off for awhile and most recently they've added a lot more benefits and the pay is decent enough... even if the workload expected is no where near what you should be paid.Salaried managers hardly care about most of their associates unless you're in their clique then you can sit around and do nothing and still expect to be paid.My favorite experience was finding out the our Market Manager who was visiting our store and spent 85% of his time in the office smoking his vape and during his tour spent the remainder of the time cussing out the management team on the floor in front of customers.The culture at walmart appears good at the start, but once you realize that if stores and their management team do not bend down to the will of the market manager of their area then they will cause absolutely nothing but stress and stress on their hourly associates until they drive them to walk out.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Take your time do your eight and hit the gateWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?They act like they send you $50 an hourWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work work work workThey don't want you to do nothing but work

title: It was a job.
review: Nothing to say except you show up, you work and they pay you. Stay out of drama and keep your eye on the next job paying more. The employee discount is nice.

title: absolutely ridiculous pls don't work here
review: The store is a mess and constantly bringing people in and firing them they do not value there associates nor the hard work they bring worst job experience of my life and it was my first sadly I hope they can learn how to run a store for the future.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customer service environment fit my skills and likes.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Cart pushing after 4 hours is the most stressful part of working with the company. Usually only filled in for a couple hours when they were short handed.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Team spirited work environment.What is a typical day like for you at the company?There were no typical days for me. I helped in so many areas that every day was a new adventure.
position: Money Center Cashier Customer Service Associate

title: If I liked it here I wouldn’t be looking for more opportunities
review: Bleh always looking for more opportunities. Could be better but people’s egos are a big proponent of management and if u get one off the rocker then you’re in for it.

title: I would go back if need be.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I loved my Walmart job.  I started out in the bakery/deli but moved after a few months to ODP (online shopper) - which was a much better fit for me.  I LOVED it!  The hours were great, my bosses were really great.  I would recommend working for Walmart.  Their benefits are awesome, too!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Shopping for our customers on the weekends with the crowdsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Most of us all got along just fine.  The people who didn't want to come to work, or create a lot of drama and/or do their job were replaced quickly, so as long as you're there to do your job, it's all good.

title: Bad place to work.
review: Very rude and unprofessional Team leads would, you are being moved around constantly one minute your on register then your on carts if you don't "move enough carts" you get yelled at I would wear sweats one Sunday cause they usually put me on carts but your expected to wear jeans when pushing carts. They also have favorites you'll know because they get easy jobs like doing tills.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Some of the benifits & some of the people you work with What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management not supporting you & they worry more about the point system instead of your job performance What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful at times depending on the size of the crew & management not helping What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful at times depending on how much help you have

title: Great job
review: Easy job, low pay, opportunity to pick up shifts. Accommodate to schedules most times. Their point system makes it so you can be flexible if late or have appointments.

title: Management is corrupt and overall trash
review: While working at Walmart #3754 I unfortunately learned that no matter how hard of a worker you can be and how much better improvement one may have done so. The management is tr**h. Seriously learned the hard way that if you seriously have to use the bathroom and you’re just starting your shift. It doesn’t matter if you clock in on time, even if you let your team lead know about your whereabouts you’re most definitely going to get terminated for using the bathroom!! If I would’ve known this. I would’ve held in my p**p and suffered through my shift if I would’ve known I was going to get fired for using the bathroom! This is just one of the many d**b things you can get fired for. It’s not even fair when your manager takes full advantage of the type of worker you may be. If they notice you are in need of that job they will take advantage of you and make you do tasks that none of your other co-workers do or have even done!!!

title: Workplace Environment
review: Not organized, some of the team leaders are not good team players. Not helpful but is there to instruct you ONLY! I have seen better team leaders roll up their sleeves and been more pro active as an employee.

title: Do not recommend.
review: Hey! do you like working for a year without advancements or raises? Do you like doing jobs you weren't hired to do? do you like being scheduled for eight days straight at alternating shifts between morning and night with no regard for your ability to actually sleep before coming in for your next shift? then do i have a job for you!

title: Productive yet poor management handle
review: Walmart is a good starter job to get your feet up but, not a job I would stay at unless I seek to be a store manager. Management is poorly handled and I don’t see myself staying there until retirement.

title: What I learned.
review: I have learned a tremendous amount of knowledge working for Walmart. My experiences have helped me explore the different avenues of running a business inside of a Super Center Store. If I wanted to start my own company. My work history at Walmart will help me exceed getting it off the ground and growing a customer base.

title: Not good
review: From my experience working at Walmart at least in this location, you are not cared about. They don’t care about sick leave, and will fire you if you hit 5 points no matter if it were important or not. The coaches do not care about you and you’re personal life, you pretty much have to devote your life to them. You get more out of your job being full time, but it is hard to become full time as they do not like to give just anyone that position. You will be expected to go above and beyond and anything less than that is simply unacceptable. Getting days off is hard, and a lot of their policies make no sense. There is also no communication between management, I will be told one thing by the store manager; and the next day being yelled at by another manager for doing said thing. They have a strict dress code, and treat those with piercings/ colored hair ect. Different. Personally I am exhausted and drained from working this job, decent money and people for sure, but management could definitely do better.

title: Just a number
review: Walmart isn’t family oriented anymore like it use to be everything is based on numbers and how to use your associates management is only worried about their profit line. You can have a death within the store associates and management doesn’t display much of a concern or a care because the business is more important. I feel the management that’s in position don’t care about real life situations until it affects them

title: There are worse jobs out there
review: Customer Host is a decent job, if you have the proper perspective.The pay isn't great, but ultimately, I just stand at the door, joke with customers, and ask to look at receipts. Training for almost every other position in the store has been easy and accessible on the handheld the company provides.The attendance policy is more forgiving that any construction job I've had. The staff has been friendly and helpful.

title: Amazon
review: Place was absolutely amazing to work for the job was easy they treated me like family helped me succeed and grow in my career a best place to work for and awesome pay and benefits

title: Bad mangers
review: Terrible place to work the management is terrible and the stuff you will go through is horrific the customers are bad and irratating and feel entitled

title: Multinational Company
review: Found great team workers, supportive and willing to train. A good systematic process to learn. Encouraging management, opportunity to grow pf you meet the KPIs.

title: Productive and friendly place to work.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The support of the people in charge and the wonderful team I work with.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to keep up with the demand of the deadlinesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great environment and a mixed culture of people who get along great'What is a typical day like for you at the company?Energized and fulfilling, and a feeling of being able to finish a job and finish it well as a team

title: Not for me
review: Management is very unorganized. I minute they want you doing one thing the next, a different manager is asking you to do something else. Lack of communication. No training. Co workers did not care about their job.

title: Awful job, awful pay
review: The management is mostly nice, the people are alright, the customers are annoying, the pay is awful. It feels like you're wasting time by being there. Use your spare time to hunt for a better job asap.

title: None
review: If you want to barely do anything and talk all the time, this is the place for you. If ya want something where you can advance, then it's not the place for you.

title: Decent place
review: The team is amazing to work with. The customers were ok to deal with, its all depending on dept. The best part for me is being able to have a flexible set schedule!

title: decent
review: it was ok good part time job. i would not really reccomend this job to anyone that is looking for a lot of hours tho.  Sometimes you get 40 other weeks you only get 15

title: Exhausting to the point of madness. Very unfair.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I like the work experiences. The knowledge learned.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of respect from coworkers and management.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very unfair and racist if your not part of their cliques your gonna have a hard time.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Doing everything by myself while others sleep.

title: Good place to work
review: Decent pay, availability to choose your own hours, I liked it. Thr other staff members where friendly but there is a stigma from customers that they don't have to respect you at all when they see the walmart blue, so that is the biggest downside really.

title: It’s alright
review: Get to be on your own for most of your shift so that’s a plus for people who like space. Pay is alright if you don’t have too many bills. Schedule is ok

title: Hay orden, disciplina,union para trabajar
review: Hay muy buena actitud para trabajar, también hay unidad, los compañeros nos ayudamos unos a otros

title: Fun workplace also has good people also nothing hard tbh
review: Good people and bad people actually it all depends on you (yourself) bc it’s mostly teens barely any grown ups.. and mostly younger adults do all the work.

title: Its a job
review: Decent place to work keeps you busy and always something to do. It was my first job as a teenager. Do your job and everything works out fine. Cant complain

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting new people and coworkers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Too many people giving orders and no one actually stepping up to make sure you have what you need to get the job doneWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, not enough compensation for the work loadWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Help customer, stock, cashier

title: Stress
review: Job is stressful and you are salary. You are always on the clock. Job load doesn’t match the compensation. Any extra hours worked are not paid. expect you to work on your days off.

title: Fast paced, decent pay, Upper mngmt sucked.
review: The pay is ok for a starting job. The job itself is good as a stepping stone, but I would not reccomend long term for anyone who values their mental health.I was lucky we had a good team lead, but otherwise, upper management had no idea how to run the job and caused more issues than they resolved.

title: Okay work at the time
review: It was alright but the management took advantage of you any chance they had. Some coworkers made it easier but others would try to tell you what to do like if they were in charge. Too many in office politics we’re going on.

title: Walmart is a "means to an end"
review: Never take the job too seriously. Walmart will exist rather you are there on a particular day or if the unrealistic target times are met or not.Management has clear and obvious favorites. The point system indicates 5 absence days leads to termination, which is low for retail anyway, but there are a few workers that are gone more than they are at work, and continue to have their jobs. Those are the same people that do little to no work, piggybacking on the work of others.Some of the tasks assigned are not your actual work, but management wants you to do their work, and rarely believe you did the task, constantly questioning you. Ps, those tasks do not change how the job and company works.It's tedious work, and generally you don't find an end. Each shift is pitted against each other. There is no sense of "team."Take the job for what it is...a paycheck.You are demanded to work all holidays, but you get NO holiday pay.The pay is good, among the best in the city.Benefits are expensive and don't cover much.If you need a paycheck, go for Walmart, but don't take it seriously. You're a number on the payroll to them anyway.

title: productive and eventful workplace
review: Management is something that could be better. It is somewhat organized but at times work can be all over the place. Overall this is a good job to start gaining experience in a workplace environment, and potentially grow within the company.

title: Great benefits lacking management
review: The benefits offered by Walmart almost make the cons worthwhile. Most of the positions are easy work but management can make the work stressful as multiple managers tend to disagree on priorities.

title: Poor management and corporate policies.
review: They force each employee to work multiple jobs by being deliberately understaffed. This causes an even higher turnover rate. Don’t expect any kind of benefits for two years if you’re hired on as “part time.” You’re actually hired on as a temp so they can push benefits back even farther. Only work here if you can guarantee you’ll be healthy and at work for at least two years.

title: Original store was great.
review: Transferred from my store states away blindly to a store in Knoxville, and being HORRIFIED is putting it lightly. The freight never stopped, colleagues from other stores in the area immediately apologized when you told them your store.The management set unrealistic goals - and I'm aware of what the goals should be coming from a store that was on process and did just as much business. The store was dirty, falling apart, employees were crying daily.

title: Great place to work
review: Everyone was willing to work and training was easy. Lots of different positions to advance once hired. Management was ok but looking to switch positions

title: productive
review: Managers aren't helpful. The pay could also be way better. have't dealt with any bad customers. Only decent thing about this job is that sometimes not very often it can be chill.

title: dreadful work place
review: the store is understaffed because they refuse to spend the money to hire more people. the associates are overworked and end up doing multiple jobs despite getting paid for only one. the pay is decent but not enough for the amount of work you are forced to do due to previously mentioned, company ignored issues.

title: Okay
review: Pay was decent but the people who work there suck and honestly just wish management didn’t act like immature adults. It could use improvement in terms of staffing.

title: Will not work around college classes
review: It wasn’t a bad place to work but they refused to work around my class schedule. I was just using this job to get through college and they told me they would work around my schedule but did not.

title: Inexperienced Management
review: The biggest issue is management is promoted not based on how well they prove themselves but by how much the store manager likes them. Their friends get promoted while more deserving people aren't given a chance. This leads to inefficiency as half the Team Leads and Coaches have no idea how half the store even runs. It is run by the associates.

title: The manager cause’s problems for me
review: The point system is horrible,the manager takes advantage of the point system and writes people he doesn’t like up for bad reasons . Upper management is good to work with except they won’t do anything about the manager causing problems

title: Decent entry level job just don't expect to be there long term.
review: Walmart is a decent entry level job with decent pay, but i wouldn't recommend working there for any time over 3 years. Pros: -Decent Starting Pay-Flexible Scheduling for students.-Not very labor intensive.-10% discount is alright.-1 hour lunches are always appreciatedCons:-Severe Hour cut after Christmas (January-March)-Absolutely no job security.-PTO is earned painfully -Wage increases are extremely rare.-No bonuses or holiday pay.

title: not bad
review: fun place to work. boring but okay management .fast paced work. flexible scheduling. easy interview process. but would not work here again. pay is way too low.

title: Every day is different
review: We work on old and new vehicles its like learning how to put a vehicle together with parts. Really fun to work on. Like last week we worked on a 1929 ford model T

title: Overworked, Underpaid, Unappreciated, Drama-Filled Job
review: I was absolutely miserable every single day at my work location. No matter how hard you try and fast you go…it’s not enough. Everyone is supposed to be a “team” but instead gossip’s, doesn’t do their fair share, and makes it miserable. Managers play favorites, don’t keep their agreements, barely do any work, and partake in the drama/gossip. Thank God, I finally found another job and got out of that place and free of the severe depression it caused.

title: Good
review: Good job to work at.the pay wasn't bad and the management was fine.sometimes the customers would get on my nerves but most of them were nice.not a bad place to work

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?My hours and salary close to homeWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Upper management is never around and never friendlyWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very childish employees, very self centered What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy hard work but time goes by fast

title: It was a terrible environment
review: Walmart was a terrible environment to work for on top of that they made you go through a major amount of work to be certified to work there it was just almost it I was in college

title: Recommend
review: Pleasant environment, decent co-workers. Good management. Decent career opportunities. All things considered it's just a temporary job or low expectation position

title: Would not recommend
review: Managers don’t care about you or anything really. Overworked. Overlooked. I would not recommend working here at all, but I had terrible experience at mine

title: The job itself is not bad it’s management
review: I would never work for Walmart againPeople with different cultures that we are head wraps, and different stuff are unappreciated and will be told to take them off even if it’s a culture related… if you’re sick or been in the hospital you were still get points because they don’t do doctors notes or hospital notes … I was in the hospital two times for three days each time and got fired because I was in the hospital

title: Unorganized
review: Worked there for 7 months, and I was constantly required to do the job of others, the manager was not very nice. The scheduling was always all over the place.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?This is the worst place I have ever worked.  Would not recommend it to anyone to work there.  All the perks and bonuses for hourly associates have been eliminated.  You have more responsibility with less pay and less labor force.  Not a good environment for anyone seeking a career.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The unrealistic demands that are put on the associates.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Sometimes seems like a hostile work environment due to the demands placed on the management team to meet metrics requirements. The true Walmart culture no longer exists What is a typical day like for you at the company?Going in with a plan then having it changed and not being able to accomplish your goals due to the constant direction change

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Employees were for the most part very friendlyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?There was absolutely no proper training for the management position I was hired for.  Also, I was fired five months in because I did not have a degree or two years in retail sales.  Neither of these issues was discussed during the interview. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Highly stressed and under appreciated.  Also very poorly paid and trained.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Miserable, due to inadequate training and pressure to meet deadlines without training.  It was constant catchup with additional tasks dropped daily from the regional manager.  The attitude was "Just get it done."

title: Nice associates
review: Great place to work. As long as you're able to have a good management staff. If you hurt yourself in any way its your fault first. Even if it has been recorded.

title: Very productive and easy place to work
review: I liked my job and management besides one person. I would work here again and as a cashier you sometimes have to deal with very rude and unreasonable customers which can be a burden.

title: Good management and easy enough workload.
review: The company as you can expect is well managed and the pay was very good at the time. For the position you are in you are very much compensated for the time you put in and the flexibility of your scheduling.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Some Co-Workers and being able to be free on your own.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not getting the days Off you requested.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s Ok, it’s easy. Layed backWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in do your work interact with some people etc.

title: Pretty good place
review: I enjoyed my time at Walmart although it isn’t the same as it used to be. My coworkers were amazing and willing to jump in and help on whatever task. Management was good minus a few bad apples

title: Es una buena empresa
review: Es un trabajo muy cómodo para mí es uno de los mejores trabajo que he trabajado

title: Worst job experience
review: I was treated horribly and ignored by most of the people there. Management had favorites they'd let get away with everything and weren't good at their jobs. The 5 point system is ridiculous. This is the only place I worked at that did that for attendance and it made things difficult especially when I lost my job for the points when I had valid reasons for missing work, but the management's favorites would hit 5 points but suddenly their points would be lowered and they wouldn't be fired. It was a very unfair work environment. I did my job to the best of my ability and never got any kind of recognition when I was doing well. There wasn't anything enjoyable about the job besides the pay. Maybe I just happened to go to one of the worst locations, but from what I've seen on Reddit, it's pretty common. Just do yourself a favor: don't work here.

title: Great
review: Company is growing so there are opportunities that might not immediately exist - Company provides regular communication, listen to and consider new ideas, andcontinually encouraging growth, both personally and professionally- Company understands work-life balance and actually respects that - Culture is conducive to creating friends and mentors with lots of opportunities to getinvolved based on your interests

title: Fun people
review: The other associates that I worked with were great and were the best part of working there. Lower management overstepped professional boundaries and would make very unprofessional comments towards us. We were not respected; however, the job was not bad. If they paid more and did not let the lower management talk to the cart associates like trash, I probably would have never left.

title: Decent pay and brnefits
review: I worked in the Fresh Area for over to years, then I left. The job, itself, was simple, and my coworkers helped make things bearable. The unbearable part was management. They were disorganized, chaotic and overbearing. We were constantly short-staffed, but they made no real effort to hire anyone. As a result, work/life balance was terrible. Many people left due to burnout.

title: Terrible day
review: What is the best part of working at the company?External mgmnt. Does not care. About people. They think everyone Is a theif.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They will not rotate the workers at the front end of any stores

title: Not bad
review: Good spot just unorganized I wish management was better but hey what can you expect from a large corporation like Walmart.

title: Great 👍
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good pay/great people 2work withWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Learning2stock/receive product properWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great people environment learning experience nWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Wonderful/exciting joyful day people friendly

title: Good management at times
review: show me, people can be really lazy, often times still throw things in other departments because I don’t feel like dealing with it. Management at times can also be difficult to deal with because some of them care and some of them don’t care. It is the luck of the draw, and you are always going to be given the short end of the stick by employees that don’t work.

title: Good Benefit
review: Great company to work for on certain level. Always good to learn for one and other or other manager. Fun and productive place to work for.. always room to move up

title: Decent
review: Decent gig for what you have to do. The new automatic self check outs kind of got rid of our jobs. Good benefits and decent pay just kind of an job in general

title: Productive and fun place
review: Great work life balanceCompetitive benefitsGood compensationStock options Good senior leadershipGood bonuses and incentives Very collaborative culture

title: Productive work environment with understanding staff
review: I work there part time 21 hours a week and I get paid hourly every other week for 42 hours. I get paid $14 an hour which is pretty fair. I enjoy getting days off because I am part time and need time to balance my work schedule.

title: Just a number
review: Management doesn’t seem to care if you’re a hard worker or not. You’re just a number to them. Benefits are decent but don’t count on HR to explain those benefits to you. You have to do your own research.

title: Wonderful people and amazing job
review: The walmart pharmacy in the Pittsburgh mills was like a second family. We all made sure we took care of eachothers so we gave the best to the customers.

title: Busy
review: It’s very fast paced and short staffed at times with high turnover. Pay is decent for what it is. Lots of job responsibility that can be overwhelming.

title: Awful management
review: You're just a number worst place I've ever worked if you value your mental health stay away from this company they have high expectations for what should be done and when your coworkers fail they will write you up as well.

title: Fair
review: It is a good job and there is room for growth. Staff gets raises and bonuses. It’s not hard work and the ability to move up does not require a degree.

title: Fun for sure, treated poorly
review: If you like to run around like a chicken all day, this is for you. Customers don't appreciate you, management doesn't appreciate you. I've heard the store manager talk poorly about employees behind their backs, and laugh about it to other members of management. Overall the only thing this job has going for it is the people you work with, which is relative to location. You are easily replaceable, and are made aware of it very quickly.

title: Fun work place
review: As a sales associate at Walmart, you have consistently demonstrated exceptional customer service skills and a deep commitment to your role. You have a strong work ethic, always showing up on time and working diligently to ensure the store runs smoothly. Your friendly demeanor and willingness to go above and beyond for customers has not gone unnoticed, as many customers have expressed their appreciation for your excellent service.In addition, you have proven to be a valuable team player, consistently working collaboratively with your coworkers to ensure a positive and productive work environment. Your positive attitude and strong communication skills have been instrumental in fostering a cohesive and supportive team dynamic.Overall, your hard work, dedication, and outstanding performance as a sales associate at Walmart have made a significant impact on the success of the store. You are a valuable asset to the company and I have no doubt that you will continue to excel in your role and make a positive impact on both the company and the customers you serve.

title: good job hehe
review: good job it was so good working there I love the culture and the people and just everything haha yeah fun times it was Gucci and fun and the pay was gud

title: Stressful, but coworkers are nice.
review: Overall dealing with customers is the worst part of this job, but seeing as you'll mainly be managing a register or self check out, that's to be expected. I found the team lead to be very helpful, supportive, and willing to listen. Additionally, all of my other coworkers were a joy to be around.

title: Stressful
review: The managers stayed locked in a room so it was hard to get change when it was needed. It wasn’t a hard process to learn however. It was enjoyable at times it just got so busy and there weren’t a lot of cashiers.

title: Simple and Laid Back
review: Sometimes the app can be glitchy and cause frustration and it can take awhile to get hold of support but It is much easier to navigate through the store than other personal shopper apps.

title: trash
review: they don't care about whether you have personal problems or if you have children they force 30 minute breaks and are unfair with their hours they prioritize certain employees and erotic relationships happening between the coworkers

title: Boring, but not usually terrible
review: Management changes fairly frequently. Some managers are bad, and some managers are decent. A good option for students in high school or college who need a few bucks and a few hours of work.

title: Pros and Cons
review: Pros- 1 hour lunch - easy job - friendly staff Cons- customers are rude- management have high expectations for what you're getting paid - must be able to manage high productivity while assisting customers

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?None we were poorly treated and never appreciate.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything was very stressful.

title: Work place is nice, but pay scale is broken beyond control for long term associates
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Management is good here, but pay is terrible for long term associates. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having the staff to handle the jobWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Depends on what area you work in.

title: Solid schedules
review: Good hours, easy work . Love the schedule . Good place to work at if your going to school. Mangement is good. Pays fair what the job that you are doing.

title: Fun work place
review: Just do your job and be kind to others and they will treat you the way you treat them. The pay is also good and they give you paid breaks as well. Amazing Job.

title: Nope
review: They only want to hire people with open availability and the assessment always fails u  they will change ur schedule and expect you to work it knowing you can’t

title: Productive
review: Overnight for Walmart is a great job. Great pay but managers aren’t great. They won’t listen and are very hard on you when you just start and expect the most form you on day one.

title: Customer surrounded work place always keeping busy
review: I didn’t have a problem working at Walmart the people were great but if you don’t like constantly running back and forth in several departments cuz people can’t do their job so you have to stop yours to do it then this is your place to work lol

title: Unrealistic Job but great associates
review: Everyday new priorities with no clear directions.District Manager is never around always on calls and only talk to you thru emails and zoom, you can see that he is always at home and acted surprise that all his stores are in bad shape.If top manager doesn't like you, start looking for a new job

title: It's okay
review: Pay was decent,management is toxic one minute they'll want you to work ot then literally tell you that they need everyone to stay on the clock past the time we are supposed to leave its an easy job but management makes it frustrating.

title: Fair pay
review: Fair pay. No work life balance. Flexible schedules usually means less hours. Often split days off. The corporate culture is living in the 1980’s. There are no systems in place to keep it fair and equitable for everyone.

title: Other you don't have a choice, RUN.
review: Don't work here unless you are absolutely desperate for a job.By working here, you are risking your mental health and your physical health. Full time will wear you out quickly. They don't care if the roads are dangerous, you'll still get a point for not showing up.Don't work for a corporation that doesn't care about you or your health.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?No good parts Walmart only cares about sales all the equipment is outdated and needs replacement What is the most stressful part about working at the company?No support from management you will be held accountable for the entire store with no help and very little payWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Awful the job isn’t worth it management is terrible What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful with no support and very little communication from management

title: It’s ok
review: Depends on manager and coworkers.  Some days are cool … some exhausting.  Pay is fair.  Customers get upset over things you have no control over.  It’s retail.

title: Horrible
review: Front end cashier managers are clicky and you could never get a day that you want off. They would schedule cashiers to be done at 11 PM then come back in at 8 AM.

title: Productive and fun
review: It was.  fun because you   count money and see crazy customers be crazy. Not much to do during   the   nights.  but days can be fairly busy.    The company wants you to sell things which is not worth the hassle.

title: eh
review: Working here is just like any other retail job, I feel like the walmart experience is universal but changes location to location as this is the 2nd walmart I have worked at now.

title: A typical day at work
review: Employees worked together to make sure apparel merchandise was in stock and available for the customers. Team leaders work hard to find task that fit your skill set. We had two 15 minute breaks and an hour lunch.

title: Easy work
review: The managements kinda reluctant way to say they'd fix the belt for truck unloads. Wasn't cool and most of the pallet jaxs sucked, but it's easy work. The pay is decent, and if your below  4.5 occurrence points at the end of the fiscal year you are eligible for a 2% raise.

title: Productive but repetitive
review: It’s great as long as you keep your self busy. Managers are unpredictable but they do have some good people who are willing to help out. Benefits are ok

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I guess the paid time off not much elseWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything, just so stressful if you show that you'll do anything and everything they'll use it and take it to the extreme What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Where I work at in the store, which is apparel,  its kind of hostileWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Super stressful I'm given so much to do and every one else gets one thing

title: Wow amazing
review: I get to walk in big aisles and help people, easy going environment and fun team .Stock processing is easy so I don’t get stressed and can study when I get home after the shift .

title: Easy job good pay
review: Job is pretty easy, with very good pay for the position. Managment can be a big problem depending on your store, and your fellow co-workers may be prone to gossip or being lazy.

title: Fun and productive
review: Very nice workplace. Managers could have better attitudes and problem solves. Coworkers are cool & mind they business as they should overall 8/10 pay could also be higher.

title: It’s alright
review: In my opinion it’s a good first job, but don’t stay for too long. You can advance but it’s definitely difficult. Background checks are often harsh and constant drug testing!

title: The pay and benefits are great. The management is poor.
review: Walmart as a whole is an awesome company to work for if you’re looking for money. The management however, does not value you and treats people horribly. Good people are taken advantage of and are easily thrown away if they don’t do as the boss asked even if it is against policy. If you can find a store with good management it’s great.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Overnight stocking was the best partWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Standing in my feet all night.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Good and friendly work experienceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy schedule all night  .

title: Unprofessional management
review: They cut your hours whenever they want. Unrespectful and unprofessional management, always short on personal to work, they  don't care about their employees, they are treated as a machines.

title: Productive
review: Worked graveyard was a good place to work until things started changing but overall was a fun place to work and learned about helping out customers and the retail aspect

title: Good customers/Ok management
review: Worked here for 2 years. Loved most of the customers and staff but felt management definitely had their favorites. Workload was a bit unbalanced amongst staff.

title: Productive and fun place to work
review: I personally didn’t have a problem working at Walmart as a personal Shopper. I went to work & came home and didn’t get involved in the negativity. My position was very fast paced therefore the work day went by quickly. I would definitely work there again.

title: Great store
review: Management is great and the store is very well kept up and they help train you in n many areas to be able to help in multiple areas of the store at all times

title: Great Place to Advance Your Career
review: Really enjoyed my time there. Management was great and I loved working with my team. I was given a Loy of great opportunities to grow as a Human Resources professional.

title: Productive floor area.
review: I value home time with my family and it’s hard to make money and be home on the weekends in Mississippi you need to live east of Birmingham in order to make good money and be home every weekend. The problem is like 80% of loads head to the east coast and nothing comes back they either go north to NY/PA etc. or to Florida where absolutely nothing comes out of. They will send u somewhere then have to get a brokered load paying extremely low.

title: Busy, but a good place to earn money and possibly make friends
review: The management is not very good, but if there are problems, there's always a way to get them fixed. Walmart is always busy, so moving around a lot is a must.

title: Cool place
review: Loveee working here people are super nice and sweet you should do it and make a lot of money as well. Sign up you won’t regret it at all! Great benefits as well

title: Depends  on where
review: Depending upon what store you're at, it's mainly the people that keep you there. I'm still friends with people I worked there with. That's not a common thing.

title: Terrible
review: You're constantly reminded how replaceable you are, managers are unbearable, and property has seen more crime recently. The attitude of "The customer is always right" even if they are so, so wrong.

title: El mejor lugar para empezar tu carrera
review: Respectan tu horario, tienen buenos beneficios, el sueldo es competitivo

title: Terrible Workplace
review: Upper management alike are liars and backstabbers. You’ll have a target on your back if you show any type of common sense and leadership. Your words don’t mean anything to upper management and you only get a promotion if you’re buddy buddy. Not worth the headache at this particular store. And this is keeping it short & sweet.

title: Decent pay, not worth the ache
review: Decent pay if you choose the right shift. Not worth the long hours and how the job quickly deteriorates your body and mind. Everybody there looks and acts like they hate you.

title: Hard Work
review: It was straight, the people are mean tho, though management is pretty understandable. The job is definitely not for the weak and you are always on your feet at least 8 hours a time

title: They’re terrific I would definitely return if I could
review: They’re an extremely great company, pay well, great customer service, great coworkers overall a great work experience , the only thing is whenever you try to get hired or rehired it’s horrifying and a great hassle to reach management

title: Long hours
review: the hours are crazy , i worked 2-11 and my part of the store closed at 10. So I was made to go around and do other peoples work who didn’t do it before they left that day

title: Work environment
review: Wants you to be in multiple places at one time while assisting customers. Long hours with no breaks until your shift is about to end. Will ask to do multiple projects at once. Does not care about your well being

title: Decent place to work
review: Good benefits, clear schedule, and easy advancement. I worked my way up to salary in about a year. Unfortunately with covid and other internal reasons I lost my drive and chose to leave. But great place to work your way up.

title: Good ppl taken advantage of
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They are connected to the Even app, which gives you access to your money when needed without fees or interest What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Very little to no training,IN THE PHARMACY What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not team oriented....much like high school with groups here n there of different type of pplWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Same day over n over n over n over,very mondaine

title: Horrible place to work force specially remote
review: 0 work life balance, they don’t care if you get sick even if you have a signed paperwork from your doctor. Walmart is a horrible company to work for would not recommend,

title: Dreadful
review: I hated coming to work everyday, dreaded it. Management was bad. They don't care about you or your life. Some of my coworkers were basically harassed/bullied by management. They will even lie to your face. Some coworkers will drive you insane, some will be the only reason why you show up still.

title: Not a fun workplace. Management delegates all their responsibilities onto the people under them instead of doing it themselves
review: Management is awful about treating their employees with respect. They delegate their tasks that they are told to do onto someone else and when it don't get done they get onto the person they delegated to instead of the manager they asked to do the task.

title: Unfair treatment of quality staff and favored treatment for all toxic staff members
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It's one of the worst ever to work for. They don't care about people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Bad management that do very bad things to staff and see them get promoted What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic, is the work environment.  The culture is some do all the work while others who are favored do bare minimum and get credit What is a typical day like for you at the company?Dealing with customers who need help, management backstabbing each other and watching the click move together

title: Toxic Environment, Incompetent and Under-Educated Management
review: Do you want to be gaslit and manipulated every step of the way? Do you want to watch under performers be rewarded and hard work be exploited? Walmart is for you.

title: A Great Place to start.
review: Is a great place to start for people looking for a first job. In my opinion there really isn't to much opportunity for career growth but its great for anyones first job.

title: They are understaffed and work their employees without consideration for need time off
review: Walmart is unable to keep good employees due to bad management. The Home office needs to start looking at why they can't keep a full staff. It's not the employees it's the management. They expect one person to run the whole dept without consideration for needing time off or vacation time. It is denied most of the time.

title: Hot and Sweaty
review: Really sweat but did good - ok place. Seemed to care about you some what. Good first starting job for anyone looking for some type of work. Good stuff for real.

title: Average
review: Stocked shelves to get through college, wasn't a great job but I got what I needed out of it. Did my job, listened to podcasts, left, got a check. Wouldn't choose it as a career tho

title: Productive and fun place were you get the opportunity to help customers find what they are looking for.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Management is willing to work with your schedule and needs you simply ask and if your on a good crew shifts are ezer when departments have you learn the store during training it helps finding things better during high demand times What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Holiday Rush and having a backed up ware house full of pallets that need to go out for the next set by a certain time What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast paced and long shifts make for a productive work week with the rest of the team on board it is possible for your leaders to keep up depending on store size Wich makes for a smooth operation What is a typical day like for you at the company?Usually it involves checking for stock and over stock breaking down boxes and pallets of goods organizing what goes were and taking into account items that sell fast to be checked semi often, some products are not sold as frequently and there for don't get changed as often unless they are on sale

title: Productive
review: Not a bad plave to wrk for overall good,  wrk is layed back. Stocking the shelf is not a hard job to do. Listen to what ur told to do and u hava it Made

title: It can be a fun place to work
review: I really loved meeting the customers and helping them.  Sometimes work could be challenging.  Most managers showed you no respect.  But for the most part meeting customers was a joy.

title: Good money opportunity but that’s it
review: Easy way to get good money but team often complains about team leaders, complaints also came from people that work on a different shift as well. Team leads could be more understanding, this frustration often stemmed from the team leads simply not being nice to the team and not listening to their team. Often found that when frustrated, team leads disregarded suggestions made by the team or made decisions solely based one their frustrations. When working as an overnight associate, I’ve seen these team leads make decisions based on personal reasoning and even heard one team lead tell an associate to ignore another for reasons that had nothing to do with the job. One team lead on multiple occasions has stood outside of the bathroom door and times bathrooms break which completely violates the associate’s privacy.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Customers are nice and appreciate help. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Seems Managers and Staff are not properly trained and never enough staff. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?A lot of drama with co workers and childish Gossip - favortism. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Checking out customers, assisting in stocking and helping customer with carry outs etc...

title: Just overall, it felt like working in a highschool bathroom.
review: The people there do not care, they're childish and rude. There are constant interpersonal/work relationships and it was constant drama. People dating, then cheating with others in the same department, it genuinely felt as though I was working with actual children. There was very little in terms of genuinely happy, work oriented people.

title: Very productive love working with co workers and being around customers daily.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with not only my co workers but able to work with customers and helping them and keeping safe and clean area.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When co workers not working as a team to get work done or if co workers come in late which cause things not to run as smoothly.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very safe clean environment easy to work with co workers and happy to work around customers on daily basis.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very easy going day working with my co workers and also working around customers everyday.

title: Easy to work here management makes it difficult
review: Typical warehouse work is to be expected.management has troubles communicating to each other never on the same page and never know what to really do. Management definitely has favorites who don’t do any work like every warehouse.

title: Dragging management
review: Managers think you’re a robot. Very poor management POOR PAY, tiring you do all the work cashier, security , managers will sometimes ask you to clean, scrub floors, do the painting when someone from higher up are visiting.

title: Fun and productive
review: I feel like we are the most important department. We work harder then most departments in Walmart. Our department responsibility is to unload all the trucks of General merchandise and keep merchandise flowing to the sales floor.  Even when understaffed we are expected to get the same amount of work done as far as unloading  trucks and stocking the freight. Cap 2 do a lot of work sorting merchandise by department.and food by numbers while keeping up with the line moving. Bending down lifting ect. and I'm just a hard worker. Walmart overall is a good place to work at  the work is fairly easy overall it's the attendance policy I hate. They give employees protected PTO and regular PTO and employees get terminated if they reach 5 or 6 points. You get a half of point when you are late and can't use Protected PTO and a full point if you miss a shift and do not have enough accumulated Protected PTO to cover 8 hours in for missed shift. They do not accept doctors excuses but they do bereavement for death.

title: Overwhelming
review: There are barely any associates. A majority of the associates are negative and make the work place not enjoyable. The work place tends to be a toxic place and I find myself dreading going into work.

title: Everyday was a good learning experience.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?continually meeting good people, busy all day long, and a very good experience. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?needing to be excused when really needed.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?everyone is willing to assist you when needed.What is a typical day like for you at the company?busy at all times which really made the day go by fast.

title: Decent enough work
review: The job was simple enough but the pay was very much lacking for the area and amount of theft that occurred in the store. Most managers were helpful with apprehensions but loss prevention was very separate from the rest of the company.

title: Don't work for them.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoyed working with old friends that have known for a long time.Working with people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The 5 point strike system.It is very unfair.Especially for working Mom's who have to pick up and take Your kids to school.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mixed some are nice and some were just stuck up and rude.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Dealing with rolling eyes .Rude and disgusting behavior from the management team.
position: Lawn and Garden Associate & remodeling Crew team member & stocker

title: Decent management
review: I really liked the management and they where really supported and always talked to you about how you where doing and made your schedule work for you.

title: Bad experience
review: Working here there is no respect for employees and although they say they have a flexible schedule, once they hire you it is extremely difficult to have them change your schedule even if it was approved during orientation and or interview. superiors lie to your face and give false hope of growth in company.

title: Draining
review: Long hours and rude customers. You get calls about the slightest problems. Not a lot of breaks in between calls. It was very tiring and the stats were hard to meet.

title: Flexible and decent pay
review: Decent and your typical job at Retail stocking shelves and helping customers. Working at Walmart shouldn't be a job you can expect so much but it's something to help you build experience for future opportunities. The benefits included dental and vision insurance. Very flexible job.

title: Long hours
review: Long hours because you get an hour lunch break. Every 2 hours you get a 15 minute break. You don't get any two days off in a row to recoup. Hours are flexed and not a fixed time everyday. Pay is ok. Pay is bi-weekly or twice a month. Not much room for home work balance due to flexibility of hours.

title: Relaxed
review: No one does anything and management doesn't care. As long as you're a good talker they will stand around and talk with you for hours. Or make you do stuff that makes no money sense

title: Just your average cashier Job
review: It was fine working there but I worked there a year and never got a raise. You will be tired especially during the holiday season. Your feet will be tired.

title: This place went down hill
review: I worked here for 6 yrs and when I left the job was not what it use to be old management use to care but new one does not and they want you to do everything with no additional recognition it a horrible place to work

title: Poor hours
review: My coworkers were pretty cool but my manager sucked. I felt over worked and underpaid. I was told to go home immediately after I put in my weeks, good thing I had another lined up

title: Easiest job in my life, but…
review: Work-life balance does not exist here. Your time off requests are denied a few days before the date, sometimes coaches go in and manually REVOKE time off requests that were approved! They can legally give you a 2 hour notice before they randomly put you on the schedule. Employee relations with the store manager is really non existent but you can go to them and talk to them if you can find them half the time.

title: Good job
review: Not a terrible place to work as a part time or first job. Management can be hard depending on the manager. Fellow employees were generally pretty nice.

title: No
review: No review it sucked employees had bad attitudes and the managers have there favorite and if your not the favorite then you get treated bad and disrespectful

title: Pretty good
review: pretty good environment but I wouldn't wanna stay there forever, you are allowed plenty of break time with an hour for lunch, the managers manage actual productivity and not stupid things like earbuds

title: I can't get away fast enough
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The coworkers make it worth itWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of caring about the workers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Different departments have a different vibe

title: Greedy company that underpay valuable people
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting beautiful customers every day!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being underpaid for 15yr! I wasn't even making $13/hr!!!!! What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Overwhelming and never appreciated What is a typical day like for you at the company?Miserable but customers made me feel better and helped me endure

title: I enjoyed the staff however health was not an issue to management
review: I worked for Walmart for about 3 years at multiple locations, and as far as the job itself it isn't difficult . If anything, it becomes very repetitive; however, when I fell ill with Covid I was terminated for missed days. I of course went through the system, but it goes to show how a lot of managers don't look into that information before termination.

title: Great Benefits
review: Work and team was great. management is typical in worrying about KPIs but that is expected in all retail pharmacys. Patients are relatively nice and understanding.

title: no place to move up
review: Ive been working at walmart for years now trying to weasel my way to a manager position(now called team leads) but its feasibly impossible unless u brown nose one of the already known management. Ive seen assossiates pull fifty plus our weeks when overtime"cannot be granted " and "W.A.S.H. has been through the roof" but i cant get an extra hour of OT when understaffed. I work two departments in my store on a regular basis and have even been suggested by a multitude of leads but the tight net crew of supervisors wont see your promotion through if you dont bend over backwards for them

title: Stressfully and unorganized
review: Very little communication. Good experience with a couple team leads and coach other wise management can just run you down. No real plan in place for each day just a wing it type thing.

title: El ambiente es Aburrido
review: Los empleados son muy lentos y no quieren trabajar

title: Horrible Management
review: I like being a cashier but the management team was horrible.  Had trouble getting change when needed and management picked favorites.  Rude to employees.

title: Mainly good place except for management at scottsburg
review: I was put into management positions without the title or pay not even a simple thank you for your help and hard work. But I enjoyed most of my time working there regardless.

title: Flexible hours
review: Employee discount and flexible hours.Enjoyed my work experience at this employer.Had two babies at the time and I got a discount on their needs. Definitely worth it.

title: Set schedule and great breaks
review: It nice that you can have a set schedule if its easier for you. If you work a full 8 hour shift, you get an hour lunch and two 15 minute breaks. The management isn't the best. Sometimes they aren't all on the same page which can make things a little rocky.

title: Terrible management
review: Store needs new management and I don't know how to get them back in time and get a good deal for the next week and then I can work on getting the kids dressed up for a

title: Stocker
review: I try so much to get a job here to be a stocker I been wanted to work here for a long time. I always try to get a job here, but nobody called me back or anything. Yes everyone at Walmart is very nice and very sweet

title: the customer is always right
review: even if they're not, they are.  that is the walmart way.  jokes aside, worked with some great people at walmart, but as per usual management is questionable

title: eh
review: its either a really fun or a really bad work environment, it honestly just depends on tour crew. good benefits .make sure to make friends with coworkers you will need it

title: I made a lot of money
review: I enjoyed yes working there. I met wonderful and fun employees. The only issue is sometimes their not understanding when it’s concerning missing work for health issues. It can be hard to get time off approved.

title: The culture is so negative
review: I started on fire ready to advance and work hard. The negativity and refusal of new team lead to do what we need to keep us going just deflated the ambition I had and it’s upsetting.

title: far from civilization
review: its walmart to similar to every other store, not much in the area so its far from civilization. perfect if you live close by or in the area. decent people

title: Fun
review: I enjoy working here. It's a great physical job, learned a lot. Able to take on store projects to advance my skill set. I like the co workers as well.

title: Decent job with lots of different positions available to choose from
review: Flexible schedule, friendly co-workers willing to show you the ropes.  Able to interact with customers in addition to your regular stocking duties.  According to training vids, many management/upper management positions are filled by former hourly employees.

title: great flexibility
review: work with you on your schedule, was easy to balance both school and work at the same time. Also had great managers, who made it a safe and laid back environment

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Flexibility in schedule/workload and room for independent work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Inspection of shelf stocking work by night supervisor.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Casual and down-to-earth, but practical and fast-paced.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in within 10 minutes of shift start. Help with truck receiving for around 2 hours, or receive a department assignment from Team Lead. Move pallets to the sales floor, find a cart, and spend most of the day stocking shelves in an assigned department and answering any customer questions. 1 hour lunch and 2 15-minute breaks, but lunch and break times are flexible. Listening on wireless earbuds is common.

title: Poor management
review: Stay away from this company unless you want to lose your health and happiness.  Treat employees poor. Your just another body to them unless you work hard. Then they use you for everything you have

title: low pay and no good management
review: The pay was extremely low even though I had cashier experience. Lots of immature kids and adults working there. I was a cashier and they asked me to go get carts from the parking lot which I found ridiculous because I did not apply for that position. Overall just a bad experience.

title: Fury
review: Best job I've ever had.. Some people make your job hard, but some make it worth while. Remember, AP is always watching.It's a great job, you gotta put in the work.

title: Awesome
review: Awesome when i was there in 2009. Not sure now. Decent pay. Things have changed so I wouldn’t apply there now. Work hours were great back then. Management was ok.

title: Good entry level start
review: Starting my career at Walmart was a great opportunity to start as my first job. It offers the chance to develop interpersonal skills and see how a business operates.

title: Do not recommend
review: The culture in this company is terrible. It serves if you’re just desperate for a job, but it’s best as a place holder while you find something else. They don’t care about their employees at all, and never will.

title: Not many opportunities for growth
review: Worked here for six years made it to set manager, they then restructured the management team. Lost my position to someone who couldn’t handle the job. Most people just stay at dept manager and don’t move up so others have opportunities.

title: Productive,fun place to work, meet good people
review: You can advance they give you 8min over your start time before your late. They offer to pay for schooling. Good pay,good benefits,room for advancement

title: Building relationships with customers and peers.
review: Work as a cashier and checkout customer groceries.  Assist seniors with their grocery check out.  Assist customers with products they requested.  It was a fun place to work however, working as hard as I did, I was not paid enough.  I took this job because of Covid-19.  Management did not support their employees.  Most times they embarrassed employees in front of customers.  The most enjoyable part of the job was leaving for the evening.

title: management disgusting, favoritism, sickos running the place, overworked for MINIMUM WAGE, and DO NOT RECOMMEND WORKING HERE
review: Everyone was overworked especially cashiers having to deal with karens with 2 registers open, long lines and everyone didnt care, management is really bad, they had favoritism everywhere and only promoted those they had connections with. Not worth it. Do NOT WORK HERE. DONT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE. It is negative and too much drama within coworkers.

title: Good
review: Hard work for good pay. Some days were tougher than others & sometimes you were shorted hours for lack of work during slow seasons, but there was good overtime during winter.

title: They are awful
review: This job sucks they promise you everything to keep you and mistreat and don't listen to concerns it's all just awful I would not recommend working here unless you have other options

title: Ehhh
review: Work is rough. Mandatory overtime more times than I can count. They don't take doctors note. Call in sick then it will be a right up. They do pay well though

title: Big company can't prioritize
review: I worked at several different stores (supercenters and markets) the managers who came up through the trenches were usually the best to work for. The upper management beyond the store was waaaaaay out of touch. Had a big wig complain that my best was dusty as he stood there in his expensive designer suit and tie. Finally had enough when I was threatened by an associate known to pack a gun and nothing was done by management. This after a man was shot in the parking lot not too long before. The pay scales are always five years behind inflation and when they do adjust, those that have put in years are not fairly bumped up the scale.

title: Fun workplace
review: Fun place to work first job, if you  are looking for an entry level job that has alright management then i recommend working at walmart once you work there foir too long youll get tired of the managers

title: Great inclusive Company with growth potential
review: I worked for Walmart for over 11 years.  It was fast paced especially last few years during pandemic.   As a manager,  there was pressure to succeed but upper management were there to help with any obstacles along the way.  I was proud of all the accomplishments during my time with Walmart.

title: overall horrible work environment
review: job security and advancement opportunities are plentiful only because they won't fire the absolute worst employees and will push you to move up constantly. no respect for the position you were actually hired to do and never actually requiring people to get their own job done as they will just reassign it to someone. they will make you do the work of 4+ people and never give you a break. they allow the worst people to slack off and push the best people to their breaking point and then deny their leave requests. i could go on

title: Its Aight
review: For years, I've wondered why Walmart was such an awesome place to work at. But now, I realize it's more than a workplace, it's my home. I want other to know

title: okay
review: as an electronics associate it was quite fun. but they kept taking us from this department to do other stuff like loading and such since they're always short staff when it comes to trucks. only downside.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people were friendly and niceWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Strict and they won't warn you if you have attendence issue or mix up

title: fun great workplace
review: you’ll be good as long as you doing your work management is pretty good and they try to care for employees, as long as your a good worker everything will go great

title: Decent
review: Decent work. The manager in your area is what really makes or breaks the work environment in whatever area you work in. Some times you will be asked to do more than your fair share. Benefits are desirable and decent cost.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It’s a job while you find a better company to work for.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?To many managers from other departments trying to tell you how to do your job when they have never done it themselves What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very cliquey or group oriented and if you don’t fit into one of them co workers are rude. They do have a good diversity of employees .What is a typical day like for you at the company?2 or 3 different managers telling you something different to do and several of them trying to talk to you like your stupid or a child.

title: purposely shortstaffed
review: Refuse to hire for positions people are trying to transfer out of won't allow in house transfers. Blatant favoritism and overworked won't hold certain people accountable.

title: Productive
review: Very nice place to work, pay is competitive, and enjoying with staff. They are flexible with my school schedule and offer discounts and benefits while working full time.

title: walmart
review: it was okay could be better at walmart management isnt the greatest and sometime have to do all the work by yourself without and help , they play favorites

title: Boring
review: Horrible job..I hate it .... management sucks..the only time I enjoy this job is on break.. no friends ppl are clicked up..they expect you to work like robots

title: Good Pay
review: The pay was good but the amount of work is excessive. Nice supervisors but at times too lenient in letting bad employees goof off and not do equal amount of work as co workers.

title: Meh
review: Walmart is just not for me everyone has there pov/ opinion of the store but for me the team leads (not all) is terrible they have no respect and they absolutely do not care about anything unless it concerns them

title: Very good company to work for!
review: Seems to me that decisions made for employees are made by people who have been there. Brilliant move! Employees feel cared for, are happy. Brings out the best in us when we are at work.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Equipment and pay and benefits What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Normal traffic and trucking, but company is very safety oriented with accountability,which I think is actually a plusWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Will probably be slip seating for awhile but is something you will have to do. The Walmart culture is good but if you don't like doing things by the book, no need to apply.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Multiple deliveries and pickups most days

title: Fun workplace but horrible managers
review: Managers are very disrespectful and lazy. Put their problems on you, and constantly move you to positions where you have zero training and they won’t help you at all.

title: Unload trucks
review: easy job have to work all holidays. Pay is good hours are slim they offer vto alot. some favs are picked to do certain jobs. Easy work, 10s or 12 hour shifts short breaks two 25 mintue breaks

title: A decent work place if you need a job.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The team leads were super nice and helped me get the hours I wanted most of the time!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Sometimes we were understaffed and didn’t get breaks as scheduledWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?For me it was always fast paced and positive! But I also ignore all the negative

title: Management sucks, coworkers make it better.
review: I liked my time at Walmart for the MOST PART. I told management time and time that some people were taking 2-3 hour lunch breaks when it’s only supposed to be an hour. Now, I don’t care what someone does if it doesn’t affect me but I would be left to run an entire self checkout by myself for sometimes 4+ hours at peak busy times. When policy seems to be 2 people always stationed at all times.
