I’ve even had conversations where people have begged to get out of doing something and I was made to do it even though I was not asked to begin with.  That’s not management that’s a joke. This particular store has a problem with people leaving and they wonder why. It’s obvious because the work environment is just totally friend based instead of professionalism.

title: Great first Job
review: Working for Walmart gave me the fundamentals to get a great grasp of customer service. The job was fun and they  were really understanding of my school schedule.

title: Productive
review: Good job great pay good coworkers I have no real complaints I love working there and I hope to retire from here. Lots of help to complete the job and managers are friendly

title: I appreciated the time i spent at wal mart and all I learned that made me a better leader.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?technology and innovation is best in classWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?attracting talent and retainingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?people centered and the investment in training.What is a typical day like for you at the company?busy with many task to accomplish and not enough time in the day.

title: Negative work environment
review: Negative work environment. Store manager plays favoritism and had many complaints by multiple employees that was continously overlooked by upper management.

title: Changing too much
review: Highest turn over rate ever, some managers are great. Others just micromanage the good ones. They keep hiring under 18 to work the registers and wonder why the customers have such a bad customer experience.

title: Nothing
review: Company does not care about you at all.  You are only a number. The workload is much more than what you can achieve. Upper management is totally disrespectful.

title: Working for Walmart
review: Walmart is a terrible company to work for. You can not advance unless you kiss the upper management’s butts to get there. And once you do, if you don’t kiss it even harder, they will find a way to get rid of you for no reason. Especially if you have any common sense.

title: Easy work poor management
review: I got written up once for talking to my fellow cashier friend when we had no customers. It wasn’t anything inappropriate we where talking about. Just a casual what are plans where on our days off and we got in trouble multiple times.

title: Fun co workers to be around management is awful
review: I was coached recently for not picking in the back room knowing we aren’t supposed to do so .It’s an easy job fairly I make 16.80 overnight but after these 6 months management has been strict on FTPR because all they care about is they’re bonus they don’t care about your mental health so I decided to leave.

title: Overworked
review: I hated working for Walmart so much. I dreaded coming into work even though I was only part time. Was constantly pulled to others places and my own section looked terrible. The managers also had very poor communication. I would never wish this job on anyone. Not to mention customers were extremely rude all the time.

title: Certain amazing workers but poor management
review: Love working with most workers, and some managers are really productive/helpful but there are a few who micro manage and would rather put drama first before the work.. and I’ve seen ALOT of people who got on a bad side of a manager and the manager will try there hardest to get you fired. Not to mention I haven’t had a raise sense 2020

title: Terrible
review: Terrible conditions and treatment. Management will insist on quantity over quality all night but then blame you for doing just that when the day shift gets upset about it.

title: Good and Bad
review: Staffing was fair compared to most retail pharmacies. The evaluations were unfair. Didn’t matter how much work you did it was all about store performance. So if the manager didn’t care then even if you work very hard. You get no reward for it.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Knowing that they don't hire management for experience or intelligence.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Sitting there and having to listen to management tell lies on associates just to suit their so-called write up What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It doesn't matter if you're good or bad at your job. If management doesn't like you you won't get ahead.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Come in and listen to Management's BS do my job and can't wait to go home

title: Slow and boring
review: Had to stock at least 2 carts minimum and if others didnt finish i stocked theres       . The break were good i guess but the customers werent. They grab stuff off the carts whileim still stocking.

title: Not worth it
review: Sure you get a decent amount of pay but the mental strain you'll experience is tremendous. I wouldn't say I like management, they can't ever agree on what needs to be done.

title: It was decent in paying my bills
review: I worked there for about 5 years. I got hired into produce department after theinterview for whatever reason. Good part was stocking floor. Bad part was being inside cooler trying to downstack pallets. It was cold in there for sure.

title: Wouldn't recommend
review: Store manager at the time wasn't the best, job wasn't hard but no one else besides my department knew how to do it. I would say management was the worst part of this position coupled with never having enough staff to run a department with so many orders.

title: High stress and overworked
review: Management will degrade you and gossip about you to your face and behind your back. You will be overworked. The turnover rate is crazy so your often under staffed.

title: At Walmart, we help people save money so they can live better.
review: Smile, greet, and thank customers with a positive attitudeStand for long periods of time while checking out customers quickly and accuratelyKeep your area clean and presentableAnswer customer questions and help them with their needsBe available to assist associates across the store as needed

title: Easy flexible work but management is horrible
review: Became familiar with products to answer questions and make suggestions. Planned order execution to simultaneously deliver items ordered together. Kept food preparation area, equipment, and utensils clean and sanitary. Worked in fast-paced environment with sense of urgency to serve guests quickly.

title: Decent place to work.
review: Decent place to work. People are pretty good to work with, management could be better. Decent health insurance. I take my job seriously and do the best I can.

title: Fun but low pay
review: Working as an asset Protection Investigator for Walmart is fun and you get to meet alot of good people. There is a high risk of being hurt and for what they pay its not worth the risk.

title: Fun to work at, didnt pay enough
review: I worked at Walmart years ago in the Toy Department as a Floor Associate. I loved my job, but they said if I learned other departments, how to mix paint in hardware, making keys in sporting goods, etc they would give me a raise. Learned everything they asked, and they gave me a dime raise. Some parts I did love, but our management at our store were clueless.

title: A fine place for shopping for food and goods but a terrible place for employment with a hostile work environment.
review: I advise anyone looking for a career at Walmart to look elsewhere than the one at Timberlake Rd. I worked here for a little over a month and while the actual work was simple and straightforward, several members of management were disrespectful and very hostile toward new associates.You are informed of very little actual information with the expectation that you'll just figure out most things on your own and when you make a mistake or fail to follow a guideline you'll be harshly chastised for not following rules that you were not even aware of.I was heavily criticized a number of times for breaking rules that I had no knowledge of because no one on the management team cared to inform me that I was doing anything wrong, then I would be blamed even though they knew good and well that I was never told the information.The fact that I was a new associate with zero experience working at a Walmart or a grocery store in general rarely ever seemed to matter to them, I was expected to work at the same pace as the more experienced workers often with hardly any instruction. I definitely was not given the supervision that I felt a new worker should receive instead I was just thrown in and expected to learn on my own then yelled at for not working fast enough.The whole environment was extremely dysfunctional with the people in charge doing a poor job of enforcing their own rules, and disrespectfully scolding the temporary associates for doing something but not saying a word when one of the full time employees did the exact same thing. I was also often given conflicting information - more...

title: Walmart
review: It can be busy sometimes but it is really easy. I really loved that job n it’s so easy to be a Walmart socket. Guys I’m telling you it is very easy.Easy money

title: Great People, Management Needs Work
review: I worked there for about 6 months. I was content with the work--when there weren't tens of pallets stuffed down each aisle that I would have to climb through as if I was on an expedition through the jungle. You could bring issues to management and they would never tell you if they were working on a solution or if they brought it up in a meeting with the higher ups. It really made you feel that they weren't listening to you because of their lack of communication. The stress started to take a toll on me physically (heart would like it was tightening up) so I quit.

title: Unfair policies and practices
review: I got sick and had to call out 3 days i went to the doctor and got a note but was told they do not accept doctors notes and therefore have received too many points to keep my employment with walmart.

title: Micromanagement at all stores
review: The managers would watch the cameras like a hawk just to make sure the workers were "working" but if you were a favorite you could get away with anything. They would also never join the workers on the floor and help get stuff done but would always complain about it not getting done fast enough

title: Not fun
review: Low pay, bad working conditions. Not being flexible with shifts, poor supervision, nobody showing up for their shifts. It is really not a fun place to work

title: Needs more people who are people friendly
review: I would love working there but they don’t have the people skills it takes to have a strong team. At the Walmarts I have worked for it everyone for themselves. But if they would have better ways to communicate with everyone, without the chance of getting fired for speaking out then it would be a better workplace.

title: Pasco Walmart
review: I love working at Walmart there's not one place and try the cities where I can work where I like every single person in the store I love Walmart Pasco

title: Very hectic, don’t care about customer or associates
review: This company stopped caring about the customer and associates. They don’t even pretend to while they have taken all the associates out of the areas to do other task and never be ready for the customer who will wait long periods for someone to come wait on them. Terrible toxic work environment. Do not fall for it, save yourself the headache.

title: Yeah not what I hoped
review: Wasn’t that bad started off. The associates in department were cool and I still stand by that for the most part. But management and HR sucks. There’s dumb rules, favoritism, you can hardly ever get a weekend off. You might get scheduled WITHIN 24 hours of a shift without consent and without courtesy message. Everyone complains about how it sucks. A lot of gossip and they just are terrible at scheduling. Good luck

title: Poor mgmt. Laziness of staff. Huge turnover of staff
review: People lie to get others fired. Mgmt only cares about a body in position. Crybabies get babied. I loved coming in with silly hats and headbands, the guests seemed to like it. However when fellow staff members mock, make fun of and throw your items away because they don't like it, that's when it goes too far.

title: Don't expect raises or for management to care
review: They refused to give me a raise for over 3 years of working. They had transferred my position to a job I didn't want and refused to give me anything else.

title: Productive and very fun place to work
review: I loved working at Walmart! They really treat their employees like family!Always willing to make any situation better so that you are able to be better at work!

title: Can be a fun place to work.
review: Walmart is a great job for you when your young. However some people make a career out of it but 9 times out of ten they are not genuinely happy work for the company. Walmart have good program to assist there employees.

title: It’s just work
review: There’s lots of favoritism at work, don’t expect anything from the company overall, they took off bonus, no overtime is allowed, every time you submit a new schedule they take long to do it in the system. 5 points policy and your out of you call out or show up late.

title: No real corporate system or HR for employees
review: Third party company that has no idea the day to day countless number of safety violations, discrimination, and countless other things; don’t recommend

title: Great starting point
review: Ok job to work for. Management is really terrible but you get to grow within the company very fast. It’s a very stressful job when management is terrible at their job so just always make sure you’re doing your work. Never let them make you do more than your job description

title: Retail
review: Typical retail job, no issues working there. You go to work help people and go home. Can be stressful at times due to low staffing and lots of customers.

title: its a great place to work depending on your department
review: I went to the interview and asked to apply for online order shopper, probably the best position aswell as overnight and merchandise. however i got cashier and that was the position that did the most work yet got payed the least. as a cashier i rarely got to use the register and most of the time i would be working in a different department yet still getting payed the cashier salary.

title: The company doesn’t fully respect its employees
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There’s little to nothing good about working for Walmart What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Short staffed departments meant often covering several different departments.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Corporate first and the money doesn’t funnel down to the workers on the sales floor

title: Big no
review: Way to repetitive and constantly working to get heavily carts into store while only having 1 other person helping the lot and management sucked and hr would do nothing

title: Not too bad
review: They pay 17 an hour and the job is pretty easy. Probably one of the easier jobs at Walmart, I got to listen to music and just ship for orders. Management kinda sucks though and they like to micromanage you cherry pick problems to make a big deal about no matter how hard you work.

title: Busy and fun workplace
review: Engaging atmosphere and good benefits. Schedule is not ideal and only 1 holiday per year. Overall it’s a good environment and career opportunity. There is a lot of growth opportunity within the company.

title: It has been a great learning experience.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The guaranteed hours and insta pay What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Cooperate not understanding what happens in the store on a personal level.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Relaxed but busy. It depends on the night.What is a typical day like for you at the company?It's long but rewarding when I see my check.

title: Flexible schedule
review: Overall this job position had flexible scheduling but very poor hourly pay base. The management wasnt very communicative or on top of things in my department. Poor communication in general.

title: Fun and work together
review: Decent pay, great communication and always able to move up if you work hard. Stressful at times but for the most part you have a voice or opinion. You have some great Mangers that work hard for the most part and then you have the ones that get away with everything.

title: Fontana not that great
review: The Walmart way is slowly dying they slowly are turning into just another trucking company. Getting paid by activities makes you work longer and you're at the mercy of the day and dispatch. A lot of down time which pays minimum wage. The management has a belief that we shouldn’t make a lot of money.

title: First few years was okay, but it went all down hill.
review: . Point system sucked...five points and ur gone. Got blammed for something I did not do and got a second level coaching for it even though the security footage clearly showed i did nothing wrong.

title: Good job
review: Nice team leads . The biggest problem is rude customers but other than that it's a pretty good job. You get two breaks a day and they work with you with your schedule

title: Great at first then very very bad
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There was some good employees not many but there was What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working with the not so good employees and managers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?At first it was great had two awesome managers then it went downhill really fast What is a typical day like for you at the company?Put out freight, waited on customers, did mods,

title: Decent overall
review: Good hours, good pay, great benefits, management could do better. Good job for high school age students but not a great long term fit.

title: It's not bad
review: A good job for a little, but not good for long term work.  Lots of turnover and management who all have different ideas depending on the shift you work.

title: Productivity
review: It was ok management was decent. The hours were flexible and understandable. The store wasn’t always fully stock which made it difficult but otherwise it was ok.

title: Stressful and not worth it
review: Been a people lead for over 2 years. Too many conflicting directions from different levels of management. Untrained team leads and coaches pushing associate’s problem onto you. Poor work life balance. Unappreciated but expected to appreciate everyone else. Unreasonable expectations and being blamed for every problem. No level of education, time management and organization can help you prepare for the mental strain this job will put you through.

title: Great place to work
review: typical day at work is performing sales and collections. Overseeing my employee and making sure that all policies and procedures are followed. Interaction with the public is extremely important. Having a relationship with each and everyone is one thing that I make sure of. The hardest part of my job is having to say no to some of my customers and the most enjoyable part of my job is knowing that I have helped someone with their financial needs. When I get a heartfelt thank you, that makes for my whole day.

title: Nice coworkers
review: Co workers are fun. Management has a horrible attitude. Understaffed and high turnover. No overtime. You HAVE to work at least one weekend day no matter what or they won’t hire you or they will just give you minimal hours. A lot of favoritism. It literally sucks the life out of you.. look around. No associates are smiling.

title: Stressful and frustrating
review: You may have your good days but there will always be something waiting to beat you to your knees. Management is NOT your friend and neither are your coworkers.

title: As long as everyone is  working together, the job gets done.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They allowed me to change my availability that works better for me & I really appreciate it. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working in the money center or customer service department on a very busy day and my co-workers call out.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment for me is ok. We're provided with what we need to get our jobs done. The team leads are very helpful. Everyone works together at my store.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?pay is fair for the work you doWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?too many stupid rules to followWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?some friends, lot of strangersWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?clock in, stay busy, stock shelves, help customers

title: Management
review: Management can be tough to deal with, but the coworkers you make can make a difference and make the job more enjoyable. Making friends here is easy and you meet all different kinds of people which is nice.

title: Relajado tercer turno buenos compañeros
review: Debe de dar oportunidades a las personas aunque no sepan el idioma ahí cosas se pueden hacer sin saber el idioma no necesariamente debe ser limpieza en muchas ocasiones sentí discriminación y aun sabiendo hacer otras cosas que las hacia bien no me lo daban por el idioma  recibí discriminación por algunos jefes y burlas por eso de los jefes de aquel entonces no se ahora pero volvería a trabajar ahí tenia excelentes compañeros que me ayudaron aun sin saber el idioma

title: Work
review: It was a job. Customers difficult at times and no overtime. The longer you work there the more responsibility you will be expected to hold without any pay increase. I enjoyed some of my coworkers but felt mentally exhausted by the end of my days.

title: Great pay, That's about it.
review: Walmart DC is a drama filled workplace, Yet somehow there is no communication between management at all. You will get written up if you're production isn't 100% and it's calculated the entire time you're on the clock, so if you have to use the restroom, don't. Breaks are basically non existent, 15 minute break, takes you 5 minutes one way to walk to the bathroom or outside, leaving you 5 minutes to sit down, eat etc. If you're looking for a great check with the loss of your physical/mental health this is the place for you! On a good note, the EH&S folks are amazing.

title: ok
review: fired for something out of my control after years being there, easy job, nagging manager makes working unbearable, gets old quick, replace you in a second

title: ambiente nada comodo
review: estresante supervisores demaciado prepotentes y cargas excesivas

title: What family?
review: Walmart claims you are part of a “family”. They are ridiculous. There is NO kind of feeling of belonging or even that they want you there. No matter how great you are at your job. It’s all about who you are friends with or who you know. They claim to be “flexible” on issues, and they absolutely are not. Don’t get sick, if you do they will fire you.

title: Stop the best postion if your a introvert
review: The managers dont really listen and its hard to find the personal managers sometimes. Working in the same department get tiring fast and i think its kinda difficult switching departments.

title: Management
review: Some managers will try to pull one over on you. With little to no regard for how it affects you. The process for advancement is simple but not very effective. The employees are nice and the job isn’t too difficult.

title: Hours and training
review: Cake decorating was one of my favorite jobs but when I got hired there was no training. I had to watch YouTube videos just to learn. Then they cut hours around holiday time

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great place to work, they actually take care of there workers.   Good pay What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lazy people who don't work, seems like that's all they hire anymore What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Clean and it was very open and diverse What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stock and go home the more work the quicker the night

title: It work out for me balance wise
review: Great place to work  it help and provides for me and my daughter I really enjoyed management could have been a lil better and different cultural. It was convenient

title: Waste of time
review: Prepared to be treated badly by supervisors and non temporary employees. If you have any intelligence, you may last 3 weeks at best before realizing the job is a complete waste of time. Zero respect, treated like a low life criminal, no guidance, training, communication. Favoritism abounds. The harder you work, the more work dumped on you to make up for the slackers- advice- JUST DONT

title: Mixed experience
review: Good job to have fresh or in highschool to bring in money or gain experience. Use it as a stepping stone but when the opportunity presents itself to move up and do better leave!

title: Good but hours and pay need to be better
review: I liked my job at Walmart for the most part, the managers and supervisors could were not too bad but the pay and hours could be better. Overall, I'd recommend working here.

title: High Turnover for a reason
review: The work you do is not too hard or difficult, and is simple to follow. You get good lunch and break time, and occasionally free lunches. However what makes this location have a high turnover is the lack of supervisor/manager support for associates. Often there was conflict between associates and management.  I personally did not have too much problems, however there was much needed improvement. Turnover was so bad that when I first joined the location, nearly everyone I knew, including managers, either quit or was fired. I do believe that beyond that its not a bad place to work at and the pay is decent for the work you do.

title: Great experience with a great company
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Great company to work friendly associates great work environmentWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?I haven't been stressed since I've been working hereWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great environment great company cultural

title: Walmart don't value your hard work or dedication
review: Walmart do not care about your hard work and waste time and money going to the academy ,is pointless and useless what we learn in the academy is not allowed to be implemented what you learn there!

title: Productive and good stable work environment
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The base pay is fair and human resources was very understanding about absenteeism as much as they could be. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Meeting deadlines and keeping customers content during rushes.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very casual and at times inappropriate-by this I mean that boundaries were often crossed.

title: Horrible place to work
review: If possible, I'd give 0 stars. The management is a joke at the certain store I worked at. That manager would be better running a circus than a WM. They are absolutely horrible.

title: Not to bad
review: Lots of people calling out so always pickiny up for others would sometimes as well have to go out to helps get carts oberall not to bad it's qlright pay low

title: Unrealistic expectations and boring
review: Stand around all day and check receipts and get verbally abused by customers. If you care about your mental health don't work as a customer host not fun.

title: Laid back
review: Nice supervisors but at times too lenient in letting bad employees goof off and not do equal amount of work as co workers. Also,  instead of disciplining employees who intentionally flout rules all employees lose perks or privileges like being allowed to use one ear bud to listen to music (leaving one ear clear to hear when mgmt calls you over PA or on the floor) while stocking overnight. They tend to lean on hard working employees to compensate the ones that they know work hard at not working. Having overnight stockers work in teams just masks the fact that 2 employees are doing 85% of a pallet while 1 wonders around pretending to work and talking on cell phone via bluetooth.

title: Life & Soul draining, miserable and an overall depressing situation with no concern for the. individual associate
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Developing team associates to be the best they can be. Supporting them so that they can replace management.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Work/Life balance is stressed upon hiring.  Work/Life balance does NOT EXIST!! We live and are forced to allow our entire souls to be sucked into this place.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible, Store Manager is a GREAT store manager, but an AWEFUL people manager!What is a typical day like for you at the company?If you are hourly (management), expect to work every weekend and extend your scheduled shift beyond the start/end time. You MUST get your assignments completed, as well as daily notes.Salaried managers are scheduled five 10 hour shifts (50 hours - 5 hour lunch). We are lucky if we get a 30 minute lunch. Never get out on time, usually 3-6 hours extra a day. Actual hours worked are between 60-100 a week (most of the hourlies make more an hour than salaried)!

title: It was fun
review: I had a blast working there for the two year stint that I did. Doing Personal Shopping and Stocking, as well as a few other activities was an experience I’ll never forget. I hope to have future experiences at my future employer/s.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They are ok to work for ,the pay is ok...they do take care of there employees What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They pay ok but it's hard to get moved up and takes timeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?They work together like family and they are a fairly good place to work forWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?U have things to do each and every day like any where's else..u just have to work at ur own pace cause some days can be hard

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people and opportunity for growth.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Deadlines are the most stressful part.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment is very laid back.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Go to work about 730. Leave about 5.

title: Work you to death
review: Work you to death, no appreciation for what you do for them and no help when you need them. They just want you to work work work work work they get angry if you take off, so don’t take off plan on work work work work work

title: Pleasant, easy work
review: The pay is fair for the work you do and the work is pleasant. The Co-workers are nice. Breaks are decent. You also get an annual bonus and 401k match.

title: Worst campany in History . They don’t care about associate situation they just see work
review: I tried to tell the manager by then not to schedule me for Sunday since i had to attend church but kept on scheduling for all weekends but couldn’t care about it 🥲

title: Poor work place
review: The management was not doing their jobs when they needed to. There was favorites being played and the ones doing their jobs are the ones that got fired while other sat around on phones and wasn’t told anything.

title: Decent pay
review: The overall environment was disorganized and the mangers were insufficient but it’s a good job if you like to keep busy and moving. You meet a lot of different people.

title: Great
review: It's real simple follow the rules and you can make a career not far from home while helping keep your community's walmart stocked. It's worth looking into working for walmart.

title: Not fun
review: Always get screwed of when other co-works call off stuffs always breaking and takes for ever to get fixed!!!!!!!!! Other than that nice place to work at

title: Ambiente de trabajo.
review: Ambiente de trabajo hostil, discriminatorio, y no hay oportunidades de desarrollo laboral.

title: Walmart in Cicero, New York don't respect their elderly employees.
review: The workers there either accept you or they don't. I didn't fit in with the workers in Cicero Walmart in New York. Walmart in Cicero, New York don't respect their elders. They talk to them like trash. The tone of their voice toward their elderly workers. Im sure most of their elderly are military people.

title: No training
review: I didn’t get adequate training. I even expressed this to management just for them to turn around and punish me for not knowing things I was never taught. Management doesn’t help out AT ALL but will nitpick everything you’re not doing while you’re busy doing something else another manager told you to do. There seems to be infighting within management that trickles down to everyone else. The lazy and unproductive employees get a free pass whereas the ones that try to work hard get punished.

title: Horrible
review: Horrible Hours, Management, and treatment. Would not recommend to my worst enemy. They would not value anyone aside from Managers and disrespect was evident.

title: Stressful Place to Work at
review: Company and management don’t care about the mental health of their employees. There is no room for growth and management isn’t fair with employees. Don’t recommend working here.

title: Walmart is fine. Management is a problem
review: Don’t know where to start. Walmart overall isn’t to bad. Some members of the management staff are extremely unprofessional. SOPs are not followed, safety is a huge concern. You have Managers talking trash about hourly employees to other hourly employees. Just to much drama. The culture needs a lot of work. Something I don’t want to be a part of

title: Fun workplace
review: Pretty chill work environment. Career advancements are available being that it is a huge company to work for. Great atmosphere for a warehouse. Decent pay

title: not a good place
review: managers do 0 work and expect the world, while also picking favorites to do nothing, definitely don’t work on nights, the overnight manager is creepy

title: Eh
review: Managers make the work absolutely terrible b/c they don’t really care what you have to say but other than that it’s good pay and hours for the most part.

title: Too much drama
review: Good pay and they make you work too long hours. Management is horrible as well hr I was able to manage many years here but it feels like being micromanaged

title: Productive and fun at times
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Work is always available every day all year long. Just ask if you don't have enough hours,you are allowed to get more hours .What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When you assigned an job and not allowed to do the job the that's easier for you to do it.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?No so well now because of pets allowed in the store peeing and having bowel movements on the floor and their owners not cleaning up the mess. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Sometimes good sometimes not so good.

title: low pay
review: They hire people who will make more than you even if you have been there for years.  So you train people to make more than you for the same exact job.

title: Self absorbed management
review: Active infighting among staff at the Sturbridge store management mainly interested in protecting their bonuses. Hasnt been a performance review for raises in 3 yrs improper training for associates, hindering their career advancement opportunities

title: Fun workplace but unorganized
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The job is fairly simple, very easy to do, and the people are nice.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?At times items are very hard to find and it takes a while to get certain orders done.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is very welcoming, everyone is very kind.

title: Decent pay good hours
review: I liked it stressful sometimes but overall it was ok the pay was decent  but sometimes the managers there stressed you out so much and nkt enough for the pay

title: fun workplace
review: everything is great here everyone is help ful and every thing will be more productive if other ppl would come on time and do their own work and mind on

title: Some management was great, some others quite the opposite
review: Some managers were just not fit for their job and shouldn’t have been in leadership roles. Yelling at your employees in front of the rest of the staff, WHILE the employees you’re yelling at are clocked out for their lunch break is not how you handle any situation.

title: Not a bad place to work
review: Good team environment not a bad place to start if you like working 3days a week. Management understanding majority of the time. Pay was ok for the most part but you will have to adhere to the attendance policy

title: Fun workplace
review: Great place to work at if you need extra money on the side. Great benefits and willing to work with you with your school schedule. I loved working here, it was very relax

title: Depressing overworked
review: I would say that Walmart was a company that said to give you 40 hours a week mandatory for scheduling if you have other events scheduled for that week you really have to work those in Walmart won't let you just get those days. Walmart's point system is very important to know about and know a backwards and forwards because if you get up to six points you are terminated or you have to wait 6 months to reapply or in a certain specialty cases you have to call ethics and plead with the ethics board of Walmart in order to get your job back which is crazy to me because Walmart does not even follow their own policy when it comes to terminations.

title: Es bueno si tienes un jefe buena onda
review: La verdad no es mal lugar para empezar, aunque se me hace algo injusto que el area de cajas y super ganen mas que otras areas que tienen una carga de trabajo mayor, como farmacia y linea blanca, ademas en todas las areas no falta el compañero flojo que hace lo que quiere y los jefes no le ponen un alto, sin duda mi experiencia ahi fue buena por el aprendizaje y la capacitación que se te da, pero fue pesada por que no hay una forma de trabajo en equipo, todos se hechan tierra a todos y tu terminas trabajando solo.

title: Fast paced
review: Great exercise and pay but not sustainable over years. Recommend getting in and start working towards a transfer to QA or QC. Coach positions are ideally the move if you're looking to move up in the ladder.

title: Alot of cardio
review: Hard work, be prepared to get walk alot of miles and nonstop work. Too much physical work for the pay. Definitely not recommended since the pay is so low

title: Fun
review: The first time you have a chance at the top is the second one you get a free pass and you can go on your way back and then go to your car to go back to your house

title: Corporate World
review: Workdays are always busy. There is never nothing to do. You work a random schedule and never get a full 40 hours. The pay is good and they do have good benefits.

title: Very bad, long hours or not enough hours and sometimes having to take your off days and work those as well.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The only good thing about working at Walmart is meeting new people and the pay.  Do not work there unless you can tolerate being verbally abused by the management or not being believed that you've had a family member pass away or a car accident. They don't care what happened in your life. They will fire you no matter what it is. They don't even accept doctors instructions or release papers. You're doomed from the start. 6 points on your record from work you also get fired.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management writing you up, no help from management for assisting customers when needed. Customers accusing cashier's.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Rotten! Having to carry around your own personal pepper spray and sun gun just to keep yourself safe.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Either being too busy or not busy enough, never getting your breaks on time if at all.

title: stressful but fun
review: obviously working at any walmart is going to be stressful at times, but the conway walmart is a whole other level of stress. despite that, I've really enjoyed working here.

title: Fun place
review: It was ok working here people were great but management was terrible they would much rather to make your job harder than to be helpful toward you.....

title: Team friendly productive work environment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The inclusion from management on down. A+ ratingWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not stressful but trying to over achieve the standard time set for filling customer orders.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Teamwork and friendly environment.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Moving freight throughout the warehouse.

title: Soul Crushing
review: Where do I begin? The word "understaffed," is thrown around a lot. Because everyone is tired of being driven into the ground. There are callouts every day and management expects you to get your area done. And help others that intentionally do nothing. I wouldn't work there if I was set on fire and that was the only way to extinguish it.

title: Retailer behind the times
review: Terrible environment. Nepotism everywhere and the pay band is awful. They claim to pay more employees more than they actually do and it's on an area by area basis.

title: Good People
review: Pretty good people, some iffy management. Good busy work when busy, but pretty boring when there are no orders. Left because I felt stuck and many people said that they were going to work for the company for a few months to a year but end up working for 20+ years.

title: A great starting experience
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Best part of my experience was the way everyone helped each other improve in there work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Incoherent working partners who lack in what needs improvement What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great makes u feel at home makes u want to come into work What is a typical day like for you at the company?Steady paced calm days due to great helping hands

title: not recommend
review: too much work too little pay with managers that don’t care. customers treat you horribly and you can get fired with very little warning. i wouldnt recommend working here

title: When’s there’s work
review: 4/10 or 3/10 scheduled large building many different departments when’s there’s work life is great when there’s no work your cleaning for days and months lighting sucks in the building

title: Long hours, little support, obnoxious managerial staff, and generally poor working conditions
review: I spent the worst years of my life working for these guys. Expectations of staying past shift to finish work only to cut hours later in the week so that they don't have to pay you overtime. The worst workers see promotion, the best workers are trapped in the menial labor positions until they are too burnt out and exhausted to continue working for the company. The pay and benefits are okay for retail, but still nowhere near living wage, and the company will often deliberately work you just under the number of hours that are necessary to get your benefits to activate in order to keep prices low.In general, avoid working for walmart at all costs. I've experienced working for three different stores in my area, and every single one is run in exactly the same lackluster fashion.

title: Decent pay and hours
review: Long hours to start. Typically 12 hour shifts. Can be exhausting at times. Once you've worked there a while the hours begin to be more spread out. If you are a front end cashier you are required to give greeters their breaks and step in to help cart pushers.

title: Wal-Mart the largest employer in America.
review: From the corporation's point of view the company is fine to work for. The problems seem more evident when the view is changed to a store level perspective. With drastically cut staff and a lack of resources and tools, completing tasks in a timely matter become a difficult challenge.

title: it was challenging
review: it took over 7 months for someone to even find my application and i had gone in and called multiple times with no response for a long time when i finally got to work i was only working part time and for a month before i got fired for the wrong reason and i used open door policy and no one ever got back to me would not recommend working there

title: Good if you have someone actually train you
review: Rally not steadily once you get trained proper and not just getting trained by other employees I mean a actual trainer.Most stores just have a stocker running everything

title: Horrible management, & “leads”
review: Easy job but the whole store is shady. Team leads has favorites and if youre not one of their pets they make it hard on you. No training, no leadership.

title: Bad
review: Walmart in Dekalb IL is very disrespectful to their employees. They do not let you use doctor note talk to you any kind of way and wouldn’t care at all.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Regular hours, moderate pay, good associates, and you're part of something bigger.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Bad weather, overbearing management, backbiting, and constant persistantly growing list of things to do that arent part of your classification.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?In as few words as possible, its complicated. My time with the company had me working with and training people who, mostly dont want to be there for anything but the paycheck, and while I do understandmoney makes the world go around but work doesnt end when you clock out at the end of your shift.What is a typical day like for you at the company?clock in and find manager, csm, or anybody in charge, let them know i have arrived. my job and title was cartpusher, so I would start my workday by collecting the garbage on the parking lot, while walking the lot grouping carts together. taking the refuse to the compacter, cleearing the compacter.  Then i would handle any carrry-ins/outs, move pallets and merchandise to designated departments. Once that was all caught up, I collect carts and rolling racks on the parking lot until I am released for a break, long enough to rest my heels, but not long enough to cool off. Going back to work pushing carts and things until the middle of the day and eat. Id clock back in and finish my shift push carts doing carryouts and occassionally cleaning the bathrooms, not something I am rated for. When its all said and done, this company isnt bad but some - more...

title: Decent
review: It got me through college. Management was not always the best, as they had their favorites. However, it paid better than some other places and it was not terrible.

title: If you like being micromanaged & have to defend every single thing you do, this is the place for you!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Becoming friends with some of your fellow associatesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management!  You can tell them about a problem & nothing gets fixed!  Water leaks-not fixed; broken handles on freezer doors-not fixed; problems in the bathrooms-not fixedWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not good. You are just a number that they really don’t care about. You are there to make them look better with numbers on paper!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Usually rather stressful! Nothing more to say-harassed by management for stupid stuff

title: Good place to work
review: Good pay and hours depend on area of work/ department you work in. Overall good place to work with good benefits for full time associates. Management is great!

title: Good but could be better
review: The work was easy most of the time, but there were times when the work of others prevented me from doing my tasks in the right time.The manager was almost never there.My colleagues and the staff in charge were always nice.There were many shift changes, and they changed my activities to an area that after resigning I discovered that they should offer higher pay.They had no problem with me speaking Spanish.

title: Money is all there worried about.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay is great if you work the midnight shift, but really high standards for putting stock away.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Time management, the supervisors make you sit in front of a computer and then throw you on the floor expecting you to know how to do the job. (Poor training methods)What is the work environment and culture like at the company?As long as you know how to do the job, and do it well, it’s pretty relaxed. But if your new be prepared for the stress of working retail.

title: Started out great but….
review: Started out great, but learned quickly I was just a number. New management came in and changed everything for the worse. I was there over ten years.

title: Decent work place
review: You stay busy throughout the day. management is pretty good all around. Great place to work while in college as they will help you and work around your schedule.

title: No Title
review: customers are terrible to workers, management isn't great, coworkers are mostly friendly and helpful.  it's a job to pay the bills but that's about it

title: It was okay.
review: It was okay. The training was subpar, things were a little disorganized, and it wasn't an ideal place to work at. I didn't stay there long, but if I had a choice to go back I wouldn't work there again.

title: Producted fun
review: Motivation dealing  with customer service good place to work keep you busy I like be busy keep motivated I like to make customers satisfied with my  happy custume skills is fun place to work you dealing with customer service retail front counter I truly have no complaints about working for Walmart It was a good experience working with customers service

title: Decent starting job
review: Great job while in college or highschool. Pay is great starting out, but don’t expect too much the people you see entering the store is always something

title: It’s a good start for a first job
review: Walmart was the first company I worked for back in 2020. I loved the hiring process because they asked important, but not intimidating questions and they gave me a chance as a 16 year old with a limited schedule. It’s a great work environment if you like or at least don’t mind people.  I love helping others and many people who shop and work at Walmart are just like me  so I felt very comfortable there. It can be daunting at times because you’re always going to have unfavorable customers and even unfavorable colleagues but i feels that as a first job, it is perfect for someone just starting out. You get that first hand experience of dealing with people that is unique to only Walmart. I only left because of management, and the uncaring attitude of all of the higher ups. I was penalized for missing work due to bereavement although I provided everything they asked and did as I was told. It was ridiculous as I could have used some proper guiding but it seemed that most of the superiors didn’t  want to be there, no one wanted to train, help, or do their actual job really. I felt like a bit of a nuisance at my location so if you’ve got crippling anxiety, then this probably isn’t the job for you. However, I do also believe that it depends on the specific Walmart you apply to. I worked at one in Tampa, Fl and It was great apart from everything I mentioned there. I have been to worse and better locations so I say that it’s a gamble. Either way, I recommend working here if you’re a minor or a young adult just trying to rattle in some change. I don’t recommend for someone seeking to make - more...

title: Productive and fun
review: Easy to request pto.Coworkers are the best but the customers can be rude because they feel entitled, and belittle you! "I buy so and so much for this coffee" type of people. Depends on type of store, some stores managers only care the quantity of drinks not quality.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting people and new friends What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I really didn't have stress hereWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Clean and work in ac every dayWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping cash out the customer

title: Cool place to work SOME good people to work with/around
review: Walmart is a good fun place to work.  Like alot of other places, it has some pros and cons.  Some people seem to be power hungry or more controlling towards staff when it comes to certain things like running freight or even small things like when to take lunch breaks, or how you talk to a person.  Overall at my store , its pretty positive for the most part  We do need improvement in a few areas and we are working on the things that need fixing.  I enjoy my job, my coworkers, my team leads, and my work I show not only myself but also others that may or may not work with or around me.  Im here for the long run I believe.

title: Management is their downfall
review: Anyone can be management, as long as you're willing to show up and delegate, that's all they care about. Literally, if you show up every day and do a terrible job they will bend over backwards for you. If you come in and try to overachieve they don't like you and will make things very difficult.

title: Mucho trabajo poco sueldo
review: Recargo de trabajo por poco sueldo Los team leader no te Dan buen trato

title: Okay
review: Upside was the paychecks. Customers can be a handful sometimes, They expect you to do the job of 2 people in a certain amount of time which is challenging since you zone and customers come right through the work you did, making it seemed like it wasn’t touch which management would give a hard time about sometimes

title: Not Bad but not amazing
review: All in all it's not a bad job or terrible pay for what I do as an OPD employee. The main problem is that your hours can be inconsistent and often get cut because other associates take to much overtime (e.g taking 30 minute shorter lunches, or staying late when not supposed to). Although it is not directly Walmart's fault that they are stealing time, it results in 8 hours shifts becoming 4 hour once. Additional many of the people who steal this time and cause the time cutes receive no repercussions for their actions and are often protected from being fired by the Team Leads in charge of my section. These Team Leads often play favorite and will remove points for showing up late for the people they like but won't if you are not one of those people.

title: Great pay, good benefits, but bad schedules
review: Great pay and benefits if your single and no kids, hours suck you either work 4 days and all day so you don't see family or you work on weekends......

title: management is awful
review: i worked for walmart for over a year up until recently, management seriously sucks nobodycares at all about you unless you’re really good friends with certain people but if you’re not then you’re pretty much on your own

title: run
review: quit after a few days disnt get i trained properly kind of just throw own it the open with zero training was very stress ful and a lot of work cery understaffed

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I stocked shelves overnight. I stocked freight overnight.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I worked a slow paced. I worked at a regular pace.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is fair. It is positive. It is fun. Outgoing..postiveWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Smooth and fun. Interesting. Outgoing

title: College
review: It’s great while in college since they can always adjust your schedule but the pay could be more competitive to really attract talent that will stay with the business.

title: Made lots of good friends
review: The management is awful, but they hate their jobs just as much as you will. The point system walmart offers is seriously flawed & isn't realistic for anyone with young children. Simply, life happens... walmart is just another giant corporation exploiting desperate folks to run their operation while paying next to nothing to do so. The horror stories are real.

title: Awful management and toxic environment.
review: The management is revolves around nepotism and favoritism. There is no room for advancement whether you’ve been long hired or a hard, above and beyond worker. I would not recommend this job to anyone because it just drains you mentally and physically. The academy trainer will ask you to do way more than necessary and if you do not comply it is something that will be held against you.

title: A typical customer service job
review: The customers are rude and it becomes soul crushing as you attempt to grin and bear it. Management is rough to say the least and was power-tripping on the meager control they could exert over the employees below them, as if they were minor feudal lords. It has been awhile since I was there so I don’t know how it is now though.

title: productive and fun workplace
review: A great place to work with flexible hours. Allowed me to go to school and work when I was available. Management cared about me and was always there when i had a question

title: PTO for what
review: It’s good pay and hours unfortunately you can’t use your pto, I had 103 hours of pto when I quit. I would put my days in 2 months in advance and they’d deny them due to “no coverage” 2 whole months in advance.

title: Awful
review: The people at Walmart are awful. The job is an extension of high school in terms of drama. Sure, it's simple enough, but the management (at least at my store) will make you want to quit on your first day. They do not care about the employees. They run on a skeleton crew. I also didn't get my last paycheck after I quit for bereavement

title: Horrible company
review: Only work here as a last resort. They don't train you and they expect you to basically run the whole back half of the store with no keys or walkie talkie so you spend your entire day running around looking for a manager who was actually trained to do stuff. And they fired me for being sick too much even though I told them I had disabilities before they hired me

title: Very easy
review: Very easy job , ok pay the job itself is just picking and bringing our orders to customers you get the occasional rude customer other then that its a very easy job you will pick up on it very fast

title: fun
review: job is very fun, and you work with good people imp passionate about the little thing do you know what I am saying it was very good working here, but it is tiring

title: Corrupt management
review: Management couldn't care less about you. They target certain employees to constantly nit pick/ get on to and show obvious favoritism. Multiple coaches have lied to my face.

title: Loved it, just not enough money
review: I'd work there my whole life if it wasn't for the pay, but to earn more, I'd have to give up my freedom in schedule and all that. Great timeclock/break/lunch setup compared to other places, great PTO policy.

title: OK job
review: Good people and coworkers have some safety issues our lot lights don't work and customers is rude and sometimes threatening us. Picking is easy dispense isn't fun after doing it everyday especially they don't rotate people.

title: It was ok
review: Not much to review it was a job when I needed one but not something I would go back to. Not enough pay for the work they expect from you.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing, terrible place to work. Bullying allowed, hassle good workersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management, they hassled the hard workers, lazy ones not spoken to.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is like the Left Woke generation. Stay away.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress the entire night, someone always running off at the mouth.

title: Typical Job
review: Nothing too great or too bad. Everyday was like a strenuous workout unloading the truck, but hey, I needed the exercise. I didn't care for the hours too much, working 2pm - 11pm every shift, but I guess it's a matter of preference. Pay could have been better for the work done, but it is Walmart after all. All in all, just a typical job.

title: Not bad for the first few years
review: not bad the first few years, now everyone wants to be your boss. you have on boss but answer to like 15 different people. stress is an understatement. Glad I don't work there anymore

title: Easy job but pay is not great
review: Job is pretty simple. It really comes down to who the managers are. Good managers will make the job a breeze.Pay is not very great tho. Been here for 12 years and still only making $17/hour

title: Not a people person store
review: They’re selective with who they advance and promote. Pay was too low for the amount of work and time required Too many customers and not enough workers

title: find a different walmart
review: the whole store is ran by mid 20’s- early 30’s and have no clue what they’re doing and don’t care. They only care about eating in the front office and not helping until 5 mins till everyone leaves. Management has favoritism while others get talked too or in trouble about the littlest of things. No one’s allowed to leave until 99% of everything is done.

title: boring and too strict
review: they will literally get on you for the smallest thing. they never see the handwork you do, but as soon as you ease up and relax a little they attack you

title: Easy
review: Not a bad job if you like customer service. Easy shifts in and out. Spend your days talking to customers and checking people out. Management cares sometimes. If they like your personality that it

title: The coworkers are the best part of my day
review: Overworked, not enough employees. Coaches( if you can find find one or no help they are nowhere to ever be found. You are overworked with more than just your department they expect you to run at least three to six at one time. Store manager seems to have no backbone to stand up to his aggressive coaches.

title: Walmart is a poor company
review: Working at Walmart is like working with tree branches. They just stay and away back n forth.  The management suck they have no ethics what so ever.  The coach’s they disappear to the office or play on the phones.  The team leads do the same thing with little to no direction for the day. As far as being promoted if u miss work and are lazy then you will succeed at Walmart, if your a hard worker and like to work look else where you will do your job plus 3 other employees job also .

title: Productive and fun
review: Good pay stable work Walmart ain't going no where the only thing is that they are very strict about being late and leave early so being puctional is the best

title: OK place
review: Store was a complete mess 24/7. Apparel was a complete mess with clothes all over the aisles. I wasn't able to pick a lot of items because nothing was being put out!

title: One of the best places to work!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part was the customer   It was always fun to work with associates as well as for the customer  like family!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Impatient  customers sometimes who need reassuring that they are important and they will be taken care of not only immediately but professionally What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's like familyAlways looking forward to coming to work What is a typical day like for you at the company?Rise and shine-the original owner instilled employees to do a company cheer to start the day

title: Very fast paced
review: Heavy lifting in backroom. Shoping with a large cart down stores isles. Overall good people there. Manager yelled a lot though. Have to work in cold coolers and freezers and part time outside.

title: ugh
review: 9 hour shifts with an hour unpaid lunch. management can be really supportive but it depends on who you work under. breaks are every 2 hours and are 15 minutes long, which is helpful for getting through the day. very underpaid. gossip can be really bad.

title: Walmart is the most unfriendly and dehumanizing company that I have ever worked at.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The check was always good. I was paid.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Absolutely an anti family atmosphere.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Seems to be an agenda to dehumanize everyone that works there.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Strategize on areas of concern. Implement plan. Work like a dog to see it get done.

title: Very fun when we done with work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Help the customer when they need What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When I’m at the service desk and when the customer returns something and you the item can’t be returned they start yelling at me that’s the most stressful part.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Together we can do it  as a team is the beautiful thing

title: Necesita estructura en la administración
review: Al llegar a trabajar a Walmart, me di cuenta de muchas cosas, la mayoría por errores de administración, tampoco son muy pro asociados, en fin, me encantaba el servicio al cliente, pero es difícil trabajar en un departamento que no tiene estructura y afecta al asociado en su desempeño.

title: Terrible worklife
review: Company doesnt care about you. They care about you always working and if you need time off you may or may not get it. If you do get it your looked at and treated awful. Plenty of more work waiting for you once your back. Terrible work life balance.

title: Fast Paced and Productive
review: It was chill for pay.  What to Expect:  • Most packages weigh less than 50lbs and automation technology is used to reduce physical labor • Fill client orders while maintaining daily quality and production targets by using an RF Scanner to pick products. • Ship client orders per customer specifications for previously picked products. • Use technology like scanners, computers and automation for improved accuracy and speed. • Perform all additional duties as required.

title: Stable pay and good benefits
review: Good pay for the work and the benefits are all pretty good, the only downside really is that management can really drag an entire department down.

title: Pro associates
review: Great job security with pretty good benefits, lots of great associates and plenty room advancement. Just be ready to work hard and time will fly by daily...

title: Overworked and unappreciated
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay was decent, benefits are okWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Schedule not the same, always required to work more than scheduled hours, What is the work environment and culture like at the company?To many clicks, management had their personal preferences to certain associates What is a typical day like for you at the company?Worked overnight so freight stocking daily

title: Management
review: This place depends completely on management, some stores are great some stores are horrible. There is some unrealistic standards set but not always upheld.

title: Productive work place but all around miserable place to work.
review: To start, the pay is not fair for the work expected. The benefits are garbage and not worth the money put into them. Management only look out for themselves, they only promote their close friends at work and not promote individuals that have worked so hard to move up, have the skills to move up and take initiative to prove their dedication to the company as they try to build a life long career.

title: Fun
review: Very fun place to work at and fun managers and just try your best because you’ll obviously have to deal with certain types of customers but being able to talk to nicer types is always the best

title: Good pay and benefits, frustrating management
review: Walmart has good hours, pay, and benefits but the management at most stores makes it incredibly frustrating to have a productive career. My manager at the time I worked here spent most of her day making tiktoks, and ignoring the department until things were going horribly wrong.

title: about the job
review: Pay could be better, job is good for teenagers in high school, college students, or someone who needs a second job, but if this is your main source of income that is a big no go

title: Dont work here
review: Management plays favorites and micromanages everything you do. They dont ever want to hire anyone so staff is always short handed.

title: Fun and rewarding.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I really enjoyed checking out customers...What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The only thing stressful was standing on my feet for so long.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Our store was very clean - associates kept the store clean.  Customers were friendly.

title: Fun people some good management
review: Overall had a great experience. But they won’t move you up unless you’re one of their favorites or a family member. The gm will sweep anything under the rug just to make him look good

title: Bueno
review: Buen ambiente para travajar los compañeros muy atentos i trabajandores

title: Overall in Honest Opinion
review: My overall opinion of experience with Walmart would be that it was an absolute challenge to face every single day and getting through those challenges have rewarded me in my growth and development in my career path and personal life.

title: Morale is very low
review: Working for this company can be very challenging. The attendance policy is based on a point system. They don't consider health issues as a reason for an absence. Unless you have accumulated pto hours, there is no paid sick time. Bonuses aren't given anymore for associates. Only a yearly bonus for upper management. It's very hard to get management to stick to their job obligations. There is a lot of favoritism and retaliation that goes on in the workplace. You have to basically cater to upper management's ego to get ahead in the company. It use to be a very enjoyable place for employment, but the morale on a day to day is very low due to the lack of respect from the upper management team. If your looking for something temporary great, but a permanent position you have to be very cautious dealing with inside and outside management.

title: Demanding
review: Very physical work pay was good upper management sucked they would throw you under the bus to save their own. Not enough help.. one team lead over 4 departments with 1 team member for the “team”

title: Busy, fair and mgmt works with you
review: Check in, cashier all shift, restock go backs. Keep check out lanes clean, tidy and restock if possible.  Breaks and lunch times are coordinated through front end supervisors.

title: Instructions on what is expected change at the whims of the person in charge for that day. Advancement is dependent upon the politics of the store.
review: Cap 1 FreshStarts a 4 am. and goes to 1 pm. Expect to work every weekend.Management is not friendly, and the majority of associates are not happy with their job.

title: Just a warn body on the floor
review: Youre just another body on the floor they are always short handed. Always changing managers and always letting the same people act the same way. I did enjoy all the pto gained and that you could cover being late with it instead of being pointed on the system.

title: Store manager is nice
review: Store manager is nice, hr is run poorly and don't expect help you have to work even positive for Covid and put anyone in danger. They don't train employees properly and expect you to do everything on your own with absolutely no help but you will be in trouble if you mess up

title: Please don't
review: I worked for Walmart for a very long time and it got progressively worse over time. I have nothing to show for my many years of my life dedicated to this company. They take away any and all benefits or flexible scheduling (won't pay you enough to earn a living but scheduling will not allow for a 2nd+ job) They are 100% beholden to shareholders and they care nothing for their customers or employees. Stay away.

title: Fast past workplace, low pay
review: It depends on the department. I recommend working CAP1-3 since times goes by fast while working on the trucks, shelves, and inventory. I worked cap 2 which focused on unloading the trucks and stocking the main departments of the store such as grocery and chemicals. Very physical and draining job, but you will burn numerous of calories. Pay was okay but could be better. Overnights get paid slightly more and have to focus on the remaining one inventory to stock up. Morning shifts finish any work that overnight misses and they organize and sone the shelves. You’re better off working at Amazon thoug.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get long lunch breaks, there's the Walmart card they give you that's like a debit card. You can get loans and it just takes it out of your paycheck.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You will be expected to do more. I was supposed to be in grocery stocking but the manager for health and beauty was gone so they stuck me there. When weather is bad and you have to miss work, you get points deducted.....they don't excuse it. If you go over their point system you can say goodbye to your job. I would never work at a Walmart again.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Its friendly at first but you get a lot of people that are overwhelmed and get mad easy.

title: Decent job great money
review: It’s corporate so they treat you like you don’t matter, but they pay you well, and the managers will work with you on days off and aren’t that bad in general as people.

title: Hardship
review: Day in and day out kind of job the days don’t go by easily. It’s prolly the hardest for first day cause they just throw you in there but once you get it down you’ll realize your first day will be like every day after that because there’s not really any training. Also management and favoritism is a thing so that’s that just deal with it.

title: Was different 20yrs ago
review: Now the culture is sub par. Unfortunate.Depending on the store, disregarding customers is ignored & tolerated.Questionable content can be spoken from multiple employees.In store HR & store manager ignores your concerns & requests for transfer to different dept or different store.Unfortunate, but true.

title: Productive and fun
review: Working at Walmart was a great experience for somebody my age and the goals I was aiming for. You get the experience to work with different people and cultures. Get to see how everything is handled in a store

title: Ok place to work
review: Very busy and and a little overworked but it is a dependable job. As long as you show up and do as your told, no one bothers you in a negative way. I rate it a 6.

title: Very good company to work for in retail
review: Very good survey and very interesting and information. I know I can have a very good time working for this company and I can have a lot of opportunities there .as a sales person or as a manager asstant or dock worker.

title: For my experience they are good people and they are people they to have patiencion to work with then
review: I have good experience working with wal-mart  and wal-mart whent turn 23. I learn how to a good to my self and my family. How to treat people better and be nice to  learn and say sorry whent we make mistake

title: It was fun love the staff
review: It was fun working at Walmart made alot of friends and connections with people in the. Bigger indeterminacy made it really easy to grow in the work force made me feel prepared

title: Was Treated Very Well
review: I spent two years as a order selector on dry side 2nd shift. Had a good supervisor team and co workers where very hard workers. Left due to health issues, but greatly miss my co workers and managers. Would definitely work here again!

title: Poor decision making for management.
review: They will only give advancement to the employees, who will only say yes to whatever the higher ups demand, without offering a reasonable compromise. The home office is in Arkansas, and they want the store here to follow what works down there. There used to be individuals who worked separate departments, which had options to adjust the department to what the local people were after. This was called S.W.A.S. or store within a store. There is no personal touch to the job, and you almost never see anyone who had advanced without serious butt kissing. They also, are usually the ones who knows nothing about the everyday operations before the advancement. These are the ones that you get to work for.

title: It was torture.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It was bad everyday- verbal abuse and threats.  The health benefits were the only good thing.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Verbal abuse and threats everydayWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Everything except the benefits were bad- I would not want to work there again.

title: Stressful goals are for managers bonus
review: Mangers have no respect or desire to help associates they have unrealistic goals and push you so they can make their bonus when addressing issues they blow you off or smoke screen you

title: Not bad for Walmart but tiring
review: Working 8 hours doing self check/ cashier was tiring. Overall a stressful work environment. Positives are you get to do your own thing and you do get breaks and lunch.

title: 5 stars
