review: What is the best part of working at the company?Ability to move up or down the ladder and even lateral movement into other areas.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Company is so big that training is inconsistent.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great culture. Always pushing respect for the individual.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Fast paced. Be ready to go from the first moment to the last each day.

title: Great if you don't mind working numerous hours
review: Walmart changed over the years.  It use to be more flexible with it's scheduling which was great when having young children.  The benefits were great and that is all different.  Being salary is tough in retail overall.  Working with customers can be very rewarding and fun.  The fundraising is great and so much fun.

title: Over shopped and understaffed
review: Met some wonderful folks. The position is set up for you to fail. The coach is not very good and enjoys tearing other people down to lift himself up and not all but most team leads are extraordinarily unpleasant…

title: Good experience, but...
review: Understaffed, you did not get your 15 min break 2 times,  during the 8 hours shift, if you had one, you are lucky)  No time for mandatory training (((

title: It was ok
review: Just your average customer service role really some customers were ok some not so much management think too highly of themselves at times but overall it was neutral

title: Walmart
review: Not a bad place to work good management willing to work with your schedule there's always someone that's willing to trade with you if you have to have a day off

title: Horrible company
review: They will tell you even six months from the time you get hired any day it will pick up and get you hours....it's all a lie...the management is clueless and the communication between shifts is non-existent....you will get 11 hours a week and be training new hires ...it's a business built on hiring and training and people quitting...I hit my numbers and did great at my job so no I'm not a bad employee trying to get back at them

title: Easy, A lot of walking
review: it is a good job for those who want a job that's not too difficult. You are either on the floor picking people's orders or in the back dispensing orders into people's cars. It can get pretty stressful when you have cars in all the bays or a lot of picks .You are timed by how many items you pick an hour and how long it takes you to dispense an order to a car.

title: It's a fun place and a good environment to work for
review: It's a fun environment to work for at Walmart we keep it fun safe and everybody's outgoing here and like a family here we have problems they help you out with that's what makes it fun

title: Awful
review: They just need better management! They need to focus on work not trying to get with every co worker. They need to be more considerate on who they hire because they will leave you hanging

title: x4ec5rv6tyu
review: terrible work-life balance i was constantly getting calls while having time off few benefits for what you have to do and bad management barley any training

title: Do not work at Walmart
review: Walmart could not care less about their employees. They have disabled people standing 8+ hours a day with no accommodations. They pay horrible. They treat you horrible. They pick favorites. They offer no bonuses or raises so the pay you start with will be the same unless the entire company updates its pay. They cut your hours without a warning making it so you can't pay your rent or can't afford food that month. I so not recommend working here unless you have no choice. The customers and managers yell at you all day

title: Average
review: Can be stressful depending on the amount of pallets you have to finish within the given task time. Grocery can aisle is a beast when doing by yourself at the super center. Stay out the way of occasional drama and you’re golden.

title: Overall a good place to work during the day, but overnight sucks
review: I was an overnight worker, and all I can say is the employees during the day don't do anything. The managers over night are over worked and nobody works together. But the pay was okay and we got 2 15min breaks and 1hr lunch so 🫠🤷‍♂️

title: Easy job, just pay attention
review: Decent job, decent pay. You get consistent hours. 1 hour lunch and 15 min break when working 8 hours. Some management is not great but overall not too bad.

title: It's working at WalMart lol.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?A paycheck.Seriously, we all know WallyWorld and there isn't really much to say about it.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers staring at you all day.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Poor and rather mechanical, I never met any of the managers higher than the floor.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Show up, bag groceries, and go home for $8 an hour.

title: Culture and pay is great
review: Great culture and great pay for an overnight stocking job. Co-workers are fun hardworking and great to get along with. Supervisors and leads not so much, there are a few(2) that make the job amazing and worthwhile. The others will make make you hate it some nights. They don’t care if your shift ends at 7 and you completed all your tasks by 4 or 5, if they wanted you to be done by 2 you will hear about it. If you continue to get done with your assigned stocking aisle before shift end but not by their “time standards” you will then have a “productivity meeting” which will consist of them telling you that you need to pick it up or it’ll turn into a disciplinary action even though you’re finishing way before your shift ends. Their logic is if you have 6-7 pallets to break down and stock they want you done in 2 hours….2! Meanwhile they do not account time for breaking down cardboard ,making sure product is in the right spot ,emptying your cardboard bin when it’s full etc. They don’t care. Also pallet jacks are limited so if you don’t find one then you’re spending your first hour with a shopping cart offloading minimal product rather than having the whole pallet in your designated aisle which slows you down. Also if you’re not back inside the building from break whenever the lead decides to lock the door then you are locked out until the lead sees you so no telling when that may be. For a little more clarity let’s say you’re a smoker. If break is at 12am and you’ve been working so hard that by the time you look at the time it’s 12:05. So you take your 15 minute break well when you - more...

title: Friendly and Welcoming
review: I can honestly say that I enjoyed working at Walmart! My first day everything was explained to me in an understandable manner and everyone was nice and happy to be there.

title: Upper management, coaches specifically, are AWFUL.
review: I worked at Walmart for 5 years. Loved my job, but my most recent Coach was one of the most AWFUL people I have ever had the displeasure of working with.

title: Okay
review: It’s okay  place to work, advancement is simple and easy.  Pay is the best I’ve had at any job I’ve ever had. Will be hoping to go back soon when I can

title: Great working with Walmart
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It’s an amazing work place to be able to work and help customers etc and also an opportunity employer What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not really but when it busy you have to be on point What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s great associates are good and great customers What is a typical day like for you at the company?I love it it’s great very busy working

title: Overworked, Underpaid
review: Asset Protection within walmart NHM is expected to carry the weight of all loss, front back and salesfloor. The job code is meaningless, as you're expected to do the jobs of several others. In my case, I did Operation Manager and Front End Team Lead work, while still being expected to do all of the Asset Protection work. I was beyond stressed, management shafted AP at any chance they could push the blame, and pay way less than anything but stockers.

title: Cold or real hot. And the floors was wet and the lifts would slide cause of the humidity on floor.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Really none. Only was scheduled for 36 hours and had to do about all you could to get them. Always wanted to send you home. And had to switch back and forth departments or move stores to get hours What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough hours. If you happy with 20 hours a week. It’s a good jobWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Slow. And drags the day. And people were not the best attitude. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Slow boring and hours was horrible

title: Easy job, but boring
review: Scanning the same boxes of clothes daiky,then placing items on floor. The upkeep of floor is impossible because there is not enough help. Customers are messy and you cannot get everything done

title: Fun but exhausting
review: Was a lot of fun working for Walmart. I was in the deli section so I was always busy. The managers would always want everything to be perfect & would let us leave until they felt it was right. The employees would call off and show up to the store anyways. Very easy job but felt like there was always an issue.

title: Not a Career job unless your going for top dog
review: Walmart is a great place to work if your just trying to make some money and add adversity to your life. however, take it from me a person who has been there for 18 years. Its great if you are young, don't care about anything. just looking to make some cash, unless your looking to be management and your not afraid to be an Butt and shred any emotions towards others, It will be just a job. Metrics is all they care about. If thats you, go for it. And whatever you do, don't trust anyone and don't make friends and you'll be successful.

title: Fun place
review: Excellent place to work people are great your always learning something new management is amazing very fun environment absolutely love it there love my Walmart

title: Decent job security
review: Great place to work to try to start a career however depending on management will decide if you can actually create one. Culture really made too many leaders without enough followers.

title: Horrible management
review: Management uses employees until there's nothing left to give. Long hours. Lying coaches. Ridiculous coaching. When they've been caught breaking the law they do their best to make it look like the associates are responsible for it.

title: scandalous,toxic work,and unprofessional leads ,and bosses.
review: Only the boss,or friends, relatives..are the one gets promoted or untouchable..they get away with alot even the leads too.. you work hard and you don't get promoted,plus they care about complaints..etc

title: Fast paced. High stress environment.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Things are constantly changing, and there is a lot of opportunity to learn new things and advance.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Short staffing and high turnover

title: Fun
review: The people I work with are like a family and look out for each other and really creates a healthy job environment for everyone I personally enjoy working here and the benefits this company offers are outstanding

title: Good place to work with if you are fast paced and have good co-workers
review: Walmart at my specific location and department was very understaffed for the period I worked there. Because of this, we were always super busy and constantly moving. Schedules are somewhat flexible but holidays are extremely hard to get off

title: Productive and learning experience
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Equal opportunity to one and all. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Fear for occurance and no fix time off.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very nice culture. Team supportive and working with collobration What is a typical day like for you at the company?Motovational and full of inspiration. Place to learn public dealing

title: Not all locations the same
review: Find a good location and your golden, find a poor one and you will be overworked and severely underpaid for what the company expects from you. I have had bad experiences, and good ones.

title: Not hard basic job
review: It is what you'd expect. Talk to customers, bring in carts, carry out items for customers in need, and do the whole retail thing. Can be physically demanding if primarily cart attendant.

title: A fun place to work at where you felt like a valued member of the team
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The moral of the store and the team work and the leadership treated everyone fairly and made everyone feel important and that everyone was valuable What is the most stressful part about working at the company?There was nothing that I found stressful about the job itself, customers can vary by their attitudes but the job itself was good What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Teamwork was r the main culture of the company and no matter what background you came from we were all on the same team

title: Nice schedule and people
review: Flexible schedule and nice people to work with. Got to try different roles in departments around the store to find what suited me the best. Overall solid place

title: Lamentable
review: Es lamentable que se atropelle a las personas que verdaderamente quieren trabajar. La cultura de la intimidación y la hipocresía. Mis nervios se hicieron trizas, abandoné el trabajo por miedo a represalía y miedo a denunciar la tortura mental modo goteo. Es drenante y frustrante, desesperanzador y cruel. No lo recomendaría a nadie.

title: Highly stressful and unfulfilling/unrewarding work. Management is the worst for anywhere I've worked.d
review: Be ready to get ran into the ground for not hitting your work goals, while watching management take away nearly all ways to achieve them. You will be paid decent, but not at all worth the stress.

title: fun
review: Very nice and simple job to work not too much stress loved the hours very friendly co workers would definitely work here again if the pay was a lil better

title: Favoritism
review: They will promote someone to a store lead with less experience as you then tell someone who has over 10yrs of experience that you're not ready for that position.

title: good
review: good place to work. good hours to work. will like people you work with. small town atmosphere to work in. nice and friendly customers that come in to the building

title: Good pay but sometimes unorganized
review: Nice place to work, every day depends in what you gonna do, the people is nice and the pay is great Unorganized sometimes and the biggest problem is favoritism

title: Great First Gig
review: For what it was it was an amazing first job. Coworkers were nice to chat with, customers were understanding, and management weren't rude or incompetent. The job itself was simple and easy to learn with the benefit of offering skills in retail and warehouse level careers. Not to mention an associates discount on products bought in store. Would definitely recommend this as a first time job.

title: productive and annoying workplace
review: no one really cars about the job abd the poeple that come through the line can be very rude. we are very understaffed so the lines can be huge and there is nothing to do about it.

title: Its a job
review: Management has issues with promoting unqualified people into management rolls. The pay is fine, but their insurance is expensive and doesn't cover squat. Since they provide insurance I cannot qualify for Obamacare and I am paying full price. It's highway robbery. They have issues with unreasonable expectations.

title: Productive fun
review: it was greaaat. good pay. would definitely recommend if you like a fun and exciting environment that always kept you on your toes! definitely ten out of ten!

title: Overall my coworker are nice.
review: They expect so much of us but very low pay for what we do. 30 min lunches and the attendance policy is ridiculous . Sometimes the manager are helpful but be careful.

title: its ok
review: so far it's not the best job, but it has decent pay. The management has a lot of favoritism which is really annoying most of the time. The hardest part of the job is customers and, interacting with them.

title: Horrible place to work. I would not recommend it.
review: Was-Mart is an okay job to work at if you are in school or just need a part time job for some gas money. If you are raising a family, or this is your career then definitely go somewhere else. Hours are unpredictable.

title: Fun, fast-paced place to work at
review: Learned a lot about the merchandising and supply chain industry.  Fast-paced, lots of moving pieces. You can learn alot and meet many great people if you manage your time and resources appropriately here.

title: Better to keep this job for a bit
review: I met good co workers it can get tough but become easy when your used to it, the pay during the time is acceptable and the job itself takes time to master.

title: Unprofessional, Hard to Advance, You're just another number in the system.
review: Through out my course of working at Walmart; this has to be one of the worst jobs I've had in some time. Management plays favorites, and only out the ones they don't like. Advancement is a Joke, you have to hound down someone in order to even ev considered for department transfer, management constantly puts you down and bullies you for using your earned Payed Time Off!  Associates stand around and converse and don't actually work half the time, the hard working Associates get a pat on the back. Management constantly throws their problems on Associates, and gives them more work outside of their job description with no prior training to do so.

title: Good pay, high turnover rate, make you work a lot for not having enough associates
review: High turnover rate, some managers are toxic, you cant ask for a weekend off because they always reject it yet they give people 3 months off to go to on vacation to their country. Not enough associates and you are expected to work for 3 people. Burnout and mental health problems because of it

title: Family like
review: Pros- different types of people with all personalities, eligible for quick advancement, food discounts, direct deposit, work with your schedule work life balance

title: It's a paycheck
review: They are no longer competitive in pay for the area. Have got rid of any incentives. No holiday pay, no bonus. No sick pay. They don't really train  any new associates.

title: with the right team the job can be enjoyable
review: depending on team and stores they all operate differently it can be a good place to work at they do pay good and do offer benefits and etc. hardest part of the job I would say is your always on your feet.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people you work with and some of the customersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?There unwillingness to work around days requested offWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Kinda hectic depends on who your team lead isWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy always rushing to do the next task

title: Welcome to Walmart
review: I needed a quick way to help me earn money and get out of the house during the chaos of 2020 and was able to acquire a job working as an overnight stocker.Stocking was fun work for me- someone who likes independent work, and organizing things. However the management had a lot of communication issues. The other coworkers weren’t as motivated and I feel  we didn’t work as a cohesive unit. I passed out due to my eating disorder and was chastised for not being fast enough. Subsequently I couldn’t make it to work, I did attempt to alert my coworkers and was let go.It wasn’t a ‘great’ job and you’re not even a cog. Though I did earn more money I’d ever wanted anywhere else.If you can’t work you’re replaced easily.If you need money and are willing to show up and DO YOUR JOB or at least make a good show of it, this is what you’re looking for.If you are motivated to ask for what you need from management as well as completing your training, you will receive the benefits- and there are many available for motivated workers.It is a company that cares for its motivated and able employees.Use your voice or you will be lost.

title: management sucks
review: it wasn’t that bad work wise but when the managers would be up your butt all the time and always take you from a job your working on and put you on another and leave the unfinished one there

title: Educational in many ways and a great place to begin a career in retail.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You meet a lot of people who are friendly and fun. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Christmas time is the most stressful time. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fun people to work with. Great learning environment. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking the shelves and straightening the products on the shelves. Helping customers find what they need.

title: Company does not Value there employees.
review: I enjoyed the employees there but for the most there were no accountability given. No help from upper management and the company in general did not value their long term employees. They paid new employees almost the same as some that were there years and years in the same position.

title: standards and easy job
review: it’s a pretty standard job most days is just making sure you’re watching customers and coordinating with your managers and employees.very repetitive tho

title: Cases per hour most important
review: They say safety is the most important but only if it doesn’t interfere with cases per hour. Accountability is inconsistent. Area managers do not get much training and struggle with hard conversations. There are week day ops and weekend ops and they do not agree on how to run the area they are in charge of.

title: Muy estresante y abusivo
review: Antes muchísimo antes era una compañía que podías trabajar y tenias buenos privilegios pero ahora por favor el que trabaje hay es por que quiere estar soportando humillaciones mal carácter de los demás y sobre todo que los que llevan mucho más años hay crean ser lo dueños de la empresa .

title: Its ok
review: Its not bad. Good benefits pretty good. Boring work and outdated tech. Alot of stress due to the importance of the work. Long hours expectations are high

title: Unproductive, ineffecient and incompassionate
review: Work life during any shift at Walmart is fine when your store is being managed by competent people. This one isn't. Finding any reason to stay has become extremely hard and getting any kind of flexibility is impossible unless you're a store favorite. Company will not work with you. Coworkers are being denied leave of absence when a relative passes. You will be reprimanded for any little mistake for certain managers, even if you are doing the right thing. Rules and company policy is up to each manager's discretion and nothing is really set in stone until they want it to be for that instance. TL;DR you're better off working anywhere else with an actual company policy and fewer mangers. Don't do it to yourself.

title: Yes it keeps you busy defently  productive
review: I worked with Walmart for 15 years over all not to bad of a place to work. The reason I left is because I was relocating to buy a home but did not work out. But anyway the managers maybe have better detection to give the employees. They should have rotating weekends at least and more holidays off beside Christmas Day. Maybe starting pay little higher also keep your pay and not dropping pay to go to other depts. have enough associate to casheir and not pull sale floor people up to check all the time.

title: I loved being a cashier here but I couldn’t meet the attendance quidrlines.
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I love the friendliness of our customers and co-workersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being sick but not able to call off because of their point system.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Clean, organized, relaxed, friendly

title: Don't Do It
review: The work is very boring, always short staffed, and management is not great. Terribly mismanaged by underqualified people who tend to be very unaware of how physically demanding it is.

title: Nothing
review: It was the worst I left with a very traumatic experience with heart of ever messing up with the fear of not being good enough cause that what we were constantly told and you reported to hr and. Ethic and cooperate they all would say stuck it up

title: Fast paced customer driven
review: Unloading a trucking helping customers I also learned how to work as a team member learn how to use a palet jack and how to be neat and organize and efficiently do my job.

title: Very good over long job
review: Key focus of success paying attention to numbers loving people attitude adjustments loving my work environment more.. made me a better worker that I am today respect others drive motivation

title: it’s ok
review: It’s fine if u don’t get caught up in the drama. Managers will overwork you and talk down to you. Money and benefits were good. If you’re overnight just do your job and go home

title: No training, no care for employees.
review: I was hired on for an overnight shift to work on a project remodeling the store. There was absolutely no training whatsoever. They force you to sit at a computer for hours expecting you to read hours and hours worth of information and immediately put you to work once you've completeled the lessons. Leads were impossible to find when you needed them to answer questions, and again there were a lot of questions due to no training and emphasis on NO training. No time off is granted prior to hire meaning you have to earn it second by second which ties to their incredibly strict attendance policy. Within a 6 month period you can miss a max of 4 days before getting fired on the spot. Time off is slowly earned and even slower if you're a temp for the company.If you're hired on as a stocker, they have high expectations when completing your work within a time frame and you'll be punished if you couldn't finish it fast enough and they don't give a lot of time. "Heating and Cooling is for customers not associates" when complaints about the temperature were said.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to work. Good benefits and hours, excellent work environment. Great team leads and managers. Flexible hours, paid time off, vacation, sick time. Overtime of that is what you are looking for

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Being able to help people in the community What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Having to answer stupid questions from customers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The coworkers are somewhat nice but can be lazy at timesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Usually a 10-7 day but sometimes mixed with a 1-10

title: Okay for Short Term
review: It takes almost no feeling and a lot of toughness to be a People Lead at Walmart. You’re responsible for 300+ employees, the schedules, the hiring, onboarding, training of associates and managers,  the turnover, labor laws, plus every associate coming to you every day (usually rudely) to take care of every little thing. There is 0 support from management at the store level, you are blamed for everything and corporate wants one thing, market wants another thing, store manager wants another thing. It’s a joke. However, you will learn a lot that you wouldn’t learn in any other position in the store. I wish it was remote or at least half remote. The expectations of what is required to get done on top of dealing with the associates in the store all day… it’s too much. There’s a reason this job used to be two people.

title: Great place to work.
review: Enjoyed working at Walmart. Supervisors and staff wonderful to work for.  Punctuality a must and personal hygiene also. Be kind and honest. And excel.

title: Could be better
review: Walmart is a good to work at. I'm my experience it was kind of bad but got better over time. The hourly rate could be 11 an hour but needs to change to at least 13

title: Meeting new people.
review: Helping and working with public. Learning to do different things. I've worked in human resources, cashier. Company was about family.  No longer about family only money. Have been a supervisor over the front end. Worked with customer service.

title: Co-workers made it tolerable to work here
review: I only worked part time for Walmart. So the max I would do was 20 hours a week because that is the most I could handle dealing with management. Managers (except one) as well as leads treat their employees like they’re step children. They’re rude and unprofessional. There was a natural disaster in which I had no electric and no hot water. So I hadn’t showered in days and they still expected me to go into work. The government issued a natural disaster order and these people had no sympathy. They’re so strict on hygiene but they wanted me to go in after not showering for days.

title: could be better
review: The hours are not consistent.   We have no holiday pay,   they cut out our bonuses, and  the short breaks are ridiculous !  Hopefully one day it will make some changes.

title: Never work at the Chambersburg PA store!
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay…. Only. Some medical benefits for part time help .  The other equal  employees not management!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Pressure to meet minimum standards while other employees hide in the restroom, their cars  and nothing happens to them.  Unequal standards for all.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Favoritism rules.  The gossip, tyranny, childish playground atmosphere!What is a typical day like for you at the company?I do my job and leave ASAP!  I hired partime and they kept changing the requirements!

title: Not worth it
review: The pay and hours are good, but management is horrible. They never listened when I needed to change my hours, even when I submitted the form. You dedicate so much time and energy and they always expect more while never putting in the same effort themselves. It's physically and mentally draining and I couldn't wait to get out. If you apply, try not to get sucked into their BS, or you'll be stuck there forever.Good luck.

title: Easily building relations with co-workers and management.
review: Walmart is a good company to work for. There are lots of good qualities, such as the long list of benefits. I would highly recommend working for Walmart. However, there are some bad things about the company as well. Apparel TA's receive the same pay as Cashiers. In Apparel your job is much harder than simply running a register and performing other easy tasks, you must lift heavy boxes of clothes and similar Apparel accessories. The pay for the labor that Apparel requires is not worth it. Another downside to Walmart is that when you are sick and miss a shift, you gain 1 occurrence, and at six you lose your job. The occurrence rolls over after six months, or you must use your PPTO to take it off. Even with a doctors note, you still get an occurrence, with the exception being Covid-19.

title: Fun to work
review: Very good company to work for managers are very understanding levelheaded and all-around nice great place to work would recommend for everybody starting off

title: Can be good if you can put up with corprate
review: Don't work there anymore due to being in appreciated and promised promotions that never came got as far as asm and it was okay I guess only really worth it once you get to store manager to deal with the stress to be worth the pay

title: Cliquey and stressful
review: Not very flexible but that can depend on your manager, they pay is fine but hopefully you have enough hours which I did not get. There was a lot of favoritism

title: Great workplace with one caveat...
review: Overall workplace satisfaction, like with many other companies, is highly dependent on where you are located. Having worked for Walmart in two separate counties/cities/states, there is a distinct difference from small town culture and metropolitan nightmare. I got to know management, coworkers, and even some customers on a personal level while working in my first location, and lost all sense of self in the later.

title: Productive
review: Great place too work. I needed a overnight job alone with my other job. The management is good  and the pay is great. It’s about time Walmart increased hourly base pay

title: Good flexibility not so good compensation
review: I enjoyed working for this company. My position title was batching where I had the responsibility of stacking freight into trucks and strategically filling up trucks.

title: Ok
review: It was a good place to work , the work was not too demanding . And it does keep you busy and physical active . The training was sufficient , but the pay did not reflect the position.

title: Completely awful
review: Awful company and awful location, the managers here are the worst and not enough of them either because no one wants to take the promotion knowing they would be worked to the bone. It's a well know fact that several managers at this location have ended up on leave because they had a mental breakdown. Managers who are that overworked do not have the time or energy to care about their employees as people, it's ALL about profit

title: Not bad but a few bad eggs
review: Most bosses are nice and will help you learn so long as you actually give more than 5% effort, your already past half the other workers, but a few can cause issues just like any other workplace

title: Unprofessional/rude management
review: Every front end manager is extremely unprofessional. They have no leadership skills whatsoever. They gossip on the clock, and they have a negative attitude at all times. They are very poor at coordinating breaks/lunches. The communication is very limited. They are very rude and overall make multiple employees uncomfortable working for them.

title: Fun and easy money
review: The coworkers were super nice and supportive. Everyone there were super friendly. The manager were super cool also. The only bad part when it’s late and your by yourself in your department.

title: Great environment
review: It's a great opportunity and pays well the only hard part is the physical demand but it's doable for most people. Management was awesome. I highly recommend. They also pay for your schooling.

title: Productive and Rewarding workplace
review: Good benefits, good pay, plenty of opportunities to move up within the company. It’s hard work but if you stick with it pays off, It’s a very good job for the area.

title: Don't work there
review: Management won't honor your availability. They'll make you work weekends because of how high the turnover rate is, and will reject your PTO requests even if its 6 months ahead of time

title: Typical day as a Walmart associate
review: Depending what job you’re in it’s all gonna be different . Each manager will run their department how they want/ how it should go. At the end of the day you’re there to help the customers.

title: Decent Job
review: The upside is cardio and decent pay. The downside is barely any carts to bring up during their busy hours. The manager and team leads when I worked there were friendly

title: Very fast work but enjoyable
review: Work was busy and had to be fast and efficient, knowledgeable, pleasant   I enjoyed the time spent at Walmart.  I enjoyed the challenge  everyday. The Walmart  I was employed at was Citrus Heights,  Sacramento. CA.  Management, co-workers, maintenance people, everyone was super nice,helpful and professional.   Really enjoyed my job.

title: Horrible
review: Fired me because their system messed up and didn’t listen to me when I told them. They don’t care about their employees. I was overworked and that was never enough for them.

title: Ok
review: Wasn't that bad of a job, the training was easy and clear, management sucked. The hours weren't too bad. The best part of the job were the coworkers.

title: A good place to kill time between real jobs.
review: A good place for someone starting out. Not much room for growth. Attendances policy is never strictly followed. Management picks and chooses who and when they will enforce rules on.

title: No I wouldn’t want to do that
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing. It’s a corp nothing is good about themWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nightshift sucks ! That’s all I have to sayWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Nothing about this big corp is good screw wally

title: Terrible job DON'T RECOMMEND IT
review: I wouldn't recommend anyone to work here no matter what. They aren't accommodating with schedules, and when you need off. They expect you to be there 24/7.

title: Good place to work.
review: Walmart is a great place to start a career if you are willing to learn! Great hours and having the same schedule every week, and you can work to get our bachelor degree and Walmart will pay for it.

title: The workers were ok.
review: Management sucks!!! Stay away from this place. They will spread lies and rumors. They love to play favorites. If your not apart of the click forget about getting a promotion.

title: Terrible company
review: Nothing to say because it doesn't matter. They are the reason there's walmart shootings because of the management just like at that store. Law enforcement needs to be involved with the 1399 store. The managers say weird stuff like there gonna lock everyone in the building, also say stuff like their watching us, and timing people like animals. I won't ever work for any Wal-Marts ever again nor my family.

title: nice work place
review: work place is clean and very functioinal the work was never to hard but very EZ to do. we work as a team clearing parking lot and pick up trace was never a one man job pay at the time was also great mangent was maybe the best part of the job

title: Didn’t like it
review: Too much work and not enough pay. The hours were long and the pay was not high enough for what we were expected to do. Walmart can do better for their employeees.

title: Fair pay
review: Pay was fair, hours not steady. Production goals were attainable if you do your part. Advancement possible if you work hard and show up. Training was great!

title: High turnover/pay caps
review: The company is no longer retested in retaining their people. They much prefer to hire new to avoid paying people their worth. Scheduling was not done according to associates availability .

title: This company doesn't care
review: Worked for this company for almost 2 years the management is not your friend they barely help when you ask or need them there is no hr just someone who tells you to call corporate when you go to her about anything the leads micromanage you hide and watch you make you feel miserable I loved my job for a while then it became mentally exhausting all the things the lead and coach would do and say to you becomes too much the pay is good i will say that and that's the only reason I think certain people tough it out but it wasn't about the work load which is heavy and they want you to do your work and then do others load as well so many people have came an went since I was there I don't think they ever cared they just need bodies to do the work and I couldn't take it anymore maybe if I wad on another shift I could have loved it again but it's like they say people don't quit jobs they quit management

title: Didn't like
review: Job is mindless and you feel awful all the time while working there.Good way to get some additional exercise in throughout the day though, so that could be a benefit to some people

title: Managment and job security
review: Working at walmart you are only aloud 4 points before you are fired. They do not accept doctors notes and if you need to leave early most managemnt is rude about it. You barely build up pto and if you want to use it you have to know way ahead of time. They say they are family friendly but i lost my job because my daughter was in Nationwide childrens hospital sick and i stayed by her side. I put in leave for it and it got denied. They expect you to send in there whole medical chart and then some for leave to be approved. And the management picks favorites and when there is drama they do nothing to try to stop it.

title: Good pay and benefits for retail job
review: Too many supervisors not enough associates...managers are being told they're just there to delegate workload.  Their "favorite" associates socialize too much and bully you for complaining about them.

title: Unproductive Overworking Hostile
review: Hostile work environment. Incompetent management. I was task with work outside of my department. I was treated poorly by a coworker and management. I was regularly kept after hours.

title: Hard work
review: Really good schedule. The pay is also really nice considering. However the management is absolutely horrible. The work is pretty repetitive and gets old fast.

title: Disgusting management and polocy
review: Managers have a huge superiority complex over workers disrespectful they don’t want growth they want a robot they don’t care for employees they want your blood not your help it’s sad

title: Absolutely the worst place to work
review: You are not a valued asset. You are just an asset. They look at you like a number and that’s all you are. You can and will be fired for any reason. Management has 100% power in all situations. There is no incentive to do anything. You don’t even get a raise off of performance. Raises are based on attendance only. Literally all about politics from the ground up. Do NOT work here unless you don’t care about yourself, your life or your job.

title: nothing
review: Not a good place to work. They over work you and the pay is not good at all. Walmart is the worst job I have ever had. I wouldn't advise no one to work there. It drains you.

title: Overall
review: Nobody should work for this company.Everybody they put into leadership roles aren't leaders, they're miserable people who are lazy. They only love to bark out orders and can't show you how things are done.

title: Fast-paced active work that is doable
review: It’s fun finding items in the store and coming across random or odd items from certain orders or so. Its an interesting(can be entertaining) job. It really keeps you moving but can be tiring if there is no team cooperation

title: Don't care about their associates
review: Horrible place to work. Wish I can get out. No good structure at ALL!!! I DONT CARE WHAT WALMART YOU HO TO. MANAGEMENT TEAM OVER ALL IS HORRIBLE!!! NO SAFETY EITHER

title: Sometimes enjoyable but mostly stressful
review: When the store was not busy, the work was very laid back and it was easy to accomplish the tasks that were assigned. However, whenever the store got even remotely busy, the front end was practically abandoned by the other departments and we were swarmed by extremely long lines, stressed cashiers, and angry customers. Cashiers were also constantly pulled to help other departments and the managers refused to allow them to return during busy times.

title: Cool place
review: Working at Walmart can be a mixed experience, as with any retail job. On the one hand, the company offers a wide range of employment opportunities, from entry-level positions to management roles, and provides a stable, well-established work environment. Walmart is also known for offering competitive benefits packages, including health insurance, retirement plans, and employee discounts.On the other hand, working in retail can be demanding, with long hours and physically strenuous tasks, such as stocking shelves and cleaning. Additionally, the fast-paced environment and high customer volume can lead to a stressful work atmosphere.Ultimately, the experience of working at Walmart will depend on the individual store and the management team. Some employees enjoy their time there and appreciate the opportunities for growth, while others find it to be a challenging and unsatisfying job.

title: Overall quite alright
review: Overall, not a bad place to work. It is very fast paced and things change all the time. So, I would make sure you are someone who is accustomed to change and can adapt quickly.

title: Simple
review: It was easy work overall, definitely could and will get crowded in the store aisles and in the online grocery pickup room. It just wasn’t for me, atmosphere wise for full time.

title: Ok
review: Wouldn’t recommend, you work hard for so long and the one day you slip you really are nothing. Company was a very great company back in the day but with the changes it’s crazy

title: nice people. easy work. mentally draining
review: it is a very draining job mentally . not super hard just depressing in a way. nice people. I would still work there if I really needed the money.

title: Terrible
review: Inconsistent rules, managers who didn't care, nothing was done about me being inappropriately touched multiple times for instance. I've worked in customers service jobs fir 10+ years and this was easily the worst. My one positive is that the customers were mostly friendly and I had a really nice relationship with lots of the regulars.

title: Is not bad place for working
review: Coworkers are niceLow pay for a lot of stress, sometimes customers are difficult.The benefits are okay but health insurance too expensive for me. I could recommend to work here.

title: It's walmart
review: Lack of proper training and bad management second department to work in and it's just very unsatisfying. Management is very annoying and only have personal goals in mind

title: A Retail Job
review: The job itself is very straightforward, with you operating the register or self checkout once you learn it. The actual environment, however, is a mess, considering that it is a Walmart. Constantly loud, with possibly disrespectful customers.

title: Unproductive
review: Totally unprofessional it's like they drop you in a shark tank you have no idea where items go and you just have to figure it out so you get yelled at for taking such a long time you're rushed through everything and constantly yelled at for not hurrying and clearing the pallets off the floor when there are only four pallet jacks for the entire store to use it's ridiculous they make it impossible to get your job done and then yell at you for not getting it done

title: Terrible
review: Revolving door of work for both employees and managers. Managers truly could not care less and the only competent assistant manager was fired for no reason. No good training for specific tasks and they ask you to perform those tasks anyway

title: Causes severe stress and anxiety
review: It’s reall hard to move up in the company when there are not many positions any more.. Management takes care of who they choose and not who deserves , pay raises are 22 to 25 cents a year depending on who they choose to take care of! The minimum raise use to be 40 to 50 cents a year plus bonuses but they eliminated that and the bonuses!! I’ve worked for the company 24 years, 15 consecutive and don’t make $14…. Please don’t let the tv commercials and smiles  fool you… I’ve thrown the towel in!!!!!! The don’t hire full time any more meaning no insurance and no real benefits.. It was very nice when I started years ago but now it’s set for one or two years meaning it’s ok for school kids and that’s exactly what they want so they can’t get insurance…. (NOT A GOOD PLACE TO WORK ANYMORE)

title: Unprofessional Workplace Environment
review: The management team over at Walmart is very unprofessional and no accountability for actions that reflect your work. The ability to move up is based off of lower level thinking and and mind games with employees. Also the people you work with can be good don’t get me wrong but overall trying build a better position is based of non work ethics.

title: Eh
review: It was alright. Very stressful at times but I made some great friends along the way. But stress stress stress is REAL in that place.. management could be bettwr

title: Fun happy place to work
review: Absolutely enjoyed working for Walmart. Great co workers and customers. The workers were treated very fair also some kind of party going on especially during the holidays. Great bonus good money too excellent health benefits.

title: Productive, fun,respectable
review: I enjoyed working at Walmart. I always was professional, and was for most part was treated as such. I worked at a Supercenter and 2 neighborhood  markets, for many years. I would love to go back.A great work environment  when management  is right..

title: Stay away toxic work environment
review: Management very disrespectful very toxic work environment. If you are over 40 years old and can't work as fast as a young person. They will overwhelmed all older employees to the point you want to quit. No holiday pay for 1 year after that forget vacation the benefits are only for Management and Supervisors.

title: Business atmosphere but friendly
review: Good benefits, fair work environment, business atmosphere but everyone also seems like family. Flexible schedule and willing to work with you to meet ur schedule needs. Great employee discount

title: Production
review: It was awesome. Lots of fun times. I made a lot of money. Gained a lot of experience checking out stuff made in China. I stopped shoplifters and tazed them until authorities arrived.

title: No work life balance
review: Constantly being scheduled extra shifts and never able to leave at end of shift. Especially during holidays and inventory time. By end of year feels like your earned PTO is equal to the extra time you have worked through out the year. Never enough hourly associates and falls on you to complete the work. As a salaried manager you don't earn overtime. Bonus is good but only if you meet the meet company goals.

title: Good Job
review: Was a good job, with different challenges day to day. Actually enjoyed my time there and coworkers. Only a few gripes like no paid holidays, and no holiday pay if you do work on holidays.

title: Straight up not gonna have a good time
review: Management is dreadful they only care about their bonuses not customer interaction or even their employees for that matter. It is all smoke and mirrors and they rely heavily on people who care about their job to train the next group of associates instead of showing them how to do things.

title: Great stepping stone
review: Liked going to work daily and felt challenged, good experience right out of highschool. The workload is not difficult and I enjoyed working with my coworkers.

title: Productive, Fun place to work
review: Great managers , gave me my hours , everything ran smoothly. My stay there was about 8 months and I chose to leave but it was pretty good. Pay was decent
location: 3400 55th St NW Rochester, MN  55901 United States

title: Tough but fair
review: This role at Walmart demands a lot of time but is made up for by the fair pay and bonus structure. You have a lot of processes to complete on a daily basis but good time management can help you through them. Because coaches work in a team setting workplace politics can really decide whether you enjoy your job or not.

title: You are appreciated and compensated appropriately for your work
review: Walmart compensates their health care workers graciously. I felt valued for my experience in my opinion as a health care provider. I had to have a lot of zoom meetings. I had to work independently with the store leaders such as pharmacy and HR and education departments.

title: Discipline must start from management
review: Management do not care for employees except those in their click. There is a lot of politics ; must people are not held accountable for their behaviors and people who get fired for lying on other employees  are called back to work because they have a friend in management.

title: Cashiers are often overworked.
review: While the cashier leads are wonderful, upper management often leaves us to drown. When our cash machine went down we were not allowed to leave signs that warned customers of this and I had to deal with customers frequently yelling at me for not telling them in advance.

title: Pays on the lower side but otherwise laid back job
review: If you work second shift you’ll most likely be unloading a truck and putting boxes on the corresponding pallets. Trucks to tend to range from anywhere between 1500 to 3500 items per. Sometimes you might get two trucks in one day but it rare. Other than that you zone or do shopbacks.

title: Management
review: Management on 3rd shift walked the floor every couple of hours and spent most of their time in office with no idea of what was happening on the floor.

title: Great job
review: Better than working at the store. Great pay and hours. Overtime is available. They give you plenty of training. You can apply with seniority to other positions

title: Good company to work.
review: Worked in the warehouse for nearly 6 months before I got covid and then a surgery. Will definitely go back if I could. Night shifts were smooth and quiet. It is very easy to learn your duties, using their technology is also easy and making your daily percentage.

title: Overworked
review: Basically every cashier at Walmart feels that they are over worked. We are always short staffed now so the cashiers who are there have to work harder. Overtime is frowned on and avoided. Maybe if the cashiers got equal pay as other department they’d be more likely to want to work.

title: Good pay, but strenuous work and bad managers.
review: The pay is good, but they work you to the bone and the managers have favoritism and only care about personal percentage.

title: Horrible
review: Worst job I ever had ever in life, they over you to death and there is no home/work balance. For a corporation that makes so much money the pay is horrible

title: Meh
review: It was not a great place to work. Management was not that great either and definitely showed favoritism. They only promote people who suck up to them and not people who actually do their job.

title: Management doesn't care about you.
review: If you happen to get sick and absolutely cannot work, even if you have a doctor's note, you'll get fired. If you don't have the protected PTO to cover it, they do not care. Management picks and chooses who to apply their rules to and changes their rules every other day. Good pay, but honestly not worth it.

title: Dead end
review: You should already know that working for walmart gives you zero room for growth and is just a job to have so you can live check to check doing really easy/basic work.

title: Great store manager and supervisors
review: The supervisors and store manager are all great. This job is definitely not for everyone though! It’s very hard on your body and I feel the pay should be higher for what it is. If you want a lazy job.. this isn’t it folks.

title: Good pay but hard work
review: Draining work, horrible in the summers. You're just a number to most of Management but there's a few good managers that actually appreciate you. Overall a good job.

title: Run as far as you can away from this company
review: If you’re not in a click you get treated like trash. Management could care less about training associates to do the right thing. As soon as you get a raise, the hours are cut.

title: Good
review: Good pay and stuff. Ogp isn’t bad and the people are fun. Customers of pickup are usually nice and understanding and sometimes not. Cant accept tips or anything

title: It's good pay but bad environment
review: The work itself isn't bad but you're treated more like a statistic rather then a human. You could get injured over something that'd completely out of your control and it's still your fault. All they care about is being the best dc in the country.

title: Awful
review: Manager don't care about you. they either make you do everything for them that THEY are supposed to do, or don't care about job advancement or work life balance.

title: overall a great job to make extra money
review: I did the personal shopper, I worked from 5 am - 2pm. It was during COVID and I think it was much more stressful to manage the job due to not having product on shelf. It was a great pay for us coming in so early in the day however it was too repetitive that I could not continue to do that daily.

title: Torture
review: Worst place ever. Stuck standing in one spot for entire shift often without break once no break and no lunch. Once a manager has it in for you, they find a way to get rid of you

title: Boring but good
review: Daily tasks are usually boring and repetitive. Team leads/managers are nice along with rest of staff. Breaks and lunches are heavily enforced which is nice. I have learned a lot of soft skills during my time here

title: Horrible place, staff and some customers
review: Low pay and will make you constantly work positions above your own pay range under the umbrella of “fill in” so they don’t have to give you the raise for the promotion. Staff in the high up positions are lazy and do not care about there employees at all! They ordered Olive Garden everyday and spent hours just chilling and eating expensive meals daily while talking negatively and making fun of some lower level employees! There was favoritism and it was basically your in the “cool click” or your 9 hour shifts will be miserable!

title: Easy work
review: Easy work, good co workers and decent customers, poor higher management (boss’s in back), good benefits, decent pay. Poor point system. Kind of a poor place to work if you have kids and are main care taker and need to take time off for unexpected illness’s.

title: Don’t work for walmart
review: Walmart is not great to work and they have no remorse at all for people. Almost died working for Walmart. Don’t go to 4503 because you will quit within a day .

title: Fun place, repetitive
review: Fun place to start but quickly gets repetitive. Good first job with some room for advancement if you’re serious about a career path. Good benefits if you’re full time.

title: very toxic company
review: wow, a lot of hype. 14hr days. you do get 2 days off together. trucks are ok. the rules are crazy!!!! They will let people (store managers, customers etc) talk to you any old way all you can do is call your boss.  management is oppressive.

title: Bad place to work
review: If you love being treat like s*** than this is the perfect job for you. And the best part is that you barely get paid any real money. Livable wage, I think NOT. this job is a joke.

title: Overall great place to work.
review: At the deli my job was super easy and was a lot of repetition. I was relied on for more than what I was paid but it never bothered me because it kept me busy and was never over the top. Besides we were already the top paying department. Sometimes we would get rude customers and I was usually the one who had to deescalate it because I “handled it best” but it was rare.  Great Management, they would teach me stuff and try to help me move up to a manager. Many supportive coworkers. Would recommend to to literally anyone. Worked there for just under 2 years when I got fired for a decently large mistake that I could have easily prevented. Overall amazing department and work culture

title: Started off fun and exciting… didn’t end that way
review: When I first started working there everything was good, the team felt like a family in OGP. Then the regional market managers stepped in and started changing things little by little that only hindered us. We hardly were respected. Had other store managers coming in “making sure we were doing our jobs” while we were absolutely slammed with orders and instead of helping out they stood and watched most of the time. Good luck getting a schedule that you need because they don’t care what you need it’s all about what they need you to work.

title: Terrible place to work
review: You’re just another number. Managers don’t even know your name. They don’t care about your schedule requests. All the employees are miserable.  I would not recommend to work here.

title: High stress environment
review: I mostly liked working at Walmart, but you have to be prepared for a very stressful day. As with most retail jobs, there are not enough people to do the work and management has no comprehension of that fact. Your immediate supervisor might understand, but the people above that will demand tasks of you that may need to be done, but can't possibly be done and take care of the customers, as well.

title: Low pay
review: $17hr starting pay for personal shopper role does not come close to paying my bills. I was offered a "promotion" to meat/produce department after 2 mos. I accepted the role but no pay raise was offered. I find that working in meat cooler and handling cold meat all day negatively impacts my arthritis. I asked to be moved to previous position 4 mos ago and management shows no inclination to get it done! They are obviously more interested in keeping that department staffed than in employee health. I am very disappointed.

title: Great retail experience
review: You learn alot at Walmart from customers to the people you work with.  Holidays get ugly on days that are slow work wise usually customers can help you through the day.

title: Just a place to earn a paycheck.
review: Just another Job. Upper management doesn't care for it's employees, they fire people based on a point system that makes no sense. Some managers don't even leave their office, they only walk the store when corporate decides to come in.

title: Not good pay for how much you
review: Not even $15 hr is just messed up having to deal with micro managing for no reason just because their bored. Co workers not doing anything but just walking around.

title: If you like to have time for your mental health, don’t work here.
review: They are very inconsiderate of your mental and physical well being. Also even if you put in for time off in advance, you most likely won’t get accepted.

title: It's what YOU make it!
review: If you have a good attitude and truly care, you can advance and climb the ladder. The pay is good and overtime is available as needed. Don't let the sour apples fool you, it's a good company.

title: It mostly depends on the management team at your location.
review: Management makes all the difference.  When I started the management was pretty good, seemed to care about employees, I got promoted quickly and planned on staying. We got a new GM afrer awhile and things changed. He wasn't there a long time when supporting managers started to leave, along with other employees. By the time I left they were very short staffed and my friends that are still there said it has stayed that way.

title: Decent
review: This place is good for a college student that needs flexiableHours . The managers don’t really like when associates talk to much . The job is easy, pay is decent for shopping for people .

title: flexible schcedules
review: they are good to work for. I feel managment could jump in a help more when needed. But they are under staffed like the rest of the depts at my store. But over all it's my fellow coworkers that make it a good place to work

title: Great
review: Great work evivormemt  for new college students and young adults for first jobs and part time jobs to work with school a lot of variety to see on the job but a lot of customer attitude to deal with also

title: Good place to work
review: If you're willing to put a honest day of work in you can build a career here.  Work hard play hard.  This has been the best place I've ever worked and will continue to grow here.  Plenty of opportunities to work your way up.  I've seen plenty of my friends grow their careers here.  Great pay and benefits.

title: Positive and energizing
review: I am driven to get up and make a difference each and every day. I can see the results of my labor and am appreciated by my supervisors. I love to see the impact I can make on the culture of the stores.

title: Enjoyable people to work with and fairly easy work
review: It was a great job being it was over night and barely anyone ever came in the store even though it was a 24/7 Supercenter. The best part was the hour lunch breaks. It actually gave you time to enjoy your lunch and nobody likes to be rushed while they’re eating.

title: Unrealistic Expectations
review: Upper management does not care about you as a supervisor. All they do is give unrealistic expectations, and then proceed to get mad when you do not complete. The job is insanely stressful for what it is, and your direction is changed all the time.

title: I enjoyed it.
review: Management was great. I liked my coworkers. The work wasn't too hard. Down-stacking was a nice break from being on the floor. And the place was air-conditioned.

title: I ended up working there 15 years
review: It doesn't have the 401K that matches your money anymore for your retirement savings and the insurance has gotten worse but other than that they've gotten a little bit better with their wages and it's actually really easy to get into management I started as a manager just cuz I had management experience. You mean a lot of people cuz there's a lot of turnover but if you get a good group of managers over you that teach you how to do their jobs you get promoted like that and that's how you just keep going and you'll get there you'll get to the top if you want to. The only people I see that might have trouble are the people who still have younger kids who can't spend all the time away from their homes because the kids need their parent

title: Just a job
review: Favoritism at its finest,management only care for themselves!the point system sucks and the pay should be better,they let the customers disrespect us and if we defend ourselves we can get fired and so on.

title: Terrible.
review: They give you no vacation or sick days without you running it by management first and even then they will still say no so you either have to suffer all day in there or just quit.

title: 1 department is what keeps the store from chaos
review: Worked for bakery walmart stocking overnight, bakery management was beautiful (kind,hundle,seriously joking while quickly working every station , so were the store boss, only problem was with night shift managers and hiring managers forgetting crucial components to do the job correctly and functioning. Everyone steals crucial devices from every department, no accountability, a lot of in-house politics.

title: Nice
review: Nice adores and the color of your skin and your skin are beautiful I would like a little bit more detail in your skin to make your hair more vibrant but you are so

title: Love helping customers
review: Everyday I get to meet new people as well as helping them with their needs to find items or information on items they purchase. The upper management  is very unprofessional , along with the store lead HR person. If you are a new hire you will not get the help you need.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Realistically nothing it's a bad place with worse peopleWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything if you fall behind by 1 minutes you get yelled at if you have to go to the bathroom you have to tell someone and if you try to go to the bathroom in the last hour of your shift you with get in troubleWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Bad work environment and rude people to work with there is so little good about the job except the payWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Unload a truck for 3 hour work stocking shelves for about an hour then go to lunch come back keep working and if you fall slightly behind get yelled at

title: Great
review: Made it easy to work for them, consistent pay and benefits, friendly employees and managers. Liked the location as well, relatively as clean as a walmart can be

title: Rather die than go back
review: They don’t care about employees. Only profit. They look down on people and speak to you as if you are less than nothing. Very negative environment. DO NOT APPLY.

title: Good Co-workers, Bad Management
review: When I got there, they sat me down in front of a computer, and made me go through utterly irrelevant lessons on things that could not happen in my store. The co-workers were great, and trained me more than my trainer. The HR department was horrible, and would move my schedule around to the point of breaking company policy.

title: Great for experience then potential advancement
review: I worked for OSL years ago. Loved it for the most part. They approved any events I planned. Gave me travel pay to help other stores. The vendors for the providers at my location were great and my team super competitive so made me work harder. Ended with many awards. Only issue is management team changed so often so didn’t always have support, and work life wasn’t great. Also many people came to me about lack of training. I was offered a management position but am concerned about training because I always went 100% in my job. I feel if I take it I might be getting set up for failure and don’t want that for my team.

title: On your feet
review: Definitely reliable and it was fun just having to shop. Really depends on management and coworkers. The last location I worked at the team leads always placed me in dispensing in the cold and snow and def had favs. They also never accepted my time off requests.  Only good part is the pay and benefits

title: Awful
review: dont do it i do not recommend for anyone who enjoys their day. if you like coming to work to pick up other peoples slack then this is the place for you

title: It is good for temporary work
review: The management where I worked was good. I had a fun time while I worked here, but I won't get a permanent job.  My first day of job training was awful. I had to ask them to train me. I have seen new people every week and they quit their jobs so easily.

title: Toxic management
review: Pay is ok, but not great for having to deal with entitled customers. Management expects you to let customers speak to you any type of way. Store and assistant managers only care about customer and not employees.

title: Job security/advancement
review: If you have some sort of chronic illness that will worsen over time, do not work here for very long. They are not very accommodating and will cut you loose if things get too bad for you. They also provide little to no support for people with mental disabilities or illnesses.

title: Cashier
review: Being a Cashier at Walmart is annoying, working on a cash register is great and it's fast-paced but then when you get on a watching self-checkout then things can get slow-paced and annoying

title: Even customers will tell you that we are short staffed
review: I have worked for the company for nearly 15 years and there are some ups and many downs. The difference on how Walmart wants their stores to run has drastically changed and is only spirally down. Somedays everyone works together, and projects and assignments get done, there really is a sense of purpose. But the majority of the time the whole store is short-staffed, customers complain often about not being helped due to short staff, a massive amount of micromanagement and the standards for everyone are not the same. You can call for help over and over again and only the same people respond while the rest are doing it themselves. Management talks down to associates and arguments over the walkie. The store preaches teamwork, but you get screwed most of the time if you're a decent employee. Productivity is something they complain about often, yet no real training is done and put on the team leads to do they don't even have the time to train since they are pulled all around.  If you are good at your job, they pull you left and right, and you don't get a pay difference even if you spend the majority of your time in a higher-paying area. Only certain people are cross-trained for everything while the majority of the people get away with not doing anything outside their department. Customers know that we are understaffed, but that’s not even the case, it’s them saying that “we are over hours” and then we get cut hours. The pay can be decent if you are in management, but the pay is never great if you are constantly dealing with entitled customers and creeps. Overall, MOST (not all) of - more...

title: Fun job
review: The digital department is a fun job that basically allows you to work at your own pace within certain parameters. I really enjoy it and it pays pretty well.

title: Decent pay & hours, the management can be fishy
review: Throughout years of working here I encountered many managers who treated the workers like trash, where unprofessional and it would take countless reports for this to be dealt with (sometimes it was just brushed under the rug) the pay was decent

title: Ok
review: The work is not bad or hard. The most difficult part is dealing with unreasonable managers! I don't like it anymore. It is time to find something else. I like the area I am In but not the management.

title: Not the best job
review: Working there is not the best. It is hard and rare to get a promotion. The managers are not fair. But Walmart does have a lot of benefit for their employees on WalmartOne that the managers do not tell you.

title: Work was fun
review: Work was fun. Got to work and socialize with customers great job. Really enjoyed my short time there. Would work there again, had to quit because i moved.

title: It Was Okay
review: Walmart was alright at first, management quality quickly went downhill after my first 90 days.  The people that work there are nice but get cycled out quickly.

title: Don’t Do It
review: Extremely messy work environment. There was always conflict among employees. Management didn’t really do anything to rectify the situation. I am happy to be rid of that place.

title: Fun and by the book
review: Very corporate orientated, but still not a bad place to work if you are the type of person to put pride in to your job.

title: Very boring
review: Managers do zero work, while the associates are left to make certain quotas. Very unprofessional work environment. No matter what even if you go to the hospita,  if you don’t have time you get points.

title: Not the best place to work but it pays the bills
review: Not the best place to work in my opinion but if management likes you they'll work with you but if they don't well good luck. I've had management work with me extremely well and others that didn't want to at all and liked to fire everyone on site.

title: People
review: There are favorites, no one is held responsible and if your a regular hourly associate you can do just about anything you want, Leads are the blame for everything as well

title: Management
review: A typical day in electronics is to keep up with merchandising, customer service, and taking care of the backroom. Management will often tell you to do one thing but then 10 minutes later tell you to do something else when you are in the middle of doing an hour long project.

title: The workers are amazing. Mangers and coaches are not.
review: I think they should promote more people and not just move already promoted people around. Their coaches need better communication skills. And their team lead in ogp needs retrained. Favoritism is a big thing in that department. They over use the good employees and the lazy ones play on their phones and watch.also they need to learn to make all people equally dispense so one person isn't doing it for 7-8 hrs like me.

title: Meh
review: Honestly don’t do it working for Walmart is like working for nothing. The pay is awful for the amount of work they’ll have you doing. I worked in apparel and frozen and dairy, somehow I knew almost every department cause they always have you doing someone else’s job and you won’t be compensated if they pay more for the department they have you covering.

title: Not fun workplace, understaffed and unappreciated
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Absolutely nothing, they over work you and you get nothing in returnWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?They over work you and you don’t even get a thank you What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Horrible busy understaffed and unorganzied

title: stocking items on shelf. working in the cold area
review: long nights.i learned team work is always a success when working together.how to put items on the shelf the right way.the manager be okay some days.the hardest part is when i have to work in the freezer. the fun part is when its almost time to go home

title: Awful place to work
review: This place is a joke. Upper Management talks down to you like your trash. People are hired and quit within days cause they see how it is. There’s a high turn around. They fire you if you miss more then 5 days. You can’t talk. They just push you to work work work and faster faster faster like a sweat shop.

title: Productive
review: Walmart can be an awesome place to work it is one of the higher paying company for people with experience. It depend on management how a store is ran

title: Bien
review: Oportunidades de trabajo de labor y buen trato con el personal

title: Mostly great people and a solid place to work
review: Every employer has their bad apples and process issues, but overall this is one of the best places to work.Great benefits, flexible scheduling, decent pay and fun people to work with.

title: It pays.
review: Probably ok if you're young and single or retired and looking for something to pass time. Not so great for those who commute and have a family. Work is remedial and straight forward.

title: Busy, customer oriented,  fast paced
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Insurance,  promote from within, stock buying options , decent payWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Salary works alot of hours and travels someWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly, children's miracle network What is a typical day like for you at the company?Depends on,what your job is but 8 hour days with 1,hr lunch for hourly, alot more for salary

title: Ok Place to work
review: Wallmart has been a steady job for the time being. It was rough during COVID but I was able to make it through and still have my job. Decent money for decent work.

title: Great place to work
