review: Really good team here they all care about you as long as you’re a good employee that goes in to make sure the job is done correctly & on time, like you should, everybody will have your back & work will also be enjoyable not just work. I really recommend working here

title: always something new to encounter
review: Never a dull moment. Always something to do to stay busy. Paid training. Super easy to learn everything they want you to know. Many advancement opportunities.

title: It's OK but not a career
review: It's OK when managers on you to do everything fast for their 100 dollar bonus and pay sucks.... it's ok for a temporary job nothing else nothing more.

title: Lots of work to do.
review: Do you want to be overworkered, yet underpaid? Expected to do way more than what they say during the interview? Walmart is for you. I don't have anything nice to say, since I personally was expected to do the work of about 3 people, and had to handle things that salaried positions were supposed to take care of.

title: Overwhelming
review: Worked here for less than a year because managers had favorites and made all other employees work harder for their slack. Wouldn’t consider going back . Atleast to the location I was at

title: Boarding
review: The company sucks you don’t get paid for the time you punch in and they don’t except docs notes the people are rude no one is friendly at all the team managers are rude and mean

title: Flexible hours
review: I worked as Fashion associate, folding and recover for ppl work closing shift. Friendly team members and helpful DM. Some Managers there just be nice when they need and ask you to do stuff, after they will show how rude and bossy they are and not appreciated what you did. When not busy time, they give short hours for PT.

title: Horrible place to work
review: This was a nightmare, always being yelled at, overworked, expected to pick up others slack, and underpaid.

title: Over worked
review: They have you work everywhere CSM was a joke he would leave all the work lode to the rest of overnight cashiers to do on the other hand the other 2 csm were awesome

title: Unorganized
review: They’ll cycle through garbage managers and still not have any type of organizing. Expect to do more than you got hired for. Don’t trust anybody higher up.

title: Orderfiller freezer
review: Everyman for them selves they care about one thing and one thing only and that’s Walmart thee work environment at 7055 is very poor don’t even bother pay looks good but when it’s only part time hours it don’t pan out save yourself the HEADACHE AND TROUBLE

title: Good job if you're uneducated and have no Hope
review: Absolutely no instructions from day one. Poor management top to bottom. The best managers are on the floor making it happen with no title. You'll work 20 years and make $5/hr more than when you started. Management always hires their favorites not best workers with brains. If you call in 5 times in 6 months you're fired, no excuses. It's just a sweatshop full of cheap to mid-range products made in China and I would advise you to look elsewhere for employment.

title: The good is manager's are very nice.
review: The company needs to come up with a better point system when you are sick. They also need to understand that not every sickness you need to go to the doctor. They also needs to take doctor excuses and not give you a point for being sick. The point system should be changed to 7 days not 5. You should give people a chance to work after the 7 days if it's there first time out sick.

title: Never again.
review: It’s all good at first but then they show there true colors. They really don’t care about the workers at all. Your just a number to them. They change all the time seems like every week there’s something new. Reliability hours are trash especially if you have a family it’s not enough. Some of there TLs are so rude and some don’t deserve to be a TL in the way they talk to people you can tell they choose just anyone who has no experience in being a leader. Just awful never again and they pay low for how the world has gone up in price.

title: To stressful
review: I often go home with my chest hurting bad head ache and feeling like I'm not wanted management could do better  they also have favorite employees let others get away with things

title: Good pay and straight forward
review: Straight forward job and the work environment was okay. I worked the night shift and everyone seemed chill. The pay was great. Besides holidays the job is pretty easy.

title: Short staffed
review: The St Albans store is incredibly short staffed. Despite this they are letting people go causing a greater problem with staffing and this greatly impacts the stress level because everything still needs to be done even if there aren't enough of people to physically do it. A culture of do more and do it faster has been created.

title: Exciting job
review: A exciting something new everyday job, downside lack of training and support. Very tough if coming from management in the main retail part of Walmart and no experience in healthcare or optical.

title: Is OK til you get hurt
review: The place is great, but as soon as you get hurt, they give you the boot even if drug test and all came back clean. I was sent to 1 of their doctors was cleared to go back to work and next thing I knew was being called into management office and being fired.

title: Degrading and miserable workplace
review: Management isn't attentive to needs of employees or customers. Workload often gets increased without a pay raise or other compensation. Complete neglect of policies from higher ups. Terrible working experience, wouldn't recommend.

title: Retail
review: Plenty of hours but was understaffed most of the time. Most days there was two people working multiple areas and always rushing. Pay was okay but could be better.

title: Working fast only to be told you are too slow
review: Don't bother breaking your back for Walmart, they could care less. All they want is for you to work inhumanly fast and hard. But no matter how fast and hard you work management will be on to you.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part was helping the customers and making sure everything was stocked What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The staff was horrible. Didn't know how to talk to people What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile. The culture was greatWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Coming in scanning and making sure everything is stocked

title: Cool people
review: Facilities these days look for mules they can replace. Not the best, not the worst warehouse I have worked at. Good employee involvement, bad management

title: Not fun
review: People there are terrible. It’s all drama, they will target you and drive you to wanna quit. They don’t take doctors notes. They have a 5 point system. They’re disrespectful and draining

title: Management Needs Help
review: There's a lack of communication between management which in the end, ends up falling on associates. Sometimes i find that managements wants regular associates to do what they make the big bucks to take care of, like at most jobs. but walmart has it bad.

title: Time consuming
review: The work here was fairly easy once you get the knowledge of knowing where all the items are. Requires a lot of fast pace work and mobility such as getting on your knees

title: Hated it
review: Bad for your mental health ,never felt safe,terrible management, worst company ever 10/10 don’t recommend great pay great benefits but it’s not worth the way you will be treated

title: A cool place to work
review: The environment is filled with positivity which contributes to outstanding customer service. While remaining active in work actives their are still moments to make it a fun experience.

title: Best of the Retail Pharmacies
review: Im lucky to work here.  Only wish I would have known earlier in my career.  Pay is great, PTO is easy and management is fair and competent.  Very happy here.

title: Just alot of unreasonable management and favoritism. You work most holidays and your days off are split up.
review: The work is not bad or hard. The most difficult part is dealing with unreasonable managers! I don't like it anymore. It is time to find something else. I like the area I am In but not the management.

title: Teamwork
review: It was very rewarding working at Walmart. You become a part of a large family. You become a great piece of the puzzle. You join with people who become a great part of your life.

title: Loss Prevention
review: Great environment to learn and grow, management was great.employees were a second family, consistent hour, opportunities for career advancement weekly training to advance skills.

title: Nice Place
review: This specific Walmart has an high turnover however, it was still a fun and nice place to work at. Majority of the staff gets along with each other. Just do what you are required to do based on your job description and there isn't any major issue.

title: Good job
review: Good job, decent pay. Easy interview process.. Not for someone who has kids and needs time off, walmart doesn't like to give its employees much time off, even in an emergency.

title: Bad management and rude managers
review: bad management in the workplace and bad managers. managers were rude and did not give time off. Pushed employees to do the job of two to three people.

title: Cool workplace with cool co workers for the most parts
review: My experience wasn't as bad because the co-workers made it worth it and the leads were cool for the most part management was shaky at times. sometimes expected you to do more then what's possible

title: Not fun
review: Not a good place to work...no raise pay every year at the end or the beginning of the year they take your half of your vacation they cut your time whenever they want to when your body is struggling to make it they want to cut hours not a good place to work

title: Above average starting pay.
review: Above average starting pay.  Most of the managers are friendly.  Great co-works.  You earn Protected Paid Time off starting on day 1.  Even if you are PT.  PPTO can be used in as small as 15 min increments to avoid points for being late or leaving early. To move up from associate to management position you are required to have open availability in hours and days off.  This makes it difficult for moms to move up.

title: Neutral
review: My expirence working in bakery/deli was both good and bad. For the first 4 months I was there it was stressful but I felt my coworkers enjoyed my presence the remaining 2 months I started to see that my team lead was just another person who didn't actually like me. I asked for a different shift and was told no because I was too slow even tho I strongly expressed the need for a later shift soon.

title: Productive fast paced
review: We had a certain time limit to complete orders everyday . Managers had favorites . I liked the job but not the people in that building . Won’t consider working there again

title: It’s a production job
review: Walmart expects you to rearrange your life they will put you on mandatory overtime when they feel like it. So they will assign you a schedule but it could change at their discretion. The managers are rude and don’t care if you have kids. You o ot get 2/ 20 minute breaks on a 10-12 hour shift.

title: it’s a good job to work at for teenagers with no job and want would want to make easy money
review: What is the best part of working at the company?the pay is good for my age can’t complain What is the most stressful part about working at the company?nothing really stressful besides when they be lying about stuffWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?it’s decent not to bad to be honest What is a typical day like for you at the company?customers trying to steal things

title: Difficult management team and no possibly to grow
review: Worked at Walmart for 2 years in different departments. Very hard to grow and the management team doesn't have skills or lead well, most are more “bosses” than leaders. People that don't work well get more benefits than people that do work. Very unfair environment. Benefits are not super great and hours are hard to get, specifically overtime. If it's not busy commercial dates, most likely you will get hours cut.Health care and other benefits are not worth and it will take more than half of your paycheck. You can learn a lot, but not a store that I would recommend if you wanna a career.

title: It's high school drama
review: Some of my coworkers were great but the management high school drama  was terrible made it a miserable job. There is discrimination going on. The corporate ethics people are no help all Walmart cares about is what makes them money and how to keep cost down they only fake caring about employees

title: I love the people that I work with.
review: After spending years working at Dollar General, I am convinced that Walmart was my SAVING GRACE!! I absolutely love what I do. And my overnight crew is AWESOME. We not only do our job, we have fun doing it!! I feel as if this is truly where I should have been all along! I am blessed to call myself a WALMART team member!!

title: Great place for pay, Bad Management.
review: Great place for pay, Bad Management. Toxic work environment that will drain you of everything worth living for. Plus the fact they are cheap in regards to assisting people with disabilities.

title: i didn't like working but felt management tried to be helpful
review: i am not sure about what to write here. i think they treated me fairly but neither they nor i were happy about me being in this job of cashier, i was offered another job before i was let go but chose not to take it. there are company policies that are not user friendly.

title: Not bad
review: Follow culture and you will be fine. Be on time and willing to work . Sometimes stressful but you can’t let it get to you. You can make time when it is needed

title: Run never work for Walmart
review: Poor management. They don't want to give out no hours. I will never work for walmart again. This job stressed me out more than any job I have ever worked.

title: Understaffed
review: Walmart is a horrible company to work for! They like micro managing employees and like throwing people under the bus!👎management is horrible and lazy

title: Minimally stressful
review: I've been here for 10 months. It's calm the majority of the time.  However, I feel management can sometimes be b a tad harsh. It's not terrible. I would recommend this job, but just thoroughly read the job description first.

title: Great Retail Company
review: Great benefits, options to move up! Great pay!! I moved up to a management position in a year with Walmart..my day to day job duties include, team management, coaching, training, scheduling, leading and guiding my crew!! Ordering supplies..Cash management..making deposits.. investigation of all long and shorts

title: Not employee oriented
review: Supervisors are able to harass multiple employees with the side of the Supervisor taken by management. They don't take this seriously. Points are not supposed to be given if you are a parent and there is a snow day. They still do, and you have to hunt them down to take these points off. I fought with them for over two weeks to takes points off for this.

title: Cashier at Walmart
review: It was very fast paced with a lot of customers. Management was bad we had a new manager every other week. Pay was pretty good and you get a 10% discount card

title: Management sucks
review: Some people like myself have inside body disabilities. Manager told me to keep working even tho I was throwing up during my shift due to endometriosis. They have points and don’t care if your disability is causing you to not be able to do your job. If you run out of points you’re gone.

title: Okay
review: Favoritism is all ima say. Besides that job is great and good lay but if you are not friends with them you will lose your job. The pay was good for the job and we got breaks

title: Poor management
review: The crew i work with consider each other brothers, however the management is poor. It’s very easy to notice the lack of care and wasted man hours in that store. Besides that, it’s a decent job.

title: great management
review: management was great while i worked there, my shift lead was always super helpful. never caused any issues, always wanted me to better myself to achieve more with the company

title: Dusty, Yet welcoming
review: My journey with Walmart consisted of good pay, open minded managers, claustrophobic spaces, demanding customers and fluctuation in orders. I ordered being active all day! They are somewhat accommodating for nuerodivergent people. People are grumpy, ogp can vary depending on the location. You need to make sure they have good pace. Overpriced benefits. Amazing education opportunities. Slow advancement. Big community, good and bad.

title: Decent job
review: Work is easy, Coworkers are cool, lifting really heavy objects though if you’re a woman but not too bad. You have a rate that you have to keep up with and it’s not too hard to meet rate. Pay is a bit lower than what I’m used to for a warehouse job

title: CAP 2 Stocker
review: Being a CAP 2 at Walmart is one of the most straight forward. All you got to do is make space and set up the pallet in the receiving. That were you unload the trucks and there days you have one or two truck. From there you take the pallet to it designated station.

title: long tearm and depends on the store
review: ths job is amazing as long as you play by the rule and give 110 24/7 otherwise it will eat you alive you give it your all or go home. they take care of thier people as long as y take care of them

title: Very Productive
review: Making sure our customers are well satisfied with all the shipment sent out. Along with great products and a fun place to work. Making sure our community is satisfied and also happy with their purchase.

title: Good location
review: Loved it here, although management wasn’t the best, I always got my hours and pay. That I cannot complain about. This is one of the nicer locations, highly recommend.

title: Excellent place to work
review: All inclusive work place! Always feels like a team effort. They do things to make us feel special. Freebies through the year. Employee appreciation days. Games and competitions to make work fun.

title: Do not recommend
review: It's not terrible but management kind of sucks and you're underpaid at my location for the work in my department. If you're part time, your benefits suck and first of the yeat scheduling is minimal at best.

title: Fun workplace
review: Walmart Distribution brought a lot of good things to my life it's a good opportunity if your need a kickstart.You will have a chance to meet alot of good people.

title: Make some cash, maybe you’ll love it
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Very very little good can be saidWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lots and lots of people doing their best to hide and avoid work.  Management knows - they just don’t careWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Culture?   Non- existent.  Environment? Toxic

title: Hated the vibe
review: The vibes aren’t good and it constantly feels as if someone is judging you, not welcoming at all. Not kind and barely train some of the employees. The people there hate their jobs but won’t quit.

title: Waynesboro Ms Walmart 👎👎
review: Terrible manager and coaches. They walk around like they own Walmart. They never appreciate the hard workers. Only favorites and certain skin color get promoted.

title: it was ok
review: Please stay away from this toxic company. Don’t expect a raise no kind. The 2 people who do theare very sneaky and do respect there employees. You will be working on a contract assignment at DEP. There they show you no type of respect and they will over load you non stop work and assignments. If you enjoy a Stressful life and like being overworked apply. I worked there 4 years and trust me nothing has changed.

title: Great Team Members
review: I loved working with the team on over nights. Hard working people who like to have fun while they work. Management was ok, it just depended on who was working. Leadership switches out a lot.

title: Poor management, easy work
review: The overnight team leads at this location are not good. Work is easy, if not repetitive. You kinda get screwed by having to work the nights of major holidays while day shift gets it off.

title: Cool for high school kids
review: It's an ok place. Normal favoritism and sides the mgrs take. I learned to get out while you can because no matter how hard you work here the lazy associates get the praise.

title: Horrible place to work
review: No communication between management and workers if you get sick they will have you call a number then jump through hoops just to be off for how ever long it takes for you to get better then if the day they set for you to come back to work and you ain’t better they will fire you doesn’t care how there employees feel or how there treated just all around horrible place to work

title: This company does what it takes to save money, even if the workers suffer from these money making decisions.
review: In my "honest" opinion of 24 1/2 years of working for this company, is that ever since Sam had passed away, there has had been so many changes within the company, that it wouldn't have been how "he" would have done things.  A lot of what they have done, for example, is to take away the incentives that were originally given to the employees. Sam Walton, did things for the people, as where now a days, it's more about making the money/profits.

title: Great Company
review: Walmart definitely will set you up for success and they care about their drivers. Out of my 20 years of driving never had a company that really take care of their drivers. Totally different culture when it comes to that. The only reason for me leaving was because of family obligations that required me in being home. It is definitely the Bentley of driving. Great company….

title: You may not be there long enough to get the benefits.
review: The rules and policies will kill you. They are policy driven, not people driven. Very punitive environment. They have to pay high wages to keep decent people. And still they lose a lot of people. It's a swamp. They pay well but there's no job security. It's worth considering working a 60 hour job rather than being paid well here. You cannot trust anyone in management, period. You are less than cannon fodder. The money and benefits are not worth it. You will learn to hate yourself. If you do not have integrity; this is the place for you.

title: Standard cashiering job
review: Cashiering is exhausting on your feet, but we at least got breaks and lunches every 2 hours. My management in particular was terrible so that made things difficult, but could be worse.

title: Very great place to work if your willing to do the work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Everything including compensation wise, highest paying company in the market.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Days very on stress sometimes you'll have a great day with no problems other days you'll have couple of bumps in the road.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and very nice and respectful to other associates and customers

title: Terrible
review: Horrible management. The laziest most negative people I’ve ever met. Will never go back. Nobody takes pride in anything they do and if you have a complaint management does nothing about it and just laughs about it.

title: Fair pay and good work structure
review: Fair pay and good work structure. The only thing I didn’t like was the manager I grew or she did not support the staff and always tried to over work them. Very rude and inconsiderate of others.

title: Poorly managed
review: Management couldn't get employees to do their jobs which leaves hard workers more to do. Overall culture is bad if you wasn't in a certain circle you were harassed.

title: Great pay and excellent environment
review: I had a fantastic time showing up to work and being surrounded by good vibes. Work is work but it helped that I didn’t have coworkers reminding me of how awful it could be and instead were excited to pass time by getting our work done and communicating about whatever.

title: Horrible management
review: Clock in, sort clothing, put clothing away, go to lunch, and take two 15 minute breaks.Learned to claims clothing, shoes and baby food.Management was horrible, 2 of the team leads had favorites, and they did not care to show it. Instead punishing all the employees for "time fraud" they only punished one of the team members (yes there was several employees who committed the time fraud). They had too many people in management and not enough people that actually worked. The work place culture was horrible.The hardest part was going in every day because you did not know what to expect from the team leads (management).Getting to go home.

title: Understaffed
review: The Fresh department was always understaffed, leaving a lot of work for a few employees. Management was easygoing and understanding for the most part. If you did the job, they wouldn't bother you.

title: Managment
review: The organization and help or feed back from every department in management was absolutely horrible and there was no communication. Attitudes towards employees was the worst part

title: A horrible waist of 9 years of my life.
review: management is verry buddy oriented if you do not become one of their buddies you do not move up. I worked hard there 9 years was one of the best workers but because I would not let them talk to me however, they wanted and would challenge them I was always denied promotions. you must be a yes mam person if you want to move up in walmart.  for some reason I thought some day they would reward hard work, but joke was on me.

title: Good job short term
review: Always busy we always had something to do so time flew by really quick. Overtime leads and coaches expect more from you everyday.The cons was there was obvious favoritism.After new management came in they wanted to remove all leads into new leads.

title: Horrible
review: Horrible company to work for. Don’t like it don’t care about employees don’t help if you need it don’t care about outside life don’t care it fill you sick.

title: Good
review: Good good I’m very good company amazing company to work floor Im loving it it’s the best everybody should work here I mean everybody it’s Amazing I love it

title: Ok pay
review: Too much drama, no clear directions. Would not recommend working at any Walmart. I’ve been a manger down to a regular associate and I had the same issues with Walmart everytime.

title: Limited workspace due to high customer volume.
review: Typical day as a stocker was fine if working with individuals of a similar work tempo. Difficult to meet manager's expectations with limited workspace.

title: Really fun environment, great schedule, easy job, good pay, bad management.
review: They were realy good with schedules and giving us the best days off that would be best suited for us but it was really hard to get fulltime here. The job was really easy for 15 an hour and   coworkers there were awesome. Management really sucked and never listened to employees.

title: fun productive
review: Working at Walmart has been a decent experience. The company culture is inclusive and supportive, but the hours can be long and scheduling is not always flexible. Overall, a decent workplace with room for improvement.

title: i’ll never work for a walmart again
review: was tossed into a department i made it clear i knew nothing about, and was given poor training. management talked badly about me and others in the department consistently. anytime i tried to bring issues to the attention of management i was ignored. random coworkers would’ve rude for no reason, and some of them didn’t wash their hands after using the bathroom EW. you couldn’t touch ANYTHING without feeling grime afterwards. basically no one gave a ****. such a gross place to work.

title: It's not a good job
review: Management doesn't care about employees at all and it most definitely shows in the way they react to things. Your problem certainly aren't their concern at all and the pay isn't good.

title: Fun Coworkers, Fast-Paced Environment, Unlimited Demands
review: I know the title of my review sounds negative, but honestly, working in OGP was so much fun while it lasted! The coworkers are great, the managers actually care about their staff, and the pay is pretty good as far as things go! Never even needed a drug test (a HUGE plus for any fellow medicinal users out there.) I ended up leaving due to stress and personal reasons, mainly the latter. But beware; corporate is CONSTANTLY raising labor expectations and always scrutinizing every little stat. This can get extremely stressful and bears weight on everybody. And of course, you'll be working on the Walmart salesfloor, so be prepared for the special brand of Walmart customers. If fast paced is your thing and you like meeting/interacting with people, 100% go for it! I'll always be grateful for the people I worked with there who really carried the whole experience. 🌸

title: Fun place
review: Love my coworkers and the work isn’t too hard but does keep you busy, you learn amazing customer service skills. If you don’t like customer interactions then you wouldn’t like it. You learn new things like using the computer system to solve customer issues.

title: Hard work but rewarding
review: They are very demanding but the benefits are worth it. Being a "24 hour" associate is not easy especially getting 2am phone calls from dispatch but you don't have to go.

title: Lack of hours or forced overtime no inbetween
review: Very hard production goals.  No excuses for missing scheduled overtime.  Very hard to get off weekend shift once on that schedule.  Made a lot of really cool people though.

title: Better pay poor management
review: All in all not a bad place to work. Told me it was going to make 13 hour but it was really 11 an hour for a while and then it went up to 13. I got fired for being sick.

title: Hard working environment
review: You will stay busy and the shifts are 9 or more hours long for full time employees and you don't get enough breaks you will work outside if needed regardless of the weather and management is very strict

title: Okay at best
review: The job is just okay. Very busy store, there is almost always something going going on and a fair amount of people there, which can be good and bad, good because it means you'll always have something to do, but bad because it can get quite stressful at times. Management isn't great but they're nice most of the time. Above average pay for a starting retail job but still could be better. Overall, not a job you want to stick with for too long, but a decent option for if you really need work on short notice.

title: Nice Pay Long Hours
review: This is a nice place to work, the pay was nice, the hours was long. The workers are nice management is helpful at time. Overall this is a nice place to work

title: Negative work environment
review: It was unprofessional and drama filled I wouldn’t recommend working there. Management is very disrespectful. If you work here be prepared to have your guard up

title: Dangerous
review: They will literally run you into the ground and still ask you to give them whatever you have left. Long shifts, very strict rules, and god awful heat in the summer and spring months.

title: Fun place to work
review: Pays good for the work. Was a fun experience and would reccomend anytime. Got plenty of hours and enjoyed my coworkers the most..don't expect much from management.

title: Just walmart
review: Wasn’t great. Wasn’t bad. If you can avoid shoot for the stars and find something that makes you happy. It’s okay to start small. And start young. Just don’t stay at Walmart ur whole life.

title: Great team
review: Great team. Everyone worked well together ,  pharmacist and pharmacy managers were all great. Would continue working there if I did not move out of state

title: Decent working environment
review: Great job and benefits, however, the high school like culture leaves a lot to be desired. Like most things in life, it is what you make of it. Flexible schedule and hours are a plus.

title: Productive and great place to work
review: Just all depends on mangers and what store you will be working at the store I worked at was great mangers was friendly and had great attitudes and wasn’t hateful at all

title: Terrible Management
review: The management was horrible you were always looks down upon so when you need something you don't get it. They were always understaffed, I always found myself getting stuck on my shifts completely alone they had 4 cart pushers hired for all 7 days of the week at different times. Not once while I was there (7-8ish months) did they hire a new cart pusher. They also wanted you to manage the entire parking lot alone and when you physically couldn't customers and staff would both yell at you. If you took a break for 3 minutes due to fatigue the people working inside would be upset it was a horrible toxic workspace

title: Wasn’t a good fit
review: I picked this position up for some extra cash the entire company was so unorganized there wasn’t any training provided and management was a joke they didn’t even realize that I hadn’t been working there for over two months

title: Productive
review: great place to work, flex able hours, opportunities to grow and move up in positions. great staff and management. clean facilities and decent pay .

title: Underpaid
review: Print solutions is a smooth and easy job to work at nine of the jobs are real physical labor but easy going. Compared to other Walmart bulildingss this one is easy

title: Great pay, great benefits, the physicality of this job was extremely hard,  but I think I did an exceptional job
review: Very excited when I got this job.  It was 3rd shift 11 hours (6:30pm-6:00am) 3 days a week Saturday, Sunday, and Monday.  Very hands on and physical, fast paced, and stood up the whole shift.  Had to b able to lift  50+lbs.  I had a nightly quota expected of me and you had to be very self motivated and able to work alone.  I liked this job very much and my coworkers were great.  Covid is the reason I did not return

title: Fun
review: Would recommend working here it’s easy and fast paced along as you do order right it’s a easy job I would highly recommend working here and doing this job

title: Easy work
review: Unload trucks and stock shelves decent pay for a full time position more money on the overnight shift management good for the most part work 5 days a week 40 hours minimal

title: Productive and fun workplace.
review: The job is fairly straightforward. At the start of the night you will get your department assignment. After that, go to your department and start stocking freight on the shelves. If you finish up early, a team lead will advisw you where to go next. At the end of the night, you will tidy up and make sure your zone is good.

title: Okay if you are young and don't gaf
review: If you are over 35, be ready to be treated like you are a burden-by coworkers, not customers. The people you work with make or break the job. When I started, I loved it. Ten years later and I was never so miserable in my life.

title: Exhausting and a waste of time
review: Management always pushes you too hard to meet your times and their expectations. You get burnt out very quickly, and while they do provide insurance and pay is $14.50 for overnights in my state, I would not recommend. They really don't care about you as a worker. They push for unrealistic goals, and you will get 40 hours, but you'll hate your life.

title: Don’t ever work for Walmart!!!
review: Walmart really needs a unit they do not like outspoken people they would rather you listen and shut up. Just learn how to start kissing 🍑 to make it you’ll be perfectly fine.

title: Super easy job, so many rules that make it impossible.
review: It was really cold during the winter, i wore a hoodie and got written up because of it, i tried to explain i have nothing warmer but they wouldnt take it. I got written up a second time for having the cup ball string toy, (where you had to get the ball in the cup) i got written up agaim for having that even tjough my customer service was outstandingly better than 100 percent of the people upfront. Ontop of that i was allways wanting to be better and learn to become a team lead, it was obvious i was good at the job, so infact they ended up telling me that theres no roles to fill but im really good at the job.

title: Terrible
review: Poorly ran. Management only cares about appearances. Equipment is cheap and breaks regularly. Service writing is some of the worst I have ever experienced.

title: Fun coworkers and different work to do
review: Managers were very nice and helpful.  Team leads were always understanding and caring, the work was very physical and fast paced.  I liked the variety and always doing something different day to day

title: Work at your own risk
review: This place is a joke, management doesn’t know what they are doing and will fire you for anything also don’t you dare get hurt at the job Bcus they will fire you after

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I have worked at Walmart Osgood Road, Fremont for over 3 yrs, my experienced working there i must say was great cos i enjoyed doing every task i was assigned to do, and not to mention the people i have worked with who are great and awesome. I love this working place, and if there is a working place that i will consider going back to… it is Walmart. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some costumers who were being not so nice. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Excellent. Employees are awesome and will at all times attend to costumers needs. What is a typical day like for you at the company?My typical day starts as i get up too early in the morning around 2:30am and try to get to work 30 minutes before start time.

title: Time goes by fast
review: Busy work. Great ppto for part timers. 10% off GM products.  Free Walmart +.  If you don’t want to work hard, then don’t stock. This make’s overnight go really fast.

title: It’s a job
review: the management sucks horribly lots of miserable people who are locked in and guilt tripped into staying or working over and doing favors for the bosses expecting something in return that will never come and don’t expect to move up unless you become real tight with upper management everyone is very serious and uptight on the hourly employee level salary management for the most part is just there.

title: Glad I moved on
review: Great associates, senior leadership needs changes in behaviors. Instead of chasing netrics actually fix the root cause issues  take care of your asso iates and they will take care of the customers

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There isn't one. Its like high school. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything the managers are liars and are two faced. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?High school. If you don't kiss butt then you don't matterWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress. Drama. Wonder what your team lead will start on you about

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The team workWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?We have a great teamWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?We all get along and help one anotherWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Great ! We have a unique bunch of team members

title: Good people, not great policies
review: The people I worked with were really sweet but they have a points system attendance so it often feels like you or others have to come to work sick or in terrible weather. It felt like we were always short staffed though and the push to use self checkouts by management makes a lot of customers angry.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Friendly staff and the profit shares. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When it is a holiday season it is.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?They can stay busy, yet be helpful.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I worked several positions,  and just kept busy.

title: They suck
review: Booooo never ever gain they really need to change management and the pay is absolutely horrendous treat workers and does not care about anyone and are very rude and non understanding

title: if you just need a job it's not the worst place to work, but i hope you have better managers then I did.
review: I felt like the management didn't care and kind of did whatever they felt. and there was a manager that had a bad superiority complex. I constantly felt like the managers were trying to retaliate with employees if they weren't performing to their standards.

title: You feel very replaceable
review: Its very easy to get fired, job is very unorganized, accorurence system sucks, would not recommend unless its ur first job ever and u need to put something on ur resume.

title: Do not work here
review: Would not recommend working at Walmart corporation or walmart stores. The management does not care about employees. They will push you out the door and you will be mentally drained.

title: Terrible place to work. Unrealistic expectations and terrible management.
review: Overall they expect you do do what no human can do. They constantly had problems with employees meeting job quotas. But if people that have been there for 20+ years are saying that they can’t do it because it’s too much, it’s impossible. These expectations may be realistic if the management was helping stock, but most of the time they’re walking around not doing anything and they zone. But if they walk around zoning all day, why do we need to take 30 minutes of time out of our stocking time to zone an aisle when we should be moving freight.

title: Flexible
review: It was a good place to work and get steady pay when I used to work there. They had an app come out for scheduling or trading shifts which was nice. Good for trying to get a money flow

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing goodWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?EverythingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Coworkers help you more than management's helpWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Folding close all day

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Stocking  shelf's that is about itWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?That they want u to know we're everything go in a month cuz u have a time to get ur stuff done byWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It is all bull it like ur in high school an the team leaders an much of leadersWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful an it like I have to rush to get it done

title: It’s a okay job
review: Working at Walmart they benefit are good but management are not they really don’t work with you I being there for 6years going on 7years March 29th the management are very nasty and rude you can better get days off if like you sick or have a doctor appointment it get denied

title: A nice rhythm to the work, friendly people
review: I have had a good experience at Walmart.   My coworkers are some of the nicest people I have ever met.   I like that the work is pretty much the same every day.  The management at my store are supportive and helpful and really care about the employees.  I wish the job paid more.

title: Not a company you want to work as a salaried
review: Salaried here equals we own you. The raises are poor if at all. Ver long hours since they don’t have to pay overtime for salaried. Say goodbye to your holidays, say goodbye to your weekends, say goodbye to enjoying your life.

title: ok place to work
review: walmart is okay to work for if you dont have a family to support. the hours are unstable at times but the people you work with can be fun if you dont take things seriously and just do your job.

title: It’s a job
review: If you like the movie final destination. Your about to live it. It’s also a nightmare on repeat, that never ends. They will suck your soul right out of you, and use it as a towel to wipe up the tears of all the damned souls that got trapped and can never leave.

title: Good job extremely dependable on management
review: You don't quit bad jobs, you quit bad bosses.With that being said, working at any level of this company will be hard when you have unprepared managers.

title: Overall good place to work.
review: I enjoyed my time working for the company. I worked there two separate times, and was able to advance in my career easily and it gave me many opportunities to learn different skills.

title: Great experience
review: Good entry level job to get experience and learn new things. Easy to apply and easy interview.made lots of friends. Opportunity to advance eventually if you work hard

title: Good job
review: Benefits are great. Stocking,cashier and other depts as needed. However the company did change over time. Do your work and keep a paper trail for everything you do

title: Different areas to give you a sense of accomplishment if you could ever get the opportunity
review: You never knew what to expect from day to day. After you figured out what to do the work itself wasn't bad. I did learn real quick that they expected you to know the job and what went where from day one. They didn't offer to train and gave judgement for not knowing. They also would promise wage increases but gave a pay cuts instead. The hardest part of my job there was dealing with management and the lack of accountability, and the favoritism shown within the employee assignments. If you could get passed all that the actual work itself was not bad at all. Time went fast and it was different from day to day.

title: Friendly place to work.
review: Decent place to work.  Friendly coworkers. Not too bad a pay.  Work was not too stressful.  Third shift hours take time to adjust to.  I would recommend Walmart as a place to work.

title: Great Work Place
review: It's A Nice And Quite Work Place For Over Night Stocking. It's alot of Pallets, Boxes With Items That's Has To Be Stocked, The bad Part it's So Bad But having To Be In Two Places At A Times When Trucks Come In we're Unloading But We Also Have Our Stocking To Have Done But I Always Get The Job Done. I Enjoy Working At Walmart Helping Customers Find Idems.

title: Great job fit advancement
review: I loved working at the Walmart distribution center. It's a very fast paced, safe, workplace. After a year you can train for a different position inside the workplace. Unfortunately I had to leave to take care of my mother who had Leukemia.so it was either quit because I WOULDN'T have had enough PPTO or PTO time saved for as much as she had to get chemo.
position: Forklift operator he gf ya 6 it it to

title: Store manager makes or breaks it
review: Salaried management is abused and hourly employees are cut back. They play favorites all the way to the top. No work/life balance. They make changes that look good on paper, but when implemented it’s impossible, but they still hold you to that “on paper” standard.

title: Working for the Antichrist
review: Possibly one of the most damaging companies in all of the world on many different scales, ecological, ethically, and culturally. You are a thrall to one of the worst corporations in the world and they let you know daily how replaceable you are all the way up the totem pole. Most leaders are veterans of the company who often times don't even like the thought of working and would sell their firstborn for a raise to meet obnoxious, abhorrent corporate quotas.

title: Shipping loader
review: I was working in Walmart in March 29th.go to learning for study to computer for program of job rule I learning to work on unloading truck and set up in where box with number on it put on box together.Management told to team in working on unloading truck and some body go to work on Towel paper and Chemical. My Co-worker go to work on Computer for Order and get hours of work for unloading and check how much hours you work in there.I working hardest the of job in there for unloading truck a then go to work on pallet on box for stuff in there. The most enjoyable part of the job at Walmart was working with my team members..

title: Upper Management is all about favoritism
review: Most of your fellow associates are awesome with the exception of a few management favorites. Upper management will literally try to work you to death and always want more or tell you to work faster. They don’t acknowledge how much you’ve already done, they just want to know why you didn’t do more.

title: Stocking freight
review: Had to stock freight assist customers Managers treat you like they own you and then disrespect you and treat you poorly if you don't do what they say pay no good

title: Not bad
review: It's a pretty decent company to work for. I was there for about ten years. I loved my coworkers, and most of management. The only thing I really didn't like was how they constantly change their company policies. Just as we would get used to one thing, they would change it again. Overall, it's a typical retail environment. It is what you make of it.

title: Bad leadership
review: overnight mangers treat you like you don't matter and talk to anyone they don't like as if they don't know anything. There no actual training you just get tossed into it

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Walmart cares about their employees less than any other company I've ever worked for. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Horrible managementWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Working at Walmart is horrible they do not train which represents the culture they have there most people don't know what they're doingWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Giant headache

title: Good job, poor management
review: Overall the job is decent, you can get along with majority of the customers and coworkers there. Just the management pick and choose when to do right by you. one of the managers that worked at the store cut my hours drastically all because I wasn’t available to work Sunday due to religious reasons. They’ll act like they care but only if you do right by them

title: It's normal.
review: Normal stocking job, it is very easy job, you literally can not do it poorly, management is fine, I wish they would give more hours consistently but whatever

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits and pay What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough helpWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?You don't move up because you qualify for the position most of the time! But it's ok.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Some days are ok.

title: The absolute worst place to work
review: i am a former employee and i was with the company for 7 months, looking forward to more than a year to work for the company. i remember i used to enjoy getting up and getting ready for work there but it was soon to change due to the weak management, the feeling of putting so much hard work and dedication to benefit the company and team that i was on but apparently it wasn’t enough for them to help move good the strong, motivated, enthusiastic, etc employees the company does have working for them in a position to move up in the company. it seems as if they only want to keep who they have that are in the upper management positions in their positions and do not want anyone who actually would and want to help benefit the company because if you’ve worked at the walmart in North Olmsted, Ohio on brookpark road you know that all supervisors “team leads/coaches” walk around the store get into conversations that have nothing to do with the task at work for the day and look for reasons to pull someone into the office to write up or terminate an employee. lastly the best way to describe this walmart is if you could imagine grown women/men in their 30’s-40’s that act like they’re teenagers with all of the gossip and hold grudges towards actual teenagers or ones in their 20’s like myself that work their hardest for the company when we are the ones doing all the work for the “team leads/coaches” to take all the credit for even though they put absolutely no effort or pride into their work but to over rush productivity when they are the ones that do absolutely nothing but the simplest things - more...

title: Ok
review: I was at Walmart for a short period I was always coming in on my days off and thought I would be hired full time but when that time came I was let go

title: Simple but stressful
review: It was pretty easy to learn how everything you gotta know to work that position but you can easily get stressed out with the long lines, tiny work space and the low amount of other registers open.

title: Horrible
review: Do not work here! Poor management and very bad work environment. A lot of favorites and bullying. Communication is non existent and you can never find management when you need them.

title: bad lol
review: working at walmart will have you overworked and underpaid. hated every second i was here. customers are cruel and dumb and the staff doesn't care at all.

title: Really wasn't a bad place to work.
review: The best thing about it was that you were constantly going.  If you like to stay busy and watch the time fly? This place is for you.  I would still be there, however, I was having back problems due to a bad car accident.  The pay at Walmart is really competitive.

title: I liked being a stocker and stocking the shelves.
review: The bad is there are never enough cashier's running the cash registers. And no matter how much the price of food goes up. Walmart is not helping the people specials on food or drinks. You want help with the cash registers train me. Or even place me as a stocker. The people are what makes Walmart without them there wouldn't be any Walmarts. Walmart is just a smile away but there is always room for improvement
position: Stocker, tire lube express, lawn and Garden.

title: Idk
review: Relaxed job sometimes, but management was majority of the problem for myself. I always ended up doing 10x my work, a lot of employees neglected their own tasks with little to no consequences.

title: Great place to work. Worked there almost 10 years but had to move to another state
review: Loved working at Walmart great interaction with same customers daily. Decent pay and they work with you on scheduling.  Management was friendly and kind.

title: Unrealistic expectations
review: Mostly for the management. Walmart has a horribly work/life balance for management, and while I am not one, that ends up falling upon the regular associates. Walmart is an ok place to work, but don't plan to move up unless you want to be berated constantly.

title: Productivity is high you're constantly on the move
review: I was really excited to work here at first but it slowly became a reality that management is terrible and they play favoritism when you're looking to advance. They have no respect in the way they treat and talk to employees.

title: Can be hit or miss
review: I pretty much enjoyed all of my coworkers. I personally liked consistency and that’s what I mostly had there. It was sometimes a struggle with upper management though.

title: Great place to work
review: Staff is friendly and it is always clean. Associates are nice. We all work together to get things done. Positive attitude. Get through the rush and go home

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?For me, the best part of working at walmart was the coworkers and the free food.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful part of working at walmart was the pressure and unfair treatment by management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment at walmart was very fast paced and stressed and pressured by management What is a typical day like for you at the company?Towards the end of my employment with Walmart they had me running the electronics dept, which I enjoyed . A typical day was fast paced and you were always being spied upon by management!

title: Good
review: Decent pay. Heavy on metrics. No work life balance. All depends on what kind of team and manager you have. Push shots like crazy. Pointless wellness days

title: Es muy bien trabajar hay
review: Super nice me encanta mi trabajo y trata de día por día doy lo mejor

title: If you have no life work here
review: Bogus. College student-athlete, once brought onto the team I was told my schedule would be able to be worked around,l. Immediately put me in working 11am to 11pm….literally you tell me how you think 1, that’s fair, 2 that’s humane in anyway, 3 how I’m supposed to manage a social life, college academics, college sports. If you have no life and have no problem working these kinds of shifts it’s honestly not too bad. Act like you’re doing something, the people there are cool ig.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people. I met some of the kindest people at Walmart that I have ever known.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When associates from the Deli didn't show up or took 3 hour lunches....We were BUSY!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fun, for the most part. I like being busy. And the managers were always very supportive  and fair.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy, but I like to be busy.Not chaotic, just fast paced.And you get to do different things within your department which is great!

title: Fun work place so many opportunities if you wanna move ive met some wonderful people there.up you can.
review: Great place to work at. Friendly people to work with they can make it very fun, you learn so much if your willing to you can grow in the company. Wonderful place to work.

title: Its ok
review: Unlimited overtime s3x scandles with management. Hard to get personal to do their job. If you need something done no one has any idea as far as loa or simple benefits 🙄🤦 pay is ok option to take money out of your check. If you work overnight you get a dollar extra. Alot of times ppl get fired because of lack of help in anything down to days off,loa , management not communicating basically things out of your control. Lots of drama plus store manager doesn't have a clue on what to do

title: The higher up the command chain, the more arrogant it gets.
review: The people I DIRECTLY and CONSISTENTLY work with are generally pleasant to be around and I personally consider a work friend. Go up a couple rungs on the ladder however and unfortunately you get people who tell you what to do via someone else from the comfort of their office because they don't want to accidentally be asked to help with something.Ive been told to (im paraphrasing here, but...) make up my mind about if I felt sick enough to go home or not because "if you fell, it would be alot of paperwork and I don't wanna do that"There are exceptions, though. There's a couple great managers I've had that genuinely made me excited to work-- albeit for Walmart-- and there are a few associates that I think need to leave their vests at home, permanently.

title: It’s a job
review: I’m glad that I met such nice people. I’m glad it’s over. Customers ask a lot of questions. We shop for them. It’s a lot of running around. It was ok.

title: Fun, Rewarding
review: If you like physical work you’ll do well and like it but if you’re lazy your going to quit sooner than later. It can be a hidden gem for some because it offers many opportunities for advancement and learning new skills

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?From the beginning till I relocated it was like family. I enjoyed my employees. Training them to have excellent customer experiences was rewarding.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Often there was an immense amount of Customer  flow with lots of different personalities

title: Ignorant Management
review: Limited training, and pushed to work solo, when I stated I didn't feel prepared to run a register alone.Basic cash and credit transactions were easy, but other are not. Managers were not available if an issue occurred numerous times, leaving long lines of angry customers. Personally felt very frustrated, and a lot of unnecessary stress, both could have been avoided.

title: Your experience depends on your leaders.
review: My experience with over four years all boils down to how leadership is at a given location. There are people that work with you, and others that will tear you down. As a person caught in middle level leadership, I tended to shield my associates from some things. In the end, I wound up with poor leaders. I was let go due to a leave technicality. I prided myself as a leader for my associates and went to bat as much as I could.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Staying busy! I worked overnight and I enjoyed it. At the time, many years ago, my young sons were around 3 and 2 and it was difficult many times during the night as I worked.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Staying awake, during that time.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was pleasant, not overwhelming.What is a typical day like for you at the company?It was a good experience that I did enjoy.

title: Place that you can come and work with friends that we welcome you with open hands
review: This review was amazing for me to talk about my first and the best work environment I have ever been, I will say people should try out for the cashier position because there are people there to help you, and make sure you learn how to handle the cash and everything

title: Good job
review: They work well with your schedule and they are very understanding Everything was good. Of course you’ll have bad coworkers but that’s anywhere you’ll work at. Over all good.

title: Productive and simple work place
review: I’ve been here for almost 2 years and enjoy it, took me almost a year to be full time. Managers have favorites but as long you do your work you’re on their good side. pay is good too ! You are able to accumulate paid time off but attendance is strict here so be in time. Reach 5 points and you’re out . But overall it’s an easy job

title: Depends on store
review: Been to 3 stores, 2 stores I loved to work there and all my coworkers 3rd not so much. Lots of work, lots of stress, bonus for management, pay fairly competitive for retail.

title: Fresh associate
review: good work, stocking merchandise on floor zoning shelves, checking date on products and time management are key to working in the bakery. good benefits

title: Easy work
review: The best way to describe it is a beginner job I started here when I was 16 I believe and it seemed like decent money being a teenager but depends on management.

title: Horrible
review: Every day sucked Nothing learnedManagers are the worstWorkplace culture is too bad and lazy. The hardest part of the job is dealing with rude customers who can’t be patient for more than a minute.

title: Stressful and unappreciated
review: They will work you beyond the time of shifts and expect you to stay over.  Bad company work ethics.  The company does not care about the overflow work upon employees.

title: Not terrible but would be better with more management
review: Not a terrible job to have, could be better with better management and supervision. Hours are not great as upper management keep cutting them and won't allow more.

title: Apasionante
review: Fascinante, Retador, entretenido, apasionante y Excelente ambiente.

title: Good with flexible hours
review: working as a stocker in the produce departments has been good, walmart will work with you on your schedule and managers aren't too demanding as long as you put your part in

title: Fun workplace
review: Stressfull place to work at. They expect alot out of you and the higher ups just stand there. It creates a hostile environment when they are constantly just on your butt about every single thing.

title: Bad management
review: Showed to much favoritism and overworked for very little , they were rude, no training, they also were judgmental and very unprofessional. I wouldn’t suggest .

title: Terrible Job
review: Management does not care about you and will treat you like trash. While I was there I only lost the benefits that they had when I started. They do not care about employees at all.

title: Face paced, good pay
review: Mandatory ot, mandatory to work any and ALL HOLIDAYS! WITHOUT HOLIDAY PAY. call ins on "key dates"(holidays/fun events like super bowl ect.) 2 points instead of one. 5 points is termination. Other then being ran like AUSCHWITZ. It's a job and for $27 starting pay you learning to deal with it

title: Fun workplace
review: Always opportunity to grow and get promoted. Everyday is definitely not the same. You will enjoy your time with Walmart its the best place. I can tell you

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay is the best in our town What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of support What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It can be stressful, and hard work and sometimes you won't have much help. But it can be good as wellWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Some days are fun and others not it's like any other place.

title: Another company with horrible managers
review: Cheat u out of full time benefits, managers are always hiding and will fire you without notice. Shows the modern day failures of the capitalism. Would not recommend

title: Good place
review: Recommend this store to a lot of people. Very kind staff and supportive environment to someone new to sales. Hours can be tough but management is flexible

title: Okay place to work trashy management
review: Good place to work if your just looking to make some money, but management is horrid constantly push tasks for them onto you. On the plus side most team members are friendly.

title: Don't like it here
review: This place is horrible. Bad management, no time off, work like dogs, never time for yourself. Under no circumstances should anyone even remotely think about working here.

title: Pros and cons
review: Great Benefits but management caree more about their Benefits than employee welfare They also took away incentives like the Sunday premium and holiday pay

title: It is what you make of it
review: Worked here for years, the company has taken everything away from the employee. No holiday pay almost none no raises what so ever. High deductible insurance. One of the few good things about the place is no mandatory overtime.

title: Not to bad
review: Decent co-workers. customers weren't the best, but it was still pretty easy to get through the day. Pay was ok but nothing incredible. At least there was AC.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The place of work made the overnight shift go by pretty quick and my supervisors and overnight manager were awesome What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When other people didn't show up you had to take on extra work to meet deadline before 7am What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Decent people are friendly What is a typical day like for you at the company?I worked in juice and water so I would average atleast 20 pallets of freight

title: Do not recommend
review: Not heavily supervised. Get breaks late. No one comes to help when they are paged. Overworked. Have to work multiple jobs at one time. Pay is not enough for the things that they have you do.

title: Highly recommend this position
review: Work was very easy, co-workers were great, management works with you, pay is great. Interview was pretty simple and training is computer based and then on the job training too.

title: It was alright
review: don’t really like the management(their horrible)pay was the only thing good about it. and you get a 1hour lunch break.They have a deli and the food was good i guess.

title: fun team hard job
review: hate the corporation’s rules love the team would recommend for a short time long term and you wanna die it gets mind numbing boring to do the same thing ever day

title: they have great  people
review: they have friendly co workers they train well and they do a great job about answering any questions you may have while you are training they are flexible if you have children that are in school

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay was decentWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not getting enough hours and the managers only cared about their buddiesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?I felt like it was high school and segregatedWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Went by fast

title: Nice place to work
review: Nice people to work with and I had a great time as my first job little bit of problems with  other coworkers but other that good environment time people

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It beats being unemployed. A few years back there would be plenty great things to say, but now, not much, if anything. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The constant and I mean constant unrealistic expectations and turnover due to the same What is the work environment and culture like at the company?You are a number and number only.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Miserable from daylight to dark and afterwards . As salary you will NEVER be “off the clock”. You are contacted 24/7 by subordinates and superiors

title: Dead end unless you don’t want a life
review: The general attitude of this place will just drag the life and motivation out of you. I’m a driven person, but working here have me no satisfaction or reason to try hard at all.

title: Fun workplace
review: Loved working here! Management was great.  Customers sucked sometimes but coworkers made it better. Left because I moved but not a bad place to start out.

title: Horrible horrible job stay away
review: The absolutely worse job I ever had!!!  Please do not work here.  Manages are horrible, people are horrible company is horrible!  Felt I was reborn when I finally left!!! The most misersjob I ever had,  I literally hit sick working there,  I slid hit COVID when only there a few weeks.  This company did nothing to protect its workers.  You have been warned stay away!!  You will regret working there.  A horrible place.  I cannot say enough bad things about this company.  People who work there a rejects who can’t get jobs anywhere else .  Managers are the worse on the planet snd people who work there are gossipy and will stab you in the back in a heartbeat.  I literally got sick working there snd that is no joke!

title: Not a place I'd recommend
review: I honestly would never work for that company again, it seems very tempting oat first sight but after a short time there you quickly realize it's not as good as it looks.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The co workersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having management back upWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very nice What is a typical day like for you at the company?Easy going. It all depends on your attitude

title: Loved working with the Customers and Employees
review: Walmart has its BAD AND its GOOD things. Not naming them all here. I have worked in Retail for a long long time. Being SICK there is A NO NO. You get in trouble and get occurrences for being sick or having an emergency with your family.

title: Good people and atmosphere
review: Love working with all the other employees were always helpful. Management was always  helpful and there when you needed them .would love to work there again.

title: Soul sucking
review: Even when I was sick they wouldn’t let me go home. Manager is expected way too much. I routinely had to Cover four departments by myself. When I went in on my day off they tried to put me in the fitting room answering phones. I wasn’t gonna answer phones on my day off when I was there to help on the floor. CSMs Try to act like assistant managers

title: Vale la pena la experiencia de trabajar en walmart
review: Yo trabaje 7 meses en walmart 6 en wisconsin y 1 en ohio el de ohio no me gusto para nada me bajaron el salario y me cambiaron el turno y muy pobre el compañerismo y el trato de los jefes después de 3 meses fuera volví a solicitar en el mismo walmart en ohio pero tras que son muy pocos los team líder o couch que estaban atento en la tienda no se ve el interés por los empleados y por tener 5 puntos me despidieron como si una persona no se pudiera enfermar no vale la pena haci trabajar en walmart

title: its ok
review: not a bad company. my location was fairly organized and not as busy as others around us most days. management could be better. they really arent lenient with the point system though for call-outs and late arrivals. communication with your team lead is key otherwise you're fired

title: Good place to work
review: Awesome benefits. I had a set schedule working in the back processing claims. I got along with coworkers and we were not micromanaged. Possible bonuses paid out every quarter.

title: Repetitive
review: Easy work, but very repetitive and boring. Same thing each day for each ten hour shift, with the same people. Good benefits and company, but very boring work.

title: Good job for the pay
review: Pretty decent place to work for first time workers and college students. Okay pay but sometimes the team leads and higher authority expect a little too much out of their associates

title: Hard work fast paced
review: Overall decent place to work what made it good was my coworkers. Management a little crazy but what job isn’t. Decent pay. Just choose a good location. Not some place ghetto

title: job
review: paying job. easy work stocking shelves . worked the over night shift.  basic work and attendance policy nothing specialsdsf fsdfsfahlshfl lse fasdfsdef

title: All the employees are miserable
review: I hated working at Walmart. It was not even the work. Even though standing in place while bagging 20,000.00 worths of food everyday is tiring. It wasn’t the deal breaker for me. It was the way I was treated. Not just by customers but by the whole store. In this day in age grocery stores aren’t exactly happy hotspots. The rising food cost affects how customers mingle with you.  Front end customer service gets paid the LEAST at that company. While simultaneously being told that our work was the “most important” which I understand. GREAT customer service gets the public coming back. However when the price you pay the employees to provide the expected service is the LOWEST. . I was a closer at my location and it was horrible. Managers would let the reshop pile sky high all day(knowly) . And expected it completely gone in 1 hour of closing time. while they were tucked comfortably in bed after their shifts. My personal closing team was very understaffed so it gave me a LOT of responsibility which was MY job solely. Certain managers would order team members to finish task not in their position to help their workload. While complaining about work that would be leftover in other departments.  I also noticed weird favoritism in front end. Certain team members would always get the more labor intensive task( bagging, zoning, big reshop carts, Cart pushing )  with very little switches for very long periods of time . While the other coworkers would be practically skipping around ON CLOCK. Less labor intensive jobs (reshop with a smaller cart, self checkout lanes, bull pen). There were times - more...

title: Horrible Pay
review: Not paying wages that people deserve . I worked there 3 years and only had 2 dollars more than I started . It used to be one of the higher paying jobs in my area now it’s the lowest .

title: Just another job
review: Just another job, it uses to be a better place to work at, then they changed everything. The company used to care more about associates now that feeling is gone. There’s a lot of favoritism in the company.

title: it's okay
review: overall ur busy all day. management is horrible. lower management positions trying to get higher management approval. but good money and good people.

title: Culture is not reflected by mgmt.
review: Corporate Office created a good sounding culture, but by pushing unrealistic goals and profits while reducing employment staffing (because minimum wage increases, still expecting stores to staff with smaller budget), and expecting them to be able to accomplish the same workload.  It's a shame because the culture on paper is good, just not embraced in stores.

title: Ehhhh
review: It was alright. The management is very favorable on who they give the positions to. The pay was decent though. Retaliation is a thing in the company, but they give you a discount.

title: Not all terrible
review: Not all terrible,the district managment left a lot to be desired..Decent pay and benefits. Other employees were awesome.  Easy to take time off, and the job was fast paced but not difficult

title: It's an ok job.
review: I enjoyed most of the people I worked with.  There was a few that thought they should be in charge and would tell the managers what to do. I was 3rd in seniority and worked the best I could , yet i have health problems and was surprised when I was laid off , they used the excuse that they were saving money,  yet I was the only one let go ( can't tell me that it wasn't because of my health) . I will say that my sezuires have stopped since I left.  But i I wouldn't recommend Walmart.  My wife works for a Walmart too and was almost fired because of having to miss work because of a ice storm AFTER being told she would be approved.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay was definitely the best thing What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not being registered into the system correctly What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very Tiring and very stressful

title: Not bad
review: Busy work nothing impossible. Different shifts throughout the day. Canfind one that's good for you. Fair pay for what you do. Not the best place for bigger money.

title: It's fine
