review: It is really hard to contact higher management about anything really. It's very hard to advance in the company. Otherwise, it's all around okay. The management in my department is kind and understanding.

title: Great work environment
review: Working on the sales floor is a very easy, entry-level job. Great for young teens out of high school and young adults wanting to gain customer service skills. Fairly repetitive tasks

title: great employees,great expierience,managment not to great
review: you will learn alot at walmart as they do move you around the store quite alot.they have prepared me for other jobs and honestly made other jobs feel like eating pie.they will work you but they have great benefits.you have to be able to multi-task and stand on your feet for long periods of time or you wont last.hardest part is training is not so great however if you learn fast like me or like to learn on your own you will be just fine.

title: Okay pay - not great management
review: Management plays favorites. They are disrespect to the staff they don't like and let the ones they like get away with anything.The pay is enough to get by but not enough to get ahead

title: Good Pay, revolving door of employees
review: While I worked there, the coaches were playing musical chairs, market had varying expectations. We became a high shrink store so they had even more market presence.

title: Unfair…poor management/supervisors
review: Do not work there!  they treat there employees like garbage!  They cut there hours without notice! They don’t not show respect to there employees only talk to them like there a dime a dozen! If you don’t want to feel like dirt or get talked to like your nothing don’t apply!

title: Makes you want to dissociate whenever you're on the clock
review: Unrealistic expectations paired with inept middle management leads to employees being burnt out. Overall wasn't pleasant. Also, the store was generally always understaffed due to a refusal to hire more employees for areas of the store that were already understaffed.

title: It alright
review: I can only speak for night shift as I’m sure day shift runs things differently but it’s just alright. It’s from 10pm to 7am every work shift. You’re on your feet the entire time except for breaks unless you’re a manger and don’t do anything.  It’s 4 days a week for part time and 5 days for full time. They’re not flexible with there schedule at all, as I asked for a schedule change and they only changed it for 2 weeks and then reverted the changes. When I asked my manager about it he laughed and did nothing. But besides that the work is pretty easy.

title: Lots of standing
review: A typical day which is hard to go by but there is pulling orders to be shipped to customers. Then you are packing weighing and Lots of standing lifting and twisting while packing boxes

title: fast papec micromanage
review: Unfortunately, I am planning to quit my first post collegiate job related to my major at the end of this month. I’m miserable and the mind gymnastics they’re putting me through, I expected better. Before this role, I was employed as a Logistics Coordinator for 7 years.If I resign, could I avoid listing it on my resume and if it comes to a background check, could the potential employers find out? I reckon I would only list the roles that I

title: Know How to Handle Customers
review: The work is consistent, and learning register does not take long. Your main problem will always be with customers. This job requires you to have patience with difficult people. I worked part-time, and when there was  a shortage of hours for the frontend, my hours were among the first to go. Pick your store wisely, because not every store operates the same way. The customers WILL take out their frustrations about the store on you and your team leads. Be prepared.

title: Good job if you want to make money without the climb
review: This department offers full-time non-managerial positions. It is a physically demanding position that can have you lifting six milk jugs in a plastic tote. Fast paced with low to medium customer interaction.Upper management is full of it and I heard some team leads are power tripping. But overall if you can handle stress and physical workloads it is worth it.

title: Fun
review: It was fun working here. The people were great and the environment was Amazon. The mangers do have favorites though so I would be aware of that. Other than that it was a great place to work

title: It was a good place
review: Walmart had its ups and downs but overall it wasn’t a bad experience. Management could have been a bit better but overall working at Walmart wasnt bad

title: Toxic, stressful environment
review: It is not what it is made to be. Management doesn’t care about your personal life & they will come at you for everything while they sit in the office on their phones. Older employees will treat the new employees like garbage . You’re required to do other peoples work for no pay differential. Also you might as well never request time off because you’ll never get any of it approved even if it’s 6 months in advance because they’re so short staffed. Also they should pay you for your 30 minute lunch especially if it’s overnight shift because no place is open for you to go to. Overall don’t waste your time even applying you can do much better and work for a place that actually values their employees.

title: Morale swings up and down with management
review: I enjoyed the work and the co-workers, however, all it takes to destroy morale is a few overbearing managers with bad management styles. They seem to promote anybody to management these days. You want to make other people's lives difficult for no other reason than your own power trip, great, here is a promotion.This marks the beginning of the ever-increasing workloads due to employee's scattering, running for the hills, and not being replaced because it is cheaper to have you do more work and not replace them. Then add in a general lack of appreciation, that puts the nail in the coffin and forces a seven-year employee, yours truly, to just walk out on a never-ending lunch break.Best mental health decision I've ever made, long live the never-ending lunch break!!!

title: Good place to work but don’t have a employee/employer trusting relationship
review: I loved my job and most of the people I worked with. The only concern I had is the fact that the managers will not stand up for their employees, ever, especially if it won’t benefit you them

title: It’s not worth the stress
review: Have you been to Walmart??? None of the workers are happy. For many reasons. So don’t expect much from this company. This is the type of place you work if you’re on your last resort. Don’t expect to be treated with respect. Don’t expect your bosses and coworkers to have common. Keep your expectations very low.

title: Relaxed work environment, quiet, it was a busy day like others but it was a very well worked day
review: Working in the truck area, sometimes it becomes very difficult, but when you have experience, you work more easily and faster, working in the staqueando areas is normally a little exhausting but it is easy and fast to do, you work as a team, if someone has any difficulty to finish their work, we help them and work as a team, if someone has any problem in being able

title: Easy
review: The job is overall an east job that anybody can do but management is not very good they all mostly care about themselves and will trade you instantly my advice is just do your job and work like nobody is your friend

title: Ok
review: Ok place to work at would work there again. Better pay than what it use to be. Advancing a lot new things are happening with the company every year. Ok

title: Fun place
review: Love working here and meeting people. They teach us patience and how to conflict diffuse. I've been here 8 years and have no plans of leaving anytime soon

title: ok
review: walmart is an okay place to work. i think there’s many other places to work that are better. for example subway is a fun environment. mcdonald’s is fun

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Minimal Supervision What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working weekends and HolidaysWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly most people will help with any questions you may have

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The work is easyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Very low pay. Dealing with customersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Keeps you busyWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Mild stressful

title: My side of the store was chill, filled with genuine people & made work fun!
review: Easy and fun place to work at for my first year and a half until we got a new store manager. He was a d1ck with a "nice guy" demeanor. Most of management had egos except for 2 of them they were chill.If you decide to work at Walmart I'd recommend produce, meats, Deli, Bakery, Dairy/Freezer. It's chill and strays away from the "drama" side of the store. Definitely stay away from becoming a cashier. I kid you not everyone up there treats their job to serious, are to competitive and just feels like Highschool all over again except filled with a bunch of adults. If you're into that, then go for it.

title: Steady work
review: Love the associates, steady schedule and good benefits.  Usually pretty busy nights makes the job go by fast  also the give one journey lunches on top of 2x 15 minutes breaks

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Flexible schedule and great people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers and Karens and some managers and team leaders What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great people, great place and great work environment What is a typical day like for you at the company?Work as stocker and help in other departments if needed

title: Equipment
review: More available equipment needed for my department for everyone to do their job in proper time. Other than that everything is great and it is a great place to work anytime.

title: Ehh
review: It’s Walmart. Too many bosses not doing a thing. Stay on the right peoples good side it will all workout. A lot of training and days on the computers.

title: It was a ok work place lots of stress
review: I did get the job done like I always do but sometimes problems that worked there did not help me at all dometimes but I still got all the groceries that the customers online needed

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I would have to say the two 15 minute breaks and the hour lunch that they give you because for me, while I was working there the breaks helped me calm down after dealing with very rude and complicated customers. Other than that I wouldn't say nothing else.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The MOST STRESSFUL part about working there would have to be the customers and some of the managers not doing there job and will the work that they require you to do by yourself such as for example, when a customer come to the register with 2 carts full of groceries, and another employee don't have nobody in there line they expect you to do it by yourself and not get no help but working at winn Dixie it was a whole different situation, see employees had other employees help them in that kind of situation but Walmart do not allow that. Everyone has to stay at they own register being anti socia👎😑What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The culture and environment is very strange and funny to me because they say everyone is "family" but it's anti socialWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy with non stop working with rude customers

title: Not exactly what I thought it was gonna be
review: I can only speak on the Jesup store #2630 overnight management needs better managing skills,it's everyone for themselves there is no teamwork whatsoever ,we didn't have the tools we needed to do our job to the best of our ability,You do not get raises unless you move up in management ,and the point system they go by is ridiculous it doesn't matter if you are one of the hardest workers, if u have an issue with a ride and they know this, and yet they still fire u because you have 5 points. and to let u know being 1 min late gets u a half a point .

title: It was okay.
review: Recommended for schoolers. Learned how to work as a team. Stress Was a factor. Would recommend. I enjoyed the pay. Gained experience. The others there were good people .

title: They have very good policy and procedures in place for most situations in my department
review: I like the work stocking. The majority of other associates are very nice but of course you have some of the mean girls that work there and like to think they are more important than they really are. The benefits are very good and they pay for a college degree completely,  books too, while working at Walmart. Not many other businesses can say that. The only complaint I've had is the lack of label printers and work phones available to do my job completely.
position: Merchandising Associate in Lawn and Garden

title: Management plays favorites
review: Management plays favorites. They expect to much from associates for the pay that they make. I get told by the Market Asset Protection Manager and the Asset Protection Coach that we have to have a certain amount of apprehensions when we don't.

title: Fun workplace
review: I enjoyed my time at walmart, management made you feel wanted. You will end up being cross trained to cover other areas. I don’t have anything bad to say about them.

title: Pay was decent but no job security
review: Pay was average maybe slightly above average but their absence policy is ridiculous 4 5 PO nts in 6 months gets your fired...points given for any Illness except covid, still expect you to work even if you have a doctor's note with a legit reason to have to stay home..no exceptions made. CSM's are mean to customers and totally unorganized. Never a set schedule even when you give them your availability they will still schedule you for the days you can't work.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?CompensationWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of work life balanceWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment and culture were taught just not applied What is a typical day like for you at the company?Always busy moving from one task to another

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with great associates. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Toxic management leadership What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not being micromanaged What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very busy and constantly changing.

title: For locals or if you have no other option.
review: Where to start, this place could be good and awesome to work at if they learned to treat their employees with respect. One of the "coaches" they have there is far from what anyone considers a civil human being. They mistreat you when no one is looking and then turn around and act as if they never said anything, the occurrences and how they are handled are made to fail even if you are a model employee that hardly ever asks for time off. They don't work with you when something comes up and basically say not my problem. If you just need a quick way to earn cash then this is your job. If however you want a place to further your career or feel like you are a part of something, steer away from this place.
position: Not gonna say since its a small town

title: Service
review: Because is good for me and my school And for me I will be happy for this job and also help others to work well and where I don't understand I want to ask and for well understood to work well.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay and incentivesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Parking is far away What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Multi cultural. A great place to work What is a typical day like for you at the company?No longer there

title: Terrible management
review: Management literally don’t care until there something massive happening…. Like there no sense or real management happening managers join together to laugh and joke rather than run a store.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Co workers are polite and helpful and so is the management team What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Sometimes the amount of freightWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great and energetic What is a typical day like for you at the company?Putting out freight in designated work department

title: Very Repetitive but somewhat chill
review: Work is super repetitive, mostly busy especially if there are callouts, can be chill once in a while. Holidays are always gonna be a hassle but it is what it is.

title: Horrible management
review: The amount of disrespect when it came to your schedule was unacceptable. They will wait until your days off to mess up your already made schedule. Would take your days off away 24 hours before they happend. Also would assign shifts within 24 hours on what was your only day off. Customers were also horrible and would record you for telling them the store was closed. Work anywhere but here

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits are pretty good, especially the slightly more hidden ones. Coworkers can be nice. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything. Bare bones staffing, stressed management told to push their problems onto you, power tripping management climbing on everyone to achieve their goals. OSHA violations, relataliation, and constant replacement of full time employees with part time ones. Horrible schedules and if you have any time you can be availabke.your hours get docked, even if you wouldnt work at those hours for your position. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic, fast paced, every person for themselfWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Come in to a mess, try to finish work from other shifts while falling behind on your own work. Doing several jobs at once and often taking breaks and lunch very late or not at all.

title: Nobody knows what's going on. No one has an answer for anything
review: Worst place I ever worked.I do not recommend it. Just a bunch of rats fighting for the cheese at the top of the trash pile.I couldn't believe it.Some nice people there but some people there that should be in jail....lol

title: Decent Entry Level Job
review: I learned lots of new skills and had some fun but the pay is sub par for the work load. I dislike the constant annoying loud music playing in the store.

title: Great pay if you are just starting
review: People just starting are making the same as people that have been working hard for the company for 5 years. So there is no real reason to stay when you can quite and get rehired 7 days later and make the same or maybe more.

title: Okay
review: The hours were okay with my work schedule, the environment was alright . There would also be rude customers at times . Would recommend to work here part time .

title: Good workplace
review: All co-workers are friendly and respectful. Pretty simple easy work, stocking shelves, keeping the area clean, helping customers. Management has been very good.

title: Bad management
review: The management will gaslight you into working then needed for jobs that don't require that of you. After breaking your body for them that will let you go over the small things that felt unsafe doing.

title: Fun coworkers and good staff
review: I loved working at Walmart I was there for almost a year and in that year I worked 3 different positions all of which I excelled at. My boss was fun and caring as well as strict and authoritative when needed.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The Pay The Management and etc What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The hours and especially during peak season

title: Productive
review: Good place to start, great environment. ProsThe money and co worker'sConsBad place managers are mean and the company doesn't care about their employeesAdvice to ManagementKindness and compassion go along way

title: It was ok
review: Hours was fair it wasn't bad it was fun good ppl magement was decent unless you miss more than 6 points then they fire you but other than that it was good

title: Productive workplace
review: Working here in my opinion isn't really amazing or terrible. Most customer interactions are positive when I use to work there. However, you will notice bad interactions whether it's in your control or not. Be very cautious of how and who you are dealing with. Who knows how much have changed since then only time can tell. With that being said, management may have also changed a lot since I was there. But, most are willing to work with you in the best way they can. There were a few situations that did not please me when handling certain aspects of availability concerns. If you are someone who can put up with most people regardless then this is a great 1st job to start. My advice is to always be open and looking for more opportunities while you are there.

title: Not the worst but not great.
review: Decent pay and benifits if you are lucky enough to get full time, but overall a company that anytime they show to be giving something to their employees is also takeing more than that away quietly  example being the lose of quarterly bonuses for the associates at lease upper managment still gets their bonuses. There was almost never enough equipment to go around so many people wouldnt be able to to their jobs right. The overall feel for the enviroment is that the company didnt care about you and managment only cared if you were friends with them other than that you are on your own and everything is your fault. But the work itself isnt that hard and can sometimes be enjoyable as long as you can get past the stress from insuferable and likely incompetant managers.

title: Disappointed
review: I use to live working at Walmart at one point in life. Back when I first started I would give five stars and praise to every aspect of the company. I became department manager within 3 months and wouldn't want to work elsewhere. When I returned to Walmart a few years later although some management and employees where still there the quality and overall life of walmart is a complete miss. Full of favoritism, unfairness, miss use of authority, unethical and unreasonable, manipulation of employees and the system, enforcing rules that are not followed by Thoe's that enforce it ect The list goes on.  Inorder to make this Walmart better at N hw 67 florisant it needs a complete restart in management and honestly needs to go back to haven't department managers instead of team leads and coaches. I completely disapprove of this Walmart location. If I was a member of corporate I would do a complete clean house and start over. If I was manager over there entire store things would be structured. Their always saying Thier hiring in all positions and can switch at anytime but when you want to switch it's not allowed.

title: they sell everything
review: the most important thing to learn in Walmart is how to interact and engage variety of people at any time of day with any product for any reason in any position people staff/customers always unpredictable teaches you to learn and respect human nature the best thing is that Walmart the most famous place in the world and sells every single thing the American home needs
location: Walmart Store 6205 Baltimore National Pike Catonsville, Maryland 21228

title: Fun Workplace and good pay
review: I loved this job and the pay was good and the hours also. If your looking for a full time or even part time job this is a good place to work. They got good benefits after being there for awhile.

title: Go work ELSEWHERE
review: Don’t stoop to the curb to work at WalmartThe management team is unjustified.. Their behavior and overall skills and attitudes reflect the overworked, lack thereof help, job assignments and daily duties to one employee, UNLESS your a ‘favorite!’ then you have no worries whatsoever!!!The environment is very intimidating with no recognition from team leads, coaches or management staff… they’re too busy huddled together talking amongst one another about employees

title: Awful management
review: The employees are great some of the best people I have worked with  but the management is terrible they are constantly promising stuff that never happens

title: Very chaotic management
review: Not worth the stress. A very chaotic place to work that doesn't treat any of it's employees right. Most of the time it will fall on the associates to get the job done, while the team leads and coaches just argue about what to do.

title: Awful
review: Horrible management. No organization whatsoever.  Management is biased because they pick favorites and only out certain people on dispensing for some odd reason

title: Pretty good job
review: Honestly the easiest job you will ever get to work. Its just unloading things off of the truck, putting them on pallets and taking them out. And if you can do apparel or break packs it honestly doesnt even feel like work because its just organizing things. Would recommend. Only thing is the coaches and team leads are horrible and most of them are not so great people.

title: It’s a job
review: It’s a job. If you can deal with the nasty customers all day, and then deal with somewhat adequate managers you’ll be fine. I worked the 4 am to 1pm shift and there was always something going on. Our cooler was small, so cold pallets sat out for extended periods of time. The whole CAP process was a joke.

title: Alright
review: I work CAP 2 and it's pretty ridiculous. At least at the Benton location, I don't get paid anywhere near what I should for the work I do. Other than that, it's easy to go to work.

title: Easy Work. Mostly good people. Terrible management.
review: Made some good friends. Work was easy enough. Management was just rude, asked unrealistic things of teams, talked down to everyone and played favorites.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Store manager very caring What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough helpWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment can be stressful at times but overall the silvis Illinois walmart is a good place to workWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Work 4am to 1pm in meat and produce our team lead is very understanding and is there for the employees..we stay very busy all day and are there for our customers.

title: Was ok
review: It was easy not hard the staff is friendly they are understanding when something comes up sometimes the employees can be rude but other than that it was okay

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with irate customers What is a typical day like for you at the company?8 hours shift

title: Worked with my schedule
review: I worked with the sheriffs office and they worked with me. Made sure you took your breaks and lunch.Made sure your area was clean before you left home, which was good cause the next cashier didn’t have a didn’t a dirty area.Made sure we had change when needed,

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay is competitively fair and there is plenty of overtime available.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough help to maintain the high quality experience that the company's vision wants for its customer.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?STRESSFUL, But management understates that...What is a typical day like for you at the company?Neverending, with not enough time to satisfactorily complete the duties...

title: Management and corporate
review: Cold environment to work in. Feels like high school. Favoritism exist here. Ignorant rules that in fact waste everyone’s time and money. Need change to happen immediately!

title: it's ok
review: retail is retail. decent pay, benefits, etc. management is hit or miss. some may be unsupportive and toxic, some are the best bosses ever. but the constant expectation from corporate and mgmt to get the undoable done sucks and it's never enough for them.

title: Ok
review: Picking isn’t bad but management is ! Favor certain associates . If they had new management that cared about hard work and not who is their best friend it would be great

title: Not worth the money
review: hard work is not appreciated. Managment cares more about productivity then the employees. The managers change faster than any other place ive been before.

title: Fun to work
review: Good place to work and fun environment and good opportunity to grow and benefit are awesome you actually enjoy working at Walmart and the people there

title: Management sucks
review: Not a good place to work, workers were overworked and the place is underpaid. Only benefit is the pto time and also the breaks. Voice a concern and it won't get fixed

title: this place will drain your life and spit you out without a care.
review: walmart is straight trash. Favoritism is everywhere. its like being in high school only much worse. the assistant managers are over worked. and the supervisors are mainly lazy.

title: Fun workplace
review: Everybody is real nice worked long hours no too bad especially when I love to work everybody loved it too all smiles and great people can’t complain about anything

title: Easy job
review: Easy job, hard on your body physically and very monotonous. It’s hard to move up within the company and even then it’s very slow with little reward. If you want to make money you have to become a salaried manager.

title: Good first job
review: Worked here while a student in high school full-time. Was a good introduction into the work force. Learning fundamental cashier, money management, and customer service has helped in my transition into college then later my career.

title: Valued by management and promoted
review: Management values you and is willing to promote you if you are committed to exceeding expectations. This opportunity is what you make of it. Do a great job and you will be rewarded.

title: Love it
review: I enjoyed working there. Hours were good.good pay and always flexible well respected by employees and never had problems with management. Also easy job

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working in frozen department as stockerWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?None.  Good environment on night shift What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Goal motivation is the best part of working at Walmart What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking the products in a timely manner

title: Can be what you make it
review: Walmart can either be the best or the worst place to work at, in my experience if you find a good manager it makes all the difference and can make the environment much better

title: Love the people I work with front end coach is phenomenal she is absolutely amazing.
review: Very good work environment very fast paced .very flexible on hours hardest part is dealing with customer and their attitude towards associate.must have a strong shield

title: Learned
review: Demanding fast pace unfair sometime.short of help all the time I learned computer skills and management skills. 20 years. Good people nice bosses some of them!

title: Decent
review: Easy, nice hours, planned days off,ppto and pto, and benefits. The pay is ok, but not the best,could be better. 1 hour to 30 min lunch breaks. Most management is ok

title: decent pay
review: I recommend this company. You can excel if you know what you are doing, able to and willing to learn, willing to do hard work, work holidays, work weekends.

title: it was ok
review: it was fine and i hope to work there again in the future. it was a short time working there but i learned quite a bit. one thing i learned was how to spell walmart.

title: Decent job
review: The work was okay it can get crazy at some hours but the inventory work can get get bad because it piles on top of eachother and then falling on the nexts shift also management doesn’t care they are not your friend

title: Never again
review: Started good, but working on the frontend team was a joke. They left me to figure things out on my own during my training period. Always got late breaks and when you gave notice about schedule changes or time off requests they always declined it or would say they “didn’t see your request” until the last minute. Customers are always rude and entitled. Management was lazy and never left their offices unless regional was coming in. All in all, it was a terrible workplace and I do not recommend it.

title: Horrible
review: Overwhelming,  your overworked and under paid.. management looks at the employees as just a number and not the back bone of the company.  Hours are very long.

title: Hard work, low pay
review: Good place to earn a paycheck that is it. Could be a great place to work, but upper management needs more people skills training. They treat associates like children and favor some over others regardless of your performance.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Growth opportunity fast past family members not just a job What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The rush an high demands but still get the work done an having super satisfied costumersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Family member an smiling faces is always a pleasure What is a typical day like for you at the company?Working hard to fill the store before costumers come to insure they can come in an out with wat they need

title: Productive and fun place to work with a lot of diversity & cool people.
review: I struggle with emotional & physical health and I have been on permanent disability since 2016. I had some problems last year and I struggled with the powers of PTSD, making it difficult to always be at work. I went to my Store Manager, I was heard and she assisted me in finding the correct ADA plan and assured me I would still have a job when I returned. I have returned to part time hours at my local store. I massively appreciated the assistance, direction, and listening skills of our management team. When you need time away from work, it's good that know that someone has your back.

title: coworkers are mostly fun
review: Walmart facilitates excelent interpersonal communication as part of the sales associate track.  I feel valued by some of the management and do not get along with other managers

title: Love it
review: The best position you can get in the store. I love it . Good pay. They don't bother you. You know what you are doing. You do the same job everyday. I love love love it

title: Fun work
review: Awesome place to work at. Great coworkers and management. Great benefits and pay. Nothing to complain about. Fun environment and you stay busy helping customers

title: Soul sucking
review: It's awful. High turnover. No accountability. Unreasonable expectations. Toxic work environment. Incompetent managers. Unlivable wages. Zero communication.

title: Had fun
review: I had lots of fun at this job but was fired due to missing too much work due to personal illness, they expect you to come to work even if you have  diarrhea.

title: Loved and miss
review: I left Walmart due to COVID and me being a high risk with my pregnancy. Dr told me to not work due to having asthma and already being high-risk for COVID the pregnancy made me more acceptable.  I wish to reapply I love my job as cashier and stocker.

title: Met some amazing coworkers.
review: The management especially in cashiering is horrible. They do not care if you're in bad health or in and out of the hospital or even have a loss in the family. If management does not personally gain anything from you then you're a liability and they will be quick to give you little to no hours and then "Let you go".

title: job is clear and straight forward
review: the schedule was great, pay was decent. as long as you keep your head down do your job, don't mix with the rig-raff you'll be fine. straight forward work load. people will help at the end of the shift, but not with over stock

title: Alright place
review: Great place to work if you are ready to deal with nagging customersI have experience working for an employer, which I am very happy to share with you if you are interested. I worked as a web developer for [company name]. I am very familiar with the job description and how it was achieved in reality.I was able to complete all tasks that were given to me on time and with quality. I learned a lot from my employers and colleagues, which helped me grow professionally and personally.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get good breaks, flexible schedule and some good friends What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When someone who is in charge of you at work tends to be nicer manangeing and backstabs youWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s who you know or look likeWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Normally pretty uneventful , normally the same as as every other day

title: Cashier
review: Long hours, weird split shifts, disorganized. High turnover, job expectations unclear. Get reviewed for how quickly you scan items but also need to interact and be to nice customers

title: Strict time limits
review: Everything is timed. If you fall behind on that time for any reason, you are penalized. Management is strict in requiring you to work very hard and fast at all times.

title: Ok work place
review: Walmart was a ok place to work for the time being I do think the pay and management could be better, they could also use better rules but it’s decent

title: You're a part of one of the largest companies in the world.
review: Walmart is a very common job for all types of people. You will be able to have a chance to get along with people from different places and life paths.

title: not bad place
review: All co-workers are friendly and respectful. Pretty simple easy work, stocking shelves, keeping the area clean, helping customers. Management has been very cooperative with availability and the scheduling is consistent. Pay could be a little better, with online shoppers making more than Garden associates, but overall I can't complain.

title: Love my work
review: Great work life balance, team culture and overtime opportunities. I enjoy the friendly and cooperative environment and the engaging support system that is offered

title: Great Place Advance
review: Love my job at Walmart. It has been a great place so far and I enjoy the staff and people who come in! I am hoping to work my way up the ladder and get a higher job.

title: Nice and quiet
review: For the most part I liked working at Walmart overnight because you did not have to deal with the customers. However in order to like that job you have to be comfortable with the late hours.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Its always a positive environment and I love the people.. also the pay rates are the best I've ever made! I love my job!!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Very Fast paced. But that's also a positive point as well.. it helps to pass the time by faster. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Positive, friendly, upbeat, goal oriented What is a typical day like for you at the company?Driving a forklift, in the freezer side, where it's cold and I love it!

title: Busy workplace
review: Job is good for staying active 10,000 plus steps an 8-hour shift. Work isn't super meaningful, but its a paycheck. Job can be challenging if your out of shape. Dispensing is probably the most physical part since you're constantly lifting heavy totes of merchandise to bring out to the customer.

title: Very fun and challenging
review: I mostly just helped out all around the store, I enjoyed talking with customers and other employees, the basics of electronics is to know a few selective ideas about electronic devices and other things. On a scale from 1 to 10 I'd rate electronics a 7/10 they mostly just brought out overstock to see if it went out.

title: Not the best place to work at
review: The people can be nice and so as the management but it’s a very fast paced with no breaks. You can sometimes feel disrespected as person from the management not caring about your needs. They expect you to know everything once you start.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Lots of experience with customer service.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I never got stressed out because i enjoyed working with and helping customers.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Tense at times.And others were ok What is a typical day like for you at the company? Busy and never a dull moment.

title: Good experience working there
review: As long as you go in and do your job you don’t hear from management.  After training you are pretty much on your own as long as you do your job and no one bothers you.  It gets really busy first of the month.  I loved the walking

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?management always has my back and supports me.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?cash accountability work in office balancing store What is the work environment and culture like at the company?my location is very nice, and seamless... have no issuesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?busy, you must be organized and detailed if you do this in this position you will succeed.
position: Wal-Mart Customer Service Manager/Cash Office Accounting

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Easy work, pay is ok and close to most people What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers from top to bottom What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Horrible, there is no culture. They fall very short on creating a safe healthy environment for its employees What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressed, high tension. No communication

title: A lot of good people, a modest amount of growth
review: Walmart 2242 has been great in terms of being able to meet people from all walks of life. I’ve had the pleasure of making pretty lifelong connections. When I wanted to move up from electronics, I was recognized by management and moved to claims on the warehouse. All about the amount of effort you are willing to put in.

title: Okay
review: I would not work as a cashier here. I think any other position would be not as bad but cashiers get paid the least and have the most brain dead job. You will be at a cash register all day and wish you were doing anything else.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There is none. What a toxic place to work. The turnover rate is insane. Severely understaffed. They won’t allow you the tools you need to do your job like pucks and printers. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything. They don’t allow you the tools to do your job. They give you these second hand virus infected phones that constantly freeze up or reset to scan your items. You spend more time fighting with the phones than scanning. Then there’s the work carts. When you arrive it’s a fight to get an empty one because almost all are still full of last shifts overstock.  The management of this store are incompetent. I’m surprised it’s still open. There’s a reason the shelves are always empty and destroyed and it’s not Covid. The day shift doesn’t face the store before they leave which makes it hard putting things away. A lot of the time they are plugging empty homes with items that don’t go there so you pull it all off the shelf and move it all to the right spot or throw your right item back into overstock. There’s just too much to list but they can’t even keep people there including team leads. Some only last a week and some do their Orientation and never come back. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic. Feel dirty after a night working there. Best way to describe it is Like how a hooker feels after a long night and can’t wait to wash it off. There’s a reason they can’t keep employees at this store.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Get there early - more...

title: Comprehensive benifits that falls flat when working for a terrible company with inflexible schedule and poor morale.
review: One of the biggest red flags is no matter what position you apply for, you work for WalMart first, it is a way they can rope you into doing labor that is not signed on for.They do not accept any form of sick note from any doctor, they are very inflexible when it comes to scheduling, they have this point system and do not realise that things happen to people. Morale at this company is extraordinarily low and going to work every day is painful within itself, before I even clock in for the day.

title: Decent entry level job
review: I think all people should have to work here at least once. You learn so much about others and about how important it is to be kind.  This was a great first job.

title: Not rocket science
review: Upper management can make or break the experience. The few good Coaches that work and communicate effectively will be run off or burned out. Most will sit in the ad office on their phones all day and only step out to whine and complain.

title: Rude & stressful
review: Management is rude. They expect you to have great days all the time which I get it’s a job but it can get very stressful for no reason they don’t know how to talk to people AT ALL

title: A stress filled overstimulating environment
review: For the last two and a half years I have been stressed out and over worked. I have no life outside of my job. I'm way to physically and mentally tired for anything after. Most of my requested days off are rejected. You can't take a day off unless you have PTO to cover it. No matter the reason. They even tried to deny me bereavement leave. I'm a breastfeeding mom and they put my supply at risk yesterday also they work on a point system for taking days off you can only miss 5days in a 6month time period or you loose your job. They do have some good benefits. The medical benefits are garbage. No where in town will expect them and you have to pay completely out of pocket to maybe be reimbursed half. Only the vision insurance is worth it. They have life insurance and 401k that are worth it. However I don't know what happens to that money if you are no longer at that job. Management is garbage they thrive in chaos and love to create extra chaos for everyone. Overall not the best job I have had.

title: Productive fun place
review: Good job, decent pay, flexible scheduling, work-life balance can be manageable. If you communicate with upper management on time they will listen to you.

title: Awful. It was Awful.
review: Awful awful awful. Bad management, favorites, will lock you into a position and not let you move if you are good at it. Literally 80% turn over rate.

title: Work environment depends on management if they are good or bad
review: Not the best healthcare plan. you have to pay a lot out of pocket before it covers anything. Not great at working with schedules if you have children

title: It’s alright
review: It’s a good job but the attendance policy sucks. All you do is shop all day. Mornings are the best but evenings are alright. It’s good pay for a starting job. Better than fast food

title: Fun place to work
review: My managers were cool. My responsibilities were pretty much the same every shift. Co workers made me feel like I was in high school again. They love rumors and other people’s business.  Do what you’re supposed to and you’ll be fine.

title: They don't care about people
review: The company doesnt communicate. They don't adequately train. And they purposely slim through benefits explanations so fewer people sign up and it costs them less. They gave me 0 explanation and therefore I had to go almost a year with no health benefits.

title: Decent Starter
review: Walmart was my first customer service job. They had amazing benefits for a first-timer. I did however notice a lack of management and it did not matter what location you went to. The best part of the job was that I formed a wonderful work family.

title: great work place
review: very good company and everyone is so nice to and you get very good pay and if you work hard the will reward you so dont get lazy just do your job and they got you

title: Poor management
review: Managers favored employees. They were lazy and pushed all their work on others. Don’t know how to be respectful. Took forever to respond when needed. They always took the customers side even when they were 100% wrong. Always taking smoke breaks more than what is allowed.

title: Easy
review: Very easy job that takes no prior expeirience you can shpw up unlaod turcks and stcok items all day very understaffed long time ago but seems pretty steady rn

title: Rewards only new employees
review: 20 year associates do not make much more than new hires. They treat middle-management, like disposable goods, promising the world, working up to the bone and giving them nothing

title: terrible auto service they are not great period they just act like a high school kid
review: i would go into detail but there is no need just go in and see for yourself it’s hazardous for the public to bring there car there even just for an oil change like i would wanna say some thing about how they operate.

title: Too much favoritism and not enough pay for associates
review: They raise the pay once every couple years and it never really keeps up with inflation. Management will let certain people do whatever they want and get away with it.

title: Productive
review: Good money for the amount of work that was expected to be done. Would work there again if I needed to. Customers and management were very easy to deal with.

title: Bad work environment
review: Don't get me wrong there were some amazing people higher up but there were also people who used their status to their advantage and made the normal employees do their work.

title: friendly environment to work
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Positive Interaction with some customersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some negative teamwork from other employeesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not enough positive feedback from managers.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Lack of teamwork required of others to make a more positive work environment for all employees.

title: Decent
review: Work is a bit phyiscal if you happen to eventually be pulled into helping with unloading the trucks and bringing out the boxes onto the floor with a pallet jack otherwise just listen to music and have fun there. Management sucks typically and they dont really care about you as a person, you are worker bees to them

title: Repetitive Fast Paced
review: Seems that Walmart is always understaffed.  Which makes your job duties difficult and overwhelming.  So manager's are rude and condescending.  Not  worth breaking your back for 16-17 an hour. Also, depending on the store you work for, Makes a big difference!!

title: Easy
review: Easy workplace has a unique culture that is their own, often described as fun, congenial, collaborative, positive, passionate, and creative. Their work environment, people, and workplace practices all help create a vibrant, positive, magnetic, and infectious culture.

title: Understaffed
review: Good stable job but being understaffed has you and others to cover multiple jobs. The people are nice but work can become overwhelming when you do not have adequate help.

title: Not bad
review: Wasn’t a horrible place to work, the pay is fairly low but that’s kinda expected for retail. Some cool co workers, management makes bad decisions a lot of the time though

title: All Bad! Horrible Company!!!
review: All Bad!!! Horrible Company!!!!! Nothing good to say. Supervisors don’t care about employees. Work area nothing but stress, stress and mistreatment of all employees!!!
position: Customer Service, plus Shipping, Receiving and Stocking too

title: Fast paced and stressful
review: Ok work environment, managers are stuck up and strict. 2 15 minute breaks paid and a 1 hour lunch unpaid. Stressful when busy. Store manager only cares about number and doesn’t care about employees

title: I love to ensure that the products were showcased in a proper manner for the customers.
review: I've worked for Walmart's establishment for about 3 years. Coming from a corporate background the infrastructures were very poor. However, I was very driven and customer service oriented to do my best to anticipate the needs of the organization. Typically, management is the face of the company. I loved my job helping with customer service and the rotation of Walmart's products.

title: Wallmart.....is not the best by far
review: They don't pay holiday pay Thier stores are very dirty the management is lazy and lack social skills always give attitude when need of days off team leads are a joke no hr department at all no sick days and the attendance policy s are terrible

title: Boring
review: Easy but boring. Hard to move up. Alot of favoritism. Most of the co workers were cool and fun to hang out with. Management was okay some were nice, others were power hungry.

title: Not a nice work environment.!!!
review: Nothing you do is enough for the company.Walmart makes you feel incompetent.Leads have very little disposition to train and direct.I do not feel appreciated in any way.

title: Easy but demanding job
review: Not the worst place to work. Management would frequently forget to give breaks which is probably the biggest con. The schedule is flexible and the pay was ok

title: Productive and great working atmosphere
review: I loved working with my fellow employees.it is a great atmosphere to work in managers are very understanding about family issues.they give you a chance to advances in your position and do yearly reviews and raises.i had to leave to take care of my elderly father and they were very understanding

It is a company that in order for you to reach a goal of rising as a person, you have to like the bosses, otherwise you will always continue down, no matter how much effort you have made as a good employee.

title: It is what you make of it
review: As an OGP worker, you have the best job in the store. You are off shopping for what people order and its extremely easy as the TC tells you exactly where the item is. There are also always going to be some extremely slow pickers on your team so as long as you don't take 30 mins in between finding each item this job is fun.

title: Working at Walmart made me feel as if I had alot to offer the customers and I was glad to be part of the team!
review: I was sorry I was never able to get a job at Walmart  in Weymouth after  I had to leave when my mother-in-law died. However, the managers were changed and, it was important that I help my husband get a new job at the time. I would really like to be part of the team again but, I would not have quit if it wasn't an emergency.

title: Pros are your coworkers cons the management they'll keep a high school mentality.
review: You will love your co workers they became my second family. The management is a joke definitely peaked in highschool and never got past that childish phase. If you're someone like me that likes to improve quality of life and safety better just keep your mouth shut because they won't do anything for you because they're job scared and won't bring it up to upper management.

title: Productive
review: It was a really good job, but not a good pay and short staffed. Its a good job for those who are still studying since they're very flexible with their schedules.

title: good first job
review: if you’re looking for a good first time job i would recommend. management isn’t the best but it pays decent and you get your breaks.  you will have to do a log of stuff outside your job title

title: stressful and unorganized
review: They over work their dependable employees. Management is incredibly rude and pick favorites when it comes to removing points. Everything is rushed and they expect for you to finish your work plus help out other departments within your time there.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Opportunity and the management were always good to meWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Shortage in staff due to employee call insWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment had plenty of opportunities to learn various departments.   Culture aligned with my beliefs What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very eventful with plenty to do

title: Scheduling
review: Schedule is not flexible you can not pick your hours. If you tell them you can only work a certain schedule they just won't schedule you. If you agree to be open with your hours then they can and will schedule you multiple days in a row because Walmart hours run between Sat. - Sat. So then they could schedule you anytime in between usually only one day off hardly ever 2 off in a row. No overtime they say they pay ot but they will cut yours so you won't get  ot.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Driving the forklift, waxing the floors , What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I didn’t have any stress I have over 40 years experience What is the work environment and culture like at the company?What I did I didn’t fill like it was work I’ve that kind of work for so longWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Came in punch in went to work

title: Not very stressful and good pay for amount of work.
review: Job was not very difficult and I found myself with a lot of free time. Management would be difficult to work with at times but nothing too bad.

title: Terrible management
review: Loved my coworkers in 2nd shift stocking but the entire store treated our crew like garbage like we weren’t important even though most days we had to help other positions out to finish their work leading to us not finishing ours. Management doesn’t know what they are doing they set the worst expectations they know can’t be met and don’t actually help out at all

title: Very hard work.
review: I started my overnight stocking job at Wal-Mart a few weeks ago and let me tell you its not for the feint of heart. The pace at which you need to be moving AT ALL TIMES is ridiculous. It will wear you down mentally and physically. Add on top of that big egos and power trips by not only the managers but by your fellow associates and it creates an extremely hostile work environment. I would not recommend anyone doing this shift.

title: Bien
review: Me aparece muy bien y completo exelente de todo y

title: What you want out of a company.
review: First, you have to recognize that most retail positions (especially management) tend to tank the work/life balance scales, mainly in the last quarter (the holidays). As a salaried member of management, you can expect to average 60+ hours a week and crank that up during the holidays. You will spend more time with your co-workers than you do with your family, guaranteed. There’s never enough human coverage, there’s always some type of “emergency” that requires you to stay late or forget about your day off. It’s just the biz. Unfortunately, no one will remember those times you stayed 4 hours past your shift to help out or the days off you sacrificed for the “team”. The first time you call off because you take a loved one to the hospital, you will forever be known as unreliable and you can forget about any future development. Because, that “team” that was so warm and thankful when your sacrifice allowed them to go home has instantly turned cold and squeezed you out. If you’re boss wants you out, you’re gone! Senior leadership is somehow immune to their own “open door” policy and even more, people ranked as high as Vice President are unable to think in a reasonable manner when it comes to the treatment of the personnel that allows the company to excel. If you’re comfortable with all of the previous FACTS, keep reading. Walmart is a dynamic company with a large variety of positions and locations possibilities. They’re also one of the largest retailers in the world, so I wouldn’t bet that stores will fade away any time soon. Success takes sacrifice! So, as long as you’re accepting - more...

title: Managers should receive specialized training
review: Aside from poorly equipped managers, the job was fun. Poor management and social skills trickle down the levels of hierarchy. The unrealistic pressures placed on the managers ruined formerly good relations between the staff and the management.

title: Great if you love being harassed daily
review: When I worked there I was constantly being yelled at by management, always rude and disrespectful towards their employees. Great pay but better options out there!

title: Treats employees poorly
review: If you have a life especially with kids outside of Walmart don't expect them to care about unexpected things like school closing they will still fire you if you have to miss too many days or will deny you those days off so that you get pointed for it. If you're their favorite you don't have to worry about it and don't really have to do much of anything but stand around in a group with the team leads chit chatting but if you're not a favorite you best get to work. When I worked there they had cashiers repainting the customer service area.  They had one girl always getting on her hands and knees scrubbing the cash registers and floors and she was a cashier.  Just expect to be made to do jobs you weren't hired to do and to deal with favoritism and horrible management if you plan on working there. They were willing to change the schedule for a girl that was newer than me because she had kids but when I asked they got mad and I also have children. Like I said, favoritism.

title: ok place to work as an hvac-r tech
review: ok place to work as an hvac-r tech, the pay is ok, benefits are ok, but could be better, lacking on vacation time, the work day is unpredictable at times

title: Nice Pay/Hard Work
review: With any retail operation that’s very busy, it’s a never ending job. My team is great, my coworkers are thoughtful, our store manager is direct, but getting everything close to perfect is a daunting task. At times working over the twelve hours we are scheduled to put in is draining. I do enjoy, however, looking at our sales figures smash the goals set by our market team.

title: It is not worth it
review: They expect you to call everyday during bereavement time, and also they do not give raises, plus they aggressively pressure you to do your job, they give you an hour break when really they should give you a 30 minute break instead.

title: Good for college
review: Good job to have in college, can give them a flexible schedule they will usually follow. But sometimes they cut hours without warning. Easy enough job :)

title: Ok place
review: Not much room for advancement if that's what your looking for. Change in management. Enjoyable part of the job is being able to work with great people.

title: Terrible Management
review: Management does not care about their employees, just being in charge. Huge power trip.Benefits are decent. If you like having a life outside of walmart, good luck. Do management work for associate pay. They will make sure they get their bonus at your expense

title: fun workplace but a lot of drama
review: you get paid well but you can’t ever get time off. their point system is messed up. you can NEVER miss ever even if you are sick. and there is so much drama. so much . and the managers are not that great . i have worked there a total of about 9 months. i went back but it was still just as bad if not worse lol

title: Cashier
review: Very little training, some unfriendly employees,supv,one who trained me had attitude,late lunches,no breaks didnt stick to days you didn't want to work pay was low

title: descent
review: descent place , management was good , they helped has as could , good work life balance , helped pay for school starting was good , just wish it was closer to where i lived.

title: Chaotic
review: Pay was okay but walmart has since gone downhill. Anything and everything goes there now. There's no professionalism and they hire anybody. It seems as if not a family oriented store anymore.

title: Simple Work
review: All co-workers are friendly and respectful. Pretty simple easy work, stocking shelves, keeping the area clean, helping customers. Management has been very cooperative with availability and the scheduling is consistent. Pay could be a little better, with online shoppers making more than Garden associates, but overall I can't complain.

title: Rewarding not enough pay
review: Company is a fast growing company. They expect a lot of you with not enough employee to complete the tasks. A lot of room for growth but expect to work over 55 hours and expect to work your off days to make sure tasks are completed and things that market level managers want you to complete

title: Eh
review: Management sucks per usual, hard work for not enough pay. For the most part you’re on your own. Only time management comes around is to tell you something needs to be done

title: Stay away
review: The store management demands that the  ogp department have to find the items, the inventory is never up to date, the night crewb does not do its job as it should and then it is up to the picker to have to go to the warehouse every time they do not find the item in the aisles which affects your pick rate. Many irresponsible and young employees in the department who never are reprimended and those who are never absent, work overtime and give 200% they take retaliation against them. People who shouldn't be team leads are and have no idea what they're doing.

title: Great place to work. Good pay and benefits
review: They are a good company to work for. I worked at 5 different stores and only had management problems at 1.  Good pay and good benefits.  Easy to get promoted.

title: Toxic 9/10 times.
review: Management is often horrible and unprofessional, They won't allow you to advance if they like you where you are at. management is constantly changing and so are policies and standards, in their newest company-wide reset, they reduced members of management and shifted more responsibilities onto the entry-level associates to save themselves money. and yet hours for all full-time associates were constantly getting cut because they were "over budget and overstaffed" when the associates were struggling to cope to start with, but no overtime either. The company opening numerous new stores due to unexpectedly high sales last year can't afford it.

title: Fun
review: I really enjoy working here I am a hard worker and don’t mind the hard labor at all,I get along with all my coworkers I learned how to control customers and talk them through problems

title: Opportunities Everywhere
review: Great company with awesome culture. People are excellent, and pay is good. Only complaint is shiftwork. Unless you are the top boss, there is no schedule that does not include working at least part of the weekend.

title: fun workplaxe
review: stay productive be on time points system covid questionnaire good schedule time off requests approved you earn pto & pptogood pay can see how much you get paid everyday

title: overworked and moronic higherups but good pay
review: I worked an overnight shift. It was rough; I was a good worker and was constantly picking up the slack for others. Despite this, rampant favoritism was all throughout the company. They would fire workers they didn't like and allow those whom they did to get away with way too much. This caused actual good workers to be blamed and have to pick up the slack. The managers would constantly cuss and belittle employees. Overall I didn't mind the work itself but rather the way that the company treated me and others. Mass firings would happen regularly after holidays.

title: Cool place to work
review: Very laid back and decent pay for the amount of work. Management can sometimes be unresponsive, but overall everyone works together and it’s a good team atmosphere.

title: Good pay
review: Cert good I really love the bosses great job good pay but strict must show up Sunday’s good I love them tuesday I only work little long big promotion love ok

title: Productive
review: Fast paced be prepared to work as hard as you have ever worked plus the shifts can be better depending on what kind of shifts work best for your life

title: good team and upper Managment
review: Worked with a wonderful team and had a great district manager as well. The pharmacy software was safe and almost impossible to make any mistakes. 401K matching was available.

title: You are just a number
review: I liked my managers but you are definitely just a number. They have a point system, and if you hit like 7 points you are fired no questions asked. I worked there for almost a year, my managers liked me so when they weren’t there I was pretty much acting manager, without the pay. Not enough staff most of the time for rushes.

title: Biggest retail chain
review: No time at home for truck drivers, they expect 14 hours a day every day including the day you go home. Rules and regulations are enormous, meetings and training videos take precedence over everything else. Slip seating 100%, pay is great if you prefer to live in a truck for 6 days and off 1.

title: Workload
review: The average employee at Walmart makes $31,618 per year. Walmart employees are most likely to be members of the republican party. On average, employees at Walmart stay with the company for 3.3 years.

title: Take it or leave it
review: My experience working for this company is more so neutral than anything.  The pay is good for the area/not much competition.  It has a high turnover-rate for good reason.  You have the potential to learn different jobs and opportunities within the company.  Though the concerns of production workers to help make their production goals more ethical and attainable are ill recieved.  Employees also seem to be encouraged to tell on each other and create unnecessary workplace drama.  The management and fellow employee cooperation and understanding is severely displaced in which effectively makes the environment undesirable to work in.

title: It's Walmart: what do you expect?
review: Job requirements are excessive for wages. Digital shoppers are required to meet strict goals and this can make the job very stressful. Some managers are good, some bad. HR is not always helpful.

title: Decent pay, unrealistic expectations
review: Busy your butt constantly and always expect more, watch for management as they are all about the company and not for helping you out, if you can't perform at a high level then this job definitely isn't for you.

title: Good paying
review: It is extremely hard work. However, you are compensated greatly for it. They all train you for three months and can cross train to different jobs in the facility.

title: Stressful and horrible management
review: Very stressful and you are forced to pick up the slack for other departments when other people just are too lazy or don’t qualify for the position. Also, don’t ever expect to leave on time, you stay until management decides you’re done

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people that work there  good schedule easy work What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Angry customers people expect to much out of a person mostly the customers What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Along of young people it's a tight knit group that has fun while at workWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers stocking shelves pulling stock from back room

title: great
review: ity, Results, Innovation and Teamwork in a positive, safe and inclusive environment. You will scan the barcodes with our proprietary handheld devices, for the current inventory at Customer locations to provide them with proper inventory information that will assist them in making better business decisions and better supporting their customers! We are passionate about our people, technology, and process because when you succeed, we succeed.

title: Not a bad place to work
review: Co workers can make or break the experience. I’d recommend just mind your business clock in and clock out to make it through the day. Schedule is fair, usually work as much as you like if you tell HR ahead of time

title: Buena paga
review: Buena paga en general pero la gerencia es un desastre. Clientes son malcriados, los compañeros no te ayudan y para crecer en la compañía es bien dificil a menos que le caigas bien al jefe.

title: Terrible managers understaffed stressful
review: This job is one of the most streaks ones I’ve ever had. Management sucked. I did the work of two people and didn’t get compensated for that. They constantly told me they were gonna how more workers from months but never did. It was stressful I took my lunch late almost everyday. I do not recommend this job.

title: Not too bad
review: As long as you do what you are asked of you and show up to work like you’re supposed to then it’s really chill. It has its days but that’s all work places though.

title: Equipment Operator
review: My job mainly deals with moving and order filling Merchandise throughout the facility on a piece of equipment. We make sure that we pull the corrects items that need to taken to taken and filled for the orders that drop for the day.

title: Relaxed environment, bad managment
review: Nothing super out of the ordinary working in the back, you get to wear your headphones, you earn pto even as part time. But, because of management nobody stays that long. The job would be great if the management was consistent on how they treat employees and were actually available to talk to you.

title: Company needs to do some soul searching
review: I've watched this company go from being a decent place to work to an absolute joke. Management is only in it to protect themselves. They have no care about their employees and HR and their open door policy is a bad joke. If you are a compassionate person they will force you to change or you are gone.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The point system is ridiculous.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Managers are so unprofessional and petty.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not safe, security is a joke!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful

title: Terrible place to work
review: Just got tired of the favorites, worked like a dog. Very much unappreciated and uncompensated.  Management  were disrespectful and thought they had the right to do as such.

title: New opportunities
review: It was an okie experience. Colleagues were supportive. HR was great. Pay rate was less. Flexible hours. Managers were emphatic. Store was always dirty.

title: Little hours
review: It was alright but when I worked there they only worked me for about 4-8 hrs like 3 days a week. I only quit because I don't like standing in one spot all day as it turns out and that I wasn't making enough money

title: Love job
review: I loved my job you make friends  management  treats you fair   good job  great benefits  long lunch  easy to work jobs   get the hours you need and want

title: not much and it was a horrible experience, but it was there for me when the pandamic started and I needed a job.
review: The days go by fast if you are in the front.  Management seems to like the kids for promotion other than qualified adults and with the pandemic it was a horrible experience.  Running out of change constantly and having to explain why to the customers.  Listening to customers views non stop about the pandemic and politics was very draining.  I felt like I was under control with management walking around and never speaking to staff.  Managements acrues so much time off they are always taking a week or two off every other month it seemed.  I never got a raise and watched while other departments got raises and the front did not.  You can transfer to another department but the pay stays the same basically and you work harder.
position: Front End Associate Duties Involving Customer Service

title: Depends on the store...
review: It's Walmart. It's a multi-billion dollar business. It doesn't care about you or your hard work. They'll always find ways to screw you over. They'll fire you and find someone else to fill in your spot. If you want to promote, start kissing up immediately.

title: Overnight
review: Working overnight is not for everyone. You have to change how you live because you’re sleeping during the day. At the time the overnight worker hours didn’t get cut like the daytime crew. It was a needed job so it was hard for them to let you go.

title: Fair enough
review: Its a fair place to work. The customers are good the upfront staff is very gossipy but if you mind your own.. your alright. You always get an hour lunch. Thats great.

title: Easy
review: The job was very easy, the pay was awesome. The only thing about this store was the management and how they would over work me sometimes. Other than that, it’s a great job overall.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing was good at Walmart  ,never work there again What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Manager s don't know what there doing  and don't know  what employees are doing What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very stressful  ,work your butt off ,and manager doesn't know what your doing, they work to many  departments What is a typical day like for you at the company?You know what you have to do like mods ,and then store manager  gives you things to do ,then co manager  gives you things to do then coach over department  gives you things to do ,then other  coaches give you things to do ,then you don't  get mods done and they wonder why

title: Liked working there, you are encouraged to learn.
