review: Loved the job and the people, having ADHD effected on occasion being on time. Was let go for not being on time by a couple minutes. Just because someone is late by a minute or two, should not determine there fate. I always stayed later than my assigned quitting time....

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay was good. Other than that everything else you can think of was not good. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working at the company. I mean as a whole I worked in the warehouse but the stores are bad too (word of mouth) the company do not care about their employees one bitWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?High school. Very catty and combative. The higher ups are the worse. You will find yourself arguing with them more than anyone and it’s like people are constantly trying to compete with one another What is a typical day like for you at the company?Typical day is like you wake up and don’t want to get out of bed at 5 am but when you finally do it is nothing but a rush from that point on. You rush to get there on time, rush around the warehouse to hit these ridiculous numbers, rush to and from lunch (40 minute break broken up into two 20 minute break for a 12 hour shift) and you rush to get home just to start it all over again the next day

title: Over worked and under paid
review: Always doing fast paced work with impossible goals, while the managers make twice as much to stand there play on the phone and watch. Then come complain at you for not meeting the expectations.

title: It’s a political game
review: Make the right friends and you’ll go far in the company. If not you’ll be very unhappy doing all the s***** grunt work and the won’t give you as many hours when the need to cut them

title: Great 1st job
review: My first job, enjoyed working here while in college. My coworkers made the job fun, and we actually want to do a good job; however, most customers assume we aren’t smart and think we are second class citizens bc of where we work.

title: Borinh
review: Not enough money they work you hard not willing too work with ur schedule they will fire you over doctors notes and not care they don’t care bout employees at all

title: Redundant duties delegated
review: Duties were delegated redundantly to miscellaneous amount of others. So a lot of work is redone shortly after being completed already by another associate and will most likely be done again by a following shift associate.

title: Walmart
review: I love Walmart security I felt safe and I enjoyed the job and I wouldn’t mind working back there and I enjoyed helping the customers engaging with them getting to know themI’m that brief15 to 20 seconds of ringing them up I enjoyed my time at Walmart it was an honor meeting and seeing new faces I loved everything about the place the enmplyoess the friend I made the cashier the managers

title: Fast-paced
review: Co-workers were great, but management and customers were not. Had to work an entire department by myself a lot of the time because the store was understaffed. Or be told to do things I knew nothing about.Having two breaks (whenever I could actually take them) and an hour lunch was a plus side.

title: No one ever seems to know what's going on within the company on a day-to-day basis very unorganized and buried demanding
review: Started out as full-time they cut my hours down to three days a week with no notification your job description is not what they tell you when you hire on you end up doing everything in the store just depending on where they need you they don't care got your personal life or whether you don't have child care whether you're sick very unsupportive management

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?It is easy work and descent pay. You can clock in and out on your phone, It is always changing and laid back. It beats a factory. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The customers and it all depends on who you are working under.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast pace but nothing out of the ordinary, alwaus changing, It's fun, laid back, and energetic all at once. Lots of Diversity and acceptence.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Easy going, no stress, work at my own pace as long as I'm hitting my goals. Everyone that I work with are helpful and kind.

title: Great Reward
review: Excellent staff and they treat the employees great sometimes the work can be hard but nothing too overwhelming. I’m an overnight associate and the pay is good.

title: Get ready to just be a number
review: Nobody cares about your well-being here’s even the other employees. Everyone’s too afraid of the management to say anything about how unsafe and badly maintained the equipment is, and the management doesn’t care about you one bit. I only saw the manager when I was walking into the shop. Very independent, figure your own rhythm out type of place, and not accommodating at all if you get injured. Don’t have a car accident while you work here, they WILL fire you.

title: It was interesting and fun most of the time
review: Sometimes customers were rude and would cuss you out. You just had to remember customers always right and smile throughout the day.My Supervisors were great though I loved my coworkers.

title: Just another corporation
review: This was my first job, it was an okay one. But definitely glad I'm gone. Management is almost always rude and only thinks abou themselves. Never get what you need to get the job done. Impossible tasks expected to be done by one person.Only good thing was since either was a corporation, there were a few PTO days.

title: good supervisor
review: The supervisor is very nice and willing to help the staff. Willing to listen to staff suggestions. Willingness to teach employees how to work effectively.

title: It's aight
review: I learned a lot and got a lot of customer service experience but I was still labeled as a cashier even though I can do everything in customer service and being paid like a cashier.

title: Decent Management, Bad Workers
review: I enjoyed my time working there. As time went on, management got better. But the majority of staff is high school students and the turn around rate is crazy. a lot of lazy people considering it is a super easy job

title: Walmart is a great environment to work at
review: What Good about Walmart is you get work as team, able to build a your career take one at a time. What Bad about Walmart is learning from your mistakes but forgive, build your intelligence from negative to positive self of stem point of view

title: Walmart is not the place to work
review: Walmart promotes bad work ethic and gives no incentive to be a productive employee. They punish the hardworking associates and praise the one who have a less then favorable work ethic.

title: Good pay, breaks, PTO, and management
review: Self checkouts or standing at a register not hard. Proper training. Good hour long breaks. Paid time off. Standing for long periods of times on the floors there weren't the greatest.

title: Tranquilo
review: Una empresa que lo tienes que ver cómo trabajo pues no ayuda a superarte pero si quieres empezar en algo y agarrar experiencia está bien

title: schedule
review: As long as you give them enough time you can pretty much choose what days you have off. It also depends if they’re willing to somewhat work with you and your needs

title: Great starter job with ok starting pay, but are expected to do more after a while.
review: Management makes or breaks your experience here. Customers do as well but you will run into terrible customers anywhere. The management I had were nice and understanding. I felt that they tried to work with me when and if they could. Working hard and having a nice attitude will help you move around in the store. Working faster only incentivizes them to give you more work but you will also be talked to for not finishing something fast enough so take it at a decent pace but don't overdo it. You don't want to get hurt here, because the entire process of dealing with a workplace injury is horrible. There are times where the "culture" feels very high school-y, though that might be due to the small town nature. (Everyone knows practically everyone).  This also made it easier to make friends of friends I'll admit, but trying to work through the cliques first was difficult. The most "enjoyable" part of the job was probably the certainty of having a job in general. The "hardest" part would probably be trying to fight through the monotony day after day. That gets real exhausting.

title: Dysfunctional and needs help
review: Awful place to work. Management was awful. Shelves are empty all the time and it’s impossible to get items to come in so customers constantly complain that they can’t the items that they want.

title: I enjoy helping out my customers and taking care of there needs.
review: The hardest part of the job is when you don't get Responsive help from your coworkers.The store I work at could be more stocked and organized. Needs some cleaning up. Some days can be stressful.

title: Unfair expectations
review: I was fired for talking to my coworkers too much. We would finish our work so there was NOTHING else to do before talking and I still somehow got fired. They kept people with upward of 10 points on their stupid system but someone who showed up everyday got fired for talking to a coworker.

title: Could be better on management
review: It’s hard at times to get off on timr , while working a 12 hour’s shift but get off workin 16 hours four to five days a eeek often , it’s a good company to work for , Fair at times

title: People share is a good company
review: I think people share is a good company to work for! I applied and the wonderful and helpful people help me with my application and just a couple days later I got a job. I am grateful

title: Decent pay
review: It was Straight forward work daily. It gives you plenty of good exercise.There was Decent pay for someone with no job history. I was thankful for a temporary job in the midst of covid while my job was shut down.

title: Awful
review: To conclude one of the worst and traumatizing job experience I’ve ever had. I wouldn’t refer it to my worst enemy. Terrible management, over exploitation, degrading pay, and treat you disposable

title: A fun place to be for the most part you won't take this place serious at all
review: If you just hire machure indiviuals that want to see others advance it would be a beatiful place management is not what it should be it's a front. Give your hard workers bonuses.Management keeps for self headquarters not aware.

title: Poor Upper Management
review: I needed to be part time because of school but the upper managers never gave me less hours and constantly pushed me to be working more hours instead. They always said how me being part time is "bad for business." The team leads were much nicer and understanding but they don't final say over scheduling from what I understand.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There isn't any good parts What is the most stressful part about working at the company?All of the coaches have never had any team building or leadership trainingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very very very stressful What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful

title: Toxic environment
review: For the most part it's a great job to work for, but the management can be toxic. Some of the managers target their employees and unfairly treat them. The occurrences can be tough to get around being that you only get 5. But with that being said the coworkers are great people, the job is easy, although can be stressful, and pay is alright for the work we do

title: Love it!
review: Great place to work. Fast paced… a lot of opportunity available if you work for it. Development is top of mind for senior leadership. Pay scale is competitive too.

title: Productive environment
review: Decent place to start out and work up. You can learn a lot from a place like this and even switch positions around the store to keep you up on your toes

title: It is a great place to meet new people.
review: Working at Walmart in Marksville, La store 1128 has been the worse job I have ever had. Management is the worse part, instead of them wanting o help their employees they talk about them behind their backs and show favoritism to the ones they are friends with. Management parties and gets drunk with associates that are the friends they hire. If you don't suck up to them you are targeted and punished until you are eventually fired. The current management at this store is horrible starting from the store manager to the coaches.

title: Short staff
review: Not the best. Over worked short staff rude employees breaks down the street from their food to be rude rude staff rude rude customer staff rude rude ok

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good working condition s.  Nice atmosphere..What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough people. Work short alot..What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Good..not great.most of the people I work with are exceptionabl. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Hard work,  do to lowPersonal.time Flys because your so busy.

title: Good place bad management
review: Had very good pay but it was biweekly and management sucked and they didn’t really train you my first day I was stuck making sandwiches without anybody telling me how they were made

title: Efficiency and accuracy
review: As a spark delivery driver we are 1099 employees which means we are our own bosses and owners of our vehicles. There should be more money involved for delivery drivers due to us having to pay for everything to do with vehicles and other employees. Money is okay, tips not as much. Employees in Walmart were kind heart but some lacked urgency for bringing groceries out on time. Also they do not follow their own policies at some locations

title: Managers
review: You have to be very specific with your availability and even then your availability will be discarded. They will make associates do a job meant for 3-4 people by themselves. Expected to work efficiently yet constantly having to stop working due to the network crashing or equipment failure or lack of equipment in general (associates will get in trouble for not working even without Wi-Fi)

title: Green
review: Muy buena experiencia en los trabajo le gustaría participar muchas a haría coge más experiencia en distintos departamentos

title: Good beginning place to start out with retail systems but be prepared for the customers
review: It was a pretty good intro into the world of retail systems but it’s not for the faint of heart. These customers will try and bully you until they’ve got what they want.

title: A workplace that expected too much for too little.
review: At first this job was simple enough, just be a cashier and sometimes grab carts. But over time duties piled up and I was eventually acting as a customer service manager effectively with no extra pay. I'm not sure if that's normal at Walmart stores, but it was very annoying being expected to do more without extra compensation.

title: Unprofessional
review: Not a good company at all poor training poor management. I don’t recommend working for this company even corporate is poor. Work elsewhere and don’t waste your time with them. They treat you wrong and expect you to be overworked and underpaid

title: Should not be the first choice of employment
review: Management is not helpful or actually respectful of employees. You are also made to do a lot of work outside of your job description that is not what you were expecting or hired to do. No one gets paid enough for the amount of work they are made to do at all. The upper management say that they want everyone to succeed but that is a lie. There are no raises, promotions, or bonuses unless you are upper management or someone the upper management brings in.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people (workers and crew). The work environment is usually relaxed. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When people make a mess and leave it. When workers don’t show up for their shift (physically and/or mentally).What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Most of the time everyone works together and helps where needed. What is a typical day like for you at the company?My day is productive. I focus on quality and most efficient way to get through my day and help others to complete daily tasks.

title: Boring
review: It’s was not a good job management was poor the employees are overworked I don’t even know why Walmart is still around until this day managers don’t care

title: Overwhelming unfair work distribution
review: The job has far too many issues with management. You get interrupted for 30 mins to an hour to zone. You get 3 departments to work while others get only one with no explanations. I hate to say it but the managers make it worse. Constantly taking you off your own job to do other things and then penalize you when you cant finish the first job they assigned you in time because you got taken off your first job. The managers say you can request for different departments but this was never given to me despite saying it would be. There's more like telling us to vote strongly agree on all of our assessment surveys of the managers and sitting behind the workers to LOOK at the computers. Its literally vote manipulation. I dont know how thats allowed. I dont want to hate walmart but these things made it difficult to like it. I loved everyone else I worked with but 3 out of the 4 managers were not great. Training was done poorly. Theres so much I didnt know and wasnt told till much later about techniques of how to do things. All I can say is if you join walmart be aware of management. It can make or break your experience.

title: Long and short shifts. Breaks every 2 hours.
review: Good pay. Nice people.  Funny co workers. You can move to different departments depending if they have openings. You can walk down your line and stick the isles.

title: No room
review: No room to grow. CSMS thought they were better than everyone. Over worked underpaid. It was like a high school. So much drama within staff. You literally couldn’t better yourself in positions whatsoever. If you got hired you were stuck at that position.

title: Easy job
review: Super easy job but management makes it hard the job its self is super chill though. I’ve been here two years and I’m officially drained and searching for a new job

title: Ok
review: Was ok overall. They overwork you and threaten to fire you if your pick rate isn't 100%. The management doesn't really know what they are doing, things are usually hectic if your dispensing.

title: Chill
review: I just did not like stocking. Co workers were usually pretty cool and the management there was not bad. If you want to work and be left alone here is  gppd place.

title: challenging but fun
review: I have only been a coach for 2 months, and I am in a very difficult store. As stocking 3 coach we have unattainable goals set in place by the store manager. She is confident that certain tasks should only take mins when in actuality, they take hours. vey out off touch. The job itself is great, but the expectations set are so out of reach with the associates i have. A good team should consist of 20 or more people. On a good night I may have 12. Not reasonable.

title: Not that bad
review: Honestly I don't think it was that bad but could have been better. Wasn't really that fun and the pay wasn't anything to be too excited about. Definitely recommend if you need a job quick.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Make sure you are vocal. From my experience they have the hours but refuse to give you moreWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers and the environment. Just a noWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not good. Favorites mess up the flow of workWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Constant work loads

title: Sucked
review: Worst experience ever I hated every minute management has no clue what was going on I wouldn’t recommend this company to my worst enemy on planet earth

title: Walmart stands out, short staffed and never ending work loads
review: I liked working for Walmart however didn’t believe in some of their beliefs. I went above and beyond to fulfill and get the job done and worked hard to stay caught up. I’m great at multitasking and enjoy busy fast pacepharmacy.

title: You're never bored
review: You are expected to finish your tasks for the day. The amount of work you are assigned is sometimes overwhelming. Management expects a lot from you throughout the day.

title: Decent
review: Team leads are always nowhere to be found but it honestly is not a terrible job especially for the money. Great job for teens/young adults, as they were amazing at working around my class schedule.

title: Your 1 person doing a 2 man job. And that's everyone managers and cart pushers.
review: Your 1 person doing a 2 man job. And that's everyone managers and cart pushers. The training is quick and they don't care if you understand or not as long as you sign the waiver...

title: Great place to start
review: I learned so much about being professional and productive in a retail corporate setting. The opportunities for advancement are available to those who want it.

title: Reliable job, unsatisfactory management
review: I’ve worked with Walmart for over a year in three locations and while all the stores mostly ask the same from you work wise, the Groton location is by far the worst when it comes to management. I’ve known them to BS their employees on the sales floor, bend the rules to their liking, and push employees to termination for petty reasons. If you don’t mind subpar management and are looking for a decent job and benefits, this is the place for you.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits, discounts, insuranceWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customer impatience in the auto care centerWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly, caring , calmWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Fun, upbeat, busy

title: Decent pay for our area. No opportunity for advancement. Hours suck
review: decent pay for our areano opportunity for advancement for technicianshours are horribleattendance is flexible due to points  systemstressful but sometimes rewarding

title: Great job
review: Easy job to do. great co workers and a friendly environment. Gets busy during holidays but job still isn’t easy. Part time hours and flexibility. Do recommend to others

title: Fun place to work for
review: Fun place to work for. Some mangers or nice and pay is great, but the only thing is they won't stop hiring so it makes it harder to get your hours. Also if u get laid off for a little while don't espect to have a Job when u come back.

title: Decent
review: High school job. Decent pay, and not ideal as you get older. It’s a good stepping stone. Would recommend for the younger crowd. Not appreciated at the job.

title: Don’t work at Walmart unless you want to be shafted
review: They will work you 39 hours a week so you can’t get benefits they write people up for using their protected pto and overall there’s to much corporate favoritism

title: Toxic work environment
review: Environment very toxic, the coworkers are great very friendly, but management makes the job miserable. There’s no communication between team leads which makes the jobs even harder

title: Stressful
review: Not a great place to work. Constantly understaffed and having to pick up the slack of being understaffed. Not enough pay for the multiple areas they assign.

title: Great pay but
review: I worked there for about 6 months and the pay was great however the hours were never consistent and the culture of the store wasn't exactly the most pleasant.

title: Great culture/“
review: The building as a whole is a great place to work. The only downfall is the stability. Your workload changes so much you may only get 20 hours a week at times.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Interacting with the customers organizing the merchandise and simply having an income with benefits What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of respect, team support, unprofessionalismWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostility, anger, envy, bullying What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful but gets the job done

title: not supported staff
review: not supported staff everyone wants to do their own thing. no help towards others and management above manager does not do anything to help it al ends up being on managers who can't do much about situations

title: they fact they think they only supposed to delegate and overwork their associates while the vacation 4 times a years.
review: Horrible place, bad atmosphere, doesn't appreciate their associates,overworked and underpaid, while the vacation 4 times a year.  Very unprofessional

title: Very Productive
review: Management, Coaches and Leads have been very helpful and very nice.  Co-workers have been fun and helpful. They have where if you need money, they have a app that you can get some of your pay early.

title: Living nightmare
review: Works you to death and still want more. Was working up to 16 hour days and making roughly 13 a hour. Not worth the stress. Great if you don't have a family and don't want a life outside of work

title: Work in the back it really is a new experience
review: It’s an alright place to work for, it’s not a set schedule, but if your full time you will get your hours. I worked CAP2 witch is second shift. I got the chance to excel once I showed that I worked hard. I became forklift certified, pallet jacket, pallet stacker, and scissor lift certified around 6months in. I’m not sure if they offer raises anymore I’m pretty sure it’s very slim to nun. You can get promoted but i really takes dedication

title: Fun engaging work but poor management
review: The work is very independent and you have a lot of opportunities but often management may make frustrating changes, squabble amongst themselves and fail to communicate with you effectively.

title: Ok
review: They work around your schedule. It's an alright job, but don't expect for it to go anywhere. Not much room for growth or major pay raise. Favoritism is unfortunately a big part of being promoted.

title: Fun but the manager is strict
review: Wasn’t a bad place to work. Loved the other employees. Hard to change schedules to match when you can and can’t work. The manager is very strict but it’s so everything runs smoothly

title: great workplace
review: fun coworkers, all in all it really isn’t too bad. though there are some people who are better than others you just have to find your people in there.

title: Very fun
review: It is a nice workplace environment, they are always looking for people to hire. It is a fun job that you can make many new friends with. I recommend applying here

title: Great place to work
review: Great work home life balance. Pay could be better and sick policies improved. This company will work with your schedule as well. So overall it's a good place to work

title: Fun
review: Great place to be , Workers and managers are very friendly. I loved the pay and also the hours . Overnight gets extra so that was a bonus . 3 breaks during the shift

title: Easy but management sucks
review: I had three different managers all telling me how to do my job and they all contradicted each other.  One manager tells me to help out inside at the register every now and then, another tells me never to go inside my job is outside, and the other tells me to help him with the cars, while the other two say im not allowed to work on the cars.  Very confusing and overall bad management with unclear direction.  Job was easy though and my coworkers were alright

title: Relationships are Transactional and Work is Tedious/Monotonous
review: The managers make no effort to learn about you as a person. They see you as nothing more than labor that solely exists to be plugged in where there is labor needed on the schedule. The job has a very "clock in, keep your head down, don't be stupid, clock out and go home" feel. There is almost no buy-in from the employees. Everyone feels overworked and underpaid.

title: Great place to grow and move up
review: Walmart has offered numerous chances for promotion and growth.  Sometimes the direction is shaky, but it is ultimately up to you for your own success.

title: Horrible management
review: Working hard gets you nowhere here. Unless you’re one of the chosen ones. In the last 2yrs they denied every pto request I put in. So time to leave.

title: It's just Walmart
review: I know everyone dreads going to walmart for shopping. it feels just the same working there except you have to be there and cant go out to your car and leave if its too overwhelming. its just walmart, really nothing special. management was okay, they were as nice as they could be while still dealing with all the stresses of their own jobs. i applaud them. most of them, some of them were creeps who liked underaged girls but... neither here nor there i guess. i dont believe they still work there but they might.

title: The Most important thing cleanliness
review: There are many people who are serious about their job and some people take advantage of other people who are not serious. And wait for the next shift to finish up the rest that should've been done. Everyone has duties that are expected to be done . But it never happens. Sometimes we're wrong for bringing it up.

title: it was cool
review: it was cool and you’ll meet people. just have to deal with rude customers and managers. but it’s a good place to start out and you’ll earn decent money

title: Not enough money
review: They need to pay the employees way more because they we be doing way too much for very little pay. Having favorites is also really annoying of management.

title: Waste of time
review: The management team was very messy. Nobody took accountability for anything and always talked about one another behind their backs. It was a very unprofessional and unpleasant place to work. The work itself was simple.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Some of the coworkersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Management is rude and hateful.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful, overworked

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?None I feel like a slave and management is terrible. If I find another job better than this, I'm sticking with it.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with drama queens and I level of anxiety.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible, nothing is organized.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress and misery

title: Productive
review: It's very productive. You have to be at work on time and you must work.. the point system is 5 points and you get a 9 minute grace period for being late

title: No clear sense of purpose
review: Working for Walmart sucked mainly because of the disrespectful and aggressive customers the business attracts. If Management did a better job at protecting their employees from threats and verbal abuse from customers and even some employees it would be a far more better business to work for. I do miss working for them, but will not return. I encourage you to work here full-time so you can get the full advantage in benefits and such, or short term.

title: Good pay, bad management, and bad hours
review: I started at $12 an hour as a 16 year old kid, which was great. Soon learned why the pay was so high, there was no flexibility in the schedules. You didnt get the days off your ask for. The management was also horrible, they liked to pick favorites. They didn't care about you or your needs, that includes your physical health. But hey, at least the pay was good.

title: Great work environment
review: Good work environment with a lot to do. Days go by fast there. Bad management. Unorganized team leads. Needs more structure. Good pay and benefits. Clean place.

title: Trabajo en equipo Buenos co workers amigables
review: Todo muy bien solo complicado llegar al 100% en tal solo 1,000 trips.Es un poco complicado almenos en el área que a mi me toco, aprender más o menos un 40% de los trips son tan pequeños que adelantan el proceso de aprendizaje cuesta acustumbrase al sistema pero si existiera la oportunidad de darle al empleado un poko de tiempo para tener ese conecte de sistema almenos ami comencé a sentirme más cómodo después de 8 meses , es muy fácil cometer un error con la presión de los compañeros ke ya saven y conocen los pasillos y productos, es fácil llegar al 100% también dependiendo el día y el área no siempre es posible almenos de ke ya ayan pasado las etapas del año para conocer cuando la manera de stok el producto. Ase una diferencia dependiendo la etapa del año.

title: good, fun
review: work is enjoyable, hours are flexible, opportunities for working multiple roles. I wish my schedule was more consistent, it could change anytime. It was fun

title: A comodar cosas
review: Puedo limpiar a comodar y tratar a las personas bien

title: Okay
review: Busy pharmacy with rude customers. Vaccines and tech work as an intern. Your typical Walmart customers. Management is nice. Pay was cut after covid was the worst part

title: Not bad for a first job
review: Doesn’t pay well for the amount of work you are expected to do. Most the time coworkers slack off and don’t get coached for it ever, so if you work hard expect extra work to be out on you. They do work well with schedules

title: Good job
review: It’s the best entry-level job to work at, knowing that I’m helping many people and making the community better makes me happy! The staff is excellent at helping you to improve yourself and be a better you.

title: Terrible store
review: Bad store to work at. Managers pick favorites and talk down to others. Poor training as well. All the managers do there is sit in the office and talk to each other. They help no one.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Free Walmart + and discount (which you don't get till you have been there 6 months)What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You don't get trained properly but they expect you to do your job perfectly. Never treated like you are a human beingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?As long as you don't mind certain advances from the bosses and doing "favors" for them  you will have it madeWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Work your butt off to be told you didn't do well enough every day

title: Easy work, good pay, but unrewarding
review: This is a great in between careers job that pays pretty good for the simplicity of the work. However, the work gets very monotonous and lacks good leadership in all departments.

title: supervisors awful
review: This had to be the worst job i had worked at. i worked for Walmart in 2016, right out of high school swing shift, and our supervisors and bosses would always give conflicting orders and would treat you terribly if you didn't listen to their orders over other supervisors or department managers. Terrible bosses

title: I did oil and tire services
review: I love my job at first until I got stuck doing both oil Bay oil changes all day long while there were five guys standing in the corner fighting over who's going to put a plug in one tire or I'd get a four tire job and then they tell me to go to lunch and take my tire job and then spend 2 hours doing the tires when I complained I lost my job.

title: Bad management </3
review: Overall the job itself wasn’t terrible but the managers? They sucked. There was the manager of my department and she would ONLY favor boys which was unfair. Management in general at that Walmart wasn’t good. Nobody cared about you but cared more about what you can give them. It wasn’t the worst since I liked the job a lot but coworkers and managers ruined it for me. As long as you don’t overwork yourself then it could be a good job but I don’t suggest it.

title: Fun easy workplace
review: Easy work place. Can be stressful. The way the day goes very much depends on management. Can meet new people and is easy enough. The most positive experience was the coworkers.

title: Good if your looking for a job
review: I worked here for 3 and a half years and it has its up and down moments. The people like coworkers and customers are mostly friendly, and others like some of management are not so friendly. Management are usually always on your case if you don’t finish work on time. But if you do your job and keep to yourself you’ll do fine.

title: Not worth it
review: Awful working at Walmart unless you NEED a job or a part time. Most admin or corporate workers who are checking out the store were not friendly at all and were VERY judgmentalp. Not people persons who are more focused on results than caring for employees. Garbage management all around. Never working there again and feel bad about people who need to work here.

title: Fun workplace
review: There is Great opportunities at Walmart. I had a great experience. First you get a 10% discount. Second paid time off and vacation time. Great environment.

title: Don’t call out!
review: They tally your call outs and automatically fire you if you’re late or call out more than 4 times in the first 6 months. I saw lots of people get fired for needing to leave work early to grab their kids or who had medical emergencies. They don’t take doctors notes so you don’t get more than what your sick/vacation time will cover before being fired. I was fired while I was in the hospital and re hired with no benefits having to start from scratch.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay day and leaving. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Walking in the front door. Dealing with the customers hostility and management mistreating and degrading you. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Conflict and hostility What is a typical day like for you at the company?Agonizing

title: Wallyworld
review: Its ok. The management was pretty mediocre and work life balance was out of whack. Very little "team work" to speak of. There is a good reason why the people of Walmart website exist.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I loved always busy always something to do 4 am till 4pm very awesome supervisors very well put together. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Getting the phone / company merchandise on your phone sales for customers to seeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Open and wonderfulWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy in the morning customer service was always busy people paying their bills

title: bad management for some, lazy crew
review: if the crew got lazy then the workload will slow, noone wanted to do a certain task and it made it hard to finish. if got a solid crew that stuff done then it would be easy.

title: Very casual depending on your management
review: Working for Walmart is a great idea if you are young or if you don’t have a lot of opportunities. Usually they are very flexible with scheduling and often times if you have a good manager the shift is super easy. Some departments have a heavy work load and short staffing, but coming from someone who works in healthcare now, it’s not terrible.

title: Never enough
review: Liked what i did , disliked who i worked for. Micro managed everything! No team work between departments. My immediate managers where nice but constantly asked to do to much.Same for most workers .

title: Family
review: Great Company , nice benefits , discount . Room to grow . Pay could be better , friendly customers , okay co-workers . Clean store , helpful managers

title: everyone treats you very poorly, they pick favorites for
review: terrible, don’t work at walmart. they don’t treat you fairly, they also dont communicate with you about work if they don’t like you. i will never work at walmart again.

title: Harassment and staff shortages
review: You’re required to work at 88% staffing and the management will bombard you with unobtainable goals and expectations. They pay favorites. The pay was ok though

title: Great Opportunities to Advance
review: Everday is the same for a personal shopper at Walmart. You clock in, you gather your tools, and you either pick orders or dispense them. Orders are always maxed out.I've learned to do a good enough job and not to overexert myself. Coworkers are great. Managers love to micromanage and customers are vary depending on the location.

title: Not the best
review: It was mediocre at best definitely would not Reca if you prefer career advancement. Pay is decent but hours are not guaranteed even when you are full time

title: Fun workplace
review: They need to give there workers Better pay. ….You get your 40 hrs a week shift……very fun place to work…… and of course you can shop where you work …..

title: Should be used as a temporary job unless you know someone to be something there.
review: My time here was spent with a lot of impossible expectations to which management responded by blaming everyone under them instead of their planning and lack of leadership. While not all places are the same at Walmart a healthy majority of them are like this. Both from my personal experience and the testimony of those I've worked with in the stores I was at and had visited to assist. It is not a recommended career choice. Only a temporary fix for a job.

title: Productive
review: Great work place I loved Walmart they point system is a little crazy so don't point out and you'll be tiatally fine working for Walmart other than that's it's ok

title: Poor management
review: The management team is unprofessional and dysfunctional and shows favoritism....... The company itself seems to be a good place to work for being that they have 401k and PTO.

title: it’s fine
review: it was a good job for the most part and i love the breaks but management was a pain in the ahh for everyone at every level. i would recommend it though

title: Amazing People to Work with, Terrible Management
review: Made really good friends with co workers so it made life way better. Anytime u would go to management about something they would give little to no answer

title: ok work place
review: it was an ok workplace to work at, but definitely not somewhere I planned to be long term but a good starting point, break time was ok not too bad and coworkers were nice

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Coworkers that keep you goingWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Supervisors and HRWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic work environment What is a typical day like for you at the company?Come in and supervisor has a huge work load because the team before you chose not to do their part.

title: Choose else where
review: Horrible work environment, managers are worthless unless it pertains to them be warned find another place to work target or anywhere else Walmart suck

title: Great plays
review: They help you out a lot even when you’re on the road now you don’t see your family as much but the money is good and you get time off when needed so if I was you I would say go for it

title: Productive work typical day off work
review: I’m hearing impaired but great lip reader and customers love how I get jobs done. I love to stay busy and working independently and keeping sales floor neat and organized

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Education opportunities/online college degree What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Upper management and poor treatment of associates disregard of work life balance.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast pace and customer driven What is a typical day like for you at the company?Dealing with disgruntled customers and sometimes disgruntled leadership.

title: Fun work place but management sucks
review: A lot of good coworker I met but the manager suck they don’t care about you at all they just care about the money and not your well being or mental status

title: Brutal honesty
review: Management pushes you constantly to work quickly, and all tasks given to you must be done in the day. Helping customers find items is constant, however mgmt doesn't consider all that time in and the job still needs to be completed. Learning how to multi task will be self taught early on and asking for help is sometimes replied with a condescending look of why can't you do it then occasionally another associate will help out, hopefully a friend you have made.  If you NEED a job its alright. You earn time off daily from working so if you need to leave or arrive an hour late/early it does not count against you. You can meet some really neat people as customers that ask you questions.

title: It's Walmart, what more is there to say
review: Day was average just running groceries to peoples cars, nothing more really. Management was average but cared if you had a situation that needed to be taken care of.

title: Good co-workers but not great pay
review: It can be a fun environment depending on the manager you get. I personally had great co-workers to make my time enjoyable. Management didn't care much if we joked around as long we got our work done.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?My overnight schedule and the hourly rate was great.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Downstacking product to make room for new overstock product.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?A fast pace work ethic.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Every hour on clock busy stocking.

title: Bad
review: It’s a job all about favoritism from management that will depend on how you get treated, regardless of how you perform. Often have feels like those with better performance are given more to do to cover for others.

title: Bad job
review: Hard to change shifts without a fight, Bad management, Lazy management, unrealistic expectations, no communication the pay was nice however that was just about it…the coworkers were decent as well.

title: Overall a good job
review: You have to deal with a lot of managers taking advantage of the good workers giving them extra work and not holding the bad workers accountable. If you want to move up it is very possible but it’s a lot of bs with coworkers

title: Its a easy job but awful
review: It's walmart they don't care about you never will but they'll pay you fairly decent. Management sucks they have favorites and will stockpile work on you if your decent on job

title: Ok work place
review: This was an okay place to work at. They always had their picks of who they wanted to promote and who they wanted to get rid of. They treated the cashier's like some garbage except for a few managers.

title: A very good work environment and there’s always something to do
review: If you apply yourself, you can go very far with the company. If you just want a paycheck then you can just do your job and you’ll surely obtain a check but, applying yourself and learning more will definitely get noticed and make you an asset to the company.

title: You become family with coworkers
review: There good and bad with this company. I loved the people I work with and buildStrong relationship with my team. They was very understanding when I need surgeries made sure I had the right fmla info and I always had well all but one time job security while I was out for fmla. The last surgery I had in sept was covered by fmla then in Nov I needed 2 days off due to having to see my dr out of town for a follow up and at first no mangers could explain to me why it was denied and it was the week of thanksgiving but I didn’t have a choice instead of working with me they deleted all my hrs in November except 4 hrs that I work day after thanksgiving. On Dec I had another manager reach out because while I was out they took my job and toldMe I can work 3rd of leave and a manger called and ask me to be cashier and at that time I didn’t have a choice but really enjoyed the relationship I bonded with customers it was more Intimacy conversation.

title: Easy job with decent pay.
review: Only thing bad about the job is the management. Sometimes you are treated poorly for unfair reasons, but if you just stay out of the drama and do 110% everyday, you should be fine.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Hours, (3)12hr or (4)10hr shiftsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of stable leadership, constantly changesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?No collaboration or teamwork, ZERO!What is a typical day like for you at the company?Dread and lots of clockwatching

title: Chill
review: Was chill when I worked there. Never had any problems with this company. Management was annoying but managers always tend to be. Not saying it’s fun but it’s not horrible.

title: Easy work for the Pay, Lack of Communication
review: I spent over 6 years collectively working for the company. My home store was managed decently. Yet, the constant change of management over shifts and departments led to miscommunication and confusion, putting people in these positions who hardly knew what they were doing or how to handle issues that arose. Overnights was by far the easiest shift because the management didn't micro-manage, but the workload could be overbearing if there were tasks not completed by the day shifts (which was a constant ordeal). All in all, it's easy work for what you get paid with great benefits. Just always expect to have management who don't know what's going on when it comes down to the inner workings, even if they've worked for the company for awhile. (If lifers of the company don't want to take management positions, what does that tell you. Hourly is the way to go.)

title: Fun place to work.
review: They need to train their employees before they hit the floor. Fast pace environment learn something new everyday. The lack of training I would say was the hardest thing to deal with. That and having multiple people giving you tasks to do.

title: Fun and easy money
review: The overall job is quite easy and straightforward. Ofc you have your good days and bad. The job can be fun or it can be bs depending on you and how well your management is. My store was straight chaos and had very poor management. Known as central Orlando's worst walmart Everything was good until I chose to stop being the yes man. It's alot of unprofessional business and childish behavior

title: Fast paced
review: Pay is fair.  The work is hard and hours are fluctuating day to day.  Would recommend for a younger person out of school looking for a pretty decent paying job

title: Love me some Walmart
review: Walmart is a great job to work for they pay good and take your feelings into consideration they work around the hours and they also check on you to make sure your comfortable with the job your doing GOOD JOB WALMART KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK

title: co workers were the best part of the job
review: Co workers were friendly and helpful. Job was monotonous but easy. Management could be better but they weren't horrible. This depends on location varies.

title: God awful
review: I worked at Walmart for only 2 years and thought "Man, I really enjoyed my shift" To only transition into "I regret working today". How it made me feel that way in only a span of 2 years says enough. Save yourself time and the Dignity and Don't work at that place.

title: Decent job for a teen
review: As a cashier your the only department in my store payed 15$ instead of 17 an hour "because the other departments are for the hard workers" Managers played heavy favorites and the amount of things you are expected to do is a lot. the co workers are super nice only got along with them very well

title: Alright place to work hour lunch break , two 15 min break. Pay sucks . Manager unfair
review: Alright place to work hour lunch break , two 15 min break. Pay sucks . Managers unfair . They choose your hours it seems like. Kind of fun / social atmosphere

title: Relaxing
review: You will get rude customers here and there but other than that it’s a calm realizing job. Needs more regular checkout thought and not self check out.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?That you can easily get away with anything. They won’t notice that you’re gone. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They expect you to do everything including managers and AT work. They make you work every department. The favoritism is crazy people who don’t work but get praised. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Easy but frustrating when you worked with people who let you do all the work. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Get there to your shift and people automatically hand off the work to new shift    expect you to do all the work while they relax and do nothing.

title: Great until a certain manager took over
review: I loved working here when I first started. The work environment was amazing, everyone did their job and if things got tough management would be more than happy to step in and help. That is until we got a new manager and things switched up. Constant micro managing at the littlest things. I’m not sure how things are now but that is a big reason I left. Pay is decent and so is the days you have to work very flexible.

title: Absolute chaos.
review: Management is awful, scheduling is inconsistent and insane, they give you your schedule 3 weeks in advance but your shift can completely change 8 hours before you’re supposed to be there. Many hateful people there, but that’s to be expected in most places. Some days it was really fun though.

title: Team Lead was horrible, everything else was fine
review: The manager or team lead was the worst person to work with. No one liked him. Other than that, pay was decent and it's full of supportive staff. And I made good friends.

title: 3rd shift expectant mama
review: i would stock cigarettes and check out customers and would sit down in a chair when no one was around while i was stocking the cigarettes and got in trouble and was told i needed a doctors note.

title: Your experience at Walmart will vary quite a lot depending on your manager and location.
review: My first location at Walmart was much more strict. They heavily enforced the dress code policy and made sure employers took lunch/breaks at their exact times and no longer. They expected you to be working very hard but in my opinion, harder than your pay was worth. At my second location, it was more relaxed, but it came with other issues. They didn't enforce all of the dress code rules only the ones that seem reasonable. They allowed you to wear earbuds while working in the back unlike my first store, which makes sense because we don't deal with other people/customers in the back. They had realistic expectations for work at first when we had enough people, but when people started to quit they expected us to complete the same amount of work with fewer people. Management was a bit disorganized; people in different departments would try and tell you what to do while your supervisor would try and tell you something else.

title: DO NOT APPLY department 207!
review: They don't care. Management abuse employees take you out during lunches and breaks. They say employees are replaceable. They cut your hours! Blame you!

title: Great place to work with the right management
review: Loved my job most of the time I was there. I was able to move up into a management position, however the last couple years I worked there, the environment was not good. Management had an anything goes attitude with no accountability. Very stressful.

title: Overworked
review: Its an easy job but the better you are the more others will rely on you to pick up more tasks. Managers and team leads have their favorites. They complain about being “understaffed” but really no one wants to work. The department is crammed into a small area so we had no space to do much.

title: Good
review: I liked it, it was awesome. Good coworkers good manager. Morning shift crew was best. I recommend. Hiring process was good. Very simple and flexible hours.

title: Decent workplace but low pay
review: It was a good high school job, all of my coworkers were very friendly and I enjoyed working with them. The pay was low but ok for a high school kid. Loved working with customers and would have stayed if I could have made more.

title: Nothing
review: Terrible place to work. You are treated like rats on a treadmill. Night shift supervisors were horrible people, treated you like dirt and nothing was good enough.

title: Good work place. TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE
review: Here at walmart dc 6070 Management loves to sweep safety concerns and really and concerns hourly workers have and bring before a manager under the rug. One thing the upper management never fails to fall back on is cutting out hours and making it pretty hard for workers to get by outside of work, just 3 months ago in September I got about 20 hours a week for a 6 week period with no overtime available now they are cutting shifts down to 8 hours againThere was 2 employees that had severe health concerns in the workplace last year the first passed away on the way to the hospital and the second man passed away on the floor while no  defibrillator was closely available very unfortunate that this places history of brushing off safety lead to the death of a employee

title: Good for college students
review: It’s an okay job to start out with, I would recommend to anyone who is currently going to school. I was able to work the shifts I wanted and got the hours I wanted.

title: Be Cautious and Smile
review: Everything was fine for my 1st year working there, but the second year, it got worse. There are too many people telling you what to do, even though most of them are in your position. Managers have their favorites that get special perks. If you need this job, just smile and do everything you're told no matter if it's your job or not and stay to yourself.

title: Negative work environment
review: If you are a work horse you will be worked to the bone. They will take non productive workers to the office but never fire them, you'll be expected to clean up after coworkers and do managements job while they (as a general whole) remain ineffective, generally lazy and unmotivated.The pay is decent and regular, health care is offered through the company for full timers and there are some opportunities for advancement. Some managers actually try to do their job well.

title: Just sucks
review: Walmart was a great company when they cared about employees and their families. As a single parent they don’t work with you when you have to miss work for taking care of your young elementary aged child.

title: A lot of hard work
review: What can I say about Walmart besides it being a hard job to work at but easy to be hired. If you can count change without a calculator, I'm pretty sure they'd hire you from how quick people come in and leave after finding out how bad some management can be.

title: Terrible environment.
review: I worked at Walmart for a year. It’s about as bad as one can expect from a company like Walmart. Management is awful and unprofessional. They over work you with no chance of overtime.

title: Productive and fun workspace
review: Quality leads provided amazing training and support. Advancement potential. A wonderful place to learn the solar industry. Support always available..

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?literally nothingWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?everythingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?toxic , stressful , makes you want to bang your head on the wallWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?stressful

title: Good company
review: Good company great advancement pay is fair couldn't be happier. The company has changed in the years I have worked for them.A ll company's have to change to stay competitive

title: Good pay but was cut hours
review: Good company with great benefits and pay but had to find a different job in July 2022 because we were cut hours. Was hard to pay bills because you never knew how long you were going to be there. May be different now.

title: Great hourly pay but no hours
review: They pay great per hour but I work on the weekend shift ( 3 days ). You only get about 7 or 8 hours day. They let you come in during the week and help out but they can ask you to leave at anytime.

title: Pretty okay
review: Not a bad work place. Do your role, complete your hours, go home. You will very rarely gave to do some extra tasks and if you need to, you can disappear for a bit to take a breather.

title: Don’t go there
review: Unless you have to don’t do it. Very stressful and disorganized. Everyone wants to be a boss but they seemed to not know how to while their …so unless you really have to I am sorry

title: Tiring and hardworking
review: It was terrible.they expected you to do impossible work with little time. Heavy stuff was put on the top shelves. It was so interesting and weird work place.

title: An average job
review: Overall a pretty laid back job, HR and management are willing to work with employees. One main issue is that coworkers tend to overstep and will try to pry into things that don't concern them. Overall though, a pretty average job experience, good job to learn customer service skills

title: Great Pay, but Terrible Management
review: management does not care how they talk to you & they don’t consider that you have a life outside of the job. they operate off of a point system & i got a point for having to leave work to go to the hospital because i could not breathe.

title: I believe that a lot of the younger people looked for things to complain about.
review: Most of the employees would look for things to complain about. As people complained I would let them know that in my work career I had found that if I look for positive work tasks and the positive recognitions from management/co-workers that they would discover that they want to work and start to enjoying there job.

title: Nice place to work
review: Great place to be. It’s really nice being in home. I loved talking to people on the phones. Making sure they have what they need to complete the job.

title: Steady and stable employment
review: Not a bad place to work. Just ask for the right schedule. Show up and work. Repetitive tasks but staying busy helps the day go by faster. I have no complaints

title: Productive and fun place
review: I had a great manager she was very understanding to a single Mom. The shifts went by quickly, I worked here until I moved back home with my family. It was a good opportunity.

title: Fast paced
review: Top when it comes to body exercises. As a personal shopper, you shop online orders and then part of your job is to dispense those order to the customers

title: Good pay and schedule
review: This is a great place to work but it does have some favoritism issues. The job isn’t easy and you do have to work for the pay. The schedule that you work is terrific, especially if you have children!

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Awful terrible bullying team leads.  Just awfulWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The manner in which I was treated and bulliedWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic. Supervisors do not know how to do their job or interact with subordinatesWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Like being in unpleasantness. The job itself was fine. I couldn’t take the toxic atmosphere

title: Great college job
review: It was good job during the summer while home from college.  I worked in both grocery and the lawn and garden center.  Lots of different coworkers from different walks of life so that was interesting.

title: Decent Job
review: Wasn't bad, felxible enough for a college student. Worked evenings during covid protocols and wasn't well trained or supervised but I was only there for a few weeks so it didn't really matter

title: Great place work
review: Really good pay! You can wear normal clothes. You get hour lunches and 2 breaks. Great people to be around. The environment is great also. The do hold back 1 check you get paid bi weekly

title: Great structure for patients
review: The structure of the company and the culture of the patients is excellent. It became hard to accommodate the time to see patients due to being short-staffed.

title: Poor higher management, but decent holidays
review: Managers do not see the day to day issues we struggle with, they come in and see any type of issues dealing with orders and get frustrated at the employees for not having it figured out, when it is there job responsibility to. I personally don't mind helping out, but its when they don't schedule people properly, get mad for things they should be doing, and especially them not contributing to helping with some of the actual work that needs to be done that they are complaining about. But we also have a lot of kind and compassionate people who work there, a lot of people who consider this place a home, the people that have worked there 5 + years, and some of them bring treats in for everyone for holidays and dress up to make working the holidays worth it.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Their pto and pptoWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing they do not care if you are sick with covid and poor ethics skills. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?With team leads and managers are disrespectful to employees and customers. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Poor behavior and they treat there employees like trash. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Being cussed at or talk down to by team leads and mangers

title: Entry Job
review: It was a good job for a high school graduate but I would never encourage anyone to work for this company. They are ruthlessly brutal to their employees about any kind of rest period, the culture is depressing, and there is NO work/life balance. Bare minimum wage with little benefits.

title: Good
review: Great work environment, good staff. Great people to work with. Very understanding managers. Very great place to come to work to every day. Loved my time here

title: There are better jobs out there.
review: I worked at a Neighborhood Market for over five years. I saw a many associates and managers come and go. Most of my last year there is when things when really downhill. We got a new store manager who was incompetent and a liar. Other managers varied from great to the lazy and useless. Things spiraled out of control which led to high turnover and staff shortages which then led to hiring too many inexperienced and/or lazy workers and inventory severely backed up.

title: Good place to work
review: Good place to work. You get decent hours and can sometimes pick up more through the app. You can not get overtime though so you have to watch out for that.

title: Cashier
review: Great workplace! Managers are great. Working with the customers is always fun. There is room to grow and be successful. My dream job in lovely Flatwoods, wv.

title: Cut hosea
review: Don't work for them they don't care about customers and they sure don't care about employees,  its like a drama filled work environment.  I've seen management know things are not priced right and will leave it for customers to pay more.

title: Loved my coworkers. Hated management.
review: Management will be but your butt about the smallest things. I loved my coworkers though, and it's why I stayed for so long. Made some lifelong friends there.

title: Ok for the short term.
review: Easy hire. Almost no training. Contradictory advice and instructions from different mangers. Overwork followed by boredom. Awful hours. Slightly below pay.

title: Management/CEO
review: Horrible place. Management not involve enough. NEVER ENOUGH EMPLOYEES. Employees NOT APPRECIATED. Issues are overlooked and perpetrators are slap on the hand and sent back onto the floor over and over and over again. The New SELF CHECKOUT is so ANNOYING We need more checkouts rubbed by employees.

title: The worst
review: I worked here for 4 years and honestly it was the worst years of my life. The only reason I stayed as long as I did was because nowhere else was hiring. Everything would have been fine if management actually fif their jobs and didn't pick favorites.

title: Great deals
review: Great place to work, great people, good pay $17 an hour. Only thing I would change are the uniforms. They are kinda ugly. I look terrible in my uniform

title: Stupid policies
review: I worked there for 8months and got fired for having 7 points. You're only allowed to have 5 points you get points for calling in. God forbid your kids get sick

title: Very mid
review: The job itself is okay, the management is absolutely awful, the work is pretty simple, the coworkers make the job tolerable but that’s pretty much it.

title: Fast paced - no time for boredom
review: For the most part I highly enjoyed working at Walmart. Most of the people in management work very hard to ensure you are happy in your job placement. If you are unhappy working in the area you are assigned they will try to move you elsewhere.

title: Boring place
review: The pay was good but the work would get old after awhile because you’re just watching people shop. On breaks you would get food but they were super strict on ate

title: Worst job ever
review: If you hate your life then go for it. Customers are ok but the managers sucks.. Never had any training regarding my role. Gave me a vest and badge and asked to work like a experienced on day one. Only few have an idea what is going on

title: Everything
review: Pay is horrible. Management is extremely toxic. They gaslight you and guilt trip you. I am an apparel team-lead and I get threatened my job everyday Becuase of stuff I don’t do. I stress out a lot Becuase of it they expect perfection for nothing good in return. Do not work here at all.

title: Horrible management
review: They don’t care about their employees they only care about customers right not employees right so that’s the reason why people don’t like Walmart and cart attendants and cashiers are underpaid if it wasn’t for us cart attendants and cashiers Walmart would be useless as a store

title: Great pay. Poor benefits
review: Inconsistent workload. Mandatory overtime for half the year and get sent home early every day the other half. Great pay. Poor benefits. Some areas are better then others.

title: Management sucks
review: They have their favorites, and if you’re not one of the favorites, you can’t get any time off from work without using your PPTO.If you  need time off, they will say no. Also they will work you the hardest why they all stand around and talk. The harder you work to tried to impress them the more they ask from you.

title: Hectic but kept you busy
review: After 4 pm it's non stop customers which is good but a lot of times stressful with only a couple cashier's cause a lot of people called off (mainly the minors)

title: awesome
review: I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed our food and service. We're always looking for ways to improve the experience at our restaurant, but it's great to know that we are on the right track. Let me know if there is anything else we can do to make your next visit even better.

title: Can be trying at times.
review: To start this off I loved working there and I really enjoyed the people I worked with including my team lead and my coach. The thing about Walmart is that it can be difficult due to picking up other department’s work. I never really minded it but others did. I was hired on for online grocery pickup, but I ran register, pushed carts, stocked, unloaded trucks, and whatever was needed done. I liked the variety of work but you will do more than what you were hired for. Also you need to stay busy, if you’ve completed your tasks find more to do. Always stay busy. I liked the whole staying constantly busy, but if you want more of a slow pace or working in bursts this may not be the job for you.

title: Flexible day
review: Work here to start out In law enforcement. Management approved advancement and gets you use to watching people. Overall good first step in male enforcement

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?working with associates that cares about their job and the customer What is the most stressful part about working at the company?customer behavior being rude What is the work environment and culture like at the company?There were rules as should be. and even one were to obey them if not you were let go.What is a typical day like for you at the company?welcoming customers. watching for customers to ring up all there ideas. watch for safety issues

title: Decent job and pay
review: Decent job if you have no life outside work.Very straight forward no training and no customers in the store except for the last hour and the first so good for people with anxeity.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You are simply just a company win number,  it doesn't matter how hard you work, they want more and will replace you if you don't. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Work load as a manager with No employees to get it doneWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Watch the news, Walmart employees apparently are upset and going postal What is a typical day like for you at the company?I don't work there anymore,  moved on

title: N/a
review: I wouldn’t say it’s bad but the management needs to be better. I also don’t enjoy jobs that play favorites and they were one of them. They never had enough equipment for us to work with.

title: Productive and fun place to work okk
review: It was a good time to work here  never any complaints. Pay is good. Great environment. Manager was nice to work with. Good team players all around. Would recommend.

title: Bad management
review: The decorating used to be fun but management is terrible and will wear you so thin until you break. There is no work/life balance and they expect you to have completely open availability.

title: Poor management
review: In a year they went theiugh 7 different team leads and "coaches" keeps a team in disparate and not able to manage properly. Most managers refused to deal with upper manager who didn't help manage his evening team for any means necessary.

title: Good pay, Terrible management and co workers
review: If you want to work at the American Fork, Utah location read this before applying. The absolute worst job experience I’ve ever had. The team leads are hired from outside the store, they never give any lower associates a chance to be a team lead unless they have friends and/or family in management already. The store is full of nepotism, high school gossip from full grown adults, almost zero regard for associates physical and mental well being, and you’re treated like a cog in this disgusting capital machine.

title: management is trash, point system is even worse
review: when i started at walmart we got 9 points, then the point system was changed and we only got 5. 10 minutes late is a half a point, requesting and getting a holiday approved off, dont worry, you still get a point and a half, that only fall off as they occur, so if theres a family or medical emergency, you could get fired for leaving if you have no remaining points.

title: Cart door for the entry is only chest night
review: I hit my head on the door for bringing in the carts so bad that I got a concussion.  The also only provided the min PPE, ie a reflective vest.  Would not recommend this job.

title: I just want to look at other reviews
review: walmart is not as bad as everyone makes it seem. there are a few things that need to change but other then that its pretty chill. just do your job and work as hard as you can the only thing is that they don't offer any overtime which is a bit of a drag. but if you work 6 hours in the middle of your shift you must have a 1 hour lunch break. oh and bring a portable charger just in case

title: Steady and enjoyable place to work at.
review: Working at Walmart is overall my favorite job that I’ve had. It’s easygoing if you finish your work in a timely and efficient manner. There is a set way to do things so you won’t get confused but if you do the other associates wouldn’t mind helping. Walmart had a positive working atmosphere, fairly flexible hours, great coworkers, and was high-paced enough to keep you busy and make the day go by quickly.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?People was so niece and it was close by my house. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?There really wasn't none unless someone didn't show up.

title: Not a healthy work environment
review: worked there for 7 years. Wish I could take those years back after how they treated me and others who worked hard. The hardest part of the position was coping of the fact some of my managers had not 1 percent of moral respect to their employees and customers especially the store manager herself before I left. Last few years my assessments there got more ridiculous where they were I wouldn't get a pay raise or a transfer because I didn't say hello to enough customers. This is not a healthy place to work at .

title: Great co workers
review: Great people to work with. But management expects more than you can do in a day. Won't work with you on hours. Getting scheduled 4 hours a day. Sometimes only 12 hours a week.

title: 3 stars
