review: What is the best part of working at the company?the help you get from co-workers is the best partWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?when the team lead understaffs the department and we're flooded with customers, all of whom are going home disappointed in their experience at WMWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?you get to make new friends in your team quickly and there's a good team spirit if you're in the right department. some work slowly, others are quicker, but it is fairly low pay for the expectations to do different jobs that you're not trained for, or when no work/customers are in your area.What is a typical day like for you at the company?in the am I'll stock shelves when there are no cars in the auto center, or unload items from containers outside and bring them into the store. then when things get busy, I'm going from one job to the next which is good, but some of the tools don't work or we have supply issues with service items that run out. You have to take your 15-min breaks otherwise you'll lose them. No pay increase for overtime worked as a part-time worker.

title: Retail
review: Having worked for nearly a year, I would like to say that there’s no set schedule. I guess you can apply for one after 6 months. The weekly schedule is unpredictable as it constantly changes. There’s a weird point system for when you call out, so when you reach 5 points you are subject to termination. Also, for each point accumulated it takes 6 months to fall of your time sheet. Some of the customers are rude and near violent. Overall, it is not a bad job, just have some tough skin and don’t call out.

title: Wonderful people who your working with coworkers and management are helpful.
review: I personally loved working in the photo department everyone I worked with was so helpful and understanding. Training was hands on but so completely different and actually fun.
position: Customer Service Associate/ photo lab technician

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Frozen and dariy What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Frozen and dariy What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Cool and cold What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good very good

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part of working at Walmart is the discount card you receive after 90 days from your start dateWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Managers wanting you to do extra work that's not your ownWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?the work environment is very RUSHEDWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day for me at the company is stressful

title: Good
review: Great experience but be prepared for people to come down your next when things don’t work. Also, management changes rules constantly to the point of no return

title: Employees were overall helpful and welcoming, Pay does not meet demand of physical work.
review: Management has a hard time keeping coworkers in building, 3 maintenance members would be on shift, work would be left to one or two do to coworkers spending hours sitting in cars. Coworkers were mostly great, great environment, depending on your role.

title: Well, half and half.
review: Co-workers were fantastic, supervisors were mostly all amazing people, but the management was so terrible there. I had the head boss SCREAM in my face and ask if I even wanted my job because I called in sick with Corona. (Positive test)

title: fun
review: nice place to work at, followed instructions and got my work done. payed bi weekly and given a decent starting pay. would recommend to anyone who wants a nice first job in retail.

title: Terrible Workplace I Recommend to Never Work Here
review: It was terrible when I worked here, I liked the 1 hour lunches and two 15 minute breaks but I hated the drama. Also the managers were very strict and I asked to only work weekends to have time I needed for homework and college classes and they proceeded to shorten my hours. Until basically I was working 14 hours a week. Managers were unprofessional and I got written up for another employee slacking off. As our department was behind because one of our associates was talking to customers instead of stocking aisles. Managers had scandals including improper conducts. DONT WORK HERE.

title: Fun place to work but miscommunication is big
review: While working at Walmart, I’ve gained a lot of friends and experience. Some days are easier than other and some days are terrible. Sometimes the management can miscommunicate which is a big issue especially when you’re questioned different things.

title: Overrated and over worked.
review: Management doesnt care/listen to their employees. They set numbers at a level that most cant/wont reach, then will fire you for not meeting those goals.

title: only fun with the right coworkers
review: not good management, understaffed, everyone is wayy overworked and underpaid for it, OGP lot was not good and barely plowed so we have to go out there and shovel it just to take out orders

title: Rude management
review: I worked there and you seldom got your breaks. You usually got a late lunch, because  they were si shorthanded.  Some customers so rude. I wouldn't  recommend anyone work for them. Your just a number to them.

title: Good luck
review: Just realize by getting yourself hired here you have effectively become a number on a screen to do what all the people in the office dont want to have to try to figure out, Your store received 20 TV's today and your wall is full already? Too bad find a spot for them cause they dont want em in the back. You're sick? you better hope not for more than a few days, dont let your points stack up

title: Overworking
review: I guess it all depends on which location you work , but i know at most dallas locations they over work you & don’t respect you , especially if you’re pregnant

title: the best
review: I loved working as a pharmacy technician here. Even when you go through ups and downs they teach you everything and you feel apart of a team. A truly amazing experience.

title: Repetitive work
review: As expected when working retail, gets the job done. Managers don’t seem inspired but loved my co workers. Interesting and hard working people. Unfortunately got my earphones stolen in the break room.

title: Work
review: Good place to work, highly recommend but keep your head down. Just keep to yourself, do your job, do your job well and you'll be well taken care of. Good luck

title: Boring but easy
review: Be prepared to take at least 5000 steps a day. Hope that you pick since that is what is the easiest. This location is always jam-packed and hard to maneuver around.

title: I really appreciate my manager
review: If you are looking for success in a business, you will find the opportunity around you in Walmart . You will work with good teams and great managers all the time appreciate it your hard work.

title: Thank you for all you do Walmart
review: It gave my more people skills then I did anticipated it too it gave me perspective on alot aspects of life I was not aware of I really in joy my time at Walmart on an off the clock

title: Don’t work here.
review: I worked there for a year and I couldn’t take the mental and emotional strain anymore. Management is absolutely terrible. They don’t care about you or your well being. They make it clear that you’re replaceable. They only care about bringing money into the store. Favoritism. Having to work in other departments, because they were always short staffed. Don’t even bother to ask for a Saturday or holiday off because they won’t give it to you. Being surrounded by negative energy from coworkers and management because nobody wants to be there. Just a horrible experience all around..

title: It’s ok
review: Walmart was ok to work at! I had some issues with management but overall would consider working for them again under new coaches. Very good pay, good benefits, fast pace environment.

title: I felt bad for all my co-workers
review: I started as a part-time employee working 4 hour shifts, 5 days a week. After a year, we were told all part time employees have to work until 10pm, and that 4 hour shifts don't happen anymore. That put me at working an average of 32-35 hours every week as a part-time employee. When I expressed wanting to work less hours due to the toll it was taking on my body, as well as my grades, a few co-workers expressed confusion/distaste, saying quote "Why would you want to work fewer hours?". The only good thing about my specific position was that I was making $11hr, and after a small raise was working somewhere around $13hr. If I could I would go into a lot more detail about my absolute distaste for this place.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The benefits were good and the pay was goodWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?How they work thier good workers harder then the lazy workersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is strenuous and the allotted time you're given to perform a task is ridiculous What is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day for me was to do my job and before I'm finished with my assignment the tell me to help another associate

title: Fun to extent
review: Higher management in the department was disrespectful and work was sometimes unrealistic goal stand point. We would be low staff towards the night and get hella pack with so many cars with basically no help

title: Great First Job
review: Walmart is a great first job. You get to learn a lot of skills that will be useful in your career. Especially customer service and effective communication

title: Good Place to work, Management can be hard to deal with at times.
review: I personally liked working for walmart and thought when I transfered to Sams club it would be the same it wasn't. Working here as a cashier was both fun and as long as you did your job you were fine.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing at all, you are just exposing yourself to drama and impossible tasksWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The wishy-washy, favoritism and retaliation What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Entirely corporate money driven greedWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Stress, trying to do all of the jobs while kissing b so you'll have a job to come back to tomorrow and then there is no guarantee

title: Good pay, intense management
review: Good pay. Always on edge managers are looking you up and down waiting for you to mess up. Fun environment if the people are fun. You are expected to know everything about the store in and out.

title: Good benefits
review: Working at Walmart gives you good benefits, but after working there for a while management starts treating you different. And Not in a good way. They find you replaceable.

title: Bueno
review: Aprendes a trabajar bajo presión, algunos gerentes tienen preferencias con el personal, otros son excelentes líderes.

title: Terrible management down to the team lead
review: The store is for lack of better words the most incompetent person I’ve ever worked under. We would have walk throughs with corporate and they would tell the stockers to pretty much hide overstock somewhere until they left. We get unfair breaks and hardly any lunch which is definitely mandatory.

title: Busy Workplace
review: I was a cashier at the Burleson Walmart in the 80's, when minimum wage was $3.75. I got a raise to $4.25, right before minimum wage rose to $4.25. It was alright. I worked as a cashier and helped in the snack bar.

title: Management
review: Management is horrible, will lie, yell and do anything but be responsible for their duties. Will actively take a minimum 6 smoke breaks aside from their regular 15 mins and lunches and ignore you when it's time to give you your break. I was also working full time but only given part time benefits.

title: Coworkers are fun, everything else is horrid
review: Good workers are overworked, bad workers are promoted. Constantly working in other departments that make more money & doing managements job for them. No schedule security, especially for parents. Walmart is good for people with no family and no need for a decent schedule

title: Good for a first job
review: For a college kid this would be ideal but their hours are always being cut and they do not care about familiesEnjoyed the work itself, management had their own drama though.

title: A good job when you want work/life balance
review: A day at Walmart sometimes has its expectations completed but each day is different. There are days when employees will call-in, thus creates the problem of lacking employees. I would have to cover other departments because in some time periods, there would be none working that department. The management was 50/50. I learned the experience of customer service to a better degree.

title: Not really a fun place to work. always understaffed.
review: From my 3 years of working there, they recognize your hard work BUT will refuse to promote you to management due to not wanting to loose a good associate so they would rather promote someone less qualified due to the job requirements in management being less.

title: Horrible
review: Only place I ever worked where Team Lead would not answer questions on how to do things. He never got me a working walkie talkie, the only way to reach somebody to cover my dinner, in 11 months. I got in trouble for taking dinner, another guy got in trouble for not taking dinner... Just HORRIBLE...

title: Keeps you busy
review: Well what can i say, It is a good decent job, i really liked worked there and my job was over night stocking and i actually liked the job position. I had to quit because of personal reasons. I would definately go back to work there if they would hire me back. I put my application in there so hopefully i can get my job back.

title: They don't care about there employees.
review: Even if your great at your job they will fire you. Make sure you always have someone with you when talking to a manager so that you have a witness.  So it's not your word against there's.

title: paycheck
review: the job wasn’t fun or anything, but it was a decent 40 hours guaranteed job with a set schedule and that paycheck would come in every 2 weeks. that’s all i can say about this job, wasn’t hard, wasn’t easy

title: Tidewater drive
review: Every Walmart is different. If you work at one then move to another you may be in for some big changes. Some management do not follow the given guidelines and rules the company goes by and as a result certain Walmarts may be poorly run with a lot of added stress and problems that could lead to mistakes like being on a reheated for 10 hours with only a 30 minute break. Mostly in a poorly run store the people become very negative and toxic towards one another which makes everyday difficult. But the good news that’s not every Walmart. You just have to find a good one and apply at it.

title: Needs a 0 star option
review: If you’re thinking about working here, just do yourself a huge favor and DON’T. You’ll save yourself a lot of hassle.   Training sucks, communication is lacking all across the board for them, not exactly honest people to work for

title: Can be a good place to work, when working with other associates or by yourself
review: This place has a long ways to go about teaching and keeping employees. They do not train very well and seems management is exempt from following the rules that regular associates have to follow. There are managers here that care and treat people very well, but they are few and far between.

title: Fun workplace
review: Great Atmosphere had no problems at all. I would recommend this job to anyone, you won’t regret working here at all. Thanks to Walmart for giving me such an amazing opportunity to work for them.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You get a 10% discount and PPTO AND PTO .What is the most stressful part about working at the company?There is always that one pain in  butt  of a boss.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Where I  worked was good just work What is a typical day like for you at the company?Good job in shipping and receiving

title: Easy job
review: Wasn’t a bad job, just boring because you do the same stuff over and over again. filling the milk isn’t fun either. the people made the place better.

title: overall good
review: i loved the people and workplace it’s self, but management is very poor.  job is straight forward, on a register most of the night, zoning the isles, and restocking items that got returned.  pay was fair.  $13/hr, but management will be on your rear end even if you miss one day

title: You're usually on your own, working in -15 degree freezers
review: I stocked the bakery and sometimes deli area. You have so much stuff to stock and it's so hard to finish everything by the time I clock out. The freezer was by far the worst part. Walmart felt very lonely and disconnected. I felt like a cog in a machine and not really a valuable member of the team.

title: Fun
review: Very busy! Learned the way to fold and also to help customers find items. Helped the store front with checking receipts. Assisted in bringing in carts are well

title: That place will make you feel like dirt
review: The management ran there mouth to associate about other associate would talk about there attend to other employees and open door policy is a lie never would want to see someone work there. The management would let certain people get by with doing nothing and other had to cover for the employees and management.

title: Don’t mind manual labor? Come here
review: If you’re lazy, don’t work here. Work life balance is great because you work long shifts but get consecutive days off. Pay is great but you will work for those dollars. It’s a decent job honestly and with decent benefits.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Best part working at the company was being able to be part of a big company unfortunately staff was very low & schedules would be unorganized, many staff were on break/lunch at the same time therefore there would be no staff out on the floors.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Company is very unorganized, unprofessional, managers need to learn to get along rather than start an argument every shift What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was very unpredictable, staff make you work everyone’s shifts even the stockers What is a typical day like for you at the company?Very chaotic, managers & staff employees were very unprofessional

title: Entry level at best
review: I only recommend if your still in school.Co workers can vary drastically by location and that will largely make or break if you enjoy working there.Aside from that the jobs about as easy as they come.

title: Work any other retail job.
review: I started out loving my job. I didn’t mind the hours (10p-7a) and I loved having the consecutive days off. The job was super easy and they had a one box per minute standard, which was decently easy especially if you worked in the department you were put in regularly. The sick time is dumb. They think that 5 days is all that people need if they’re sick. Their covid policy was dumb. They care about money and not employees.

title: Good job if you have no family
review: Terrible hours, no work/life balance. Never really have the same schedule, and if you request Sundays off long term, they cut your hours to next to nothing.

title: Management is the worst
review: I worked for Walmart for 5 years the first 2yrs was ok but after that it kept getting progressively worse. my team lead and immediate coworkers were the only thing that kept me going but the managers were the worst kind of people they only care about money and expect way to much from there associate's I was constantly belittled and always got the you did good but... treatment I was in constant fear of getting a coaching for the most basic stuff mangers would go out of there was to try and find things wrong overall a very bad experience would not recommend

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I was enjoyed work in my areaWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The ability to meet new peopleWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working outside of your assigned post and not getting paid for itWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great work environment with easy going peopleWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Clocking-in grab the cart and maintain the floor safety for the public

title: Great Job for newcomers
review: I worked as cart pusher and it was for the most part very easy however the lack of staff in my position always made it hard to succeed. Also managers expect way to much out of you for   $17.00 hourly. i would only recommend this job if your in school., and not full time as it gets busy in weekends and holidays.

title: It was and it okay place to work.
review: Management sucks. They don’t really care about you and they make that very clear. You take the blame for everything the higher ups do. Only good thing is the pay.

title: Terrible Management
review: Corrupt management with no regard for employee’s and customer.Throwing their inferior in position for blames and none to 0 recognition for hard working employees. All they care bout is their bonuses.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There isn't! They treat their workers like trash. They abuse their senior citizens, and mentally and physically challenged workers. The racism is very present to anyone that works there.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile and very narcissistic.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful.

title: Great company
review: Loved working here, the management was great, very helpful and attentive. Training was very thorough. Metrics were not hard to meet and if you did not meet they helped you meet them

title: fun workplace
review: Fun to do, days would go by quick. Flexible schedules, management was understanding . Unloading trucks by hand was the only tiring part about the job but other than that fun place to work at.

title: The vision center is a good department to work in
review: Overall the vision center at Walmart (owned by Walmart not nvi) is a good place to work. There's not a lot of pressure but as long as you help the patients as best you can, you'll succeed. Pay for opticians is among the best I've seen in the industry in NJ.

title: Good
review: Pay good and hours but management sucks they expect unrealistic goals for the department and they don’t care how busy the department is and don’t won’t send no help

title: Management doesn't care about you or respect you and neither does HR
review: This is THE worst company I've worked for. The management walks around and bullies all associates. If you do absolutely nothing all day you get away with it, and if you're a hard worker you get punished for it by being forced to either do the others work as well as yours or get written up and when you go to ethics about it they never even get back to you. You also don't get promoted unless you do less than the care minimum and if you're a hard worker you get stuck in your position. I could go on and on about how awful this company is but instead just know they do not care about you and no matter how poorly they treat you the store manager's excuse will be "this is a company."

title: Taxing on the Body.
review: Very high pay. Order filling is pretty strenuous starting out. If you are not in shape then it will get you there. Just take care of your feet, knees, and back.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?People I work with on frontendWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management not caring about their workersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Mixed emotions environment is badWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers and being friendly

title: The bottom of the barrel job
review: Don’t work really they are an awful company. Like they don’t care about you what so ever. The only thing they care about is money. They are all ran poor

title: Good job, could be better.
review: It's a job that has lots of opportunities for growth, however, some of the team leads in certain departments can make shifts absolutely draining. The pay is okay in some departments,  while the pay in others is just unfair for the amount of work that's done.

title: Productive workplace
review: Walmart is fun to work at. You never have to worry about being isolated to do a complicated 5 person task alone. Whenever it's time for lunch register automatically lock you out

title: It’s alright
review: It’s pretty easy but I feel like they don’t train you enough. They expect you to know everything right off the bat and if you don’t you’re kind of on your own.

title: Ok, money was great
review: Ok, money was great. At times you have to really work hard but it was the on call for me thatkept me discouraged. I hear that its starting to get better

title: Don’t do it
review: If you have a job where they offer sick time and vaca, don’t give it up to work here. Medical benefits are okay, but everything else is a losing situation.

title: Good money but hard to decide if it's worth the headache that comes with working there
review: Working at walmart pays the bills but that's about it. All the wrong people are put into management as well it's hard to move up if you are not a brown noser... also it does no good to show them how hard you can work because you are then expected to work like a dog everyday and it's still not good enough while people that don't even try get babied.

title: Horrid
review: Horrid don’t do it. Management doesn’t care about you only themselves and their bonuses. They take 3 hour lunches and you can’t ever find them when they are actually needed.

title: khk
review: working here was pretty easy, as you would only have to do oil changes and tire work. Where i worked it was usually slow so it was mostly just standing. not a bad place to work.

title: bad management, fun coworkers
review: pay sucks, the customers suck, and most of your managers and team leads suck. only good thing about this place is the opportunity to meet new friends

title: Fun ,very busy.I love working there
review: Very busy not enough night workers from 8 to 11. No self check out. The hardest part is returns getting them sorted and back on the shelf. Keeping up with your you learns.

title: okay work
review: Its good easy super fun work never had such a fun time working at wallys world great people especially the customers who are so very nice to you at all times

title: Highschool drama
review: The work was alright. Hours fluctuated alot but i was working through school and was flexible. Working in a large enviorment with so many people resulted in a lot of rumors and gossip that was unnecessary stressful

title: No training
review: I went from being loss prevention to being move to TLE when the position was eliminated. I was not trained at all and management was never available when needed

title: Great coworkers, horrible schedule
review: Late hours and working every weekend including Sundays. Health insurance has a very high deductible and high premiums. Took away incentive bonus but still tell us to sell as much as possible. Pay is not keeping up with inflation. Prices have raised significantly but pay has not since especially they took away bonuses.

title: People are fun
review: Lot of stress on the job definitely need more. Training. Been there for many many many years the place isn’t the same as it use to be at all don’t go !

title: procductive
review: nice coworkers, and mean managers plus the customers that come in sometimes are nice but alot of them yell at you all the time. one time i had someone spill milk on me

title: Good work environment
review: Walmart as a whole treated me well overall with reasonable accommodation, even in all the locations I've worked in when I was training as an API. I was treated with respect by other associates and management.

title: Busywork
review: A decent job with decent pay but its exhausting work with little respect but they hire on the spot and are very flexible for students. The training you do doesn’t properly prepare you for the job and you end up doing things that weren’t disclosed before you took the job.

title: Always somebody trying to knock u down and scared you are getting favorable treatment
review: If they think you're happy their going to complain that you are being treated with favoritism I just want to be a happy part time employee working 4 days a week getting 29-32 hrs a week but no some full time employee thinks I should have to work 5 days a week therfore my schedule is 40 hrs and Walmart doesn't even schedule full time for 40 hrs but I as a part time get scheduled for 40 because I'm happy I don't get it

title: You're a number, not a person
review: The strict attendance policy is pretty ridiculous for real life. You are a number in the system and if you cannot conform to their computerized standards of a productive employee, you are terminated. Management and chain of command are unreliable and confusing.

title: It's a good place to start but don't try to make a career out of it
review: If your just starting it's a good place to start but don't expect to get a higher position with out becoming friends with some one in a higher position. Sadly at this tipe of places that's the only way to go higher in position by becoming friends seniority or years of experience dont count towards your overall work.

title: Management
review: Management doesn't care about you, they feel like they're semi god.. Not flexible with time. Work is easy but the pay is low. Just an okay work..... .

title: Fun and productive workplace
review: Always had something that needed to be done so I was always busy which I love to stay busy at work. I enjoy challenging tasks as well. All employees including other managers were fun and outgoing to be around and work with..we always had fun but still got all of our work done. It was just an overall great work experience I had with them.

title: Micromanagement
review: Good pay and crazy hours. Must be able to handle micromanagement. They threaten with cameras, but search you and ask what your doing all hours of the shift.

title: Depends on manager. Lot of politics in some teams
review: Depends on manager. Lot of politics in some teams. More to learn in the DevOps side than development side. Distribution of work is not great. Bad leave policy

title: Repetitive
review: About 10miles walking while stocking. Consistent schedule.Hour lunch with 15 min breaks every 2 hours.Attendance policy is outdated and management does not inform you properly of policies.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Your Days offWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The stress starts when you first clock in What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Diverse, people of all colors, ages, shapes and sizes What is a typical day like for you at the company?Terrible, after clocking in starts stress and anxiety and it continues until it’s time to clock out

title: Walmart Online Pickup
review: The work isn't hard, just repetitive. The problem is upper management that doesn't work with our department making too high demands without givinging us the tools to succeed, i.e. a lack of proper staffing and a refusal to allow overtime.

title: Equal opportunity employer
review: I never felt I was discriminated against for being different and my supervisors helped me whenever I seemed to be struggling with communication skills or finding where I was supposed to be. Overall, Walmart is a great company to work for and where you can strive to work towards your goals and get a good career. They will even help those who wish to further their education and get a college degree.

title: Pay is good
review: Good pay. If you can deal with extreme abuse to your body then it's a great permanent job. As long as you show up and show improvement you're good for the first 90 days

title: Productive
review: Good work in environment. Excellent people to work for.  Productive and fun. Good hours and an easy work. Nice place to work if you have a family!.!.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The crew I work withWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Nothing at allWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great i love it What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy everyday

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The open door policy and the willingness to help employees succeed What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with the few managers that are vindictive and petty. Because they are knowledgeable some of there actions are overlooked at times or they just know the system so well they manage to get away with stuff. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's like a family I'd say. But like every family you have the bad seeds that pop-up or those who have their 'favorites'. Those are the ones noticed and promoted moreso because of who they know.What is a typical day like for you at the company?That depends on the section of the company you're working in. Overall, the average day is full but not stressful.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people I worked with were amazing and friendly.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The long lines during rush hour were really stressful for me because I was a cashier.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's very friendly and fun for families to come in and want to continue coming back for there essentials and other needs.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Long hours as I was one of the openers. I stocked candy on the registers during the morning and was on register in the afternoon.

title: left after a week
review: Working here was not what I thought. The discount sucks and you only get that once you worked there a certain amount of time. For them to be hiring ppl I kind of felt invisible. I had to keep asking ppl what to do, where to go. They had me doing random useless stuff, like they didn’t know where to put me. Their stocking and scanning process was weird and extra. Had me in freezer for 2 hrs. Too many rumors of supervisors doing weird stuff going around.

title: okay work
review: Working at Walmart can be a challenging but rewarding experience. The retail giant offers a wide range of jobs, from entry-level positions to management roles, and provides employees with opportunities for advancement. The company culture is fast-paced and customer-focused, with an emphasis on teamwork and a positive attitude. The pay and benefits are generally competitive, and scheduling is often flexible. However, the workload can be heavy, and dealing with difficult.

title: Mindnumbing but easy
review: Every day you come up with new ways to keep yourself from losing your sanity. Customers suck but the work isn't hard, breaks and lunches are enforced, and the pay isn't half bad.

title: It’s ok
review: Lots of favoritism from management , as long as your a yes man , work ethic means nothing to them. Show up is all that is required , do the bare minimum and you’ll be fine

title: Typical retail bad management
review: Typical retail work , ack of respect for associates and team leads. It pays good for the position in exchange for being their gopher and punching bag.

title: Fun workplace
review: Ok place. Would recommended to anyone looking for a stable workplace. You also get paid every week. Perfect for outgoing and quiet people as well. Many hours too.

title: Great benefits terrible management
review: I really loved my job they had great benefits up until management did nothing to stop bullying/harassment and constant discrimination from multiple co workers and a member of management. They do not care if you bring all of your issues up. Ethics gives you the runaround to follow their procedure before filing with them nothing about it ever gets done. Everyone becomes friends with everyone which makes them not want to do any write ups on anyone. Lots of favoritism if your friends with upper management

title: It is very easy to request time off and call out
review: I mainly don’t like how management treats their associates. I’ve also been denied going on my break on my schedule time. Other than that, requesting off is super easy and if you ever have a question, the app they use is super easy to use but, sometimes it doesn't work.

title: A rewarding job but had some of the worst experiences
review: It was a great job that I got to do. I loved working with the associates under me and trying to improve the business. The issues that ruined the experience were long days of anywhere between 12-16 hour days (when scheduled for 8 hrs.), a boss who only focused on her favorite team lead, and finally clear procedures being broken when it benefits “the team”

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?None that I can think of, unfortunately. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Constant supervision with out offering solutions to speed up pace to stock on shelves other than suggesting using a chronometer to check on speed. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Favoritism for white associates and unfortunately Latinos got the bad end of it as to receive more demand to finish quicker rather than non Latinos associates. What is a typical day like for you at the company?stocking new merch on shelves.

title: Sucks
review: Terrible management at least at the location I worked at and definitely no job security you could lose your job at any second if a hire up dislikes you

title: Easy work
review: Overall Not too bad. Quick and easy hiring process. Great place if you want guaranteed hours. You may be stressed out due to Irresponsible team members.

title: It’s okay, but you’re going to work
review: It’s an okay place to work, managers just micromanage way too much!!! The shift days and hours are great! Just don’t expect too much. Walmart isn’t what you think.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I worked with great supervisors in my department and  a great and caring team of employees. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I did some strenuous physical labor What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Everyone in our department got along great and worked together well.

title: Hourly wage
review: In my area this is probably the only reason people apply. Otherwise training at our Walmart front line cashiers is horrible. Like feeding them to the wolves on the first day and expecting them to interact and know what they’re doing on the tills.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing would not recommend What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic and exhausting What is a typical day like for you at the company?Exhausting

title: Good enough
review: Needed supplemental income and stayed long enough to become Dept manager.  Enjoyed the team, management cared and I could leave work at work.  Would have liked higher pay, but don't we all?

title: Awesome
review: Easy to move up if you want to and work for it. Good pay and good management. Customers can be hard to deal with but that's part of retail. Good benefits!

title: Its okay
review: It's always busy and they will always need you. It's hard to work here if you go to college management has a lot of favoritism and Walmart customers are the worst to deal with.

title: Bad management
review: Was always promised that I would get off on time and that was never the case, management was awful and supervisors were unfriendly and immature. Always understaffed

title: Bad supervisor
review: Wouldn’t recommend anyone to go, the store does not accept doctors notes, force you to change department or terminate if you are under injury. Unfriendly to employees.

title: Horrible
review: Management is always a problem. Playing favorites and hostile coworkers. The only good thing about Walmart is the decent pay. I would try and avoid it.

title: Decent pay
review: If you are between jobs it’s a decent company, if you are looking to promote up and you are a really hard worker and should get promoted you will not, unless you are best friends with someone higher up. Pay  and hours are decent.

title: Repetitive,mind numbing,ambition draining
review: Slightly beginning getting to learn new things. then the mind numbing repetition of work everyday made you dread the thought of having work, and dread every day.

title: Room for Advancement
review: The great thing about Walmart in my experience is the ability you have to advance from any level. As a salaried manager, you will work long hours, and busier times of the year are tough, but I enjoy who I work with and the benefits of the job. I have grown a lot in my time with the company, and for that I will always be grateful.

title: Huge company, very deep organigram, agile environment
review: Walmart has been a surprise on how well the associates are treated. It has been a really good experience with a renewed leadership and a clear business objective.

title: Poor schedule
review: Scheduling makes it hard for you to have a good work/life balance, a simple change with the schedule would still provide coverage and make happy employees Favoritism is often shown

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They offer all insurance, 401k, and they do have different shifts. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They have too many people that tell you what to do and how to do the job, and there isn't enough people to do the job rightWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful and high demand. Culture is wonderful. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Start to do one project then get pulled in 5 to 6 other different directions to do other different things and never really get the 1st one done or get it half way done

title: There are some really good people but bad management
review: The people I worked with were fantastic, really great for the most part. The work was very reasonable the kind of stuff you expect from retail. But they happened to premote the most incompetent and underhanded manager ever, he was allowed to cover up multiple cases of harrassment for almost a year. The store I was working at recently had a major management overhall only two left standing.

title: Good work place
review: I Loved my managers when working at Walmart. They always helped when needed and respectfully talked to us about ways to improve our work. The people really made the job.

title: Great co workers salaried managers not
review: When I got hired I loved to work I loved my working environment who I worked under my leaders were great competent friendly but still a leader management changed everything went downhill nobody cared anymore and manage it management had their favorites and that's who succeeded

title: easy
review: working at walmart ogp is easy. quick to learn and pay is good. you get 40 hours a week if you’re full time. only downside is the job is mentally draining.

title: All depends on your store management
review: Positions were continually being eliminated, mine included. I ended up being moved to electronics in order to stay employed full time. Sometimes I was forced to work on the front/main registers & in other departments. I hated being out of my element because I strive to provide excellent customer service but couldn't when I was untrained & unfamiliar with a certain department.

title: Easy job medical benefits after 60days
review: Management is horrible -pay is not good unless you work overnight -attendance is based on a point system that is unfair -no holidays pay -only managers get bonuses

title: Good starting
review: It was a good place to work. There was some miscommunication between supervisors and employees. Supervisors were also insensitive to pregnancy symptoms

title: its walmart. does not pay enough and the hours keep you from finding other work.
review: its walmart. does not pay enough and the hours keep you from finding other work. everyone was just worried about not getting in trouble.  its walmart.

title: Good money for the work
review: Just go to work you’ll get paid managers I guess it depends on where you work but they suck good thing everything is pretty easy they also sometimes pretty flexible with hours

title: Lies
review: Catfishers! They lie about everything and is a toxic environment. I will never come back here again because of the poor management and lack of help. This is the worst’s place I’ve worked!

title: Tired but and kinda happy
review: It is a stressful job and the managers take it so seriously. They compared us to a cap 2 team they had 2 years ago that the truck unload led by four and all merchandise stocked on the shelves by 8pm. Even though it is a job, the managers took it way too seriously. When you hurt your back and your discs, is Walmart going to pay for it? No!

title: Was ok at first
review: Depends a.lot on the management as to whether you'll like it here or not. Bad managers who don't care about employee can tank morale faster than anything.

title: Very disrespectful management
review: Managers are uptight about time off that they won't approve nothing unless you beg for that time off some coaches are really nice just store management needs to learn how to talk to folks

title: Managers
review: Upper management needs more training, plenty of room for improvement when it comes to fixing lines. Most lines at a walmart will have to be thrown manually due to the electrical lines shutting down 24/7

title: Alright
review: Clock in go to work meeting then go to workYou get 2 breaks one 15 one 20. The keep you over and sometime require you to come in earlier. Learn to drive multiple equipment Good payManagement is not the best

title: Fast paced environment
review: My stay there was very brief, but the job is repetitive and doesn't take long to get the hang of, it's only a matter of getting through the day and making sure you're fit enough for the physical demands. That said, stocking and unloading trucks is particularly a point of tension for those who are new and having trouble keeping up with those who have been doing the job for a while. There's not really a sense of culture or community. I found merchandising to be better than stocking overall.

title: Good pay bad schedules
review: 18 an hour was great. Shop manager is cool. Store management sucks and the scheduling is constantly changing. Be prepared to get talked to about the most pointless things while big issues are ignored.

title: Decent
review: Easy work but management is a little too busy, you can get lost in the mixup if your not careful. Good people and employees around but its hard to find stability

title: Productive, safe environment
review: I liked how comfortable the environment was, coworkers were friendly and good people to work around. I worked at the neighborhood market things were Mello the pay was good

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There is no best part of working for this company!! They are so nasty to work for very rude bosses to much favoritism going on they need to be shut down!!!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Have to be fast paced when you are a personal Shopper and getting the orders right.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Horrible to much favoritism going on at store not clean What is a typical day like for you at the company?You work 9 hours a day only get paid for 8 cause you get a 1 hour lunch break they not like any overtime and they like to cut hours on everybody.

title: Fun place to work
review: It was a good place to work with decent pay for entry level and what you were doing easy to learn with plenty of overtime it's a good place to start off at

title: Coworker
review: I was a previous employee at Walmart they need to respect their employees, recognize their hard work. If transfer to other locations be able to keep there seniority not loose it having to start over. Also their policy "attendance" needs to be reviewed.!!!.  If you have  a family that doesn't work and that main event/black out time Nov to Jan. That's a joke!!!  If you got a gai in which we all do, one should not be penalize for that due to weather,or other things. They need corporate to correct some things. Really look into what is really going on in to their stores.#4286.

title: Honestly the lack of teamwork stands out the most to me...
review: No where near competitive pay, benefits are decent though. It's a good place to sharpen your retail skills, and they have a lot of opportunity to move up.

title: stressful
review: staff didn’t help much. you had to figure it out on you’re own for the most part. i loved the coworkers i had but it was a stressful unorganized environment to work in.

title: Productive, fun, diverse
review: While working at Walmart I noticed several things, they don't care to spread work evenly. Yes we are getting assigned tasks but if there were to be a huge group of younger workers just hanging out, that was fine as long as somebody did their work.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?If you report discrimination you will get back lashWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Leadership not listening What is the work environment and culture like at the company?If you dont do what Maneger say if it over work you get yelled atWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and over work

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Driving power equipment What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Poor management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very depressing and high expectations with no help. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Always moving. Your being watched

title: Productive workplace
review: Loved my job! I was surrounded by great coworkers. Although the schedule didn’t sometimes match my availability that was set in the system, that was the only problem I had with the job.

title: decent job
review: pays the bill but not much room to grow, hope they would invest more to the employee. better get a another job if you want to do something meaningful with your life

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Customer  meetings People. They don't care about the employees 😒 They take  you for granted. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management  the way the mangers talk to the employees. They have  no respect for them. What is a typical day like for you at the company?A lot of stress they want you try to try to catchCustomer  stealing  but you are a Cashiers notyour job.

title: Fast paced job, good management, easy to get more hours
review: Everyone says they had a bad time at Walmart, but I genuinely loved my experience, my coworkers, even management. The only downside would be certain customers, but you can have bad customers anywhere. The only reason I left is because I moved areas and I wanted to try something new, but I'll definitely be going back to Walmart!

title: Not a nice place to work.
review: There is nothing much to learn. Not a nice place to work. So much of politics. Not a good team playing place. Management will decide many things themselves. No upward feedback heard.
position: Technology Leader with More Than Senior Manager

title: Fun but low pay
review: Fun because of the coworkers, they buy the employees food during holidays, low pay and rude customers though. Other than that, it is really easy and good for quick money

title: meh
review: the job wasn't the best. Had to work long hours with little to no recognition; and was often asked to assist in other departments that were hire paid while receiving the normal pay.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Co worker’s and first shift What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some of the psychological work What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The future plans of the company What is a typical day like for you at the company?Hard work but working with others

title: Terrible management
review: Terrible management. Never cared for their employees. Would always get a lunch two hours or even an hour before my shift ended. I would not recommend it.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?none there was tons of favoritisim taking place and cover ups for people who did not contribute to the shared work load. while people who would do the extra workwould get fired just for coming in late a couple timesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?they assign anyone they see as an actual worker more work instead of having those who do nothing pick up somethingWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?stressful would not recomend to anyone unless it is really needed.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?this place is terrible to workWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?managers do not care about you at all, hours not stable at allWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?the environment is soul draining, it will chew you up and spit you outWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?you go in, start work, and most of the time you get no help and then get blamed when you cant do a 3 man job by yourself

title: Unrealistic
review: You get in trouble if you don't get through your pallets. Other workers come in after you and not do their share of stocking. You don't get enough hours to make a living.

title: decent pay
review: pay was pretty good, fun coworkers, could get stressful at times but that happens with any job. Coworkers are typically really fun to be around and it can make long shifts alot easier to get through

title: Fun but tough management
review: We were never staffed they did not give us breaks and they treated us very badly. Management pick and chose who did the easy stuff and made the people they don’t like to do the hard work.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Horrible place to work What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not caring

title: First job
review: Worked at Walmart as first job. Good experience. Pay at minimum wage as expected for teenager in high school. Hours were event during the week. Left for other job.

title: Productive, but it's not easy
review: It wasn't bad as a first job, but man it got really repetitive quick, they don't pay the guys that work in this Florida sun enough for all that must be done

title: Great
review: Fun place to learn and grow as a recent college grad new to the company and new to a management role. Every place has its opportunities but Walmart has opened a lot of doors of opportunity for me.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Friendly people to work with and good working conditions What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Usually to many bosses pulling you in different directions What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Low stress work. Culture is friendly What is a typical day like for you at the company?Head down and do the job

title: The people care
review: Not an easy job. Try my best. Will always be a low paying job. It is hard to advance. I do my best. Do not expect much more than what I currently am making.

title: Easy work, just gets tiring and boring
review: The reason I gave 3 stars is mainly because of management. I loved my coworkers and the job was easy, but I couldn’t stand management. I worked there for over a year and over time the management just got worse and they can be kind of rude!

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Moving up in the company is easyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management, store managers, employees, always under staffed and no one never wants to do their job. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible, not clean stores, prices too high What is a typical day like for you at the company?Being stressed from doing all the work.

title: It was fine
review: I liked it. Working her egave me lots of knowledge and opportunity. I didn't love the hours or the management. Customer service is a drag, but overall it was a good experience.

title: Management if very rude to associates and favortism is high
review: Managemet is very bad there. They show a lot of favortism to those workers that actually do nothing, are always late, and always call off. When you start part of orientation they tell you about your PTO but never approve it. Therefore you have to use your protected PTO to take the time off or get a point that is the reason a lot of people point out. Management does not show any support to employees at all even the leads. Very bad place to work.

title: Worst place to work
review: Uncaring. Selects certain people to target make fun of and tries to get them to quit. Customers are.great. Worst coaches and team leads.  I liked a few of the people.

title: Soul-killing
review: Walmart's points system for attendance is a nightmare, and many an employee has ended their time there pointing-out due to something like illness. Generally they short-staff most areas and any given employee is doing work that should have two people doing

title: Fast paced
review: Management is always changing, and they act like they care. You let them know and they have us take surveys too, but nothing changes. There is a test involved before you start working, somehow a lot of employees pass, and they don't know how to read English. when it comes to customer service, we fail BIG time.

title: Okay
review: It's okay, with the right ppl work gets done, customers are cool, leads are okay, coaches don't much , when the rush hits you feel it , go niners bcb taking over

title: I enjoyed working at walmart
review: I worked for 10 years at Walmart.  I liked the different jobs that I had there. I would still be working there if I had been consistently punctual. Because of my lateness, they stopped scheduling me. That was a hard way for me to learn to  be sure to always get to work early in my next job!!!

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?People;flexible schedule What is the most stressful part about working at the company?None; just do your job!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Fast pacedWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy; but given more opportunities to progress

title: Mid
review: It's exactly what you think it's like. Not a horrible in between job but don't plan on staying long, It will suck the life out of you. Incompetent management sometimes.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?They give you regular breaks to keep you at your best.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management that come in from outside the store.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Some culture. Positive work environment What is a typical day like for you at the company?Walmart keeps you busy. There’s always something to do to stay busy. A lot of supervisors during daytime ahifts

title: Busy fast paced work place, with three day weekends
review: If you need a temporary/quick job this is for you. Nothing long term though, you will be overworked, under appreciated, and most likely not taken seriously if you have any problems or questions. Way too many mangers that don’t know what they’re doing, you may even be harassed for simple mistakes. Very high school/ clique- ish work environment! Beware.

title: Long hours somewhat tiring
review: Not enough help for the amount of work they give you. Sometimes they’ll give you 8+ hours of work by yourself. It’s not enough time to do the work and if you don’t finish you’ll get coached

title: Managements needs work
review: Terrible management poor execution of training and lack of leadership. I would rather work in a prison that go back to Walmart. The Sick time and paid time off is great though

title: Day to Day
review: Management don’t know what they are doing, or communicate with each other. You get different managers asking you to do different things. If you have pto, you get paid to have off, otherwise you get an occurrence when calling in. Must ask for days off 3 weeks in advance, but if you don’t have pto you don’t get paid. Additionally, you are not given equipment to do your job efficiently, you are expected to use your personal phone to assist customers.

title: Worst mistake I've made re: taking a job
review: After my interview with the pharmacy manager I was excited to start, but on day 1 the staff made it clear I was not welcome.  I have experience as a pharmacy tech, but not for walmart so all the systems are different and no one ever took the time to teach me anything and questions are frequently met with impatience. We have to walk the length of the store to fetch coats from lockers taking up break time because walmart does not trust it's technicians to keep them in the pharmacy.

title: Good place to work, just maybe not this position
review: Honestly, the work was pretty easy, consisting mostly of folding clothes and pretending to zone since there was nothing to do most of the time. Easy work for great pay but I felt quite bored at times and wished I worked in a higher paying position.

title: Understaffed and overworked
review: Good stepping stone sort of job while you hunt for something better. There's a 50 cent bonus for working overnight, not sure if that's worth the blow you're gonna take to your health for it

title: For those who just want to fill a day
review: There are some good people as associates and team leads, but upper management is filled with people who do not have a unified sense of direction.  They tend to be reactive to upcoming senior management arrivals instead of proactive about the environment.  They do not have enough bodies to get the job done correctly, so everything ends up being half done or not at all.

title: Stressful
review: You cant have anything to drink in the pharmacy,  you work every weekend, work till 9:00pm, no seniority so your hours will never get better and you are treated like a number. Walmart doesn't care about you.

title: Busy but easy money
review: It’s a super easy job with super easy money.Expect to be busy 24/7.the days will go by fast as long as you work hard.Also management is chill as long as you work hard

title: Overworked almost always
review: no work/life balance working overnight shift. And they barely want to work with your schedule. Management is all over the place and TLs constantly contradict each other. Way too much is expected of overnight team. The pay is decent but you are overworked and will pretty much be exhausted after every shift.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?co-workers were nice and fun to be aroundWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management was all for themselves, no teamworkWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?very stressful and not worth the low payWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?long and stressful. no cohesiveness

title: Good Management ; Good Pay
review: The pay and management was good. We also received plenty of breaks throughout the day. And they weren’t too strict on times of which they were taken. Most annoying part is when co workers call out and your stuck working a job by yourself

title: Okay.
review: Too much stress. You could be doing your job and helping customers at the same time and still get told that you are not doing anything. You could stay over to get your job done and then they get mad that you got overtime. If you dont get your job done you will still get yelled at about it. No matter how good of a worker you are for that company they dont care about you and never will. They only care about themselves or company money.

title: Meh
review: Walmart is a good starting place as a first job but after a year or two you should advance in a different company. Since it's retail, you will deal with feeling lesser than by not only customers but by your management as well. Management is really bad with communicating with their associates and with their equals, you should take their trust at face value, no more, no less. It's a job that should be seen as a job and nothing more, go to work, do what your assigned to do, than go home.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers and the emplo were the best part of the job What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being short of staff could be stressfulWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment and culture was great thereWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day was keeping the meats on the wall for the customers

title: Horrible
review: Will destroy your body, and they don’t care they’re more worried about numbers. If you really need the money they’ll take you in they have an extremely high turnover rate because they fire anyone who can’t keep up

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?meeting peopleWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?when you have to be nice to some  jerks..What is the work environment and culture like at the company?all depends on who you are working with..What is a typical day like for you at the company?ok long as it was busy..

title: Stressful
review: My experience with the Walmart I worked at was stressful. The job was pretty straight forward but it was the management that I worked for that created a horrible atmosphere. They didn’t want to follow one best way. In the end, they all got fired for stealing money (thousands of dollars). Walmart itself is a good company to work for if the system is being utilized properly. Things have changed since I have worked there and it seems to be a much better place to work nowadays compared to how it used to be. I was working during the transition of starting to use the One Best Way system that they now have. They system really puts things in order.

title: I loved what time I was at Walmart the two weeks but something more serious I had to take care of I home ...
review: I work two weeks but the time I was there I enjoyed cashing customers out and smile , greet customers in a positive attitude. Sometimes life throws a curb ball at us and it takes president over employment but I'm back on track finally and I love the opportunity to work for Wal-Mart again..,.

title: Nothing good to say
review: Horrible management. Ridiculous expectations. They would literally work a person to death. Absolutely would not recommend, even to my worst enemy. Pay is not worth the stress

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?By far the worst company to ever work for you are way over worked and way underappreciated no respect care or concern for there employees give everything you got to them and get nothing in return so very sad What is the most stressful part about working at the company?You are spread to thin expect you to run 3 or more departments at a time with little to no help the leadership is a joke What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful everyone is is exhausted everyday mentally and physically straining with a hostile environment

title: Easy money lot of hours
review: 15$ an hour to pretty much walk around and make it look like ur busy u can be stocking for the whole shift and take as much time as you want no one is over you most time left alone to work

title: I hated it
review: I felt like i didn't belong there . The managers were weird. Not enough hours . Never received any proper training. Just overall not worth it. Most enjoyable was it was some what independent work.

title: Easy and comprehensible
review: Applied to be a cashier but got to try out multiple different positions at my local Walmart, I didn’t stay too long but definitely worth a shot to try out different aspects of retail work

title: Fun work easy
review: Good place to work . The manager was always nice . The pay was decent . It had great work hours . Was fun always had something different to do. The job was very dependable always had hours as long as your worked hard and didn’t miss shifts .

title: Minimum wage and alright hours great benefits
review: You start at minimum wage livable hours and 32-40+ hrs a week management is alright depends who you work under not every works and you pick up other people’s slack

title: good pay, stressful job
review: in terms of pay walmart is a great place to work- tons of opportunity to move up in the company. however, the job itself could become quite draining because a lot is expected of employees. overall, i’d still recommend it though.

title: Pay and work
review: Overwork for the pay and responsibilities but position is manager and starts at 16/hr so decent pay. Never stop looking to move up either with or without Walmart. They will have your job posted before your obituary

title: It is okay
review: I worked here during the summer and it was okay. It wasn't amazing nor terrible. It pays well and coworkers will be willing to help you with anything you don't understand. However, they will give you full-time hours even though you are part-time so I would honestly just apply for full-time.

title: The expectation exceeds the ability to complete the volume of workload
review: Mngmt is handed down to little hours of scheduled help for workload, and favoritism runs rampant generally. Assoc are overworked and grumpy from imbalance of workload. The best part is if you are a workhorse you are rewarded with more work.

title: Very understanding place to work!
review: Very easy to communicate with staff. You enjoy helping regular customers that come in on the regular. You learn a lot and very easy to be printed if you focus and strive for the company! Very great experience!

title: Physically exhausting job
review: It’s too much for the that pay,especially for overnight shifts.It’s ok for a few months only AND if you have ok management..They usually pushing too much.

title: Stocking only is easy but there is more
review: There are more thing that you have to do if you do stocking 2, which is unload the semi truck which is not very good for your back or feet at all. They also blast horrible music. I am in the process of trying to switch to something else.

title: Stressful job
review: There’s no room for growth at this company. Employees can literally do whatever they want. Be prepared to work 10x hard while managers walk around all day hovering over everyone.

title: Buenos
review: Bueno buenas condiciones de trabajo y disponibilidad

title: Nice environment
review: From the day I started I was welcomed into the location from all employees and managers. I couldn't believe how easy the job was and how quickly I learned how to do it

title: Fun Workplace
review: Fun job with fun coworkers who know how to brighten the mood. Everyday felt exciting and motivating especially working alongside people who share your interests.

title: Co workers very friendly
review: Very friendly and helpful teammates first job I had and was a little nervous but my co workers were very reassuring that I would do fine and that if I had any questions

title: A Good First Job
review: I liked how breaks and lunch was almost always on time. Coworkers were nice. The pay was also good and there were a lot of bonuses at that time. Another good part was there was no overtime work needed which is a huge plus. A good part time job for a college student.

title: good job
review: good job great benefits awesome manager great  loaders and nice driver  would still be there  but retired  just praise this  company in the respect there drovers

title: Non fun workplace
review: Horrible management . Horrible employeees oh my jeez and they are ever Never checking their dates on meats and cheeses and yogurts etc. management is rude anemd careless

title: Good place to work.
review: It’s a good place to work for a first job, it’s not too bad the people are nice and the pay is decent. Honestly the hardest part of the job was unloading truck depending on what they had you unloading

title: Decent benefits and pay
review: Decent schedule and starting pay. Alot of responsibility if you are in a management role. Stressful furingbthe holidays and could definitely use more help in the stores.

title: A lot to do
review: always something to do that isn’t in your department, don’t transfer from days because your pay will never get fixed. No matter how much freight your department pushes out to the floor don’t expect to meet expectations. NEVER take seasonal departments unless you like chaos that would take and entire shift to FIX doesn’t including actually stocking it .

title: Good Starter
review: I worked at Walmart for over 8 years.  Most my coworkers were great.  The pay and benefits stink, but you can work your way up if you've got the dedication.  The problem is anyone can do this and at times you get some really interesting management for it.  It's a good place to start out working though as you learn customer service and get served some humble pie.

title: You get stocks in the company, and get to begin a 401k
review: I had a very good experience working at Walmart. The only pain was that I was not where I am now, and my education skills were able to be used, but did were not used as much as I would have liked them to.

title: Good management
review: The management was good. However there were couple people in management that need a reality check but besides that most of them were ok. They should change the pay to weekly and I would’ve stayed.

title: Customer Disrespect
review: Its a good job for the most part especially if you have good staff. The one thing I really hated was the disrespectful customers constantly reaching over me instead of saying EXCUSE ME.

title: Okay job s**t management
review: The job is okay but it gets repetitive really fast. Most of the management doesn't give af about you or you best interest.. I got fired just out of the blue no reason whatsoever

title: It could be better
review: They do not give paid covid leave and are constantly changing rules. They recently told me I could not have water on the sales floor. I threw a whole fit to make me have consistent access to water.

title: Not Bad
review: I enjoyed the job. Is physically demanding and was short staffed at times though. Work was either picking groceries or dispensing orders to customers (lots of sun)

title: Adventurous place to work
review: Co-workers are often friendly and very helpful.Working at Walmart is an adventure. Work schedules can be challenging, often changing hours from day to day.

title: Workplace
review: It was ok but the issue is that most workers are underpaid. It is common in these types of places to experience this although. I was only there for a few months before I quit.

title: No room for growth
review: Never promotes from within despite someone knowing the ins and outs of the job. They would always hire someone off the street with no experience rather than someone who already works there, because "it would cause conflict among the staff if someone were promoted and they weren't."

title: Not the hardest job but some slackers make it annoying
review: Easy enough job to do for reasonable pay. Due to that though you’ll get coworkers who slack off frequently. Hardest thing to do is probably getting surveys as no one ever wants to fill one out.

title: Fun and good place to work at
review: I was working with the remodeling crew , at the Walmart in senatobia ms.my review was always great …..well done and I miss working there and would like to go back

title: Nice job
review: Worked as a cashier. It was a good job. Basically just had to help people with their purchases. All managers and coworkers were super nice. Nice place to work at.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Enjoyable coworkers, busy lifestyle.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Unfair expectations, high stress environment, managerial favoritismWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?High expectations and low employee care, a lot of pressure to do 6 peoples worth of work in a 8hr span.

title: Mixed
review: To start with the hourly rate of pay is good. Since after COVID hours are very sparse and hard to get a full paycheck. Most managers I’ve encountered have been great, but there is some bad ones on every shift. There is certain times of the year where it slows down and upper management enforces it’s little petty rules to get people fired (gets rid of a lot of bad eggs but some good people do get caught making small mistakes and get ran out). There is always opportunity to move around once you meet the requirements. So take this however you want it’s mainly based on if you just show up work and don’t cause any problems they usually leave you alone. If you can I do recommend either weekend nights or week nights it’s far more relaxed and not as much politics.

title: Went down hill fast
review: The new management system the enacted in 2020 resulted in a major decline in productivity. Managers are spread way to thin. In the process of phasing out department managers, the company lost a lot of good managers.

title: Loved it but was stressful
review: The hours were great. It was a little hard to get time off but I genuinely enjoyed working here. Most of management was actually super nice and that's a rare thing to find.

title: Workplace
review: Great opportunity to grow and learn the world of retail. There are good programs and training in place that ensure successfulness in role. There are great advance opportunities if willing to relocate.
