title: Good place to work when going to college or if you need a side job to make some more money. Decent pay and benefits, so that is a plus!
review: You get two 15 minute breaks and an hour lunch payed. Getting a good team lead or manager is a gamble though! Be ready to work, especially if you're assigned to moving freight or working the floor! The most enjoyable part of the job is becoming friends with your crew.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The employeesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Answer questions on the spotWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Manageable stress What is a typical day like for you at the company?Fulfillment

title: Not a good place to work at
review: Don’t work for them. They do not appreciate their employees. The pay is ok. No time off approved ever! Don’t waist your time or their time. Management is horrible

title: TRATO DESIGUAL POR EDAD
review: PESIMO TRABAJAR PARA ESTA EMPRESA DEBIDO A SUS SUPERVISORES. AL SER PERSONAL JOVEN TIENDEN A TENER DISCRIMEN POR EDAD. UBICANDOLOS EN AREAS PESIMAS DE TRABAJO Y EXIGIR COSAS QUE A SIMPLE VISTA ES IMPOSIBLE. TRATO DESIGUAL PARA ADULTO COMPARADOS CON LOS DE SU MISMA EDAD.

title: Terrible management
review: Walmart distribution center does not care about its lower level workers, specifically order fillers. Order fillers are subjected to freezing temperatures, unsafe work areas, every minute of your day is timed and any time missing from "picking" will result in an occurrence. Management is terrible. Half of the managers don't know what they are doing. They show a lot of favoritism. I think they are trained to lie because the majority of the managers will lie straight to your face without a second thought. Most of the workers hate working there but the pay is too good. The culture is toxic. The job is depressing. Mandatory overtime almost everyday. Shifts are always understaffed or people leave early which puts more work on others. Probably the worst job I've ever had

title: Over worked
review: Over worked. Not paid enough no benefits no job security lack of communication no problem no good supervision no structure need better training need more employees

title: Awesome place
review: It's a fun place to work and good for college students.  It's a bit competitive to advance in if you want to make a career though but is very doable with time

title: Do not work at walmart.
review: If you want to be work to death. Management not have your back, management having special people, that will do anything for but others dont matter. Store manager thats always on vacation. Company lets people threating there associates lifes and does nothing about it. If you want to keep your mind intact, dont work here. All they care about is the store, if you have something happen, or car breaks down, or emergency, they dont care. They still tell you that you need to work, or theybare short staff and not accept you LOA and points you out.

title: Plenty of work beneifits
review: The managment I interacted with at the King NC locaton wasnt very friendly to me. At all. I didnt have a good experience trying to transfer to another location.

title: Great Enviroment
review: This place is all about teamwork and great safety culture! You will always be able to ask questions and get the assistance that is needed and will never feel left out.

title: Lots of drama
review: Bad management. It’s a workload but the hours are okay. There’s a lot of favoritism but I guess thats everywhere. Cool first job though. Pay isn’t all that bad.

title: Your coworkers are the best part of this job.
review: It’s an ok job to get you though school. However, i feel like it’s not a good career the benefits are ok. Also once you reach store manager there is a high risk of getting fired.Because you get blamed for everything and don’t get help. We use to get bonuses every quarter now we don’t get anything. Doesn’t value associates the only good part is the flexibility with the schedule.

title: Ok but going down Hill
review: I enjoy Customer Service but the current Direction of the company is moving away from customer service and is losing its values doing so and its showing with the loss of good employees and the ever revolving door.

title: Not recommended
review: Poor management that gets hired in and don't know anything about the other positions under them.Unfair treatment depending on department, the cold department is allowed to have water to stay hydrated and the dry department isn't.Management acts like they own you and they pick favorites. They let the attractive women in the workplace get special treatment. Management twist the rules when in their favor. Bonuses not paid out correctly or at all.

title: fast paced environment
review: your gonna be moving a lot but there is downtime when not a lot of orders are coming in. it's a overall balance of working 100% then slows down and picks up again it's an alright job.

title: It’s Walmart
review: As everything else, management can always be better. Lots of politics take place aka favoritism. Overall a simple job. You show up and do your job. As the title of this summary, it’s Walmart. You will occasionally have a few bad customers you run into but that’s about the only really bad thing unless you happen to score a really bad group of managers too.

title: Very slow
review: The pay good my department never had a lot of work but over all good place to work health benefits are horrible so if you have family I wouldn’t recommend

title: Point system
review: They have a 5 point system. .5 point for late and 1 point for being absent. They accept no excuses at all no matter the situation. And they usually deny time off request because they can't keep employees.

title: Ok
review: Overall it was ok , the environment was ok the management was ok, the customer were ok.good entry level job. One hour left lunch breaks and 15 mins break. Ok hours

title: Alright place
review: A little bit unorganized at times and there’s a lot of change over but that’s just part of it. Not the worst job, pretty laid back most of the time. Not bad

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Family. It's more than just a job. They treat you like family.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I didn't have any stressful situationsWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment is calm and the culture is great.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy but fun

title: Ok place to work
review: It’s an OK place to work. You would definitely get a check working 9 to 5 OK atmosphere. The parking is OK as well benefits OK I guess I was OK as well to

title: Hostile management
review: Leadership in the company in this area is really awful, no support, they forget how is it to be a benching pharmacist, no respect for work life balance

title: Easy job
review: Easy place to work at. A lot of orders get placed usually in the weekend the rest of the is pretty much not that busy. Good starting pay could be better

title: good pay and nice management
review: loved the ppto and pto great place to work i enjoyed my team leads, they were very nicei enjoyed making the cakes, it was messy but fundefinitely recommend

title: overall good place to work
review: good pay, flexible hour, team lead was supportive. other management within the store not so much and rude. dress code it casual no leggings or sweatpants. occasionally got to help at other store locations.

title: Clean nice place to work
review: I have been at Walmart since June 26 2000 great place to work!! Management cares about their associates and keeping a clean warehouse and always first a safe warehouse

title: Poor Management
review: I was excited to work there because of the pay, but soon learned that they pay you well so they can treat you badly. They have too much stock and blame you for not dealing with it fast enough. Good pay or not, I highly recommend checking out another place to work at.

title: Cashier
review: They could at least try to care. They should let us sit down and management should act like they care. A lot of time when your sick or it’s an emergency, they do not care in training I was informed if someone dies that person loose their job and so will you if you attend the funeral, i thought  that was wrong.

title: Flexible schedule with incentives
review: Walmart delivery is a great way to earn extra cash on your own schedule. It gets really busy on nights and weekends and you can easily change your delivery zone if your zone slows down.The hardest part of the job is waiting for orders to be dispersed.

title: Long hours and bad PTO
review: The length of shifts are completely dependent on who shows up and volume . You might be there 10 hours , you may be there 15. The job itself is quite easy , and the money is good . But I wasn’t treated wonderfully.

title: lame vibe with lots of theft
review: walmart does huddles in the morning like go team go and it is a form of brainwashing and the leaders do not work and get all the bonuses and there are no cashiers anymore

title: Hard work, decent pay
review: Hard to get the shift that is most desired. Management definitely doesn't play by the books, and that includes upper management. Decent pay, if you can get your hours.

title: Productive
review: Productive workplace where you can help customers in countless ways. Whether that it be utilizing your customer service skills or a simple transaction you learn a lot.

title: I grew  here
review: Was my second job it depends who’s the leads but over Al great employer took time to help and really see where I was coming from especially fresh out of high school

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Paid time offWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management always expects more than is humanly possible What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic and biased What is a typical day like for you at the company?Makes me feel like I should have just called in

title: Workplace
review: Working at Walmart was overwhelming with the amount of work for very little pay. I do agree that it's a equal opportunity employer but it simply wasn't for me

title: Overall Experience
review: Working in digital is a nice job and nice pay but all managers in Digital are not great managers. They cause unnecessary  drama and the team leads are scared of the coach of the department and they do not stand on what is right even when the coach does unfair business practices or pick on associates for no reason. The hardest part of the job was letting people talk to you any kind of way including management. They would talk to you as if you are five years old. In addition, when you ask the team leads something they always give you the runaround or send you to the coach to solve your problems who really do not care for anyone but herself. The coach will tell you she will handle something and never do. She will ignore your calls or texts about something that is important to you. However, if you did something wrong she would handle it right then. In conclusion, I enjoyed my time at Walmart as everything else excluding management was positive and I met people and became friends with people who will I will be friends with for a long time.

title: It's a job
review: It's a job. some days are good some not so much. Benefits are ok. Management is about the same everybody else says.. hit or miss (mostly miss). Get along with coworkers

title: Toxic environment - Bad management
review: Working at Walmart wasn't the worst but had major flaws in management. You couldn't really trust them or go to them. Some customers are nice but a majority give you a bit of a hard time. Apparel was my favorite place to work in the store.

title: It’s okay
review: Decent place to work an the pay was okay mostly a job for highschool/college students. But there are definitely cliques within the different departments. I worked with mostly Hispanic employees in my department and if you weren’t Latino you were probably going to be an outsider with no-one to really talk to. Wasn’t a problem for me because I’m an introvert but if you’re someone who likes to talk there’s that.

title: Easy
review: It’s an easy job. Nothing really hard about it. Very boring!! I would’ve stayed but it was to boring felt like my days were really slow. I’d recommend if you like slow paced work.

title: Great environment
review: Very good first job to work the people are very welcoming and helpful you are always valued in the team and the managers are great as well they make sure to help.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Easily get along with coworkers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some of the managers

title: Easy, low expectations
review: It's Walmart, if you show up to work you are already ahead of most others that work there. Do what's required and nothing more because you won't be rewarded for going above and beyond.

title: Chronically understaffed
review: Constantly in a state of losing workers and struggling to staff certain departments.  Cashiers and GM associates make the lowest hourly rate.  Most GM positions require cross training to other areas, including filling in for positions such as online grocery, but without the higher compensation

title: Good people and Alright management
review: Job is fairly self explanatory, nice to be able to work with a group of people and talk throughout the day as long as ur getting trucks unloaded. Management is kinda all over the place at times but alright.

title: Productive and good work place
review: I would love to work at walmart good people,good work place,I can do alot of things cashier,stock,good at cooking I would be a good worker just give me a chance and let me show u

title: Cut throat
review: Don't get sick or have a death on family.  They will take u off the schedule for a week then put u back on during your time off and not tell u. Will get rid of you right before your benefits kick in.

title: Great job and Pay
review: Great company to work for. Amazing pay and a lot of potential to move up. The managers are very easy to communicate with and address your concerns anytime.

title: it’s eh
review: pay is good, co workers are all mostly nice, customers can be okay at times, always wanted me to do the impossible after being there for only a bit…..

title: Productive
review: I love working at Walmart. I keep busy and made sure I was doing a good job.if you can't do that you need to look for a job that you can do that. Management was more than fair.

title: Great job!!
review: I really like working as a stocker for Walmart. I know/heard other people around saying that Walmart was the worst job ever to have and I honestly think it depends on where you work and who you work with. With a good team and management, it’s a great place to work at!

title: Stressful job
review: Great place to meet new friends, but horrible management team. Never actually just a sale associate but everyone in the store will always be a backup from all directions.

title: Very toxic
review: Mangers will pick favorites and make the work environment toxic. Expect to do a 2-3 person job. They like to bark orders but don’t know how operations work

title: Fun
review: Una buena experiencia y muy buena gente. Gerencia era buenísima también. Nunca tuve una mala experiencia. Me fui porque quise. Fui cajera y empleada de piso. Muy buenos recuerdos.

title: Glad I got the experience
review: Work is good and glad I had a chance to learn alot and farther my experience in the automotive field. I'm always up for a challenge and take full advantage of any opportunity

title: Average Retail Job
review: They have good benefits, but they work you to the bone. They offer average pay with yearly 2% raises. It can get quite stressful at times, but whether or not it gets to you depends on your coworkers.

title: poor leadership
review: There is little to no leadership. One manager will assign you to one task, only for another to take you away from it. Which gets you in trouble with the prior manager.

title: Great folks
review: Great people to.work with but a drag on your emotional feels. Management was ok but lacking. The peeps kn the ground were on fleet but the management would gove the occasional stinkery-do.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?As a salaried member of management the compensation was fair. The best part of working for Walmart was their commitment to community involvement. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The politics and the lack of constructive support from leadership. Corporate goals were a constantly moving target. Accountability for compliance violations appeared to be dependent upon relationships. One of the most consistent traits of the organization was their inconsistency. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The culture, at times could be viewed as toxic. What is a typical day like for you at the company?No two days are the same. Each day brought a new set of challenges and opportunities. As a result of the pandemic, in-stock conditions are not measured as harshly as in the past. Managing labor is always a challenge. It’s always a great day when the company can support a nonprofit or community organization.

title: Another Corporation
review: Cutting hours so higher up people can get a bonus when they make more than everyone in the store in one paycheck. Terrible place to work. No growth..

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits and after completing a wait period you are able to apply for new or different positions within the store or transfer.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to assist many customers during the busiest times of the year.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly for me some coworkers are like family now.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Depending in which area you work in and if you are a supervisor or not checking emails, doing morning routine, morning meetings, procedure to complete daily tasks and any new ones assigned.

title: Boring but easy
review: A bit boring since you’re only called up to cashier mostly and sometimes other positions but besides that its a decent job just watch out for the team leads as rules go off of how they feel it should go.

title: Productive
review: The pay is there but you work hard for it. Management is not the greatest. Every dollar is worked for and your micro Managed heavily. It pays but it depends on what you will tolerate.

title: Terrible Company
review: They do not follow their own policies. The only way you can advance or even have a decent work life there is to "be in good" with the management. There is a huge amount of favoritism and management will go after you if you different from their opinion (not policy) at all. Very toxic company. Day shift does nothing so if you want to work for this place DO NOT go to night shift. They set unreasonable time frames to get an extremely large amount of work done and if you are not exactly completed in that time frame (which includes stocking,zoning,clean up messes, adjust inventory counts if needed,and claims) you will get written up.

title: Restocking went smoothly nightly but lunch breaks weren't the best
review: Typically i stocked eggs/milk/cheese. The managers were nothing but nice, hardest part was the tv at break. Win lose or draw 24-7. Actually good spot.

title: Ehh
review: Not great pay for what you deal with. Nobody cares and you are easily replaced. Turnover rate is high because of how little you are paid but bust your butt trying to meet goals.

title: Its a Job, show up work leave.
review: Don't expect much other than to have work to do and your appreciation for it is the pay. Management is also swamped with work tasks and thus can't be managers. The company is structured to funnel products to customers and they  don't actually care about the employee anymore.

title: Good pay and decent benefits, nothing else is that great though
review: The work isn't necessarily fulfilling. The management will try to stretch you as thin as possible, and although you have to fight for anything you want like hours or PTO, the pay and benefits are great for a job that requires no experience.

title: Good pay. Forced whenever they need you.
review: I’ve worked here for about 4 years. Good money. I enjoy working with people from different backgrounds. The job itself isn’t that bad, although hitting your production every week can be stressful. They expect you to work overtime whenever they need you. We work most holidays without any extra pay. Culture isn’t that good. Everyone for themselves. Management only cares about hitting their numbers. Other than that good paying job.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Horrible discipline structure. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not getting promoted because my relatives work there. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful. The team leads are not very educated. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Too many responsibilities to do.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with public and some of the associatesWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The communication is not very goodWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Okay unless you strike one of them wrong management that isWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?It used to be hustle and bustle

title: understaffed, overworked
review: it's a job. they will hire anyone, which means if you're a hard worker, and reliable, you wind up doing even more work to take up for the slackers. most of the team leads care about their unders and are easy to get along with.

title: Paid well, lots of drama and immature management.
review: The pay and work wasn’t the problem it was being treated like garbage by supervisors and coaches. The co workers are amazing though! Great place to work to find friends.

title: Ok, if you like slip setting, OTR
review: Advertising is misleading. You will not make 100k unless you work six days a week. It is over the road. sharing your bed with several other drivers. They prefer you sleep at Walmart stores which if dangerous.

title: This was a great job, I miss working there.
review: Maintenance Tech. NightShift. Most my required tasks for the day would easily be finished by lunch, leaving me time to help everyone else as well as be attentive to customers. Coworkers were friendly and 9/10 of the managers were too. The hard floors did bother my knees until I got good shoes.

title: Fun
review: Easy work, helpful supervisors and leaders. Worked all night, few first months were ok, then I started feeling it. Would never work overnight again.

title: Productive and a fun workplace to work at
review: Don’t have much to say other than it was a nice place to work at. I remember them giving us free Popsicles at no charge in the ice bin and you can take as many as you want it and they were delicious and I didn’t care that we took them for free and that was pretty cool that I thought.

title: Worst place ever
review: Walmart is by far the worst place you could ever worm. You are over worked and underpaid. They do not and will not ever appreciate you or the work you do. They will cut and add hours to your shifts with no warning. They will not fire the segsual harrasers no matter how many times you report them. They do not care about you. They will completely screw you over. You're "confidential" business will not be kept confidential. The managers will talk badly about you to other associates everyday! Everybody is fake. If you ever work at Walmart don't make friends nobody is your friend.

title: Don’t work for Walmart
review: I’ve worked at 3 different locations and each was worse the last. At each and everyone it started from management and the lack of respect they have for their employees. Management doesn’t hold people accountable for job performance and will push workload to other employees! I am currently looking for new employment and can’t wait to celebrate my escape from Walmart

title: Toxic work environment
review: The pay and salary are decent, but overall the Company has a fast paced Toxic work environment. The customers are rude a lot of the time. Management can sometimes lack compassion toward employees.

title: watch cameras make stops if you see theft
review: it was ok, when boss was there we would make stops when i was there alone i would sit in office and play on phone easy enough. insurance is trash if you have a family.

title: Productive workplace
review: Loved working at Walmart….. Coworkers were great… Managers were great and helpful …. Very Easy but lots of work to do every shift…. Pay was decent for the job itself….

title: Fun place to work
review: A lot of 18 to 30 age group working there. I am over 50 but I managed to keep up. Was assigned to housewares but always ended up working in other departments which caused friction between my team leader and other leads in those departments. I am a Veteran so I did what I was told. Some of the management staff were hard to work with but most of them good to work under.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people you work with. (Not including managers.)What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The higher ups have extremely high and unrealistic standards and you are expected to be perfect.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment overall is toxic and the only reason I stayed was because of my coworkers.

title: Walmart
review: Walmart is different in many ways they don’t have any time to do what you need to do and sometimes they treat you wrong but the pay is good and supervisors are good

title: It’s Walmart
review: A typical day at work for me is to stand around and wait for a customer to come through my line. I scan their items then bag them then take their money. That’s it. You get nice customers and you get rude customers. I haven’t learned anything working here other than the fact that every grocery store you work for is the same. Management is mostly good. Some of them are lazy and do things wrong but I get treated pretty well. One good thing about working here is the coworkers. They are friendly for the most part and our management sometimes supply us with food especially the holidays which was nice. This job is not hard except for dealing with horrible customers. They will be rude, they will steal, and they will be fraudulent. The only enjoyable part for me is my coworkers.

title: Unfair PTO and benefits
review: Walmart’s attendance policy is very strict and unfair. It’s incredibly hard to build up any PTO hours in order to have a vacation or take a sick day. Schedule is not very flexible. Not a great company to work for

title: Pretty chill
review: Overall, the environment is pretty cool now. So long as you do your job well and don't cause any problems, nobody really bats an eye to you. Overall, pretty sweet gig.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing was good What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The policies

title: A Good Place for First Time Employees and Those with Disabilities
review: Walmart was my first job and is one I would recommend for first time employees as well as those with disabilities. Walmart staff and managers were very accommodating to me. Understanding that I have a disability and doing what they can to help me be a productive worker. The managers are patient, kind and understanding. My only complaint would be the strike system and lack of sick days but other then that it is a good place to work.

title: Don’t expect it to be better than what you hear
review: Pros:Decent pay (5th and 1st shifts 21.00 starting. 30 hours)4 days off typically Cons:Lack of stable hoursBackbreaking workUncaring apathetic managementRidiculous production numbers Management favoritism HazingNotes:While you do get 4 days off, you’ll need them to recover from your 3 days of work. I’m talking some of the most physically tasks I’ve ever preformed at a job. This can include anything from lifting trailers that are top to bottom entertainment centers that you have to lift by hand to 70 to 80 pound grills and such you have to lift by hand with no help. Don’t let the fact you are a forklift driver get you twisted. A bulk of the jobs will be done using your actual hands.Favoritism is rampant, most of the good trailers (easier ones) are reserved for those that are willing to get close to upper management. If you are brand new, there is also a “hazing” that goes on where the new associates are given the worst of the worst trailers in an attempt to see if they have the mettle to stay.Do not take this job. Just don’t do it.

title: Profiling (brutal) Estandar bajisimo de contratacion, hay secciones que parecen areas de reclusos
review: Excelente tienda la mejor en precios y variedad(Innegable)Servicio online de Primera. Colectivo de trabajo y politicas internas? PESIMOSBasicamente un Lobby mafiosoEl Profiling es BrutalNo se toma en cuenta la preparacion del individuo o experiencia.Bueno para gente competitiva pero muy sufrible a nivel profesional.Hay gente dirigiendo por pura empatia y amistad con los cargos superiores.El quid pro quo" destaca bastante.Algunos supervisores practican el Mobbing descuidadamente con trabajadores de caracter noble.Lamentable que una tienda tan amada en la comunidad sea tan fea a nivel corporativo.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?LOVED MY POSITIONWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?BLACK FRIDAY SHOPPERSWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?WORK ENVIRONMENT IS GOOD.What is a typical day like for you at the company?VERY BUSY DEPENDING ON YOUR POSITION

title: Great
review: Great place to work. Easy to move up. Good benefits. Great schedule work five days each week and off two consecutive days that you pick. Good customer return.

title: Interesting work
review: Walmart Asset Protection is a somewhat flexible role depending on which store and "market" you work for. There are a lot of policies and procedures that hinder the work and you may be pulled from your role to assist with anything else that may come up (i.e. unload a pallet, stock shelves, etc.). Aside from that the role is what you make of it and there is no set schedule to the day. As a self-starter this was great. Depending on management at each particular store your experience might be fantastic or miserable. Mine was very good and I have no complaints in that area whatsoever. The pay is abysmal but the benefits were decent, especially with the free tuition. In the end, I could not afford to work there anymore as the pay didn't keep up with the bills.

title: normal but not enough pay
review: just go in and do what you went for. there can be gossip, but its what you signed up for. not hard.   its more manual labor than critical thinking easy first job

title: Not for everyone
review: Most days are spent outside in the cold dispensing to cars- rain or shine. Management has favorites. Pickers have the easy job but if your dispensing - you will get burnt out quick. Other than that if you want to work they have the hours.

title: Productive
review: Place to work is nice just do your job and you should be find only let do what you do you know how it is ya feel me my beoha this is what we do and you know

title: It is every nice place to work..and I did self checkout too.
review: Would be a great place to work and convenient to where I live and to see everyone there every day. People are sometimes nice but sometimes they are ever tired

title: Great if you like being just a number
review: Management is disrespectful. It’s only good at my store if you want to be a robot. Work load is more than the average person can handle and if it doesn’t get done you get coached  for productivity. There is no compassion at all.

title: Bad
review: Just horrible , rude people no hours and cheapPay don’t work here if you can help it . They don’t care about anyone and will give you three hours a week

title: Typical retail firm
review: Work consisted of customer service, management was stressful but fairly reasonable, coworkers were often the most difficult part of the job. Would recommend to someone who is in school.

title: Worked with school schedule…
review: They worked with my school schedule which was convenient for me. But, dealing with the public frustrated  with Walmart policies was aggravating. Pay was okay, could be better.

title: bad management
review: They are good at some locations but in others they don't care about anyone. the coworkers are great. they work is hard but you can move up if you are in good with the boss.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Coworkers, teammates & the coaches What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Inventory to restock and unpacking the boxes. Then zoning the area to keep neatWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It’s a good atmosphere working thereWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy with customers checking out

title: Equal opportunity
review: All race disabilities and special needs are hiredBad part is mgmt or department heads arent serious at work,  they arent good problem solvers and expect employees to handle problems.

title: It's walmart
review: If you have a good set of coworkers than it can make it barrable. Otherwise very understaffed and overworked. And the management doesn't really care.

title: Excelente higiene en todo el edificio buen parque buena seguridad  agua café chocolate
review: Walmart NJ9 es mas que una familia todo es excelente ,lo mejor que me pasado en la vida como empleo 100%

title: Terrible place to work
review: Unless u are in management you are nothing at Walmart and half of the managers suck to work with because all they go on about is themselves and their personal problems at home , & unless you are willing to do personal favors you will not advance with that company. They put associates which have never run a register in their with no TRAINING ,& then when a mistake happens you are to BLAME THEY MAKE U SIGN PAPERS YOU WERE TRAINED WHEN YOU  WERE NOT .

title: What were you expecting?
review: If you end up there it's because you have nowhere else to go. It's like that for everyone else too. Some managers know this and like to be cruel just because they can.

title: 1 star
review: Management most of the time is rude and disrespectful. The 5 point system is stupid. Could be better. The policy provides no backup for the employees.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing they didn’t have anything good to say about them. I had a horrible experience with working here. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?I hated absolutely everything about working here What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Drama filled, always having bullies picking on people. A lot of “clicks” so to say. Everyone there is rude or snobby and only care about themselves What is a typical day like for you at the company?I don’t have a typical day there because I quit there because how bad it was

title: Online Grocery shopper
review: The work life balance is not important to Walmart. Since I’ve been working here I’ve been getting schedule outside of my availability and I’ve worked 8 days straight at time! Also the higher ups are rude and think they can get away with everything

title: Easy job but horrible work environment
review: Managers don’t see you as a person just a body; they refuse to appreciate the hard workers and ignore anything wrong with the lazy workers. Expectations are crazy high for the number of employees that are underpaid and under appreciated

title: Coworkers are the only redeeming aspect in my experience
review: 6 years and counting and I can probably count on one hand how many supervisors/managers I had that actually cared about us. Barely livable pay in this day and age, basically survived paycheck to paycheck. Basically forced to work even if you're sick because management won't send you home if they can help it. Don't even get me started on their absence point system or "key event dates." Literally the only upside is that I love my coworkers on my shift and they make it bearable.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?While all jobs have pros and cons. This job pays ok and has benefits. The longer you stay the better. The fellow employees have become good friends of mine.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Expectations of speed to get things done arent always realistic. Plan time off very carefully with supervisors.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It becomes like family and close friends. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy but satisfying. Never boring.

title: Stressfull and demanding place to work at
review: You had a very busy and very strict quota to meet every single day at work. Other then that the only really good thing about working there was my coworkers.

title: Just ok, it’s a job
review: Long hours and rude customer. Store is constantly going through rebrands. Hardest part are rude customers and lack of support from management. You get a lot of hours though

title: Terrible
review: The people were terrible, especially management, but the coworkers are definitely cool people. I definitely wouldn’t wish that job on my worst enemy.

title: Unprofessional management
review: Terrible workplace with lots of immaturity from team leads and some employees. There's a reason most employees look in a bad mood all time. Walmart has unrealistic expectations. Do it a certain way in a certain timeframe or get terminated.

title: What even are Walmart CSR’s?
review: If you are a customer at Walmart especially in Elizabethtown Ky you should receive a W2 because you are your own cashier.  If management was at minimum good”ish,” easiest job ever because the customers do most of it. p.s. etown cx’s don’t be offended by the rabid guard dogs at the store doors, they do that to the people who get their W2’s there too…

title: Decent pay but your over worked
review: Loved the people i worked with but i could not stand the managment. Walmart should really reconsider promoting from within because they tend to not know how to manage.

title: Awful
review: Phew, management is bad. Plays favorites and half of them don’t even know how to do their own job. It’s weird. Understaffed with an aversion to hiring people. Easier to put the workload on one or two people and hope the store doesn’t explode.

title: Unrealistic work & poor treatment
review: Most days I did more than my job description while working with a skeleton crew. Management is hard on task time frames, but never tells you the best method to keep in that time or what rules they expect you to ignore that day to keep in that time. It was a tedious process with multiple customers asking for help which may take up to 20 minutes, all of which I assume the time frames didn't plan for. I learned patience because everyone, including managers from their higher ups, was cranky about the unrealistic work expectations that only got more unrealistic during the holidays when even they worked during breaks. It shows no equity or inclusion for transgender or neurodivergent people, in fact I experienced microaggressions daily, including some outright. The only good part was the slower days after holidays ended, and the few decent employees that got smart and found better jobs.

title: Productive and fun workplace. Good environment.
review: You will always be productive. Coworkers will help you if they see that you are in need. Good environment, work and the people. Only job that management actually cared about my mental health.

title: annoying and dumb
review: managers are annoying some times,  definitely all have a superior complex like they don't just work at Walmart. They are also big on petty work that has nothing to do with the job you signed up for

title: Very nice work place
review: Very nice ,kind people , good pay . I advise anyone to work there . A lot of growth and learning opportunities. The benefits are good. The job is ver easy Job basically you just count money and bag groceries all day , be nice and helpful to the customer for.

title: N/a
review: Good people. Work was sometimes hard. Money was fair for the work. Management-some was great, some tried to treat you as a child. It is what it is tho.

title: Great team
review: The front end team is just amazing the atmosphere is so positive the coworker team leads and coaches are amazing they’re all kind and respectful and genuinely care about all their team associates

title: Mentally exhausting
review: Work your tail off for little return. Expected to work as if there were 20 people in the area but really just you. Don't expect your managers to care about you.

title: very stressful and typically understaffed
review: Managment is pretty bad, they don't schedule managers then expect the teenagers to close at 11pm, even though were supposed to leave at 10pm. Understaffed most of the times so were expected to our managers jobs and also other workers jobs while they sit around and chit chat with other employees.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Best skillsWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers service What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very greatWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Good skill

title: Good job Overall good company
review: Overall I enjoy the job I do  and my coworkers and managers. They are supportive and will work with our schedules. The only issue is Walmart in general. It's a hard company to work for. It fast paced and involves lots of heavy lifting and walking on a daily basis.

title: Worst company.
review: Walmart as a company does not care for their employees. Management is riddled with egotistical people who only care about themselves and their bonus. Regular hourly associates are severely underpaid and under appreciated. The sick time policy is a joke. Parents with disabled children should stay away at all costs. On top of that certain employees get away with policy violations and egregious behaviors based on their relationship with management.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The wide variety of people that you meetWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working within a department that has family members working together. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Faturnity like, if your not liked or favored your not recognized. What is a typical day like for you at the company?It could depend on either being fully staffed or under staffed.

title: Great Place to work
review: Worked here a few months. Super helpful and full of great people. Pay is decent and management always ready to help any way they can. Clean bathrooms and store.

title: Advancement opportunities
review: Show up, work hard, show you're worth the investment and you WILL get promoted if that's your desire. Work is easy enough. Management is a mix of 50% good and 50% don't know what they're talking about. People are always good to work with. Great benefits! Average pay right now. Nothing special anymore, they used to lead the indu6butbare falling behind.

title: Fun workplace with horrible management
review: No increase in pay, no payed holidays off, almost impossible to get overtime, almost no advancement opportunities, and no increased pay if you work a holiday. 14$/hr in most departments.-Completely disrespectful management with no care for you. -Does not care for open door policy.It’s a place to work if you’re desperate. Coworkers are the best part of the job, as well as ability to use your phone almost whenever.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The experience, PTO, and the friends I have made over the years What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not so family-friendly scheduling, very few holidays off, rude customers, hard to advance in career, constant walking on concrete floors, management that loses their cool when things don't go their way, and constant push for changing how the company does business (trying to copycat competition with online sales/business models).What is the work environment and culture like at the company?More stressful than it was 10 years ago. Fewer older associates to have conversations with. Too many minors working jobs that adults could probably do better.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful and tiring

title: Fun work place
review: Great management good team work good co workers late nights  my coworkers were great. Schedule was not the best always changing always worked the weekend

title: A literally garbage pit with managers who play favorites
review: If you enjoy being overworked and over stressed this is the place for you! When taking any problems to management they listen and then do nothing or give excuses. Need a handbook to know the rules? Ope! Too bad! It’s On ThE wIrE - a Walmart site that is impossible to navigate. Need a good work life balance? Not at Walmart! You sold your soul and your managers to not have to approve your time off requests. Another policy they’ve implemented- instead of giving you a yearly performance review to determine a raise they’ve turned it into a cost of living raise. If you use the points the company gives you to use and you’re above 3 at the time of the end of the fiscal year YOU DONT RECEIVE YOUR COST OF LIVING RAISE. The policies are a joke and so are the “managers”. Do not work here if you have any will to live - you will lose that will.

title: Productive and supportive/understanding staff
review: My expensive with working at Walmart would be amazing! Walmart is such an amazing work environment for many people to explore their options for their drive to work. Walmart helps you find the perfect position that’ll suit you best and if your having difficulty finding or choosing their supportive of any decision that you make.

title: Like a bad teacher
review: Hard to get help, you get in there they show you the videos but you’ll never see them to ask questions so you’re stuck trying to get ahold of them after hours

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?meeting customers, learning cash registerWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?holiday rush with increased number of customersWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?encouraging, some training, supervisor assistanceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?busy, customer and coworker positive interactions

title: Company is decent, people make the difference
review: There is little upward movement available, and the pay sounds good at first, but once you realize the amount of work required for the pay you realize it isn't enough.

title: it's okay
review: it's a normal job, with flexible hours, and some of the management has favorites, fast-paced, make sure you're on time, overall good job just not for me anymore

title: Very productive and always on the move
review: Walmart distribution is a hard working job if your looking to get payed good and work hard this is the place to go. They offer great benefits and the discount card is good also

title: Favoritism
review: If you’re not one of the favorites you will hate it there. Management was trash, everything was a mess. You would sometimes be left by yourself when you have multiple orders to get through

title: Easy
review: I personally felt that working at Walmart wasn't difficult. I had OK management. The worst part was really the customers, which you can't really choose.

title: Company feels like im working for Amazon
review: Pros: Pay is goodHealth Benefits 401(k) Cons:Management No paid holidays Overworked and under-appreciatedAttitudes from salaried management is unbearable

title: Good place to learn how retail jobs work!
review: I want to start off by saying the regular associates in the store were great, kind and friendly, always willing to help others. The benefits/ pay  are some of the best I have had when working for a retail company. As for work/life balance it is hard when you don’t have a set schedule like I did when I worked nights, when you work days it was all over the place if you have to do stuff with your family especially if you have kids that are active in school sports! When I first started in 2017 things were good, I advanced pretty quickly. I went from an overnight associate to a Support Manger in 2 years. Things were good until I transferred to a store closer to home. The management at this store acted like they were behind you. In 6 months of being in this store they changed their tune. I decided to transfer to days and as a Team lead since, I was told I could not step down to a stocker position even though I told management I was stress out from being an overnight Team lead and I was having health issues. The Team lead position I took was a new AP Team lead position which works in DSD/CLAIMS area. Needless to say, Management knew that the 3 associates in the DSD/Claims area were either going to be retiring soon or quitting due to them putting their 2 weeks notice . 3 days before the associate who was retiring left I started training in the area.  I was left in the department by myself to check in vendors, do claims and get any and all paperwork done in an 8-hour time frame. I was told I need to be a team player but when I asked for help, I got none!  I quite after a shooting at - more...
position: Team Lead/Support Manger/ Stocker/ DSD-Claim reciver

title: Need improvements asap
review: Management at store 950 Bartlett, Tn needs a crash course on how to deal with people. This store management are people just placed in the positions and don’t know nothing about being in management just got the position for the pay. By far the worst job I ever had in my whole entire life I wouldn’t recommend my dog to work there.

title: Easy work but mangers are terrible
review: You always at work, mangers always want you to do other people job, they wont appreciate nothing you do, it’s easy work but they diff got they favorites.

title: work here if you hate yourself
review: degrading job, dealing with rude customers all day and team leads who don't really care. theyve been here so long that the life has drained from their eyes. dont get stuck here.

title: Fun
review: It was a very fun experience for me to meet new people and explore the wonderful d diversity my job had to offer. It was a pleasure working at Walmart though some days were draining.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I get family vibes and I enjoy working with as a forklift driver,hr team is very helpful,management are nice and understandingWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?It wasn't stressful!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Clean,more quite than the usual warehouse, and culture it was a diverse companyWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Drive a forklift and pick items and drop off at dock area or load trucks which I enjoy

title: Fast past
review: I have been apart of WalMart for 6 years. I started as a entry level associate and worked my way up to assistant manager. Walmart is fast paced and continually adjusting to the economy. I have gained countless experience and knowledge to bring to any team. Walmart has been a staple in the world for many years. I can truly say it is one of the better companies out there."

title: Unrewarding
review: At this moment I've worked a year as a personal shopper. The job and the tasks of a personal shopper are oddly enjoyable. I stay busy, active, and the day passes quickly. The biggest downside is the pay. The only way to increase your pay significantly is to promote to a team lead position, but that really just means you take on excessive responsibility and are overworked. Since the pay is so bad many don't take the job seriously, and that can lead to a multitude of problems if you want to move up.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The discounts on some of the things.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with certain types of customers. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?They say they care but they dont really.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Clock in get stressed and stay that way until clock out.

title: They encourage high turnover
review: Its Walmart so we know the drill. They don’t treat employees well, but even after biting the bullet for 3 years they will treat you no better than someone they hired 3 weeks ago. They’ll try to make you take on additional responsibilities without pay, and if you take on that responsibility they’ll still hold you accountable for any mistake you make, even $10 worth, when its not even your department. They’ll fire you w/o 2 weeks notice so treat them the same way

title: Good
review: Ok work with ghetto customers no back up when in conflict with people hours suck                                    Have to stay on property on brakes and nothing done

title: Buen ambiente de trabajo
review: Buen ambiente de trabajo siempre te toman en cuenta por tu desempeño y labor puedes ascender de puesto

title: Very good
review: Nice workplace good people good hours Bad mangers sometimes but that’s only in certain sections. Good area and good coworker. Overall would recommend

title: Management is not the best
review: Overall fun place, learned alot of skills, made several friends, training is good, management is the worst, they treat you like you are less and have no regard for your family and home life, they will cut your hours unexpectedly

title: Enjoyable
review: I worked here for about two or so years, and so far it has been really enjoyable. But sometimes the workload they give you is a bit much, but it's doable. The people here are amazing, it's definitely worth to work here and start off.

title: Meh workplace
review: Can't keep a store manager.  Store managers come in and run good employees off. Just a terrible management chain. The compensation as a whole don't care about you as a person.  Decent pay though.  Offers college program limited degrees though

title: Walmart Cashier
review: It was okay working there. I got hired before the holiday (Christmas), so it was still busy. No one really ever trained me well as a cashier so I actually had to learn everything by myself and asked questions a lot but they got annoyed, it wasn't my fault though because a couple of weeks later, I found out I was supposed to be shadowed by another employee who worked before I did, meaning I wasn't supposed to be on the register yet. But they made me work on a register myself especially when it got busy. I also was never told by HR how to take days off or request days off. I had to personally talk to my manager then figured it out on my own. I had my share of good and bad experiences with customers. Most customers were kind.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay check every week.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?You find your own or create yours.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful and disrespectful customers.

title: Fun and not so serious
review: Walmart is an easy job, fun, a lot of playing around mostly. The management is not anything to be taken serious. They really show favoritism towards certain people and its unfair, they wonder why people don't stick around. Easy work and mean customers

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Absolutly nothing unless you fortunate to work for good management.  Almost impossible What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working for incompetent managementWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Hostile all the management way downWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Working like a mule overnight. Fright overload. Managers on a rampage in the morning because its not "grand opening" ready

title: Interesting and always learning
review: Best place ever, so many opportunities lol Offeres to pay 100% of schooling. Very laid back as long as u do your job. Always chances to move up in rank quickly!

title: It is a productive company with advancement
review: I liked working at Walmart, I was a cashier and I got to meet a lot of new people, some good and some bad, but not to say they were bad they were probably having a bad day, so you treat them just like you would want to be treated and see if it brightens up their day.

title: Okay
review: Good pay, not so good management. Would ask you to stay to do extra work but get angry if you hit overtime. No consequences for people who would consistently call in.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Horrible place 5o work nothing is organized supervisors don't know what they doing. They talk to you crazy. Hours always short or work unavailable. Bathrooms never clean!! It's a complete mess!! If u looking for free money and ratchet fun and not looking for a career or to advance this is the job for u!What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Driving a 1hr to work just for them to tell us it's no workWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Pure gold strip club. A whole bunch of people including supervisors doing nothing at allWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Like a back yard cookout on a hot sunny day

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I enjoy the work.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management is unprofessional and rudeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very stressful. Policies are not followed. Favoritism is rampant.What is a typical day like for you at the company?I work nights. I usually have 9 to 10 pallets of freight to stock plus I am expected to zone my 3 departments and put up returns for them. If I can't get to returns & zone, management mistreats me.

title: Stress
review: Very stressful management is horrible depending on where you go but I’ve always had a terrible time there. Co-workers we’re awesome but the management on the other hand is terrible

title: Easy work and great pay
review: Was a great place to work, I was there for peak season, picking and packing is very easy there. Managers we’re nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend anyone to apply here

title: Not a fun place
review: Sucked no a great place to work. Never employee anybody full time and never had the proper guidance. Not a fun place to work 20 years ago. Would never work at Walmart again

title: The most enjoyable part of working at Walmart are the customers
review: A day at Walmart consists of being told you can't talk nor speak to the other associates, I learned over the years that management doesn't care about the associates except to over work them, under pay them and you can best believe they will not stand by you. Their culture gas gone down hill and fast, sure isn't how Sam Walton wanted his company ran. The worst part of working at Walmart is the fact that you're not cared about and the best part would be the customers that call you by name and ask for you when they come in.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?This company has a ridiculous attendance policy . The store manager is not a friendly person. They have tons of clicks. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managementWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Clickish, if you are not involved in their group then they treat you like an outcastWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Customers yelling at you bc they want the product for cheaper. Ppl stealing all the time. Management not doing their jobs.

title: Mid.
review: Management is stiff and corporate with unrealistic expectations of what an active store looks like. Coworkers vary as Walmart will hire almost anybody. Oftentimes work can feel unrewarding and unrecognized.

title: Productive Workplace
review: In my opinion it wasn't too bad of a place there was some great managers others not so bad. They make you do a lot of work and to finish in a period time, overall it was good place to work there.

title: Just Busy Scheduling
review: Whenever there are busy days like weekends, It depends on the management to arrange you on that specific day.  Shortage of staff means more hours (overtime) and conflict. Sometimes less communication. Please select your management wisely.

title: Great Company, However Managers make or break the workplace
review: Good pay and advancement opportunities. Not always the best managers to work for. Some managers create a negative workplace which makes it hard to want to work for them.

title: Okay work place
review: Everything goes smoothly, long as you get your work done. Ok management, ok pay. Its good for a 1st job opportunity. Multiple different shifts. Multiple available positions to apply for.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?If you work overnight shift. You have your own free dependency. You work at your own pace What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When we get overloaded with actual freight freight and you may be pressed for time. It can get overwhelming What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Versatile What is a typical day like for you at the company?I come in clock in and get straight to work. Take a 15 min break then back to work take an hour break and we’re back working then you have one last 15 min break after that you push your freight out and go home

title: Good pay and break
review: The pay is good compared to many minimum wage jobs and you get a 1 hour lunch if working over 7 hours. The only downside is some associates aren’t as good working as others, so sometimes you have to pick up their slack.

title: Okay
review: It was okay. It was a typical Walmart. There were some good managers but also some bad managers. Some treated you like a child. Bonuses were low. Pay was low.

title: Busy working non stop
review: Not a bad overall job just lots of stoking everyday. Some days feel a bit east others are boring and full of stocking stocking stocking. Shoppers shop and barely interact so that could be good I guess

title: Management doesn’t care about employees well being
review: The pay was decent and the job was fairly easy but it was stressful due to poor management it was a lot of times I went a whole shift without taking my breaks and they failed to hire new associates when they seen us struggling bad with the amount of orders we received

title: Frustrating Environment More Concerned with Bottom line
review: Walmart is fortune 1 for a reason. They like to cut corners. Sometimes those corners are their employees, sometimes it's general attitude. It's a depressing place to work, with little care for improvement on this front.

title: Good associates
review: Some very hard working and loyal associates work at this location but they’re not supported by the management team. When you have medical appointments or family emergencies you’re penalized for it. Not very many incentives to make you want to come to work or enjoy being there once you do.

title: Busy,fun,stressful,fast environment
review: A typical day as work would be steady which would be in the end of the month.I learned at lot from software and problem solving. The hardest part of the job is when there isn’t enough people.

title: Terrible work life balance
review: Don’t expect to have a life or go home on time or get your breaks on time . Management team needs work , but the associates are good people. Over worked and underpaid in such a dangerous environment.

title: Alright
review: It’s a decent job, not too hard. Pretty flexible schedule and are willing to work with you. Only bad thing is it can get super crowded and you have to work fast

title: Good short-term
review: I believe it's good employment for someone who's in school maybe or looking for a job just to get by at the time too easy to lose that job they don't care that much about others health and needed time off.

title: High turnover rate
review: High turnover rate, pay is fair. The benefits are pretty good too. The upper management demands more than there is time in the day to do. Very corporate, but will promote within the company

title: Every store is worse in its own way
review: Absolutely awful place to work. 2 types of Walmart worker experiences. Either you have a boss that cares way too much about what you’re doing and how you’re doing it (even if they don’t know what they’re talking about) OR you get a boss that does absolutely nothing. I worked at a Walmart for 6 months and I genuinely could not tell you my bosses name. No idea who was in charge. I just worked 8 hrs a day hoping I was doing the right thing.

title: Laid back and nice coworkers
review: Onboarding process was smooth and coworkers were helpful in showing the ropes. Only complaint would be I would often fill in for other people who call out at other departments which leaves my tasks for those days unfinished and build up overtime.

title: Pay
review: Will sometimes give you less hours than you expected. You can always pick up shifts but only if a manager approved them. The call in policy is very strict.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The hourly wage. But there is no cohesion. Also the management is taught to ignore any suggestions that an hourly worker may have to help the department improve their operation. Socialism is definitely creeping into Walmart's management. That is why the wages are high, because there is a very large turnover. A company that is bringing in Billions of dollars per year should have one of the best employee programs in the world. Many supervisors are only there for the pay and benefits. They are oppressed and unhappy. Far from the vision that the founder, Sam Walton, visualized for Walmart.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Feeling that you're not appreciated. Lack of organization.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, and sometimes overwhelming. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Sometimes a struggle, fighting through the many tasks that are ahead.

title: toxic environment, play favorites, false advertisements
review: Management are cruel, don't offer unpaid time off when requesting time off 3-4 week  in advance before scheduled. Management ignores contently. Walmart has no HR located at walmart alpine

title: bad
review: even a lower paying job with better management would be worth it. Mid management and up get quarterly sales bonuses if their departments make their goals. Walmart use to give the bonus to everyone but now its only management. Which means even if let's say you are the top deli out of 15 stores your boss gets the credit for all the hard work not you or anybody on your team.

title: Horrible place to work
review: This place is down right horrible to work. The management is really bad they don’t care about anything but themselves. Lazy and make others do other departments jobs without training. Will get in trouble if you try and leave for an emergency. Lie about policies especially including payed leave while sick.

title: Walmart is what you make of it.
review: Reality:  this is not a glamorous job.  The work is thankless and repetitive, and sometimes overwhelming.  Stocking shelves with an expectation of one case per minute, having to pull down the "topstock" (all the stuff on the shelves customers can't reach) for the whole store, and overcoming many obstacles to be the front end of a huge supply chain is a LOT to do.  The pay is great for the type of job, with the responsibilities and expectations that go with it.  This is not a stand around and play with your phone job.  This is an off and running from the start marathon every day, but it's strangely not the draining sort.  By the end of a shift I would be exhausted, but feeling great after accomplishing a lot.Success, failure, or just getting by is really up to the individual.  Work hard, communicate well, keep positive, and don't get dragged into workplace politics and you can thrive at this company.  They do heavily believe in giving hard workers a chance to move up, beware though that the expectations are high.  Respect is a two way street outside of the outlier of the occasional problem person/manager, but there's so many mangers that you aren't trapped with only having one as a resource.   HR can be very functionally useful depending on the person that is in the HR role.  The company policies are fair, and there's a path to solving just about anything, and the staff at our store took it seriously to the best of their ability.  The benefits are excellent, this place is the key to moving up in the world, their educational benefits are better than almost any company - more...

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Everything What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Trying to learn everything What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great everyone get along What is a typical day like for you at the company?It’s good day every day

title: The best jobs I’ve ever had
review: The best jobs I’ve ever had To go more in depth I’ve worked there for a very long time and the people here are good and I’ve never felt any happier sadly I’m not working there anymore and I really wish I could I left because I was going through a rough patch and I don’t know how to deal with my Mental health so I am in and I wish I didn’t but the people that work there are amazing and I enjoyed my job

title: 1 star

title: It’s mid
review: It’s not too bad of a work environment, it can be a fun, easy job to pass the time, and if you work in unloading you pretty much work as one unit. The negatives about it though is that when the management is put under pressure by higher ups like corporate, they start getting nervous, irrational, and use negative means to motivate you to work harder and faster. Overall as long as you get your work done, and actually work with consistency and at a good pace, managers won’t breathe down your neck.

title: Eh
review: Walmart is a decent company in itself, however the management and the lack of associates makes it hard to want to stay. I love the people I work with even my direct supervisor, but going from department to department when things need to get done is a huge turn off.

title: Starting working 3 yrs ago prior to launch of delivery
review: Horrible..    too many drivers using other people account to make money..... Leaving the one's who were there from the start hungry to get orders. It may start out good but after awhile you discover you are left behind struggling to get orders when you have great ratings....... Don't leave a full time job depending on Walmart to always come through making over a 1000.00 a week. That was so long ago in the market area I'm in. Even had to travel out of state in order to pay bills....... Don't be fooled by the hype........ They just want their products delivered by any means necessary...... I'm just saying...... Love at first sight but don't get comfortable....... They just like everybody else....... Business...... and you really don't matter....... Trust

title: Productive
review: Great pay, the environment was nice . You had your weekends to yourself as well. I loved working for Walmart warehouse. I only stopped working there because they laid us off

title: Fun but stressful
review: Being a shopper was fun, great co-workers. Management was horrible. Walmart themselves put to much on worker and expect you to get it done in one shift and the work really takes 2 maybe even 3 full shifts to get done

title: Easy but Tedious
review: Every day was pretty similar. People would come in for tire and/or lube work. They would get upset with the pricing (even though the pricing is some of the most competitive in the city). You would stock shelves at night. Not a lot of upwards mobility but overall, couldn't ask for more from a second job.

title: Good place to work
review: Good place to work with the right coworkers. It has job security. Overall, it is a pretty easy job (the produce department) Its the perfect job if you like making areas look full and organized, its satisfying

title: Learning Experience
review: Meeting new people and learning new things is really the only plus. Management have their days. Usually they work with you concerning your scedule, but not always.

title: Terrible place to work
review: If you have a good Team Lead it isn't so bad but they expect so much for such a low pay rate.  A lot of preferential treatment/favoritism.  Many violations of company standards but nothing is ever done about it, many should be terminated but it is overlooked.  Upper management not good, they may be nice people but rarely address  issues.  The only part I enjoy is some of my co-workers, we do have fun working with each other.

title: Normal Workplace
review: A normal working environment with everyday tasks. Management was nice some of the unlike managers were reported and replaced. The staff was cool and no one was looking over your shoulder the whole time.

title: This place will make you hate life
review: Only work at Walmart if you truly hate yourself and others. I seriously cannot express how much Walmart as a company sucks the life out of you. Management plays favorites, half of your team will do no work and put it all on you. The people are toxic to work with. Customers will not treat you like a human. The attendance policy is unfair. Vacation accruel sucks unless you've been with the company for 30+ years. The pay is god awful unless your maxed out.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people, and just do your job maybe once in awhile help your co-workersWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Getting things  finished before your off and your co-workers could clean up after themselvesWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and multi cultured.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and not boring

title: Great place to work
review: It was a calm place to work with a good team and management. Hardest part would be during the holidays when extra truck loads would come. I enjoyed that we could borrow money before we got paid from our check Incase you where short on funds.

review: Buen lugar de trabajo, grato ambiente conmposibilidades de crecimiento personal. Pero el salario por cargos y por horas de trabajos es muy bajo para una empresa tan grande.

title: Okay workplace
review: Long hours, decent management, entry level job. Would not recommend to a friend. Get good customer experience since many people come into Walmart. Get to learn on the spot.

title: great!
review: it was amazing I learned so much that it was engraved in my brain. if you wanna work for a company that makes you feel safe work at Walmart and never look back!

title: It was a drag
review: Horrible management they don’t care about employees. Over worked understaffed. Morale always in the dump. No bonus or incentive for employees. So glad I left

title: Place sucks
review: 18 years at Walmart place gets worse every year.. they took away the bonus, holiday pay, $1 extra an hour on Sunday, and last they also took away the incentive raise it’s a 2% across the board… they are also limiting the discount on less items! I just got a better job and more $

title: Got trained to do self checkout
review: Enjoyed working there. Met a lot of people..  Got a lot of excersise walking. Friendly to all costomers. Helped the costomers find what they are looking for

title: Not a bad job, but communication could be improved
review: The job itself wasn't bad. It's a lot of walking. However, my schedule was never set, like it was supposed to be. There was a scheduling error every single time the schedule came out and it took a lot of back and forth of reminding the leads/higher ups to get it fixed.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay. title: Decent pay and managers.
review: Overall, I enjoyed my time working at Walmart. The supervisors and management was decent and competent. The pay could have been better as well as the hours.

title: Okay job, toxic environment
review: The job itself wasn’t bad. The managers assign you to the same spot every shift even when asked to be assigned to another area which can make the job boring.

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with the rude bosses/coworkers on the daily basis. title: Mehhh

title: Efficient and enjoyable work
review: it's important to have your own phone for the app you will need download to see the ppto your accruing. as well as the tc to scan item and scan barcode basket. you are timed. as well as that it has to be an accurate the picking in a short frame of time. your not given much time for practice. but overall great experience working with the general public for pickup, shipping and online delivery to your home.

title: llevo un año y medio esperando que q me den un ful time , pero ni siquiera tengo las horas de un part time.
review: Las horas de los empleados que tenemos tiempo trabajando nos cortan las hora y los días de trabajo , para poner gente nueva con menos sueldo. De que nos vale que nos aumenten el sueldo , si no nos van a dar horas , ni más días no llegamos a las 40 horas a la semana , con eso no se sobreviven.

title: Teribble
review: Hate it there. Management is nothing but children they don’t know how to run a store or a team the pay is not worth the work and abuse you take. I do not recommend it to anyone.

title: Lacked support
review: Required to work with no support or help that would easily be for 5-6 people. If you worked overtime, they would cut your hours to prevent you getting overtime pay.

title: Good place to learn basic
review: Great place to learn basics about vehicle maintenance. These skills will serve you for the rest of your life. When I worked there in 2017 the management in the shop was great and we were a team.

title: Productive, happy, and fun workplace
review: Working at walmart was one of my best experiences, especially with it being my first job. I was a cashier and the management was so easy to work with, they are a balance of fun and serious.
