title: productive job nice people.
review: Really great job for a long-term career, I loved working here great staff very good team leads and loved the highly recommend this job to anyone serch

title: Good place to make money and get lots of hours.
review: This job is good for someone who wants to be at Walmart for the rest of your life. It is also a good job for people who need to make more money or need the hours. Every job has its bad employees and management and this place has it’s few but overall it’s a pretty good place to work.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay options ( weekly or biweekly, your choice w| the even app )What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everything about this job was stressful. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Unorganized, lacking in materials

title: Great pay, awesome benefits, decent team leads
review: If you work night shift the pay is outstanding but it would probably come out better if it was just slightly less as I believe it is so good that it puts you into a higher tax bracket cuz I made more net income when I worked on a drilling rig & actually made $2 less an hour so I'm assuming it was a tax bracket thing.

title: Terrible
review: No concern for associates. Poor pay for regular associates and high work loads. Understaffed severely . Terrible company over all. I don’t see any cons with them

title: Coworkers are great- management is terrible
review: I loved all my coworkers but management was a joke. I spent about a third of my shift in the bakery doing my actual job before being pulled elsewhere to help. I'd stay late if needed and come in early as well. Only ever had to leave for my children (single mom)  and when my car was totaled they were unwilling to work with my availability so I ultimately had to quit before I was fired for not being able to hold to my given shifts.

title: Good pay..
review: That’s about it, good pay and bad management. They don’t take into consideration anything going on. It’s ran with no communication. It was daily just wondering what suck show I was walking into.

title: Productive and fast pacing
review: Good to build up experience and fast pacing. Along with that ok pay for starters. Management was distant and quiet in some departments. Ok place to start off.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The way they take care of the employees.and customers.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When they don't have enough of employees.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Family style

title: Work Duties are Enjoyable and Fulfilling, Environment is Toxic
review: This is a very fast paced, high expectation work place. The compensation is great for the area, but you sacrifice a lot to work there. Mandatory overtime, extremely high turn over, some shady and catty work drama. Training is not always great due to the high turn over, and the management can be shady. Don't expect a stable environment, policy and procedures change even on the week to week. Flexibility and adaptability is a must. Very rigid rules, and consistent micro managing until you are well established and trusted. (High stakes for mistakes) Overall, the job itself is great. The environment can be highly unstable and toxic. My personal experience was good for the most part but it takes a certain person to weather the storms.

title: Easy job, lazy management
review: The work is easy but your also working with children everyday, the managers/management team members are lazy and will push you to get stuff done or stay after your shift to finish work even if it's not work assigned to you. Walmart has a point system that will cause anyone to get fired for little to no reasons. For example calling out for being sick more than 5 times in a six months period will cause you to get fired. For every point you get you have to wait six months for the point to be taken away, you get a maximum of 5 points before you are fired

title: Management plays favorites
review: You will be a hero one day and the zero the next. Good pay if  you get lucky to get full time  Some workers don’t have to do the job all is expected to do

title: Great experience
review: I used to work at Walmart, I love my OPD Manager, team leads and co-workers. They are all nice. I love my schedule. Great experience, pay and benefits.

title: Don’t even bother.
review: Just stay away from here. Every managers got their favorites, you get the same people being lazy never doing their job. Pay sucks. There’s a reason the store number is 666.

title: Overworked but with almost fair pay.
review: Coming in most days has become a chore most over anything as management does not see you as a person and will hold policy and numbers over your wellbeing.

title: Good place to work at.
review: Good place to work love my team only con is the attendance system only get 4.5 call ins in a 6 months period. Which is a joke. But other than that I really like the environment and the people.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?You meet nice people and it pays nice if you're not a cashier or apparel.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?No one answers their phones even though they're supposed to.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Toxic and everyone is set up to fail. What is a typical day like for you at the company?You are constantly dealing with short staffing even on non-busy days.

title: Fun
review: Easy Job. It was a fun day every day. The pay was not great but they offer good benefits. The schedule was flexible. It was not hard to take a day off.

title: Job pretty easy. Terrible store manager and leads communication
review: Walmart would be a great place to work, if better management was in charge.  The atmosphere is dark and very negative. There's need for employee care, meaning, physical and mental health. There's much that needs fixing!

title: Pays the bills but management can be pretty bad
review: Been with this company for almost 10 years. I've learned that seniority doesn't matter when it comes to moving up within the company.  Being good at what you do or even having great customer service means absolutely nothing if you want to move up. I've noticed that if you're a "yes man" without a lot of knowledge of how the store runs (newbie), you're more likely to get promoted quickly.  Or if you're friends with management.  Pay for overnights is decent but doesn't always match the workload.  You'll always be doing the job of 2 or more people, you'll get used to it. The floors will hurt your back and feet permanently (get good shoes).My advice is do your job, keep your head down don't do too much or extra because then they expect it all the time and you get the same pay as the newbie slacking in the corner.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Been working with Walmart for 6 years my seven years will be this year I have learned a lot What is the most stressful part about working at the company?They way manger talk to people What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's very good and I'm happy working for the companyWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and good and I stay focused

title: Frustating
review: Not a very friendly place to work. Personnel is something else.The workers are very uptight. Some will walk walk right past people and not even speak , don't ask if need help. There are some that stay on phone all the time very very clicky especially on online orders it's awful they are very rude people.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The best part is meeting new people.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Most stressful is management because they never have your back. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Highly stressful, everything is your fault and management sucks.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful. Constant calling of my name to be here and there.

title: Very very horrible place to work at
review: The management is terrible and doesn’t care about employees at all. If I could give less starts I would, very unprofessional and unfair behavior from all the management there.

title: Great place to work
review: Great place to work! Great pay and benefits. Most people are friendly and helpful. Just follow the rules and it’s grand. Must be ok with working most weekends

title: Chaos
review: It's a okay to work with if you are friends with your team lead. Most of the time it's overwhelming loads of work that the other employees relying to you.

title: It’s alright
review: Love working on cars lol they feed you from time to time and make sure you get your 40 hours every week. Love that everything is right in the store with me . The management could be better but hey it is what it is

title: Good employees make you want to stay
review: Overall a decent job. Retail is retail, and Walmart is king of retail. You will work holidays, except Thanksgiving and Christmas, and you will probably work the days before and after to prepare the site for those holidays. Expectations are high, which inherently isn't a bad thing, but when the expectations include overloading the few associates we have, it can be problematic. Being a manager isn't all bad, but the pay does not reflect the work load. $16 to be over training new hires in frozen, dairy, deli/bakery, and produce, ensure those respective departments are always top notch, and then work like everyone else because you had 3 call outs can get tiring very quickly. There is a point system for termination, call out 5 times without using protective paid time off and you're gone. Except at the WM I work at, you aren't. They just erase your points, therefore rewarding bad behavior. If you're looking to slack off and call out every other day, it's great. If you're a manager and expect to have a team come in to assist your areas, it isn't great. The only thing worth it here is the people. The employees are great and funny, caring and cool. I've made many friends here, and they're the only reason I have remained here for as long as I have.

title: To much Stress!! To pull 90% in few months
review: The $$ was Good but  only worked PT!! Only 2 times worked 8 hrs in 5 months!! Expected to much from the Order Fillers to Pull 90% in 5 months & when you Didn't it was Good Bye!! Most of my Co - workers didn't get 90% also in 1 Days work & always had to wait for other Order fillers in front of you to Pull there stuff first!! & Slowed you down & also lift Drivers pulling pallets down & waiting for them to refill & stock up on empty Pallets in your Department all the time & then wasn't able to meet your % for the Day!! BS!! Machines that you worked on wasn't working right or The earpiece wasn't able to hear right while filling your orders!! 👎👎

title: Poor management
review: A typical day at work would be grabbing a cart and taking off you know what needs to be done and u don’t have to wait around for a manager you can just get to work. The hardest part is when people slack off and hide in restrooms or other parts of the store. Management has favorites and will cheat you out of money they promised. People usually work as a team and get things done on time for the customers.

title: Productive and fun work place
review: Very fast pace and be ready to be on your feet for 8 hours, the workplace is great, made a lot of friends with coworkers, pay could be a bit better due to the amount work required

title: Just dont.
review: by the time youre paid its been weeks and they found three things that they didnt like about you, phrased them as warnings and then fired you because you are a meat puppet. They dont care about a thing. They will have you cover for a manager because they are sick two weeks into employment. No training nothing, youre done. Good luck.

title: Good with cons
review: Just make sure your boss is respectful. Pay is good but the headaches is not worth it sometimes. The job as a whole is fine but you give up a lot of your life doing it .

title: Fast paced
review: Different stores will experience different problems. Home office buyers over order and then blame stores for backing up creating a never ending workload that you are expected to finish.

title: I enjoyed the experience.
review: Loved my team members. Management wasn't terrible but communication could have been better. Daily operations protocol and guidelines were still being worked out.

title: I liked it, sometimes hard
review: Great place for young person to work,and move up for promotion pay & benefits are bout average or above, lots of different personalities to work with. Customer's we're nice,, i worked graveyard shift in 2015 to 2017.

title: itter buckets destroyed my back for a year or two after I quit. The management progressively got worse and I got out just in time. Lol
review: This was a fun job. I didn't have to deal with too many people since I started stocking shelves at like 3am. The constant heavy lifting of dog food bags and cat litter buckets destroyed my back for a year or two after I quit. The management progressively got worse and I got out just in time. Lol

title: Chill place to work
review: Very easy and repetitive job that anyone can work at. Not recommended if you are still in school or want to to do much outside of work. Managers are cool and don’t bother anyone.

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I got a paycheck every two weeks. I met some really nice people. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful, customer service is very hard. It is even more so since 2020 for some reason. People have forgotten their manners What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy, customer service, stocking, and stocking some more… cases of merchandise everyday needs to be put on the shelves, and then you have to find someplace to put the overstock… busy

title: Lot of technology stack
review: Lot of new technology stackManages high trafficvery good tech stackGood compensationOverall good place to work, but need to spend more time.Should be ready to do any type of task.

title: Good entry level job
review: Worked in the meat department restocking shelves. Pay is what you'd expect of retail, at or slightly above minimum wage. Job is fine if your immediate supervisor is cool like mine was.

title: Cashier
review: No support when it comes to being disrespected by a customer to them no matter if you weren’t wrong the customer had the say so basically but they pay great that’s the good part

title: Working with the public can be stressful at times but also keeps you busy.
review: Good work environment other than odd dippersful or criminal costumers but Walmart attracts all kinds doesn't it.   Overall the management are driven high class people, and the hourly staff are for the most part friendly helpful people in my experience.

title: Favoritism
review: They don’t care about working everybody is family so favoritism is real. They talk about everybody and tell personal business to coworkers . Don’t not

title: Low pay
review: Don't care about employees. You are just a number. Benefits are expensive. Hours are not consistent. Management has favorites. Very difficult to advance.

title: I worked there and got paid
review: I'm only righting this review so that I can look at other job reviews on indeed so that I can work somewhere else, Everyone I formed a bond with in that building was gone before I quit Myself

title: Fair Pay, Bad Environment
review: If you work here, keep to yourself and get out as soon as possible. I was a garden center employee and was suddenly moving freight, stocking and working overstock in basically all of general merchandise. The salary is worth it, but I would not recommend getting to know your coworkers.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The one and only good thing about working at Walmart is you get breaks every 2 hours and an hour lunch. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The most stressful thing about working for walmart is the managers who don't care about their employees. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The environment at my particular store was fun at times and hostile at times. It all depended on which team lead was running the front-end. What is a typical day like for you at the company?A typical day for me was being a self-checkout attendant and listening to people complain about only 1 lane being open.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Payday and when your shift is over.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Caring about your work, when management does not.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Do as I say, not as I do. You are set up to fail everyday.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Get to work.  Told everything is bad because of, let’s say Tuesdays crew (and since you were off on Tuesday, you are still at fault).  Get the picture.Break, lunch, break, go home.Repeat the fun…..

title: Very fast paced, detail oriented, quick learner and physical challenging.
review: It’s a corporation so it gives very little interest in team building.  It’s all about the profit and it’s return from you.  I have nothing good to say about Walmart except a livable wage for Cheyenne.

title: Horrible place
review: If you’re looking for a job, please stay away. This place really takes a toll on mental health. Especially if you’re somebody with goals, definitely not worth it

title: Walmart
review: Decent entry level job. Walk around the store picking orders for customers to pick up or for shipping. Sometimes you work in the Backroom staging orders and sometimes you are the one dispensing the orders to the customers outside.

title: You will stay busy!
review: I did enjoy the always moving part. Some of the Team Leads and Managers made the job intolerable. It’s an okay job to get you through until you can find something better.

title: Easy Going Work Place
review: It was overall a good experience. Just a bad experience with one team lead. I enjoyed my time there. I worked at Walmart for 2 years and I thought it was a good time.

title: Low pay, boring work
review: Doing the same thing over and over again. Very repetitive. Managers are fine and try to help. Schedule is very random. They do not care about availability

title: Don’t work here unless you need too
review: It a huge pain to work there they say they get you help but they don’t till you get lock out of the system and then they send help and for the most part management was not nice

title: Good way to start yourself
review: Overall great job but not kind to employees with disabilities. I was trying to apply at a different walmart and was turned down due to my autism being too much for the position of cart attendant.

title: I was a cashier this does not apply
review: I believe working at Walmart was not all bad but if you get hurt they will not acknowledge it.  I loved most of the public and it was mostly great but I would not work there ever again.

title: Jobs a joke
review: The management was the worst to deal with…when there actually was management. Half the time you need have a higher up to request time off or to leave early. It was an absolute joke. The hours were always inconsistent and never were steady. Customers are rude as h*ll and acted like they owned everything.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There isn’t a good part everyone treats you like you’re dumb and they don’t treat you rightWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Working for the company is stressful you never know what’s going to happen What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Trash everyone has a stick up there butt and nobody can take the responsibility for it and they play a blame game on the shifts and they don’t try to fix the issues What is a typical day like for you at the company?Over working yourself to get stuff done when you’re underpaid

title: Management Does Not Care
review: Store Manager randomly cut the hours of everyone who was part-time by over ten hours and would not give them their hours back. The team leads were really nice, but the managers showed little care toward employees. The pay rate seems nice, but they will majorly limit your hours to where your paycheck isn't healthy.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?A paycheck What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having help from your so called team lead !!!What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful and no organization What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stressful

title: Miserable place to work
review: You get personal days but when you try to use them management rejects them and you receive attendance points. No Holliday pay. They keep you part time so you get no benefits and constantly cut hours. Management is terrible

title: Growth and development
review: Walmart helps young people mature and grow up and show responsibility you’ll definitely be able to learn a lot about stocking or whatever area you work you will become great at it WAL-MART teaches you how to be the best at you position and shows your strength and weaknesses

title: Boring and no communication
review: The job is incredibly boring and the management only made it worse. They constantly changed the rules and failed to let anyone know. Customers were also just rude all the time

title: It's Walmart
review: The job is what you would expect. The pay is actually quite decent and it can be fun working with co workers. However it does get hectic during holiday season and it can be hit or miss with your managers, some might be good some might be awful. Also some departments might go understaffed and without a team lead for a long time so associates may have to pick up slack in other areas which can be annoying.

title: Fun
review: Honestly Walmart is the best. People are friendly and helpful. They are professional and extremely flexible with the schedule. I would recommend this position to whover.

title: Fun workplace
review: Good place to work out, many of the employees were very chill and helped each other out, would go back if I wasn’t moving away. Managers are good people too, very kind.

title: Comfortable and easy
review: Easy and comfortable work place, the only downside is the scheduling. I think it's computer generated. Almost doesn't even feel like you're working.

title: Fast paced
review: Great job if your driven. Work is fast paced. Metrics get lied about and your told to shop backroom during regular walls instead of the floor being fully stocked.

title: Good pay good benefits
review: Very demanding job, but if you can deal with that, the money is decent and the benefits are good. I have been working there for almost seven years now.

title: Great place to work
review: Everyone treated me great and they were very friendly from the first day I started. They made sure I had the training I needed to do my job and was always there if I had questions.

title: Stressful and Bad Management
review: Job for the most part was easy. Lines could get long and sometimes we would only have 3 lines open. We were understaffed for the most part and management could care less.

title: Focus on your space and your team
review: Pros: Proprietary RX software Connexus is simple and laid out well. Easy to pick up and navigate. Coworkers and pharmacists were the highlight of my workday, they stood up for techs and stepped in when help was needed.Cons: Walmart gives too much power to patients, abuse was frequent and ignored. Pharmacy workspace was very tight and made working with 3+ techs and 2 pharmacists uncomfortable.

title: Fun over all, nice people
review: Worked there as a work and travel student, had fun while working there, nice people, even the higher ups. Also nice how many people I got to meet, it did help because it was summer so there were a bunch of other students from all over the world.

title: Good job for area
review: Working for Walmart has its ups and downs.  Good to be employed!!  Sometimes hours cut, what are you going to do.  Just show up and do what they ask.  Keep out of the gossip mill.  Other than that it’s a good job.

title: Wallflowers need not apply.
review: If you are the type to keep you head down and work then it is very difficult to be promoted in this company.  If you like to be the center of attention and always like to be talking (not doing the real work) then it could be a great place to work.  Great place to be if you are of the minority.

title: Not a good place to work for disabled people
review: Terrible communication and the company doesn’t care about you. I was given false information that almost got me fired and you can’t trust anybody there

title: Productive good paying job
review: They usually treat you pretty good and take care of you well if you stay long term. They give stocks as bonus’s for those who stick around long term and have good advancement opportunities to those who want it.

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The pay, hours wasn't badWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Ppl that worked there for years are real judgemental and rudeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?There store is real dirty What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy and stressful

title: Decent
review: Worked there for 2 years decent starting job but would not recommend longer without pay raise or promotion. Coworkers and management were mostly good at my store but obviously experience will vary by location

title: Went downhill fast
review: I worked there for about 3 years. The management was okay at first but the environment quickly devolved. They got rude and short tempered quickly, expected everyone to constantly help in other departments while expecting them to also never move from their assigned post. The entire management team has changed a few times since I was there and after I left. I wouldn't recommend working under any of those managers, but they have all left so can't say if it's gotten any better.

title: Productive back room
review: Walmart pays good and only works with college schedules.  If you show them an excuse for not working (catching covid) you’ll still get fired . certain locations are very careless of their workers . The customers are super rude and the managers do not break up or diffuse the situation them employee just gets fired . Although it’s great to work if you are still in school just for a good pay it’s still a unfair job on mostly the managers part in certain locations .

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?My coworkers and some customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Some customers some management and few coworkers and the department being unorganized when I walked in and to many people in my space areaWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very unorganized, mismanaged ,chaotic, management not listening, unorganized MESS

title: It's all who ya know and who likes you
review: Walmart has changed, ask any associate and they (if they've had been there long enough) will tell you that. Not for the good. It's always been about politics, who you know and whether they like you or not, this rule apply if you want to move up within a company. I've seen many people get turned down because they were not liked.  There is no more quarterly bonuses, the only people that get those now are Team Leads and upper management, and believe me trying to get either to actually do their job is impossible, they hide more than they work and get the big money. If you want a job just to come into and then go home, yeah, you can do it.. just don't get caught up in the "you can go anywhere within the company" bull or Sam quotes, that's a man that knew about people and treating them like so, sure they still have his pictures and throw quotes out left and right but they don't actually believe them anymore. Good Luck!

title: Good
review: the place was good, managers are cool. its pretty laid back i believe, i stayed there for a while but if you are under 18, i don’t recommend if you are looking for more than 4 hours

title: Needs department managers back
review: Team Leads in most areas have too many departments under them. If you don't have the right associates,  you are going to fail. Love the other associates.  Pay is good. Expectations too high. Not enough people hired.

title: Don't work for this company unless you hate yourself
review: Honestly an overall horrible place to work. They treat their workers like cattle and talk about them in numbers. If you are sick with a fever, forget it you might as well quit, unless you can find a Walmart qualified doctor (which is not easy to come by). They will always throw you on things that are not your job and constantly ask for more of you, but never be thankful for it. Lastly, don't forget the thieves who enjoy getting in your face and screaming at you when no one wants to protect you from them. P.S. I'm a minor. Absolutely awful place.

title: Toxic
review: They don’t care about you there. You could do everything right and still be in trouble for someone else’s wrongdoing. The pay is decent but not worth the trouble

title: More and more work
review: The harder you work the more work you get with nothing to show for it. Nothing is done about the lazy people that don't work. Pay is not great for the amount of work they want you to do.

title: Starter Job At Best; morale is dependent on management
review: I worked an overnight stocker position with Wal-Mart for around 7 years. Many of those years were fine, a decent job with regular promotions and offers to move up in the company. But the morale and demeanor of all the employees changed based on management. Whether it was a hard-working manager who valued our help (which led to good morale and overall satisfaction in the employment) to a non-chalant, wispy manager (which led to apathy and decreased morale).In my estimation, if you're not planning to move up, move on when you can. It's a paycheck at best, a headache consistently, and health problems over time if you stay.Cheers.

title: Good job
review: Its honestly a good job to work at. Pay is good and management was awesome. The hours were good as well. If you wanted more hours you can ask and it can be arranged

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?As a former salary manager of Walmart building relationships was the best part of the job. Although I had been with the company almost 8 years before my departure, if was like having an extended family. But as the years progress it became more like a duty to work there. The demand and unrealistic expectations were insane especially when Covid 19 entered the world. The lack of compassion (which they preach) was not a thing. There’s no work life balance. If I would have left Walmart 6 years ago  and you ask if I’d ever work there again my answer is yes, ask me know and my answer is NO. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having employees, turnover rate is ridiculous. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?No motivation and  demandingWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?My last few years I wasn’t looking forward to walking through those doors.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Your discount card and coworkers. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having enough people to cover shifts and over working employees. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Very messy and full of gossip and confusion. What is a typical day like for you at the company?As soon as I arrive I’m counting down for my shift to end.

title: Good
review: Great place to work. Good benefits. I feel like I am respected when I come to work everyday. Pay could be better, but what do you expect. I like the people I work with.

title: Easy job, terrible management.
review: Stocking shelves is easy. The management and their demands is what makes this job a nightmare. They get a list of what each area has work wise. So they look at it and assume when you should be done. Most days we are done early, but the one time we aren't.. We get chewed out. Not like something could have come up to take up a bit of time.. Like, I dunno, a pallet falling over or having to make bails. Maybe hunting for an empty cart  or pallet jack because there are none. 2 mins here and there adds up but for them, that's unacceptable

title: I love Walmart
review: Too many chiefs and not enough Indians is what goes around this facility everywhere. Constantly unsure of tasks and management is poor. They need leaders not just someone who is there to get paid and only worry about themselves

title: Some good some bad
review: I like my customers and coworkers for the most partI do feel overworked at time because it’s usually only a few registers openBut hey it’s Walmart, not the worst job I’ve had

title: Overall  a Good Well Rounded Job
review: The management was nice. The pay was well but that also depends on your state's minimum wage. It did get hectic and was stressful during certain days.

title: Horrific management
review: The management there was horrendous. None of them were on the same page, so one would tell you to do something, then another would come along super mad that you’re doing the very thing you were told to do. Very stuck up managers who thought they were better than you and treated you like dirt. I made life long friends there that I’m still friends to this day with, they are the only thing that made the days bearable!

title: Definitely keeps you busy and strategizing throughout the work day.
review: Very busy, always something to do, can be very stressful at times. Demand and urgency is high. Expectations are high but its a business. You can learn a lot.

title: Long hours and a lot of stress
review: The work is simple however there is a lot of stress that comes with it. It’s always something that upper management has you do to or it’s that they wait till the last minute to do something. But the people are nice and you can learn a lot.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?stable pay checkWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?poor scheduling, no flexibility, and having to put up with harassment.

title: Fun but stressful
review: There are 3 shifts at Walmart mornings are hectic cap 2 is a joke and 3 shift is hut or miss depending on the MangerYou get in out what you put in growth is possible and you have to show you want it

title: Don’t work for walmart.
review: While working for this Walmart I received pretty much 0 training for everything I was expected to do. I was a minor and they had me working register alone in the garden all day with no communication to managers. When issues occurred I often got extreme attitude from customers and no help from management it was extremely stressful. They let me go and nobody told me why or let me know prior just locked me out of my accounts ignored my calls and finally let me know weeks later. Got no raise or review the whole time I worked there and they paid me the bare minimum in the middle of covid,  with 1$ extra covid pay. Walmart is a joke.

title: Easy keeps you busy
review: Love working here sometimes it gets a little hectic but a lot of customers makeThe day go by faster management is great no issues so far I have been here for a week

title: Fun and productive workplace
review: Had a good time, my coworkers were cool and the job itself isn't bad. Find the same selection & prices as in-store, with the convenience of pickup or delivery. Order online & get groceries delivered in as little as 1 hour. Epic Deals. Low Prices on Top Gifts. Shop Now. Deals For Days. Types: Electronics, Home Products, Toys, Apparel.

title: No
review: Not a good place to work bad days and lots of stocking mangers are rude I would not even recommend this to a person. It can be good if you young and have time

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing for real What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The racist people in chargeWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful What is a typical day like for you at the company?Dealing with a bunch of people hating daily

title: The company is awful
review: The company doesn't care about you unless you have complete open availability and are full time. They expect you to dedicate your life to the company while they can change store policies anytime to put your job and livelihood in jeopardy. Don't work here if you can help it.

title: It's ok
review: Management is terrible, money was decent for an easy job if they don't give you to many pallets with only 4 hours to do it in the hardest part of the job is trying to do a task in there time frame

title: Productive
review: Fun, laid back not many bad things to say but the pay is fine if you don't intend on needing money to live. Not a great job but seems to qualify as one.

title: Would Not Recommend
review: I worked at Walmart for 2 years and I would not recommend it. Online Pickup is probably the best job in the store because you get to walk and push the cart all over instead of staying in one area, but expectations were too high at this company. People who work hard and follow the rules do not get appreciated enough, but people who do not put in any effort get promoted. We had to go find items in the backroom when most of the time it was packed and so full you could barely squeeze through the valleys when the item was not on the shelf; not just for dry foods either, the coolers and freezers, too. Just recently before I left, the store manager wanted us to start going to the trailers outside if it gave a location there in freezing cold weather. Dress code became absolutely ridiculous; no hoodies, no jackets with full front zippers, but the vests they give you have a full front zipper?! Always kept the store cold even when it’s cold outside. Overall, I only enjoyed my experience there because the job was easy and I made good friends with coworkers. Don’t be fooled, this is a good part time job for anybody in school or maybe just as a side job, but for a full time job, there’s better places out there.

title: Horrible place to work
review: Management treats you like trash . They look down you like you a piece of trash. I hope the place gets better. Their health insurance is good just didn’t like the management

title: Okay job
review: The job pays well and is easy. The employees are toxic. Management chooses favorites. Walmart job seems fine and doable. Mightve been a better experience at a different location

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Working with most customers.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Childish trivial managers are rampant and fully supported by higher management. The managers have no skills beyond being childish and trivial.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Full of "no knowledge" managers require you to cowtow to their nonsense.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Crazy busy taking care of nonsense.

title: Consistant work
review: A typical day for a first shift produce stocker. First we down stack what came off the truck. Seperate into what will and will not go onto the sales floor. Label all of what does not fit out. Scan and indicate any items in backroom that also may go out.Clean and remove bad produce from sales floor. You are managed by you're team lead. The hardest part of the Job is down stacking heavy items from pallets. The most enjoyable part is comrodery with other workers and the bonds you make with a common goal.

title: People I worked with were nice (Not the managers).
review: I was lied to about having started Protected Part Time off when starting. It was taken away without me being told, and management did nothing about it.You are expected to do the work of 2 people by yourself.Constant overtime even when you don't want it.No positive feedback from management.I had to miss thanksgiving because of the job, and they expected me to miss Christmas as well.Refusal to move your days off to match your schedule.Lost my Check on the 2nd payday and made me get paid 3 days later.

title: Great team to work with
review: Loved it there. Hated moving away. Unfortunately I had to move away and leave.  I do miss most of my coworkers. The pay could be better but I enjoyed my team.

title: Does not care about employees
review: I hurt my back while employed at Wal Mart, not on the job, I asked for simple restrictions of not lifting pushing or pulling anything more then 10 lbs and was denied the work accommodation even though it was only for 2 weeks. I was department manager and was only allowed to work in my department 2 days a week and was being yelled out for my department looking bad.

title: Good coworkers
review: Enjoyed the coworkers.  Managers were okay.  Worked will with scheduling.  Possibility to advance if you can find a job you want in the company.  Has decent benefits

title: easy job
review: Very fast paced , but quickly learn tasks. Little to no training but easy. A lot of coworkers . Stacked and organized pallets with also shelves and at times need to organize top stock

title: It’s a job
review: The job itself wasn’t hard nor bad but I got lied to from the beginning. Was told I would get 40 hours but only got 24 hours. Sometimes I would get called in 2-3 hours before my shift and then I’d get in trouble for coming in. All in all not a bad job and it’s easy to learn how to do just wish they people that worked there were a little nicer.

title: Great managers and coworkers, unrealistic expectations
review: They have "times" that we are supposed 2 be done by. However, when corporate does the time study, they just time how long it takes you to put the item on the shelf. They don't include opening the box the product comes in, breaking down the box, moving pallets, breaks, nothing! A lady had 3 pallets of stuff 2 put up once, the time she was given to put all 3 good size pallets up? 3 MINUTES!!! Walmart has unreasonable expectations and even though some team leads understand those times can't be met, they're made by their superior to say something to us. 1 of our team leads I adore! She worked her way up and is the only 1 that understands those times are impossible! We get 2 15 minute breaks and an hour lunch, breaks are great! The company does make sure we have time to rest. Pay is amazing, store itself is always clean and well cared for, u can pretty much set your own days to work so my only complaint is the unrealistic expectations, which could lead 2 being fired

title: Happy to be part of Walmart
review: It's a great place to work and staff make you feel like you're always part of the team all around. It's a good feeling when your shift is over and everything that was appointed to the team was accomplished. I am glad to be working at Walmart. My experience with them over the years has been a great one overall.

title: Terrible management
review: They don’t care they want more work but don’t want to pay more money. Management is horrible turnover rate is high…you work every holiday except for Christmas but no holiday pay and they don’t want to pay for nothing extra

title: Environment/ Opinions
review: Working at walmart has helped with my social skills, also the environment welcomes you as a family. there’s great opportunities to learn new things about the company everyday, and also the benefits! are major !

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Over the years the pay has increased and you got to take home a paycheckWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Walmart used to be a place for single moms and or older people to be able to work, not anymore.  Walmart doesn't care about family or family needs, just the moneyWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stress stress stress watch your back and don't believe a word from management What is a typical day like for you at the company?Long and never ending. Management does not communicate with each other and that flows downhill

title: It’s okay nothing special
review: There’s times it’s really boring other times you’re on the move. You have a set schedule and the management/workers are nice. There’s times where the pay to work ratio are not worth especially during holidays

title: nice workplace, laid-back employees
review: good pay for the amount of work, management is easy to talk to and the breaks are nice, but environment can be overwhelming when busy, especially during holiday season so it can get stressful if you have a hard time being consistent with socializing and need to recharge

title: Good beginner job
review: I worked here as a high school student for my first job. It was just like any other retail job, you stock items, deal with customers and that's it. Part time is more flexible than full-time

title: Very productive.
review: Pay is great, however how many hours you work depends on the time of year and how much workload is available. Hardest part of the job is learning how to stack.

title: Good pay, iffy job.
review: I started working here the moment I turned 16. Being there 4 years, it wasn't terrible. Definitely a good job for extra money or to make a full time income. OT is decently available at times and sometimes you get managers that completely suck or others that inspire you to work harder. Each Walmart is different but the one I worked at, 3453, was a decent store.
position: Cap 2 Associate, Fresh Associate, Deli Associate

title: Making friends
review: It's hard to believe that there is no open door management here. The team leads and store manager as well as human resources are like teenagers, any problem you have the whole store knows your business and if you have a problem with someone or something going on nothing is done at store level. There is no diversity where I am at and everyone is talked to like dogs and treated badly.

title: Wack
review: Working for Walmart is okay. I do groceries I do a lot of thing like pulling and packing out fast. Sometime I can finish 6 pallets by my self I was pro. I work with my team all the time.

title: Terrible
review: Walmart is the worst company ever to work for! You’re so overworked and underpaid! They don’t care about you! And if you stand up for yourself you become a target and they will bully you non-stop

title: Fast paced
review: Worked at this facility before covid came around.  Benefits and pay better than most other jobs around. Very fast-paced job, and physically demanding.

title: awful
review: Can never find a manager when you need one to help you on register. Equipment unreliable. Strict attendance policy and unrealistic amount of ability to call out. Terrible discount. Can fire you for whatever they want whenever they want no matter how long you’ve worked there. Worked during height to covid and their “essential employees” were never compensated reasonably for working conditions. Kept covid cases a secret.

title: Pay is decent
review: Pay may be decent but, there is no structure for team work and support. It seemed as if someone was always out for someone else.  Huge turn over, I believe because of it.  Not all mgt is like this but a huge handful of them

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Helping customers to have a great experience.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Being told to go faster or else termination What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful unorganized and unsafe What is a typical day like for you at the company?Overwhelming dealing with shift leaders standing in front of you with negative attitudes often

title: lots of work good pay
review: long days same thing all day same boxes lots of work but good pay and very repetitive management can be a lot better, pay is good because the job is not easy

title: Not fun
review: Rough place  To work and not very good management at all because they all think they are better than everybody and I think everyone deserves better than that

title: They don't care if you have a Dr's note or not for any reason.
review: Didn't get trained in the deli for the kitchen until 4 mths of being employed. Team leader has serious attitude problems. They trained someone that was hired after me to perform all duties. I got hurt lifting frozen food from the freezer and was told my note from the emergency room doesn't count.

title: Great job but very demanding
review: The typical work day is fast-paced and you're constantly busy. If you're not busy, something will be found for you to do. I learned many customer service skills such as telling the customer in terms of their vehicle what services were done and gave them suggestions of what to get fixed on the vehicle. Management is very peculiar on who is in the "in-crowd" and who is not. Most higher-up management were friends and if one manager doesn't like you, they all seem to have something against you. The entire environment is cliqued up and if you're welcome in the store all depends on how certain people feel about you. The hardest part of the Job would be the customer service. You always need to have your feelings put to the side when dealing with customers whether they are happy, sad, angry, or just calm. Most of the time, they hear a small change in your voice and assumptions are made. The most enjoyable part of working at this job was gaining the knowledge and skills I didn't have walking in. I learned a new thing every single day and do not regret the experience and knowledge I have gained.

title: good place to work
review: good place with benefits. Stressful but have great work people , Not sure what the raise system is now but it used to be good.  Always shorthanded.  They need more people that want to show  up to work.

title: WalMart
review: WalMart only cares about WalMart. Not the associates or customers. The bottom line is WalMart only cares about how much money WalMart makes. Sam Walton would be ashamed of how the company is run.

title: Good job but a couple members of management could be a bit rude at times
review: Overall it's a good job. Your co workers will help out and make sure you know what your doing before asking you to do something. A couple members of management can be a bit rude but most of the other management are good people and willing to answer any concerns you may have.

title: Awful place to work
review: Stay away if at all possible.  More bad managers than good ones,  no accommodation to anything at all no matter the circumstance.  The work is fine for the pay but not worth what you have to put up with from interactions with other employees

title: Extremely fast paced
review: I did not like working at Walmart. Though they are flexible, the job is hard on the body, it is non-stop, and customers do not treat you like humans.

title: Great weekend Management
review: Fast pace job, productivity is paramount. The weekend schedule pays decently for said location. The Job is worth it because of the manager they have. He sticks his neck out for his employees

title: Not fun
review: Was not a good experience barley got breaks moved around to much and for work you do bad pay.overall good co workers management very nice.wish was more organized.

title: Promising Start, Followed by downward spiral.
review: Typical days when I was first hired were simple. I would go to work, perform the various tasks and come home. It was suspicious how I was hired for one position and then moved to another during the hiring process, but it was mostly overlookable. Around 6 months into working here, things began to change. Management was never the strongest point, but it consistently got worse. Conflicting orders, constantly increasing duties, and refusal to fix prominent issues in addition to blaming their employees for not trying harder while shirking their own responsibilities. I do not recommend working here. It starts out positive, but quickly can change depending on management. Please don't make the same mistake I did and heed the warnings of other reviews, as its not limited to a specific location it is most likely not middle managements fault, but rather company policies that result in these issues.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Nothing special What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Everyone thereWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?No culture just trash What is a typical day like for you at the company?Like confused how come this is the biggest retail ever

title: Easy work but no treated fair
review: Pros: Work was easyCould do whateverCons: Pay was horribleCoworkers started a lot of dramaBreaks were shortAlways short staffedManagement suckedNo room for growth

title: horrible.
review: they don’t care about anyone but their own selves. they don’t care about mental health, anything. horrible company. i had covid and they wanted me to work.

title: short staff
review: They usually had me work alone, I had asked for help several times to no avail.. Friendly employees and team leads. Management is lacking though. It could be better.

title: Bad management
review: Love working there hate management have lots of favorites cut hours with no warning deny time off any time after October to January.

title: Pay was okay but management was bad
review: Pay was okay but management was bad, point system ensured that you would lose your job if you hadn't quit by then. Overall not a great place to work.

title: Fun place to work but strict
review: It’s an ok job it’s just very strict the managers are nice also . Sometimes it can be overwhelming but overall it’s such a good job . It very organized

title: Good place to work
review: It was overall a good place to work. You get the hours that you need, and the pay is decent. The only complaints I have is about the management.  Some of the management are good, but a couple are insensitive and rude.

title: Not for hard working people
review: Work hard, do everything they say to get promoted for 2 years and the first opportunity for a promotion given to new person so that new hires can be introduced to "the person that got promoted in only 4 months". Never mind the 4-6 people they have been there working hard for 2-5 years. You hard work is meaningless. Least this was my experience both times I worked for this company. Two different store, different managers but same result.

title: overall outstanding
review: this store gives you the opportunity to grow and move forward. you work with wonderful people and meet great customers. of course as any other job you have your bad days but they will make them easier.

title: I enjoyed the type of work
review: I  enjoyed the type of work I did. I just feel like once the team lead found out about my criminal history he started treating me differently,  also one of the team members for some reason singled me out and would yell at me all the time about nothing just to show he could do it an team lead wouldn't do anything about it. An one day I asked the gentleman if he felt safe always yelling at people like that an that is when they started to find a reason to let me go. Eventually I was told I was no longer needed. It would be nice to have a fair 2nd chance.

title: Productive
review: Good job if you need the money and need hours. Management was alright when I was there, but that is probably because they kept changing and hiring different managers. Store was kind of hectic, was very disorganized and packed with merchandise everywhere. The PTO is great, just need to let the managers know when you are planning to use it. Decent job if your willing to be fast pace and be in your feet all day.

title: Productive and fun
review: It was great job that provided great security we worked 4 days 10 hour shifts and we would scan returned items from the stores. The work culture was fun

title: Nice  work place until you’re a manager
review: Stepped up to a manager role until realizing the disrespect, lack of appreciation, and unrealistic expectations wasn’t worth it. Worked there for 2 years and 7 months before recognizing I can get better pay, without being a manager at another company

title: Okay Job
review: The job is great. It’s the coworkers and management there that makes you hate the job. Beneficially is that the pay will always be reasonable wherever Walmart you work (most of the time). You can also take off from your future paycheck and with the inflation right now it helps you stay afloat. There is always OT. This could be a pro or a con.

title: Coworkers and money
review: It’s a great starter job with ways to move up the work was easy it payed great and came with great benefits and the scheduling was perfect, management was very poor and you’re constantly overworked.

title: Great!
review: Great opportunities! Wasn’t my first time working here but every time I rejoin it’s always a great experience! Management is just hard to work with but that’s normal.

title: Great Place to Work, But Can be Very Stressful
review: (Neighborhood Market) Mostly do the same thing every day; this was my first job and I learned plenty; store manager and asm were great but higher ups don't really know/care about anything happening in a place they rarely visit; associates were jaded, uncaring, or indifferent about their work but we were mostly fond of each other; hardest part was when I was in charge of people because no one wants to listen when they know there are no consequences; enjoyed the few hours before or after closing when there are no customers

title: Great job just didn’t like the people i was working for
review: I didn’t like my manager, we were under staffed and got blamed if we didn’t get through all of our picks because of it. The job is easy though, but not a good environment.

title: Easy
review: Easy money for your day. Get in and out. As hard as it is try your best to stay out of the drama and mini-reality shows going on around you. Let your money fold

title: Basic job
review: The job is simble but several managers barely know what they are doing and are always understaffed. They also expect everything to get done despite that.

title: Walmart is a stressful environment
review: There is a lot of favoritism. I have worked at three different Walmarts and they all have very rude managers and rude staff. The managers are not easy to talk to or even approachable and they will fire you even if you missed your shift for good reason. I would not recommend working here unless you like kissing up to them all day just to get ahead. This place is not a healthy environment and it makes you feel very stressed and having to talk yourself into walking into work.

title: The pay was nice but...
review: Certain managers expected way more out of your pay grade. Severely understaffed and you got in trouble for not doing 5 peoples job. Never will work for walmart again

title: Very toxic
review: You will be stalked your first day by leads, asset protection, managersThey will follow  you when you  are on your  breakIf you know better  than the lead they get madThe managers make smart remarksJust very toxic please trust me stay away from this place not worth your  emotional  stability Lots of clueless managers that don't know what they are doing and want the workers to work harder  than them even though  they get paid more than usThey want you to be their punching  bagsToday is my last day and I'm happy I worked walmart  back in 2016 and it was wayyy better it has gone down the hill now.

title: Good workplace with good benefits
review: Not a bad place to work. They pay fairly at their warehouses and the benefits are pretty good. Advancing is not easy, because their is limited positions.

title: It's okay
review: Overall, this is an okay job. Don't expect too much in terms of job advancement or opportunity depending on where you get hired. Management sucked and played favorites and the only thing that kept me around was the friendships and connections I made. Don't go above and beyond for this company. Clock in, do your work, and go home.

title: Horrible place
review: Where do I begin..this place is a joke. Worked for 4 years, barely get a raise, management sucks, they pick favorites, they love politics, cut full time hours, work/life balance is a joke, they don’t work with you, you don’t pick your days off, if you get hurt at work they told me they have no light duty but yet gave another pregnant person light duty, they kept a drunk and a drug addict but yet kept firing other people, some can call off as much as they want but others are only allowed 5 points and they are fired, they put too much of a work load on their hard workers and not enough on the slackers so you get burned out easily. It’s not a fun place at all. I highly recommend you stay as far away as possible.

title: Watch you job title
review: When I started I was a cashier and then for one shift I did self check out. Like any position Im placed I did the best that I could. Next thing I know im constantly the self check out person even though I hate it. It wasnt until months later that I learned my manager changed my job title without informing me. Pay attention to everything.

title: So-so
review: Overwhelming flow, often can not take breaks, customers are disrespectful and mean. Management is helpful most of the time, coworkers... depend. Schedule is hectic.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?8 hr days, fast pace, good payWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not having enough work and having to push a broom for hoursWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It was great to work with different cultures What is a typical day like for you at the company?Receiving incoming freight, sometimes repacking it

title: Just a job
review: Management will never learn your name, work till 11 one night then be there at 7. Was a summer job. The dollar extra on Sunday was nice. hopefully it had changed. Other positions might be better then cashier

title: Fine
review: Overall the job was fine nothing too bad some days are stressful. Managers are nice and it wasnt a bad place to work. You can get raises fairly quickly.

title: Toxic Beliefs and Unhealthy Environment
review: This place unravels all the good principles a person is taught. Faster is better. Numbers are more valuable than people (and their needs). Favoritism outweighs good character

title: Like any other job
review: pretty easy job. be on time. don’t call off & you’re fine. strict point system depending on which store. managers have favorites, that’s common most places though.

title: Not a Bad Place to work if it a starter job for experience.
review: Working at Walmart was not a horrible experience at all. The people at my particular Walmart were fun and enjoyable. The management on the other hand was rude and misogynistic. Overall was not a bad place but could be a lot if you have need for equal respect.

title: Typical Retail Job
review: It is what it is. You show up, work, get paid min wage(at the time I was working) and hope customers don't abuse you too bad. You are occasionally asked to go help on register during busy times usually around 11-1pm.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Can't think of one. I'd rather be marooned on a deserted island.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with their ridiculous security policy in asset protection. Oh, and the lousy pay working holidays.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible. People always complaining about items out of stock. Walmart is money driven, not employee value.What is a typical day like for you at the company?In asset protection it varies due to trying to remain unpredictable to the perps.

title: Expected to do the work of 5 people
review: Terrible company to work for. They could care less about their people, or their customers. I worked there for almost 20 years and never had a pleasant experience.

title: Fun environment
review: Coworkers are great and fun to be around. They are very helpful and knowledgeable about the store. I like going to work everyday and talking to the customers.

title: Relentless
review: 80-90hrs a week with no end in sight. Very little support. Decent pay with a nice bonus. You’re just a number there though and can be replaced no matter how good you are.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?When I quitWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managerWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Somewhat friendly What is a typical day like for you at the company?Greeting the vendors

title: Not a bad place to work
review: I enjoy working with the team pay is ok my manager is the best raises suck 2%per year unless you advance to team lead or higher we start at 15 for ODP 16.50 for overnight and 13 for cashier

title: Have a lot of safety cookouts
review: Good to work for no stress but you don’t get paid for everything you do and don’t scratch or break anything on the truck you lose al safety bonus plus all mileage you have

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?There isn’t a best part any longer. Loved job for years, but now it is very hard to just show upWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Lack of Leadership and training What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Stressful , no one cares anymore except ones receiving bonusWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Hectic and miserable . Leadership is lacking

title: Good for short term
review: I worked in the Walmart warehouse for 18 years. I stayed because I had zero skills for anything else. At the beginning, th pay was good. But it did not stay that way.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The customers What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not getting recognition and not very many people stay working there long.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Terrible management that are really rude.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers

title: Good team but management doesn’t care
review: All the employees at my level were kind but anyone higher up didn’t care about us. Treated poorly. Very clear that we were replaceable. If you gave them any opening they would exploit it.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Benefits like health insurance,  401 K pension plan store discounts. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Covering other Walmart pharmacies in the area on a short notice. Discrimination based on gender I was the only male of 3 RPh's and the only one used to cover other pharmacies emergencies. What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The Pharmacy Supervisor has the best shifts and responds to the Pharmacy District Manager not necessarily to the store manager. There was a division between pharmacy staff and store members. Never felt accepted and pleased by this working environment. What is a typical day like for you at the company?As staff Pharmacist , usually alone with the tech's, enter and dispense prescriptions for patients. When in charge of the Diabetes Control Program very difficult to program patient interviews on a short staff of RPh's.

title: Decent & straightforward job
review: I worked 4am - 1pm Typical day - You finish the stocking for the overnight members that werent able to finish, take overstock (leftovers) to the back room and organize that. Clear out overstock that is on the floor (on top of shelves). Count stock, note what we need, make sure everything looks nice, safe and get rid of anything that is broken or damaged. Management wasnt involved in what I was doing at all, they usually just walked around.Hardest part was picking up after other peoples slack and having to do too much for little pay (10$ hr at the time) A lot of people didnt want to do weekends and most departments were understaffed so I would help them often.You learn a lot, it goes by extremely quickly, its not difficult at all unless you're literally blind, customers don't really bother you, I was able to sneak in a bluetooth earbud and listen to podcasts during the very early morning before management got there, you dont have to depend on other people too much. Good if you want to work on your own, if you can walk a lot, most I lifted was 60lb and if you like organizing things.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Assisting the customers.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with management What is the work environment and culture like at the company?The work environment is stressful

title: Good workplace
review: I enjoy working for walmart, but not getting enough hours. I need 15 to 25 and currently getting less than 10. Was told my availability was holding my hours down. I changed availability but due to not being able to work past 3pm nit getting hours

title: Productive Job
review: Process freight and stock shelves across the store from basic Pharmacy or Health and Beauty Aids to Housewares, Toys and Seasonal items. You are responsible for assisting customers, addressing misplaced items, taking care of your designated department so it looks presentable, and returning equipment (pallets, pallet jacks, carts, etc) when completed. There is a lack of communication between supervisors which can cause issues for your daily work. We have had about 5 employees promoted to Team Leads/Coaches, but all were either new hires or transfers, which makes for low morale for those in the home-store wanting to move up.

title: Productive and fun place to work.
review: Enjoyed working here. Great people and stayed busy. Unloaded trailers, then stocked the product. Great management as well. Made some good friends working here and would work here again if given the opportunity

title: Worst job of my life don't apply there
review: The Manger of apparel was inconsiderate and even though the whole apparel team tried their best she didn't care at all. I never got off on time because we were alot of times sent to online pickup delivery even though they would make us stay there for hours then not even care if you were till 7pm they would still expect you to finish all the work that takes all day to do. I got a point for going home at the end of my shift because my child needed dinner and I had the supplys in my locker. Their point system is so bad  to the point that you 5 point every 6 months. They told that I had to reschedule my doctor's because I had to be at work when I can't miss the appointment. Don't even try to have  doctor  appointments while working cause even if you give them knowledge of the appointment a month in advance you are most likely to not get it off. I regret ever moving to apparel it was the worst part of walmart online pickup delivery can't keep employees so they make everyone do their work without the pay but try to tell us that we are a team. Produce was a department to work the Manger in walmart super center was amazing, caring, and knew how to his job. The hours were solid and the work was hard and enjoyable.

title: Favoritism at its finest
review: If you are a favorite even if you are lazy you will get promoted if you are hardworking and put effort they will keep you in your position and will not let you leave cause nobody else would do the job as good.

title: Okay place to work at
review: I mean, what can I really say it’s walmart, you cannot expect much from working here. Sure you can climb the ranks, but beware like any other place. The room is just too noisy, co workers are fine, to some extent some are horrible people, but in general it’s okay

title: Ehhh.
review: I love the people I work with, however the prioritization is terrible. Things that need to be done get pushed aside as we work on tasks that aren’t as important. Also the gossip is really bad, even from the pharmacists. Scheduling is rough, especially since there is always call ins because we are always so backed up. He is great though at my location, he seems to really care about you and any issues you have.

title: Job is easy management sucks.
review: The management is terrible.I used to enjoy my job but now I hate it. Managers lying about availability for morning shift and their attitudes are terrible.

title: you work like a slave
review: no money, no respect, unstable schedule, unable to work independently, with a bad management, no boring down time, fast paced, low pay, tight schedules

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Co-Workers and regular breaks.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Customers, especially on self check-out, and rude team leads.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Negative. Team leads were often rude. No one enjoyed working there. Any person asked on my first day said they hated it.What is a typical day like for you at the company?On self checkout all day, possibly a register for a few minutes. Sometimes individuals would be forced to go to break late and then also forced to sign meal violations for which they could be later written up.

title: It was a fun work place to learn from
review: For my first job it was a good learning experience it taught me how to be social and pilot and work at a steady speed I learn how to work a cash register and etc.

title: Awful awful awful
review: I have never had a worse job, the customers were rude, upper management was rude, coworkers were gossipy and clichey even if it was the best Walmart in the world I'd never go back to that company

title: Fun workplace low pay
review: I loved working there but the pay is awful. Coworkers were great and you feel like a team. Would have stayed if employees were paid more for what they are worth

title: Managers are not very nice
review: The organization is bad and managers aren’t as organize with their employees and expect them to do everything. They are not nice and give you very little flexiblitilty.

title: Don't care about you
review: I was a cart person making $13 an hour and would only get criticized and never praised. The company only cares about how things improve their position and not how it affects their workers

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Meeting new people, nothing....What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management doesn't treat the employees with respect What is the work environment and culture like at the company?At lunch time everyone clusters together with their own kind

title: Horrible
review: 3rd shift stocker, poor training. Low wage. Didn't stay long because of it. Didn't interact with any management. Would not recommend working there to anyone.

title: no
review: management sucked and are lazy. fun place go work but managers were the worst part of it. You could never find the managers when you needed them. And don't try to impress them neither they don't care.

title: Good team and enjoyable work fast paced
review: My time at Walmart was enjoyable and I was part of a family there though I worked overnights so my experience will probably differ to those working the day shifts. Expectations were high and the work is fast paced but i enjoyed it and excelled. A combination of Covid-19 and some time tracking issues led to me pointing out for attendance there is a 90 day rolling point system which could use some work but I miss it and would go back In a heartbeat

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The harassment and fraternizing What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The management making a joke out of people because they are not a part of your group so you get harassed and made fun of on a daily basisWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's worse than high school.. you'll get targeted by pathetic management into killing yourself and still will be told you're worthlessWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Harassed by management and friends of management.. typically the non con department anyone who drives there drives dangerously and the management has no regard for human life

title: Great place
review: Salary is great and most coworkers are easy to work with. Company offers many great benefits. Hourly associates make very good money as well. Hourly supervisor pay is highest in the area.

title: Productive and decent place to work but can be stressful at times especially depending on your job position.
review: I think it's a decent place to work but my biggest issues were lack of compassion or care from the managers when asked for help or support.  We're supposed to be a team but didn't get that.  The job can be stressful at times too, depending more on the job title you have there. Also lack of benefits for people on part-time. Low pay too.

title: Worth working here
review: Best stuff ever at Walmart,canal winchester they were very loving,caring and supportive at all times.Also time was best for me to do eight hours a day and get home now fatigued.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Not anything  wasn't happy with the job.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The managers and how they treat their employees.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Not good at all need a big change in the business.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Everyday I when to work for this business I cried. I was so unhappy 😂😭😂😭!!!!!!!

title: It was ok, money wasn't bad but there was a lot of broken equipment that never got fixed and made things needlessly difficult
review: The work itself wasn't that bad. However there were a variety of issues that started popping up that made doing my job needlessly difficult. But overall not bad

title: Good place to work and meet new people
review: When working a Walmart you can promote quite easily, job performance and attendance is key to getting ahead. Customer service is the most important thing.

title: Awesome
review: My brief working experience with Walmart was awesome. I'd love to work fur her again. Just didn't know I could transfer from one city to another and reapply.

title: Busy work, Poor Management
