review: Pay was low, about $500 bi-weekly, no benefits for part time and never wants to put someone on full-time. Upper management was bad. She thought yelling at employees all the time was a way to get people to be productive and took her boyfriend in the back room regularly.

title: For someone who was recently out of High School it was Okay
review: Walmart is 1 of the companies what is borderline a deadend job. but for a person who was recently out of High School it was 1 of the better option for someone who was new to work force especially one who had disabilities and no other option. But if you have complicate health issues Walmart is not a good company to work for because you will get fired if you are not at work due to some health issue.

title: Unfair and rude management
review: I've been at walmart for about 2 and a half years and I've never worked at a more horrible place. There's no chance to get a raise and if you have kids they do jot care if they get sick. They don't care about their employees and will look right past you if you don't suck up to them. O/10 would not reccomend.

title: Loved my coworkers
review: I had amazing coworkers. That's about it. My team leads were great. My manager and coach, not so much. Pay is okay in some places. I was asked to do way more than I was compensated for. They don't care about you. You have to go about this job knowing this. Walmart treats its employees like garbage and will continue to do so because they can. I was fixing mistakes constantly for a team lead as were my other coworkers. Management had completely unrealistic expectations, especially for the pay. They claim to care but if they did, they would show it.

title: Good pay no life
review: They pay is very good however they do not care about work life balance. Being salaried they would make you work your day off or would not allow you to go home on time just to do stupid things. They were always cancelling approved pro time.

title: bad work environment
review: the management was literally terrible and they all talk about you behind your back. they don’t guide you whatsoever and just throw you into the job with no training. Everyone is so rude and doesn’t care about themselves or their job.

title: The training is terrible. We had had to "figure it out"
review: The training is terrible.  They like to tell you will get written up. They change  schedule any time they want, you can't make plans.  The regular people that I worked with were great. The upper echey is will not listen to requests for days off.

title: Fun Evironment
review: The overall environment was fun. Met great people to work beside. My department manager was great, but the store manager had poor people skills with his team, too demanding of his people.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Team members at the facility itself.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?The lack of leadership and the accountability due to HR always fearful of doing the job at hand to support management process. Also district leader lack of professionalism and development to feedback given from those with great experiential historyWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Great except for the lack of supervision due to them fearful of repercussions for allowing management to do their job or feedback for them not doing their jobs.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Management is typically micro managed and metrics only driven with no true sense of work environment. It is #’s, $, and goal driven only no true team member focus from above.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Employee discount that’s it. Some employees were pleasant to work with. What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Attendance policy is HORRIBLE. They won’t accept a doctor’s note for an absence. It’s ridiculous. Not family friendly. No work /life balance at all.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Work environment is ok. Favoritism is there but most companies have that. Kind of toxic and no encouragement to grow with the company. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers. Being micro managed. Not appreciated. Sometimes not given the tools you need to succeed.

title: No A/C. Strict about production. Trust employees as numbers instead human beings.
review: The building and equipment are old, treated like we’re numbers instead of human beings. Production’s strict especially when’s there’s no volume. Clocking in/out is a 5min walk, from the break room & we’re expected to have 20min break instead 30min break on a 12-13 hour shift? There’s no motivation. Just a big dark block of energy in the warehouse.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?getting enough hours and makin sure the next shift has sum to do as well What is the most stressful part about working at the company?the managers dont care about there team worried about there higher management above dem What is the work environment and culture like at the company?diff stores has diff vibes so it all depends about culture What is a typical day like for you at the company?depends on the hours u want to do

title: ok to have start off in career
review: ok pay. dont really give you time to study for certification. retail pharmacy was just not for me for no care of patients and fast paced environment for little pay and no hours

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Can’t think of anything What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Only given 5 points to be absent before they can fire you.  If you work part-time, it takes a long time to save up PTO.

title: Easy job Great pay
review: Maybe be a lot st 1st but once u know where stuff goes its super easy. Great benefit u can go to school for free 10% discount. No drug test u only have to pass an assessment before u get an interview if u don't pass u have to wait 6 months to try again,

title: Its Walmart
review: A vanilla retail experience.  It depends completely on your management what experience you'll have.  My management was very chill and I was able to get away with a lot of slacking.  Some I've heard are very strict though.  Its probably not as hard as working at target or Aldi.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The people, benefits and career opportunities.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When an associate do not report for work, associates at work have to pick up the slack.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Easy work environment to work in if you do your job. There is a great mixed culture at Walmart.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Sometimes easy, sometimes okay and sometimes hard. It depend on what you make of it.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Teamwork. Work with great hard working colleagues.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Depends on how you manage each day.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Different people and homeless around but ok.What is a typical day like for you at the company?Greeting people and make them feel special.

title: Started out great
review: Started out excellent, was rewarded for hard work, but once getting a management position, everything changed, the harder I worked the worse I got treated. My own direct superior even the me under the bus on my way out, which was uncalled for, and three store manager was fired shortly after. Tried to appeal to corporate, but they said open door it with my store manager. How do you do that when the person you're trying to open door is the same person?

title: Ok to work for
review: It's an okay place to work for but if you have any medical going on they will just take you off the schedule and fire you and there's never enough people

title: Good for younger adults
review: Good job for college students. As for non-college students, move up if you want more money. Hours fluctuate a lot. They do provide good health benefits if you have open availability and are able to work with lot.

title: Bad
review: Honestly have nothing good to say about this company they underpay there workers they fire you for abswnts even if you have proof that you were in a hospital the whole time an you can't even be knew an make normal mistake because then you get one mark with. 3 marks your first either way

title: It was really fun to work at Walmart
review: Walmart is a really really god job they give you a lot of opportunity to achieve your goal, l Would love to tell you go to Walmart is a good place where they will take care of you

title: Favoritism,immature and unrealistic  goals
review: Favoritism in the work place but that’s to be expected, they hire team leads that are still in highschool who have no idea how to lead other children which makes no sense. They give unrealistic assignments with unrealistic time to finish.

title: Enjoyable Task
review: Communication is poor from management. Never know logistics , rules chang but not informed by management. You basically hear it from coworkers that heard it from another coworker and info is accurate. It's like management keeps it a secret but expect employees to know. Enjoyable Task. Rapport with customer good.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Management and rate pay and good working environmentWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?no stressful part about working at the companyWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?My work environment and culture at the company was very goodWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?My typical day was on meeting, configuration, monitoring, resolving performance issues

title: Depends who you're working with
review: Honestly it's a simple and good job with decent pay but it's your manager and coworkers that either makes or breaks you especially on super busy days.

title: Producción no acorde
review: Te piden seguridad al mismo tiempo que te piden producción desmedida y eso no va de la mano con la seguridad, nunca te sientes parte de esta empresa, por el contrario estas pensando todo el tiempo que se van a inventar para escribirte o peor aun botarte

title: treated fairly with a good work/life balance
review: the scheduling has become erratic, pay has stagnated, and turnover has gone through the roof. Center is constantly being constrained by terrible corporate decisions and policy changes and even upper management all over the US is experiencing high turnover. Everyone is abandoning a sinking ship, which is a shame because some of the employees have been here over a decade and have invested a lot of effort into this career only to have their effort completely invalidated. Avoid this company and any others owned by them.

title: Easiest place I have worked and best place
review: If you put your money into the stocks through Walmart they also match what you put in. You also get a discount card after 3months of working there not the best to be honestly. After 3-6 months you start building ppto which no manger needs to approve.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Good part time job What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Overnight hoursWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Low stress, nice co workers What is a typical day like for you at the company?Stocking shelves

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?The job is simple and enjoyableWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Management ughWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's good except for a few of the management teamWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Smooth and productive

title: Never again
review: Reported a team lead and was told my claim was automatically closed due to insufficient information but was given the name store and everything that happened in detail. Made me work in HBA with usually more than 2 pallets and carts by myself and expected me to finish zoning and still do returns. I loved the job at first but it became a huge issue when I constantly asked for help and relieved nothing in return. Emergencies would happen and it was difficult to get the day or weekend off due to "not enough coverage."

title: An ok place to work
review: It’s an Okay place to work . I have great coworkers . Management was okay . Customers could be rude sometimes. But overall it was good. Pay could be better.

title: Good place to work if you can adapt quickly.
review: The Good:Work Remotely from home.Supportive Team Leaders.Flexible schedules and you can take a day off when necessary as long as it's not often within 90 day period. Pre-Requested Days Off don't count against you.Pay is decent. Bonuses come through Annually.Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision. Free Gym at Fitness Center.The Bad:Be prepared for things to change often in regards to guidelines. You will need to be able to adapt to a new way of doing things with little warning.You may be asked to shift to a different department within the call center with little warning or training.Training. Expect little of it. In place of much of the actual Training you have Knowledge Base articles that offer guides on how to perform tasks. These "KBs" are often out of date and do not cover everything. If you can learn a task by reading a user guide or manual then you'll be fine. Take your own notes.

title: It's a job
review: It's a place to work, you get paid, you work with a lot of people who just don't care about being there and the managment I think tries their best but it's still walmart.

title: Poor management great lessons
review: They’re all about micro politics. The management seems to be stuck in old ways and don’t see a need in being honest or forthright. Some of the leads you work with maybe the only people you can trust. Upper management is at the whim of corporate and will lie or terminate based on emotional or illogical reasons. You’re not thanked because they feel the extra mile was already supported to be given. Be careful with this company.

title: Prices in quality
review: I’m so glad I had the privilege to be with you and you have been so wonderful with us. I’m sure you’re very proud to be  one of the top leading companies. I hope to depend on you forever!

title: Not the best experience
review: Very over worked, taken advantage of, favoritism galore. No communication whatsoever. Many times were completely understaffed and still expected to give out twice the work load.

title: Ok
review: It was just regular. If your hourly rate is bad there’s that but other than that enjoy unlocking cases and rolling teevees to cars. Oh and you should also know how to set up a prepaid mobile device.

title: Management is not the best and there isn’t a flexible schedule
review: I honestly enjoyed my job as a personal shopper. It was pretty easy for the most part but honestly working with the management was difficult because most of them didn’t want to help when we got super busy and behind. Most just walk around doing nothing, but that was mostly from this store. Also the hours are not good and they are not very flexible with schedules even when they say “they have a flexible availability.” You have to have an open availability to even be able to work there or they’ll just cut your hours even more. Also the point system was not good, at least for this store because you only had until 4.5 points to get terminated. which that means basically you can only call that many amount of times unless you had PPTO to cover that, but even then that was still hard to get after working a lot of hours. Being a cashier wasn’t bad until you had no people to help when it got busy and managers disappeared. You also have to wait until someone takes your spot to even go on break or lunch and it would be just at random times, also the same with leaving. I did enjoy the walmart + and the associate discount wish it was a little more though.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Get to meet new people and help them out....it feels good when you find what their looking for.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Learning how work the phone a little stressful but fun....What is the work environment and culture like at the company?It's good....a lot of the workers are friendly. What is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy, busy, busy but that's a good thing because it makes you feel good about yourself.

title: Awful
review: Do NOT work here. They do not accept doctor notes, requesting time off is really difficult, you’re not allowed to switch shifts, management is absolutely awful including store manager.

title: Good pay for the area
review: Horrible working conditions. Very limited breaks. Ridiculous pressure to meet production goals. Impossible to work safely and meet the minimum goal so you don’t get fired. They do not take into consideration delays that are out of your control. For instance, if there is a long line to refuel your lift, you do not get credit for that down time, it goes against your production. Late trucks, not enough people to clear inbound freight or replenish pick bins, spills, equipment down. The only way to make production is to literally RUN through your entire shift and pray you don’t get hurt. If you do get hurt, they will harass you into not filing a workers comp case and get medical care. If you do, they require a rep to go INTO your doctor appointment with you! Despite being on your feet for 12 hrs plus, you only get 20 min for lunch and the break room is far away. Need to use the bathroom? Not if you want to make production. Meanwhile, all office staff get an hour for lunch and two paid breaks.

title: Great place to work. Great culture
review: Working here is a blessing. The people are great. Positive work culture, fun and the money good. There is room to grow in any direction you want. 100% paid college. Cdl program. Good benefits, good money, lots incentive

title: Productive and stressful
review: Overall a very okay experience. Some drama in the department but when your with your favorite coworkers it gets better. Team leads are there for you but managers were a little weird.

title: Nobody cares about anything
review: Do a good job, oh well, do a bad job, oh well.  Too many managers trying to fight over employees.  For example, in the Deli area, I was constantly asked to push carts or stock, but then didn't have time for my deli responsibilities.

title: Not fun
review: When I started working at Walmart, everything was good. Ever since I took the management position, they expect me to complete 200 tasks within my shift which I can’t do. Reason being be cca use they don’t hire people for my department so everything g is on me

title: 4 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Hey paid every two weeks and you can dress comfortably What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Dealing with rude customers and dealing with managers who think they know something but in reality they don’t What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Friendly and the working environment is a bit stressful What is a typical day like for you at the company?Fridays are the typical days……

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?To accomplish your goals by the end of your shift What is the most stressful part about working at the company?When the shift ahead of you doesn’t finish their freight or take items to put in back roomWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?Corporate AmericaWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Busy Trying to get all task done before the end of shift

title: Walmart offers a flexible and challenging work experience.
review: It can be a great time and rewarding to work here, however there is a chance to have your shifts removed when requesting time off, if you catch the attention of anyone in a position of power, that's it your pretty well done working there. They will keep an eye on you the entire time afterwards. Some employees are given the chance to transfer to other work positions/teams instead of getting a coaching or reprimand, other employees are immediately called to the office for a coaching and are not given this opportunity. They forget to close the office door when talking about people which is against company policy.Work life balance is non existent since the managers believe everyone should stay for overtime when tasks are incomplete even when they do not have the people hired to complete their daily tasks.Example: one year we were informed our team was supposed to be 32 people to ensure completion everyday.We had 15-24. Sometimes less.

title: It’s what you’d expect
review: On your feet all day.  Lines never end, it’s always busy. Short lunches. Don’t always get the hours you need and/or want. Some customers are very rude.

title: Starts out ok but they dont  care about you and will replace you in a second
review: was hired in as a cart associate and did not get help for months. 3-4 months later they finally hired someone who did not work. the job is way harder then it needed to be and they do not care.

title: Attendance policy is horrible
review: The attendance policy for Walmart is absolutely horrible. Most employees who dont succeed at Walmart do so due to their attendance point system.. I worked over 40 hrs a week every week; and lost my job still due to attendance!

title: Do not bother
review: U can grow if you want to die there. I have to keep coming in and everybody is winny all the time. If you want to keep getting into issues then work at Walmart and disturb yourself with growing because you will not be growing anywhere.

title: Poor Management
review: Management needs to be more approachable and caring. Staff are over worked and hours are not flexible. Good workers are assigned to cover multiple tasks while lazy workers walk around talking and doing the bare minimum. I’m thankful for the job, but i dread going to work.

title: Busy
review: Ok work. Very busy lots of turnover at the time. Was a good started job, hs like culture, managers were either really good or really bad….ok expieencr overall

title: 3 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?When I clock outWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Not enough space to answer this properly

title: Big company with many jobs and departments to work not just the store
review: Many people only consider the store side of Wal-Mart, but there are actually many diverse jobs with this company.  Alot of folks I worked with went on to other random jobs in the company like Wal-Mart Meteorologist, or Wal-Mart Real Estate Agent.

title: Doesn't care about employees
review: Management constantly changing your schedule after the schedule has been released and not making sure it's okay with you before making the change. The paid tuition program is great

title: Success is who you know, not what you can do
review: The pay for my department was decent and the work is easy. The coworkers are the only thing enjoyable about the job. One member of management will tell you to do one thing, and then another will tell you to do something totally different, and then you get in trouble by the first manager for not getting your assignment done and then you’re thrown under the bus by the second member of management.  Was approached about multiple advancement opportunities and interviewed only to be turned down for someone that has been there less time. It’s all about who you know, not what you can do. The hard workers have to pick up the slack of the lazy ones but still never told good job or that you are appreciated. If you do too good of a job they will keep you from moving anywhere else, including promoting. They will only promote you if you are hateful to your associates. Being nice to others gets you nowhere in this company. Regular associates get poor pay with no bonuses, while upper management get huge bonuses every year. I don’t agree with the values of this company.

title: Fast Pace But Repetitive
review: Overall I liked my job, but when it came to doing other tasks it seemed you were always cooped up in one corner. Same thing everyday with no variety. Overall it was a good beginners job.

title: Somewhat laid back and easy for part time.
review: I've been working at walmart for 3 years while attending college.  Management is somewhat understanding of my schedule so that's a plus. There are some days where it's very busy and there's barely any room to get work done.

title: Bad management
review: The management is really don’t know what they doing the work is not bad it’s just and managers the workers there are chill and hard workers no matter how much we to it seems to never be enough

title: Lies
review: They do not pay u like they promise, there's so many rules to follow it's hard to even get one load done a day... And also they watch u like a hawk.  Benefits aren't all that great.

title: 2 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?Pay is goodWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Does not give breaks as legally requiredWork 4 hours straight with no breakWhat is the work environment and culture like at the company?I had a very bad experienceWhat is a typical day like for you at the company?Helping customers or filling medication bottles as required by prescription

title: Management
review: Your feelings on working at Wakmart fully depend on what kind of manager you have. If you're lucky and get a great manager they will go out of their way to make your work/life easier. However I wasn't this fortunate, my managers were the type that told people "they are replaceable" when they make a mistake.

title: Decent part-time job to start, can become worse over time.
review: I worked for about 2 years in the automotive section inside and saw at least 3 employees start and finish their jobs at Walmart just in my area during my time there, which speaks to the turnover rate. Management can be hit or miss and things can be pretty hectic especially around certain dates throughout the year. If working inside, be prepared to work outside of your department and to be familiar with knowing where most things are, even if it's across the store. For the most part, if you are very proactive about letting them know ahead of time, they can work with your schedule but dates that are already scheduled are usually going to stay that way. Clocking in and out through the app is great, I never had to come in a day I wasn't scheduled and was never forced to stay late or come in early although I was asked to multiple times. Overall, if I had more help from management or just more associates working there at all, it would've felt a lot less miserable.

title: Fun and easy
review: This job was fun and easy but could overwhelming sometimes with the lack of management. Be aware of employees that are in the same position as you that tries to run you!

title: Great working environment
review: Management has your back no matter the situation and the pay was good. You work lots of hours but it's well worth it on payday. I would recommend working here and miss it

title: Take the position serious enough to be considered for a promotion
review: Everything moves like clockwork at Walmart. Once you know your position and have become efficient in completing your tasks, your day will go smoothly. I've learned that Walmart is always willing to promote individuals who show they take their jobs seriously and complete their tasks with time to spare and is willing to take on more responsibility. For the most part, management can be helpful and supportive, but there are a few that can benefit from taking a class in human kindness. The team members are friendly and willing to answer questions and help with tasks that you may be unfamiliar with. The hardest part of the job is a team member not participating or completing their assignments. The enjoyable experience I had with this company is the team effort to complete tasks in various departments.

title: Good Atmosphere
review: Great place to work for teens and college students. I do wish pay was a little higher, but overall great atmosphere. Easy to learn how do your job as well

title: Excelente
review: Excelente empresa con buenos beneficios, se trabaja en equipo, buena relacion con los jefes, el personal, se trabaja en equipo.

title: 1 star
review: What is the best part of working at the company?When I clock out.What is the most stressful part about working at the company?Knowing no matter what you do you will be criticized.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?Environment is stressful.  What is a typical day like for you at the company?Rushed, people and management are never grateful for anything you do.

title: Pro
review: Fun environment to work in. See new people everyday. Always are doing something different because someone always calls out or doesn't show up. Some of the managers are understanding.

title: Trabajo en general
review: Es un trabajo con excelentes experiencias, es un trabajo que demanda mucho trabajo físico, pero tiene buena paga y excelentes beneficios.

title: 5 stars
review: What is the best part of working at the company?I was happyWhat is the most stressful part about working at the company?Odd hours, not getting week ends off.What is the work environment and culture like at the company?You become  a big family 👪 What is a typical day like for you at the company?Get there on time,work the program,finish with a smile.

title: Not too bad
review: So far has been pretty laid back with open opportunities to bring my skillset from my previous work experiences while exploring new technologies to benefit my team and the company long-term.

title: Poor leadership
review: Poor management at the top, store manager and store lead were very condescending and rude. More direct management was ok. Decent benefits. Great coworkers for the most part

title: Chill people
review: Really liked it just decided it was time to move on. It was basically just cleaning the store and making it look presentable the next day for customers.

title: Fun and caring place to work at
review: Been working here for six years and still loving it, my job can be stressful at times but still very worth it. Highly recommend working here. We'll either make you laugh or laugh too hard.

title: Depends on the area
review: Working for Walmart has its ups and downs like any other job. The Location of the store and depending on what department you're in really matters.TLE and Electronics are probably the best places to work depending on coworkers.

title: Good beginner job
review: The job was good working while being in high school, but wouldn’t continue after. Hours were pretty decent. But the pay could be more for the work we did.

title: Horrible company
review: Walmart is the most self centered, money hungry, gas lighting company.  They care nothing for thier employees. We are just a number to them. I hate WM
